I think the price is comparable to other boba places, plus given in a glass bottle.
You can pick up lids for the bottle at the little station, along with the straws and napkins.
Overall, the drink was pretty good!
I would probabaly be back if I'm nearby.
house blend black.author: Maggie W.
house blend black.review: Finally tried this place! Was greeted at the register and I think the cashier might've been new, but not a big deal. The bobarista was really friendly as well. Ordered 2 House Blend Black, which came out to be a total of $10, but I love me some check in discounts even if it just knocks it down a few bucks. I think the price is comparable to other boba places, plus given in a glass bottle. You can pick up lids for the bottle at the little station, along with the straws and napkins. Overall, the drink was pretty good! I would probabaly be back if I'm nearby.

excerpts:
House blend black (half sugar)
Green mango
CoffMilk

Tea
Salt Crema Oolong (too sweet for me
and they don't let you make adjustment to specialty drinks)
house blend black.author: Cynthia T.
house blend black.review:
I adore Plentea, and I'm fairly picky about my boba. My favorite drink here is the Oolong Peach. The boba was nice and chewy, but not overly so. The drink also wasn't too sweet even at normal sugar level. I did tone it down once and ask for no sugar, and the drink was still super delicious. 

I also appreciate Plentea's lovely glass bottles. I always bring mine back to get the 10% discount which pays for the addition of boba. 

One nit: I've gotten used to the honey soaked boba from a boba joint in NY, and I think Plentea would benefit from have that as an option on their menu. The honey flavor just adds a whole new dimension to the flavor profile of the drink.

Items I've tried (ranked in order of preference):
Oolong peach (delicious with no sugar)
House blend black (half sugar)
Green mango
CoffMilk Tea
Salt Crema Oolong (too sweet for me and they don't let you make adjustment to specialty drinks)

excerpts: the House Blend Black was brewed so strongly that i even watered it down after.
house blend black.author: Hana K.
house blend black.review: hands down the best milk tea i've ever had!! the House Blend Black was brewed so strongly that i even watered it down after. the Jasmine Green was perfect! boba was cooked flawlessly but they didn't give much of it. love the fact that they are reducing waste by giving glass bottles free of charge! i'm from the LA area and i will miss this SF tea.

excerpts: I also tried the house blend black milk tea
house blend black.author: Sophia G.
house blend black.review:
The customer service at Plentea is above and beyond. The female cashier working that day made sure I was satisfied with my drink and took all measures to accomplish this. This alone makes plentea a five star in my book. 

Plus my strawberry oolong with 30% sweetness, was perfect! 

I also tried the house blend black milk tea and it had a nice strong tea taste, another plus!!

I will be back for more drinks!

excerpts: Highly recommend house blend black tea!
house blend black.author: Christina X.
house blend black.review: Authentic tea with milk! Remind me of my high school best memory in China Highly recommend house blend black tea!

excerpts: On my most recent visit, I ordered their house blend black milk tea, and it had a rather strange strong burnt aftertaste.
Not sure what it was, maybe the tea was a bit over roasted or something.
house blend black.author: Alvin W.
house blend black.review: Aside from the interesting bottles that Plentea drinks come in, their milk tea quality was a bit lacking. On my most recent visit, I ordered their house blend black milk tea, and it had a rather strange strong burnt aftertaste. Not sure what it was, maybe the tea was a bit over roasted or something.

excerpts: From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea.
The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness.
jasmine green.author: Ahmad J.
jasmine green.review:
Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi. Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times. The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas. For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond). For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each). Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%). It seems to cross all boxes as far as options are concerned.

Over a period of time I've tried most of their Classic and Special Milk teas. One thing that distinguishes Plentea from other boba tea places is their insistence on using glass bottles instead of plastic cups, supposedly to help the environment. In today age when you can get fully compostable cups and straws, insisting on using glass bottles for protecting the environment is just wrong. Let's call it what it is, a marketing ploy that positions Plentea differently from their competitors. Goes without saying I am not a fan of these glass bottles as they feel heavy and makes holding the drink painful. I would prefer if they give you a choice of getting a glass bottle rather than palming them off on everyone. Anyway let's move on to the drinks.

The short and simple review would be that their drinks are good not great. It took a little trial and error to get to my customization right here. I started by getting my drinks 50% sweet, but found that for my taste I needed their regular sweetness (but that would be a little sweet for most people). Then I replaced whole milk with half-and-half as whole milk tended to undermine the tea taste and lastly getting less ice prevented the teas from becoming diluted with time.

From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea. The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness. What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte. It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.
 
Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-Tea just a block down. In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom. During normal hours I prefer to go to i-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.

excerpts: We had the sea salt crema coffee and jasmine green tea with tapioca balls.
jasmine green.author: Holly A.
jasmine green.review:
Wow I love the clean look inside this spot. It also helps that my drinks came in cute glass bottles and didn't cost an arm and a leg like other places. We had the sea salt crema coffee and jasmine green tea with tapioca balls. 

(Slurping with the straw) ahhhh.... enjoying the moment here! I will be back to try other drinks!

Discount if you bring/reuse their bottle for another drink :)

excerpts: the Jasmine Green was perfect!
boba was cooked flawlessly but they didn't give much of it.
love the fact that they are reducing waste by giving glass bottles free of charge!
i'm from the LA area and i will miss this SF tea.

jasmine green.review: hands down the best milk tea i've ever had!! the House Blend Black was brewed so strongly that i even watered it down after. the Jasmine Green was perfect! boba was cooked flawlessly but they didn't give much of it. love the fact that they are reducing waste by giving glass bottles free of charge! i'm from the LA area and i will miss this SF tea.

excerpts: Their Jasmine green tea is awesome!!!
jasmine green.author: Zeynep D.
jasmine green.review: Their Jasmine green tea is awesome!!! However, honey lime tea is super sweet I'd not have it for the second time...

excerpts: Their jasmine green milk tea is delicious!
The boba is also chewy too.
If you return the glass bottles you also get 10 percent discount!
jasmine green.author: Nick L.
jasmine green.review: Their jasmine green milk tea is delicious! The boba is also chewy too. If you return the glass bottles you also get 10 percent discount!

excerpts: It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha.
jasmine green.author: Stephanie H.
jasmine green.review:
Plentea is another boba place I decided to run to along the Embarcadero. Obviously this was so I could more fairly compare it to Bottle Zup, which is a very similar boba shop. I also wanted to go running, but needed a motivator, so obviously the solution was to make a bubble tea shop the destination and boba my reward.

Unfortunately (for those who may have been pedestrians between my apartment and Plentea), I did not have the opportunity to run over a mile back home carrying a bottle full of boba in one hand and a bubble tea straw and my phone in the other, as I did when I visited Bottle Zup. This is partly because I was feeling lazy and the Montgomery Muni stop is nearby, and partly because Plentea only gives a plastic cap to cover the bottle, and I was afraid it wouldn't hold up under the stress of my running home.

As for the drink itself, the boba had a nice chewy consistency to it and was slightly sweet, but I am not a fan of the matcha latte. It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha. I like my matcha strongly-flavored and textured, so this didn't quite hit the right note.

This place is pretty overpriced--I paid nearly $6 for my drink after tax, and had to pay in cash ($10 credit card minimum) which is a pain because it meant that I had to carry cash there while running and carry change back! The glass bottle is sturdy and slightly bigger than the one from Bottle Zup, but even if I bring it back for the 10% discount, I'm not sure it's worth it. I like the novelty of the glass bottle, but you could easily get the same for slightly better tea at Bottle Zup. The one thing Plentea does have going for it is that it stays open so late (until 11pm) which is super convenient in a city where so many places (specifically boba places) close so early.

excerpts: Recently, I had the jasmine green milk tea.
It was rather watered down but drink came out quickly
and you get a glass bottle!
jasmine green.author: V C.
jasmine green.review: This is usually my second choice when there's a huge line at iTea. They have really cut down the menu to offer the basics with minimal additions. Prices are reasonable. Recently, I had the jasmine green milk tea. It was rather watered down but drink came out quickly and you get a glass bottle!

excerpts:
Pros:
- Price is fair for what you get
- Clean interior and relatively fast service

Cons:
- Overly sweet drinks 
- The matcha green tea tastes like jasmine green tea
jasmine green.author: Crystal Z.
jasmine green.review:
TL;DR - Literally just, meh.

Honestly, I might return, I might not. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here tho.... especially reading some of the other Yelper's complaints.

Pros:
- Price is fair for what you get
- Clean interior and relatively fast service

Cons:
- Overly sweet drinks 
- The matcha green tea tastes like jasmine green tea so...... missing matcha, a lot. Just order the jasmine milk tea
- Mostly ice in the drinks
- Awkward and rude staff (ie high schoolers with major 'tude problems because they need a little spending money and they have to *gasp* work!)
- Lack of options (If you're going to specialize, make it good. Basically, make each drink something memorable -which the drinks were not-. If you're just riding the hype train, then add more options so everyone can enjoy the disappointment.)

excerpts: I ordered the lemon green tea and my friend ordered the Jasmine green milk tea with boba.

The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good.
It had the same taste was Quickly's tea.
I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas.
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.
The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good.
It had the same taste was Quickly's tea.
I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas.
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.

It had the same taste was Quickly's tea. I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas. 
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.

but I tried my friend's black tea
& it still had that floral taste.
Both teas were on the watery side, I like a more creamy taste.
Not sure what happened but was very unhappy with the tea.
The boba was fine, the seating upstairs was great & the glass bottle is cool

jasmine green.author: A. G.
jasmine green.review: Ordered an oolong tea but tasted like jasmine green -_- Maybe they messed up my order but I tried my friend's black tea & it still had that floral taste. Both teas were on the watery side, I like a more creamy taste. Not sure what happened but was very unhappy with the tea. The boba was fine, the seating upstairs was great & the glass bottle is cool but it's not worth it since the tea sucked.

excerpts: I came here and tried the jasmine green tea, thai tea, and regular milk tea.
I would say that their teas are good but not worth my $5.
Thai tea is probably the best that i tried.
jasmine green.author: Cecile S.
jasmine green.review:
Came here to get the glass bottle that came with a large drink during their promo period. I think they only have one size for all drinks? Anyway, what kind asian doesn't line up for free stuff. One time I was the last person to get a glass bottle before they ran out. Whoop whoop, small victory. Line is always out the door after 1145 or so. one time I waited 25 mins to get to the cashier. 

 All their drinks are on the pricier side, $4-6 per drink. So without the glass bottle, the drinks here are actually not worth it. they give you a 10% discount if you get plastic. I came here and tried the jasmine green tea, thai tea, and regular milk tea. I would say that their teas are good but not worth my $5. Thai tea is probably the best that i tried. They also have some snack and lunch foods.

Will not come again when there are better and cheaper places. I fell for the glass bottle gimmick and that's it.

excerpts: I've had their regular black milk tea, jasmine green milk tea, and sea salt crema with oolong tea.
jasmine green.author: Dale W.
jasmine green.review:
This is definitely one of those milk tea shops where you've heard about it so much that you just HAVE to go try it. If not for the drinks themselves then for the ability to talk about said drinks afterwards.

The single defining characteristic of Plentea is the cute milk bottle they hand out with every drink. (I think I've accumulated four by now....) It's quite eco-friendly, and you have the added benefit of bringing back your bottle for a discount. (10 whole freakin' percent.) Although the general problem I've noticed is, I don't decide ahead of time whether or not I want Plentea, and by the time I pass it and decide that I do want something to drink... well, there's another bottle for me.

The drinks themselves are definitely solid, but not mind-blowing. I've had their regular black milk tea, jasmine green milk tea, and sea salt crema with oolong tea. I always leave satisfied with the taste of my tea, but as I mentioned earlier, the tea tastes the same as any other decently upstanding milk tea shop. At $4.50 a bottle for milk tea and $4.95 for crema, I would also be perfectly happy going to Sharetea, for example, and getting an equally good milk tea for $3.50 and creama for $4.25. 

Giving Plentea 3 stars for decent yet overpriced milk tea.

I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well!
Definitely had the perfect balance between sugar, tea, and milk.
A few of my friends tried it, but only felt so-so towards it.
I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well!

I guess it's a place thats not consistent with their milk tea making, which is bad for boba cravers.

I guess it's a place thats not consistent with their milk tea making, which is bad for boba cravers. But, the glass jars were too cute to pass by for me!

excerpts: for two drinks (decided to go safe and got jasmine green milk tea and thai iced tea both with boba) - total came out to about $11-$12? pretty steep for some boba.... but i figured its because of the glass bottles....and the location - nothing labled "financial district" is really cheap.
the milk tea was alright...
nothing fancy
i believed the boba were honey flavored.. at least to me it tasted like honey - similar to T-Pumps so that was good.
i would come back.... because im a sucker for glass jars.
jasmine green.author: Kristina L.
jasmine green.review:
what got me excited to come here was the boba in a glass bottle. browsing through fb is great advertisement. my friend had came here before the grand opening day - soft opening? and everything was 50% off at that time. so im like whoa! i gotta go... but the two days before their grand opening.... they were closed... so came here on their grand opening day and waited about 30 mins? for two drinks (decided to go safe and got jasmine green milk tea and thai iced tea both with boba) - total came out to about $11-$12? pretty steep for some boba.... but i figured its because of the glass bottles....and the location - nothing labled "financial district" is really cheap. the milk tea was alright... nothing fancy i believed the boba were honey flavored.. at least to me it tasted like honey - similar to T-Pumps so that was good. i would come back.... because im a sucker for glass jars. i also want to try their fresh fruit tea.... 

if you bring your glass bottle back you get 10% off... which isn't much... i think your better off paying that 10% for a new glass bottle...

excerpts: I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea.
I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and
my friend who didn't wanna take risks
didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet
roasted oolong.author: Calvin Z.
roasted oolong.review:
First off - glass bottles. As someone who has really aesthetic friends, Plentea really helped me flex on them - "yeah your nicely edited photo of your latte and laptop at a coffee shop is aesthetic but have you ever had Thai milk tea in a glass bottle?" I'd like to think that when they saw my photos of my bubble tea in a glass bottle they whispered to themselves "damn I need me one of those".

Anyways.

Generally, bubble tea makes me feel bloated afterwards. I realize this is because they probably use powder, or because their tapioca comes from some questionable source, who knows. With Plentea's drink offerings, it tasted clean and like real tea and milk, which is something I appreciate a lot and I'm willing to pay the premium if I know what I'm drinking is not powder. I can even see the staff make my drink in front of me, which is more reassuring than the places that have someone take my order, disappear into the back, and come back with my drink. 

I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea. I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and my friend who didn't wanna take risks didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet, it just tasted like a nice milk tea with hints of Nutella. My goal is to try everything on the menu before I leave SF.

And again... glass bottles. You don't even pay more than you would at other popular bubble tea shops... maybe a bit less actually. Maybe I'm a sucker for these novelties, but it's what drew me in and the quality of the milk tea is what kept me coming back.

excerpts: They offer milk teas such as Jasmine, Roasted Oolong, and Earl grey.
roasted oolong.author: Danielle A.
roasted oolong.review:
Plentea: home of the famous  (environmental-friendly) tea jars and moderately priced drinks ($4-5)

It's not often when I'm back in the SF area, so I decided to come back here after exploring more boba places around the bay.  I came around 5-6pm on a Saturday evening. I was very surprised to see that it wasn't packed but there was a few customers ordering. The last time (and first time) I came, it was quite crowded with music pumping. It's nice to a peaceful and calm vibe sometimes at boba places but I'd rather it be more alive...ESPECIALLY on a Saturday. 

There isn't PLENTEA enough of drinks to choose from their menu but still enough choices to pick out a drink. They offer milk teas such as Jasmine, Roasted Oolong, and Earl grey. Plentea also has hot drinks such as Hot Oolong milk tea and cold brewed teas (Peach oolong, Premium mountain oolong, etc). They're are mostly known (in terms of drinks) for their Sea Salt Creama which I recommend to those who haven't tried it yet. I'm not a huge fan of Taro Milk tea but for all those Taro lovers out there, Plentea doesn't offer Taro Milk tea.

The guy who took our order was very quick and attentive. He was really informative by letting us know that the sweetness of their Thai tea cannot be adjusted. Kindly, he offered us a sample to see if it was too sweet for my mom's liking. Once we got our drinks, the person who made my drink even asked me to tell him if I needed more sugar in my Jasmine Milk tea! After that, I was highly appreciative of their amazeballs customer service. Rarely any places I try out, gives us a sample when we ask if one of their drinks are too sweet before we order. That's mostly why I was really impressed with their customer service. Y'all are doing that portion right for sure. 

I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba (surprise surprise), my sister got the Matcha Milk Tea with egg pudding, and my mom got the Thai tea also with egg pudding. Can I just say, Thank you Plentea very MATCHA for that Jasmine Milk Tea. It was definitely one of the best Jasmine Milk Tea I've ever tasted in my mouth. The tea was just as strong as the amount of half and half they put in. The creaminess of the half & half and the brewed taste of the Jasmine was just BOOOOOM. They also put in the matcha in front of you if you order the Matcha milk tea which creates a cool ombré mixed effect. That adds on even more to this Tea place that just shouts aesthetic. 

The guy who took my order was even considerate enough to ask me if I wanted whole milk or half and half with my Jasmine Milk Tea. I didn't catch his name or the one who made my drink but I thank them for making my second experience here more enjoyable.

I'd give this place 4.5 stars due to the fact they can't adjust the sugar for some of their drinks like the Thai Tea since it's pre-made.

excerpts: I ordered the roasted oolong milk tea without any toppings (which are an additional .50 cents each) and it came in a very cute milk jar.
The caps for the jars are located right by the register, so make sure to grab one if you want to save your drink for later!
The drink itself was good, but nothing to write home about.
If you prefer a strong tea flavor, the roasted oolong milk tea is probably too mild.
roasted oolong.author: Robin C.
roasted oolong.review:
If you like cute and dainty milk tea jars, this place is it!

Located in Chinatown, the store is quite small but emanates a fresh and clean vibe with a color palette that consists of light woody browns, black chalkboards, and accents of green potted plants. A cozy place to chill if you can snag a seat from their limited seating selection. 

I ordered the roasted oolong milk tea without any toppings (which are an additional .50 cents each) and it came in a very cute milk jar. The caps for the jars are located right by the register, so make sure to grab one if you want to save your drink for later! The drink itself was good, but nothing to write home about. If you prefer a strong tea flavor, the roasted oolong milk tea is probably too mild. 

The service was quick and friendly! It only took about 5 minutes before my drink was ready. Granted, I was only there in the evening so I can't speak much for overall service time! 

If you're visiting the city, this is a great place to stop by for a drink as well as the milk jar souvenir!

excerpts: I had roasted oolong milk tea.
Tasted good, not too sweet.
It came in a glass bottle.
Pretty cool, but heavy to walk around with it.
You get 10% off next time you bring the bottle back.
roasted oolong.author: Stella S.
roasted oolong.review: I had roasted oolong milk tea.  Tasted good, not too sweet.  It came in a glass bottle.  Pretty cool, but heavy to walk around with it.  You get 10% off next time you bring the bottle back.

excerpts: I ordered a sea salt caramel specialty milk tea and my friend ordered a roasted oolong.
Not too sweet, but still flavorful enough.
I usually frequent Wonderful Food on Irving and Purple Kow in Richmond, but Plentea is a strong contender!
I'll be back!
roasted oolong.author: Y D L.
roasted oolong.review: I love this place! Cute interior, reusable glass bottles, but the best of all- their tea is high quality! I ordered a sea salt caramel specialty milk tea and my friend ordered a roasted oolong. Not too sweet, but still flavorful enough. I usually frequent Wonderful Food on Irving and Purple Kow in Richmond, but Plentea is a strong contender! I'll be back! =)

excerpts: Okay so their roasted oolong is a good classic safe bet, but recently I realized how much of a sweet tooth I had.
I ordered their iced milk honey boba w/ pudding and caramel
roasted oolong.author: Tiffany S.
roasted oolong.review:
Okay so their roasted oolong is a good classic safe bet, but recently I realized how much of a sweet tooth I had. I ordered their iced milk honey boba w/ pudding and caramel and it was quite the diebetus drink - comparable to Purple Kow's iced milk drink w/ boba and honey boba. 

I don't think fruit teas are my thing- I've tried their mango tea w/ small chunks of mango floating around and I wasn't too impressed. Just felt super watered down. 

Anyways, it's nice to know I don't have to travel very far to get boba in the financial district anymore. 

The location is located super close to Onigilly, Sushiritto, and Murrachi's too so you can pair boba with some afternoon munchies. Sounds like the perfect combo to me. 

Will swing by again if I'm ever in the financial district!

excerpts: On my first visit, I ordered a sea salt creama oolong tea.
When it came out, I was like "oooo layered and cloud wispy looking!" in my head.
The baristas there recommended to shake it up.
I hesitated and glanced to the customer next to me who ordered a similar drink-- he was shaking his up.
By his
sea salt creama oolong.author: Bonnie T.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
On my first visit, I ordered a sea salt creama oolong tea. When it came out, I was like "oooo layered and cloud wispy looking!" in my head. The baristas there recommended to shake it up. I hesitated and glanced to the customer next to me who ordered a similar drink-- he was shaking his up. By his I mean his drink. 

"Am I doing this right" I commented, as I screwed on the lid and began agitating the bottle's contents. 

The other customer just smiled and did not really give me a clear response. Maybe he was shy or something! 

Overall the tea was quite light and gentle in flavor-- the oolong could've come out more. The sea salt was interestingly detectable. I do wish I thought of tasting the oolong tea and sea salt separately before mating them together like that. That's what group think and peer influence will do to you. Next time! The tapioca balls were underwhelming but decent-- I like them sweeter. 

In conclusion, I look forward to putting cute flowers in the empty glass bottle.

excerpts: This time I got the sea salt creama oolong
and it wasn't that memorable.
The tea flavor was missing and the creama felt flat.
And for the price, I expect so much more.
Overall, there is far better boba places to get drinks like boba guys a few blocks away.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Brian N.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
Drinks 3/5. Service 4/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 3/5.

Rebranding alert! This place use to be a little more busy looking with more clutter in the shop. It had more food options and more  decor on the walls. Today, it's a little bit more streamlined with simpler decor, with a main theme of white. The drink list got smaller and even the signature drink bottles changed a little with the caps being a hard cap that you can screw on versus a flimsy plastic cap. 

However, the drinks are just as mediocre. The tea flavor from the drinks aren't that prominent and the flavor itself like they advertise like mango aren't that prominent either. The fruit teas are all premade so the fruit can't subbed out for a different tea. This time I got the sea salt creama oolong and it wasn't that memorable. The tea flavor was missing and the creama felt flat. And for the price, I expect so much more. Overall, there is far better boba places to get drinks like boba guys a few blocks away. It's worth trying just for the bottle, but it's nothing special. 

Tips - The fruit tea is better tasting than the normal milk teas. The Thai tea is also premade but you can't really go wrong with thai tea.

Pros - you get to keep the bottle and the bottle now comes with a cap that seals the bottle better. 

Cons - lacks in tea quality and a lot of their tea is premade beforehand.

excerpts: We got a sea salt creama oolong and strawberry tea, both with tapioca, and were pretty pleased.
While waiting in the cramped shop (hey folks, there's lofted seating upstairs!)
, I watched them make the strawberry tea and leave it sitting on the prep counter for five minutes while my oolong was ready.
With four people making drinks at the same station, it gets busy back there.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Gwen W.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
Squished in between Onigilly and some other restaurant on Kearny is Plentea, home of deliciously milky drinks and chewy boba balls. I've come a long way from a childhood spent drinking powdery 99 Ranch smoothies and mushy tapioca. While I still enjoy my super cheap Banh Mi Che Cali BOGO milk teas with the flavorless balls, I'd like to think I'm finally at a point in my life where I know what good boba tastes like.

At nearly 3 p.m. on a Friday, the line for Plentea stretched past Onigilly. The poor guys managing the counter at Onigilly must get excited when someone approaches the entrance just to lean against their shop windows, waiting for a shot at Plentea.

It's 15% off of 2 drinks if you check in on Yelp, and in an attempt to be environmentally conscious, 10% off if you bring your glass bottle back. We got a sea salt creama oolong and strawberry tea, both with tapioca, and were pretty pleased. While waiting in the cramped shop (hey folks, there's lofted seating upstairs!), I watched them make the strawberry tea and leave it sitting on the prep counter for five minutes while my oolong was ready. With four people making drinks at the same station, it gets busy back there. It would likely be more efficient if they had someone also calling out order numbers, as some people are reeeeeally slow at picking up orders.

It's weird that they used bottled waters to make their teas that didn't look like they were glass, but I invite them to prove me wrong on that. We can at least taste the difference in quality, so er...taste buds 1, recycling bins 0? I didn't see a place to recycle the bottles either, so I think it'd be more in line with their mission and other glass-enthusiasts like T.epiphany if there was an option to give the bottles back.

excerpts: I didn't like the sea salt creama oolong Milk Tea as much, the creama just didn't fit to my taste at all.
I got it because it was a specialty drink, and it was pretty unique, since not many boba places have that drink.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Annie Y.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
The bottles and interior are gorgeous! The wait was decent, as it does get a little crowded if everyone just sits and waits there, but they do have a upstairs section, which is really cool. The employees were really nice. The drinks were okay, I've tasted better, but it was a nice first time try here. Parking is really hard to find, since a lot of the meters are tow-away during certain hours. So you can either park at the parking lot, or find parking farther away and walk your distance here. I didn't like the sea salt creama oolong Milk Tea as much, the creama just didn't fit to my taste at all. I got it because it was a specialty drink, and it was pretty unique, since not many boba places have that drink. But other than the drink, everything else was pretty cool.

Recommendation(s):
None yet 

Visit Again: Willing to give it one more try
Recommend to Others: Maybe after my second try at this place

excerpts: Second time, I got the sea salt creama oolong tea.
I'm usually easily satisfied with most boba drinks.
I always finish my drinks...
but I couldn't even bring myself to finish half of it.
It just tasted blech.
My boyfriend got an upset stomach from his drink and was not feeling so great for the rest of the night.
Not only that, all of my friends and I agreed that we felt extremely parched after drinking their tea.
Service was whatever.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Lincy H.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
I really wanted to like this place because of their hipster glass jars.

I came here twice. The first time was decent. The girl who helped me was sweet. She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea and I remember enjoying it. I wouldn't bother with the food. I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever. I only got it cause I was hungry, but I could have definitely done without it.

Second time, I got the sea salt creama oolong tea. I'm usually easily satisfied with most boba drinks. I always finish my drinks... but I couldn't even bring myself to finish half of it. It just tasted blech. My boyfriend got an upset stomach from his drink and was not feeling so great for the rest of the night. Not only that, all of my friends and I agreed that we felt extremely parched after drinking their tea. Service was whatever. The guys who work there could maybe smile once in awhile.

Both times, I did not get a glass jar because they ran out. Also, what happened to the discounted price when you don't get a glass jar? $5 for a crappy drink and whatever service?

I don't think I'll be back.

excerpts: I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong.
So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink.
The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt.
The egg pudding had a good consistency as well.
One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers.
The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Kitty K.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
This shop isn't located in Chinatown like I had thought since on Yelp's address it did say it was in Chinatown. It's way closer to the FiDi but still within walking distance of Chinatown (~8-10min). There's only street parking and parking's hit and miss (depends on when you go). There are a few stools and tables down stairs, but they have a cute little loft upstairs as well with a couple cushioned seats and more tables. No public bathroom.

I have been wanting to come here for ages because I love the jars that they serve the drinks in! I came here with a group of friends right after dinner in North Beach, so we walked over around 9PM on a Sat. I was surprised it wasn't packed or that there wasn't a line. I definitely wasn't going to complain!

Drink Menu:
Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Tea: ($4.95) Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95) Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95) Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50) Honey Tapioca, Egg Pudding, Taro Pudding, Coffee Pudding, Aloe, Grass Jelly)

Waffle Sandwiches Menu: ($8.95) Add 2 Slices of Applewood Smoked Bacon +$1
Morning Waffle: Only served before 10AM. Bacon, Egg, Spring Mix, Swiss Cheese
Turkey Club: Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Tomato, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Hot Pastrami: Pastrami, Swiss cheese, Avocado, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Smoked Salmon: Blue Cold Smoked Salmon, Herb Cream Cheese, Cucumber & Chives

Salad Menu: ($8.95) served with Spring Mix, Avocado, Tomato, Pecan
Meat: Turkey / Pastrami / Smoked Salmon
Dressing: Ginger / Mustard Soy Sauce / Yuzu Citrus

*All vegetables are organic

Dessert Menu:
Strawberry Belgian Waffle: Whip Cream, Fresh Strawberries, Jam, Almond Slices & Chocolate Syrup
Banana Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream, Banana, Nutella, Almond Slices, & Chocolate Syrup
Marshmallow Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream Topped w/ Toasted Marshmallow & Chocolate Syrup
New York-style Cheesecake
Tiramisu
Add Vanilla or Green Tea Ice Cream: +$1

Our Order:
Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding 
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca

I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong. So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink. The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt. The egg pudding had a good consistency as well. One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers. The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks. One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet. The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers. The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus. Fairly pricey but so yummy!

Note: If you don't want your drink in the glass bottles, you get a 10% discount off the drink prices and get your drinks in a plastic cup instead. You also get the same discount if you bring the bottle back

excerpts: I ordered the sea salt creama oolong tea with egg pudding and loved it!
sea salt creama oolong.author: Christina N.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
Newly opened boba place that serves boba in a glass jug that you can bring home. If you return with the glass jug, you will get 10% off your order. 

I ordered the sea salt creama oolong tea with egg pudding and loved it! There are seats upstairs and on the ground floor and it seems like a great place to chill and work or chat with friends.

Will definitely return again!

excerpts: Also I tried my friends' drinks - honey lemon oolong tea, milk green tea and also the sea salt creama oolong , they all taste so good!
sea salt creama oolong.author: Joanne W.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
I m here for vacation from hawaii, n tried lots of bubble tea in San Francisco as well. Hands down the drinks here are super good

I love their iced milk w/ brown sugar and taro pudding , it's like drinking pop corn with caramel. Love it so much!

Also I tried my friends' drinks - honey lemon oolong tea, milk green tea and also the sea salt creama oolong , they all taste so good! 

Not to mention their very famous glass bottle, it's reusable , environmentally friendly and u also get to hv 20% off for next purchase when u bring it back to the store!! Genius idea! 

I recommend everyone to visit them if u r in town n craving for some boba drinks!

excerpts: I ordered sea salt creama oolong with boba while my other friend ordered passion fruit oolong with lychee jelly.
sea salt creama oolong.author: Wanda V.
sea salt creama oolong.review:
I stumble upon Plentea when I was visiting Pier 39. Today, I decided to give it a try since I was touring my friends around the area. 

The line was decent since the place is actually small. I love how cute the bottle is compared to other boba shops. 

However, the drink was a different story. I ordered sea salt creama oolong with boba while my other friend ordered passion fruit oolong with lychee jelly. The drinks aren't as great as other tea places. 

Also, they gave me so much boba that I had little to drink with. They do offer adjustment to drinks but like most other places, it's mainly made from syrup. 

The pricing for this place is expensive - only because you are paying for bottle. They have little sittings inside, but unlike other boba joints, they don't give you the password to their wifi. 

I would recommend going to ShareTea, TPumps or even Purple Kow if you are looking for a better tasting boba drink compared to the bottle that makes the drink look nice.

excerpts: My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea.
Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.
matcha latte.author: Tiffany K.
matcha latte.review:
I've been to Plentea a few times already, even when it first opened. This place was pretty cool and cute in the Financial district. What got me were the glass bottles. I think it has been over a year or two since I came back, and recently this place has changed a bit. They still have the glass bottles, and same menu but I think the food menu has changed a bit and maybe owner? But anyways all in all this place is great, their teas are fresh and I like the glass bottle that goes with it. I also like their tapioca, its made pretty good, as some places tend to leave it out long and its very hard and chewy. Unfortunately its in downtown area, so I cannot make my way here as often. This place does get busy, and parking can be a pain depending on time of day. It is on the pricyer side for teas so I cant say I would come back here everyday. Service is great and quick would def recommend everyone to come here and try it out if they have not already. 

My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea. Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.

excerpts: I got the Matcha Latte with almond milk, boba, and less sweetness ($4.95), which was presented beautifully with the layers and I saw them make it with fresh matcha.
matcha latte.author: April L.
matcha latte.review:
There are a lot of boba places in SF and this one is definitely one of the better ones! 

My boyfriend got the avocado smoothie with aloe ($5.95) with jelly (the only boba place I've seen in SF with avocado as an option, which is his favorite!), and it was AMAZING (I wanted to trade mine for his). It was creamy, but not overly sweet. 

I got the Matcha Latte with almond milk, boba, and less sweetness ($4.95), which was presented beautifully with the layers and I saw them make it with fresh matcha.

Yes, it's a bit on the pricier side but that's because they use fresh ingredients and put it in a glass bottle that if you bring back to refill you get a 10% discount! Love love coming here and am craving this place as a I write this review!

excerpts: Matcha latte was delicious - they mix up matcha the traditional way, then pour it on top of chilled milk.
Great matcha flavor.
matcha latte.author: Tasha H.
matcha latte.review:
~$4.50 for a drink, which includes the glass bottle you can take home - not bad! 

The tea here you can tell is higher quality, and they use real dairy products for their milk drinks. I usually get drinks at 50% sweetness, and here the sweetness reduction is serious - 50% here is probably equivalent to 25% elsewhere. 

Matcha latte was delicious - they mix up matcha the traditional way, then pour it on top of chilled milk. Great matcha flavor.

excerpts: The matcha latte was great.
They seem to make their teas with authentic ingredients.
My friends got boba or lychee jelly milk teas and they tasted about the same as similar drinks from other places, so if you don't want to wait in the long line at boba guys just go here.
matcha latte.author: John L.
matcha latte.review:
Somewhat long line at popular times. Prices are around average for a tea place.

There's a second floor area with tables if you want to sit down for a while. The matcha latte was great. They seem to make their teas with authentic ingredients. My friends got boba or lychee jelly milk teas and they tasted about the same as similar drinks from other places, so if you don't want to wait in the long line at boba guys just go here.

excerpts: Looks like they've added some additional flavors (LIKE THAT BOMB ASS MATCHA LATTE)
but the verdict is still esspensive.
matcha latte.author: Adrianna L.
matcha latte.review:
Listen up, you are paying for the aesthetic.

The aesthetic of the marble counter top, the aesthetic of the milk bottles and the aesthetic of the decorations. 

I drink a lot of boba but do I consider myself an expert? Absolutely not/kind of. That's besides the point. 

While I enjoy a good instagram aesthetic as much as the next person, the prices for a drink here are too high. I understand I'm paying for overhead, cute decorations and milk bottles but I would seriously rather pay for a plastic cup if it dropped down the cost here. The boba is average.

Looks like they've added some additional flavors (LIKE THAT BOMB ASS MATCHA LATTE) but the verdict is still esspensive. You can walk over two blocks to iTea for a bigger serving of boba and a wider variation of flavors.

If you are wanting a cute pic for your instagram story or your yelp review (HI!) then head over to Plentea. If you care about how much money you spend if you drink boba on the daily then this place is a hard pass for me.

excerpts: The Matcha Latte is excellent, made fresh in front of you.
matcha latte.author: Mariam A.
matcha latte.review:
I don't know how Plentea doesn't have five stars. This place is hands down my FAVORITE. They have the best quality and taste of tea, plus many milk and toppings options. Their House Black Tea Milk Tea has a slight natural chocolatey taste that I'm addicted to. The Matcha Latte is excellent, made fresh in front of you. Everything tastes natural and is not watery like other chain places.

I live in Oakland Chinatown and work in Downtown San Francisco so I've been to a LOT of bubble tea places....this is the BEST.

excerpts:
Matcha latte with egg pudding half sweet 

Jasmine MT with honey boba, half sweet 

Strawberry black tea with chia seeds

House Black MT with boba and grass jelly, half sweet

Pineapple Oolong tea with chia seeds and grass jelly
matcha latte.author: Leah H.
matcha latte.review:
P.E.A.R.L. Standard Rating = 4.5/5
P-Perfect Chew
E-Extras  (variety of toppings and tea options)
A-Accommodations/Ability to customize
R-Real Ingredients 
L-Liquid Gold (Quality of Tea)

P  (.5) Not consistently stellar, as I've occasionally had the disappointing hard center, but when it's fresh, it's smooth and chewy all the way through! 
E  (1.0) Add-ons include chia seeds, pudding, honey boba, and grass jelly. I also like the many tea options that are available.
A  (1.0)  You can change ice, sweetness, and milk options. The team (both cafes are pretty reasonable for other requests) Additionally, the fact that Plentea uses glass bottles allows for accommodations to be made post-production, which is helpful for any sweetness level changes. 
R  (1.0) Housemade syrups and seasonal fruits here (i.e., avocado, papaya, taro). You won't see powders or conventional packaged syrup flavors! 
L  (1.0)  Super sippable hot, cold, black or sweetened! Plentea uses organic loose leaf teas. Their matcha (hand-whisked) is also pretty delicious! 

FAVES: 

Matcha latte with egg pudding half sweet 

Jasmine MT with honey boba, half sweet 

Strawberry black tea with chia seeds

House Black MT with boba and grass jelly, half sweet

Pineapple Oolong tea with chia seeds and grass jelly 



#thePEARLstandard
#mrsbeansbobablog

excerpts: I purchased the sea salt cream oolong tea and a matcha latte.
I must say, this was one of the best matcha drinks I've ever gotten from a tea shop.
I watched the matcha being made with the traditional Japanese tools, and how she layered the drink-
it's so pretty and smells so good freshly made!
I highly recommended this place!
Their boba is really soft and thankfully not overly sweet, perfect to leave more emphasis on the tea.
The combo of the refreshingly well done tea and overall aesthetic won me over.
The glass bottles are definitely following me to work.
Also the 15% off two drinks with a check in is nice; just like the employees even at twenty minutes until closing.
matcha latte.author: Misa C.
matcha latte.review: If you need a tea fix and don't want to trash the plant with more plastic and like reusable bottles to take to work/school, this place is for you. I purchased the sea salt cream oolong tea and a matcha latte. I must say, this was one of the best matcha drinks I've ever gotten from a tea shop. I watched the matcha being made with the traditional Japanese tools, and how she layered the drink- it's so pretty and smells so good freshly made! I highly recommended this place! Their boba is really soft and thankfully not overly sweet, perfect to leave more emphasis on the tea. The combo of the refreshingly well done tea and overall aesthetic won me over. The glass bottles are definitely following me to work. Also the 15% off two drinks with a check in is nice; just like the employees even at twenty minutes until closing.

excerpts: What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte.
It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.

Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-
Tea just a block down.
In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i
-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom.
During normal hours I prefer to go to i
-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.
matcha latte.author: Ahmad J.
matcha latte.review:
Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi. Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times. The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas. For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond). For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each). Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%). It seems to cross all boxes as far as options are concerned.

Over a period of time I've tried most of their Classic and Special Milk teas. One thing that distinguishes Plentea from other boba tea places is their insistence on using glass bottles instead of plastic cups, supposedly to help the environment. In today age when you can get fully compostable cups and straws, insisting on using glass bottles for protecting the environment is just wrong. Let's call it what it is, a marketing ploy that positions Plentea differently from their competitors. Goes without saying I am not a fan of these glass bottles as they feel heavy and makes holding the drink painful. I would prefer if they give you a choice of getting a glass bottle rather than palming them off on everyone. Anyway let's move on to the drinks.

The short and simple review would be that their drinks are good not great. It took a little trial and error to get to my customization right here. I started by getting my drinks 50% sweet, but found that for my taste I needed their regular sweetness (but that would be a little sweet for most people). Then I replaced whole milk with half-and-half as whole milk tended to undermine the tea taste and lastly getting less ice prevented the teas from becoming diluted with time.

From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea. The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness. What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte. It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.
 
Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-Tea just a block down. In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom. During normal hours I prefer to go to i-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.

excerpts: I got the regular black milk tea and got my husband the matcha latte.
matcha latte.author: Betty R.
matcha latte.review:
Great concept and milk tea comes in cool glass milk bottles but I've had better tea and thought they didn't give much tapioca for the additional charge. 

Today was the first time I passed by this place without a line out the door so I decided to finally try it. Super disappointed--guess you could say I had very high expectations based on the popularity and it was just average. 

Tea didn't taste very strong. Not sure if they don't steep it long enough or if there's too much milk but it lacked more tea punch. Tapioca wasn't bad but there didn't seem to be much given the big glass bottle of milk tea. I got the regular black milk tea and got my husband the matcha latte. Both could be customized for sweetness level which is always a plus to me because I don't like my milk tea to be too sweet. Each topping is an additional $1 and you just don't get enough of the add ons.

Their fruit teas looked pretty good. I saw a lot of people walking out with them after I ordered but I probably won't be back again after this time so won't get to try it. Sorry but first impressions really do count with me when it comes to drinks or food. If you want a cool glass milk bottle then you should give this place a shot but it's probably not worth waiting in a long line for.

excerpts: I felt like the drinks were limited, but the Matcha Latte was amazing.
I also adjusted the sweetness to half, and sweetness exceeded my expectations.
Service was really great too.

I also really love the concept (what makes this place different from most) about how there's glass bottles that you can keep, but I think it's fair enough to have an alternative for customers who do not want to keep it.
Other than that, I will definitely come back.
matcha latte.author: Tiffany N.
matcha latte.review:
I rarely get milk tea in SF, my only spot would be Little Sweet. We wanted to get Boba Guys, but the line was out of the door and we didn't feel like waiting. So, we went to Plentea. 

It wasn't crowded, and the interior is amazing. It's a really pretty and aesthetically pleasing place to hang out at. I felt like the drinks were limited, but the Matcha Latte was amazing. I also adjusted the sweetness to half, and sweetness exceeded my expectations. Service was really great too. I also really love the concept (what makes this place different from most) about how there's glass bottles that you can keep, but I think it's fair enough to have an alternative for customers who do not want to keep it. Other than that, I will definitely come back.

excerpts: I've ordered the thai ice tea and the matcha latte and both were great.
The default sweetness level is perfect for me (I usually get 25% sugar).
matcha latte.author: Vianna V.
matcha latte.review:
My favourite bubble tea shop in sf so far! I've ordered the thai ice tea and the matcha latte and both were great. The default sweetness level is perfect for me (I usually get 25% sugar). There's also something really satisfying about watching them whisk the matcha and pour it in. 

The service is amazing as well. The guy that took my order was so polite and cheerful. The first time I went the tearista even let me sample the tea because I was having trouble deciding on what to order. 

There's also an upper level with seating and outlets !

Love this place so much

excerpts: The matcha latte at Plentea had the right amount of sweetness and a strong fresh milk taste.
Often times bubble tea places will use milk powder or other artificial powdered flavors, leaving you with a very bloated feeling after a few sips.
This was definitely not the case at Plentea!
Their drinks even come in a super cute reusable glass bottle, at a very reasonable price compared to other stores that serve drinks in plastic cups.
What's not to love about Plentea!
matcha latte.author: Annabelle S.
matcha latte.review: The matcha latte at Plentea had the right amount of sweetness and a strong fresh milk taste. Often times bubble tea places will use milk powder or other artificial powdered flavors, leaving you with a very bloated feeling after a few sips. This was definitely not the case at Plentea! Their drinks even come in a super cute reusable glass bottle, at a very reasonable price compared to other stores that serve drinks in plastic cups. What's not to love about Plentea!

excerpts: My favorite is the matcha latte with almond milk and mild sweetness.
matcha latte.author: Denise L.
matcha latte.review: Solid place for bubble tea, especially if you want a cute glass bottle to keep afterwards. My favorite is the matcha latte with almond milk and mild sweetness. I've gotten the classic milk tea before, and I find it to be too sweet (and I love sweet drinks!) It's probably just good marketing, but I swear having your boba in a glass bottle makes it taste colder and more refreshing. There's not a ton of seating available, but on off-peak hours, I like to catch up with friends upstairs on their sofas.

excerpts: probably the worst matcha latte i have ever had it did not taste anything like matcha latte and on top of the that the boba was so hard ):
i
m super disappointed because i was really excited to come!
i recommend their lime tea though that was pretty good...
matcha latte.author: Remy W.
matcha latte.review:
probably the worst matcha latte i have ever had it did not taste anything like matcha latte and on top of the that the boba was so hard ): im super disappointed because i was really excited to come! 
i recommend their lime tea though that was pretty good...

excerpts: Their original milk tea and matcha latte are both yummy.
It's cool that they let you keep the glass jars.
matcha latte.author: Di W.
matcha latte.review:
I've been here twice and my experience has been enjoyable both times. The second time I visited, they were renovating part of the downstairs and all of the upstairs, so seating and waiting space was cramped. Their original milk tea and matcha latte are both yummy. It's cool that they let you keep the glass jars. Hot drinks are not served in the jars, only iced drinks.

Tip for Chase Sapphire Preferred and Reserve cardholders: This location uses Square to process payments, which does not process as Dining (confirmed by Chase customer service) so you will not receive your bonus earn here. I found out the hard way :(.

excerpts: I ordered an iced matcha latte and it came in their signature cute glass bottle.
The cashier said that the glass bottle was included and that if I brought it back next time, I would get a 10% discount on my next purchase.
That's pretty cool, but that also means I would need to remember to bring it back, which is difficult for those spontaneous trips up here to SF.
So I might just use it as a vase.
The matcha latte was pretty good, it had a nice flavor to it, but wasn't anything too special.
The one thing I didn't like about this place is the $10 minimum to pay with credit card.
So if you're planning just to get one drink for yourself, remember to bring cash.
The name of pretty cute though.
The matcha latte was pretty good, it had a nice flavor to it, but wasn't anything too special.
The one thing I didn't like about this place is the $10 minimum to pay with credit card.
So if you're planning just to get one drink for yourself, remember to bring cash.
The name of pretty cute though.
matcha latte.author: Sylvia K.
matcha latte.review: I was craving boba and decided to check this popular place out. It's a cute little place and it was crowded with people. I ordered an iced matcha latte and it came in their signature cute glass bottle. The cashier said that the glass bottle was included and that if I brought it back next time, I would get a 10% discount on my next purchase. That's pretty cool, but that also means I would need to remember to bring it back, which is difficult for those spontaneous trips up here to SF. So I might just use it as a vase. The matcha latte was pretty good, it had a nice flavor to it, but wasn't anything too special. The one thing I didn't like about this place is the $10 minimum to pay with credit card. So if you're planning just to get one drink for yourself, remember to bring cash. The name of pretty cute though.

excerpts: I ordered the matcha latte with boba and it was pretty good.
matcha latte.author: Valerie C.
matcha latte.review:
Love this place! Everything is on point from the workers to the tea to the ambiance. 

Who hasn't seen the super cute plentea glass bottles? I had to see if this place lived up to the hype. I ordered the matcha latte with boba and it was pretty good. I prefer boba guys, but it was still a very very good matcha. 

This location is multileveled with an upstairs lounge area. I love the the upstairs, perfect place to relax and enjoy tea. 

Fast service+charming guy working register=

sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby

coffee was p good I guess
, more mediocre tho.
iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee.
strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there.
the drink was kinda watery
, it's very lite on sweetness
but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth.
they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch.
overall nothing to get crazy about.
the bottles are glass and reusable
I believe.

matcha latte.author: Grace N.
matcha latte.review:
service was gr9, drinks were bleh

I came here with 4 friends and we all swapped/tasted drinks (I know-beware of mono) but they still all tasted so blannndd. crie.

we tried matcha latte (cold), sweet taro milk, coffee milk tea (cold), and a strawberry fresh fruit tea (best out of allllladem). matcha latte tasted like straight up milk with green dye. sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby, it had [REAL] taro bits that my friends did not like (I enjoyed the bits bc my love for taro has never relinquished), but other than that, sweet taro tasted like sweet milk. coffee was p good I guess, more mediocre tho. iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee. strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there. the drink was kinda watery, it's very lite on sweetness but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth. they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch. overall nothing to get crazy about. the bottles are glass and reusable I believe. you can grab a plastic cap on your way out to save the rest of your drink.

the store is super hip and cute tho. I guess you could come here for the IG pic and what not but I don't recommend plentea for da dranks. sowey

excerpts: I got the Matcha Latte
and it just tasted like milk...
The boba wasn't the best I've had either.
It was a little too chewy and the texture
didn't feel very smooth.
So...I probably wouldn't recommend coming her, unless you're on a mission to get one of these jars haha.
I definitely should have opted for Boba Guys instead.
matcha latte.author: Ashley Y.
matcha latte.review: Honestly, I'll admit that I came here for the jars. Yes you can keep them if you want, but we didn't want to haul it around with us the rest of the day so we just gave them back. I still don't know how they have so many jars that they can afford to give every customer one...The drink itself was alright..nothing special. I got the Matcha Latte and it just tasted like milk...The boba wasn't the best I've had either. It was a little too chewy and the texture didn't feel very smooth. So...I probably wouldn't recommend coming her, unless you're on a mission to get one of these jars haha. I definitely should have opted for Boba Guys instead.

excerpts: As for the drink itself, the boba had a nice chewy consistency to it and was slightly sweet, but I am not a fan of the matcha latte.
matcha latte.author: Stephanie H.
matcha latte.review:
Plentea is another boba place I decided to run to along the Embarcadero. Obviously this was so I could more fairly compare it to Bottle Zup, which is a very similar boba shop. I also wanted to go running, but needed a motivator, so obviously the solution was to make a bubble tea shop the destination and boba my reward.

Unfortunately (for those who may have been pedestrians between my apartment and Plentea), I did not have the opportunity to run over a mile back home carrying a bottle full of boba in one hand and a bubble tea straw and my phone in the other, as I did when I visited Bottle Zup. This is partly because I was feeling lazy and the Montgomery Muni stop is nearby, and partly because Plentea only gives a plastic cap to cover the bottle, and I was afraid it wouldn't hold up under the stress of my running home.

As for the drink itself, the boba had a nice chewy consistency to it and was slightly sweet, but I am not a fan of the matcha latte. It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha. I like my matcha strongly-flavored and textured, so this didn't quite hit the right note.

This place is pretty overpriced--I paid nearly $6 for my drink after tax, and had to pay in cash ($10 credit card minimum) which is a pain because it meant that I had to carry cash there while running and carry change back! The glass bottle is sturdy and slightly bigger than the one from Bottle Zup, but even if I bring it back for the 10% discount, I'm not sure it's worth it. I like the novelty of the glass bottle, but you could easily get the same for slightly better tea at Bottle Zup. The one thing Plentea does have going for it is that it stays open so late (until 11pm) which is super convenient in a city where so many places (specifically boba places) close so early.

excerpts: Unfortunately, I got the matcha latte with almond milk/boba with reg sweetness and I could not taste any matcha nor any other taste.
Even the boba tasted off, generally boba is sweeter and a little chewy.
matcha latte.author: Sarah I.
matcha latte.review:
Walked over to a couple of boba places around 3pm and saw it was packed everywhere. Stumbled upon Pleatea and they only had two people waiting in line. Red flag.

In summary, extremely overpriced boba. I paid $6 for a tasteless boba drink in a jar. $6?!!! I understand they are trying to be different with the mason jar bottle but the drink has to match the price. Unfortunately, I got the matcha latte with almond milk/boba with reg sweetness and I could not taste any matcha nor any other taste. Even the boba tasted off, generally boba is sweeter and a little chewy. This was mushy and did not have a good texture.

Noted if you come back you get 10% off if you bring the bottle back. But with the super high price why not go down the street to I-tea instead?

I am a huge fan of boba and you really can't mess up a boba drink. Sadly I will not return due to the poor taste and the extremely high price of meh boba.

excerpts: My friends got the Matcha Latte, they said it was bitter and left a nasty feeling on the tongue.
I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade
I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade
matcha latte.author: Katie P.
matcha latte.review:
The glass bottles are cute and reusable but the drinks were disgusting. I got the lavender lemonade and it tasted bitter and like soap. It had a spicy taste of some sort, neither me nor my friends liked it at all. My friends got the Matcha Latte, they said it was bitter and left a nasty feeling on the tongue. The atmosphere is really nice; crowded, but aesthetically pleasing. 

It is also pretty overpriced. I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade

excerpts: Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and
my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.
matcha latte.author: Angela T.
matcha latte.review:
Literally one of the cutest tea places I have ever come across. No other tea place can compare to the bottles, minimalistic walls, and (small) upstairs section with a nice loft-style view of the downstairs. The most Instagram-worthy cafe there is out there. It is kind of small though so I assume that it can get crowded at times, but everything else about the shop aesthetics is 5/5.

Now, on to the tea. So I have not tried much from the wide variety of their menu, but when I tried the Fresh Fruit tea (peach), the tea was comparable to my all-time favorite tea shop, Fantasia. The flavor was strong enough and not extremely artificial, so 5/5 on the tea. However, I would say that the tapioca is a little more harder than I wanted but still decently chewy. 4/5 for the pearls only because I am biased to Fantasia's incredibly soft, chewy ones.

So overall, I would give it around a 4.75/5. Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.

excerpts: I ordered the CoffMilk Tea with tapioca and my friend ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca, neither of the drinks look like the picture on the menu.
Both drinks were alright; I've tasted better.
The only cool part about this place is that their bottles come with the drink you order.
The service was friendly, but they were extremely slow with making the drinks.
matcha latte.author: Kiersten S.
matcha latte.review: My friends and I have been hearing about the hype about Plentea for a while, so we decided to check it out. I ordered the CoffMilk Tea with tapioca and my friend ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca, neither of the drinks look like the picture on the menu. Both drinks were alright; I've tasted better. The only cool part about this place is that their bottles come with the drink you order. The service was friendly, but they were extremely slow with making the drinks.

excerpts: There are so many flavors--original milk tea, matcha latte, sweet taro, coffee milk, almond milk, and even nutella milk (??!).
They also have fruit teas for the non-milk tea lovers.

Drinks are ~$5 and you basically choose your flavored drink cold/hot, sugar level (50% is usually perfect for me for other places but plentea makes it less sweet compared to other places which is perfect for me), and finally add-ins (my fav!).

For add-ins you get to choose from: taro/egg pudding (my must-have!), tapioca (boba), chia seed (for the health nuts), lychee jelly (fruity peeps), grass jelly (yum), red bean (for the sweeties), and aloe (light jelly/texture).
My favorite part is the glass bottle your drink comes in.
They're super adorable and you can even keep them!
I got the almond milk tea with taro pudding (my two fav things together omg), cold, 50% sugar.
Loved it!

It had a nice almond flavor that tasted really pure (NOT artificial almond flavor that gets stuck at the back of your throat), subtle black tea mixed in the background that was not overpowering or bitter, and perfect level of creaminess that just had me wanting more!
Definitely wished they gave more taro pudding because it was that good--again, no artificial or overly sweet taro taste, and the pudding tasted soft and fluffy.
I'm already ready to come back and try some more!
Matcha is definitely my thing
so...until next time!
matcha latte.author: Alvina L.
matcha latte.review:
FIRST time of PLENTEA ("plenty") times to come! 

Point to note: I am not a crazy boba fan and really don't drink boba all that often (except for half and half in socal which I lovee or sharetea which is pretty good too).

However, this place definitely has my stamp of approval for your boba fix. There are so many flavors--original milk tea, matcha latte, sweet taro, coffee milk, almond milk, and even nutella milk (??!). They also have fruit teas for the non-milk tea lovers. Drinks are ~$5 and you basically choose your flavored drink cold/hot, sugar level (50% is usually perfect for me for other places but plentea makes it less sweet compared to other places which is perfect for me), and finally add-ins (my fav!). For add-ins you get to choose from: taro/egg pudding (my must-have!), tapioca (boba), chia seed (for the health nuts), lychee jelly (fruity peeps), grass jelly (yum), red bean (for the sweeties), and aloe (light jelly/texture). My favorite part is the glass bottle your drink comes in. They're super adorable and you can even keep them! (or bring them back for your next drink for 10% off...correct me if I'm wrong). 

I got the almond milk tea with taro pudding (my two fav things together omg), cold, 50% sugar. Loved it! It had a nice almond flavor that tasted really pure (NOT artificial almond flavor that gets stuck at the back of your throat), subtle black tea mixed in the background that was not overpowering or bitter, and perfect level of creaminess that just had me wanting more! Definitely wished they gave more taro pudding because it was that good--again, no artificial or overly sweet taro taste, and the pudding tasted soft and fluffy. I'm already ready to come back and try some more! Matcha is definitely my thing so...until next time!

excerpts: Dropped by after dinner and grabbed a Hot Matcha Latte with Grass Jelly.
matcha latte.author: Anna M.
matcha latte.review:
Dropped by after dinner and grabbed a Hot Matcha Latte with Grass Jelly.

Hot drinks don't come in the glass bottle, so don't order a hot drink if you're coming for the bottle aesthetic. 

The drink was okay - not too sweet but the matcha flavor wasn't too strong either. The grass jelly was slightly sweet and yummy, but the portion wasn't very generous.

I've been here before for boba, and I would say this is overall a decent tea shop but doesn't compare to anything from LA.

excerpts: I got the matcha latte with almond milk, egg pudding and less sweet.
I like you can customize the sugar level.
They also have food and snacks like salad and waffles.
But I think some of their dishes are premade.
There's an upstairs area for you to sit and chat.
I didn't see any bathrooms, so that kinda sucked.
matcha latte.author: Minerva L.
matcha latte.review: Cute place, drinks come in these cute bottle with caps. I got the matcha latte with almond milk, egg pudding and less sweet. I like you can customize the sugar level. They also have food and snacks like salad and waffles. But I think some of their dishes are premade. There's an upstairs area for you to sit and chat. I didn't see any bathrooms, so that kinda sucked.

excerpts: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!
matcha latte.author: Doug V.
matcha latte.review: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I got the Matcha Latte with Egg Pudding and the Sea Salt Crema Tea with boba.
I thought the matcha was quite watered down and mediocre at best.
My boyfriend's sea salt crema was also meh.
The prices are extremely high (but I guess this is because you can keep the bottles).
Keep in mind that the drink size is smaller than the norm as well since the bottles are quite narrow.
My boyfriend also got very little boba in his drink compared to other places.
All in all, the only thing I am happy about is now
I have some cute bottles for memories.
matcha latte.author: Trinh D.
matcha latte.review: The three stars are mainly just for the cute bottles. My boyfriend and I got the Matcha Latte with Egg Pudding and the Sea Salt Crema Tea with boba. I thought the matcha was quite watered down and mediocre at best. My boyfriend's sea salt crema was also meh. The prices are extremely high (but I guess this is because you can keep the bottles). Keep in mind that the drink size is smaller than the norm as well since the bottles are quite narrow. My boyfriend also got very little boba in his drink compared to other places. All in all, the only thing I am happy about is now I have some cute bottles for memories.

excerpts: I got the matcha latte with boba and egg pudding and it was sweet and pretty good!
It was $6.95 in the end
and I think because of the huge bottle you get it's worth it!
matcha latte.author: Renita T.
matcha latte.review: Love the bottles!!! The boba was a bit small, but it was tasty! I got the matcha latte with boba and egg pudding and it was sweet and pretty good! It was $6.95 in the end and I think because of the huge bottle you get it's worth it!

excerpts: and I do really like their Matcha Latte, but the lines are usually too long for me to get one on my lunch break anyway.
matcha latte.author: Christina R.
matcha latte.review:
If you're coming for a cute drink in a cute cafe, totally worth it. The bottles are adorable and reusable (I use one as a vase sometimes).

If you're coming just for some boba, it's pretty good but not worth the over $5 pricetag. Yes, you do get a discount if you return the bottle, but it's still pretty expensive for just a drink. 

True, FiDi doesn't have a lot of options, so I still will come in every once and a while and I do really like their Matcha Latte, but the lines are usually too long for me to get one on my lunch break anyway.

Essentially, a little better quality than other boba shops in Chinatown but pretty expensive for what you get unless you admit you're only doing it for the cute jar.

excerpts: I got the matcha latte which was ok, just ok.
It tasted more like milk then matcha
so maybe they put too much milk?
It would have been much better if I tasted the matcha.
The boba was not good at all because it was not chewy but very hard.
