I would come back to give them another try because there stuff might be better if it was not that busy.
matcha latte.author: Mike G.
matcha latte.review: Like others have said, the good thing about this place is you get a glass bottle. The other things vary. I got the matcha latte which was ok, just ok. It tasted more like milk then matcha so maybe they put too much milk? It would have been much better if I tasted the matcha. The boba was not good at all because it was not chewy but very hard. I would come back to give them another try because there stuff might be better if it was not that busy.

excerpts: I drink a LOT of boba and am obsessed with salty cream over my matcha latte
so just can you make it happen?
matcha latte.author: Christina C.
matcha latte.review:
Didn't get my glass bottle but you know what? I don't really care. 

I ordered a matcha green tea latte w/salted cream, which isn't really on the menu. They seemed slightly confused by it since they guy I was ordering it from hadn't heard of that idea or combo before, but I was pushy. I was like, "Yo trust me! I drink a LOT of boba and am obsessed with salty cream over my matcha latte so just can you make it happen?" And sure enough he did...and it was great...until...

I realized a few sips in that not only was it not salty enough, it just wasn't salty at all! I tasted my friend's who got the oolong w/salted cream (MY GOD THAT DRINK IS A DREAM) and realized mine was not done right! I went back and the woman was totally ready and offered to make me a new drink, which I didn't really feel like I needed, but if she could just add some salted cream to the mix, I would be soooo happy! So that she did and back I was to being a happy camper.

Two thumbs up to this spot - I've officially arrived in the world of expensive boba. Let the wallet thinning over beverages begin!

excerpts: I loved the matcha latte and the boba was perfect!
It wasn't mushy and wasn't too hard.
The matcha latte wasn't overly sweet and milky.
I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends!
The matcha latte wasn't overly sweet and milky.
I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends!
matcha latte.author: Sofia S.
matcha latte.review: I loved the matcha latte and the boba was perfect! It wasn't mushy and wasn't too hard. The matcha latte wasn't overly sweet and milky. I would definitely recommend this to all of my friends!

excerpts: the CoffMilk Tea said it reminded her of Vietnamese coffee.
coffmilk tea.author: Karishma M.
coffmilk tea.review:
I got the mango green tea and was a huge fan. I'm vegan so I was looking for an option with milk. It was green tea with chunks of real mango in it. I think sugar was added but I didn't get around to asking. I love mango and I like green tea so it was a good combination. You also get to keep the glass containers they give you with a lid.

My friend who got the CoffMilk Tea said it reminded her of Vietnamese coffee.

My friend who got the Strawberry Green Tea liked hers as well and said she also tasted the real strawberry in it.

I think if you get the right drink then this place could be a great option for you.

I know I'll be back for more mango green tea and I may add red bean as a topping the next time around.

excerpts: I opted for the coffmilk tea which is Hong Kong style "ying yang
coffmilk tea.author: Ronald L.
coffmilk tea.review: I'm a fan of the glass cups they use (more like tap glass bottles).  Environment friendly for sure!  I opted for the coffmilk tea which is Hong Kong style "ying yang" aka coffee and milk tea mixed together.  Great drink with enough caffeine but not too much so you can sleep at night.

excerpts: I ordered the CoffMilk Tea and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea.
The thing I love about this place is that for $4.50, you get milk tea in a glass container that you could end up keeping/reusing after finishing your drink.
The price is so cheap that I'm ended up questioning how they can possibly make a profit!!
coffmilk tea.author: Alex L.
coffmilk tea.review:
The venue is very nicely decorated, with little plants scattered around the store, giving it a very fresh and clean vibe. The store has enough seating for about 12 or 13 people at once. Menus (pictured below) are conveniently positioned above the cash register and there are PLENTY of deals/offers! At the time of this review, there is an offer of 15% off two drinks when checking in. 

I ordered the CoffMilk Tea and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea. The thing I love about this place is that for $4.50, you get milk tea in a glass container that you could end up keeping/reusing after finishing your drink. The price is so cheap that I'm ended up questioning how they can possibly make a profit!! As if that wasn't enough, my friend noticed chalk writing on the wall stating that you could save 10% off on future purchases if you bring your own bottle (reuse the bottle) 

The service was very quick and efficient. I ordered and got my drink within 10 minutes. This is especially great during lunch hours because I recall this place being very packed during the day time.

excerpts: I ordered the CoffMilk Tea with tapioca and my friend ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca, neither of the drinks look like the picture on the menu.
Both drinks were alright; I've tasted better.
The only cool part about this place is that their bottles come with the drink you order.
The service was friendly, but they were extremely slow with making the drinks.
coffmilk tea.author: Kiersten S.
coffmilk tea.review: My friends and I have been hearing about the hype about Plentea for a while, so we decided to check it out. I ordered the CoffMilk Tea with tapioca and my friend ordered the Matcha Latte with tapioca, neither of the drinks look like the picture on the menu. Both drinks were alright; I've tasted better. The only cool part about this place is that their bottles come with the drink you order. The service was friendly, but they were extremely slow with making the drinks.

excerpts: I decided to get Coffmilk Tea with boba (tapioca) and
to me it just tastes like your average ice coffee.
It was a bit water down and lacked in flavor.
coffmilk tea.author: Devin T.
coffmilk tea.review: Was strolling around Chinatown/Union Square Area and decided to get some milk tea. This was my first time trying out Plentea and the line went out the door. First impression of this place was that it must be pretty good. I decided to get Coffmilk Tea with boba (tapioca) and to me it just tastes like your average ice coffee. It was a bit water down and lacked in flavor. Don't get me wrong, the recycled glass bottle is unique but the milk tea I got was not up to par. I've heard from friends that recommend to get other drinks on their menu that are not milk teas are better and I might consider coming back to give it another try!

excerpts: We ordered the Coffmilk Tea and the Green Milk Tea.
coffmilk tea.author: Karen C.
coffmilk tea.review:
Have to admit, I was enamored by those cool milk bottle-esque glasses that the drinks come in. But in the end, that's where the obsession stops. The milk tea itself is decent, the boba soft, and the bottle super cool. The menu is pretty limited, but that's not always a bad thing if it's executed well. We ordered the Coffmilk Tea and the Green Milk Tea. The coffmilk is just a coffee milk tea, with good coffee flavor. The green milk tea was decently strong in tea flavor. I just wasn't wowed by the flavor profile with either drink. I probably should have been more adventurous and gone for the sea salt crema tea or coffee, but I don't get to drink SF grade boba very often anymore, so I have to get my fill when I can. There's a yelp discount which was helpful, but I honestly hate places that charge for toppings. It just feels very stingy and the original prices really aren't cheap. Guess you're paying a premium for the bottle! 

And oh, that bottle that I was so excited to add to my collection? Cracked after one use.

excerpts: Skip the coffmilk tea/fruity drinks.
coffmilk tea.author: Chelsea L.
coffmilk tea.review:
Milk tea (50% sweet)! 


Skip the coffmilk tea/fruity drinks.

excerpts: literally just average boba for about $6 (drink + boba). ordered the Coffmilk Tea and was pretty disappointed.
coffmilk tea.author: Ben L.
coffmilk tea.review: just OK boba. literally just average boba for about $6 (drink + boba). ordered the Coffmilk Tea and was pretty disappointed.

excerpts: Don't order the almond milk tea or the coffmilk tea.
The almond milk tea tasted like they dumped a couple teaspoons of almond extract in milk tea.
They did offer us a new drink for free.
We got the regular green milk tea, which was significantly better.
coffmilk tea.author: Liz D.
coffmilk tea.review: Don't order the almond milk tea or the coffmilk tea. The almond milk tea tasted like they dumped a couple teaspoons of almond extract in milk tea. They did offer us a new drink for free. We got the regular green milk tea, which was significantly better.

excerpts: I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea.
I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and
my friend who didn't wanna take risks
didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet
nutella milk tea.author: Calvin Z.
nutella milk tea.review:
First off - glass bottles. As someone who has really aesthetic friends, Plentea really helped me flex on them - "yeah your nicely edited photo of your latte and laptop at a coffee shop is aesthetic but have you ever had Thai milk tea in a glass bottle?" I'd like to think that when they saw my photos of my bubble tea in a glass bottle they whispered to themselves "damn I need me one of those".

Anyways.

Generally, bubble tea makes me feel bloated afterwards. I realize this is because they probably use powder, or because their tapioca comes from some questionable source, who knows. With Plentea's drink offerings, it tasted clean and like real tea and milk, which is something I appreciate a lot and I'm willing to pay the premium if I know what I'm drinking is not powder. I can even see the staff make my drink in front of me, which is more reassuring than the places that have someone take my order, disappear into the back, and come back with my drink. 

I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea. I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and my friend who didn't wanna take risks didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet, it just tasted like a nice milk tea with hints of Nutella. My goal is to try everything on the menu before I leave SF.

And again... glass bottles. You don't even pay more than you would at other popular bubble tea shops... maybe a bit less actually. Maybe I'm a sucker for these novelties, but it's what drew me in and the quality of the milk tea is what kept me coming back.

excerpts: I'm open to trying their Nutella milk tea as well.
Come if you're in the area and try for yourself!
nutella milk tea.author: Staci W.
nutella milk tea.review:
I was really excited to try this place because the pictures were so cute but I was pretty underwhelmed :/ 

I went on a nice day and surprisingly there weren't that many people in front of us. The interior was decorated in that cute, minimalist Insta-friendly style that's really popular lately. I'm definitely a fan of  the design because I'm a sucker for wood accents and plants! The guy who made our drinks was pretty friendly and recommended a drink for my friend who was undecided on what to get so that was pretty sweet. 

Drinks came out relatively quickly and I can't deny the aesthetic appeal of the bottles. Unfortunately my milk tea tasted kinda watered down and not that memorable. My friend and I ordered bubble milk teas with less sugar and ice. Maybe the milk tea would've been better with full sugar but it was just okay. Our other friend's drink was better. Unfortunately I can't remember what it was called but it was some type of fruity green tea. 

If I come back I'll probably get a green tea or a full-sugar milk tea. I'm open to trying their Nutella milk tea as well. Come if you're in the area and try for yourself!

excerpts: They have nutella milk tea which was interesting.
For cold drinks, they give you a glass bottle that you can take home if you want.
It's environment friendly
so i was super happy to see this.
nutella milk tea.author: Yeonhwa S.
nutella milk tea.review:
The place is cute and nice that they have seating upstairs but it wasnt very clean. Hair, dust, and trash everywhere. Maybe because i went late at night, but it was still not very pleasant. 

The drink was ok! They have nutella milk tea which was interesting. For cold drinks, they give you a glass bottle that you can take home if you want. It's environment friendly so i was super happy to see this.

excerpts: From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea.
The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness.
nutella milk tea.author: Ahmad J.
nutella milk tea.review:
Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi. Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times. The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas. For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond). For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each). Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%). It seems to cross all boxes as far as options are concerned.

Over a period of time I've tried most of their Classic and Special Milk teas. One thing that distinguishes Plentea from other boba tea places is their insistence on using glass bottles instead of plastic cups, supposedly to help the environment. In today age when you can get fully compostable cups and straws, insisting on using glass bottles for protecting the environment is just wrong. Let's call it what it is, a marketing ploy that positions Plentea differently from their competitors. Goes without saying I am not a fan of these glass bottles as they feel heavy and makes holding the drink painful. I would prefer if they give you a choice of getting a glass bottle rather than palming them off on everyone. Anyway let's move on to the drinks.

The short and simple review would be that their drinks are good not great. It took a little trial and error to get to my customization right here. I started by getting my drinks 50% sweet, but found that for my taste I needed their regular sweetness (but that would be a little sweet for most people). Then I replaced whole milk with half-and-half as whole milk tended to undermine the tea taste and lastly getting less ice prevented the teas from becoming diluted with time.

From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea. The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness. What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte. It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.
 
Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-Tea just a block down. In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom. During normal hours I prefer to go to i-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.

excerpts: My favorites are the sea salt crema oolong and Nutella milk tea.
nutella milk tea.author: Sunil R.
nutella milk tea.review: Was my regular stop for many years when I worked around the corner. They were always busy but rightfully so. Very good Boba and snacks. My favorites are the sea salt crema oolong and Nutella milk tea.

excerpts: We ordered Nutella milk tea and a regular milk tea.
I really like how it's all made with real tea
so it's slightly on the bitter side.
Much better than the powder milks tea.
Super cute how they put it in a glass bottle that's reusable.
I do wish
hey had more flavor options though
it is pretty limited.
Overall would definitely go back when I get a chance
nutella milk tea.author: Nina Y.
nutella milk tea.review: Came here with some friend and got the 2 for 15% off deal with the yelp checkin. We ordered Nutella milk tea and a regular milk tea. I really like how it's all made with real tea so it's slightly on the bitter side. Much better than the powder milks tea. Super cute how they put it in a glass bottle that's reusable. I do wish hey had more flavor options though... it is pretty limited. Overall would definitely go back when I get a chance

excerpts: I got the roast oolong tea ($4.50 + boba, 50 % sugar, less ice )while my friends got the Nutella milk tea ($4.95 + boba) and oolong salt cream ($4.95 + boba)!

Honestly the texture of the boba was excellent (think better than some of the boba guys places I've been before, much improved since the last time I had been) and I could tell how fresh the milk tea was!
Roast oolong had the perfect creaminess to it with the whole milk, so 5/5 would recommend!
Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!
Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!
nutella milk tea.author: Kristie M.
nutella milk tea.review:
Came here on Sunday afternoon around 5 pm with a couple of friends to see that Plentea no longer had its giant tv screens on the wall, and a new updated menu! It looked good and I hadn't been in about a year so was excited to try it after it had been a while! 

I got the roast oolong tea ($4.50 + boba, 50 % sugar, less ice )while my friends got the Nutella milk tea ($4.95 + boba) and oolong salt cream ($4.95 + boba)! You get 15% off 2 drinks (doesn't apply to roe than 2 drinks) if you check in. 

Honestly the texture of the boba was excellent (think better than some of the boba guys places I've been before, much improved since the last time I had been) and I could tell how fresh the milk tea was! Roast oolong had the perfect creaminess to it with the whole milk, so 5/5 would recommend! Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!

We also got free cups of water when we asked so don't be shy if you need some too after drinking all that boba! Price point is pretty good especially since you get to keep the bottle and can bring it back for a discount- and they have new metal lids instead of plastic! 

Overall, great and will be back again soon! 

PS they redid their counter set up so that you pick up the boba on the side instead of the front like before!

excerpts: I had Nutella Milk Tea with Tapioca, and ..
It was good.
nutella milk tea.author: Rudy H.
nutella milk tea.review:
I was craving for some Asian desserts at 10 pm and I thought about taking Uber to Richmond for some hot Asian desserts.
But I changed my mind because it was raining and windy. so I grabbed my umbrella and walked 5 minutes instead, problem solved.
I had Nutella Milk Tea with Tapioca, and ..
It was good.

excerpts: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!!
They were both very delicious.
Sadly live to far
or I'd be there every day!
Customer service was good!
nutella milk tea.author: Karina R.
nutella milk tea.review: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!! They were both very delicious. Sadly live to far or I'd be there every day! Customer service was good!

excerpts: Try the nutella milk tea!
Just doo itt
nutella milk tea.author: Stefanie R.
nutella milk tea.review: Customer service is amazing! One of the men was so helpful and kind to my boyfriend and I, offering suggestions and catering to our sweetness needs. Try the nutella milk tea! Just doo itt

excerpts: I would have liked to also try their nutella milk tea or fruit tea w/ real strawberry bits.
They also have snacks, a couple entrees, and belgian waffles here too.
nutella milk tea.author: Ashley C.
nutella milk tea.review: Plentea is a short walk away from Union Square so if you're looking for a boba place, you definitely should stop by here! Their drinks are a little pricier, ranging between $4-6, compared to the average $3-4 range, but it's because their drinks come in a pretty glass bottle that you get to keep! It's a small little shop so if it's a weekend, you might want to just grab and go. I wanted to get a drink that looked pretty for the pics - so I ended up getting a strawberry milk tea with taro pudding. It was really yummy! I finished it quickly, not sure if it's because I love boba or if it's because it seems like a smaller portion haha! Either way, it was delicious. I would have liked to also try their nutella milk tea or fruit tea w/ real strawberry bits. They also have snacks, a couple entrees, and belgian waffles here too.

excerpts: I had the hot Nutella milk tea with aloe & egg pudding (a total deviation from my normal coconut or almond milk basic boba)
I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea.
It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be.
You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.
I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea.
It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be.
You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.
nutella milk tea.author: Tasha P.
nutella milk tea.review: First time here. An interesting selection. It's more expensive than most boba places. I had the hot Nutella milk tea with aloe & egg pudding (a total deviation from my normal coconut or almond milk basic boba) I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea. It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be. You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.

excerpts: Tried a few drinks, including the sea salt crema oolong and nutella milk tea.
I also tried my wife's green tea matcha and almond milk tea w/ red bean.
The best one was the sea salt crema hands down.
I asked for it half sweet, but the gentleman at the register said it wasn't too sweet to begin with, so I had it as is and he was right, the sweetness was just right.
The sea salt crema topping was done perfectly as well.
I'm a fan of the glass bottles they put their drinks in.
They don't leak or spill when you shake your drink or flip it upside down with the lid on.
One negative thing about this place is that they don't have a restroom.
You guys sell drinks.
That just doesn't make sense to me.
nutella milk tea.author: MJ E.
nutella milk tea.review: Came here 2 times in a day when visiting Chinatown. Tried a few drinks, including the sea salt crema oolong and nutella milk tea. I also tried my wife's green tea matcha and almond milk tea w/ red bean. The best one was the sea salt crema hands down. I asked for it half sweet, but the gentleman at the register said it wasn't too sweet to begin with, so I had it as is and he was right, the sweetness was just right. The sea salt crema topping was done perfectly as well. I'm a fan of the glass bottles they put their drinks in. They don't leak or spill when you shake your drink or flip it upside down with the lid on. One negative thing about this place is that they don't have a restroom. You guys sell drinks. That just doesn't make sense to me.

excerpts: I had a taro milk tea with boba and my brother had the nutella milk tea with boba, both with reduced sugar (I know, blasphemy!).
The taro was delicious!
It was made from real taro and not the powder that some places use.
nutella milk tea.author: Jason W.
nutella milk tea.review:
Finally swung by Plentea after hearing all the hype...and also being insanely jealous of the glass bottles that everyone had.

I had a taro milk tea with boba and my brother had the nutella milk tea with boba, both with reduced sugar (I know, blasphemy!). The taro was delicious! It was made from real taro and not the powder that some places use. The nutella was good as well but had a bit more of a dark chocolate flavor rather than the distinctive hazelnut flavor of nutella.

Either way, the boba in each was perfectly chewy. The glasses are awesome though! Bring them home and use them for tiny aquariums or little decorative pieces or use them for coffee/milk/etc. Also, if you bring them back (at least at the Kearney location), you get 10% off!

All in all, a bit pricier than some places but you get what you pay for!

excerpts: So I guess that's a no go for the Nutella milk tea I wanted to try.
Went with the black milk tea instead Without boba of course.
The black milk tea was kind of strong, but that's just personal preference.
nutella milk tea.author: Gina K.
nutella milk tea.review:
A boba shop that didn't have boba....I came in Sunday a bit after 7 (they close at 11) and they ran out. Not only boba, but Nutella too? So I guess that's a no go for the Nutella milk tea I wanted to try. Went with the black milk tea instead Without boba of course. Also ordered the honeydew and strawberry milk. 

The place has 2 levels which is awesome since the front of the store to the register is basically 10 feet. 

The black milk tea was kind of strong, but that's just personal preference. The honeydew milk tastes fresh, but a bit light and the strawberry milk was perfect. 

Only downside to the fruit milk drinks are that they blend them up so its pretty frothy. A bit disappointed I couldn't try the boba.

excerpts: I came in with my boyfriend and we ordered a Black Milk Tea and Nutella Milk Tea.
Would highly recommend both to anyone trying to this place out for the first time.
Love the fact that they put their drinks in a glass bottle!
nutella milk tea.author: Marina P.
nutella milk tea.review: First time coming here from Seattle. Friendly staff, and always willing to help. I came in with my boyfriend and we ordered a Black Milk Tea and Nutella Milk Tea. Would highly recommend both to anyone trying to this place out for the first time. Love the fact that they put their drinks in a glass bottle!

excerpts: My fiance had the nutella milk tea
and it was also pretty gross...
and how can you mess up anything with nutella?!?
nutella milk tea.author: Anastasia N.
nutella milk tea.review:
I was SO excited to try this cute boba tea place out. As I was walking around the area to find the perfect lunch spot, I walked by this place and it screamed to me, "COME HERE FOR DESSERT AFTER YOU'RE DONE WITH LUNCH?" And so I did. I was so excited about finishing my lunch just so I can come here. Unfortunately, I wasn't satisfied at all.

The decor and the glass jars, LOVED IT. If not for that, I'd give this place 1 star. I love boba. I love milk tea. How can something as delicious as these two things together fail so miserably? Well, it happened. Both my fiance's and my drinks weren't good... they were actually pretty tasteless. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing? (I was told the sea salt creama was the most popular drink, but I would never recommend it)! My fiance had the nutella milk tea and it was also pretty gross... and how can you mess up anything with nutella?!? Yikes. 

I really hope this place gets their milk tea in check...

Also, be sure to check if there's actual boba in your drink. My fiance ordered the boba for an extra fee and they forgot to add it in. Too bad we realized that till after we already left the place.

excerpts: I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk.
My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea!
I wouldn't recommend this drink.
nutella milk tea.author: Alesia C.
nutella milk tea.review:
So, the first time I went to Plentea, they didn't have the glass bottles... the only reason why you go and try Plentea for the first time is so that you can Instagram those glass bottles! So I left, and decided to try my luck again later, and they did have the bottles!

I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk. My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea! I wouldn't recommend this drink. My friend got the strawberry black tea, and she liked it, I had a sip and it was good. There were real strawberry bits in it! If I ever came back to Plentea again, which I probably won't, but if I did, I'd try a fruit tea! We both got boba, and maybe the boba was just bad that day, but I wasn't a fan. It tasted pretty bland to me. 

I also think it's pretty expensive for a cup of boba, but I guess you're technically paying for the bottle too. You can save 10%, I believe, if you bring the bottle back and reuse it. 

Worth the try to see if you find something you like and the cute photo, but not worth the price in my opinion.

excerpts: The Nutella milk tea with boba was excellent and I loved the glass jar approach.
Customer service was friendly and efficient.
Highly recommend Plentea for boba!
nutella milk tea.author: Christina T.
nutella milk tea.review: I visited Plentea for the first time Saturday afternoon and was very impressed with the quality of the milk tea.  The Nutella milk tea with boba was excellent and I loved the glass jar approach.  Customer service was friendly and efficient.  Highly recommend Plentea for boba!

excerpts: Ordered the Nutella milk tea with boba and egg pudding.
Didn't taste like Nutella.
Egg pudding had no flavor.
Boba was fresh.
Staff was friendly, helpful, fast and hard working!
Comes in a cute glass jar.
nutella milk tea.author: Shanette F.
nutella milk tea.review: It's good, nothing special. I would have liked a little more chocolate sauce. Ordered the Nutella milk tea with boba and egg pudding. Didn't taste like Nutella. Egg pudding had no flavor. Boba was fresh. Staff was friendly, helpful, fast and hard working! Comes in a cute glass jar. :)

excerpts: Sister had the Nutella milk tea, which we both agreed tasted like chocolate milk.
We hoped for a more hazelnut flavor.
Line went out the door but the drinks came out pretty quick.
nutella milk tea.author: Janice G.
nutella milk tea.review: I ordered an Oolong almond milk tea with taro pudding. It was delicious! The oolong and almond made a surprising fruit like flavor that I really enjoyed.  Sister had the Nutella milk tea, which we both agreed tasted like chocolate milk.  We hoped for a more hazelnut flavor.  Line went out the door but the drinks came out pretty quick.

excerpts: I ordered the Nutella milk tea and was worried it would be too sweet, but the sweetness wasn't too over the top.
nutella milk tea.author: Marcia L.
nutella milk tea.review:
Plentea takes one of my favorite things, boba tea, and puts it in a cute glass jar. Love it! 

The menu was a little bit confusing to me: you can customize the amount of sweetness on some drinks, but not others. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea and was worried it would be too sweet, but the sweetness wasn't too over the top.  

Approximately $6/drink after you add in a topping, such as boba.

excerpts: I usually order the Nutella Milk Tea, which is delicious.
I've also tried their Thai Tea and Mango Smoothie.
All good choices.
All drinks range from $4.50 to $6.
A bit pricey, but I guess the glass bottle makes up for it.
nutella milk tea.author: Jadelann J.
nutella milk tea.review:
i'm sure there's a bunch of bubble tea spots in San Francisco, but hey... it's the Original Glass Bottle Milk Tea in SF. For the price of their drinks.. I think being able to take home one of their glass bottles as a souvenir is pretty worth it. And if you come back with your bottle you can get an extra discount on your drink. But don't forget to check Yelp to see if they offer any discounts as well. The last time I went they offered 20% off. 

Anyways. They offer a wide range of Milk Teas and Fresh Fruit Slush drinks. I usually order the Nutella Milk Tea, which is delicious. I've also tried their Thai Tea and Mango Smoothie. All good choices. All drinks range from $4.50 to $6. A bit pricey, but I guess the glass bottle makes up for it. But keep in mind - if you go towards the end of the day they may be sold out of the glass bottles. 

 They've also expanded their food options as well! Last time I went we ordered the Octopus Balls... pretty tasty! i'd say give that one a shot. 

The only downside to this spot is the parking. I always have trouble finding parking around the block. So be prepared to either pay for parking or walk a few blocks.

excerpts: I got the Nutella Milk Tea HOT
and it was pretty gross.
Maybe if I had gotten it cold.
The service is good
but it's hard to understand the employees though they are very nice.
Just didn't have a good experience with my order.
nutella milk tea.author: Laura T.
nutella milk tea.review: I got the Nutella Milk Tea HOT and it was pretty gross. Maybe if I had gotten it cold. The service is good but it's hard to understand the employees though they are very nice. Just didn't have a good experience with my order.

excerpts: my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.
nutella milk tea.author: Angela T.
nutella milk tea.review:
Literally one of the cutest tea places I have ever come across. No other tea place can compare to the bottles, minimalistic walls, and (small) upstairs section with a nice loft-style view of the downstairs. The most Instagram-worthy cafe there is out there. It is kind of small though so I assume that it can get crowded at times, but everything else about the shop aesthetics is 5/5.

Now, on to the tea. So I have not tried much from the wide variety of their menu, but when I tried the Fresh Fruit tea (peach), the tea was comparable to my all-time favorite tea shop, Fantasia. The flavor was strong enough and not extremely artificial, so 5/5 on the tea. However, I would say that the tapioca is a little more harder than I wanted but still decently chewy. 4/5 for the pearls only because I am biased to Fantasia's incredibly soft, chewy ones.

So overall, I would give it around a 4.75/5. Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.

excerpts: Plentea has a solid selection of hot and cold drinks, including a popular Nutella milk tea which can be served hot or cold.
nutella milk tea.author: Irina P.
nutella milk tea.review:
(4.5) My office orders milk teas often. Plentea has a solid selection of hot and cold drinks, including a popular Nutella milk tea which can be served hot or cold. Good selection of toppings.

All teas come in returnable glass bottles which can make things tricky when on the go.

excerpts: They have lots of tea options including some creative ones such as Nutella Milk tea
and they also offer various toppings other than just bubble.
nutella milk tea.author: Athena C.
nutella milk tea.review:
Plentea satisfied my thirst for bubble tea ever since I moved to the bay area. I was spoiled by overflow of bubble tea options in New York City and I haven't had a chance to try them in San Francisco. Plentea was a great introduction to the bubble tea world here. 

They have lots of tea options including some creative ones such as Nutella Milk tea and they also offer various toppings other than just bubble. My personal favorite has always been the grass jelly for summer season and the egg pudding around the year. 

You can ask them to decrease sugar and ice level for your preference although the counter girl English isn't very good. 

The price is slightly higher than other places in Chinatown but you do get a nice glass jar out of it. If you reuse it, you get 10% discount.

excerpts: - Nutella Milk Tea
: This is my go-to drink, and definitely my favorite out of everything I've tried here!
You can definitely taste the chocolate, and together with the the boba creates a symphony of sweet flavor.
The boba itself, to me, has the perfect consistency.
Highly recommend.
- Matcha Milk Green Tea: This is really good as well.
The sweetness of the tea balances out the green tea flavor.
I recommend getting this drink with the taro pudding, which has a subtle, yet noticeable taro flavor.
nutella milk tea.author: Jay C.
nutella milk tea.review:
My best friend introduced me to this place, and I've been going back ever since! It's really central to Chinatown and Union Square, so definitely check this place out!

The line is hit or miss; sometimes it goes way out the door, while other times I can just walk in and right up to the counter. They do have a limited selection compared to other boba places, but the items I have gotten are actually really good:

- Nutella Milk Tea: This is my go-to drink, and definitely my favorite out of everything I've tried here! You can definitely taste the chocolate, and together with the the boba creates a symphony of sweet flavor. The boba itself, to me, has the perfect consistency. Highly recommend.
- Matcha Milk Green Tea: This is really good as well. The sweetness of the tea balances out the green tea flavor. I recommend getting this drink with the taro pudding, which has a subtle, yet noticeable taro flavor. I also really liked the consistency of the pudding.

I really like the fact that they serve the boba in glass milk jugs that you can keep! They also provide lids for them, if you want to save it or take it to go.

Overall, I really enjoy this place and frequently return to it whenever I'm on this side of San Francisco. Definitely recommend!

excerpts: I ordered the Nutella milk tea (4/5) and the Almond Milk tea (2/5).
The Almond tea had too much flavoring
and I couldn't even taste the tea in it!
nutella milk tea.author: Zeinab J.
nutella milk tea.review:
Working at milk tea shop myself (I won't mention which one) I have high expectations for tasting the tea in my drinks, so I was really excited to try Plentea for the first time. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea (4/5) and the Almond Milk tea (2/5). The Almond tea had too much flavoring and I couldn't even taste the tea in it! I was really disappointed in that. 

Also, when I got my drinks I didn't notice there was a crack in my bottle until I was already on my way home to SJ!!! Do the employees even check the bottles?!?! 

I will probably not come back here again and just stick with my milk tea places back in SJ.

excerpts: My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting.
Worth a try, but probably won't return.
nutella milk tea.author: Gary C.
nutella milk tea.review: Honestly, the tea is so-so, it's not impressive. The gimmick here is that they let you take their glass bottle to-go! We tried the taro ice milk which is tasted good. My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting. Worth a try, but probably won't return.

excerpts:
and I have had 

Nutella milk tea 

Nutella milk tea with extra nutella 

Iced coffee milktea with nutella 

Lavender lemonade with aloe
Currently craving iced coffee milk tea with nutella.. yum..
nutella milk tea.author: Lindsay S.
nutella milk tea.review:
When you first walk in and look at the menu it looks so simple and plain but once you you mind opens up to all the possibilities come into mind. 

My husband and I have had 

Nutella milk tea 

Nutella milk tea with extra nutella 

Iced coffee milktea with nutella 

Lavender lemonade with aloe (wish it didn't have seeds pain in the ass to drink)

Fresh fruit Oolong mango tea with grass jelly

Sweet taro milk with taro pudding and grass jelly 

Iced carmel milk with tapioca 


and we have yet to cover the menu. 

I really enjoy the glass bottles that come with the every drink and the discount that is offered if you bring it back. 

Currently craving iced coffee milk tea with nutella.. yum.. :)

excerpts: Ordered the regular milk tea with black tea and the Nutella milk tea.
Both very good.
We ordered takoyaki as well and that was delish.
nutella milk tea.author: Nancy Y.
nutella milk tea.review: Ordered the regular milk tea with black tea and the Nutella milk tea. Both very good. We ordered takoyaki as well and that was delish.

excerpts: I personally went with the Nutella Milk Tea which had a nice little chocalately addition to each sip of milk tea.
I didn't ask for any bubbles
so I can't comment on that.
However do note that you only get to keep the glass bottle if you order a cold drink.
Warm drinks will not come in the glass bottle.
nutella milk tea.author: Jackson S.
nutella milk tea.review: Great little boba shop on my first visit to SF. Many options that all seemed delicious. I personally went with the Nutella Milk Tea which had a nice little chocalately addition to each sip of milk tea. I didn't ask for any bubbles so I can't comment on that. However do note that you only get to keep the glass bottle if you order a cold drink. Warm drinks will not come in the glass bottle.

excerpts:
I ordered the Nutella Milk Tea w/out Boba and I loved it. 
I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option. 

I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option.
nutella milk tea.author: Tony D.
nutella milk tea.review:
Went for the first time and enjoyed the ambiuance of the small yet, well put together Boba shop. I'm not really into Boba, but a friend and I went and we enjoyed it. I ordered the Nutella Milk Tea w/out Boba and I loved it. I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option. 

Great place! Plus I like the bottles the drinks come in.

excerpts: Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc).
I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening.
There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.
nutella milk tea.author: Amy V.
nutella milk tea.review:
Been meaning to try Plentea for awhile now, but I tend to forget that it's there. So i finally decided to give it a try on Thursday with my boyfriend and I've been back 3 days straight now! I really like the bottle but at the same time I don't because it jack the price of the drink up so much.

I've had the Thai Tea with boba and it was good, but not my favorite. My boyfriend got the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and that was really good. You could still taste the matcha and it wasn't overly creamy or sweet either. I don't know if it's the days that i went that the boba was hard? So the next time that I went, i got the the Caramel Ice Milk with grass jelly. It kinda reminded me of Half&Half ice milk drink. It wasn't crazy sweet like the ice milk in Tea Society nor was it bland. It was sweet enough for me to finish the whole bottle and not feel sick after. 

Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc). I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening. There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.

excerpts: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!
nutella milk tea.author: Doug V.
nutella milk tea.review: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!

excerpts: I had the nutella milk tea which kinda tasted like chocolate milk.
Not something I would get again to be honest.
the second time I went
I got the strawberry fruit tea
and that was yummy.
I shared the waffle with my friend and it was ok.
I just enjoy the concept of using reusable glass bottles and they have a good amount of flavors to choose from.
Their real fruit slush was good too from trying from my friend.
nutella milk tea.author: Heather S.
nutella milk tea.review: How amazing is this place to provide reusable glass bottles and when you bring it back you get 10% off!! Their flavors were great. I had the nutella milk tea which kinda tasted like chocolate milk. Not something I would get again to be honest. the second time I went I got the strawberry fruit tea and that was yummy. I shared the waffle with my friend and it was ok. I just enjoy the concept of using reusable glass bottles and they have a good amount of flavors to choose from. Their real fruit slush was good too from trying from my friend.

excerpts: I've had the Nutella milk tea all the way to the taro one, and they're all really good
so this is a definite place to try!
:D
nutella milk tea.author: Jordan C.
nutella milk tea.review:
Probably one of the top 10 boba spots in the bay that I like is this place! Their souvenir signature glass cups that they give with the drinks were a cool idea.

Setting wise the place barley has no parking outside so your gonna have to probably walk from somewhere nearby so expect to walk! The place is two floors, but still kinda small so the line goes outside. There are only like 8 tables on the bottom floor (2 seaters) so when your drinking your drinks or eating food your gonna be looking at the people next to you that are in line.

Food and drinks! Food wise the food was okay I ordered the salmon rice plate before and it wasnt hella bad, but I did recognize the costco fish on it loool! But the food didn't taste processed ya know? Other foods like the sashimi salad was okay the sashimi was decent not frozen tasting or something and salad was fresh. Drink wise I've had the Nutella milk tea all the way to the taro one, and they're all really good so this is a definite place to try! :D

excerpts: We ordered the milk tea and Nutella milk tea both with boba.
I really enjoyed the milk tea because it wasn't too milky
and I was able to taste the tea.
My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea.
I didn't get to try it
but I assume it's chocolatey.
We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like.
It was super adorable upstairs.
They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters.
Overall, I would come back here to try other things.
My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea.
I didn't get to try it
but I assume it's chocolatey.
We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like.
It was super adorable upstairs.
They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters.
Overall, I would come back here to try other things.
nutella milk tea.author: Shannon C.
nutella milk tea.review: Came here a few minutes after they opened and lemme just say, the guy that was ringing up our order was really nice. I didn't catch his name but he was super friendly. He also pointed out that he was wearing the same sweater as my boyfriend lol. Anyways, since we came when it opened, we were able to get the glass bottles. The drink prices range from 3.50 to 5.95 I believe. We ordered the milk tea and Nutella milk tea both with boba. I really enjoyed the milk tea because it wasn't too milky and I was able to taste the tea. My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea. I didn't get to try it but I assume it's chocolatey. We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like. It was super adorable upstairs. They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters. Overall, I would come back here to try other things.

excerpts:
The selection (they had NUTELLA milk tea!!!)
2)
nutella milk tea.author: Kris P.
nutella milk tea.review:
Two things I was a big fan of at Plentea:

1) The selection (they had NUTELLA milk tea!!!)
2) The use of reusable glass bottles (ranks high in 'grammability)

Obviously I had to get the Nutella MT as it was such a unique menu item. The Nutella flavour was strong and the drink itself was very good. Boba was prepared well. 

The glass bottle is narrow but very tall and comes with quite a lot of tea. Great value for the price.

There are usually lineups at Plentea, but the service is quick and you'll receive your drink in a reasonable time.

Definitely worth a visit!

excerpts: Nutella milk tea is a must try as well.
nutella milk tea.author: Vivian T.
nutella milk tea.review:
Love the almond milk tea and lychee jelly here. I want to say best I've had, just the right amount of sweet for me. 
Nutella milk tea is a must try as well.

excerpts: The nutella milk tea made my friend throw up, while the other drinks were mediocre at best.
Only good thing about this place is the cute jars I guess.
0/10 do not recommend!!
nutella milk tea.author: Vincent L.
nutella milk tea.review: My friends and I visited SF and stopped by here to grab some late night boba. One of them ordered the Sea Salt Oolong Milk Tea but actually tasted like the ocean. The nutella milk tea made my friend throw up, while the other drinks were mediocre at best. Only good thing about this place is the cute jars I guess. 0/10 do not recommend!!

excerpts: Love the fruit milk teas, nutella milk tea, and sweet taro milk tea.
nutella milk tea.author: Julian S.
nutella milk tea.review: Best boba I've ever had. Love the fruit milk teas, nutella milk tea, and sweet taro milk tea.

excerpts: I like how they have nutella milk tea, something a lot of places don't have.
I didn't get to try the food but
since the appeal of this place seems to be the bottle, I probably didn't miss much.
The boba itself is pretty nice and chewy.
nutella milk tea.author: Allan Y.
nutella milk tea.review: The line is long but the wait time isn't too bad. They get your drinks out to you very quickly even though there's a lot of people. In terms of drink quality, this place would get 3 stars but because of the utility of the glass bottle they give you, I give it an extra star. The drinks aren't anything special and the variety is a bit lacking. I like how they have nutella milk tea, something a lot of places don't have. I didn't get to try the food but since the appeal of this place seems to be the bottle, I probably didn't miss much. The boba itself is pretty nice and chewy.

excerpts: The Nutella Milk Tea tasted like chocolate milk.
The brown sugar milk tea was a little too sweet but pretty good, nonetheless.
Pretty reasonable boba price considering you get to bring home a glass bottle.
nutella milk tea.author: Shela D.
nutella milk tea.review: The Taro Milk is actually real Taro and none of that fake powder stuff, so so good! The Nutella Milk Tea tasted like chocolate milk. The brown sugar milk tea was a little too sweet but pretty good, nonetheless. Pretty reasonable boba price considering you get to bring home a glass bottle.

excerpts: I like the place, and the staff are great, but I ordered the nutella milk tea and there was zero nutella in it!
Just milk tea and chocolate syrup :(
nutella milk tea.author: Anna K.
nutella milk tea.review: I like the place, and the staff are great, but I ordered the nutella milk tea and there was zero nutella in it! Just milk tea and chocolate syrup :(

excerpts: I ordered their special iced nutella milk tea ($4.95) and it tasted like chocolate milk.
Toppings are extra at $0.50 a pop.
In general, their drinks are a little more expensive than I'm use to.
However, I would go back to give them another shot but just order something else.
nutella milk tea.author: Maxine C.
nutella milk tea.review: I primarily wanted to go here for the fact that they serve bubble tea in glass bottles (something that you do not see on the East Coast). I ordered their special iced nutella milk tea ($4.95) and it tasted like chocolate milk. Toppings are extra at $0.50 a pop. In general, their drinks are a little more expensive than I'm use to. However, I would go back to give them another shot but just order something else.

excerpts: The Nutella Milk Tea is so bomb
I can't even begin to describe my obsession-but don't forget to grab a lid to shake!
The fresh fruit teas: all are seriously incredible.
I have never been to a place that puts real fruit in the teas
and it's just an added touch of love to the things.
My favorite is a toss up between the mango and strawberry.
The honey lemon tea.
That's all.
Cute little limes floating in there really just help the citrus-y flavors come alive and is just a really awesome tea.
For the slushes, I've heard that you have to try the avocado, but I've only had the blueberry.
SO GOOD.
Toppings:
I love the aloe and the boba, but it's a real bummer that it costs extra:/ kinda disappointing since the drinks average $5 a piece.
The employees- AWESOME.
I've never had a bad experience there and they are always so accommodating and nice!
I've never had any sort of negative interaction with any of the people that work there.
It's very inviting and makes it easy to come back(embarrassingly frequently).
This place is all around really cute, it's small but for a takeout tea place in the city you'd be crazy not to expect that.
Parking can also be crazy, if you don't find yourself walking there nearby
it's not good to go noon-1 on weekdays because it's the financial district and everyone insists on taking their lunch.
But just about halfway down on the next block, there's a parking garage that's not too expensive and the employees there are very nice as well!
Overall, a very awesome place:)
nutella milk tea.author: Nina P.
nutella milk tea.review:
This place is seriously the source of my happiness. 
The Nutella Milk Tea is so bomb I can't even begin to describe my obsession-but don't forget to grab a lid to shake! 
The fresh fruit teas: all are seriously incredible. I have never been to a place that puts real fruit in the teas and it's just an added touch of love to the things. My favorite is a toss up between the mango and strawberry. 
The honey lemon tea. That's all. 10/10. Cute little limes floating in there really just help the citrus-y flavors come alive and is just a really awesome tea. 
For the slushes, I've heard that you have to try the avocado, but I've only had the blueberry. SO GOOD. 
Toppings: I love the aloe and the boba, but it's a real bummer that it costs extra:/ kinda disappointing since the drinks average $5 a piece. 
The employees- AWESOME. I've never had a bad experience there and they are always so accommodating and nice! I've never had any sort of negative interaction with any of the people that work there. It's very inviting and makes it easy to come back(embarrassingly frequently). 
This place is all around really cute, it's small but for a takeout tea place in the city you'd be crazy not to expect that. Parking can also be crazy, if you don't find yourself walking there nearby it's not good to go noon-1 on weekdays because it's the financial district and everyone insists on taking their lunch. But just about halfway down on the next block, there's a parking garage that's not too expensive and the employees there are very nice as well! 
Overall, a very awesome place:)

excerpts:
Matcha latte with egg pudding half sweet 

Jasmine MT with honey boba, half sweet 

Strawberry black tea with chia seeds

House Black MT with boba and grass jelly, half sweet

Pineapple Oolong tea with chia seeds and grass jelly
strawberry black tea.author: Leah H.
strawberry black tea.review:
P.E.A.R.L. Standard Rating = 4.5/5
P-Perfect Chew
E-Extras  (variety of toppings and tea options)
A-Accommodations/Ability to customize
R-Real Ingredients 
L-Liquid Gold (Quality of Tea)

P  (.5) Not consistently stellar, as I've occasionally had the disappointing hard center, but when it's fresh, it's smooth and chewy all the way through! 
E  (1.0) Add-ons include chia seeds, pudding, honey boba, and grass jelly. I also like the many tea options that are available.
A  (1.0)  You can change ice, sweetness, and milk options. The team (both cafes are pretty reasonable for other requests) Additionally, the fact that Plentea uses glass bottles allows for accommodations to be made post-production, which is helpful for any sweetness level changes. 
R  (1.0) Housemade syrups and seasonal fruits here (i.e., avocado, papaya, taro). You won't see powders or conventional packaged syrup flavors! 
L  (1.0)  Super sippable hot, cold, black or sweetened! Plentea uses organic loose leaf teas. Their matcha (hand-whisked) is also pretty delicious! 

FAVES: 

Matcha latte with egg pudding half sweet 

Jasmine MT with honey boba, half sweet 

Strawberry black tea with chia seeds

House Black MT with boba and grass jelly, half sweet

Pineapple Oolong tea with chia seeds and grass jelly 



#thePEARLstandard
#mrsbeansbobablog

excerpts: The pineapple green tea is pretty good but the strawberry black tea tasted slightly off, like bagged black tea from diners, not organic high quality Asian teas.
The jars are cute and would make a neat flower vase
but the drinks did not impress me too much.
strawberry black tea.author: Ellen G.
strawberry black tea.review: I was really looking forward to this place because of the jars and the fresh concept of organic teas. Despite the medium reviews, I persevered and gave it a try. The tea flavor is very mediocre and the selection isn't the largest. I'm not the biggest fan of milky teas so I guess it was slightly hard to find a drink I'd like since the majority of what they are known for are milky drinks. The pineapple green tea is pretty good but the strawberry black tea tasted slightly off, like bagged black tea from diners, not organic high quality Asian teas. The jars are cute and would make a neat flower vase but the drinks did not impress me too much.

excerpts: He got a strawberry black tea with boba.
The strawberry flavor was reminiscent of Smucker's strawberry jam, but less sweet, with a strange, unnatural aftertaste.
strawberry black tea.author: Nicole H.
strawberry black tea.review:
I remember the first time I walked by this spot, right after I'd met with the big boss at my current job-- it was the middle of August, the sun was shining, the weather was perfect, and I had just been freed from weeks on weeks of being at the office until midnight (for real though). The glass bottles looked so hip, the drinks so perfect for summer.

I've been here at this job for a year now. The bottles no longer seem as hip (perhaps the 30-strong bottle collection at work has something to do with it), but some of the drinks here can still be good. In direct comparison to my first time at Plentea, today was cold, rainy, and windy. The bf was in town after a business meeting so we stopped here for a quick drink. He got a strawberry black tea with boba. The strawberry flavor was reminiscent of Smucker's strawberry jam, but less sweet, with a strange, unnatural aftertaste. Boba isn't as chewy as I'd like it to be.

What I'd recommend getting here are the ice milks (yum!). Pro tip: If you're trying to watch your calories, drink half of it (and all the bobas) and put it in the freezer for another day! What I also like about this place compared to iTea and Boba Guys is that there's actually a place to sit (a cute little alcove upstairs!). 

I've also had some of the foods-- the smoked salmon salad and tiramisu. Given that they're a boba shop, I'd pass on these. They're kinda like stuff you'd get out of a box.

excerpts: The Strawberry Black Tea was my favorite
and I could see why it's one of their best sellers.
Sweetness on most of their drinks is adjustable to your preference which is a plus!
Will be back the next time I'm in the city.
strawberry black tea.author: Tiffany P.
strawberry black tea.review:
I was craving boba on a recent trip to San Francisco and fortunately we were just down the street from Plentea. 

Very small location but super hip with the fairy lights and succulents that line the ceiling and walls. 
They serve all their drinks in glass bottles which add a nice touch. They provide bottle caps if you are taking the drinks to-go and also give a 10% discount if you bring your bottle back on your next visit. 

The Strawberry Black Tea was my favorite and I could see why it's one of their best sellers.
Sweetness on most of their drinks is adjustable to your preference which is a plus! Will be back the next time I'm in the city.

excerpts: I order the Caramel Iced milk with boba and she ordered the Strawberry Black tea with boba least sweet.
I enjoyed my Caramel iced milk and the nice flavor and chewyness of the boba.
The drink did not melt super fast and the cool glasses they give you are worth it too.
They had about 5 people working at once, which was weird because they were all just standing around and only one guy made our drinks.
strawberry black tea.author: John M.
strawberry black tea.review:
As stated in other reviews be prepared to shell out a few bucks for parking if you're not walking or using public transportation. Dropped in with the girlfriend after eating lunch a few doors down at Murraci's (man that place is good). 

I order the Caramel Iced milk with boba and she ordered the Strawberry Black tea with boba least sweet. I enjoyed my Caramel iced milk and the nice flavor and chewyness of the boba. The drink did not melt super fast and the cool glasses they give you are worth it too. They had about 5 people working at once, which was weird because they were all just standing around and only one guy made our drinks.

excerpts: and I got the strawberry black tea.
I can tell they used fresh milk in the roasted milk tea and in the strawberry black tea their were fresh chunks of strawberries.
The glass jars are a added bonus as well (which they do not charge for & you get to keep it).
It was well worth the money
and I would definitely come back.
strawberry black tea.author: Kathy N.
strawberry black tea.review: I love bubble and I go pretty often getting similar flavours at each location. I went to Plentea and my boyfriend got a roasted milk tea and I got the strawberry black tea. First of all I LOVEEEE their roasted milk tea. I can tell they used fresh milk in the roasted milk tea and in the strawberry black tea their were fresh chunks of strawberries. The glass jars are a added bonus as well (which they do not charge for & you get to keep it). It was well worth the money and I would definitely come back.

excerpts: My friend got the strawberry black tea, and she liked it, I had a sip and it was good.
There were real strawberry bits in it!
If I ever came back to Plentea again, which I probably won't, but if I did, I'd try a fruit tea!
We both got boba, and maybe the boba was just bad that day, but I wasn't a fan.
strawberry black tea.author: Alesia C.
strawberry black tea.review:
So, the first time I went to Plentea, they didn't have the glass bottles... the only reason why you go and try Plentea for the first time is so that you can Instagram those glass bottles! So I left, and decided to try my luck again later, and they did have the bottles!

I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk. My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea! I wouldn't recommend this drink. My friend got the strawberry black tea, and she liked it, I had a sip and it was good. There were real strawberry bits in it! If I ever came back to Plentea again, which I probably won't, but if I did, I'd try a fruit tea! We both got boba, and maybe the boba was just bad that day, but I wasn't a fan. It tasted pretty bland to me. 

I also think it's pretty expensive for a cup of boba, but I guess you're technically paying for the bottle too. You can save 10%, I believe, if you bring the bottle back and reuse it. 

Worth the try to see if you find something you like and the cute photo, but not worth the price in my opinion.

excerpts: I highly recommend their strawberry black tea with aloe, sea salt crema oolong tea and their pastrami waffle sandwich.
strawberry black tea.author: Alice X.
strawberry black tea.review:
I highly recommend their strawberry black tea with aloe, sea salt crema oolong tea and their pastrami waffle sandwich. They are freaking good! 

Their turkey waffle sandwich is good too, but I think the pastrami tasted waaaaaaay better!

I've also tried their pastrami salad and I think it's okay.

DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT get the drinks with pearl/boba! They are hard! 

No restrooms here!

excerpts: I tried the strawberry black tea & peach oolong tea.
Both drinks were really refreshing and wasn't loaded with artificial sweeteners like most tea places.
There was was a perfect balance of tea and fruits in each drink.
I need to come back and try other combos when I'm back in the city.
strawberry black tea.author: Hang H.
strawberry black tea.review: Walked by Plentea on a hot summer day, and boy I'm glad I got my drinks here! There was a line, but it moved quickly. They serve their tea in a glass cup that you could bring home. I tried the strawberry black tea & peach oolong tea. Both drinks were really refreshing and wasn't loaded with artificial sweeteners like most tea places. There was was a perfect balance of tea and fruits in each drink. I need to come back and try other combos when I'm back in the city.

excerpts: If I can recall correctly, I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea with honey boba.
My boyfriend ordered peach green tea with honey boba, and both of us complained about the amount of sweetness in the drinks.
Seemed to have a lot of sugar, and while drinking it, the jar seemed to be quite sticky.
Not something you would like to carry around all day.
strawberry black tea.author: Mandy G.
strawberry black tea.review:
This place is not worth the hype. The only good thing about coming here is their cute jars which is about ~$5 for a drink. A bit pricey but that's the cost of getting something cute? If you keep it and bring it back, you get a 10% discount for reusing it..which isn't exactly much in my opinion. 

The place itself is pretty tiny and has 2 floors. It feels like a loft. Not many tables, but if you see one, you should snag one! It can probably seat 2-4 people? 

If I can recall correctly, I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea with honey boba. My boyfriend ordered peach green tea with honey boba, and both of us complained about the amount of sweetness in the drinks. Seemed to have a lot of sugar, and while drinking it, the jar seemed to be quite sticky. Not something you would like to carry around all day.  My drink also didn't taste any different and wasn't as amazing as compared to other boba places in the SF area. 

From a fellow yelper, she says they have about 300 jar-cups per day. If you don't arrive early enough for them, you'll get a plastic cup! Lines are also normally out the door, so try to avoid peak hours which is probably during lunch and mid-evening (around 4:30 pm).

excerpts: I got the sea salt crema oolong tea with tapioca, and a strawberry black tea with lychee jelly.
Strawberry Black Tea - I got this for my afternoon "coffee break", though I tried it immediately because there was ice in it
and I didn't want to wait til it was slightly watered down
(some other review said there isn't room for ice because of the milk bottle opening.
Yeah well that's not true).
That one is definitely a winner!
strawberry black tea.author: Riza A.
strawberry black tea.review:
I'm a boba addict and always on the hunt for the latest and greatest. I've seen the infamous milk bottle on IG and of course decided to hit up Plentea on a lunchtime adventure. 

I got the sea salt crema oolong tea with tapioca, and a strawberry black tea with lychee jelly. I also got the turkey club waffle sandwich. 

Sea salt crema oolong - initial reaction? Different. I definitely tasted the sea salt. Not so much the oolong. I quite honestly didn't know what to think of this one. I probably wouldn't order it again, though at least I can say I tried it. Expanding those horizons right?

Strawberry Black Tea - I got this for my afternoon "coffee break", though I tried it immediately because there was ice in it and I didn't want to wait til it was slightly watered down (some other review said there isn't room for ice because of the milk bottle opening. Yeah well that's not true). That one is definitely a winner! Great tea flavor, not too sweet, and real strawberry bits contained within. 

The turkey club waffle sandwich was bland. No taste to the waffle, I tasted more avocado than pesto, and correct me if I'm wrong but I thought clubs had bacon? And for a waffle sandwich, this thing tasted healthy. I'm all for healthy but it just did not feel right and deflated my boba happy bubble. 

So, Plentea is definitely a must try. Skip the sandwiches. Pricey for boba but whatever, you're paying for a cute glass bottle. I'll be back.

excerpts: I had the fresh strawberry black tea, it was REALLY good!
It was about $5 and I loved the fact that they give it to you in a glass container that you get to keep.
They have a large variety of teas to choose from.
strawberry black tea.author: Suki B.
strawberry black tea.review:
Beware: The line is RIDICULOUSLY long! But don't let that turn you away, the tea is really good! 

We had to wait about 30 minutes, so I definitely need to figure out what time they're slow because I definitely don't want to wait that long again. The place is new, so I think they're still trying to figure things out.  The employees seemed a bit flustered.

I had the fresh strawberry black tea, it was REALLY good! It was about $5 and I loved the fact that they give it to you in a glass container that you get to keep. They have a large variety of teas to choose from. I want to try one of their milk teas next time. 

Great addition to the FiDi!

excerpts: I ordered the fresh fruit tea and got strawberry black tea.
strawberry black tea.author: Cris-ann L.
strawberry black tea.review:
Decided to give this place a shot with a friend. Line was out the door, just like you'd probably see at T-Pumps. I would have turned right around but my friend & I had nothing better to do. All the drinks are roughly $4+ (expensive for milk tea) and are served in a glass jar... which probably accounts for the high prices as the glass jar is pressed into that price. You need a $15 minimum for card which I also found ridiculous! I'm not trying to buy 3 drinks just to use my card. I ordered the fresh fruit tea and got strawberry black tea. I wasn't impressed with the drink for the time I had waited in line (seriously 20 minutes) and the price I'd paid.

Save your money and go to T-Pumps instead. Kudos for trying to endorse the reduce of trash/reuse of bottles by offering a discount for bringing it back for your next drink, but who's really going to conveniently carry that glass bottle around?

excerpts: I ordered the strawberry black tea with boba which also included strawberry bits and my mom ordered the coffee milk tea with boba.
Unfortunately they had just ran out of boba, and it took at least 20 minutes for them to make more!
, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us.
Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return.
At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?
, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us.
Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return.
At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?
strawberry black tea.author: Simone M.
strawberry black tea.review:
When my mom and I walked up the line was out the door and for the next hour or so we were in there, there was a steady stream of people coming in and going out. The menu was pretty impressive, with a large selection of milk teas, fruity teas, flavored milk, and plenty of toppings to go with it all. Tucked away at the bottom right corner of the menu was a good selection of snacks, including Takoyaki.

I ordered the strawberry black tea with boba which also included strawberry bits and my mom ordered the coffee milk tea with boba. Unfortunately they had just ran out of boba, and it took at least 20 minutes for them to make more! If I didn't have good company with me, I wouldn't have wanted to stick around and wait, especially being that the place is so small. 

Drinks were okay, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us. Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return. At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?

excerpts: My bf got the strawberry black tea I believe...again very average.
strawberry black tea.author: Denise C.
strawberry black tea.review:
Came here one time when I happened to be in Chinatown. The only reason I was able to try it is because now they are open on weekends.

Only way to get here would be the bus. I can't imagine driving here and having to find parking in FiDi. Nope nope nope. The shop itself is pretty small and very hipster-feeling. I'm talking about chalkboards, wood paneling. Luckily when I came here it was not very crowded, but there was still a line. I could see it being quite hectic on a weekday.

Service was like any other boba place, and it was fairly prompt despite the crowd.

The drinks themselves were..okay I guess. I thought mine was weird tasting. I got a mango yogurt black tea. The mango totally overwhelmed any tea flavor that was in there. And the mango didn't really taste or feel fresh (there were mango chunks in the tea). It kind of reminded me of the preserved dried mangoes. My bf got the strawberry black tea I believe...again very average. 

I'm glad I came here because I got the much-talked-about glass bottles. However, the price is quite expensive for just a boba. It's just as expensive as getting Starbucks (most boba does not cost as much as a frappucino).

I can't really see myself coming back much. I'm usually not in the area (Chinatown/FiDi), and when I am I have better places to get better boba for cheaper.

excerpts:
=) 

Sea salt crema Oolong tea, strawberry black tea, mango green tea =
strawberry black tea.author: Christine Y.
strawberry black tea.review:
I like the tea here, better than Share. It just tastes great every time I get it. Maybe it's in the glass bottles =)

The girl at the front (Filipino?) had great customer service skills, instructing her co-workers to shout out the numbers louder (cmon chica, you can't be whispering those numbers out, it's loud in there) and letting me have a bag for my food when I literally didn't have a dime on me to pay for it. I love her. She's way better than the kids at ALLLL those other places. Yeah I'l make the trip out here from outer richmond for that. =) 

Sea salt crema Oolong tea, strawberry black tea, mango green tea = all winners. 
I didn't try, but the waffle pastrami sandwich and banana nutella dessert I ordered to-go for my friend looked amazing.

excerpts: I got the fresh strawberry black tea and mango green tea.
It was delicious.
The taste was simple, tasty, but not too sweet.
I'll come back for sure, hopefully I remember to bring my bottle to get 10% off.
Lol
strawberry black tea.author: R M.
strawberry black tea.review: I love my boba so I've been wanting to try it. There was a line out the door when I went but it's not the same wait as tpumps. I like that the boba comes in a bottle you can keep. The price isn't too bad. I got the fresh strawberry black tea and mango green tea. It was delicious. The taste was simple, tasty, but not too sweet. I'll come back for sure, hopefully I remember to bring my bottle to get 10% off. Lol

excerpts: So I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea; you can add toppings like lychee, tapioca, aloe and other varieties.
I received my order less than 6 minutes;
which I think that's fast.
The Strawberry Black Tea had strawberry bits and it tasted like Strawberry.
Plus it comes in this awesome bottle; you can keep but you can bring it back to get a discount on your drink!!!.
Overall my experience with Plentea was awesome; I plan to go again soon.
strawberry black tea.author: Jaiesha C.
strawberry black tea.review: First I would like to say.. Thank goodness for Yelp! I decided to see what the buzz was all about on this small place; in the financial district close to chinatown. When I arrived; yes it was a line. The wait was actually less than 10 Mins. I came here close to 1 pm today. When I walked in; there were a few tables and a upper level for people to drink their teas and relax. I walked up to the cashier and told them it is my first time here; The cashier recommend me the popular fruit teas were strawberry and peach. So I ordered a Strawberry Black Tea; you can add toppings like lychee, tapioca, aloe and other varieties.  I received my order less than 6 minutes;  which I think that's fast. The Strawberry Black Tea had strawberry bits and it tasted like Strawberry. Plus it comes in this awesome bottle; you can keep but you can bring it back to get a discount on your drink!!!. Overall my experience with Plentea was awesome; I plan to go again soon. ;)

excerpts: , it wasn't anything special, but the pineapple green tea was amazing.
It came with little chunks of fresh pineapple and somehow both the tea flavor as well as
the pineapp flavor were very much there.
Usually these "infused" teas from other shops are kind of watered down or tastes like fruit syrup so the one from Plentea was a pleasant surprise.
pineapple green tea.author: Belinda J.
pineapple green tea.review:
We walked by Plentea plenty of times on our multiple lunch trips to R&G Lounge from our hotel. I'll be honest (and tacky): the only reason we decided to go here instead of the billion other boba tea places in SF was because of the milk jars these guys sell their tea in. Usually shops make you pay extra for glass jars, at least here in LA. 

I had the original black tea blend with boba and my husband had the strawberry banana smoothie with boba. We also went back to grab tea before departing SF and he tried their pineapple infused jasmine tea. 

The wait is a little long considering how many employees they have working, but all of the staff were very friendly and we didn't receive any funky, messed up orders. 

The black tea was really delicious with a deep, rich flavor that was perfect with half sugar. Like their signs say, it does come with a noticeable hint of chocolate which I loved. The boba was chewy and not soggy at all; ya just can't do soggy boba unless you're crazy.

The smoothie was just okay, it wasn't anything special, but the pineapple green tea was amazing. It came with little chunks of fresh pineapple and somehow both the tea flavor as well as the pineapp flavor were very much there. Usually these "infused" teas from other shops are kind of watered down or tastes like fruit syrup so the one from Plentea was a pleasant surprise. I wound up taking so many sips of this one that my husband ended up asking if I'd like to switch...

The $5 a tea price tag is fair for what you get even if other places might sell for slightly cheaper. Don't forget to check in for 15% off your order of 2 drinks or more!

excerpts: The pineapple green tea is pretty good but the strawberry black tea tasted slightly off, like bagged black tea from diners, not organic high quality Asian teas.
