The jars are cute and would make a neat flower vase
but the drinks did not impress me too much.
pineapple green tea.author: Ellen G.
pineapple green tea.review: I was really looking forward to this place because of the jars and the fresh concept of organic teas. Despite the medium reviews, I persevered and gave it a try. The tea flavor is very mediocre and the selection isn't the largest. I'm not the biggest fan of milky teas so I guess it was slightly hard to find a drink I'd like since the majority of what they are known for are milky drinks. The pineapple green tea is pretty good but the strawberry black tea tasted slightly off, like bagged black tea from diners, not organic high quality Asian teas. The jars are cute and would make a neat flower vase but the drinks did not impress me too much.

excerpts: I really do like their glass bottles but next time I'd try something else than the pineapple green tea.
pineapple green tea.author: Jenny H.
pineapple green tea.review:
Ah, yes. I totally approve of them giving the glass bottles out (makes for a nice pic ALSO sustainable). However, the drinks were just average to me. 

I totally love the decor and the ambiance of the place. Woodsy, bright and hipster, oh yes this place caters to teens and friends! There's also an area upstairs to chill too if this place gets packed, which I ventured up to. 

-DRINKS- 
Pineapple Green Tea - I saw the girl just pour it from a premade pour-er so I was disappointed that I paid around $5 bucks for it. I liked the pineapple chunks, but the drink was just meh to me. Nothing special. If I were to get it again I would maybe get it less sweet as well. 

Lavender Lemonade - my friend got this and I ended up liking it! It's refreshing and the seeds make for a unique taste. I would ask to go easier on the lavender though! 

I appreciate that they are affordable and the vibes are pretty chill. I really do like their glass bottles but next time I'd try something else than the pineapple green tea.

excerpts: We got the matcha green tea, the jasmine and the pineapple green tea!
All yummy!
The line went quick and it wasn't a long wait to get our drinks, the cashier was friendly and don't forget to check in so you can use your 15% off !
I totally forgot about it when I was paying
pineapple green tea.author: Nikki O.
pineapple green tea.review: Mmm boba is good here! The price is reasonable and they don't charge extra for the cute bottle! You can adjust the sweetness to your drink and I love the option of chia seeds! We got the matcha green tea, the jasmine and the pineapple green tea! All yummy! The line went quick and it wasn't a long wait to get our drinks, the cashier was friendly and don't forget to check in so you can use your 15% off ! I totally forgot about it when I was paying

excerpts: My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea.
Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.
mango green tea.author: Tiffany K.
mango green tea.review:
I've been to Plentea a few times already, even when it first opened. This place was pretty cool and cute in the Financial district. What got me were the glass bottles. I think it has been over a year or two since I came back, and recently this place has changed a bit. They still have the glass bottles, and same menu but I think the food menu has changed a bit and maybe owner? But anyways all in all this place is great, their teas are fresh and I like the glass bottle that goes with it. I also like their tapioca, its made pretty good, as some places tend to leave it out long and its very hard and chewy. Unfortunately its in downtown area, so I cannot make my way here as often. This place does get busy, and parking can be a pain depending on time of day. It is on the pricyer side for teas so I cant say I would come back here everyday. Service is great and quick would def recommend everyone to come here and try it out if they have not already. 

My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea. Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.

excerpts: We ordered a classic milk tea, sea salt cream oolong milk tea, mango green tea, and a honey lime green tea from the suggestion of the worker.
All of the drinks were ok.
Nothing I would go out of my way for.
A con with these glasses is the straw gets in the way if you want to close it.
It's basically an open container otherwise unlike the boba cups with a sealed top.
Of all the drinks we got I'd stick with the classic milk tea.
mango green tea.author: Lanha T.
mango green tea.review: Don't forget to check in to get 15% off if you order 2 drinks like I did. Came here because I thought the glasses were cute. We ordered a classic milk tea, sea salt cream oolong milk tea, mango green tea, and a honey lime green tea from the suggestion of the worker. All of the drinks were ok. Nothing I would go out of my way for. A con with these glasses is the straw gets in the way if you want to close it. It's basically an open container otherwise unlike the boba cups with a sealed top. Of all the drinks we got I'd stick with the classic milk tea.

excerpts: I got the mango green tea and was a huge fan.
I'm vegan
so I was looking for an option with milk.
It was green tea with chunks of real mango in it.
I think sugar was added
but I didn't get around to asking.
I love mango and I like green tea
so it was a good combination.
I know I'll be back for more mango green tea
and I may add red bean as a topping the next time around.
mango green tea.author: Karishma M.
mango green tea.review:
I got the mango green tea and was a huge fan. I'm vegan so I was looking for an option with milk. It was green tea with chunks of real mango in it. I think sugar was added but I didn't get around to asking. I love mango and I like green tea so it was a good combination. You also get to keep the glass containers they give you with a lid.

My friend who got the CoffMilk Tea said it reminded her of Vietnamese coffee.

My friend who got the Strawberry Green Tea liked hers as well and said she also tasted the real strawberry in it.

I think if you get the right drink then this place could be a great option for you.

I know I'll be back for more mango green tea and I may add red bean as a topping the next time around.

excerpts: WARNING: do not order the Mango Green Tea.
mango green tea.author: Danielle A.
mango green tea.review:
WARNING: do not order the Mango Green Tea. It is almost as if the tea used in this drink is the same exact tap water that was used to wash the mango itself. 

Overall, I loved the glass cups and the decorations. The place looked very aesthetic.

excerpts: I tried the Mango Green Tea this time around and it was the perfect blend of sweetness and very refreshing with the boba it was great.
Would recommend and the pricing is good for the beautiful bottle you can keep as a souvenir.
mango green tea.author: Jenny T.
mango green tea.review: 4 years after coming back here and not much has changed! I tried the Mango Green Tea this time around and it was the perfect blend of sweetness and very refreshing with the boba it was great. Would recommend and the pricing is good for the beautiful bottle you can keep as a souvenir.

excerpts: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!!
They were both very delicious.
Sadly live to far
or I'd be there every day!
Customer service was good!
mango green tea.author: Karina R.
mango green tea.review: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!! They were both very delicious. Sadly live to far or I'd be there every day! Customer service was good!

excerpts: My go to and favorites at Plentea are the Mango Green Tea with lychee jelly and aloe and the Matcha Green Tea with boba.
The tea flavor is very strong just how I like it which I feel is hard to find at other tea shops.
Also the staff is very kind and they have an upstairs part that not many people go to that you can sit and enjoy your boba.
mango green tea.author: Lo H.
mango green tea.review: This is one of my favorite boba spots thus far. I love the fact that they put your drinks in a cute, skinny, mason jar-like cup that you can take home with you to keep. My go to and favorites at Plentea are the Mango Green Tea with lychee jelly and aloe and the Matcha Green Tea with boba. The tea flavor is very strong just how I like it which I feel is hard to find at other tea shops. Also the staff is very kind and they have an upstairs part that not many people go to that you can sit and enjoy your boba.

excerpts: I had the mango green tea with lychee jelly.
Pretty good but definitely hard to get the jelly out of the bottom.
It's a cute novelty spot and I brought the jar with me back to NY to have as a keepsake
Keep in mind, it's about $5 for a jar of bubble tea so not cheap in any way
but I guess the jar is worth the extra $1.
mango green tea.author: Lisa C.
mango green tea.review:
I love trying out different bubble tea spots outside of NYC so of course I had to come here. My little sis brought me there b/c the tea comes in a cute glass bottle. There are also plastic lids for the jar but be careful, it's not very tight. So if you plan to put the jar into your bag, make sure it stays up right. 

I had the mango green tea with lychee jelly. Pretty good but definitely hard to get the jelly out of the bottom. It's a cute novelty spot and I brought the jar with me back to NY to have as a keepsake :) Keep in mind, it's about $5 for a jar of bubble tea so not cheap in any way but I guess the jar is worth the extra $1.

excerpts: The mango green tea was refreshing and had small mango pieces in it!
and it had a good balance of fruit and tea flavor.
Parking can be hard to find because it's street parking and downtown.
mango green tea.author: Sara C.
mango green tea.review: It's a bit on the expensive side but you do get a nice glass jar! I like the aesthetic of the shop and the boba has good flavor and just the right consistency. I really liked the iced milk drink, which was a perfect blend of sweetness and creaminess. The mango green tea was refreshing and had small mango pieces in it! and it had a good balance of fruit and tea flavor. Parking can be hard to find because it's street parking and downtown.

excerpts: I recommend the mango green tea, which has bits of mangos.
Sweet level is normal pretty sweet which is how I like my drinks
mango green tea.author: Sherry Y.
mango green tea.review:
I recommend the mango green tea, which has bits of mangos. Sweet level is normal pretty sweet which is how I like my drinks but if you don't ask for it less sweet. 

Brown sugar milk tea was only ok, gong chat is still my favorite for it. 

Line is usually out the door but luckily we came here after the lunch rush and barely had a line. 

They use five star, which is an extra +! So just enter your phone # when you're at the register. I prefer this rather than carry an extra card.

excerpts: - first was a mango green tea, and second time I had papaya milk.
mango green tea.author: Dianna H.
mango green tea.review:
It's great that there's finally a decent boba place near where I work!!! I never understood why there weren't good places in downtown.

I've been here twice and had two different drinks - first was a mango green tea, and second time I had papaya milk. 

I would say their milk tea is decent but nothing great. Doesn't deserve the $4.50 or $4.95 they charge you. 

BUT THEIR FRUIT MILKS. I could go on all day about them! And I don't even like milk normally! The papaya milk was extremely tasty and fresh. Not only were there still bits of papaya floating around in the drink, but they also used really yummy ripe papaya for maximum deliciousness!! ^_^

Had some friends who tried the strawberry milk, and while I didn't try any, they swore by it and called it their new favorite drink.

As far as the space itself goes, there are two floors - the first floor and half of a second floor above with some more cozy seating. Both times I was there (once at 3 pm on Wed and once at 11:30 am on a Thu), there weren't too people sitting inside, so it was pretty easy for my friends and I to find a spot to sit and take a nice little break from work.

As much as I love this place's fruity milk drinks (they're the main reason behind the 4 stars), I have to admit there are some cons:
-pricy
-no credit cards accepted under $10
-no rewards system (okay this isn't really that big of a deal, but given how many times I see myself coming here, I really hope they implement something soon!)

excerpts: The mango fruit milk was surprisingly really refreshing as well, and the mango green tea was just as good as my drink.
mango green tea.author: Joanna Q.
mango green tea.review:
I tried mango oolong tea with tapioca. It was super refreshing, and had a really strong tea flavor, which I really appreciate. I could've gone without the boba, it was nothing too special, and the tea was more refreahing by itself. It was quite expensive though, my drink came out to be about $6 (with the glass jar). 

My friends' drinks were pretty good too. The ice milk was too sweet for my taste, but pretty good. The mango fruit milk was surprisingly really refreshing as well, and the mango green tea was just as good as my drink. 

Not sure if I would come back because of the price, but I guess if you're in the area and in the mood for boba...

excerpts: They still had some when we came by and so we ordered a fresh mango green tea with boba and a salted crema oolong tea with boba.
Okay you're definitely paying for the glass bottles because two drinks came out to 11 bucks.
Next time I'm coming by
I'm getting my drink in a plastic cup
(they have that option and its cheaper).
The drinks were actually really tasty and refreshing.
And the boba was perfect.
mango green tea.author: Dara S.
mango green tea.review:
Oh the hype that I've heard about this place. Came by after work one day around 6-7pm. The line wasn't that long so it was pretty relieving. I did hear that after a certain time during the day they run out of the glass bottles. Okay, giving into the hype I wanted a glass bottle. (you would want one too!)

They still had some when we came by and so we ordered a fresh mango green tea with boba and a salted crema oolong tea with boba. Okay you're definitely paying for the glass bottles because two drinks came out to 11 bucks. Next time I'm coming by I'm getting my drink in a plastic cup (they have that option and its cheaper). The drinks were actually really tasty and refreshing. And the boba was perfect.

excerpts: I tried the Mango Green Tea and IT
WAS
SO GOOD
so refreshing
and you even get to keep the jars!!!
mango green tea.author: Kelly P.
mango green tea.review: Their fruit teas are better than their milk teas. I tried the Mango Green Tea and IT WAS SO GOOD  so refreshing and you even get to keep the jars!!!

excerpts: Mango green tea is where it's at.
The pieces of mango in your drink along with the boba is pure genius.
Not to mention the adorable glasses you get with each drink.
Yes it's a little pricey, but let's be real.
The glasses are totally worth it.
I may or may not have a dozen of them in the drawer of my desk at work.
But really though, you want me to lug ten of them all the way back to Kearny for a free drink?
No thank you.
Other than that, great drinks and service
and I'll definitely be coming back
mango green tea.author: Sam L.
mango green tea.review: Before coming here I consistently went to Destiny on Kearny for boba, but I came here once and never looked back. Mango green tea is where it's at. The pieces of mango in your drink along with the boba is pure genius. Not to mention the adorable glasses you get with each drink. Yes it's a little pricey, but let's be real. The glasses are totally worth it. I may or may not have a dozen of them in the drawer of my desk at work. But really though, you want me to lug ten of them all the way back to Kearny for a free drink? No thank you. Other than that, great drinks and service and I'll definitely be coming back :)

excerpts: Mango green tea with honey boba is my drink of choice.
I'll definitely come back!
Don't forget to bring back your glass bottle though for the 10% off!
mango green tea.author: Elena V.
mango green tea.review:
I went once and wasn't really a fan because they put fruit mango chunks in my drink. I went back a second time to try it again and they didn't add chunks to my drink and j loved it. It was such a tasty drink and so refreshing. They are also very generous with their boba! Such a good place. Mango green tea with honey boba is my drink of choice. I'll definitely come back! 
Don't forget to bring back your glass bottle though for the 10% off!

excerpts: The mango green tea with lychee jelly will be my first love in SF!
mango green tea.author: Xx L.
mango green tea.review: Really really nice juice! The mango green tea with lychee jelly will be my first love in SF!

excerpts:
=) 

Sea salt crema Oolong tea, strawberry black tea, mango green tea =
mango green tea.author: Christine Y.
mango green tea.review:
I like the tea here, better than Share. It just tastes great every time I get it. Maybe it's in the glass bottles =)

The girl at the front (Filipino?) had great customer service skills, instructing her co-workers to shout out the numbers louder (cmon chica, you can't be whispering those numbers out, it's loud in there) and letting me have a bag for my food when I literally didn't have a dime on me to pay for it. I love her. She's way better than the kids at ALLLL those other places. Yeah I'l make the trip out here from outer richmond for that. =) 

Sea salt crema Oolong tea, strawberry black tea, mango green tea = all winners. 
I didn't try, but the waffle pastrami sandwich and banana nutella dessert I ordered to-go for my friend looked amazing.

excerpts: I tried the the sea salt cream oolong tea and my girlfriend tried the mango green tea.
The drinks tasted pretty good overall.
My drink was a little too salty/creamy and not enough sweet/tea.
The mango green tea was good and came with little mango chunks which was a pleasant surprise.
Unfortunately, I do not believe these drinks lived up to the almost $6.00 that we had to pay for each! 2 drinks with pearls came out over $11!
I guess the high costs are due to the glass bottles that they come in
that you can take home (which is pretty cool
mango green tea.author: Thomas B.
mango green tea.review:
Decided to try this place out after hearing lots of good things. I tried the the sea salt cream oolong tea and my girlfriend tried the mango green tea. The drinks tasted pretty good overall. My drink was a little too salty/creamy and not enough sweet/tea. The mango green tea was good and came with little mango chunks which was a pleasant surprise. Unfortunately, I do not believe these drinks lived up to the almost $6.00 that we had to pay for each! 2 drinks with pearls came out over $11! I guess the high costs are due to the glass bottles that they come in that you can take home (which is pretty cool I must admit). 

The real reason I am rating this so low is actually about the bottles. After finishing our drinks, I decided to rinse the bottles in a bathroom sink. While rinsing, the bottle slipped out of my hand, falling about 1/2 a foot into the bottom of the sink. This very small drop completely shattered the bottle into 15 pieces, cutting up my hands. If you are going to use glass bottles like these that you suggest to re-use, make sure the glass isn't such crappy quality! Warning to everyone planning on re-using these bottles, be very careful with them!

excerpts: Marie got mango green tea with boba.
mango green tea.author: Liping H.
mango green tea.review:
My friend Marie and I came here on a spontaneous boba craving, and it seemed like this was the only boba place that was open late at night. So we took a big ass trip from the Mission to Downtown.

It was worth it! Marie got mango green tea with boba. She appreciated the bits of mango in the drink.

I got the thai milk tea with boba. I thought it was okay, I wish I got the more popular ones like the regular milk tea with the special whatevs. But it wasn't horrible though! 

I mean, we were in the mood for boba, and this satisfied it.

The total was around ~$10. Not too shabby for a late night boba expedition.

Anyways, if you're getting a boba craving at night; Plentea is a pretty good choice.

excerpts: (I got the mango green tea with tapioca).
The flavors in mine were a bit bland and all the tapioca was stuck together and hard to get through the straw.
mango green tea.author: Danielle B.
mango green tea.review: I want to start out by saying that it's is only getting a 3 star rating only for the fact that you can keep the glass bottle your tea comes in! We stopped by here earlier today and enjoyed the loft area for sitting upstairs. It wasn't the best boba tea we got in town, but it was okay (I got the mango green tea with tapioca). The flavors in mine were a bit bland and all the tapioca was stuck together and hard to get through the straw. My boyfriend has his with milk tea and it was way too thick for my liking. It was also on the pricier side of different places I've been in San Francisco, but like I said you can keep the bottle!

excerpts: I ordered the mango green tea with aloe, and I really enjoyed it!
It was pretty sweet, so I may adjust the sweetness next time I come in.
Which reminds me, plus points for being able to adjust sweetness!
I don't think they mention it on their menu, but my friend mentioned they could do it for some drinks.
mango green tea.author: Mia T.
mango green tea.review:
I've gotta say, take home bottles is such a good idea. You can even get a lid for take out purposes! Plus you get 10% off your drink if you bring them back? Sold.

A friend of mine had always been telling me about this place, and I'm glad I did! I ordered the mango green tea with aloe, and I really enjoyed it! It was pretty sweet, so I may adjust the sweetness next time I come in. Which reminds me, plus points for being able to adjust sweetness! I don't think they mention it on their menu, but my friend mentioned they could do it for some drinks. If you're not sure, just ask!

I wasn't able to taste the waffles, but they looked so good! I definitely need to come back again.

excerpts: So I ordered a regular milk green tea and mango green tea both with boba.
The Jasmine milk tea had a really nice floral note to it and the mango one was pretty good, tasted like any other mango green tea I've had.
The glass bottles are of course a nice souvenir to keep at the end.
Overall, a pretty good first try!
mango green tea.author: Sam L.
mango green tea.review: So I ordered a regular milk green tea and mango green tea both with boba.  I barely ever get regular milk tea just because I feel that it's very plain but I just wanted to try it here.  However, they actually gave me Jasmine milk green tea instead and I am actually glad that they messed up.  I actually did not even know it was Jasmine until i noticed the difference in color with my friend's regular milk tea.  The Jasmine milk tea had a really nice floral note to it and the mango one was pretty good, tasted like any other mango green tea I've had.  The glass bottles are of course a nice souvenir to keep at the end.  Overall, a pretty good first try!

excerpts: One fresh fruit mango green tea for me and one for the boyfriend.
We both enjoyed our flavored green teas - not to sweet and just enough tea taste.
Nothing mind blowing
but it was nice and refreshing after having a heavy bowl of ramen.
The prices is a bit steep though - $5 for a drink.
Wtf?!
But I believe if you bring your old Plentea bottle or order a plastic cup you get a discount.
I got 20% off because they ran out of the Plentea bottles during my visit
mango green tea.author: Serena K.
mango green tea.review:
Stumbled upon this place by accident. I had just finished early dinner with a group of friends next door at Ramen Underground when my BF noticed people drinking milk teas and fruity tea drinks. (He knows I how much I love fruity iced teas - its got its own little compartment in my tummy just like dessert.) We walked a few door downs and BAM - Plentea!

One fresh fruit mango green tea for me and one for the boyfriend. We both enjoyed our flavored green teas - not to sweet and just enough tea taste. Nothing mind blowing but it was nice and refreshing after having a heavy bowl of ramen. The prices is a bit steep though - $5 for a drink. Wtf?! But I believe if you bring your old Plentea bottle or order a plastic cup you get a discount. I got 20% off because they ran out of the Plentea bottles during my visit and I got my drink in a plastic cup instead.

I didn't know about the existence of the famous cute Plentea glass bottles until I checked out the Yelp photos after I got into the car that I saw the cute little glass bottles. (Oh darn.)

Will I be back? Sure if I'm in the area. There's a lot of drinks on the menu I have yet to try but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit...

excerpts: I got the fresh strawberry black tea and mango green tea.
It was delicious.
The taste was simple, tasty, but not too sweet.
I'll come back for sure, hopefully I remember to bring my bottle to get 10% off.
Lol
mango green tea.author: R M.
mango green tea.review: I love my boba so I've been wanting to try it. There was a line out the door when I went but it's not the same wait as tpumps. I like that the boba comes in a bottle you can keep. The price isn't too bad. I got the fresh strawberry black tea and mango green tea. It was delicious. The taste was simple, tasty, but not too sweet. I'll come back for sure, hopefully I remember to bring my bottle to get 10% off. Lol

excerpts: I had the mango green tea that came with mango chunks and it had the perfect amount of sweetness.
Its fairly hard to get the perfect proportion of when it comes to tea
but Plentea was pretty successful.
Its also a bonus that we get to keep their beautiful glass bottles.
mango green tea.author: Larissa Q.
mango green tea.review: As a Bay Area teenager, I've been to my fair share of amazing milk tea joints. Plentea is definitely on the top of my list. I had the mango green tea that came with mango chunks and it had the perfect amount of sweetness. Its fairly hard to get the perfect proportion of when it comes to tea but Plentea was pretty successful. Its also a bonus that we get to keep their beautiful glass bottles.

excerpts: Want was really good its the mango green tea with lychee jelly.
mango green tea.author: Lonni L.
mango green tea.review: The waiting line is ridiculously crazy.  I got the taro milk with taro pudding.  That wasn't good at all. My sister got the sea salt. That was nasty.  Want was really good its the mango green tea with lychee jelly.

excerpts: However, honey lime tea is super sweet
I'd not have it for the second time...
honey lime tea.author: Zeynep D.
honey lime tea.review: Their Jasmine green tea is awesome!!! However, honey lime tea is super sweet I'd not have it for the second time...

excerpts: Other than the sweetness, I can't complain about the Brown Sugar Ice Milk with pudding & boba.
I put the bottle in the freezer because my ice milk wasn't so icey when I got home.
I found that boba freezes very quickly!
But even frozen, the boba wasn't hard and old tasting.
It had a nice chew and they soaked up some milk flavor, it was quite nice.
ice milk.author: Soy Y.
ice milk.review:
Sweetness warning...
If you normally get 50% sweet anywhere else.. you probably want to go less sweet here.

Other than the sweetness, I can't complain about the Brown Sugar Ice Milk with pudding & boba.

If they can find a way to have a lid where the straw fits through it, it would be great!

I put the bottle in the freezer because my ice milk wasn't so icey when I got home. I found that boba freezes very quickly! But even frozen, the boba wasn't hard and old tasting. It had a nice chew and they soaked up some milk flavor, it was quite nice.

excerpts: Ordered: Ice milk tea and  nutella
milk tea are my go to here.
One of my favorite milk tea shops downtown.
ice milk.author: Terry N.
ice milk.review:
Pros: Glass bottles! No cute images printed on them but basic rectangular bottles that looks like old school milk bottles. The lids are like the metal caps from Snapple so I'm impress how they're trying to move away from plastic. Menu is pretty minimal and not overwhelming. They also work with Ritual now! Prices are fair too, about $4.50

Cons: Not giving them 5 stars only because their drinks are inconsistent from time to time. Hit or miss because their drinks can be bland sometimes.

Ordered: Ice milk tea and  nutella milk tea are my go to here.

Would I recommend: Yes! One of my favorite milk tea shops downtown.

excerpts: Come for the brown sugar ice milk.
Brown sugar ice milk 5 stars when its done right.
ice milk.author: James S.
ice milk.review:
Come for the brown sugar ice milk. Its really good. 

They remodeled this place and its much cleaner and brighter inside. They are still eco friendly and revamped their food menu. 

Biggest complaint about this place is that it's not consistent. You'd think they'd have their formulas down to a science, but it can vary depending on how busy they are and who is making your drink. I've complained before and sometimes they fix it, and some times they just say thats how it is.

Overall 2 stars. Brown sugar ice milk 5 stars when its done right.

btw, if you are super eco friendly, you can bring back the glass bottle for 50 cents off your next purchase.

excerpts: My husband and I highly recommend the Ice Milk drink with brown sugar & tapioca.
It reminds us of the popular ice milk drink at Half & Half tea in Los Angeles.
I do prefer the taste of the iced milk drink with brown sugar at this location in SF more than the Berkeley location, because it's the perfect blend for me.
ice milk.author: Eunjoo P.
ice milk.review:
Love this place. 
My husband and I are milk tea/boba enthusiasts & have even driven & flown to LA to get our milk tea fix, many times. lol 
Plentea is our new favorite though. If you don't like your drink, they will adjust to your liking or make you a new/different drink all together. The price is great, as it's not much more than you would normally pay for a milk tea drink but you get a beautiful glass bottle with the lid to reuse at home or to bring back to get 10% off. 
My husband and I highly recommend the Ice Milk drink with brown sugar & tapioca. It reminds us of the popular ice milk drink at Half & Half tea in Los Angeles. 
I do prefer the taste of the iced milk drink with brown sugar at this location in SF more than the Berkeley location, because it's the perfect blend for me. Not too sweet. 

Hoping that Plentea opens a location in Cupertino near where we live soon so that we don't have to make the 1.5 hr drive each way. :)

excerpts: My friend ordered the ice milk and it was creamy, smooth, and perfect for a hot day.
The way I would describe it would be milky with a sweetness of caramel.
The price here is about $5 but you get the keep the bottle
so it is worth it in my opinion.
The tea quality is there as well.
ice milk.author: Ellen V.
ice milk.review: Awesome drinks flavor and a cute glass bottle for your boba! The quality of the tea is there for sure. I never had a matcha milk tea this strong in flavor before in my life. I wasn't complaining though. It was refreshing and aesthetically pleasing. My friend ordered the ice milk and it was creamy, smooth, and perfect for a hot day. The way I would describe it would be milky with a sweetness of caramel. The price here is about $5 but you get the keep the bottle so it is worth it in my opinion. The tea quality is there as well.

excerpts: We ordered the caramel ice milk w/ boba, which was good and had the consistency and flavor of a vanilla shake.
the caramel flavor was there
but it was bit overwhelmed by the milk.
boba was a bit on the hard side but it didnt get in the way whatsoever.
ice milk.author: Boba R.
ice milk.review:
We ordered the caramel ice milk w/ boba, which was good and had the consistency and flavor of a vanilla shake. the caramel flavor was there but it was bit overwhelmed by the milk. boba was a bit on the hard side but it didnt get in the way whatsoever. the reusable glass bottles were a nice touch



rankings
flavor/freshness/boba texture/total (out of 5) and ranking next to the 8 chinatown boba shops we tried that day
person a: 4/5/5/14 #6
person b: 3.5/5/1.5/10 #7
person c: 4/5/4/13 #4
person d: 4/5/4/13 #5
person e: 6/6/6/18 #1
me: 4/5/3/12 #3
average: 4/5/4/13 #4.3

excerpts: My go to drinks here that kept me coming back is the Taro Ice milk tea.
It taste very good and not that artificial flavoring, it contains real taro chunks.
I've also tried their honeydew milk tea which was ok.
Overall what I enjoy about their drinks is that they don't use artificial flavoring.
I would say go with their Ice Milk drinks because they are very GOOD.
ice milk.author: Michele G.
ice milk.review:
Visited this place many times!

First off this place has a very hipster vibe with their decor and seating. There are cute plants hanging on the side of the store as well. Menu was straight forward and easy to follow.

Pricewise for a boba milk drink it is pricey because of the glass jar/bottle. Be prepared to spend at least 5.25 for a drink with one topping.

My go to drinks here that kept me coming back is the Taro Ice milk tea. It taste very good and not that artificial flavoring, it contains real taro chunks. I've also tried their honeydew milk tea which was ok. Overall what I enjoy about their drinks is that they don't use artificial flavoring. I would say go with their Ice Milk drinks because they are very GOOD. Boba balls are average, not too soft but not chewy enough to my standard.

Customer service is ok, no connection whatsoever, just order and then get your drink.

excerpts: I got the ice milk with pudding and boba, something I normally get in SoCal.
ice milk.author: Vivian Y.
ice milk.review:
I dropped by Plentea when I came to visit my friends in SF. They recommended this shop, and I trust their opinion because they grew up in the SGV too. I got the ice milk with pudding and boba, something I normally get in SoCal. Plentea's version was just as good; the boba was chewy and sweet. 

I thought it was a cute touch (also environmentally friendly) that the drinks came in glass jars. These glass jars are not very sturdy though. I tried making tea and poured boiling hot water into the jar, and the bottom cracked--not the shop's fault; I was just dumb haha. So just in case you want to reuse the jar, use it only for cold drinks LOL

excerpts: The first night I got the ice milk tea--oolong with tapioca bubbles and grass jelly.
I didn't think it was too sweet for me, but the grass jelly probably did a good job of offsetting the sweetness in any case.
My 2nd visit, I got the matcha with lychee jelly.
I really, really loved the lychee jelly; this was my first time trying it
so I can't speak to how it might compare to other places, but
I thought it was so yummy and would definitely get it again.
ice milk.author: Connie L.
ice milk.review:
I came here twice last week while working in the area; once on Friday night around 8:45 and then the following afternoon around 1:30. It wasn't too busy either time; I was in and out in about 5 minutes each visit. 

I really liked both of the drinks I got (both cold). The first night I got the ice milk tea--oolong with tapioca bubbles and grass jelly. I didn't think it was too sweet for me, but the grass jelly probably did a good job of offsetting the sweetness in any case. My 2nd visit, I got the matcha with lychee jelly. I really, really loved the lychee jelly; this was my first time trying it so I can't speak to how it might compare to other places, but I thought it was so yummy and would definitely get it again. The glass bottles were a cool novelty and the caps were secure; I lugged my drink up a few hills both times and didn't have any issues with spilling. 

There is some seating on the 1st floor of the cafe; it looked like there was an upstairs too, but I didn't get the chance to go up there. The drinks were prepared very quickly and were a good size. Both times, the staff I encountered were friendly and efficient.

The drinks were pretty expensive, which knocked it down from 5 to 4 stars for me. I think you're probably paying for the glass bottle, but I think the price might still not be ideal for some. Overall, it was a nice place with good drinks and a cute idea for the bottles and I'm glad I stopped by.

excerpts: I got the caramel ice milk with grass jelly.
Even though I got less sugar it was still a bit too sweet for me.
TBH, I wasn't too much of a fan for my drink.
It seems like fruit tea is the way to go
so i'll definitely come back to give that a try to see if my opinion changes.
ice milk.author: Keizzel C.
ice milk.review:
Very excited to try this place after looking at all the hipster photos of their glass bottles. 

Location: In the center of Fidi and only a few blocks from where I work/BART. Hole in the wall so it can definitely get packed and the line can be out the door if you're there during the rush. 

Service: I appreciate the ability to pick the sugar level in my drink since I usually do 50%. Even though it was the lunch rush they're pretty quick with your drink with plenty of glass bottles to share. 

I got the caramel ice milk with grass jelly. Even though I got less sugar it was still a bit too sweet for me. TBH, I wasn't too much of a fan for my drink. It seems like fruit tea is the way to go so i'll definitely come back to give that a try to see if my opinion changes.

excerpts: However, my favorite drink here is definitely the Caramel Ice Milk.
I highly recommend it.
It was super creamy
and I always stop by to get it when I am in the area.
The glass bottles are also really cute and I now have 5+ of them because I keep coming back for more!
If you come here alone, bring back the glass bottle for 10% off.
If you come here for someone else, check in on Yelp to get 15% off!
ice milk.author: Catherine S.
ice milk.review:
I first heard of this place by friends on Instagram who were posting super cute pictures of the cute bottles that the tea came in. I was really excited to get one of these bottles, and decided to stop by on a random night since I was in the area to see if I could still snag a bottle. I was so happy to see that they still had many crates full of bottles when I got there around 8PM (but people say they usually run out earlier in the day). 

There are a few seating areas in the tea shop and the ambience is quite nice. The first time I came, I ordered the Thai milk tea, but it was a little too milky for me with not enough tea and was nothing special. However, my favorite drink here is definitely the Caramel Ice Milk. I highly recommend it. It was super creamy and I always stop by to get it when I am in the area.The glass bottles are also really cute and I now have 5+ of them because I keep coming back for more! If you come here alone, bring back the glass bottle for 10% off. If you come here for someone else, check in on Yelp to get 15% off!

excerpts: the Caramel Ice Milk and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea - both were pretty good
ice milk.author: Racheal D.
ice milk.review:
I've been dying to come here ever since I saw the cute glass bottles all over Instagram but I must say I was a bit disappointed.

The price wasn't really a problem for me at all - $4.75 for bubble tea and you get to keep the bottle? That's pretty worth it for me!  I got the Caramel Ice Milk and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea - both were pretty good but we wish the sugar level could be adjusted (sadly that wasn't an option).

Service in this location is meh... the cashier didn't seem like she enjoyed her job that much!  I didn't really appreciate the tone she was giving my friend and I when we were ordering our drinks - she seems a bit annoyed but hey we're not even from SF so spare us the attitude!

Overall - very average place.

FYI - $10.00 credit card minimum!

excerpts: Also, I always get their brown sugar ice milk with boba and egg pudding.
This is the one boba place where regular PMT, while good, is not their best drink.
p.s. bring your glass bottle back for a discount.
ice milk.author: Savi J.
ice milk.review:
I'm surprised I haven't written a review for Plentea yet, as I've been here over 20 times by now. This is the first place I take friends when I'm in the city. I remember when the place first opened and it was such a hit with the glass bottles, over time the location has physically changed, mainly to be more accommodating for bigger groups. The last time I came, the upper area was open, but clearly (and hopefully) still needed some finishing touches. I love how they have five stars and yelp discounts. 
Also, I always get their brown sugar ice milk with boba and egg pudding. This is the one boba place where regular PMT, while good, is not their best drink. 
p.s. bring your glass bottle back for a discount.

excerpts: I usually get the ice milk tea with brown sugar.
This is soooo delicious, perfect balance between sweet and tea, and there's something about the brown sugar part that's so good!!
The hot almond milk tea also has lots of flavor, must try during a cold night.
The matcha tea is kind of gross, Doesn't taste like the matcha from...
Like.. Sbux..
That I love...
There's plenteaaa of seats and an upstairs as well, but the loud music and bustling baristas don't make this a good work place- nice spot to drink boba and chill.
Took away a star bc
I hate places that makes you purchase a minimum in order to use your cc!
C'mon guys!
ice milk.author: Maria C.
ice milk.review:
Love this tapioca spot! For about 5$ you get your drink and a cute, glass milk jug, which you can bring in next time for a slight discount (10%). It's nice that there's only one size to the drinks as well. 
I usually get the ice milk tea with brown sugar. This is soooo delicious, perfect balance between sweet and tea, and there's something about the brown sugar part that's so good!! The hot almond milk tea also has lots of flavor, must try during a cold night. The matcha tea is kind of gross, Doesn't taste like the matcha from... Like.. Sbux.. That I love...
There's plenteaaa of seats and an upstairs as well, but the loud music and bustling baristas don't make this a good work place- nice spot to drink boba and chill. 
Took away a star bc I hate places that makes you purchase a minimum in order to use your cc! C'mon guys! It's 2016

excerpts: the Ice Milk w/ Brown Sugar drink and their tapioca is decent
but I don't really want to spend $6 for a drink...anyways I would say one pro is the space which is nice
and it's a good place to check out at least once!
ice milk.author: Lena T.
ice milk.review: I would bump it up but you're essentially paying for the aesthetic bottle when you could walk down like a block and head to iTea but I do really like the Ice Milk w/ Brown Sugar drink and their tapioca is decent but I don't really want to spend $6 for a drink...anyways I would say one pro is the space which is nice and it's a good place to check out at least once!

excerpts: I used to love coming to Plentea, and my drink of choice was the Ice Milk with brown sugar and taro pudding.
The first time I went back to Plentea after it re-opened, I again got my usual Ice Milk with brown sugar.
When I tried to order the taro pudding, I was told they no longer offer that topping.
ice milk.author: Jackie Y.
ice milk.review:
I used to love coming to Plentea, and my drink of choice was the Ice Milk with brown sugar and taro pudding. 

However, a few months back, Plentea closed for renovations, and after re-opening, it just hasn't been the same. 

The first time I went back to Plentea after it re-opened, I again got my usual Ice Milk with brown sugar. When I tried to order the taro pudding, I was told they no longer offer that topping. The drink itself was also severely disappointing -- it tasted nothing like it used to and was pretty much flavorless ice. 

I went back again a few weeks ago to give Plentea another try and was again disappointed by my drink. Taro pudding still isn't offered as a topping.

The interior decor and menu have changed quite a bit, leading me to think Plentea might have changed hands.

Lastly, Plentea no longer uses the Five Stars loyalty program (and did not communicate the termination of the program beforehand), so all the points I collected are lost.

excerpts: The price for the drink itself wasn't awful considering you get a bottle, but I ordered an ice milk with caramel and it was greatly lacking in sweetness despite my past experiences with other boba shops.
As it turned out, it was because the caramel was sugar free, something that took me like 20 minutes of taste testing to realize.
Yeah...
it's not for me.
Why bother with unsweetened caramel?
My company seemed to enjoy their drinks and you get to keep the bottle afterwards
so that's cool
I guess.
Bring the bottle back for a discounted drink next time!
ice milk.author: Jenn T.
ice milk.review:
I guess people come here for the bottle but I came here because my group preferred Plentea to i-Tea. The price for the drink itself wasn't awful considering you get a bottle, but I ordered an ice milk with caramel and it was greatly lacking in sweetness despite my past experiences with other boba shops. As it turned out, it was because the caramel was sugar free, something that took me like 20 minutes of taste testing to realize. Yeah... it's not for me. Why bother with unsweetened caramel?
My company seemed to enjoy their drinks and you get to keep the bottle afterwards so that's cool I guess. Bring the bottle back for a discounted drink next time!

excerpts: If you're into something really sweet, I like the ice milk tea with caramel & egg pudding and boba.
ice milk.author: Payal R.
ice milk.review: If you're into something really sweet, I like the ice milk tea with caramel & egg pudding and boba.

excerpts: I saw only one item with the boba and that was the $4.95 Ice Milk with Tapioca Pearls.
ice milk.author: Ed U.
ice milk.review:
Gee, if someone had told me that I'd be sucking a straw in a milk bottle at my advanced age, I would have brushed that remark aside as I was certain that would not happen in my lifetime. At least before I was put out to pasture at Shady Pines. But who knew this boba craze would take off with youthful Asians hanging out at all these bubble tea shops popping up everywhere. Some handle it well like Sharetea in the Metreon where they don't make you feel like an idiot for ordering a Coffee Ice Blended with chunks of coffee jelly that you have to suck up in a wide-mouth straw.

This place, however, appears to enjoy making you feel like an idiot by forcing you to drink their stuff in a milk bottle like it was a retro-hip version of the Juice Shop. Besides which, the selections are on the paltry side here. I had just finished a hearty meal at Hunan Homes and was looking for something to quench my thirst after dinner. I saw only one item with the boba and that was the $4.95 Ice Milk with Tapioca Pearls. Sure enough, it came in a milk bottle just like what you would see in a Doris Day movie where she locked herself out of the house with Rock Hudson nowhere to be found.

So here I was among the hip Asian youth of this city trying to look cool as I sucked hard to get every one of those pearls out of the damn milk bottle (photo: http://bit.ly/1DsWvsK). With heavy doses of brown sugar and caramel in it, it was mostly an oversweetened drink with chewable pellets. I felt like the beginning of an Amy Schumer joke. When I attempted to return the bottle back to the over-giggly cashier, she gave me small-mouth and 'tude about how I was supposed to keep it so I would come back and get it refilled. Refilled? I'll bring my own sippy cup, thank you very much.

BOBA - 2 stars...cold milk sweetened up to excess like I was seven or something
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...contemporary vibe with lots of suckers and presumably suckees
SERVICE - 2 stars...I don't want your bottle...seriously
TOTAL - 2 stars...Sharetea awaits

excerpts: My go to is the ice milk with caramel and taro pudding as a topping inside.
ice milk.author: Vanessa L.
ice milk.review:
My go to is the ice milk with caramel and taro pudding as a topping inside. It really depends who makes it in order to get a really good one and depends if it's busy or not that day. 

The first time I tried it: only a few customers and a lot of caramel was put inside so it made the drink taste better and sweeter. 
I came again just recently: line was out the door, not enough workers to make the drinks, there were only like two people, and even the cashier had to help out with making the drinks. I got my drink, barely any caramel and taro pudding, I felt like I was just drinking whole milk... So disappointed because I was looking forward to drinking it that day as dessert. 

Brought my own bottle, so I did get 10% off of my purchase.

excerpts: The ice milk with caramel was pretty good (again, not too sweet) and it came slushed.
They had a Nutella one that I was thinking of getting
but I initially thought it might be overly sweet
so I went with the ice milk.
ice milk.author: Esther A.
ice milk.review:
I had imagined extremely sweet drinks but was pleased that it was not. The $4.85 price tag (tapioca balls, chia seeds, aloe etc are extra) wasn't bad considering you get a glass container whereas in another Boba place that shall remain nameless will tack on $12 if you want their glass mason jar. 

The ice milk with caramel was pretty good (again, not too sweet) and it came slushed.  They had a Nutella one that I was thinking of getting but I initially thought it might be overly sweet so I went with the ice milk. 

Not sure I'll be lugging around the glass container to get the 10% off but good to know they encourage recycling of containers.

excerpts: She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea
and I remember enjoying it.
I wouldn't bother with the food.
I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever.
ice milk.author: Lincy H.
ice milk.review:
I really wanted to like this place because of their hipster glass jars.

I came here twice. The first time was decent. The girl who helped me was sweet. She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea and I remember enjoying it. I wouldn't bother with the food. I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever. I only got it cause I was hungry, but I could have definitely done without it.

Second time, I got the sea salt creama oolong tea. I'm usually easily satisfied with most boba drinks. I always finish my drinks... but I couldn't even bring myself to finish half of it. It just tasted blech. My boyfriend got an upset stomach from his drink and was not feeling so great for the rest of the night. Not only that, all of my friends and I agreed that we felt extremely parched after drinking their tea. Service was whatever. The guys who work there could maybe smile once in awhile.

Both times, I did not get a glass jar because they ran out. Also, what happened to the discounted price when you don't get a glass jar? $5 for a crappy drink and whatever service?

I don't think I'll be back.

excerpts: I ordered the ice milk with caramel and my boyfriend got the milk tea flavor.
Both were chilled to a perfection.
The ice milk was sweet but overly frothy.
The milk tea was simple - very classic.
Their boba was chewy, no complaints there.
The drinks weren't astonishingly amazing, but who knows?
It felt like I paid $5 for three gulps...
ice milk.author: Celestine A.
ice milk.review:
Confirmed: the hype is more because of the glass bottles than the actual boba.

I ordered the ice milk with caramel and my boyfriend got the milk tea flavor. Both were chilled to a perfection. The ice milk was sweet but overly frothy. The milk tea was simple - very classic. Their boba was chewy, no complaints there. The drinks weren't astonishingly amazing, but who knows? It felt like I paid $5 for three gulps... Even with the Yelp check-in discount, two drinks brought the bill above $10. 

There's a few tables and seats downstairs but it looks like upstairs is for those hoping to either study or lounge around. The place is very cutesy from the decor to the glass bottles to how "cute" that they think this size isn't a rip-off.

excerpts: I've been here a few times and always get an Ice Milk Brown Sugar with boba.
Some say that it's really sweet, but I think it's just the right amount of sweetness because the ice waters it down anyway.
ice milk.author: Fallon P.
ice milk.review:
I've been here a few times and always get an Ice Milk Brown Sugar with boba. Some say that it's really sweet, but I think it's just the right amount of sweetness because the ice waters it down anyway. I mean it's obviously one of their popular drinks for a reason...

I would suggest stopping by before the lunch crowd. Otherwise, the line is out the door. It does move fairly quickly, but can take a few minutes to get your drink. 

The glass bottle is cute and you can bring it back to re-use for a 10% discount. But, sometimes they don't always have the bottles. Sure, $5 for boba seems steep, but I  like the quality of their drinks. However, their texture of honey boba can be hit or miss.

excerpts: My favorite drink is the Carmel ice milk.
I always grab 2 cause one is not enough.
Real MVP is my boy Han for showing me this place thanks bruh.
Over all good place closed at 11pm but not on the dot.
#PAYPABOY
ice milk.author: Donald A.
ice milk.review: Real cool spot drinks gets made pretty fast. The used to have a little snack section but it's gone now. I was really wanting something to snack on too. My favorite drink is the Carmel ice milk. I always grab 2 cause one is not enough. Real MVP is my boy Han for showing me this place thanks bruh. Over all good place closed at 11pm but not on the dot. #PAYPABOY

excerpts:
I ordered the Ice Milk Drink with pudding and boba and it was bomb.com 

Pros: 
- Honey boba definitely taste like honey
- Good price (for serving them in mason jars)! 
- Nice interior design 
- Nice staffs 

Cons:
- Limited seats because the venue is kind of small
ice milk.author: Steven C.
ice milk.review:
This is my first time and I have to say I'm very impressed! Im from SoCal and I'm very picky when it comes to trying a new boba place, but this place is so good! I ordered the Ice Milk Drink with pudding and boba and it was bomb.com 

Pros: 
- Honey boba definitely taste like honey
- Good price (for serving them in mason jars)! 
- Nice interior design 
- Nice staffs 

Cons:
- Limited seats because the venue is kind of small 
- Nothing else cos this place is amaaaaazing!

excerpts: I got the ICE MILK drink and it was amazing.
If you like balanced sweet and roasty, this is an excellent choice for beginner.
ice milk.author: Tee K.
ice milk.review:
I don't understand why this place isn't a 5 star.
People are complaining about parking spots but that's not their fault and it's SF what do you expect.
Price is really fair compared to SF boba pricings like Boba Guys.
I got the ICE MILK drink and it was amazing. If you like balanced sweet and roasty, this is an excellent choice for beginner.

excerpts:
Some faaaaves:
- Strawberry black fresh fruit tea
- Brown sugar ice milk (may be too sweet for some people!)
ice milk.author: Robinne D.
ice milk.review:
I always gotta stop by here whenever I'm in the Financial District. And oh yeah, bring your bottle back for a 10% off discount! (But I don't because I'm a glass bottle hoarder, hehehe.) Call ahead of time to ask if they still have glass bottles in stock for the day because sometimes they run out during their rushes. 

I don't know any other place in the Bay Area besides Plentea that gives out boba in a glass bottle that you can actually take home. Drinks taste great, and the glass bottles add a great presentation to it. For about $5 per drink, I'm always satisfied with my boba from Plentea. 

Some faaaaves:
- Strawberry black fresh fruit tea
- Brown sugar ice milk (may be too sweet for some people!)
- Oolong milk tea

excerpts: * ICE MILK (BROWN SUGAR)
3 STARS:
I expected the ice milk to be akin to PK or HH
but really it left me wanting more.
ice milk.author: Jess C.
ice milk.review:
I've read practically all of the reviews at Plentea, so trust me, I knew I was in for an expensive milk tea before I arrived. I had also been warned about the unfriendly cashier who practically was rolling her eyes at me the entire time while I asked her questions.

* BLACK TEA CREMA WITH PUDDING (~$5.50) - 4 STARS:
Tea crema was rich and thick and reminded me of Purple Kow and Half and Half. Just a few hours earlier I had One Plus Tea House's version which made it clear how Plentea's quality was far above the many copy cats out there. The tapioca was perfectly cooked and the egg pudding was standard but good. The tea is good, not quite as strong and bitter as boba guys. I asked for 50% sweet and it was the perfect sweetness. 

* ICE MILK (BROWN SUGAR) (~$5.50) - 3 STARS:
I expected the ice milk to be akin to PK or HH but really it left me wanting more. It's not as rich and creamy, and way too sweet (make sure to ask for it 25-50% sweet).

* PEACH FRUIT TEA ($4.95) - 3 STARS:
Their fruit teas are merely a black tea with a fruit syrup mixed with fresh cut fruit. The peach tea was way too sweet for my liking.

I enjoyed my black tea crema and the perfectly cooked tapioca balls. Despite the price, I could see myself coming back if I needed an emergency boba mid work day. Perhaps if there was no line, or perhaps if the cashier didn't have her eyes permanently rolling around, this might be a 4-STAR establishment.

Note: no hot drinks. All tea is caffeinated. A few decaf options - fruit drinks and lemonade.

excerpts: Anyway, a group of us ordered a variety of drinks that ranged from regular milk tea, ice milk, fruit tea, and green milk tea.
The ice milk with pudding was also spectacular.
ice milk.author: Nina H.
ice milk.review:
I'm so glad I discovered this place on Instagram! I don't even know what hashtag I was searching, but I somehow stumbled onto some food blogger's Instagram account and bookmarked this spot immediately because I really wanted the bottle.

I really love the concept of the bottle to take home because it's "green" and it's a pretty novel concept for the bubble tea world. If only they would start one in Seattle too...

Anyway, a group of us ordered a variety of drinks that ranged from regular milk tea, ice milk, fruit tea, and green milk tea. They made for really cute photos.

I tried all of them and they were really tasty, especially the fruit tea with strawberry. The ice milk with pudding was also spectacular. I probably should've asked for more sugar in mine but I opted for 50% sugar, so it wasn't as sweet, but probably healthier.

The honey boba was the BEST part!!! And also the unhealthiest, but whatever, I was on vacation. The food also looked amazing, like the savory and sweet waffles. Seems like a cute spot for breakfast or brunch too. Prices are little big higher than your usual boba joint, but hey, they are sustainable, and I'm willing to pay a bit more to take home the bottle.

The interior was cozy and modern; very chic.

They are still working out their kinks so there might be a line... but then again, aren't there lines everywhere you go in SF?

excerpts: Went in and ordered an ice milk green tea with an addition of honey tapioca.
Total came out to $5.44, which is pricey, but the tea quality does taste better.
ice milk.author: Kristi T.
ice milk.review:
Quite cool that their drinks come in glass bottles; the bottles even have their name on them! They start putting the drinks in plastic cups after they run out of bottles, which seems to be the first 200 or 300. If you opt for the cups rather than the bottles, you'll receive 20% off your drink. Also, bring back your bottle next time for a discount!

Went in and ordered an ice milk green tea with an addition of honey tapioca. Total came out to $5.44, which is pricey, but the tea quality does taste better. If you usually like your drink sweeter, this may not be the one for you.

Second time around, I ordered the peach green tea. They had fruit chunks but the entire drink just tasted bland, watered down, and artificial. Still pricey at $5.38!

I really wish I liked this place more as the decor and desserts seem so cute. The bottle is a nice touch though!

excerpts: I ordered the brown sugar ice milk with egg pudding ($4.95) and it was amazing!
ice milk.author: Karen L.
ice milk.review:
I ordered the brown sugar ice milk with egg pudding ($4.95) and it was amazing! The glass bottle is cute and I can't wait to return with it to get a discount on my drink. 

Drinks range from $4.50 to $6.50 and they have an extensive menu of sandwich and dessert waffles as well as a salad. If you don't want to eat here though, there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance like Ramen Underground and Sushirrito.

excerpts: I had the pleasure of trying the sea salt oolong tea, peach green tea, mango yogurt tea, honeydew fruit milk, and brown sugar ice milk.
My favorite is the brown sugar ice milk, hands down.
It's not overly sweet
and I like the consistency (between watery and just a little icy).
The peach green tea was a tad on the sweet side.
My bf enjoyed the mango yogurt a lot, but was disappointed in how sweet his honeydew milk was.
The sea salt for the oolong is much saltier than I've had at other places.
Make sure you mix that sucker up good.
ice milk.author: Christine L.
ice milk.review:
They're pretty smart. The main reason I went here, and I think others would also agree, is that they serve their drinks in adorable glass milk jugs. Who could resist? It's not for the service, that's for sure. They're not rude or anything, just not friendly either. Usually, I feel the employees would ask if I had questions or made suggestions. This wasn't the case. 

Now onto the drinks. I had the pleasure of trying the sea salt oolong tea, peach green tea, mango yogurt tea, honeydew fruit milk, and brown sugar ice milk. My favorite is the brown sugar ice milk, hands down. It's not overly sweet and I like the consistency (between watery and just a little icy). The peach green tea was a tad on the sweet side. My bf enjoyed the mango yogurt a lot, but was disappointed in how sweet his honeydew milk was. The sea salt for the oolong is much saltier than I've had at other places. Make sure you mix that sucker up good.

excerpts: Ice milk extra caramel is my regular and I usually buy a fruit tea as seconds since I live so far away.
Their peach black tea is excellent.
ice milk.author: Rick R.
ice milk.review:
Only bad thing I've experienced is its only in SF...
Their drinks are nicely balanced, not too sweet. Ice milk extra caramel is my regular and I usually buy a fruit tea as seconds since I live so far away. Their peach black tea is excellent.

excerpts: I ordered the brown sugar ice milk tea with pearls and egg pudding.
ice milk.author: Steffi G.
ice milk.review:
Plentea over Boba Guys any day!!!

I ordered the brown sugar ice milk tea with pearls and egg pudding. It's just as amazing as Cafe Lattea down in Cupertino. 

The glass jars intrigued me, as well as how well presented the drinks were displayed on social media. I was not disappointed. It's a bit pricey, but who cares?! It's a good drink! 

The ambiance is very hipster and modern. Small, cozy interior. Fast service. The staff gave really good recommendations. Usually, I've heard there is a line that goes out the door, but luckily, we were in and out right away.

Tip: if you bring the glass bottles that you purchased, you get a discount on your future visits.

excerpts: I always get the ice milk with caramel
and it's amazing!
It's perfect for us people that can't drink tea.
I love it when the drink is cold yet the pearls are hot.
Yummy!
My husband loves their milk teas.
The tea is so fresh
you'll keep coming back.
ice milk.author: Rachel P.
ice milk.review:
We always come here when we're in the city. I always get the ice milk with caramel and it's amazing! It's perfect for us people that can't drink tea. I love it when the drink is cold yet the pearls are hot. Yummy! My husband loves their milk teas. The tea is so fresh you'll keep coming back. I just wish they had bigger sizes.

You'll also be suprised how good their takoyaki balls are. Try it and you won't regret it. 

This is definitely a good place to go to after a day/night out in the city.

excerpts: We tried the taro ice milk which is tasted good.
ice milk.author: Gary C.
ice milk.review: Honestly, the tea is so-so, it's not impressive. The gimmick here is that they let you take their glass bottle to-go! We tried the taro ice milk which is tasted good. My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting. Worth a try, but probably won't return.

excerpts: My favorites have been their avocado milk smoothie (loveee these), strawberry green tea fruit tea (real fruit chunks in it!), and ice milk with caramel and brown sugar (which is technically a rip off cause you're literally getting iced milk with some caramel
but it's so delicious!).
I'm actually not a big boba fan so can't offer any input on that
but I always get lychee jelly in my drinks and this place is up to par.
The glass bottles come with a plastic cap so you can seal your drink when you're done with it.
They're also very big head-turners.
ice milk.author: Tiffany S.
ice milk.review:
My go-to boba/tea place in FiDi! I love all their drinks and the glass bottles you get to take home with you are such a nice perk. My favorites have been their avocado milk smoothie (loveee these), strawberry green tea fruit tea (real fruit chunks in it!), and ice milk with caramel and brown sugar (which is technically a rip off cause you're literally getting iced milk with some caramel but it's so delicious!). I'm actually not a big boba fan so can't offer any input on that but I always get lychee jelly in my drinks and this place is up to par. The glass bottles come with a plastic cap so you can seal your drink when you're done with it. They're also very big head-turners. I always get people asking me where I got my drink if I'm walking around FiDi with it. 

They do have some cons though. They have a minimum $10 credit card charge so sometimes I have to buy 2 drinks so I can use my card when I don't have cash (which I guess isn't entirely a bad thing cause I get an excuse to overindulge). Their drinks are also kinda pricey compared to other boba places (albeit you are partially paying for the glass bottle). The glass bottles are cute but you have to carry around the bottle with you the rest of the day. 

Overall a very yummy boba/tea place in FiDi and I'd highly recommend if only for the cute basic glass bottles. 

Tip: 10% off if you remember to bring the glass bottle back next time! (But who has that kind of foresight)

excerpts: I've have the Ice Milk with caramel and the brown sugar, but the caramel is better.
ice milk.author: Eric E.
ice milk.review:
This is a good place to bring a date or to hand out with friends. 

ENVIRONMENT
The downstairs space is limited but there is an upstairs as well. Don't expect it to be quiet..think Starbucks.

SERVICE
It's a little slow. You can wait in line for up to 30 minutes; especially on Saturdays. It's good, but they really need to start taking orders from people standing in line starting at the front door. They use an iPad for payment so it would really be easy.

COST
It's a bit pricey, but you get to keep the beaker. They do offer a 10% discount if you bring your own beaker back, but who carries a glass container around with them. 

QUALITY
I will that it's good and they take the time to get it right. I've have the Ice Milk with caramel and the brown sugar, but the caramel is better. The iced coffee is just ok, but the standark milk tea with boba is good. 

FOOD
I haven't eaten there since they do not offer anything Gluten free.

excerpts: I love going here for the ice milk with caramel!
The Matcha wasn't that great
but it was okay.
The fruit slushes are pretty delicious!
It's a bit of a walk from downtown market (Powell St.)
but it's worth it.
Be sure to bring your jar back to get a discount on your drinks!
The seating upstairs isn't spectacular or spacious, but it's better than crowding up the bottom seats by the door.
ice milk.author: Sabrina H.
ice milk.review: I love going here for the ice milk with caramel! The Matcha wasn't that great but it was okay. The fruit slushes are pretty delicious! It's a bit of a walk from downtown market (Powell St.) but it's worth it. Be sure to bring your jar back to get a discount on your drinks! The seating upstairs isn't spectacular or spacious, but it's better than crowding up the bottom seats by the door.

excerpts: Ice milk with Caramel and boba - quite bland ..
ice milk.author: Trinity N.
ice milk.review:
**REVIEW FOR DRINKS AND SERVICE ONLY. 

Ice milk with Caramel and boba - quite bland .. Nothing special 

Peach green tea with lychee - fresh fruits bits are in the drink which is awesome. Aside from that it's really basic , normal , nothing special. 

Glass bottles are cool !! 

It was about $10 for both drinks including the Yelp! 15% off for checking in. The service is kind of slow. They seem to be low on supply and had to refill a few things while I was there and there was a line sooooo heads up its gonna take a while.

excerpts: So the next time that I went, i got the the Caramel Ice Milk with grass jelly.
It kinda reminded me of Half&Half ice milk drink.
It wasn't crazy sweet like the ice milk in Tea Society nor was it bland.
ice milk.author: Amy V.
ice milk.review:
Been meaning to try Plentea for awhile now, but I tend to forget that it's there. So i finally decided to give it a try on Thursday with my boyfriend and I've been back 3 days straight now! I really like the bottle but at the same time I don't because it jack the price of the drink up so much.

I've had the Thai Tea with boba and it was good, but not my favorite. My boyfriend got the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and that was really good. You could still taste the matcha and it wasn't overly creamy or sweet either. I don't know if it's the days that i went that the boba was hard? So the next time that I went, i got the the Caramel Ice Milk with grass jelly. It kinda reminded me of Half&Half ice milk drink. It wasn't crazy sweet like the ice milk in Tea Society nor was it bland. It was sweet enough for me to finish the whole bottle and not feel sick after. 

Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc). I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening. There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.

excerpts: I get the Caramel Ice Milk EVERY SINGLE TIME.
IT IS AMAZING.
Personally I love drinks that have great smooth texture and temperature along with the right amount of sweetness, and this always hits the spot.
ice milk.author: Vincent Y.
ice milk.review: I get the Caramel Ice Milk EVERY SINGLE TIME. IT IS AMAZING. Personally I love drinks that have great smooth texture and temperature along with the right amount of sweetness, and this always hits the spot.

excerpts: I got the oolong ice milk tea.
It comes in a glass bottle with the logo on it - very cool "green" way to serve up a beverage.
Unfortunately the tapioca was a little overdone, making the very outside of the boba too soft and the inside overly chewy.
The tea itself was ok but was exceptionally sweet.
Since the sign near the register said to tell them about any drink that isn't perfect, thankfully my friend took the bottle out of my hand and told them it was too sweet
(I was thankful that she was so bold).
ice milk.author: Thomas C.
ice milk.review:
Summary:  Trendy tapioca tea place in SF that is more about quantity than quality

Tea:  I got the oolong ice milk tea.  It comes in a glass bottle with the logo on it - very cool "green" way to serve up a beverage.  Unfortunately the tapioca was a little overdone, making the very outside of the boba too soft and the inside overly chewy.  The tea itself was ok but was exceptionally sweet.  Since the sign near the register said to tell them about any drink that isn't perfect, thankfully my friend took the bottle out of my hand and told them it was too sweet (I was thankful that she was so bold).  It came back with more tea in it and much better.

Shop: Cool shop with places to sit.  Clean and trendy, steps above the old boba tea shops from a decade ago.  Nothing incredibly special about it though.

Overall:  With just 3 visits to Plentea and Boba Guys, I have to say Boba Guys has this place beat.  The boba wasn't cooked well and the tea itself was just ok.  Go Boba Guys for quality.  Go Plentea for quantity and to support their green efforts.

excerpts: Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50)

Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95)

Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95)

Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50)

Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca
One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet.
The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers.
The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus.
ice milk.author: Kitty K.
ice milk.review:
This shop isn't located in Chinatown like I had thought since on Yelp's address it did say it was in Chinatown. It's way closer to the FiDi but still within walking distance of Chinatown (~8-10min). There's only street parking and parking's hit and miss (depends on when you go). There are a few stools and tables down stairs, but they have a cute little loft upstairs as well with a couple cushioned seats and more tables. No public bathroom.

I have been wanting to come here for ages because I love the jars that they serve the drinks in! I came here with a group of friends right after dinner in North Beach, so we walked over around 9PM on a Sat. I was surprised it wasn't packed or that there wasn't a line. I definitely wasn't going to complain!

Drink Menu:
Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Tea: ($4.95) Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95) Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95) Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50) Honey Tapioca, Egg Pudding, Taro Pudding, Coffee Pudding, Aloe, Grass Jelly)

Waffle Sandwiches Menu: ($8.95) Add 2 Slices of Applewood Smoked Bacon +$1
Morning Waffle: Only served before 10AM. Bacon, Egg, Spring Mix, Swiss Cheese
Turkey Club: Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Tomato, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Hot Pastrami: Pastrami, Swiss cheese, Avocado, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Smoked Salmon: Blue Cold Smoked Salmon, Herb Cream Cheese, Cucumber & Chives

Salad Menu: ($8.95) served with Spring Mix, Avocado, Tomato, Pecan
Meat: Turkey / Pastrami / Smoked Salmon
Dressing: Ginger / Mustard Soy Sauce / Yuzu Citrus

*All vegetables are organic

Dessert Menu:
Strawberry Belgian Waffle: Whip Cream, Fresh Strawberries, Jam, Almond Slices & Chocolate Syrup
Banana Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream, Banana, Nutella, Almond Slices, & Chocolate Syrup
Marshmallow Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream Topped w/ Toasted Marshmallow & Chocolate Syrup
New York-style Cheesecake
Tiramisu
Add Vanilla or Green Tea Ice Cream: +$1

Our Order:
Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding 
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca

I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong. So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink. The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt. The egg pudding had a good consistency as well. One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers. The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks. One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet. The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers. The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus. Fairly pricey but so yummy!

Note: If you don't want your drink in the glass bottles, you get a 10% discount off the drink prices and get your drinks in a plastic cup instead. You also get the same discount if you bring the bottle back

excerpts: Ordered: ice milk w/ egg pudding (there's taro pudding also)
ice milk.author: Julian T.
ice milk.review:
Came here for the bottles left with a plastic cup =[ .

The cool thing about this place are the hours and glass bottles! One of few boba places that are open later. Honestly I have too much of their glass bottles but it always slip my mind to bring them back for the discount. Overall the drinks are good nothing spectacular would taste better in a glass bottle tho! 

Ordered: ice milk w/ egg pudding (there's taro pudding also)

excerpts: That's why it's called FLAVORED ICE MILK!!!
Oolong Tea with Strawberries/Green Tea with Peaches- not too bitter and too light.
You can taste the tea on top of that they use fresh fruits always a plus!
Strawberry Milk- reminds me of Momo Milk bar beverage.
Milk steeped with bright fruit flavor.
ice milk.author: Hedilyn G.
ice milk.review:
First of all let me just call out you "yelp snobs" for having super high expectations from a place that has only been open for less than a freakin' week!!! Really?! 
 
*No bathroom... (not all places in the financial district or downtown area have one, get over it! Go to Starbucks!) 

*Limited options or adjustments to the menu...( they've only been open 5 days!!! The people who work there are only getting acquainted with the amount of items they have on the menu. It takes a few times to get it down. How do I know? Because I'm a chef! Repetition is the key, not to mention the owner is still trying to get feedback about his products. I spoke to him tonight, i told him the smoked salmon waffle was good but the salmon was a little too salty since the slices are big.) 

*Steep pricing... $6.50 for a pint (2 cups exactly, yeah I weighed the shit out with a measuring cup) of milk tea is not bad when you're smack dab in the middle of downtown. The bottle costs $4 retail by itself, which means the cost of your tea is about $2.50 including tax besides that it's all about the location. You want something cheap go to China town or the Sunset.
