I usually don't like reading comments nor ratings because a lot of you guys are so subjective. It's annoying as hell! But anyhow I'm giving this place 5 stars. Great location and good hours (finally good boba around downtown and open till 12am), flavors are spot on and well balanced (I've had 4), lovely interior and straight forward menu (better because it doesn't confuse the consumer plus too many options gets overwhelming e.g t pumps/teaway), Waffle options are fun and the waffle itself was perfect in texture and sweetness (Had smoke salmon, it was nice the owner wanted to give you more  but it gets to salty because of thickness. He took note of it and graciously thank me for telling him what my thoughts were). STAFF was very warm and friendly. Hope I gave the owner some justice. It's a cool concept no doubt! My pastry team's guilty pleasure.... 

Flavors I've had:
Brown Sugar- taste like maple... Perfect amount of sweetness for using brown sugar. For that person who was complaining about how it taste like sugar milk, guess what it is! That's why it's called FLAVORED ICE MILK!!!
Oolong Tea with Strawberries/Green Tea with Peaches- not too bitter and too light. You can taste the tea on top of that they use fresh fruits always a plus! 
Strawberry Milk- reminds me of Momo Milk bar beverage. Milk steeped with bright fruit flavor.

excerpts: I ordered the ice milk with green tea and egg pudding for close to $6.
ice milk.author: Heejin L.
ice milk.review:
There always seems to be a line whenever I drive by it so I decided to try going close to opening time.

There was only one person in line in front of me but like 10 people waiting for drinks.  It took about 12 mins to get my drink.

The glass bottle is cute. They only give 300 bottles out a day.  If you want to just get a plastic cup, they give you a discount.

I ordered the ice milk with green tea and egg pudding for close to $6.
The taste was ordinary and the egg pudding had no flavor.

Parking is tough.

excerpts: The ice milk was too sweet for my taste, but pretty good.
ice milk.author: Joanna Q.
ice milk.review:
I tried mango oolong tea with tapioca. It was super refreshing, and had a really strong tea flavor, which I really appreciate. I could've gone without the boba, it was nothing too special, and the tea was more refreahing by itself. It was quite expensive though, my drink came out to be about $6 (with the glass jar). 

My friends' drinks were pretty good too. The ice milk was too sweet for my taste, but pretty good. The mango fruit milk was surprisingly really refreshing as well, and the mango green tea was just as good as my drink. 

Not sure if I would come back because of the price, but I guess if you're in the area and in the mood for boba...

excerpts: Surprisingly, Plentea has one of the best Ice milk drinkI've ever had.
I ordered it w/ brown sugar and egg pudding.
LOVE it!!!
ice milk.author: Miss G.
ice milk.review:
Surprisingly, Plentea has one of the best Ice milk drinkI've ever had. I ordered it w/ brown sugar and egg pudding. LOVE it!!! The sweetness of the milk drink is complimenting the no-so-sweet egg pudding which I think is the great combination.

They don't have that many variety of drinks but they also serve sandwich and waffles. The place is not too big but they have seating upstairs and some downstairs. It can be really crowded during lunch break so prepare your trip accordingly. 

I have tried their milk tea w/ black tea and tapioca, I don't think it's their specialty so it's just okay! it tasted the same as regular instant milk tea that you can get from asian grocery store, not too special from what i've experienced. Not to mention that the tapioca is kinda hard to chew and a little bit tasteless compared to purple kow boba.

Definitely will come baackk! especially because they serve it it glass bottle so we can always reuse it and they give 10% whenever you come back. good marketing!

excerpts: My friends got the ice milk drink, one with brown sugar and the other with caramel.
The brown sugar was really sweet but tasted pretty good, while the caramel tasted as though they had melted down caramel candies into the drink.
ice milk.author: KC W.
ice milk.review:
For the price you pay, the drinks here are really not worth it. The cheapest drink is $4.25, and that's before you add boba or other toppings for .50! That's probably the most expensive boba I've ever had, especially considering how small the cup is. 

In terms of taste, it's not too bad. I had a sea salt crema oolong tea, which wasn't too sweet, and the saltiness complimented it nicely, but there wasn't a whole lot of tea flavor. My friends got the ice milk drink, one with brown sugar and the other with caramel. The brown sugar was really sweet but tasted pretty good, while the caramel tasted as though they had melted down caramel candies into the drink. Probably not a drink I would order again. 

They also ran out of their famous glass bottles (it was around 230pm when I went) so if you want a bottle you have to go in the morning or in the evening when they restock. I'd come back if I was downtown and craving boba but you're better off going to the Richmond or sunset.

excerpts: Got their brown sugar ice milk drink with tapioca - thought it was pretty good!
Love the cute glasses they come in and come back with it for 10% off, but I would personally just keep it.
On average about $5 for the drink with boba and the glass - which isn't a bad deal.
ice milk.author: Jennifer Y.
ice milk.review:
Got their brown sugar ice milk drink with tapioca - thought it was pretty good! Love the cute glasses they come in and come back with it for 10% off, but I would personally just keep it. On average about $5 for the drink with boba and the glass - which isn't a bad deal. Worth it in my opinion.

Only cons are it's all the way near Chinatown but if you're there at least you can get lunch nearby, but of course not great parking anywhere so would have to take public transportation there.

excerpts: I love the caramel ice milk with egg pudding.
It's like salted caramel ice cream without the salt
ice milk.author: Grace H.
ice milk.review:
This place blew my mind!

I love the caramel ice milk with egg pudding. It's like salted caramel ice cream without the salt and it's not as heavy!

The jasmine milk tea is great if you ask for it less sweet. 

The fruit teas are a bit too perfumey for me.

excerpts: Got the Thai ice milk tea w/aloe; even after about 30 mins., when the ice melted, the flavor didn't dilute and still had that Thai tea flavor (like a Thai tea should taste); I also like how my drink stayed cold after making a pit stop to grab a quick lunch before I headed back to MUNI.
Will be back, but it won't be a constant thing.
ice milk.author: Jessica S.
ice milk.review:
I gave it 4 stars because Plentea is located in an area for people who are already in the financial district, downtown/union square, and/or Chinatown; plus, to make the trip across town, just to grab tapis, is not worth it.  Since I didn't have to work, I decided to ride MUNI to check out the hype.  Considering the area/district, and that this is hand made milk tea in a reusable glass bottle (which is the only tapioca place, so far, that does this), I'd say prices are somewhat reasonable.  Perfect location as it is in the middle of a block of restaurants, and people can grab drinks back to their workplaces.

Came here just in time, right at the beginning of the lunch rush, so I waited about 5 - 8 minutes for my order.  Got the Thai ice milk tea w/aloe; even after about 30 mins., when the ice melted, the flavor didn't dilute and still had that Thai tea flavor (like a Thai tea should taste); I also like how my drink stayed cold after making a pit stop to grab a quick lunch before I headed back to MUNI.  Will be back, but it won't be a constant thing.

excerpts: The smoothie drinks are good and my friends like the brown sugar ice milk.
Personally my favorite would be the sea salt crema drinks.
If you're a fan of gong cha, you will like it here.
The cream on top is super thick unlike other places!
The strawberry fruit tea with strawberry bits was not good, despite what many reviews have said...we didn't bother drinking anymore after we tried it.
And my friend is usually obsessed with anything and everything strawberry!
We also got the honeydew oolong tea with grass jelly.
It was so sweet that it tasted syrupy.
The honey lemon black tea with boba was so strong.
It was good
but I think next time I would ask for it with green tea instead so it can have a lighter taste, but I would probably give it another try.
I'm looking forward to coming back for my sea salt crema!
ice milk.author: Maleah M.
ice milk.review: I wish there was a plentea closer to San jose! I went on a Saturday night around 7pm and the place was empty aside from the one girl in front of us. It's clean, has a cool environment, and has an upstairs area to hangout which is really great. The hype for these glass bottle (which you get to keep) drinks is real. Sort of. Well I guess it depends on what you get. The smoothie drinks are good and my friends like the brown sugar ice milk. Personally my favorite would be the sea salt crema drinks. If you're a fan of gong cha, you will like it here. The cream on top is super thick unlike other places! The strawberry fruit tea with strawberry bits was not good, despite what many reviews have said...we didn't bother drinking anymore after we tried it. And my friend is usually obsessed with anything and everything strawberry! We also got the honeydew oolong tea with grass jelly. It was so sweet that it tasted syrupy. The honey lemon black tea with boba was so strong. It was good but I think next time I would ask for it with green tea instead so it can have a lighter taste, but I would probably give it another try. I'm looking forward to coming back for my sea salt crema!

excerpts: My favorites are the mango black milk tea, the mango ice milk, the mango smoothie...
ice milk.author: Arianna N.
ice milk.review:
Okay, I'll admit, I'm a sucker for a cute bottle-- and don't even get me started on boba. So when I was strolling down the streets of the FiDi, I did a double take when I saw a group of strangers pass by sipping bubble tea in those adorable glass containers. Luckily they were kind enough to point me to Plentea, otherwise I would never have found my go-to FiDi spot for my (constant) boba cravings. 

The taste is pretty consistent-- not too sweet nor watery, and they use fresh fruit instead of the artificial-tasting powder that most other boba joints use. My favorites are the mango black milk tea, the mango ice milk, the mango smoothie... okay, pretty much anything and everything with mangoes. 

There's always a long line out the door, but don't worry as the service is pretty quick. Sadly, it's pretty pricey for boba (around $5)  and there's a $10 minimum card charge, hence the 4 star rating. Still, you get a 10% discount if you bring back your bottle which is kinda nice.

Long story short, I'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area. As for me, I see plen(tea) of Plentea in my future. :)

excerpts: I got a peach yogurt drink the first time and an ice milk drink the second time.
The brown sugar ice milk drink was better than the yogurt, but even then, it was just okay.
Their boba is okay, not too sweet and a little bland.
I just left underwhelmed.
I think it's because I waited too long both to order and for my drink.
ice milk.author: Ariana V.
ice milk.review:
I wanted to love this place but I don't. The stuff they serve you is pretty basic... in a glass bottle. I went twice and got the plastic cup the second time... which spilled the top portion of my drink when I poked in the straw.

It took 15-20 minutes for our drinks to come out both times.  There's a wait/line because they work super slow and the store is not huge. 

The drinks are really mediocre. I got a peach yogurt drink the first time and an ice milk drink the second time. The brown sugar ice milk drink was better than the yogurt, but even then, it was just okay. Their boba is okay, not too sweet and a little bland. I just left underwhelmed. I think it's because I waited too long both to order and for my drink.

excerpts: Love ice milk boba with brown sugar!!
Felt like I'm back to my home town.
ice milk.author: 心怡
ice milk.review: Great tea!! Love ice milk boba with brown sugar!! Felt like I'm back to my home town.

excerpts: We tried the avocado with egg pudding and the Carmel ice milk with tapioca - both were good but the Carmel was dealt great.
ice milk.author: Calon L.
ice milk.review: One of the better milk tea/boba places I've tried. The ordering process is a little slow because your barista (bobista?) takes your order and makes your drink. The result is that the line tends to get a little long at busy times. The wait is worth it, however, because the teas, milks, and slushed are pretty great. They serve the teas in an old school glass milk bottle that you can return for a 10% discount or you can request it to go in a standard plastic cup. We tried the avocado with egg pudding and the Carmel ice milk with tapioca - both were good but the Carmel was dealt great.

excerpts:
4/5 Taro Ice Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50 % sweet 
Variety:
We got the Brown Sugar Ice Milk and the Taro Ice Milk.
While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it.
I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area
and it's worth a try.
P.S.
i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!
While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it.
I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area
and it's worth a try.
P.S.
i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!
ice milk.author: Christiana C.
ice milk.review:
Drink of Choice: 4/5 Taro Ice Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50 % sweet 
Variety: 4/5 
Ambience: 3.5/5 (cute and a few tables up and downstairs, but busy busy busy!) 

One of those places that you see on your instagram/fb feed and have to try just once.. at least for the picture. We got the Brown Sugar Ice Milk and the Taro Ice Milk. While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it. I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area and it's worth a try. 
 
P.S. i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!

excerpts: Ice milk tea was not good, something funky about the flavor
ice milk.author: Ryan L.
ice milk.review:
It's cool, but it's pricey for what it is. Wanted taro milk tea but they didn't have taro. Tried the sea salt crema oolong tea, it was good but the crema part doesn't really mix with the tea so you get curdles towards the bottom of the drink. Brown sugar milk with pudding tasted like sugar milk, we wanted caramel but they didn't have any caramel - just opened and there's no caramel or taro?? Okay. Mango oolong tea was good but they forgot to give us boba even though it was requested. Ice milk tea was not good, something funky about the flavor but I couldn't put my finger on it. 

Come here for the novelty of a cool glass that can second as a vase or something. Not worth the $5-6 for a drink, even for this area. Bring the glass back for 10% off your drink, that's equals a free topping - if they happen to remember to put it in.

excerpts: The regular black milk tea, almond milk tea, and taro ice milk are also great choices in my book.
ice milk.author: Sharon L.
ice milk.review:
The cool glass bottles are what draw me to this milk tea spot. It's cool to drink out of (though part of me is afraid that I'm going to drop it and glass is going to shatter everywhere, but that's besides the point) and nice to keep to reuse at home. You are paying a bit more than other drink places (I think because of the bottle and the location), but you do get a discount if you bring the bottle back during your next visit. 

The drinks aren't bad and they have a pretty good menu selection to choose from. I really like the Matcha Green Milk Tea with tapioca (sorry, I'm anti saying boba). The regular black milk tea, almond milk tea, and taro ice milk are also great choices in my book. You definitely taste the tea in their drinks and the tapioca is perfectly sweet and chewy. 

The only downside is that its location is out of the way for me with it being in the financial district. But it is a nice addition to the hustle and bustle work area and is great to grab on your lunch break. Just be aware, lines are almost always out the door in the afternoon.

excerpts: Over the last couple of weeks I had a plain milk tea with boba, a matcha slush, a lavender lemonade, and the brown sugar ice milk with taro pudding.
Everything was generally okay except for the matcha slush as it didn't really taste like anything but ice, and it was really difficult to drink out of a glass bottle.
Nothing really stood out to me in terms of taste - it is pretty much your run-of-the-mill tea, but dressed cuter.
ice milk.author: Robbin A.
ice milk.review:
Plentea! I finally got to go here and I didn't realize it was so close to my meeting spot after work. I finish up at 6pm, so I always get here right when they get their deliveries for their fancy glass bottles. I have never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes, though for my first two visits, using card was fine - note that there is now a $15 minimum to charge, so be aware of this before stopping by.

The tea itself is all right. Over the last couple of weeks I had a plain milk tea with boba, a matcha slush, a lavender lemonade, and the brown sugar ice milk with taro pudding. Everything was generally okay except for the matcha slush as it didn't really taste like anything but ice, and it was really difficult to drink out of a glass bottle. Nothing really stood out to me in terms of taste - it is pretty much your run-of-the-mill tea, but dressed cuter. This would be the ultimate gift to give to someone when you're running late or want to leave a good impression on someone's mind - few things are more special than giving someone boba in a capped glass bottle and a smile.

The service itself isn't all that spectacular, I admit. Much of the time they seem flustered or aren't particularly pleased about giving customers more information about a drink or how to order. I imagine that on a bad day, this is not what you want to deal with - if you want a better drink with the same lackluster service, skip the fancy bottle and head over to pretty much anywhere else in the Inner Richmond, Sunset, etc. This may be the outskirts of Chinatown, but it's basically like you're in FiDi, which I think really makes for a better picture of this place.

Overall, it's not bad. You get a discount for bringing the bottle back (which you will probably want, because even if you get two cups of tea/etc. beverage, it's probably not enough for that $15 minimum charge...considering that it's $5-6 a drink). I went there enough times to say that I wouldn't go back unless I am reeeeally craving some overpriced lemonade or something.

excerpts: I had the black milk tea with pudding and ice milk and two separate occasions.
Both were delicious.
The second time I came it was just past closing and they served me anyway.
ice milk.author: Christine D.
ice milk.review:
Their reusable bottles are so cute I wish I were a local so I could come back regularly with it and get the 10% discount. I had the black milk tea with pudding and ice milk and two separate occasions. Both were delicious. The second time I came it was just past closing and they served me anyway. I was very grateful.

It is kind of pricey and there will be a long line during peak hours but I like the drinks so I think its worth it.

excerpts: I've had the milk tea and ice milk with brown sugar, both are good along with all the other drinks shared with my friends.
You get to keep the glass bottle and cap - which is nice.
Don't forget to check in for a 25% discount!
ice milk.author: Kevin N.
ice milk.review: Already addicted to the milk tea here!  My friends and I like to come by and hangout upstairs.  The drinks are excellent.  I've had the milk tea and ice milk with brown sugar, both are good along with all the other drinks shared with my friends.  You get to keep the glass bottle and cap - which is nice.  Don't forget to check in for a 25% discount!

excerpts: I have tried ice milk, sea salt coffee, fruit tea.
The tapioca is made perfectly.
Only thing is the long wait, I'll get the drinks everyday if no wait required.
ice milk.author: Tiffany O.
ice milk.review: Great drink selections. I have tried ice milk, sea salt coffee, fruit tea. The tapioca is made perfectly.  Only thing is the long wait, I'll get the drinks everyday if no wait required.

excerpts: I usually get ice milk with brown sugar and egg pudding, which comes to around $5 - a little pricy, but tastes pretty good.
They also have wi-fi, which is nice.
ice milk.author: Jenny Z.
ice milk.review: This is one of my favorite boba places in the city. It can get pretty full with limited seating at peak hours, but service is usually quick. The glass bottles are really cute (10% off if you bring yours back to reuse!). I usually get ice milk with brown sugar and egg pudding, which comes to around $5 - a little pricy, but tastes pretty good. They also have wi-fi, which is nice.

excerpts: I ordered the Brown Sugar Ice Milk With Boba.
Nice and sweet.
The tapioca balls were purple though.
I'm spoiled because this place gives you these glass bottles, which you keep.
Now if I get bubble tea anywhere else I'll be expecting one.
The space had an upstairs and downstairs.
The downstairs area was crowded, but the upstairs appeared to have more space.
The tea was under $5.
However, I was wondering if a discount was applied if you brought your glass bottle back.
Seems like an earth friendly option.
Not sure if it's offered, so ask if you live in the area.
I'd visit again if I'm in San Francisco, but for now I'll be seeking Bubble Tea spots in my area.
The stuff is good!
ice milk.author: Natasha C.
ice milk.review: Bubble Tea! I've heard of it, but never experienced it until now! Ok, so it's tapioca balls added to the tea. The tea is a milk based tea. The tapioca balls are flavored. Plentea is a popular place. The place was packed. Though it seemed like a common occurrence because they prepared all orders quickly. I ordered the Brown Sugar Ice Milk With Boba. Nice and sweet. The tapioca balls were purple though. I'm spoiled because this place gives you these glass bottles, which you keep. Now if I get bubble tea anywhere else I'll be expecting one. The space had an upstairs and downstairs. The downstairs area was crowded, but the upstairs appeared to have more space. The tea was under $5. However, I was wondering if a discount was applied if you brought your glass bottle back. Seems like an earth friendly option. Not sure if it's offered, so ask if you live in the area. I'd visit again if I'm in San Francisco, but for now I'll be seeking Bubble Tea spots in my area. The stuff is good!

excerpts: the drink I got which was mango ice milk tea was ok
, It could be better.
The pearls isn't soft enough, but I'm coming back to try other drinks
And hopefully it is better.
ice milk.author: Leslie N.
ice milk.review: I dont get the hype of this place but it is a Super cute place! I love how they give our drinks in glass jars, super creative and usable ;) the drink I got which was mango ice milk tea was ok, It could be better. The pearls isn't soft enough, but I'm coming back to try other drinks And hopefully it is better.

excerpts: I also tried my friend's caramel ice milk and it was fantastic.
I will be visiting again soon.
ice milk.author: Xavier S.
ice milk.review: The oolong milk tea is very good. I also tried my friend's caramel ice milk and it was fantastic. I will be visiting again soon.

excerpts: Yes, they have brown sugar ice milk, which they blend up together - yummy!
Yes, I try and stop by whenever I'm in the area.
And yes, I leave empty bottles in my trunk so I can reuse them and get 10% off my order - after all, how many of those bottles do I really need.
And yes, drinks cost about $5
but no, that doesn't stop me!
ice milk.author: Rachelle T.
ice milk.review: Yes, the bottles are cute. Yes, they have egg pudding topping. Yes, they have great fresh fruit teas - mango is the best. Yes, they have brown sugar ice milk, which they blend up together - yummy! Yes, I try and stop by whenever I'm in the area. And yes, I leave empty bottles in my trunk so I can reuse them and get 10% off my order - after all, how many of those bottles do I really need. And yes, drinks cost about $5 but no, that doesn't stop me!

excerpts: I got one of their popular Ice Milk with Caramel and Boba.
Sadly it just tasted like sugary milk with over chewy boba.
ice milk.author: Andrew B.
ice milk.review:
My first time here and I had to check out what the hype was all about. That's what it is mainly... A hype. It's not the worse milk tea place I've had (that place is also in SF ), buts also not the best. I got one of their popular Ice Milk with Caramel and Boba. Sadly it just tasted like sugary milk with over chewy boba. 
I got an Oolong milk tea for my brother and that tasted better, but again, I've had better and I've had worse. 

It's worth another try. Plus the have desserts!

excerpts: I got the ice milk with pudding , caramel and grass jelly.

One of my cons is that when I got to the front of the line they notified me that I would have to pay 50 cents extra because they ran out of milk and would charge me for the soy milk ( but isn't that your bad?)
My other con was the grass jelly-
and I have had it at multiple locations-
tasted strange
but I was too in a hurry to take it back.
I think all in all , it was a fun place to try
but I don't see myself going there for my next boba fix.
ice milk.author: Desiree C.
ice milk.review: So I just had to try what everyone has been ranting and raving about on my instagram and facebook feed. For me this was a 'treat yo self' day but usually I try not to spend over $5 for boba but to try out this place, I caved in. I love the cutesy bottles- as everyone has mentioned before, you get 10% off if you bring it back- which I think is genius. I got the ice milk with pudding , caramel and grass jelly. One of my cons is that when I got to the front of the line they notified me that I would have to pay 50 cents extra because they ran out of milk and would charge me for the soy milk ( but isn't that your bad?) My other con was the grass jelly- and I have had it at multiple locations- tasted strange but I was too in a hurry to take it back. I think all in all , it was a fun place to try but I don't see myself going there for my next boba fix.

excerpts: There is a variety of menu on the board, i did not know which one i should get so i decided to try ice milk with caramel, which was the most popular drink there.
I added tapioca and egg pudding into my drink and i was impressed by the cute glass jar when i received my drink.
The tasted was really good and i really love the tapioca here.
That's the best tapioca in San Francisco.
Also, you can take the glass jar home, grab a cap ( next to the straws).
You can get 10% discount if you bring your bottle at the next tome you visit.
The price is not too high, almost $4 or $5 and add mote topping just 50 cents.
The service is also good and fast.
The only disadvantage at Plentea is that they don't have any restroom for customer.
By the way, Plentea is one of my favorite place i want to come after my class.
ice milk.author: Tran D.
ice milk.review: My friend introduced Plentea to me when i came to San Francisco last year. The line is usually long. I had to wait about 10 minutes to order a drink. There is a variety of menu on the board, i did not know which one i should get so i decided to try ice milk with caramel, which was the most popular drink there. I added tapioca and egg pudding into my drink and i was impressed by the cute glass jar when i received my drink. The tasted was really good and i really love the tapioca here. That's the best tapioca in San Francisco. Also, you can take the glass jar home, grab a cap ( next to the straws). You can get 10% discount if you bring your bottle at the next tome you visit. The price is not too high, almost $4 or $5 and add mote topping just 50 cents. The service is also good and fast. The only disadvantage at Plentea is that they don't have any restroom for customer. By the way, Plentea is one of my favorite place i want to come after my class.

excerpts: I got the brown sugar ice milk because they said it was one of their more popular drinks.

I wanted to adjust my sweetness to 50% but the cashier recommended getting it at regular because "it will defeat the purpose of getting the drink in the first place" and he said it's "not even that sweet anyway.
First taste?
pretty darn sweet to me!
There wasn't anything unique about the drink that would want me to order it again.
Prices are slightly more expensive especially since the drink doesn't come with tapioca.
ice milk.author: Wendy Z.
ice milk.review: The concept of serving milk tea in glass bottles already attracts many customers to come and try their boba. Unfortunately I was not wowed by their flavors and limited selection of drinks. I got the brown sugar ice milk because they said it was one of their more popular drinks. I wanted to adjust my sweetness to 50% but the cashier recommended getting it at regular because "it will defeat the purpose of getting the drink in the first place" and he said it's "not even that sweet anyway." First taste? pretty darn sweet to me! There wasn't anything unique about the drink that would want me to order it again. Prices are slightly more expensive especially since the drink doesn't come with tapioca. We ended up using the 25% off offer on Yelp which helped with the costs but probably would not place Plentea as one of my go to spots for milk tea. The reusable glass bottle though is an incentive where I can see many customers returning for, especially since you get 10% off each time you bring your bottle back.

excerpts: I tried the Ice Milk w Pudding and it was alright...kinda too sweet for me.
Nothing wowed me, except the glass bottles.
ice milk.author: Quyen L.
ice milk.review: I tried the Ice Milk w Pudding and it was alright...kinda too sweet for me. Nothing wowed me, except the glass bottles.

excerpts: Ordered caramel ice milk with egg custard and lychee jelly.
Beautiful presentation and delicious liquid dessert for me.
ice milk.author: Mrs P.
ice milk.review:
Arrived right at 11 a.m. when they opened and there was no line. Ordered caramel ice milk with egg custard and lychee jelly.  Beautiful presentation and delicious liquid dessert for me. My friend declared her black milk tea the best she's ever had!

I noticed fresh papaya and honeydew being cut behind the counter for a fruit drink. Hooray--they use the real stuff!

Definitely paying a premium for these drinks in a glass bottle, but the presentation is outstanding!

excerpts: Got the Ice Milk with boba (brown sugar).
Tasted like brown sugar.
I like my iced milk thicker, so this place wasn't as good to me.

Total: $5.38
for Ice Milk with Tapioca (Brown Sugar)
ice milk.author: Leila T.
ice milk.review:
Got the Ice Milk with boba (brown sugar). Tasted like brown sugar. I like my iced milk thicker, so this place wasn't as good to me. The boba balls were super chewy, but not enough sweetness in the boba balls. 

I would go to Purple Kow for my Iced Milk.

Total: $5.38
for Ice Milk with Tapioca (Brown Sugar)

excerpts: but the Ice Milk with Pudding was really good and saved this place.
I like that we got to keep the cool glass jars
ice milk.author: Andrew D.
ice milk.review: The Black Milk Tea was very watered down and bland but the Ice Milk with Pudding was really good and saved this place. I like that we got to keep the cool glass jars :)

excerpts: So I got the green tea ice milk tea with 75% sweetness.
ice milk.author: Sekhmet S.
ice milk.review:
After working at a place making milk tea from powders and sugar solution I've become very picky about my milk teas. Namely that they shouldn't taste like sugar and powder. This place definitely meets my expectations, real tea!

Reusable glass bottles is a great idea. I'll be brining mine back tomorrow for more and a lovely discount for bringing it back!

I asked if I could have it less sweet and apparently you can choose any percentage of sweetness! So I got the green tea ice milk tea with 75% sweetness. Very delicious!

I also got to try the Oolong sea salt crema tea, which was good too.

I'll definitely be back many times to try all the flavors... maybe add the honey tapioca next

excerpts: ICE MILK
WITH BROWN SUGAR
IS THE BOMB !
lines are long though, but you can get there on weekdays when there's no line.
ice milk.author: Florencia I.
ice milk.review: ICE MILK WITH BROWN SUGAR IS THE BOMB ! lines are long though, but you can get there on weekdays when there's no line.

excerpts: Also got the brown sugar ice milk tea with egg pudding.
ice milk.author: Anna L.
ice milk.review: This place is awesome. The baristas were so nice to us because they genuinely cared about our Boba needs. Got a green milk tea. It was really good, the best in the city.  Also got the brown sugar ice milk tea with egg pudding. I was looking for Brown sugar milk tea ever since I tried in in LA and this place was the first Boba place that taste similar. Love this place :D

excerpts: I ordered the ice milk with caramel, egg pudding, and boba.
It was soooo yummy!
I like how their tapioca is soft and squishy
, I know some places who freeze their tapioca and it comes one rock hard yuck!
I like the fact you get a discount here if they run out of glass bottles
and if you bring in your old glass bottle.
I'll be back next time I'm in town!
ice milk.author: Michelle Q.
ice milk.review: Love this cute little spot. Walked In around 2 today and was surprised there was no line especially since it's a Saturday. I ordered the ice milk with caramel, egg pudding, and boba. It was soooo yummy! I like how their tapioca is soft and squishy, I know some places who freeze their tapioca and it comes one rock hard yuck! I like the fact you get a discount here if they run out of glass bottles and if you bring in your old glass bottle. I'll be back next time I'm in town!

excerpts: But overall, their Ice Milk Drink with Egg Pudding and brown sugar is... DELICIOUS!
I love how the brown adds so much flavor because I tried the Ice Milk Drink with caramel and there just wasn't as much flavor as the one with Brown Sugar.
I'd probably go back to go try one of their Fruit Teas because It looks so refreshening and delicious!
ice milk.author: Angela L.
ice milk.review: The drinks are a little pricey, but its reasonable, because the bottles that they gave us are so cute and reusable!  I just wish the caps were a screw in type, not a push on. But overall, their Ice Milk Drink with Egg Pudding and brown sugar is... DELICIOUS! I love how the brown adds so much flavor because I tried the Ice Milk Drink with caramel and there just wasn't as much flavor as the one with Brown Sugar. I'd probably go back to go try one of their Fruit Teas because It looks so refreshening and delicious!

excerpts: I got the fresh fruit mango milk drink with tapioca and ice milk with tapioca & taro pudding.
The bottle caps, straws, etc were all placed neatly on the counter!
I think my drinks came in no later than 5 minutes.
The food there in my opinion is not worth it.
Something they should improve on, is putting more ice in it.
My fruit drink was cold yes but not cold enough.
it was too foamy and needed more ice.
The taro pudding is good!!!
I am willing to come back to try more of the drinks.
I would give this place a 3.5.
ice milk.author: Josie D.
ice milk.review: I came to this place because everyone was raving about this hype and for the cute bottle! When I got there, there was a line, but that's okay because tpumps was just like that when it had it's grand opening here in sf irving. Since it's gonna be pretty busy for awhile, they should make the drinks with a faster solution. The place is a bit crowded, especially the first floor. When it was my turn to order, the cashier was very nice and suggested me whats good. I got the fresh fruit mango milk drink with tapioca and ice milk with tapioca & taro pudding. The bottle caps, straws, etc were all placed neatly on the counter! I think my drinks came in no later than 5 minutes. The food there in my opinion is not worth it. Something they should improve on, is putting more ice in it. My fruit drink was cold yes but not cold enough. it was too foamy and needed more ice. The taro pudding is good!!! I am willing to come back to try more of the drinks. I would give this place a 3.5.

excerpts: Got the Ice Milk Drink with Pudding at 50% sweet.
Pretty tasty and not too sweet.
Glass was cool since I can bring it back for a 10% discount.
Otherwise if you have no plan too bring it back
I don't think it's worth the added cost.
Prices are pretty high and they ask if its "to go" or "for here".
I said "to go" and was still charged sales tax.
It is up to the establishment to charge tax if the food is "to go
" so I think it would help them out a lot with the pricing if they do not charge tax on "to go" orders.
Also, I know its the first day and it still took some time to prepare my drink even though I was the only one.
So be prepared to wait until they get up to speed.
I'll be back with my glass to try some other drinks.
ice milk.author: Jason C.
ice milk.review: Got the Ice Milk Drink with Pudding at 50% sweet.  Pretty tasty and not too sweet.  Glass was cool since I can bring it back for a 10% discount.  Otherwise if you have no plan too bring it back I don't think it's worth the added cost.  Prices are pretty high and they ask if its "to go" or "for here".  I said "to go" and was still charged sales tax.  It is up to the establishment to charge tax if the food is "to go" so I think it would help them out a lot with the pricing if they do not charge tax on "to go" orders.  Also, I know its the first day and it still took some time to prepare my drink even though I was the only one.  So be prepared to wait until they get up to speed.  I'll be back with my glass to try some other drinks.

excerpts: Got the matcha smoothie.
It was pretty good.
Facility is decent, fancier than quickly.
Nice that you get to keep the glass bottle.
matcha smoothie.author: ChiefFinancial O.
matcha smoothie.review: Got the matcha smoothie. It was pretty good. Facility is decent, fancier than quickly. Nice that you get to keep the glass bottle.

excerpts: The fresh fruit smoothies are great, but a bit on the pricey side.
fruit smoothies.author: Claire W.
fruit smoothies.review:
The tea drinks and smoothies taste pretty fresh. I love that their drinks come in a recyclable glass bottle that you can keep or bring back for a discount on a future visit.  

The tea drinks are a bit watered down, so I would recommend getting light ice. The fresh fruit smoothies are great, but a bit on the pricey side.

excerpts: They also have iced milk w/ pudding (brown sugar or caramel) as well as fruit smoothies and fruit milk (strawberry, blueberry, peach, mango, honeydew, avocado, etc.).
fruit smoothies.author: Janetto L.
fruit smoothies.review:
When it comes to marketing, Plentea got it down to a T.  Serving boba in a glass bottle is getting people in the door.  Right as 11am hit this morning, the line was already forming and as soon as its door opened, line went out the door.  I know we're in the FiDi and all, but I was quite shock everyone was getting their boba fix so early in the day.  Mind you, they only serve a certain amount of drinks in their glass bottle each day which may be the reason people are flocking here right when they open.  It's a cute bottle to keep but if you bring it back during your next visit, you will get a discount.

Drink menu is quite extensive, they offer a variety of different options aside from just your usual flavored milk teas and green/black fruit teas.  They also have iced milk w/ pudding (brown sugar or caramel) as well as fruit smoothies and fruit milk (strawberry, blueberry, peach, mango, honeydew, avocado, etc.).  They even have a seasonal section for their taro milk, matcha green tea, lavender lemonade, matcha slush, etc,)

Granted they serve these drinks in a glass bottle, but at their price point, you are not getting much drink in return for the cost.  My Brown Sugar Iced Milk w/ Pudding was tasty, but at $4.95 + tax ($5.38 total), one may reconsider.  The drink barely made it back to the office after only a few sips.  It's crazy how even boba made its mark in the FiDi to charge such prices.

I did not see anyone order from the side menu, but they do also offer an array of savory waffle sandwiches and Belgian waffles, along with a few other dessert items.  

Plentea is spacious and there's a good amount of seating both upstairs and down.  However, this is only a good place to stop by if you are in the area or works down in the FiDi.  It definitely works for the working class clientele but I wouldn't suggest making a trek down here just to try it.  Parking is just virtually impossible in the area (sadly).

excerpts:
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh
Fruit Tea: ($4.95)
Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
fruit smoothies.author: Kitty K.
fruit smoothies.review:
This shop isn't located in Chinatown like I had thought since on Yelp's address it did say it was in Chinatown. It's way closer to the FiDi but still within walking distance of Chinatown (~8-10min). There's only street parking and parking's hit and miss (depends on when you go). There are a few stools and tables down stairs, but they have a cute little loft upstairs as well with a couple cushioned seats and more tables. No public bathroom.

I have been wanting to come here for ages because I love the jars that they serve the drinks in! I came here with a group of friends right after dinner in North Beach, so we walked over around 9PM on a Sat. I was surprised it wasn't packed or that there wasn't a line. I definitely wasn't going to complain!

Drink Menu:
Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Tea: ($4.95) Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95) Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95) Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50) Honey Tapioca, Egg Pudding, Taro Pudding, Coffee Pudding, Aloe, Grass Jelly)

Waffle Sandwiches Menu: ($8.95) Add 2 Slices of Applewood Smoked Bacon +$1
Morning Waffle: Only served before 10AM. Bacon, Egg, Spring Mix, Swiss Cheese
Turkey Club: Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Tomato, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Hot Pastrami: Pastrami, Swiss cheese, Avocado, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli

Salad Menu: ($8.95) served with Spring Mix, Avocado, Tomato, Pecan
Meat: Turkey / Pastrami / Smoked Salmon
Dressing: Ginger / Mustard Soy Sauce / Yuzu Citrus

*All vegetables are organic

Dessert Menu:
Strawberry Belgian Waffle: Whip Cream, Fresh Strawberries, Jam, Almond Slices & Chocolate Syrup
Banana Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream, Banana, Nutella, Almond Slices, & Chocolate Syrup
Marshmallow Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream Topped w/ Toasted Marshmallow & Chocolate Syrup
New York-style Cheesecake
Tiramisu
Add Vanilla or Green Tea Ice Cream: +$1

Our Order:
Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding 
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca

I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong. So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink. The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt. The egg pudding had a good consistency as well. One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers. The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks. One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet. The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers. The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus. Fairly pricey but so yummy!

Note: If you don't want your drink in the glass bottles, you get a 10% discount off the drink prices and get your drinks in a plastic cup instead. You also get the same discount if you bring the bottle back

excerpts: The prices are a bit "steep" (tea pun intended) and range from $4.50 for the milk teas to $6.50 for the fresh fruit smoothies.
You're paying for a.) convenience since this place is right on Kearny and b.)
the Plentea branded glass bottle.
fruit smoothies.author: Faith Y.
fruit smoothies.review:
Bubble tea in the FiDi? Ermagherd, it's a dream come true! 

The prices are a bit "steep" (tea pun intended) and range from $4.50 for the milk teas to $6.50 for the fresh fruit smoothies. You're paying for a.) convenience since this place is right on Kearny and b.) the Plentea branded glass bottle. But to put it into perspective, the gourmet coffees and fresh-pressed juices dotted all around the neighborhood go for higher. 

I got the oolong crema tea which was presented quite prettily with the crema foamy and swirling on top of the tea. It tasted fresh-brewed with just the perfect amount of sweetness and cream. Two thumbs way up. Like a weirdo, I also took a picture of someone else's fresh fruit orders which also looked super refreshing. 

Grab a plastic bottle cap and bring your bottle back for 10% off your next order. Not too shabby!

excerpts: Others that I noted were fruit smoothies, fruit milk, and fruit tea.
I ordered the honey lemon green tea.
It had the perfect amount of sugar, not overly sweet like most boba tea shops.
The green tea was strong with more of a bitter aftertaste.
The tea is served in a glass milk jar.
I thought this is extremely cute and sold more as a novelty.
After speaking with one of the employer or employee, she suggested that I try the Honey Lemon Oolong Tea where the tea is not as bitter.
It was yummy and refreshing.
Definitely ordering that next time!
There were plenty of seating downstairs as well as upstairs for those that have larger groups.
On the weekend, the place was of course filled with teenagers.
Drinks were roughly 5.50 if you choose to include boba, jelly, or aloe.
fruit smoothies.author: Becky Q.
fruit smoothies.review:
I was extremely excited to see that there is a new boba tea shop open in the Fidi. Nestled next to Onigilly, Plentea is conveniently located on the bustling street of Kearny. 
  
Plentea has a natural wood decor with artificial pots of mini greens lining the wall and a chalkboard menu.  
 
There were a assortment of milk teas where you can choose whether if you want black, green, oolong, and thai tea. Others that I noted were fruit smoothies, fruit milk, and fruit tea. 
 
I ordered the honey lemon green tea. It had the perfect amount of sugar, not overly sweet like most boba tea shops. The green tea was strong with more of a bitter aftertaste. The tea is served in a glass milk jar. I thought this is extremely cute and sold more as a novelty.  
 
After speaking with one of the employer or employee, she suggested that I try the Honey Lemon Oolong Tea where the tea is not as bitter. It was yummy and refreshing. Definitely ordering that next time!
  
There were plenty of seating downstairs as well as upstairs for those that have larger groups. On the weekend, the place was of course filled with teenagers.   
 
Drinks were roughly 5.50 if you choose to include boba, jelly, or aloe.

excerpts: The menu is well versed, your typical selection of milk teas, the even have fruit milk, fruit smoothies and their food selections looked good.
fruit smoothies.author: Justina L.
fruit smoothies.review:
So my husband has been raving about Plentea's boba milk tea for some time now because they cater to his office frequently. We have been searching for great boba in walnut creek/concord area for months and I finally had an opportunity to visit this past sat. We managed to get street meter parking right out front and the place has a cool vibe, top hits music playing and a neat lounge upstairs. 
The menu is well versed, your typical selection of milk teas, the even have fruit milk, fruit smoothies and their food selections looked good. I was so happy to see matcha green milk tea!!! My husband got the caramel milk tea which was a bit sweet for my tastes. 
4 stars because they do not have restrooms available (not good if you have kids in tow), and the girls behind the counter were very friendly to your face but I could hear inappropriate conversation going on...
They have a card minimum of $15 which seems a bit crazy for a boba place and their prices for their drinks range from $5-6. Now you do get a cool glass container which you can bring back for discounted drinks in the future. Too bad I don't live in the city, but I will definitely be back after I try the Japanese curry place a few doors down.

excerpts: The fruit smoothies are really good!
But the people trying to pour it into the bottle were having issues
and I was standinf there staring for about 10 mins....
that was kind of annoying if you ask me.
fruit smoothies.author: Monica N.
fruit smoothies.review: Arrived around 2pm and there was at least 30 people a head of me. I waited in line for about 45 mins and then it took a good 15-20 mins to get my drinks. The fruit smoothies are really good! But the people trying to pour it into the bottle were having issues and I was standinf there staring for about 10 mins.... that was kind of annoying if you ask me.

excerpts: My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea.
Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.
milk tea.author: Tiffany K.
milk tea.review:
I've been to Plentea a few times already, even when it first opened. This place was pretty cool and cute in the Financial district. What got me were the glass bottles. I think it has been over a year or two since I came back, and recently this place has changed a bit. They still have the glass bottles, and same menu but I think the food menu has changed a bit and maybe owner? But anyways all in all this place is great, their teas are fresh and I like the glass bottle that goes with it. I also like their tapioca, its made pretty good, as some places tend to leave it out long and its very hard and chewy. Unfortunately its in downtown area, so I cannot make my way here as often. This place does get busy, and parking can be a pain depending on time of day. It is on the pricyer side for teas so I cant say I would come back here everyday. Service is great and quick would def recommend everyone to come here and try it out if they have not already. 

My favorite drinks to order are the : Mango green tea w/ lychee jelly, peach green tea, matcha latte (really good), lavender lemonade, and their house milk tea. Also a good thing about the glass bottles are you can re-use them and bring it back.

excerpts: We ordered a classic milk tea, sea salt cream oolong milk tea, mango green tea, and a honey lime green tea from the suggestion of the worker.
All of the drinks were ok.
Nothing I would go out of my way for.
A con with these glasses is the straw gets in the way if you want to close it.
It's basically an open container otherwise unlike the boba cups with a sealed top.
Of all the drinks we got I'd stick with the classic milk tea.
milk tea.author: Lanha T.
milk tea.review: Don't forget to check in to get 15% off if you order 2 drinks like I did. Came here because I thought the glasses were cute. We ordered a classic milk tea, sea salt cream oolong milk tea, mango green tea, and a honey lime green tea from the suggestion of the worker. All of the drinks were ok. Nothing I would go out of my way for. A con with these glasses is the straw gets in the way if you want to close it. It's basically an open container otherwise unlike the boba cups with a sealed top. Of all the drinks we got I'd stick with the classic milk tea.

excerpts: As someone who has really aesthetic friends, Plentea really helped me flex on them - "yeah your nicely edited photo of your latte and laptop at a coffee shop is aesthetic but have you ever had Thai milk tea in a glass bottle?
I'd like to think that when they saw my photos of my bubble tea in a glass bottle they whispered to themselves
I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea.
I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and
my friend who didn't wanna take risks
didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet
, it just tasted like a nice milk tea with hints of Nutella.
the quality of the milk tea is what kept me coming back.
milk tea.author: Calvin Z.
milk tea.review:
First off - glass bottles. As someone who has really aesthetic friends, Plentea really helped me flex on them - "yeah your nicely edited photo of your latte and laptop at a coffee shop is aesthetic but have you ever had Thai milk tea in a glass bottle?" I'd like to think that when they saw my photos of my bubble tea in a glass bottle they whispered to themselves "damn I need me one of those".

Anyways.

Generally, bubble tea makes me feel bloated afterwards. I realize this is because they probably use powder, or because their tapioca comes from some questionable source, who knows. With Plentea's drink offerings, it tasted clean and like real tea and milk, which is something I appreciate a lot and I'm willing to pay the premium if I know what I'm drinking is not powder. I can even see the staff make my drink in front of me, which is more reassuring than the places that have someone take my order, disappear into the back, and come back with my drink. 

I've had here the Thai milk tea, Nutella milk tea, and the roasted oolong milk tea. I thought the Nutella milk tea would be too sweet and my friend who didn't wanna take risks didn't order it, but it was actually really pleasant - not overwhelmingly sweet, it just tasted like a nice milk tea with hints of Nutella. My goal is to try everything on the menu before I leave SF.

And again... glass bottles. You don't even pay more than you would at other popular bubble tea shops... maybe a bit less actually. Maybe I'm a sucker for these novelties, but it's what drew me in and the quality of the milk tea is what kept me coming back.

excerpts: I'm going to try to make my own milk tea in it
milk tea.author: Leeyen R.
milk tea.review:
I love this place enough that my desk at work has a collection of at least 5 bottles- oops! 

Pros: 
Quality tea used to make drinks 

Interesting selection (not sure why the fruit teas are cold-pressed instead of made hot then chilled, but it tastes good) 

Real milk instead of the non-dairy creamer used at places like I-Tea. They also have several milk options. 

Stylish glass containers with a lid that you can reuse. I'm going to try to make my own milk tea in it ;)

Cons: 
They should get a loyalty program!

excerpts: The oolong milk tea with sea salt crema and grass jelly was pretty good.
I liked how it wasnt super sweet and had full of tea flavor.
milk tea.author: Tina R.
milk tea.review: The drinks here are pricey but hey, you cant blame them since they use glass bottles, which are pretty sturdy and comes with a bottle cap so you can take your drink 100 percent to go. The oolong milk tea with sea salt crema and grass jelly was pretty good. I liked how it wasnt super sweet and had full of tea flavor.

excerpts: The milk tea was pretty good but the waits can be long bc
there's not too many people on staff.
I got the milk tea with boba 50% sweet and it was a solid experience.
The upstairs area is pretty quiet
so it's a good study or chill place.
The decor is also pretty nice with lots of wood and plants.
Overall a wholesome experience
milk tea.author: Lawrence H.
milk tea.review:
Pretty alright. Honestly This place was pretty solid in our time of need because it opens later than other places. The glass bottles are nice, very eco friendly which I can always support. They just need reusable straws next lol. 
The milk tea was pretty good but the waits can be long bc there's not too many people on staff. I got the milk tea with boba 50% sweet and it was a solid experience. The upstairs area is pretty quiet so it's a good study or chill place. The decor is also pretty nice with lots of wood and plants. 
Overall a wholesome experience

excerpts:
The GOOD:
- Good looking bottles and milk tea design for pictures
- There is seating downstairs and private seating upstairs -- so if you ever want to meet someone or play some board games upstairs, there's space for that here @ plentea.

The MEH:

- More americanized milk tea...
milk tea.author: Vy T.
milk tea.review:
This was the first bubble tea joint I visited when I first moved to the Bay Area... First thing that went through my head was "Seattle has better bubble tea" lol. Since then I've been back another 4 times, and can say nothing really changed x)

The GOOD:
- Good looking bottles and milk tea design for pictures
- There is seating downstairs and private seating upstairs -- so if you ever want to meet someone or play some board games upstairs, there's space for that here @ plentea.
- If you bring back your bottle, you can get 10% off your next purchase... nice.. but I haven't managed to do this yet lol.

The MEH:

- More americanized milk tea... if you like that TEA flavor of other bubble tea places, you won't find it here... it's more like a milkshakey flavor here.
- Drinks are all on the sweet side and can be inconsistent most days
- Boba is on the harder side, never perfectly chewy

excerpts: Unfortunately my milk tea tasted kinda watered down and not that memorable.
My friend and I ordered bubble milk teas with less sugar and ice.
Maybe the milk tea would've been better with full sugar
but it was just okay.
Our other friend's drink was better.
If I come back I'll probably get a green tea or a full-sugar milk tea.
I'm open to trying their Nutella milk tea as well.
Come if you're in the area and try for yourself!
milk tea.author: Staci W.
milk tea.review:
I was really excited to try this place because the pictures were so cute but I was pretty underwhelmed :/ 

I went on a nice day and surprisingly there weren't that many people in front of us. The interior was decorated in that cute, minimalist Insta-friendly style that's really popular lately. I'm definitely a fan of  the design because I'm a sucker for wood accents and plants! The guy who made our drinks was pretty friendly and recommended a drink for my friend who was undecided on what to get so that was pretty sweet. 

Drinks came out relatively quickly and I can't deny the aesthetic appeal of the bottles. Unfortunately my milk tea tasted kinda watered down and not that memorable. My friend and I ordered bubble milk teas with less sugar and ice. Maybe the milk tea would've been better with full sugar but it was just okay. Our other friend's drink was better. Unfortunately I can't remember what it was called but it was some type of fruity green tea. 

If I come back I'll probably get a green tea or a full-sugar milk tea. I'm open to trying their Nutella milk tea as well. Come if you're in the area and try for yourself!

excerpts: They have nutella milk tea which was interesting.
For cold drinks, they give you a glass bottle that you can take home if you want.
It's environment friendly
so i was super happy to see this.
milk tea.author: Yeonhwa S.
milk tea.review:
The place is cute and nice that they have seating upstairs but it wasnt very clean. Hair, dust, and trash everywhere. Maybe because i went late at night, but it was still not very pleasant. 

The drink was ok! They have nutella milk tea which was interesting. For cold drinks, they give you a glass bottle that you can take home if you want. It's environment friendly so i was super happy to see this.

excerpts: Pretty good oolong milk tea.
I would come back if in the area.
I like that they didn't add a lot of ice
so the tea flavor stays strong.
Boba had a nice chew to it.
The oolong milk tea didn't taste like what I normally think oolong tastes like.
milk tea.author: Jennifer T.
milk tea.review:
Pretty good oolong milk tea.  I would come back if in the area.  I like that they didn't add a lot of ice so the tea flavor stays strong.  Boba had a nice chew to it.  The oolong milk tea didn't taste like what I normally think oolong tastes like.  Maybe it's the sweetner they used, but it was still good.

The drink comes in a cool glass jar.  The only thing I don't like about the jar is that it's a square.  How am I suppose to fit it in my cup holder?!  But it's cute I guess.

excerpts: Their House Black Tea Milk Tea has a slight natural chocolatey taste that I'm addicted to.
milk tea.author: Mariam A.
milk tea.review:
I don't know how Plentea doesn't have five stars. This place is hands down my FAVORITE. They have the best quality and taste of tea, plus many milk and toppings options. Their House Black Tea Milk Tea has a slight natural chocolatey taste that I'm addicted to. The Matcha Latte is excellent, made fresh in front of you. Everything tastes natural and is not watery like other chain places.

I live in Oakland Chinatown and work in Downtown San Francisco so I've been to a LOT of bubble tea places....this is the BEST.

excerpts: There are Plentea (get it) of other milk tea places that are cheaper/better in my opinion.
milk tea.author: Anne S.
milk tea.review: I went here a while ago so this is coming in late, but the tea was alright. The cost was kind of high--maybe $6. Came with a reusable glass I still use, though. Overall, not life changing or necessarily up to the hype. There are Plentea (get it) of other milk tea places that are cheaper/better in my opinion.

excerpts: Average milk tea, over-the-top cuteness.
milk tea.author: Querida Q.
milk tea.review:
Average milk tea, over-the-top cuteness.

Get your Instagram fix and you can also keep the glass jar.

excerpts:
Pros:  

- Free glass jar
- Decent milk tea
milk tea.author: Josh Giosue D.
milk tea.review:
Pros:  

- Free glass jar
- Decent milk tea

Cons

- i tea is close by, which in my opinion tastes better

milk tea.review:
I love vegan milk teas, especially when I can get them with vegan tapioca (the boba is honey-free).

What makes Plentea stand out from the rest (aside from their high prices)? They seem to put a lot of thought into their recipes and seem to use quality ingredients...I can taste the difference with their soy milk, which is super tasty.

My favorite drink to get is the matcha milk tea with boba and soy milk, unsweetened. The drink comes in a cute glass bottle and is beautiful overall. They first place the boba inside the bottle and fill it 2/3 up with soy milk then mix up the matcha on the side and pour it on top. This drink looks super pretty when they hand it to me...and I'm always afraid to shake it up, haha! The jasmine milk tea is also delicious but the matcha is my go-to. Plentea is my favorite milk tea place in SF.

excerpts: Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi.
Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times.
The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas.
For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond).
For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each).
Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%).
From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea.
The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness.
milk tea.author: Ahmad J.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is another popular Boba Milk Tea place in FiDi. Unlike the other places, it is open late, which has got me here a couple of times. The menu here is simple consisting of Classic Milk Teas, Special Milk Teas, Cold Brewed Teas, Ice Blended Drinks and Hot Teas. For milk you have options for both dairy (Clover whole and half-and-half) and non-dairy (Silk Soy and Califia Almond). For toppings you have boba, aloe, grass jelly, lychee jelly, chia seeds and egg pudding (50c each). Sweetness can be customized to your liking (100%, 50%, 25% or 0%). It seems to cross all boxes as far as options are concerned.

Over a period of time I've tried most of their Classic and Special Milk teas. One thing that distinguishes Plentea from other boba tea places is their insistence on using glass bottles instead of plastic cups, supposedly to help the environment. In today age when you can get fully compostable cups and straws, insisting on using glass bottles for protecting the environment is just wrong. Let's call it what it is, a marketing ploy that positions Plentea differently from their competitors. Goes without saying I am not a fan of these glass bottles as they feel heavy and makes holding the drink painful. I would prefer if they give you a choice of getting a glass bottle rather than palming them off on everyone. Anyway let's move on to the drinks.

The short and simple review would be that their drinks are good not great. It took a little trial and error to get to my customization right here. I started by getting my drinks 50% sweet, but found that for my taste I needed their regular sweetness (but that would be a little sweet for most people). Then I replaced whole milk with half-and-half as whole milk tended to undermine the tea taste and lastly getting less ice prevented the teas from becoming diluted with time.

From the drinks that I've tried, I like their Jasmine Green tea and Nutella Milk Tea. The Jasmine tea has a strong Jasmine flavor that shines through even at 100% sweetness. What I didn't like was the Matcha Latte. It was pretty weak and needed a lot more Matcha powder to give it the bitter sweet finish.
 
Most of the teas are just under the $5 mark which with toppings will put you about $6 a cup give or take, which is in line with what you would pay at the fancy Boba Guys but 10% more than what you would pay at i-Tea just a block down. In my pecking order for Boba tree places in FiDi (or at-least the ones that I've been to) Plentea lies in the middle of i-Tea and Boba Guys, with i-Tea on top and Boba Guys at the bottom. During normal hours I prefer to go to i-Tea and end up coming to Plentea only for a late night boba fix.

excerpts: Today I decided to try the traditional milk tea with black tea blend, but since I'm vegan I asked with Almond milk but the cashier suggested doing with their regular dairy-free milk option, Coffee Mate, which is how they do it traditionally, I accepted.
milk tea.author: Tiago G.
milk tea.review:
Great boba tea, their options are very very tasty. 

Today I decided to try the traditional milk tea with black tea blend, but since I'm vegan I asked with Almond milk but the cashier suggested doing with their regular dairy-free milk option, Coffee Mate, which is how they do it traditionally, I accepted.

Later on I was researching the ingredients and I confirmed that this product "Coffe Mate", although dairy-free, it's not vegan since it contain "Milk Solids".

This means that if you are not vegan and simply lactose-intolerant, or you would like to avoid dairy, then this milk option will do fine to you, however if you are concerned with animal abuse, then you can be sure cows have been harmed just the same way, since this is a cow milk's byproduct.

I'm sure the cashier didn't know that, hence I'm not complaining - as a matter of fact I'm quite satisfied with them, since I came back 30min after I left (once I did my research back on my office) and since I haven't had open the bottle yet I returned to the store, explained what happened and I asked them to redo it with Almond milk, and they redid it immediately (although they were not much apologetic as they might not have believed much on what I said). 

Thus - I would like to leave a call out for vegans to not go for the "Coffee Mate" milk option since it's not vegan.

Lastly, I would strongly suggest the owners to mark their vegan options on the menu. You can simply put a (v) mark in front of your 2 vegan-friendly milk options: Soy milk and Almond milk. If you do that I will raise this review to 5 stars.

excerpts: Great concept and milk tea comes in cool glass milk bottles

milk tea.author: Betty R.
milk tea.review:
Great concept and milk tea comes in cool glass milk bottles but I've had better tea and thought they didn't give much tapioca for the additional charge. 

Today was the first time I passed by this place without a line out the door so I decided to finally try it. Super disappointed--guess you could say I had very high expectations based on the popularity and it was just average. 

Tea didn't taste very strong. Not sure if they don't steep it long enough or if there's too much milk but it lacked more tea punch. Tapioca wasn't bad but there didn't seem to be much given the big glass bottle of milk tea. I got the regular black milk tea and got my husband the matcha latte. Both could be customized for sweetness level which is always a plus to me because I don't like my milk tea to be too sweet. Each topping is an additional $1 and you just don't get enough of the add ons.

Their fruit teas looked pretty good. I saw a lot of people walking out with them after I ordered but I probably won't be back again after this time so won't get to try it. Sorry but first impressions really do count with me when it comes to drinks or food. If you want a cool glass milk bottle then you should give this place a shot but it's probably not worth waiting in a long line for.

2. They give you the glass containers to take home which is awesome !

excerpts: Plentea has your average assortment of boba drinks; they stick with what's popular like jasmine milk tea, oolong, and black milk tea as well as matcha.
When we came here, my friend got the original milk tea
and I got the oolong.
My friend loved her milk tea and thought the boba was amazing.
I'm a huge fan of oolong and thought that my drink was good, but watered down and a bit too sugary.
milk tea.author: Bryan W.
milk tea.review:
When I'm craving boba in San Francisco, you bet there are a ton of options to choose from. Generally, Plentea isn't my number one option, but I needed another one of their cute jars after mine had broken so that took me and my friend here!

I think San Francisco has at least 2 different Plentea locations, and the one on Kearny was the closest one to us. Unfortunately, the parking here is especially horrendous since it's between Chinatown and the financial district, so you may have to loop around a few times or double park.

But after you find parking, you'll walk into a different world, a more beautiful world without walls separating people~ Plentea is known for its aesthetics and you see it right when you pass through the door. There's beautiful lights all around the ceiling and walls, there's cute plants on shelves, and the atmosphere is overall cute and welcoming.

So how do the drinks stack up? Plentea has your average assortment of boba drinks; they stick with what's popular like jasmine milk tea, oolong, and black milk tea as well as matcha. When we came here, my friend got the original milk tea and I got the oolong. Pro tip: do not swap out the milk base when you order; I've heard it doesn't taste was good. 

Drinks came out a few minutes later in their cute jars, and after taking our instagram pictures, we dug in. My friend loved her milk tea and thought the boba was amazing. I'm a huge fan of oolong and thought that my drink was good, but watered down and a bit too sugary. However, I finished that thing quick cause it was still good! 

Overall, I enjoyed this Plentea. The tea was okay even though mine was way too sweet because the taste was decent and the price was not bad for the fact that you get to KEEP THE JAR!!!, but I wouldn't come here above other places in the Bay. The presentation and atmosphere here do give you a reason to come. I'd give this place a "nice-su, I'd take my parents here" rating because the experience was good and passable!

Drink well and prosper,

excerpts: I got the roast oolong tea ($4.50 + boba, 50 % sugar, less ice )while my friends got the Nutella milk tea ($4.95 + boba) and oolong salt cream ($4.95 + boba)!

Honestly the texture of the boba was excellent (think better than some of the boba guys places I've been before, much improved since the last time I had been) and I could tell how fresh the milk tea was!
Roast oolong had the perfect creaminess to it with the whole milk, so 5/5 would recommend!
Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!
Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!
milk tea.author: Kristie M.
milk tea.review:
Came here on Sunday afternoon around 5 pm with a couple of friends to see that Plentea no longer had its giant tv screens on the wall, and a new updated menu! It looked good and I hadn't been in about a year so was excited to try it after it had been a while! 

I got the roast oolong tea ($4.50 + boba, 50 % sugar, less ice )while my friends got the Nutella milk tea ($4.95 + boba) and oolong salt cream ($4.95 + boba)! You get 15% off 2 drinks (doesn't apply to roe than 2 drinks) if you check in. 

Honestly the texture of the boba was excellent (think better than some of the boba guys places I've been before, much improved since the last time I had been) and I could tell how fresh the milk tea was! Roast oolong had the perfect creaminess to it with the whole milk, so 5/5 would recommend! Friends like their drinks, and noted that the Nutella milk tea was slightly less sweet than it used to be, and almost like a chocolate milk!

We also got free cups of water when we asked so don't be shy if you need some too after drinking all that boba! Price point is pretty good especially since you get to keep the bottle and can bring it back for a discount- and they have new metal lids instead of plastic! 

Overall, great and will be back again soon! 

PS they redid their counter set up so that you pick up the boba on the side instead of the front like before!

excerpts: My husband and I are milk tea/boba enthusiasts & have even driven & flown to LA to get our milk tea fix, many times.
lol
Plentea is our new favorite though.
If you don't like your drink, they will adjust to your liking or make you a new/different drink all together.
The price is great, as it's not much more than you would normally pay for a milk tea drink
but you get a beautiful glass bottle with the lid to reuse at home or to bring back to get 10% off.
milk tea.author: Eunjoo P.
milk tea.review:
Love this place. 
My husband and I are milk tea/boba enthusiasts & have even driven & flown to LA to get our milk tea fix, many times. lol 
Plentea is our new favorite though. If you don't like your drink, they will adjust to your liking or make you a new/different drink all together. The price is great, as it's not much more than you would normally pay for a milk tea drink but you get a beautiful glass bottle with the lid to reuse at home or to bring back to get 10% off. 
My husband and I highly recommend the Ice Milk drink with brown sugar & tapioca. It reminds us of the popular ice milk drink at Half & Half tea in Los Angeles. 
I do prefer the taste of the iced milk drink with brown sugar at this location in SF more than the Berkeley location, because it's the perfect blend for me. Not too sweet. 

Hoping that Plentea opens a location in Cupertino near where we live soon so that we don't have to make the 1.5 hr drive each way. :)

excerpts: Plentea also has hot drinks such as Hot Oolong milk tea and cold brewed teas (Peach oolong, Premium mountain oolong, etc).
They're are mostly known (in terms of drinks) for their Sea Salt Creama which I recommend to those who haven't tried it yet.
I'm not a huge fan of Taro Milk tea but for all those Taro lovers out there, Plentea doesn't offer Taro Milk tea.
Once we got our drinks, the person who made my drink even asked me to tell him if I needed more sugar in my Jasmine Milk tea!
After that, I was highly appreciative of their amazeballs customer service.
Rarely any places I try out, gives us a sample when we ask if one of their drinks are too sweet before we order.
That's mostly why I was really impressed with their customer service.
I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba (surprise surprise), my sister got the Matcha Milk Tea with egg pudding, and my mom got the Thai tea also with egg pudding.
Can I just say, Thank you Plentea very MATCHA for that Jasmine Milk Tea.
It was definitely one of the best Jasmine Milk Tea I've ever tasted in my mouth.
The tea was just as strong as the amount of half and half they put in.
The creaminess of the half & half and the brewed taste of the Jasmine was just BOOOOOM.
They also put in the matcha in front of you if you order the Matcha milk tea which creates a cool ombré mixed effect.
The guy who took my order was even considerate enough to ask me if I wanted whole milk or half and half with my Jasmine Milk Tea.
I didn't catch his name or the one who made my drink
milk tea.author: Danielle A.
milk tea.review:
Plentea: home of the famous  (environmental-friendly) tea jars and moderately priced drinks ($4-5)

It's not often when I'm back in the SF area, so I decided to come back here after exploring more boba places around the bay.  I came around 5-6pm on a Saturday evening. I was very surprised to see that it wasn't packed but there was a few customers ordering. The last time (and first time) I came, it was quite crowded with music pumping. It's nice to a peaceful and calm vibe sometimes at boba places but I'd rather it be more alive...ESPECIALLY on a Saturday.
