There isn't PLENTEA enough of drinks to choose from their menu but still enough choices to pick out a drink. They offer milk teas such as Jasmine, Roasted Oolong, and Earl grey. Plentea also has hot drinks such as Hot Oolong milk tea and cold brewed teas (Peach oolong, Premium mountain oolong, etc). They're are mostly known (in terms of drinks) for their Sea Salt Creama which I recommend to those who haven't tried it yet. I'm not a huge fan of Taro Milk tea but for all those Taro lovers out there, Plentea doesn't offer Taro Milk tea.

The guy who took our order was very quick and attentive. He was really informative by letting us know that the sweetness of their Thai tea cannot be adjusted. Kindly, he offered us a sample to see if it was too sweet for my mom's liking. Once we got our drinks, the person who made my drink even asked me to tell him if I needed more sugar in my Jasmine Milk tea! After that, I was highly appreciative of their amazeballs customer service. Rarely any places I try out, gives us a sample when we ask if one of their drinks are too sweet before we order. That's mostly why I was really impressed with their customer service. Y'all are doing that portion right for sure. 

I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba (surprise surprise), my sister got the Matcha Milk Tea with egg pudding, and my mom got the Thai tea also with egg pudding. Can I just say, Thank you Plentea very MATCHA for that Jasmine Milk Tea. It was definitely one of the best Jasmine Milk Tea I've ever tasted in my mouth. The tea was just as strong as the amount of half and half they put in. The creaminess of the half & half and the brewed taste of the Jasmine was just BOOOOOM. They also put in the matcha in front of you if you order the Matcha milk tea which creates a cool ombré mixed effect. That adds on even more to this Tea place that just shouts aesthetic. 

The guy who took my order was even considerate enough to ask me if I wanted whole milk or half and half with my Jasmine Milk Tea. I didn't catch his name or the one who made my drink but I thank them for making my second experience here more enjoyable.

I'd give this place 4.5 stars due to the fact they can't adjust the sugar for some of their drinks like the Thai Tea since it's pre-made.

excerpts: I never had a matcha milk tea this strong in flavor before in my life.
I wasn't complaining though.
It was refreshing and aesthetically pleasing.
milk tea.author: Ellen V.
milk tea.review: Awesome drinks flavor and a cute glass bottle for your boba! The quality of the tea is there for sure. I never had a matcha milk tea this strong in flavor before in my life. I wasn't complaining though. It was refreshing and aesthetically pleasing. My friend ordered the ice milk and it was creamy, smooth, and perfect for a hot day. The way I would describe it would be milky with a sweetness of caramel. The price here is about $5 but you get the keep the bottle so it is worth it in my opinion. The tea quality is there as well.

excerpts: Friendly barista at 7:30PM on a Thursday advised me that the nondairy milk would taste way better than soy in my black milk tea + egg pudding, and she was right.
milk tea.author: Angel V.
milk tea.review:
Friendly barista at 7:30PM on a Thursday advised me that the nondairy milk would taste way better than soy in my black milk tea + egg pudding, and she was right. 

Great tasting tea and perfectly cooked boba/pudding here. I love the reusable glass bottles, which are included in the price of the drink. The upstairs seating area is my favorite place to hide when I get tired of walking around downtown.

excerpts: The coffee milk tea taste more like coffee and lack creaminess.
I'm glade two of the drinks had no boba.
Well the upside at lease they kept the change in the new twist lid than the easy cheap plastic cap that falls off.
The bottle is beautiful for lots of artsy crafty things
plus it's reusable.
milk tea.author: Christy V.
milk tea.review: Awww sad day. Today the boba was hard and inedible. The coffee milk tea taste more like coffee and lack creaminess. I'm glade two of the drinks had no boba. Well the upside at lease they kept the change in the new twist lid than the easy cheap plastic cap that falls off. The bottle is beautiful for lots of artsy crafty things plus it's reusable.

excerpts: I had Nutella Milk Tea with Tapioca, and ..
It was good.
milk tea.author: Rudy H.
milk tea.review:
I was craving for some Asian desserts at 10 pm and I thought about taking Uber to Richmond for some hot Asian desserts.
But I changed my mind because it was raining and windy. so I grabbed my umbrella and walked 5 minutes instead, problem solved.
I had Nutella Milk Tea with Tapioca, and ..
It was good.

excerpts: I ordered the oolong milk tea with tapioca, but I could barely taste the tea, and it seemed like it was pre-made because I didn't feel like the tea had been freshly brewed and mixed with the milk tea.
The tapioca was also very small in size relative to other boba I have tried.
milk tea.author: Julie Y.
milk tea.review:
Decided to check this place out while walking around the Chinatown area. I was drawn to the place because of the unique mason jars that they use for their drinks. It is a very cool concept and different from a lot of the other boba places I have visited. Honestly though, the only good thing about this place was the mason jar concept. I ordered the oolong milk tea with tapioca, but I could barely taste the tea, and it seemed like it was pre-made because I didn't feel like the tea had been freshly brewed and mixed with the milk tea. The tapioca was also very small in size relative to other boba I have tried. I wish the tapioca was a bit bigger and had a sweeter taste.

I also think that the volume of the drinks are not that much, and the jar deceptively presents the drink to seem like it is a large quantity for the same price, if not more relative to other boba places. I was not that impressed, but it was very cool that they didn't charge extra for the jar and let you keep it as well. The atmosphere of this place is nice, and there is a cozy upstairs area as well.

Probably will not be back, but it was a neat experience having my boba served in a mason jar.

excerpts: hands down the best milk tea i've ever had!!
milk tea.author: Hana K.
milk tea.review: hands down the best milk tea i've ever had!! the House Blend Black was brewed so strongly that i even watered it down after. the Jasmine Green was perfect! boba was cooked flawlessly but they didn't give much of it. love the fact that they are reducing waste by giving glass bottles free of charge! i'm from the LA area and i will miss this SF tea.

excerpts:
So environmental friendly 
The matcha milk tea that I had was very nice, freshly made.
I totally recommend this place.
milk tea.author: Nora A.
milk tea.review:
Loved the tea and the glass containers initiative!! So environmental friendly 
The matcha milk tea that I had was very nice, freshly made.
I totally recommend this place.

excerpts: My go to drinks here that kept me coming back is the Taro Ice milk tea.
It taste very good and not that artificial flavoring, it contains real taro chunks.
I've also tried their honeydew milk tea which was ok.
Overall what I enjoy about their drinks is that they don't use artificial flavoring.
I would say go with their Ice Milk drinks because they are very GOOD.
milk tea.author: Michele G.
milk tea.review:
Visited this place many times!

First off this place has a very hipster vibe with their decor and seating. There are cute plants hanging on the side of the store as well. Menu was straight forward and easy to follow.

Pricewise for a boba milk drink it is pricey because of the glass jar/bottle. Be prepared to spend at least 5.25 for a drink with one topping.

My go to drinks here that kept me coming back is the Taro Ice milk tea. It taste very good and not that artificial flavoring, it contains real taro chunks. I've also tried their honeydew milk tea which was ok. Overall what I enjoy about their drinks is that they don't use artificial flavoring. I would say go with their Ice Milk drinks because they are very GOOD. Boba balls are average, not too soft but not chewy enough to my standard.

Customer service is ok, no connection whatsoever, just order and then get your drink.

excerpts: I've tried their boba milk tea,
jasmine milk tea, and their thai tea.
All of their drinks could use more of a tea flavor, as they're a bit diluted.
Their boba is always nice and chewy and the bottle is a definite plus.
Their drinks are also on the less-sweetened side, so keep that in mind if you prefer sweeter drinks.
milk tea.author: Shirley H.
milk tea.review:
Plentea isn't my all time favorite boba shop, but they're a solid go-to in my book.

I've tried their boba milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and their thai tea. All of their drinks could use more of a tea flavor, as they're a bit diluted. Their boba is always nice and chewy and the bottle is a definite plus. Their drinks are also on the less-sweetened side, so keep that in mind if you prefer sweeter drinks. They'll happily remake your drink if you're not happy with it.

They also have twist on caps for their bottles now, so no more spills!

excerpts: I rarely get milk tea in SF, my only spot would be Little Sweet.
We wanted to get Boba Guys, but the line was out of the door and we didn't feel like waiting.
milk tea.author: Tiffany N.
milk tea.review:
I rarely get milk tea in SF, my only spot would be Little Sweet. We wanted to get Boba Guys, but the line was out of the door and we didn't feel like waiting. So, we went to Plentea. 

It wasn't crowded, and the interior is amazing. It's a really pretty and aesthetically pleasing place to hang out at. I felt like the drinks were limited, but the Matcha Latte was amazing. I also adjusted the sweetness to half, and sweetness exceeded my expectations. Service was really great too. I also really love the concept (what makes this place different from most) about how there's glass bottles that you can keep, but I think it's fair enough to have an alternative for customers who do not want to keep it. Other than that, I will definitely come back.

excerpts: I love Plentea - hands down my favorite black milk tea boba around.
I like the remodel (maybe to compete with boba guys?)
and my drink tastes the same.
My only gripe is that the plastic cups are no long an option.
The glass bottles are gimmicky and drives me crazy.
But, I guess, the environment.
milk tea.author: Erika C.
milk tea.review:
I love Plentea - hands down my favorite black milk tea boba around. I like the remodel (maybe to compete with boba guys?) and my drink tastes the same. My only gripe is that the plastic cups are no long an option. The glass bottles are gimmicky and drives me crazy. But, I guess, the environment. Yes. 

Oh - and the caffeine will keep you up.

excerpts: I also tried the house blend black milk tea
milk tea.author: Sophia G.
milk tea.review:
The customer service at Plentea is above and beyond. The female cashier working that day made sure I was satisfied with my drink and took all measures to accomplish this. This alone makes plentea a five star in my book. 

Plus my strawberry oolong with 30% sweetness, was perfect! 

I also tried the house blend black milk tea and it had a nice strong tea taste, another plus!!

I will be back for more drinks!

excerpts: " aka coffee and milk tea mixed together.
Great drink with enough caffeine but not too much
so you can sleep at night.
milk tea.author: Ronald L.
milk tea.review: I'm a fan of the glass cups they use (more like tap glass bottles).  Environment friendly for sure!  I opted for the coffmilk tea which is Hong Kong style "ying yang" aka coffee and milk tea mixed together.  Great drink with enough caffeine but not too much so you can sleep at night.

excerpts: I got the jasmine milk tea from here~
the drink is by far the best I have had in SF~ before I used to have to drive all the way to San Mateo just to get a decent cup of milktea, but now I have a better access to good quality drink now.
The sweetness is perfect, which I have adjusted to 80%, which is less sweet.
And I can definitely taste the tea and the milk~ and the glass bottle is definitely a plus +
++ which you should get your drinks here.
Losing one point due to its location, which I hate going to downtown with all the traffic and people~ but it is a overall very good place to get your boba!!
milk tea.author: Man Chun K.
milk tea.review: I got the jasmine milk tea from here~ the drink is by far the best I have had in SF~ before I used to have to drive all the way to San Mateo just to get a decent cup of milktea, but now I have a better access to good quality drink now. The sweetness is perfect, which I have adjusted to 80%, which is less sweet. And I can definitely taste the tea and the milk~ and the glass bottle is definitely a plus ++++++ which you should get your drinks here. Losing one point due to its location, which I hate going to downtown with all the traffic and people~ but it is a overall very good place to get your boba!!

excerpts: I came here with my roommate the other night and ordered a honeydew oolong milk tea.
The service was alright, but the drink itself was lacking.
I was kind of disappointed with the drink because it tasted really water down.
The boba itself was OK though.
milk tea.author: Victor L.
milk tea.review:
I came here with my roommate the other night and ordered a honeydew oolong milk tea. The service was alright, but the drink itself was lacking. I was kind of disappointed with the drink because it tasted really water down. The boba itself was OK though. Rather than getting it in a glass bottle, I opt for the plastic cup.

In terms of pricing it was kind of expensive for what it was. I think I paid around $5.50 for a 16 ounce drink. I think the standard everywhere else is around ~$5 for a 24 ounce drink. 

The seating upstairs was spacious and I could imagine it as a cool hangout spot.

excerpts: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!!
They were both very delicious.
Sadly live to far
or I'd be there every day!
Customer service was good!
milk tea.author: Karina R.
milk tea.review: Got the mango green tea and Nutella milk tea!! They were both very delicious. Sadly live to far or I'd be there every day! Customer service was good!

excerpts: Plentea is actually one of my favorite spots in SF to get milk tea -- particularly their oolong milk tea.
I've tried a ton of other places in the city but you can clearly taste the powder.
Womp.
At plentea, you can taste the quality in the tea leaves and flavor.
Only downside: it takes them forever to make drinks.
Sure, they have the cute glass bottles but that hinders efficiency and speed.
Boba for life!
milk tea.author: Lauren L.
milk tea.review:
Boba boba, I love boba! 

Plentea is actually one of my favorite spots in SF to get milk tea -- particularly their oolong milk tea. I've tried a ton of other places in the city but you can clearly taste the powder. Womp. At plentea, you can taste the quality in the tea leaves and flavor. Only downside: it takes them forever to make drinks. Sure, they have the cute glass bottles but that hinders efficiency and speed. Boba for life!

excerpts: I have tried the original milk tea before which I thought was okay
but I can't say whether or not the quality has gone down since I haven't tried it recently.
They also used to have a rewards system which unfortunately they do not have anymore.
The menu now is also very plain and boring, I liked it when they had the pictures of the different kinds of tea.
may come back to give this place another shot and try their matcha or milk tea again, as for Thai tea, I'll stick to other places.
milk tea.author: Cheryn L.
milk tea.review:
Ordered the Thai ice tea today and it tasted too sweet and watered down. I spent almost $5 (no toppings) for my drink and its really not the price. I have tried the original milk tea before which I thought was okay but I can't say whether or not the quality has gone down since I haven't tried it recently. 
They also used to have a rewards system which unfortunately they do not have anymore. The menu now is also very plain and boring, I liked it when they had the pictures of the different kinds of tea. may come back to give this place another shot and try their matcha or milk tea again, as for Thai tea, I'll stick to other places.

excerpts: With the recommendation of others, I ordered my milk tea with half sugar.
The milk tea itself it
just okay.
It tasted like watered down milk, with no tea flavor.
I wouldn't come back.
There are "plentea" of other boba places in the city.
milk tea.author: Marilyn T.
milk tea.review:
Like the other reviews have mentioned, I think people like to come here for the cute little glass jars. #diditforthegram #diditforthesnap 

With the recommendation of others, I ordered my milk tea with half sugar. The milk tea itself it just okay. It tasted like watered down milk, with no tea flavor. I wouldn't come back. There are "plentea" of other boba places in the city.

excerpts: Their milk tea has a strong chocolate taste that doesn't really resemble its namesake.
When I visited before I remember they had a bunch of betta fish in tiny cramped tanks too which was kind of messed up.
It's just not my kind of place.
milk tea.author: Alexander C.
milk tea.review: The redeeming factor that this place has for me is their interesting idea of giving glass bottles to customers.  If you return your bottle you get a percentage off for your next visit. Unfortunately this doesn't apply to me as I most likely won't come back here.  Their milk tea has a strong chocolate taste that doesn't really resemble its namesake.  When I visited before I remember they had a bunch of betta fish in tiny cramped tanks too which was kind of messed up.  It's just not my kind of place.

excerpts: Try the nutella milk tea!
Just doo itt
milk tea.author: Stefanie R.
milk tea.review: Customer service is amazing! One of the men was so helpful and kind to my boyfriend and I, offering suggestions and catering to our sweetness needs. Try the nutella milk tea! Just doo itt

excerpts: The first night I got the ice milk tea--oolong with tapioca bubbles and grass jelly.
I didn't think it was too sweet for me, but the grass jelly probably did a good job of offsetting the sweetness in any case.
My 2nd visit, I got the matcha with lychee jelly.
I really, really loved the lychee jelly; this was my first time trying it
so I can't speak to how it might compare to other places, but
I thought it was so yummy and would definitely get it again.
milk tea.author: Connie L.
milk tea.review:
I came here twice last week while working in the area; once on Friday night around 8:45 and then the following afternoon around 1:30. It wasn't too busy either time; I was in and out in about 5 minutes each visit. 

I really liked both of the drinks I got (both cold). The first night I got the ice milk tea--oolong with tapioca bubbles and grass jelly. I didn't think it was too sweet for me, but the grass jelly probably did a good job of offsetting the sweetness in any case. My 2nd visit, I got the matcha with lychee jelly. I really, really loved the lychee jelly; this was my first time trying it so I can't speak to how it might compare to other places, but I thought it was so yummy and would definitely get it again. The glass bottles were a cool novelty and the caps were secure; I lugged my drink up a few hills both times and didn't have any issues with spilling. 

There is some seating on the 1st floor of the cafe; it looked like there was an upstairs too, but I didn't get the chance to go up there. The drinks were prepared very quickly and were a good size. Both times, the staff I encountered were friendly and efficient.

The drinks were pretty expensive, which knocked it down from 5 to 4 stars for me. I think you're probably paying for the glass bottle, but I think the price might still not be ideal for some. Overall, it was a nice place with good drinks and a cute idea for the bottles and I'm glad I stopped by.

excerpts: I tried their black milk tea, and was kind of disappointed.
Like another Yelper said, it tasted kind of chocolate-y.
Not like black milk tea at all.
On a second visit though, I tried their honey lemon black tea.. and that was much better!
They actually topped it with three slices of lemon.
milk tea.author: Jennifer F.
milk tea.review:
Plentea doesn't charge extra for the glass bottles like most places do, and I like how they get customers to reuse the bottles (eco-friendly!) with incentives. That being said, the price for drinks is kind of pricey for the amount of drink (compared to normal bbt cups). So, I guess prices might already be marked up for those bottles? I tried their black milk tea, and was kind of disappointed. Like another Yelper said, it tasted kind of chocolate-y. Not like black milk tea at all. On a second visit though, I tried their honey lemon black tea.. and that was much better! They actually topped it with three slices of lemon. Definitely think it's a hit or miss depending on the drink you choose, and what your preference is.

NOTE: 15% off of two drinks when you check-in on Yelp, and 10% off if you bring back their bottle to reuse!

excerpts: I got a coffee milk tea with boba.
The boba seemed a little bit old and other than the atmosphere of the shop and the fact that they place your boba in a glass bottle, if wasn't all that great.
milk tea.author: Nicole K.
milk tea.review:
Pleantea was okay. I went in there with high hopes because the pictures on Yelp looked great but the boba was honestly pretty mediocre.

I got a coffee milk tea with boba. The boba seemed a little bit old and other than the atmosphere of the shop and the fact that they place your boba in a glass bottle, if wasn't all that great.

excerpts: The first time I came, I ordered the Thai milk tea, but it was a little too milky for me with not enough tea and was nothing special.
milk tea.author: Catherine S.
milk tea.review:
I first heard of this place by friends on Instagram who were posting super cute pictures of the cute bottles that the tea came in. I was really excited to get one of these bottles, and decided to stop by on a random night since I was in the area to see if I could still snag a bottle. I was so happy to see that they still had many crates full of bottles when I got there around 8PM (but people say they usually run out earlier in the day). 

There are a few seating areas in the tea shop and the ambience is quite nice. The first time I came, I ordered the Thai milk tea, but it was a little too milky for me with not enough tea and was nothing special. However, my favorite drink here is definitely the Caramel Ice Milk. I highly recommend it. It was super creamy and I always stop by to get it when I am in the area.The glass bottles are also really cute and I now have 5+ of them because I keep coming back for more! If you come here alone, bring back the glass bottle for 10% off. If you come here for someone else, check in on Yelp to get 15% off!

excerpts: the milk tea was amazing employees were very helpful have finally I got to try different teas all pretty good
milk tea.author: Veronica C.
milk tea.review: Amazing little place the milk tea was amazing employees were very helpful have finally I got to try different teas all pretty good

excerpts: the Caramel Ice Milk and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea - both were pretty good
milk tea.author: Racheal D.
milk tea.review:
I've been dying to come here ever since I saw the cute glass bottles all over Instagram but I must say I was a bit disappointed.

The price wasn't really a problem for me at all - $4.75 for bubble tea and you get to keep the bottle? That's pretty worth it for me!  I got the Caramel Ice Milk and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea - both were pretty good but we wish the sugar level could be adjusted (sadly that wasn't an option).

Service in this location is meh... the cashier didn't seem like she enjoyed her job that much!  I didn't really appreciate the tone she was giving my friend and I when we were ordering our drinks - she seems a bit annoyed but hey we're not even from SF so spare us the attitude!

Overall - very average place.

FYI - $10.00 credit card minimum!

excerpts: I've gotten the classic milk tea before, and I find it to be too sweet (and I love sweet drinks!)
It's probably just good marketing, but I swear having your boba in a glass bottle makes it taste colder and more refreshing.
There's not a ton of seating available, but on off-peak hours, I like to catch up with friends upstairs on their sofas.
milk tea.author: Denise L.
milk tea.review: Solid place for bubble tea, especially if you want a cute glass bottle to keep afterwards. My favorite is the matcha latte with almond milk and mild sweetness. I've gotten the classic milk tea before, and I find it to be too sweet (and I love sweet drinks!) It's probably just good marketing, but I swear having your boba in a glass bottle makes it taste colder and more refreshing. There's not a ton of seating available, but on off-peak hours, I like to catch up with friends upstairs on their sofas.

excerpts: It's only 9:30pm on Saturday night and they've already run out of Nutella for their milk tea and no more waffles!
It's Saturday night, how do they keep customers without proper inventory?
With 4-5 people behind the counter, you'd think drinks would be made faster.
Took at least 10 minutes.
Almond milk tea was strong: good balance between tea and milk flavor, not too sweet.
They asked what kind of tea
milk tea.author: Kristine F.
milk tea.review:
It's only 9:30pm on Saturday night and they've already run out of Nutella for their milk tea and no more waffles! It's Saturday night, how do they keep customers without proper inventory? With 4-5 people behind the counter, you'd think drinks would be made faster. Took at least 10 minutes. Almond milk tea was strong: good balance between tea and milk flavor, not too sweet. They asked what kind of tea and I chose black. 

They don't serve plain hot black coffee with milk but they have iced coffee with milk? The only difference is ice. 

Line is out the door, barely any other places are open until 11. Upstairs lounge area's visible from the door. Comfy seating, clean. No public restroom available. 

Most drinks are $4.95, not including toppings. 
5 Stars rewards
15% off two drinks with Yelp check in
$10+ to use credit card
10% off if you bring the glass bottle back next time. 

They offer a couple rice bowls, takoyaki, waffles early in the day?

excerpts: so I ended up getting a strawberry milk tea with taro pudding.
It was really yummy!
I finished it quickly, not sure if it's because I love boba or
if it's because it seems like a smaller portion haha!
Either way, it was delicious.
I would have liked to also try their nutella milk tea or fruit tea w/ real strawberry bits.
They also have snacks, a couple entrees, and belgian waffles here too.
milk tea.author: Ashley C.
milk tea.review: Plentea is a short walk away from Union Square so if you're looking for a boba place, you definitely should stop by here! Their drinks are a little pricier, ranging between $4-6, compared to the average $3-4 range, but it's because their drinks come in a pretty glass bottle that you get to keep! It's a small little shop so if it's a weekend, you might want to just grab and go. I wanted to get a drink that looked pretty for the pics - so I ended up getting a strawberry milk tea with taro pudding. It was really yummy! I finished it quickly, not sure if it's because I love boba or if it's because it seems like a smaller portion haha! Either way, it was delicious. I would have liked to also try their nutella milk tea or fruit tea w/ real strawberry bits. They also have snacks, a couple entrees, and belgian waffles here too.

excerpts: I had the hot Nutella milk tea with aloe & egg pudding (a total deviation from my normal coconut or almond milk basic boba)
I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea.
It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be.
You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.
I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea.
It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be.
You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.
milk tea.author: Tasha P.
milk tea.review: First time here. An interesting selection. It's more expensive than most boba places. I had the hot Nutella milk tea with aloe & egg pudding (a total deviation from my normal coconut or almond milk basic boba) I was pleasantly surprised by the Nutella milk tea. It was not as chocolates as a I thought it would be. You could taste each element without one overpowering the other.

excerpts: Got the milk tea with boba, 5/5.
Also it comes in a glass bottle so you can keep one as a souvenir.
milk tea.author: Melissa M.
milk tea.review: Got the milk tea with boba, 5/5. Also it comes in a glass bottle so you can keep one as a souvenir.

excerpts: The milk tea is pretty typical.
It has a slightly different taste from what I'm used to with some sort of a sugary chocolatey flavor to it.
Their boba is nice an chewy and they have a wide variety of drinks to choose from and even some food too.
milk tea.author: Joshua M.
milk tea.review:
If you're coming to Plentea, you're certainly here for the nice lil glass bottles. They have them all over the cafe with plants in them amongst other things as decor. You get to take them home with plastic caps as well. The only thing is that they are a bit difficult to grip especially if you are planning to carry it around while walking in SF.

The milk tea is pretty typical. It has a slightly different taste from what I'm used to with some sort of a sugary chocolatey flavor to it. Their boba is nice an chewy and they have a wide variety of drinks to choose from and even some food too.

excerpts: Ok milk tea.
Nothing special.
Tea is not bold, pretty bland taste.
But if you get the tea drink by itself, then it's definitely not too bad.
milk tea.author: Linh D.
milk tea.review: Ok milk tea. Nothing special. Tea is not bold, pretty bland taste. But if you get the tea drink by itself, then it's definitely not too bad.

excerpts: I usually get their Jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly.
It tastes okay
but I feel like it tastes a bit too creamy.
To be honest, I only tried it to because they had the glass bottle which is pretty cool.
milk tea.author: Elizabeth L.
milk tea.review: I actually expected more from Plentea. I usually get their Jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly. It tastes okay but I feel like it tastes a bit too creamy. To be honest, I only tried it to because they had the glass bottle which is pretty cool.

excerpts: I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea.
Normally when I try a new boba place I always order Milk Tea to determine if I like it or not.
Unfortunately it didn't meet my standards.
It tasted more like milk and sugar instead.
milk tea.author: Yinja L.
milk tea.review:
There was plentea of people waiting in line that's for sure. To be honest I really only came for the bottle because I mean who doesn't like cute bottles? 

I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea. Normally when I try a new boba place I always order Milk Tea to determine if I like it or not. Unfortunately it didn't meet my standards. It tasted more like milk and sugar instead. Also it wasn't really worth waiting in line for 20 minutes then waiting another 10 for our drinks. 

I'll probably come by another time when it's less busy and try some other drinks.

excerpts: The menu includes classic milk teas, fruit milk teas made with real fruit, blended milk tea, and iced teas plus a small assortment of small plates that range from sweet waffles to fried fish balls.
My girlfriends ordered the black milk tea and the almond milk tea.
We all added boba, of course!
The sea salt cream oolong tea was good but not the best I've had.
I really liked that the tea wasn't overly sweet
and I could really taste that distinct oolong profile, but the sea salt cream wasn't well balanced.
It leaned a bit too much on the salty side and the consistency could have been more on the meringue side rather than melty.
milk tea.author: Stephanie P.
milk tea.review:
Did you say boba?

Last time I was in the Bay I had to try the famous Boba Guys. This time around my must stop boba visit was Plentea. They have a really cute storefront-- it's pretty narrow but they have an upstairs loft where customers can lounge for a bit with their drinks. The menu includes classic milk teas, fruit milk teas made with real fruit, blended milk tea, and iced teas plus a small assortment of small plates that range from sweet waffles to fried fish balls. They also have a specials board with rotating seasonal teas and offerings.

I immediately went for one of their specials: sea salt cream oolong tea. Sea salt cream is my absolute favorite but not many tea houses carry it, so when I see it I have to order it. My girlfriends ordered the black milk tea and the almond milk tea. We all added boba, of course! The sea salt cream oolong tea was good but not the best I've had. I really liked that the tea wasn't overly sweet and I could really taste that distinct oolong profile, but the sea salt cream wasn't well balanced. It leaned a bit too much on the salty side and the consistency could have been more on the meringue side rather than melty. If you love sea salt cream, you know what I mean. 

I tried my friends' drinks and they were good but nothing to write home about it. Though major points for not being drenched in sugar; I hate it when tea house do that. The cute glass jars can go home with you or can be recycled with the shop which I thought was really cool for those of us that have an abundance of cutesy mason jars from other foodie adventures (guilty!).

The service was friendly. Just a note for debit/credit card users they only accept for purchases $10 or more which I can know can be annoying but I'm used to this with tea houses. We also used the 15% off check-in offer on Yelp with no problem, they just let us know that it would only apply to two drinks which was fine with me.

excerpts: Out of the ones I've tried the matcha milk tea was my most preferred, but not a favorite.
I was not a fan of the strawberry milk tea.
milk tea.author: Angel K.
milk tea.review:
Plentea has just the cutest name EVER! I love that you get a little souvenir cup and a discount if you bring it back in next time. Definitely gimmicky, but I love it! As for the teas, I don't think I've found my favorite yet. Out of the ones I've tried the matcha milk tea was my most preferred, but not a favorite. I was not a fan of the strawberry milk tea.

It is just the absolute cutest place to hang out too. Lots of seating, and a cute little upstairs area. However, the few times I've been, it's been rather hot inside (to the point that I was starting to sweat!). They also have sandwiches and food that actually sound good too, which is awesome!

excerpts: I'm not a fruity milk tea drinker, but the pink strawberry milk tea looks so cute in that glass bottle that I had to order one, and it tastes fantastic!
Grass jelly also got its perfect balance of softness and chewiness.
I didn't get to try their boba
milk tea.author: Mandy D.
milk tea.review:
Very strong and aromatic tea. That's a plus.

Drinks come in super cute bottles. That's another plus!

I'm not a fruity milk tea drinker, but the pink strawberry milk tea looks so cute in that glass bottle that I had to order one, and it tastes fantastic! Grass jelly also got its perfect balance of softness and chewiness. I didn't get to try their boba but I have a feeling it's also great.

The reason why it's not a 5 stars is because parking sucks, service was a little slow and this will never be my to-go place due to location and price.

excerpts: and I tried the jasmine milk tea
and I must  admit, it was really good.
I really would recommended it to someone who's never tried it before
milk tea.author: Camille F.
milk tea.review: This was first time here and I tried the jasmine milk tea and I must  admit, it was really good. I really would recommended it to someone who's never tried it before

excerpts: Order: We had the Honey Lemon Black Tea and Oolong Black Milk Tea (both with boba).
milk tea.author: Michelle B.
milk tea.review:
Unlike other bubble tea places, they give a cute clear glass bottle with your order (to keep, for free). 

Parking: It is in the city, so street or paid parking. 

Ambience: It is a cute, modern space with 2 floors. The second floor is a loft. 

Service: Ordering was fast, but at the time we were there, the store was in the midst of making the boba, so it took 20+ mins to get our drink.

Order: We had the Honey Lemon Black Tea and Oolong Black Milk Tea (both with boba).

Verdict: The space is pretty big for being in the city. The store has two floors -the first floor has some seating and where you order the bubble tea and the second floor is like a loft with seating. I like the fact that the bubble tea is not more expensive than other places, but you get to keep the cute, reusable bottle - very eco-friendly of the store to do that and also marketing (as my friend and I were asked where we got the bubble tea from). 

Note: If you check-in to Yelp, you get 15% of two drinks there.

excerpts: I ordered the matcha milk tea flavor because I could adjust the sugar levels and the type of milk used.
We also had all our drinks in glass bottles that you can take back after drinking in.
Well designed place with throwback music.
Clean and sleek interior with a few plants on the walls (going for that succulent vibe).
If you're yelp elite you also get 15% off two drinks here
so we used that!
milk tea.author: Diana Y.
milk tea.review: This place is known for its unique boba flavors. I ordered the matcha milk tea flavor because I could adjust the sugar levels and the type of milk used. We also had all our drinks in glass bottles that you can take back after drinking in. Well designed place with throwback music. Clean and sleek interior with a few plants on the walls (going for that succulent vibe). If you're yelp elite you also get 15% off two drinks here so we used that!

excerpts: Tried a few drinks, including the sea salt crema oolong and nutella milk tea.
I also tried my wife's green tea matcha and almond milk tea w/ red bean.
The best one was the sea salt crema hands down.
I asked for it half sweet, but the gentleman at the register said it wasn't too sweet to begin with, so I had it as is and he was right, the sweetness was just right.
The sea salt crema topping was done perfectly as well.
I'm a fan of the glass bottles they put their drinks in.
They don't leak or spill when you shake your drink or flip it upside down with the lid on.
One negative thing about this place is that they don't have a restroom.
You guys sell drinks.
That just doesn't make sense to me.
milk tea.author: MJ E.
milk tea.review: Came here 2 times in a day when visiting Chinatown. Tried a few drinks, including the sea salt crema oolong and nutella milk tea. I also tried my wife's green tea matcha and almond milk tea w/ red bean. The best one was the sea salt crema hands down. I asked for it half sweet, but the gentleman at the register said it wasn't too sweet to begin with, so I had it as is and he was right, the sweetness was just right. The sea salt crema topping was done perfectly as well. I'm a fan of the glass bottles they put their drinks in. They don't leak or spill when you shake your drink or flip it upside down with the lid on. One negative thing about this place is that they don't have a restroom. You guys sell drinks. That just doesn't make sense to me.

excerpts: The house black milk tea with boba is a must try!
The boba here is soft and fresh!
This place makes real milk tea with real ingredients, not like those places that pump artificial flavors and sweeteners aka places that ask you do you want 25% 50% or 100% "sweetness".
Each milk tea comes in a glass bottle.
milk tea.author: Elliott N.
milk tea.review:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: no wait to order

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: clean and open ambiance

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The house black milk tea with boba is a must try! The boba here is soft and fresh! This place makes real milk tea with real ingredients, not like those places that pump artificial flavors and sweeteners aka places that ask you do you want 25% 50% or 100% "sweetness". 

_____

Overall Experience

5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
Each milk tea comes in a glass bottle.

excerpts: The large menu screen shows your choices of various types of milk tea, coffee tea, fruit tea, lemonades and fruit/milk drinks.
My Thai milk tea with boba add-on was sweet, but not overly sweet.
If in the area, I will stop by to try another one of the choices.
Doubt I'll have the empty bottle with me.
milk tea.author: Al L.
milk tea.review:
After a nice dinner nearby, my friend suggested that we get some bubble tea at Plentea.  The large menu screen shows your choices of various types of milk tea, coffee tea, fruit tea, lemonades and fruit/milk drinks.  There are eight add-on choices for your drink at $.50 each, such as bobas, grass jelly, and red beans.

Their drinks are served in a glass bottle, reminiscent of the old milk bottle.  If you bring your bottle back, you get 10% discount on your next purchase.  Or you can use it as a water terrarium, like they have on display.  Interesting idea. 

They have an upstairs seating area with about 4 tables with seating for about 16.  

My Thai milk tea with boba add-on was sweet, but not overly sweet.  If in the area, I will stop by to try another one of the choices.  Doubt I'll have the empty bottle with me.

excerpts: Got a mango smoothie and pearl milk tea.
Loved the smoothie, was really creamy.
I didn't like the pearl milk tea and
though it was too chocolate-y and not that sweet but my friend loved it.
I would recommend the milk tea if you aren't a big fan of sweet drinks.
milk tea.author: Maya D.
milk tea.review: Got a mango smoothie and pearl milk tea. Loved the smoothie, was really creamy. I didn't like the pearl milk tea and though it was too chocolate-y and not that sweet but my friend loved it. I would recommend the milk tea if you aren't a big fan of sweet drinks.

excerpts: I got the classic oolong milk tea with soymilk.
The tea flavor isn't strong but it'll do for now, when there aren't any other shops close by that are open.
I had the sweetness level at 50% and it's not that sweet.
Really wish the tea flavor was more pronounced...
The tapioca balls are meh...
milk tea.author: Audris K.
milk tea.review:
Guy at the register wasn't that friendly. Very monotonous, didn't smile, and didn't even tell me what options I could adjust. Only because I've bought from other boba shops did I know to ask for sweetness and ice adjustments. He didn't explain how the bottle system worked. I only knew that they had bottles from seeing the pictures on Yelp. But I didn't know anything other than that. 

I got the classic oolong milk tea with soymilk. The tea flavor isn't strong but it'll do for now, when there aren't any other shops close by that are open. I had the sweetness level at 50% and it's not that sweet. Really wish the tea flavor was more pronounced... The tapioca balls are meh...

excerpts: My mango milk tea was a bit disappointing though.
I already had my doubts with a fruity milk tea, because when I've ordered it at other teahouses in the past the flavoring and creamer starts separating after a while.
I had to learn the hard way that this place is no different :(
milk tea.author: Vincent L.
milk tea.review:
This place is ridiculously poppin! Came on a weekday afternoon and the line was still way out the door, about a 20 minute wait. 

For a tiny boba shop in the heart of SF, Plentea's not bad when it comes to interior ambiance. While the loft seating is commendable, the layout of the bottom is just a bit disappointing. In the name of aesthetics, the already scarce amount of space is further reduced; I was sitting with my friend on a side table waiting for our order, but as more people ordered after us and took a seat as well, we were basically locked in and had to ask each and every person who sat down to move for us to go back to the front register. 

Customer service was a mixed bag. While the guy who took our order had a pleasant attitude, I honestly didn't feel like he gave us truthful opinions about the menu. We asked several questions, only to hear very generic responses that basically meant "everything is good, everything is popular". While arguably a smart answer, it just seemed like a copout to me.

The peach green tea my friend got was pretty refreshing and didn't scream "I'M MADE WITH SYRUP!" thanks in part to the bits of peach on top. My mango milk tea was a bit disappointing though. I already had my doubts with a fruity milk tea, because when I've ordered it at other teahouses in the past the flavoring and creamer starts separating after a while. I had to learn the hard way that this place is no different :( On the bright side, the very aesthetically pleasing glass jars are included in the price!

Overall, not a bad place; just be prepared to wait, not have good seating, and be careful with what you order LOL.

excerpts: The cashier, Emily, was very nice and reminded me to mix my sea salt oolong milk tea
milk tea.author: Megan L.
milk tea.review: Love how modern it looks here! The cashier, Emily, was very nice and reminded me to mix my sea salt oolong milk tea

excerpts: It just tasted like regular milk tea but sweeter.
Nothing really special
milk tea.author: Vanessa L.
milk tea.review:
Unique flavors and they open later compared to other boba shops which is a plus. 

I got the iced milk with brown sugar and I liked it. It just tasted like regular milk tea but sweeter. Nothing really special but it was good. 

BF got the sea salt crema and I don't think he really liked it. I for sure didn't like it. It was bitter and not satisfying. He said he couldn't taste the sea salt in it. 

Definitely not the best we had, but not the worst.

excerpts: I went to Plentea and my boyfriend got a roasted milk tea
First of all I LOVEEEE their roasted milk tea.
I can tell they used fresh milk in the roasted milk tea and in the strawberry black tea their were fresh chunks of strawberries.
The glass jars are a added bonus as well (which they do not charge for & you get to keep it).
It was well worth the money
and I would definitely come back.
milk tea.author: Kathy N.
milk tea.review: I love bubble and I go pretty often getting similar flavours at each location. I went to Plentea and my boyfriend got a roasted milk tea and I got the strawberry black tea. First of all I LOVEEEE their roasted milk tea. I can tell they used fresh milk in the roasted milk tea and in the strawberry black tea their were fresh chunks of strawberries. The glass jars are a added bonus as well (which they do not charge for & you get to keep it). It was well worth the money and I would definitely come back.

excerpts: I don't mind paying for expensive boba milk tea if it's good
but it's not.
And don't let the glass bottle foul you, it looks like a standard size drink but its way less than standard small.
And how many of these bottles can you collect?
Drinks are water down, lacking in tea flavor.
I use to think it was decent
but it got worst.
If there are completion around, shouldn't you try to improve?
milk tea.author: Sandy B.
milk tea.review:
I don't mind paying for expensive boba milk tea if it's good but it's not. And don't let the glass bottle foul you, it looks like a standard size drink but its way less than standard small. And how many of these bottles can you collect? Drinks are water down, lacking in tea flavor. I use to think it was decent but it got worst. If there are completion around, shouldn't you try to improve? So many options in the city therefore this isn't one.

Services is friendly tho and a lot of tables and seating.

excerpts: I think their milk tea and fruit tea are decent, they tend to be over sweet at times.
However, my favorite is the Milk Ice Tea with Brown Sugar.
It tastes exactly like vanilla ice cream.
milk tea.author: Natalie L.
milk tea.review:
One of the hyped boba tea places in the city! They are known for their signature glassware.

I come here once in awhile since it is just a few minutes away from my office. I think their milk tea and fruit tea are decent, they tend to be over sweet at times. However, my favorite is the Milk Ice Tea with Brown Sugar. It tastes exactly like vanilla ice cream. I also tried their Takoyaki Balls, they are OK, more flour than tako inside. 

Overall, a decent place, but I prefer i-Tea more which is nearby!

excerpts: Oolong Milk Tea w/ Boba - $4.50 +
$.50 - Good milk tea.
Perfectly sweet when I got no sugar.
milk tea.author: Kevin W.
milk tea.review:
Very hipster boba spot.

Located on the edge of Chinatown. Terrible street parking. Long lines. 

Yelp checkin gives you a discount.

Drinks come in old school milk bottles. I believe I saw you that you get a discount if you bring it back.

Oolong Milk Tea w/ Boba - $4.50 + $.50 - Good milk tea. Perfectly sweet when I got no sugar. Not worth $5 though.

Green Peach Tea w/ :Lychee Jelly - $4.95 + $.50 - Fresh peachy flavor. Comes with small peach pieces. Lychee Jelly added the right amount of sweetness to no sugar sweetness level.

excerpts: I had a taro milk tea with boba and my brother had the nutella milk tea with boba, both with reduced sugar (I know, blasphemy!).
The taro was delicious!
It was made from real taro and not the powder that some places use.
milk tea.author: Jason W.
milk tea.review:
Finally swung by Plentea after hearing all the hype...and also being insanely jealous of the glass bottles that everyone had.

I had a taro milk tea with boba and my brother had the nutella milk tea with boba, both with reduced sugar (I know, blasphemy!). The taro was delicious! It was made from real taro and not the powder that some places use. The nutella was good as well but had a bit more of a dark chocolate flavor rather than the distinctive hazelnut flavor of nutella.

Either way, the boba in each was perfectly chewy. The glasses are awesome though! Bring them home and use them for tiny aquariums or little decorative pieces or use them for coffee/milk/etc. Also, if you bring them back (at least at the Kearney location), you get 10% off!

All in all, a bit pricier than some places but you get what you pay for!

excerpts: The almond milk tea isn't overpowering
and I asked for 75% sweet
and it was perfect.
Minimal design for the interior with light wood makes the place feel open and bright.
milk tea.author: Sally L.
milk tea.review: This tea place is located not too far from Westfield mall. It's a cute little tea place serves boba into a glass bottle if that's what you're into. I really enjoy places that does that. It's so cute. They have different toppings for your tea like most places. We added chia seeds and boba to ours. The almond milk tea isn't overpowering and I asked for 75% sweet and it was perfect. Minimal design for the interior with light wood makes the place feel open and bright.

excerpts: My son ordered the strawberry black milk tea, which didn't have any strawberry taste to it at all and the same goes with my husbands and he ordered the mango milk tea...no taste of mango.
milk tea.author: Sandra L.
milk tea.review:
This is a small place with a cute setting. I wasn't too impressed with the drinks. 
I ordered the Sea salt creme oolong tea since it seemed quite popular, but turns out I didn't like it as much as I wanted to. I can taste the sea salt in the creme, but there was barely any sweetness to the drink and the boba was just decent. My son ordered the strawberry black milk tea, which didn't have any strawberry taste to it at all and the same goes with my husbands and he ordered the mango milk tea...no taste of mango. Kind of disappointing. 

I did enjoy my slice of chocolate mouse cake though...that was the best part.

excerpts: So I guess that's a no go for the Nutella milk tea I wanted to try.
Went with the black milk tea instead Without boba of course.
The black milk tea was kind of strong, but that's just personal preference.
milk tea.author: Gina K.
milk tea.review:
A boba shop that didn't have boba....I came in Sunday a bit after 7 (they close at 11) and they ran out. Not only boba, but Nutella too? So I guess that's a no go for the Nutella milk tea I wanted to try. Went with the black milk tea instead Without boba of course. Also ordered the honeydew and strawberry milk. 

The place has 2 levels which is awesome since the front of the store to the register is basically 10 feet. 

The black milk tea was kind of strong, but that's just personal preference. The honeydew milk tastes fresh, but a bit light and the strawberry milk was perfect. 

Only downside to the fruit milk drinks are that they blend them up so its pretty frothy. A bit disappointed I couldn't try the boba.

excerpts: I came in with my boyfriend and we ordered a Black Milk Tea and Nutella Milk Tea.
Would highly recommend both to anyone trying to this place out for the first time.
Love the fact that they put their drinks in a glass bottle!
milk tea.author: Marina P.
milk tea.review: First time coming here from Seattle. Friendly staff, and always willing to help. I came in with my boyfriend and we ordered a Black Milk Tea and Nutella Milk Tea. Would highly recommend both to anyone trying to this place out for the first time. Love the fact that they put their drinks in a glass bottle!

excerpts: I was recommended to try the Oolong milk tea by the helpful employee at the register
and I liked it, it had an interesting flavor.
Keep in mind that you can request to try the favors before committing to a type.
My friends got a variety including: iced coffee, strawberry fruit milk tea, and apple honey flavored tea.
They enjoyed it, but our complaint is that it can be a little too sweet and the drinks were average.
The lines to get these teas is also so long out the door that it may not even be worth
the 20 minute wait just to order.
I also find these teas to be a little pricier than other places, but that may be due to the glass bottle
it comes in that you get to keep!
milk tea.author: Khoi N.
milk tea.review:
This is a nice tea shop with ok tasting teas. I was recommended to try the Oolong milk tea by the helpful employee at the register and I liked it, it had an interesting flavor. Keep in mind that you can request to try the favors before committing to a type. My friends got a variety including: iced coffee, strawberry fruit milk tea, and apple honey flavored tea. They enjoyed it, but our complaint is that it can be a little too sweet and the drinks were average. The lines to get these teas is also so long out the door that it may not even be worth the 20 minute wait just to order. I also find these teas to be a little pricier than other places, but that may be due to the glass bottle it comes in that you get to keep! If you visit often be sure to keep the bring the bottle for discounts. 

If the downstairs gets crowded check out the upstairs for extra seating. The couches are comfortable and it is a great space to hang out. But one thing is that I found that it was strange to no have a bathroom in a place that sells drinks...

excerpts: Their jasmine green milk tea is delicious!
The boba is also chewy too.
If you return the glass bottles you also get 10 percent discount!
milk tea.author: Nick L.
milk tea.review: Their jasmine green milk tea is delicious! The boba is also chewy too. If you return the glass bottles you also get 10 percent discount!

excerpts: The service is great and top notch, but the actual milk tea wasn't good.
The milk tea was watery and lacked flavor.
milk tea.author: Linette F.
milk tea.review:
oh terrible! This will not satisfy your boba cravings. The service is great and top notch, but the actual milk tea wasn't good. The milk tea was watery and lacked flavor. The bobas were hard and I almost wanted to say that they were not fresh since they were not soft and chewy. 

I would come back just for the service, but I would not recommend the mlik teas here.

excerpts: It's kind of expensive and it's pretty lack luster milk tea.
There's only one place in SF that I do go to when I visit
and it's Boba Guys.
I've been to this place because people had a lot of those glass cups that they got to keep as souvenirs.
I think that's pretty cool because they function as really nice coin jars or a vase for temporary flowers.
But outside of that, there's not much
It is a good spot of average, no-nonsense, milk tea.
milk tea.author: Kenny N.
milk tea.review:
It's kind of expensive and it's pretty lack luster milk tea. There's only one place in SF that I do go to when I visit and it's Boba Guys. I've been to this place because people had a lot of those glass cups that they got to keep as souvenirs. I think that's pretty cool because they function as really nice coin jars or a vase for temporary flowers. But outside of that, there's not much I'd recommend about Plentea.

It is a good spot of average, no-nonsense, milk tea.

excerpts: It does up the price of the average milk tea to around $5 and that's before the toppings/boba is counted.
I had the CoffMilk which was a coffee milk tea
and I was disappointed that it didn't look like what was pictured on the menu with the swirls of white and dark brown floating down to the bottom.
Instead, it was already all mixed in and looked similar to a Starbucks Frappuccino bottle.
Taste-wise
milk tea.author: Diana C.
milk tea.review:
99 bottles of boba on the wall, 99 bottles of... Raise your hand if you came here for the bottles. You too? So it's not just me?

Let's admit it. The major draw for this place is definitely the neat glass bottles you can take away from this place. For tourists, it's a nifty little souvenir. For locals, it's one less glassware I have to buy at Ikea. It does up the price of the average milk tea to around $5 and that's before the toppings/boba is counted. But then again, you're in SF and most of the trendy boba shops are that expensive these days. 

I had the CoffMilk which was a coffee milk tea and I was disappointed that it didn't look like what was pictured on the menu with the swirls of white and dark brown floating down to the bottom. Instead, it was already all mixed in and looked similar to a Starbucks Frappuccino bottle. Taste-wise, it was just as similar to the Mocha Frap you can buy at Safeway although slightly more diluted with the ice. 

Tea-wise, I'm not blown away. I wouldn't fork over my $5 for it on any occasion except for when I'm needing a new bottle or have a friend visiting from out of town. I do think the experience of coming here is unique because you can watch them make the drinks and they use a funnel to pour in the boba into the bottles. It definitely beats watching the boba cup sealer machine (although that has its fun at times). And who can resist the allure of having your own Plentea bottle to keep?

Important Tidbits: Make sure to get a plastic cap for your bottle. They're at the counter. But they aren't 100% seal proof so don't put your full trust in it. There's a Yelp check-in offer for 15% off two drinks so check-in on Yelp. Credit card minimum is $10. No bathroom but there is upstairs seating. And you can bring back your bottle for 10% off your next purchase. But who actually wants to carry their bottle back?

excerpts: We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca for $5 each and the drink was not good.
My boyfriend and I came here to satisfy our boba cravings, but their drink was quite disappointing.
The jasmine milk tea was very watered down and to put it quite bluntly, it was bad.
$5 for a jasmine milk tea with tapioca is pricey and I'm pretty sure it costs $5 to cover the price of the glass jars
milk tea.author: Jen S.
milk tea.review:
I like the aesthetics of Plentea, but the drinks are meh.

We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca for $5 each and the drink was not good. My boyfriend and I came here to satisfy our boba cravings, but their drink was quite disappointing. The jasmine milk tea was very watered down and to put it quite bluntly, it was bad. I'm a fiend of boba so I can usually finish any drink without a problem, but this was one of the very few boba places where I ended up not finishing it.

You can keep the glass jar for free. If you bring it back the next time, you get a discount. $5 for a jasmine milk tea with tapioca is pricey and I'm pretty sure it costs $5 to cover the price of the glass jars (I would rather pay less to not get a glass jar because I wouldn't keep it).

Giving 2 stars because in comparison to other boba places in the area, their drink is terrible. Not taking off the last star because the aesthetics are nice (I guess). They also have seating available upstairs, which I thought was a nice area to relax and sip.

If you're all about the aesthetics, this place is for you. If you're looking to get great boba, this is NOT the place for you.

excerpts: Boba was stale, and milk tea tasted like sugar water with tea fragrance.
Drink was less than mediocre, but I came here for the jar.
The jar is pretty cute, but the drink is not worth.
milk tea.author: Tiffany H.
milk tea.review: Boba was stale, and milk tea tasted like sugar water with tea fragrance. Drink was less than mediocre, but I came here for the jar. The jar is pretty cute, but the drink is not worth.

excerpts: I've tried their milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies.
Honestly, it was alright but not great.
Customer service is great here however 6-7$ for a mediocre drink isn't worth it for me.
Inside was very aesthetically pleasing and gives a modern feel to it.
There is also a second floor where you can chill I believe.
Bring your own glass bottle back
and you get 10% off.
There are better boba places in SF I wouldn't come back here.
milk tea.author: Tina C.
milk tea.review: I came here plenty of times and I decided to finally write a review for this place. Located in the financial district. Parking can be hard in the daytime but easy at night. I've tried their milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies. Honestly, it was alright but not great. Customer service is great here however 6-7$ for a mediocre drink isn't worth it for me. Inside was very aesthetically pleasing and gives a modern feel to it. There is also a second floor where you can chill I believe. Bring your own glass bottle back and you get 10% off. There are better boba places in SF I wouldn't come back here.

excerpts: Literally my favorite boba/milk tea shop of all time.
Their menu is fairly small but simplicity works wonders for them.
Each time, I've ordered something different and they have always been consistent with their drinks since I've liked everything so far.
Usually at other boba places, it's a hit or miss and some drinks on the menu are great
milk tea.author: Phuong T.
milk tea.review:
Literally my favorite boba/milk tea shop of all time. Their menu is fairly small but simplicity works wonders for them. Each time, I've ordered something different and they have always been consistent with their drinks since I've liked everything so far. Usually at other boba places, it's a hit or miss and some drinks on the menu are great and some are subpar. 

I've also tried their waffles and takoyaki and both were delicious.

I love how you get the complimentary glass bottles unlike other places where they charge you. Bring back the bottle and save 10% off your order. 

The place is extremely small even with upstairs seating. I wish they had a location in the East Bay but it's relatively close walking distance wise from Union Square if you're in the area.

excerpts: They have a lot of options, but I settled on their milk slush with boba and their taro milk tea with boba.
I always get 0% sugar, and it was hard for them to give me no sugar.
It isn't a problem, since I understand that a lot of boba spots pre-mix or prep their teas (like taro tea is notorious) beforehand.
milk tea.author: Jodi H.
milk tea.review:
When you're in SF, there are plenty of boba options...but I kept on hearing about these fancy plentea glass bottles that you could take away with you, so I ventured here on a late afternoon.

They have a lot of options, but I settled on their milk slush with boba and their taro milk tea with boba. I always get 0% sugar, and it was hard for them to give me no sugar. It isn't a problem, since I understand that a lot of boba spots pre-mix or prep their teas (like taro tea is notorious) beforehand. So I wasn't bummed, but told them that I didn't like my tea too sweet. 

There wasn't a long line, but we waited for a while...10-15 minutes for two drinks. Their glassware truly makes the tea seem very special, but once you strip that part away...their bubble tea is very creamy, milky, and on the sweeter side :\ I'm a big fan of Taiwanese style boba, and plentea just didn't do it for me. I could see why millenials love this place (snapchat/insta purposes), but their quality of tea barely had a tea flavor...and I wouldn't go out of my way to (impossibly) park near Chinatown to get plentea. I can go to uber sweet Purple Kow if I want my cup of sweetness.

Oh, and they also use FIVESTARS!

excerpts: It's a long wait for milk tea/milk coffee drinks.
This place is pretty popular so maybe they are known for different drinks, but that day I was looking for your basic milk tea with boba
milk tea.author: Matt K.
milk tea.review:
It's a long wait for milk tea/milk coffee drinks.  Their novelty is that they serve your drink in a milk glass container that you get to keep.

I didn't think it was worth the wait.  The line is long to order, and then after you order you also have to wait awhile to get your drink.  The portion is big, but the taste is just ok.  

I enjoyed my milk container, but my drink wasn't very good and so it was just a lot of liquid that ended up finishing without being super impressed.

This place is pretty popular so maybe they are known for different drinks, but that day I was looking for your basic milk tea with boba and I've definitely had better elsewhere.

It's a trendy place to check out, but I won't crave coming back.

excerpts: I usually get the ice milk tea with brown sugar.
This is soooo delicious, perfect balance between sweet and tea, and there's something about the brown sugar part that's so good!!
The hot almond milk tea also has lots of flavor, must try during a cold night.
The matcha tea is kind of gross, Doesn't taste like the matcha from...
Like.. Sbux..
That I love...
There's plenteaaa of seats and an upstairs as well, but the loud music and bustling baristas don't make this a good work place- nice spot to drink boba and chill.
Took away a star bc
I hate places that makes you purchase a minimum in order to use your cc!
C'mon guys!
milk tea.author: Maria C.
milk tea.review:
Love this tapioca spot! For about 5$ you get your drink and a cute, glass milk jug, which you can bring in next time for a slight discount (10%). It's nice that there's only one size to the drinks as well. 
I usually get the ice milk tea with brown sugar. This is soooo delicious, perfect balance between sweet and tea, and there's something about the brown sugar part that's so good!! The hot almond milk tea also has lots of flavor, must try during a cold night. The matcha tea is kind of gross, Doesn't taste like the matcha from... Like.. Sbux.. That I love...
There's plenteaaa of seats and an upstairs as well, but the loud music and bustling baristas don't make this a good work place- nice spot to drink boba and chill. 
Took away a star bc I hate places that makes you purchase a minimum in order to use your cc! C'mon guys! It's 2016

excerpts: I've tried a few drinks, and I've got to say that their milk tea is actually pretty average.
I do like the Honey Lemon tea a lot though.
It's not too sweet and super refreshing.
Their boba is chewy and nice SOMETIMES.
It changes everytime I come here.
Boba wise, I prefer Boba Guys's a lot more.
Overall, I generally wouldn't come here unless my friends do.
The best part about Plentea is just how cute and aesthetics everything is (including the bottle!).
milk tea.author: Diane Z.
milk tea.review: I've been here at least 5 times, and each time it's a pretty good experience! I've tried a few drinks, and I've got to say that their milk tea is actually pretty average. I do like the Honey Lemon tea a lot though. It's not too sweet and super refreshing. Their boba is chewy and nice SOMETIMES. It changes everytime I come here. Boba wise, I prefer Boba Guys's a lot more. Overall, I generally wouldn't come here unless my friends do. The best part about Plentea is just how cute and aesthetics everything is (including the bottle!).

excerpts: I tried a bit of the classic milk tea here
and it was good,
but like everyone says it was pricey.

Also with the glass bottles, you have to stick around and can't really walk around with your bubble tea (plus, it's on the border between downtown and Chinatown so there isn't too much in the very immediate vicinity).
The line was also very long on a Saturday afternoon and it took a really long time for about 5 of us to wait and get our tea!
milk tea.author: Ziyan C.
milk tea.review: I tried a bit of the classic milk tea here and it was good, but like everyone says it was pricey. Also with the glass bottles, you have to stick around and can't really walk around with your bubble tea (plus, it's on the border between downtown and Chinatown so there isn't too much in the very immediate vicinity). The line was also very long on a Saturday afternoon and it took a really long time for about 5 of us to wait and get our tea!

excerpts: Milk Tea
every time he comes here; it's different and tastes amazing
and I guess he can't get enough?!
milk tea.author: Jamaica B.
milk tea.review:
Love this place! I'm not a big boba drinker because I'm so picky ... but this place is one of my top go to boba places.  I try something new every time I come here. Liked every single drink I've gotten so far. My boyfriend gets the Nutella Milk Tea every time he comes here; it's different and tastes amazing and I guess he can't get enough?! Lol. 

I think what sets this place apart from other boba places are their jars. They're unique (cus it has their logo on them), reliable (I squeeze my cups sometimes lol), and you can take them home (cus who doesn't love mason jars?!). Bring your jar back and get a discount on your order! 

Another plus is the aesthetic of the place. Come here with friends or come here alone to do some homework, it's great for either occasions. And lastly, location location location! Basically in the heart of the city. Walk a few more blocks up, you reach Chinatown. Walk a few blocks back, you reach the heart of downtown shopping! Hope this helps. Definitely a place to try!

excerpts: I was worried that Plentea is over-hyped due to its location and glass jars, but I enjoy their coffee milk tea and matcha red bean slush.
Their drinks are not overly sweet, you can definitely taste the tea flavor.
The coffee milk tea is so bold in coffee flavor, yet you can taste the milk tea at the same time, highly recommended!
milk tea.author: Karen C.
milk tea.review:
Drinks averaging at $5 is pricey for bubble tea, but using the yelp check-in 25% off discount make it a reasonable price. Otherwise, bring your old glass jar for 10% off. 

Whenever I come here it is always crowded. There are about 5 tables upstairs for seating, but most people get the drinks to-go. These are comfortable seats though, and it is a cutely decorated balcony area, definitely a great spot for taking a break.

I was surprised that the drinks are really good quality! I was worried that Plentea is over-hyped due to its location and glass jars, but I enjoy their coffee milk tea and matcha red bean slush. Their drinks are not overly sweet, you can definitely taste the tea flavor. The coffee milk tea is so bold in coffee flavor, yet you can taste the milk tea at the same time, highly recommended! 

Be warned the caps to the bottles are not tightly sealed, and will spill for sure if not placed upright. I will come back to try their fruit tea in the future!

excerpts: Their original milk tea and matcha latte are both yummy.
It's cool that they let you keep the glass jars.
milk tea.author: Di W.
milk tea.review:
I've been here twice and my experience has been enjoyable both times. The second time I visited, they were renovating part of the downstairs and all of the upstairs, so seating and waiting space was cramped. Their original milk tea and matcha latte are both yummy. It's cool that they let you keep the glass jars. Hot drinks are not served in the jars, only iced drinks.

Tip for Chase Sapphire Preferred and Reserve cardholders: This location uses Square to process payments, which does not process as Dining (confirmed by Chase customer service) so you will not receive your bonus earn here. I found out the hard way :(.

excerpts: I tried the milk tea with boba.
The milk tea is not overly sweet but rather has more a tea taste which I really enjoyed.
I then tried their thai tea since this is one of my FAVORITE drinks ever.
They did my favorite drink justice as it was not overly sweet and tasted pretty good.
I'm kind of picky when it comes to thai tea
so it says a lot when I enjoyed their thai tea.
I love the packaging and how they give their boba in glasses!
I washed mine out and kept it since I liked it so much.
It is a bit more pricier than other boba places
but I think it's worth it.
Definitely want to come back to try some of their other flavors as well!
milk tea.author: Julia K.
milk tea.review:
Been wanting to come here for awhile after seeing a photo of the cute glasses they give the boba in and finally got around to trying Plentea.
First time I came I tried the milk tea with boba. The milk tea is not overly sweet but rather has more a tea taste which I really enjoyed. 
I then tried their thai tea since this is one of my FAVORITE drinks ever. They did my favorite drink justice as it was not overly sweet and tasted pretty good. I'm kind of picky when it comes to thai tea so it says a lot when I enjoyed their thai tea.
I love the packaging and how they give their boba in glasses! I washed mine out and kept it since I liked it so much. It is a bit more pricier than other boba places but I think it's worth it. 
Definitely want to come back to try some of their other flavors as well!

excerpts: I love milk tea.
How can something as delicious as these two things together fail so miserably?
Well, it happened.
Both my fiance's and my drinks weren't good... they were actually pretty tasteless.
Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing?
(I was told the sea salt creama was the most popular drink, but I would never recommend it)!
My fiance had the nutella milk tea
and it was also pretty gross...
and how can you mess up anything with nutella?!?
I really hope this place gets their milk tea in check...
milk tea.author: Anastasia N.
milk tea.review:
I was SO excited to try this cute boba tea place out. As I was walking around the area to find the perfect lunch spot, I walked by this place and it screamed to me, "COME HERE FOR DESSERT AFTER YOU'RE DONE WITH LUNCH?" And so I did. I was so excited about finishing my lunch just so I can come here. Unfortunately, I wasn't satisfied at all.

The decor and the glass jars, LOVED IT. If not for that, I'd give this place 1 star. I love boba. I love milk tea. How can something as delicious as these two things together fail so miserably? Well, it happened. Both my fiance's and my drinks weren't good... they were actually pretty tasteless. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing? (I was told the sea salt creama was the most popular drink, but I would never recommend it)! My fiance had the nutella milk tea and it was also pretty gross... and how can you mess up anything with nutella?!? Yikes. 

I really hope this place gets their milk tea in check...

Also, be sure to check if there's actual boba in your drink. My fiance ordered the boba for an extra fee and they forgot to add it in. Too bad we realized that till after we already left the place.

excerpts: I ordered the CoffMilk Tea and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea.
The thing I love about this place is that for $4.50, you get milk tea in a glass container that you could end up keeping/reusing after finishing your drink.
The price is so cheap that I'm ended up questioning how they can possibly make a profit!!
milk tea.author: Alex L.
milk tea.review:
The venue is very nicely decorated, with little plants scattered around the store, giving it a very fresh and clean vibe. The store has enough seating for about 12 or 13 people at once. Menus (pictured below) are conveniently positioned above the cash register and there are PLENTY of deals/offers! At the time of this review, there is an offer of 15% off two drinks when checking in. 

I ordered the CoffMilk Tea and my friend got the Oolong Milk Tea. The thing I love about this place is that for $4.50, you get milk tea in a glass container that you could end up keeping/reusing after finishing your drink. The price is so cheap that I'm ended up questioning how they can possibly make a profit!! As if that wasn't enough, my friend noticed chalk writing on the wall stating that you could save 10% off on future purchases if you bring your own bottle (reuse the bottle) 

The service was very quick and efficient. I ordered and got my drink within 10 minutes. This is especially great during lunch hours because I recall this place being very packed during the day time.

excerpts: Tapioca is an obvious must, lychee jellies make the milk tea sweeter.
So if you like that, make sure to get some!
milk tea.author: Angel C.
milk tea.review:
Pretty good bubble tea but more expensive than the typical run-of-the-mill shops. It definitely has a hip San Francisco vibe where they use organic this and that. I love that they give you a milk jar for the tea! Super cute :) And yes, you can walk away with them. Though if you bring them back on your next visit, you can get a 10% off discount. You also get a 15% off of 2 drinks if you check in on yelp - nice deal if you came with a friend.

They have a nice variety of toppings you can choose from, much more than what Boba Guys offers. I usually get Tapioca and Lychee jelly. Tapioca is an obvious must, lychee jellies make the milk tea sweeter. So if you like that, make sure to get some!

excerpts: Pretty cool place even though hella expensive for milk tea.
$10 for bubble tea, really?
but I typically like my milk tea
this sway.
The appetizers and dessert was pretty meh
so I would advise against getting it.
I got the toast and the octopus balls and although they were fresh and well-made they didn't taste that great/filling.
milk tea.author: Kevin L.
milk tea.review:
Pretty cool place even though hella expensive for milk tea. $10 for bubble tea, really? I guess it's worth it since they serve it to you in a glass bottom that you can take home!

Flavor was kinda bland but I typically like my milk tea this sway. The appetizers and dessert was pretty meh so I would advise against getting it. I got the toast and the octopus balls and although they were fresh and well-made they didn't taste that great/filling.
