excerpts: I've tried their famous original Milk Tea and Sea Salt Milk Tea - both with boba and they're spot on!
milk tea.author: Annisa J.
milk tea.review:
This is my go-to boba tea place when I want something fresh and not overwhelmingly sweet - just the way I like it! I've tried their famous original Milk Tea and Sea Salt Milk Tea - both with boba and they're spot on!

Prices are relatively OK, one of the things that sets them apart from other boba teas is that they serve the tea in a glass bottle with "Plentea" embossed on it and they're serious about reusing it, meaning: if you come back for your future visits bringing the bottle, they'll give you 10% discounts for your purchase!

The store is not that big, but filled with enough seats. Most of the time they have long line, and I wish the store has a public restroom.

excerpts: This is an excellent marketing strategy, especially in the milk tea industry, because people who ordered can bring a little souvenir home and use it for themselves again.
Even though the number of regular tea options were greater than the number of milk tea options, I still wasn't disappointed.
I ordered the Thai Milk Tea with Boba (the milk tea I usually order when I go to a boba shop to test how the milk tea is) and it came filled up all the way to the top of the glass jar.
The taste and quality of the milk tea was just above average.
To be honest, I would rank it higher than Boba Guys (which I find overrated and average).
The blend of Thai Tea and the milk made it taste just about right; there was really nothing crazy about it.
milk tea.author: Eric O.
milk tea.review:
What drew me and my friends' attentions to this place were the glass jars/bottles they filled with your order of tea with and let you bring home. This is an excellent marketing strategy, especially in the milk tea industry, because people who ordered can bring a little souvenir home and use it for themselves again.

Even though the number of regular tea options were greater than the number of milk tea options, I still wasn't disappointed. I ordered the Thai Milk Tea with Boba (the milk tea I usually order when I go to a boba shop to test how the milk tea is) and it came filled up all the way to the top of the glass jar. The taste and quality of the milk tea was just above average. To be honest, I would rank it higher than Boba Guys (which I find overrated and average). The blend of Thai Tea and the milk made it taste just about right; there was really nothing crazy about it. The actual boba itself was also fresh and cooked well, which I enjoyed.

Would I come back? Yes. Do I need to come when I visit SF again? Maybe; personally, I would be fine with going to some other boba shop nearby because it wasn't mind-blowing enough to take my breath away and say "I must come back here again and again!". I'm not saying it sucks, but instead, it was nice and I was satisfied.

excerpts: I opted for a simple first order, and chose the black milk tea with tapioca.
I thought the milk tea was one of the best one I've ever tasted.
Otherwise, I definitely recommend trying the milk tea - you won't be disappointed!
milk tea.author: Regina L.
milk tea.review:
This place ALWAYS has a line, no matter what time of day it is. I've always been curious, but never patient enough to wait in line. But the other week, as I was walking down Kearny around 5pm, I walked by and say NO line! I quickly ran into and scanned the extensive menu. I opted for a simple first order, and chose the black milk tea with tapioca. Watching the drink get made was pretty interesting (giant funnel for the tapioca), and as much as talk about the glass bottles being a fad, it actually made a difference (perhaps not in taste, but just in overall experience). 

Pro tip: If you bring back the glass bottle, you get a 10% discount on your next drink. 

I thought the milk tea was one of the best one I've ever tasted. It was just the right amount of sweet, and the tea itself was very flavorful. 

The next time I walked by and there wasn't a line, I went in and ordered the same thing (I wasn't feeling very adventurous), and it was great the second time as well. 

My only criticism would be the lack of professionalism from the staff. Both time that I went, the staff were goofing off, having personal conversations with each other, and doing too many things at once. During my second time there, it felt like my presence was almost a burden, as it seemed the two team members would rather just continue their conversation than take my order. Otherwise, I definitely recommend trying the milk tea - you won't be disappointed!

excerpts: Got the Oolong milk tea w red bean which was pretty much standard for me.
The glass bottles are a cool touch (and a super environmentally friendly add-on for the environmentalists and hipsters in SF).
I don't think it's worth $5-7 for a standard milk tea drink, but I guess you can include the cost of a glass jar as well.
Went in for the experience and pretty much got what I needed.
Will prob go back, but most likely I wouldn't have my glass jar in my purse to whip out to reuse for 10% off haha
milk tea.author: Tiffany Z.
milk tea.review:
This place is a really cool boba spot in DTSF w their upstairs seating inside. Got the Oolong milk tea w red bean which was pretty much standard for me.  The glass bottles are a cool touch (and a super environmentally friendly add-on for the environmentalists and hipsters in SF). 
I don't think it's worth $5-7 for a standard milk tea drink, but I guess you can include the cost of a glass jar as well.  Went in for the experience and pretty much got what I needed.  Will prob go back, but most likely I wouldn't have my glass jar in my purse to whip out to reuse for 10% off haha

excerpts: You can get your fancy flavors at i-Tea, but if you want black milk tea boba, Plentea is legit!
milk tea.author: Matt H.
milk tea.review: Great, basic boba in a reusable glass. Eco friendly is a big plus for me. You can get your fancy flavors at i-Tea, but if you want black milk tea boba, Plentea is legit!

excerpts: However, I did try the matcha milk tea with lychee jelly, it was good, it's not the best that I've ever tried
but it was still good.
I still like the concept of the glass bottles that  they give you and how you get to keep it.
milk tea.author: Jane S.
milk tea.review:
It's been about 1-2 years since the last time I've been here (I use to go here more often) and I decided to come back today since I haven't been here in a while.The place changed, it's not like how it use to be anymore. 

I liked it before when they had more options to choose from for milk teas and it seems like they got rid of like half of their milk teas. However, I did try the matcha milk tea with lychee jelly, it was good, it's not the best that I've ever tried but it was still good. I still like the concept of the glass bottles that  they give you and how you get to keep it. Also with their new menu, they got rid of their food.

Plus they upgraded the place, so their upstairs changed. I felt that the vibe use to be more open and comfortable to sit in. Their walls use to have see through bars where you could sit and see everything from downstairs. Now they put a concrete wall where you can't see anything at all when you're sitting down. Plus the plain grey concrete wall makes it more boring and depressing to sit at. Also, they use to have couches and plants to give the area a more welcoming and appealing  look. Now it's just plain wooden tables and chairs.
However, the downstairs interior did look fine. 

I miss the old Plentea, I wouldn't be coming back anymore because of their new upgrade.

excerpts: I asked about their most popular drinks and was recommended to try their original milk tea.
I ended up ordering a black milk tea with lychee jelly at 50 percent sweetness.
milk tea.author: Nancy T.
milk tea.review:
I've been to Plentea twice so far and haven't been impressed by the drinks either time. The second time I stopped by was a couple of days ago and honestly, the drinks from this place would probably be worth only 2 stars but the fact that you get your drink in a cute glass bottle (that you get to keep) deserves an extra star.

I asked about their most popular drinks and was recommended to try their original milk tea. I ended up ordering a black milk tea with lychee jelly at 50 percent sweetness. Unfortunately, the drink tasted watered down and diluted instead of just with the sugar content adjusted. 

However, the lychee jelly was good! Definitely recommend that as a topping to try. I'd probably only stop by again if I wanted to get another jar. It's about $5 for the drink + the jar which is really decently priced. I didn't try it myself but my friend got one of their coffee milk teas and said it was pretty good so try exploring some other options on the menu other than their original milk teas!

excerpts: I have never heard of a milk tea spot with no restroom.
That is a major red flag for me.
Really wanted to give this place a 1 star because I really needed to use the restroom.
Employees sent me to a parking garage that apparently had a restroom.
Never found the parking garage?
Or I think I found the parking garage
but it was closed
/locked up?
Do people just grab and bounce for the milk tea here?
Or do people actually sit down and socialize here?
Because I am more of the person who like to sit down and socialize at the milk tea place that I go to.
milk tea.author: Cecilia N.
milk tea.review:
Location is in a very high traffic street. No parking close by that I know of. Luckily this place is close to the BART. We came here specifically to use a restroom. We bought our drink (Thai Tea) and asked for the restroom. Turns out there was no restroom. I have never heard of a milk tea spot with no restroom. That is a major red flag for me. Really wanted to give this place a 1 star because I really needed to use the restroom. Employees sent me to a parking garage that apparently had a restroom. Never found the parking garage? Or I think I found the parking garage but it was closed/locked up? Anyways, we had to go to another place and buy something there to use the restroom. 

So I wonder: Do people just grab and bounce for the milk tea here? Or do people actually sit down and socialize here? Because I am more of the person who like to sit down and socialize at the milk tea place that I go to. And if that place does not have a restroom, I am definitely never coming back again. 

upside of Plentea: 
nice clean decor
glass boba bottles

downside of Plentea: 
no restroom?!?!?!?!
expensive (due to the glass bottle) 

Tips for Plentea:
Please offer a restroom for your customers. 
You have lost a customer here. 

OVERALL: Drinks are actually decent but really expensive due to the glass bottle. There's no restroom. Good luck trying to find a toilet around Plentea. I don't recommend this place because the lack of a restroom.

excerpts: To be fair, I got a soy milk substitute but the other drink I ordered was the nutella special milk tea which wasn't creamy at all.
The vibe of the restaurant is cute and chic but not worth the hype.
The drinks came out fast and there was no wait, and there was ample seating both upstairs and downstairs.
Since I have two glasses now, I probably won't be back.
milk tea.author: Erika N.
milk tea.review: I've been here twice in the past 4 years and both times were really just okay. Save yourself the $5 (unless you really want that glass jar) - or at least make sure to check in for the discount off two drinks. The milk teas are really watered down and didn't taste good. To be fair, I got a soy milk substitute but the other drink I ordered was the nutella special milk tea which wasn't creamy at all. The vibe of the restaurant is cute and chic but not worth the hype. The drinks came out fast and there was no wait, and there was ample seating both upstairs and downstairs. Since I have two glasses now, I probably won't be back.

excerpts: 25% off when you check-in using Yelp, a black milk tea, Thai milk tea, and a takoyaki came up to about $12.25.
Anywho, the milk tea was great, didn't taste watered down, and it was my first time actually liking something similar to Thai ice tea.
The boba were pretty chewy and small.
milk tea.author: Nancy H.
milk tea.review:
TAKOYAKI! In the most unassuming place, with long lines, and drinks served in glass bottles, I found the takoyaki I've been searching for. 

25% off when you check-in using Yelp, a black milk tea, Thai milk tea, and a takoyaki came up to about $12.25. Your order number gets called loudly for drinks but they just put my food order on the counter without calling the number loudly like they did for drinks.

Anywho, the milk tea was great, didn't taste watered down, and it was my first time actually liking something similar to Thai ice tea. The boba were pretty chewy and small. Overall, I guess we lucked out on well made drinks and stocked glass bottles. 

Now the takoyaki. Six amazing balls of goodness. It was actually crispy on the outside and soft and creamy on the inside. But wait there's more! Not one dinky piece of octopus was in it but TWO decently sized pieces of chewy octopus. If only it wasn't $5.25 for 6 pieces but one or two more. 

As usual your mileage may vary, but the bottles are cool and their drinks are creative, so it was worth a try.

excerpts: I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk.
My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea!
I wouldn't recommend this drink.
milk tea.author: Alesia C.
milk tea.review:
So, the first time I went to Plentea, they didn't have the glass bottles... the only reason why you go and try Plentea for the first time is so that you can Instagram those glass bottles! So I left, and decided to try my luck again later, and they did have the bottles!

I got the Nutella milk tea w/ less milk and more tea because my friend who got it before said it just tasted like chocolate milk. My drink still tasted like chocolate milk, I could barely taste the tea! I wouldn't recommend this drink. My friend got the strawberry black tea, and she liked it, I had a sip and it was good. There were real strawberry bits in it! If I ever came back to Plentea again, which I probably won't, but if I did, I'd try a fruit tea! We both got boba, and maybe the boba was just bad that day, but I wasn't a fan. It tasted pretty bland to me. 

I also think it's pretty expensive for a cup of boba, but I guess you're technically paying for the bottle too. You can save 10%, I believe, if you bring the bottle back and reuse it. 

Worth the try to see if you find something you like and the cute photo, but not worth the price in my opinion.

excerpts: If you like cute and dainty milk tea jars, this place is it!
I ordered the roasted oolong milk tea without any toppings (which are an additional .50 cents each) and it came in a very cute milk jar.
The caps for the jars are located right by the register, so make sure to grab one if you want to save your drink for later!
The drink itself was good, but nothing to write home about.
If you prefer a strong tea flavor, the roasted oolong milk tea is probably too mild.
milk tea.author: Robin C.
milk tea.review:
If you like cute and dainty milk tea jars, this place is it!

Located in Chinatown, the store is quite small but emanates a fresh and clean vibe with a color palette that consists of light woody browns, black chalkboards, and accents of green potted plants. A cozy place to chill if you can snag a seat from their limited seating selection. 

I ordered the roasted oolong milk tea without any toppings (which are an additional .50 cents each) and it came in a very cute milk jar. The caps for the jars are located right by the register, so make sure to grab one if you want to save your drink for later! The drink itself was good, but nothing to write home about. If you prefer a strong tea flavor, the roasted oolong milk tea is probably too mild. 

The service was quick and friendly! It only took about 5 minutes before my drink was ready. Granted, I was only there in the evening so I can't speak much for overall service time! 

If you're visiting the city, this is a great place to stop by for a drink as well as the milk jar souvenir!

excerpts: First timer here at Plentea and went with the matcha milk tea (no toppings) because it's one of their top drinks.
milk tea.author: Jennifer T.
milk tea.review:
First timer here at Plentea and went with the matcha milk tea (no toppings) because it's one of their top drinks. 

Pros: 
1) Strong tea essence 
2) It smells so great and of .. strong .. tea 

Cons: 
1) Too sweet! I'm not sure if you can adjust the sweetness but I would definitely recommend to do so
2) Definitely on the $$$$$$ side of boba because of their glass bottles 

I had a couple swigs of my sister's peach green tea and I would rather get that if I was in the area again! 

Pros: 
1) Strong tea used
2) No overbearing sweetness 
3) Peach chunks were sweet and added a nice touch 

Cons: 
1) Pretty basic and easy to make at home (is that a con I would consider it more of a pro but you do you) 
   1a) Because it's so basic I probably wouldn't get this now that I think about it, but it is a refreshing and light drink!

excerpts: Wifey's favorite place for boba milk tea.
Boba is a must with her tea.
Showed up right when they opened and was informed boba will not be ready for another 30 minutes.
As a business, unacceptable.
milk tea.author: Brian H.
milk tea.review: Wifey's favorite place for boba milk tea. Boba is a must with her tea. Showed up right when they opened and was informed boba will not be ready for another 30 minutes.As a business, unacceptable.

excerpts: If you're into something really sweet, I like the ice milk tea with caramel & egg pudding and boba.
milk tea.author: Payal R.
milk tea.review: If you're into something really sweet, I like the ice milk tea with caramel & egg pudding and boba.

excerpts: I love how the milk tea comes in a glass bottle (and a secure lid for it, too!)
The taste is average, but the boba is decent.
I ordered the Fruit Milk tea (honeydew) with boba.
milk tea.author: Nina M.
milk tea.review:
I love how the milk tea comes in a glass bottle (and a secure lid for it, too!)
The taste is average, but the boba is decent.  It's not too hard or too soft. 

I ordered the Fruit Milk tea (honeydew) with boba.

excerpts: I visited Plentea for the first time Saturday afternoon and was very impressed with the quality of the milk tea.
The Nutella milk tea with boba was excellent and I loved the glass jar approach.
Customer service was friendly and efficient.
Highly recommend Plentea for boba!
milk tea.author: Christina T.
milk tea.review: I visited Plentea for the first time Saturday afternoon and was very impressed with the quality of the milk tea.  The Nutella milk tea with boba was excellent and I loved the glass jar approach.  Customer service was friendly and efficient.  Highly recommend Plentea for boba!

excerpts: The first drink we tried was the Mango Milk Tea.
It didn't taste very mango or really tea.
I felt like it was just a very sweet milk tea with the slightest hint of mango at the end.
milk tea.author: Helen W.
milk tea.review:
I passed by Plentea last time I was in SF, but since I was trying Boba Guys, I passed on Plentea. However I've been thinking about this place since then, and finally got a chance to go back.

The store is very cute, with the wood decor wall on one side,and the chalkboard on the other side. Their signature bottle motif is continued throughout the store, including a fish in the middle bottle on the wall! There is a decent amount of seating for such a small store because you can go to the upstairs.

We ordered two drinks to take advantage of the 15% off deal on Yelp, but our total still came out to $9+, even without toppings. This is an incredibly steep price, but is justified by the glass bottles you get to keep. However, if you're not into that, I have no idea if there are plastic/cheaper alternatives. I definitely had some friends in our group who would've preferred going somewhere cheaper.

The first drink we tried was the Mango Milk Tea. It didn't taste very mango or really tea. I felt like it was just a very sweet milk tea with the slightest hint of mango at the end.

The other drink we tried was the Lavender Lemonade. This is carbonated in case you were hoping for the more classic drink. It was also very sweet, and I didn't actually taste much of the lemonade flavor. It was refreshing though.

Overall, the main draw of Plentea is definitely the cute bottles. However that translates into higher prices, which fail to be justified by the drinks themselves. These had a tendency to be on the sweeter side, and we're lacking in fruit flavors. 

If you do decide to come back, bring your bottle back and receive 10% off your order (no idea if it can be stacked with the yelp deal).

excerpts: Tried the mango slush (3/5) and oolong milk tea with pearls (3/5).
milk tea.author: Tiffany L.
milk tea.review:
Finally got the chance to try this place out. I was surprised to see that they are open so late! Sharetea, my usual place was closing soon so I decided to drive a little extra to try Plentea out.

Tried the mango slush (3/5) and oolong milk tea with pearls (3/5).

The tea taste is sort of non existent. Perhaps it was late in the night and the batch was bad. 

I liked how the mango slush wasn't too sweet.

I know people love their glass jars but I found them cumbersome. I wouldn't want to walk around with it, it's kind of heavy and awkward to hold. Cute, but probably not that fun to carry around.

excerpts: Honestly, the basic black milk tea is the only drink I like getting here.
I've tried other things in the past, but they just don't taste very good.
If you just want a generic black milk tea with boba, this is the place to go.
If not, I would highly recommend checking out a different boba place in the area.
milk tea.author: Lakshmi M.
milk tea.review: Plentea has a lot of hype around it because of the glass bottles that you can take back for 10% off. However, I feel like their drinks really don't stand up to all of that hype. Honestly, the basic black milk tea is the only drink I like getting here. I've tried other things in the past, but they just don't taste very good. If you just want a generic black milk tea with boba, this is the place to go. If not, I would highly recommend checking out a different boba place in the area.

excerpts: Only reason I came to this place was because I was in area and searched up milk tea.
Although this place has 3 1/2 stars, I still came because... the jars... hehe.
milk tea.author: Donna H.
milk tea.review:
Eh... Only thing bout this place is the super cute decor and look of the place, plus they serve your drink in a jar. That's about it. The drinks have nothing special about it... They also take forrrrreverrrrrrrr making your drinks. Literally waited 20 minutes for my drinks (2). 

Only reason I came to this place was because I was in area and searched up milk tea. Although this place has 3 1/2 stars, I still came because... the jars... hehe.

excerpts: I didn't like the sea salt creama oolong Milk Tea as much, the creama just didn't fit to my taste at all.
I got it because it was a specialty drink, and it was pretty unique, since not many boba places have that drink.
milk tea.author: Annie Y.
milk tea.review:
The bottles and interior are gorgeous! The wait was decent, as it does get a little crowded if everyone just sits and waits there, but they do have a upstairs section, which is really cool. The employees were really nice. The drinks were okay, I've tasted better, but it was a nice first time try here. Parking is really hard to find, since a lot of the meters are tow-away during certain hours. So you can either park at the parking lot, or find parking farther away and walk your distance here. I didn't like the sea salt creama oolong Milk Tea as much, the creama just didn't fit to my taste at all. I got it because it was a specialty drink, and it was pretty unique, since not many boba places have that drink. But other than the drink, everything else was pretty cool.

Recommendation(s):
None yet 

Visit Again: Willing to give it one more try
Recommend to Others: Maybe after my second try at this place

excerpts: I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and when I received my order I literally thought that I accidentally ordered chocolate milk...
I mean if you want some overly sweet/chocolatey milk with some fresh tapioca taste then this place is perfect!!!
While this place is trendy and cute in terms of decor and the glass bottles, I won't be coming back because of the chocolate-y milk tea and fish abuse :(
milk tea.author: Jacqueline T.
milk tea.review:
If you hate actual tea and love chocolate I highly recommend you come here! I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and when I received my order I literally thought that I accidentally ordered chocolate milk... I mean if you want some overly sweet/chocolatey milk with some fresh tapioca taste then this place is perfect!!! You know, aside from the fact that they also abuse their beta fish... (there was a tank at the counter as well as one on display on the wall and both were extremely dirty.)

While this place is trendy and cute in terms of decor and the glass bottles, I won't be coming back because of the chocolate-y milk tea and fish abuse :(

excerpts: I'm not so into milk tea
as sometimes it does a number on my stomach, so I usually go for the fruitier drinks plus tapioca.
I was happy to see Plentea had a honey apple tea option with tapioca.
I went for that, and it was so refreshing.
They give you your drink in these adorable glass bottles.
You can bring it back for a 10% discount next time.
The only thing is, the bottles are a bit heavy
so I think its weight actually discourages people from bringing back the bottles.
I'm an environmentalist, can you tell?
Customers probably keep coming back without bringing their bottles for re-use and have a pile of heavy bottles at their work desk or at home as a result.
Could Plentea consider re-designing their bottles so that they are durable yet light enough to encourage people to bring them back for multiple uses?
milk tea.author: Maile N.
milk tea.review:
I'm not so into milk tea as sometimes it does a number on my stomach, so I usually go for the fruitier drinks plus tapioca.  I was happy to see Plentea had a honey apple tea option with tapioca.  I went for that, and it was so refreshing.  They give you your drink in these adorable glass bottles.  You can bring it back for a 10% discount next time.  The only thing is, the bottles are a bit heavy so I think its weight actually discourages people from bringing back the bottles. I'm an environmentalist, can you tell?  :)  Customers probably keep coming back without bringing their bottles for re-use and have a pile of heavy bottles at their work desk or at home as a result.  Could Plentea consider re-designing their bottles so that they are durable yet light enough to encourage people to bring them back for multiple uses?  Thank you.

They also serve waffle sandwiches and HUGE salads. I want to try one of their sandwiches next time!

excerpts: but my favorite is the lavander lemonade and my favorite milk tea is the coffee milk tea.
The reuseable cups are kind of nice
but I feel like I never bring them back for the 10% discount
and they're hard to clean
so they're bad as household cups.
But aesthetic 10/10
milk tea.author: Richard X.
milk tea.review:
I really like the milk teas here, it's a little on the pricey side but it's never a bad option. I think the fruit teas are a bit too watery but my favorite is the lavander lemonade and my favorite milk tea is the coffee milk tea. 
The reuseable cups are kind of nice but I feel like I never bring them back for the 10% discount and they're hard to clean so they're bad as household cups. But aesthetic 10/10

excerpts: Aside from the interesting bottles that Plentea drinks come in, their milk tea quality was a bit lacking.
On my most recent visit, I ordered their house blend black milk tea, and it had a rather strange strong burnt aftertaste.
Not sure what it was, maybe the tea was a bit over roasted or something.
milk tea.author: Alvin W.
milk tea.review: Aside from the interesting bottles that Plentea drinks come in, their milk tea quality was a bit lacking. On my most recent visit, I ordered their house blend black milk tea, and it had a rather strange strong burnt aftertaste. Not sure what it was, maybe the tea was a bit over roasted or something.

excerpts: I tried the classic milk black tea with boba, and the milk tea tasted terrible.
I think there was way too much creamer in it.
And I did not care for the quality of the boba.
After taking a few sips, I had to pour my drink down the drain.
At least I have a nice glass out of it.
milk tea.author: Rachel H.
milk tea.review: I will admit I was most excited about the glass cups, and unfortunately, that's the only thing that's good about this place. I tried the classic milk black tea with boba, and the milk tea tasted terrible. I think there was way too much creamer in it. And I did not care for the quality of the boba. After taking a few sips, I had to pour my drink down the drain. :( At least I have a nice glass out of it. :)

excerpts: Plentea is a must-go place for milk tea and chilling.
The bad: Their milk teas aren't too sweet for people who are used to milk tea places that have sweetness adjusting levels (Ex.
milk tea.author: Michael L.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is a must-go place for milk tea and chilling.

The good: The japanese food there such as unagi and takoyaki are a MUST TRY, especially for avid food adventurees and people who want to explore other cultures. Also, their drinks seem pretty natural and healthy tasting, plus their glass bottles can be taken home and kept (Which is way better for the environment than plastic cups).

The bad: Their milk teas aren't too sweet for people who are used to milk tea places that have sweetness adjusting levels (Ex. Cool Tea Bar or Pekoe).

The ugly: The decor, from when I went into the place, was still under construction and was littered with cardboard boxes. They took up much space and was a distraction of enjoying the decor.

Overall, it was a great stop just to hang and chill after an exhausting day in SF. I recommend the place, thus giving the rating it deserves.

excerpts: Taro Milk Tea with Taro Pudding.
milk tea.author: Yayrim K.
milk tea.review:
+ Drank: Taro Milk Tea with Taro Pudding. Their drinks, alone, are 5 stars.

+ Free WiFi: Check the wall (to your right) when you walk in. Password was written on there somewhere.

+ Space: The seating is very limited. There are a couple tables on the main floor & upstairs, there are 3-4 bigger tables with ottomans. Got lucky & found a table upstairs, where I was able to work on my laptop for an hour. 

+ No bathrooms :/

+ Employees: On the few occasions I've visited here, they've been kind & service was pleasant. There was one time I walked in 15min before closing time on a Friday night- dey waz STILL all smileyz. That is pretty rare.

+ Wait Time: 6-7 minutes.

+ Glass Jar ("bottle"): You get to keep the glass jar your boba tea is served in. They look pretty sweet. Along the left side of the cashwrap counter, they had (not sure if it's still there) a few jars that were made into DIY mini-terrarium/zen garden-looking display decorations. I thought that was pretty creative. Might have to try that with mine sometime. 

+ Location: Located on the left side of Kearny Street (one-way street w/ a few lanes). 

+ Parking: It's a busy area but there usually is a few street parking spots available on Kearny. (the times i've visited are between 8pm-10:45pm)

excerpts: She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea
and I remember enjoying it.
I wouldn't bother with the food.
I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever.
milk tea.author: Lincy H.
milk tea.review:
I really wanted to like this place because of their hipster glass jars.

I came here twice. The first time was decent. The girl who helped me was sweet. She suggested brown sugar ice milk tea and I remember enjoying it. I wouldn't bother with the food. I had the salmon waffle sandwich and it was whatever. I only got it cause I was hungry, but I could have definitely done without it.

Second time, I got the sea salt creama oolong tea. I'm usually easily satisfied with most boba drinks. I always finish my drinks... but I couldn't even bring myself to finish half of it. It just tasted blech. My boyfriend got an upset stomach from his drink and was not feeling so great for the rest of the night. Not only that, all of my friends and I agreed that we felt extremely parched after drinking their tea. Service was whatever. The guys who work there could maybe smile once in awhile.

Both times, I did not get a glass jar because they ran out. Also, what happened to the discounted price when you don't get a glass jar? $5 for a crappy drink and whatever service?

I don't think I'll be back.

excerpts: The first time I went, I just got the jasmine milk tea which was really good.
You can totally taste the jasmine which i love.
The second time I went, I got the honeydew milk tea.
Before taking a sip, I thought it was kind of a weird combination, but it actually works.
The honeydew wasn't overpowering and it didn't taste like a fake syrup.
milk tea.author: Sophia Y.
milk tea.review:
Just when I thought SF couldn't get any more hipster... even the boba drinks are in glass milk bottles now! You can always opt for a plastic cup instead or return the bottle, but if I'm paying $5 for a drink, I'm keeping the cute bottle! It's actually a really cute place and event has a cool  upstairs loft area considering how small the place is. The first time I went, I just got the jasmine milk tea which was really good. You can totally taste the jasmine which i love. The second time I went, I got the honeydew milk tea. Before taking a sip, I thought it was kind of a weird combination, but it actually works. The honeydew wasn't overpowering and it didn't taste like a fake syrup. The teas tasted very natural, and now powdery. 

Overall, this place has good drinks. Kind of pricey though and I don't know if it's because of the glass bottles...

Protip: bring the bottle back for 10% off your next purchase!

excerpts: She offered a milk tea and a flavored tea.
I got a regular milk tea with pearls and a White Peach Green Tea.
The drinks were aesthetically pleasing in their glass jars that come with a lid if you choose to take it with you to have for later.
I didn't find anything particularly special with the milk tea, but loved the White Peach tea; it had finely chopped pieces of peach, well brewed tea and the boba was pretty good here.
milk tea.author: Janet N.
milk tea.review:
Known for their signature glass bottles and teas, your girl had to stop by especially when it was close in proximity to Sushiritto!

It being my first time, I let the cashier know and asked her recommendations. She offered a milk tea and a flavored tea. I got a regular milk tea with pearls and a White Peach Green Tea. The drinks were aesthetically pleasing in their glass jars that come with a lid if you choose to take it with you to have for later. I didn't find anything particularly special with the milk tea, but loved the White Peach tea; it had finely chopped pieces of peach, well brewed tea and the boba was pretty good here. My drink was refreshing, had natural peach flavor and no bitterness from the tea.

The shop itself is an Instagrammer's dream, v aesthetic, I mean just look at the glass jars ... if that doesn't make boba lovers and hipsters head over heels- I don't know what will.  Prices are also not that bad considering you get to keep the glass bottle. The service was a bit slow, they were currently cooking the boba pearls and there was already a line out the door.

Definitely would come back when in the Chinatown area and definitely try their other flavored teas.

excerpts: The best milk tea in SF hands down.
You can taste the freshness of the ingredients.
Real milk with real tea and the perfect level of sweetness.
The macha milk tea was even made with real matcha!
Incredibly friendly and patient staff and owner that took the time to help me chose a drink.
Would definitely be coming back
milk tea.author: Justin H.
milk tea.review: The best milk tea in SF hands down. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients. Real milk with real tea and the perfect level of sweetness. The macha milk tea was even made with real matcha! Incredibly friendly and patient staff and owner that took the time to help me chose a drink. Would definitely be coming back

excerpts: Ordered the Nutella milk tea with boba and egg pudding.
Didn't taste like Nutella.
Egg pudding had no flavor.
Boba was fresh.
Staff was friendly, helpful, fast and hard working!
Comes in a cute glass jar.
milk tea.author: Shanette F.
milk tea.review: It's good, nothing special. I would have liked a little more chocolate sauce. Ordered the Nutella milk tea with boba and egg pudding. Didn't taste like Nutella. Egg pudding had no flavor. Boba was fresh. Staff was friendly, helpful, fast and hard working! Comes in a cute glass jar. :)

excerpts: However, my drink was just not good for a basic milk tea.
By all means come here if you want a glass bottle (I'm using it), but it's nothing crazy in terms of milk tea.
milk tea.author: James H.
milk tea.review:
I came here around 3pm on Friday with a couple of friends. I waited around 20 minutes until I made it to the front of the line. My drink, Black Tea with Boba, came out very quickly. I did like the quick service and how the interior of Plentea looked. However, my drink was just not good for a basic milk tea. The printer also didn't print my friend's ticket, so she didn't get her drink until she pressed the guys behind the counter about it. 

By all means come here if you want a glass bottle (I'm using it), but it's nothing crazy in terms of milk tea.

excerpts: I ordered an Oolong almond milk tea with taro pudding.
It was delicious!
The oolong and almond made a surprising fruit like flavor that I really enjoyed.
Sister had the Nutella milk tea, which we both agreed tasted like chocolate milk.
We hoped for a more hazelnut flavor.
Line went out the door but the drinks came out pretty quick.
milk tea.author: Janice G.
milk tea.review: I ordered an Oolong almond milk tea with taro pudding. It was delicious! The oolong and almond made a surprising fruit like flavor that I really enjoyed.  Sister had the Nutella milk tea, which we both agreed tasted like chocolate milk.  We hoped for a more hazelnut flavor.  Line went out the door but the drinks came out pretty quick.

excerpts: My friends & I have even tried their regular milk tea & matcha milk teas.
All good.
I've had better matcha, but overall this place is great!
Of course I'd come back.
Haven't had the chance to try their food, but maybe soon.
Save your glass bottles & save $ if you come back!
milk tea.author: Stephanie A.
milk tea.review: It's probably good I don't live/work in SF because they would know my boba addicted self by now.. Lol. Fresh, high quality ingredients. Decor inside is cozy, modern, & the upstairs hang out area is a nice spot to chill in. Hate that they don't have a public restroom though.. Esp if you're loading your bladder with delicious infused tea. Lol. Yes it's a luxury item, but man oh man when you treat yo self-- this place sure does treat ya tastebuds right! I'm loving their salted caramel & fresh blueberry smoothies. My friends & I have even tried their regular milk tea & matcha milk teas. All good. I've had better matcha, but overall this place is great! Of course I'd come back. Haven't had the chance to try their food, but maybe soon. Save your glass bottles & save $ if you come back!

excerpts: I ended up getting the coffee milk tea
, my friend got the matcha milk tea.
Honestly, it was okay.
milk tea.author: Akash P.
milk tea.review:
Came here after a lunch at Sushirrito on a Friday at ~1:45 PM.

This place was pretty crowded. As in the line was kind of long, but did not take long at all. Most people also just grabbed their boba and left, meaning there was a good amount of seating, especially up stairs.

I ended up getting the coffee milk tea, my friend got the matcha milk tea. Honestly, it was okay. I am not sure why there are so many people going here.

Not much to really say besides there are better places to get boba in SF. Sorry Plentea, not a fan at all. Not BAD, but not GOOD either.

excerpts: They messed up my order, so I am drinking an Oolong Milk Tea sadly.
I asked the nice, female cashier if this was my Oolong drink order and she said it was right.
I even held up the receipt that said "Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea" and she still said it was right.
I thought, "Wow they must already shake up the sea salt cream and tea for their customers beforehand.
There is a huge difference between a Sea Salt Cream Oolong and a regular Oolong Milk Tea.
My mistaken Oolong Milk Tea was pretty tasty
but it wasn't what I wanted.
50% Sweet was sufficient; 75% Sweetness is probably my max (25% - 100% Sweetness level offered).
The boba honey pearls were extremely chewy and saturated in the middle.
I probably got the bottom of the bucket of an old batch, blergh.
I don't mind giving them a try again but my distasteful experience only merits a generous 3 Stars.
milk tea.author: Donna T.
milk tea.review:
**Boba Princess Approval PENDING**

QUICK TIPS:
+ Card allowed for $10+ orders
+ Cute jars comes with drinks!
+ 10% discount every time you bring your Plentea jar back
+ NO Restrooms for customers! x_x
+ Food/dessert menu available (sandwiches, salad, waffles, cakes)

:( I am typing this as I am sipping my Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea...NOT! They messed up my order, so I am drinking an Oolong Milk Tea sadly. I asked the nice, female cashier if this was my Oolong drink order and she said it was right. I even held up the receipt that said "Sea Salt Cream Oolong Tea" and she still said it was right. I thought, "Wow they must already shake up the sea salt cream and tea for their customers beforehand." o___o

Now perusing through Yelp, I AM SO MISTAKEN! How can they cheat me out of my drink, such injustice! So DOUBLE TRIPLE check your drinks before you leave. Don't be shy and ask! There is a huge difference between a Sea Salt Cream Oolong and a regular Oolong Milk Tea. Sad Face :(

What's there to say? Come for the cute-tastic jars of course! There is no Rewards System because they give you the glass jars and returning with the jar gives you 10%, pretty sweet deal if you frequent Plentea often. Cash/card accepted. There's also a limited menu of food items (sandwiches and waffles) as well, and although the drinks are slightly pricier, I don't mind the glass jars for my drinkware collection. 

Overall, the teas are authentic and pretty decent. My mistaken Oolong Milk Tea was pretty tasty but it wasn't what I wanted. 50% Sweet was sufficient; 75% Sweetness is probably my max (25% - 100% Sweetness level offered). The boba honey pearls were extremely chewy and saturated in the middle. I probably got the bottom of the bucket of an old batch, blergh. I don't mind giving them a try again but my distasteful experience only merits a generous 3 Stars.

excerpts: I ordered the ice milk with caramel and my boyfriend got the milk tea flavor.
Both were chilled to a perfection.
The ice milk was sweet but overly frothy.
The milk tea was simple - very classic.
Their boba was chewy, no complaints there.
The drinks weren't astonishingly amazing, but who knows?
It felt like I paid $5 for three gulps...
milk tea.author: Celestine A.
milk tea.review:
Confirmed: the hype is more because of the glass bottles than the actual boba.

I ordered the ice milk with caramel and my boyfriend got the milk tea flavor. Both were chilled to a perfection. The ice milk was sweet but overly frothy. The milk tea was simple - very classic. Their boba was chewy, no complaints there. The drinks weren't astonishingly amazing, but who knows? It felt like I paid $5 for three gulps... Even with the Yelp check-in discount, two drinks brought the bill above $10. 

There's a few tables and seats downstairs but it looks like upstairs is for those hoping to either study or lounge around. The place is very cutesy from the decor to the glass bottles to how "cute" that they think this size isn't a rip-off.

excerpts: I accidentally dropped my glass & spilled the whole glass of milk tea on floor.
The employees quickly cleaned the floor & made me another one for free!
Also, the glass bottle didn't break.
Five star service & drinks.
milk tea.author: Yilei S.
milk tea.review: I accidentally dropped my glass & spilled the whole glass of milk tea on floor.  The employees quickly cleaned the floor & made me another one for free!  Also, the glass bottle didn't break.  Five star service & drinks.

excerpts: Ordered the Black Milk tea with boba.
Tasted pretty disgusting, did not like at all.
I even asked the cashier to recommend what drink was good and/or popular and she listed the Black milk tea as one of the best.
milk tea.author: Mickey B.
milk tea.review:
Ordered the Black Milk tea with boba. Tasted pretty disgusting, did not like at all. I even asked the cashier to recommend what drink was good and/or popular and she listed the Black milk tea as one of the best. 

The only positive was the cool drinking bottle and upstairs seating.

excerpts: I went with a classic milk tea just to get a feel for the place, and it was so delicious!
I live on the east coast, so
unfortunately I won't get a chance any time soon to visit Plentea again, but a girl can still dream.
milk tea.author: Lisa L.
milk tea.review: My favorite thing about this place is that you get to keep the glass bottles. I already lost my plastic cap, but that just means I have to make a second trip. I went with a classic milk tea just to get a feel for the place, and it was so delicious! I live on the east coast, so unfortunately I won't get a chance any time soon to visit Plentea again, but a girl can still dream.

excerpts:
We ended up trying the:
+ Thai Milk Tea with boba:
Their boba is SO good!
It's the perfect size and so chewy.

They also put in the perfect amount - it's not like you're overly saturated with boba like some other places.. Totally would recommend this. 
+ Peach Oolong Tea:
Not bad!
milk tea.author: Rita Y.
milk tea.review:
Stopped by at 10:50pm right as it was about to close and there were still tons of people in here! My friend told me to stop by cause - glass jars come on. Your first check in you get 15% off your entire order. You can find street parking pretty easily (or at least at 10:50pm). 

We ended up trying the:
+ Thai Milk Tea with boba: Their boba is SO good! It's the perfect size and so chewy. They also put in the perfect amount - it's not like you're overly saturated with boba like some other places.. Totally would recommend this. 
+ Peach Oolong Tea: Not bad! The fruit bits inside were a bit sour for my taste but still tasty nontheless. 

I would definitely come by again if I'm in the area. Not sure if I would ever remember to bring the bottle back for the 10% off. I suppose it's time to start a collection of bottles.

excerpts: I love Milk Teas, but I must say this place's milk tea is not very good.
Tastes watered down and has a funky aftertaste.
I like the bottles they give honestly.
I would go somewhere else for better flavored milk tea.
But I like the Taro Milk with Taro pudding here
cause they use fresh taro.
Kind of too sweet, but tasty.
Parking is hard, but there's a lot around the block.
I still have to try their regular iced tea drinks.
milk tea.author: Edgar F.
milk tea.review:
Nice atmosphere. I love Milk Teas, but I must say this place's milk tea is not very good. Tastes watered down and has a funky aftertaste.  I like the bottles they give honestly. I would go somewhere else for better flavored milk tea. But I like the Taro Milk with Taro pudding here cause they use fresh taro. Kind of too sweet, but tasty. Parking is hard, but there's a lot around the block.
I still have to try their regular iced tea drinks.

excerpts: I ordered the Nutella milk tea and was worried it would be too sweet, but the sweetness wasn't too over the top.
milk tea.author: Marcia L.
milk tea.review:
Plentea takes one of my favorite things, boba tea, and puts it in a cute glass jar. Love it! 

The menu was a little bit confusing to me: you can customize the amount of sweetness on some drinks, but not others. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea and was worried it would be too sweet, but the sweetness wasn't too over the top.  

Approximately $6/drink after you add in a topping, such as boba.

excerpts: I had roasted oolong milk tea.
Tasted good, not too sweet.
It came in a glass bottle.
Pretty cool, but heavy to walk around with it.
You get 10% off next time you bring the bottle back.
milk tea.author: Stella S.
milk tea.review: I had roasted oolong milk tea.  Tasted good, not too sweet.  It came in a glass bottle.  Pretty cool, but heavy to walk around with it.  You get 10% off next time you bring the bottle back.

excerpts: so after consuming the delicious curry lunch from Muracci's Japanese Curry & Grill a few shops down the street, I noticed that Plentea was right there before me so I could totally quench my milk tea thirst for the day.
I ordered an Almond Milk Tea with 50% sweetened.
it was WAY too sweet (he didn't even want another sip of it.)
n
I really couldn't taste the tea flavor in it either.
there should b a balance between the tea n other additional flavors n not just an over abundance of the latter.
however, I'm interested in trying their other crema drinks
so I'm willing to give Plentea another shot.
I just hope I remember to bring my empty "milk bottle" next time I go to SF.
(most likely not.)
milk tea.author: Julie W.
milk tea.review:
so after consuming the delicious curry lunch from Muracci's Japanese Curry & Grill a few shops down the street, I noticed that Plentea was right there before me so I could totally quench my milk tea thirst for the day. 

the shop is located on Kearny Street. u can't miss it. the name of the shop is huge above the front door. the exterior has an urban rustic look with slabs of wood on the front n there's a large window which lets in light from the street. the interior is small with 3 small side tables while the second floor (at least there's a second floor.) has more a few more seats. 

one thing which I thought was kinda strange was that the restroom in the shop is only allowed for their employees to use. i mean the main thing u r selling is liquids n being filled up n having no place to relieve yourself doesn't make sense at all. they should at least let paying customers use it right?? 

on to their milk teas. they have a menu with pictures of each flavor of teas n also a small blackboard with the most popular ones written down. that's pretty helpful. I liked how each of their teas come in a cute glass bottle to take home n it's reasonably priced. (looks like an old style milk bottle.) if u come back with the empty bottle for them to refill the next time, it's 10% off. 

I ordered an Almond Milk Tea with 50% sweetened. it was WAY too sweet (he didn't even want another sip of it.) n I really couldn't taste the tea flavor in it either. there should b a balance between the tea n other additional flavors n not just an over abundance of the latter. however, I'm interested in trying their other crema drinks so I'm willing to give Plentea another shot. I just hope I remember to bring my empty "milk bottle" next time I go to SF. (most likely not.)

excerpts: 04/22/15 - I got the Fresh Fruit Milk Tea Avocado
and it's very milky.
I like not don't like how the avocado taste isn't strong.
milk tea.author: Nicole C.
milk tea.review:
I came here just because I wanted one of their cool glass bottles.

I came here around 4PM/5PM on a Saturday scared that they would run out of the bottles because apparently they only limit to giving out 300 a day now.

The line was out the dooooor...! But the wait surprisingly wasn't too long which impressed me. I ordered the Honeydew black fruit tea with glass jelly. It was almost $6 o__o so crazy...! But I guess you can save a bit if you reuse the bottle since you'll get 10% off your next order, but still - relatively expensive.

As for the drink itself - I wouldn't come all the way out near Chinatown to get this... It's pretty inconvenient to get here unless you live near by. But the taste wasn't too bad - very tea like (which I prefer). I liked how they put chunks of honeydew in my drink so it's legit and not just syrup!

There's not a lot of room in this place so if you're looking for a place to chill, come here early or plan accordingly after getting your boba fix.

04/22/15 - I got the Fresh Fruit Milk Tea Avocado and it's very milky. I like not don't like how the avocado taste isn't strong. But if you're looking for a creamy drink, this might be the one for you!

I also forgot, $10 minimum charge w/ credit cards... So bring cash!

excerpts:
- The jars that your drinks come in are free for you to take home, with an additional discount whenever you bring it back here.
- Their menu is simple, with milk tea, tea, special drinks, and snacks, like waffle sandwiches.
- They take card and cash.
milk tea.author: Jerianne G.
milk tea.review:
I've always seen loads of pictures of bottles of boba drinks on any form of social media and I wondered whether I'd ever see what Plentea was all about. Finally I had the opportunity to try the place out!

I'm giving it 3.5, but they don't do half stars so I guess 4 will do in this case.

Pros:
- Very simple interior, with two floors available for those who would like to stay in and hang out after getting their drinks.
- The jars that your drinks come in are free for you to take home, with an additional discount whenever you bring it back here.
- Their menu is simple, with milk tea, tea, special drinks, and snacks, like waffle sandwiches.
- They take card and cash.
- They provide caps for your bottles, so you are free to take it to-go.

Cons:
- Location is near a busy area, so looking for parking is like being in a scavenger hunt.
- Pretty pricey for one drink.
- Although it's discounted if you bring back your bottle, it's basically like paying for a drink at other places. 
- There's a minimum fee if you're using card.
- Despite being two floors, the place is pretty small and the line can get pretty long, so prepare to wait outside for a bit. 

Overall a decent boba place with a cute concept in putting drinks in bottles. It's O-K in my book, but it'll be a while before I return to this place.

excerpts: we tried matcha latte (cold), sweet taro milk, coffee milk tea (cold), and a strawberry fresh fruit tea (best out of allllladem).
matcha latte tasted like straight up milk with green dye.
sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby
, it had [REAL] taro bits that my friends did not like (I enjoyed the bits bc my love for taro has never relinquished), but other than that, sweet taro tasted like sweet milk.
coffee was p good I guess
, more mediocre tho.
iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee.
strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there.
the drink was kinda watery
, it's very lite on sweetness
but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth.
they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch.
overall nothing to get crazy about.
the bottles are glass and reusable
I believe.
matcha latte tasted like straight up milk with green dye.
sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby
, it had [REAL] taro bits that my friends did not like (I enjoyed the bits bc my love for taro has never relinquished), but other than that, sweet taro tasted like sweet milk.
coffee was p good I guess
, more mediocre tho.
iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee.
strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there.
the drink was kinda watery
, it's very lite on sweetness
but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth.
they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch.
overall nothing to get crazy about.
the bottles are glass and reusable
I believe.
milk tea.author: Grace N.
milk tea.review:
service was gr9, drinks were bleh

I came here with 4 friends and we all swapped/tasted drinks (I know-beware of mono) but they still all tasted so blannndd. crie.

we tried matcha latte (cold), sweet taro milk, coffee milk tea (cold), and a strawberry fresh fruit tea (best out of allllladem). matcha latte tasted like straight up milk with green dye. sweet taro milk wasn't toooo shabby, it had [REAL] taro bits that my friends did not like (I enjoyed the bits bc my love for taro has never relinquished), but other than that, sweet taro tasted like sweet milk. coffee was p good I guess, more mediocre tho. iono nothing special, just think of milk coffee. strawberry fresh fruit was aight but it was the best drink voted by all my friends there. the drink was kinda watery, it's very lite on sweetness but maybe bc I have a big sweet tooth. they put in fresh strawberry bits which was a nice touch. overall nothing to get crazy about. the bottles are glass and reusable I believe. you can grab a plastic cap on your way out to save the rest of your drink.

the store is super hip and cute tho. I guess you could come here for the IG pic and what not but I don't recommend plentea for da dranks. sowey

excerpts: I wish I wasn't afraid to try new things but luckily their green milk tea with boba was great.
milk tea.author: Stephanie N.
milk tea.review:
My friend recently moved up to NorCal and she was raving about the vibes here. Came around and tried it and it wasn't too busy for a Sunday afternoon. 

They offer samples if you're very indecisive like we are. I wish I wasn't afraid to try new things but luckily their green milk tea with boba was great. It comes in a cute and pretty big bottle with Plentea engraved into it. 

The prices are fair especially for the drinks coming in glass bottles. I got 15% off two drinks with their Yelp check in. 

Sat up in their little loft and there's plentea of seating (haha). They have cute decor which is extremely instagram worthy. 

They have some pretty good mainstream beats to keep the vibes going. I will definitely come back here when I visit!!

excerpts: The iced milk drinks are good and so is their oolong milk tea!
milk tea.author: Alyssa C.
milk tea.review:
The drinks are good but Ive had better, theyre also a little on the pricey side but at least you get to bring home the cute bottle and then receive a discount when you bring it back next time! 

The iced milk drinks are good and so is their oolong milk tea!

excerpts: I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea.
It wasn't too bland nor too sweet.
It was just right
:) the glass bottles it comes with was really cool.
One thing that bothered me was that they don't clean the spilled milk outside of the bottle when they put it at the counter for us to pick up.
So I would have to wipe it myself when I get it.
milk tea.author: Jenny N.
milk tea.review: This was my first time trying Plentea. I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea. It wasn't too bland nor too sweet. It was just right :) the glass bottles it comes with was really cool. One thing that bothered me was that they don't clean the spilled milk outside of the bottle when they put it at the counter for us to pick up. So I would have to wipe it myself when I get it.

excerpts: We had an almond milk tea, it tastes like they just mixed the almond powder with a little bit of tea and barely any milk.
I probably wouldn't come again, there are so many other milk tea places to choose from that this drink was overpriced and hyped up.
milk tea.author: Tiffany Y.
milk tea.review:
I came here with my friend after getting sushirrto, we were playing tourist since it was her first time in the city. 

They have enough seating upstairs for like 20 ppl in case you didn't want to cram into the small waiting area downstairs.  I think that plentea is popular for their glass jars, because their drinks aren't very sweet, milky, or creamy enough for my liking. We had an almond milk tea, it tastes like they just mixed the almond powder with a little bit of tea and barely any milk. It was super super lightly flavored. 

I probably wouldn't come again, there are so many other milk tea places to choose from that this drink was overpriced and hyped up.

excerpts: Unlike most boba places I had tried like boba guys and bubblecup, plentea milk tea is the best yet.
Their stores also have seats inside
so it's friendly welcome.
milk tea.author: Tina L.
milk tea.review: Wow, this boba place is by far the best one in San Fransisco yet. I got their milk black tea with boba and the drink is strong and delicious! Unlike most boba places I had tried like boba guys and bubblecup, plentea milk tea is the best yet. Their stores also have seats inside so it's friendly welcome.

excerpts: I ordered a black milk tea with boba.
When I go to boba places, I like to try the basic flavors because it is often an indication of the quality of tea and ingredients.
milk tea.author: Lydia H.
milk tea.review:
I came here after 4th of July fireworks and had a pretty good experience. There were about 5 people in line in front of my group of friends. 

The prices here are a little more than your average boba place. This is probably because the drink comes in a glass container that you get to keep.

I ordered a black milk tea with boba. When I go to boba places, I like to try the basic flavors because it is often an indication of the quality of tea and ingredients. I liked my drink a lot and the boba was really good. 

The interior of the place is modern and nice. When I visited, it was pretty late and they had already closed the upstairs so I was not able to see what it looked like.

Good tea. Good place. I would return. I'm not sure, but I hear that if you bring your bottle back, you can get a discount. I'll be coming back... With the bottle.

excerpts: I opted for the Almond Milk Tea but was right to be cautious.
It tasted very creamy and like it was made from powder.
I know a lot of places opt for the powder almond, but I still don't know why.
Not too sweet and didn't have the texture issue that I had with my Almond Milk Tea.
If you're in the mood for milk tea and want something nearby, by all means, stop in.
Just don't expect anything amazing from the experience.
milk tea.author: Alvin M.
milk tea.review:
My friends were craving some boba in SF and couldn't find a decent place open on a Sunday so we opted for Plentea because we were in the area.

The place had a nice area to sit in and relax or do work. The line was out the door, but didn't take long to get to the front. Maybe 5 minutes and another 5 minutes to get our order.

Sadly, the tea here is average at best. However, they do come in some pretty cool mugs (jars?)! Consolation prize, but at least it's not particularly expensive for a jar of tea. About $4.50-5.00 for a bottle. Not including any toppings at about 50c each.

I opted for the Almond Milk Tea but was right to be cautious. It tasted very creamy and like it was made from powder. I know a lot of places opt for the powder almond, but I still don't know why. It just doesn't taste nearly as good as the syrup form and the texture is just weird in tea form.

On the other hand, the Sea Cream Tea that my friend got tasted pretty good. Not too sweet and didn't have the texture issue that I had with my Almond Milk Tea.

If you're in the mood for milk tea and want something nearby, by all means, stop in. Just don't expect anything amazing from the experience.

excerpts: I will say that the prices are a bit disappointing if you get anything other than milk tea.
I ordered the strawberry smoothie and my total was a little over seven bucks.
There was nothing particularly special or different about the experience other than the bottle, which is admittedly cool, but there's no justification for the price, sorry.
milk tea.author: Angela M.
milk tea.review:
I caught the Plentea hype bug and decided I had to try it, given my addiction to boba. If you get out at the Montgomery Street BART station, it's a very quick walk to Plentea.

I got here around one, expecting a line out the door, a half an hour wait, and no glass bottle by the time I got to the counter; instead, there were only two people ahead of me and it was a very fast wait between order and drink completion. 

I will say that the prices are a bit disappointing if you get anything other than milk tea. I ordered the strawberry smoothie and my total was a little over seven bucks. There was nothing particularly special or different about the experience other than the bottle, which is admittedly cool, but there's no justification for the price, sorry. The smoothie was at least delicious, made with real strawberries (leaving chunks of berry in my drink, which was great) and a great combination with boba, and I think it's nice that you get a 10% discount if you bring your bottle back on your next visit.

Plentea gets an extra star for the pretty cool space, which has a loft area above the registers and has a clean, open, airy interior. But unless you manage to get a bottle on your visit, the boba isn't an experience worth as much as they charge. I'd like to come back and try the waffles here, and other snacks. A good drink, so if you're nearby definitely check it out.

excerpts: I personally took the basic route and went with a classic black milk tea with boba.
There's only one size for all of the drinks because they come in a nice hipster glass jar (but only for cold drinks) that you get to keep.
I give the actual bubble tea 3 stars
but I added another star because I liked the jar so much.
The milk tea was a little sweet in my opinion, and the bubbles were kind of small and not too flavorful.
It wasn't bad
but I've definitely had better.
They also let us sample a couple of different tea flavors in the beginning which was nice.
I liked the ambience of the upstairs seating area and the playlist they were playing!
milk tea.author: Rachel K.
milk tea.review: This place has a really wide variety of drinks, many I've never seen before. I personally took the basic route and went with a classic black milk tea with boba. There's only one size for all of the drinks because they come in a nice hipster glass jar (but only for cold drinks) that you get to keep. I give the actual bubble tea 3 stars but I added another star because I liked the jar so much. The milk tea was a little sweet in my opinion, and the bubbles were kind of small and not too flavorful. It wasn't bad but I've definitely had better. They also let us sample a couple of different tea flavors in the beginning which was nice. I liked the ambience of the upstairs seating area and the playlist they were playing!

excerpts: It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha.
milk tea.author: Stephanie H.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is another boba place I decided to run to along the Embarcadero. Obviously this was so I could more fairly compare it to Bottle Zup, which is a very similar boba shop. I also wanted to go running, but needed a motivator, so obviously the solution was to make a bubble tea shop the destination and boba my reward.

Unfortunately (for those who may have been pedestrians between my apartment and Plentea), I did not have the opportunity to run over a mile back home carrying a bottle full of boba in one hand and a bubble tea straw and my phone in the other, as I did when I visited Bottle Zup. This is partly because I was feeling lazy and the Montgomery Muni stop is nearby, and partly because Plentea only gives a plastic cap to cover the bottle, and I was afraid it wouldn't hold up under the stress of my running home.

As for the drink itself, the boba had a nice chewy consistency to it and was slightly sweet, but I am not a fan of the matcha latte. It wasn't too sweet, but the blend tastes more like jasmine green milk tea than matcha, but I am not a fan of the super-blended, mild-tasting matcha. I like my matcha strongly-flavored and textured, so this didn't quite hit the right note.

This place is pretty overpriced--I paid nearly $6 for my drink after tax, and had to pay in cash ($10 credit card minimum) which is a pain because it meant that I had to carry cash there while running and carry change back! The glass bottle is sturdy and slightly bigger than the one from Bottle Zup, but even if I bring it back for the 10% discount, I'm not sure it's worth it. I like the novelty of the glass bottle, but you could easily get the same for slightly better tea at Bottle Zup. The one thing Plentea does have going for it is that it stays open so late (until 11pm) which is super convenient in a city where so many places (specifically boba places) close so early.

excerpts: This is how my SO and I rate milk tea now.
Yes, the prices are higher than most milk tea places but you get to keep the glass bottle that comes with it.
The Thai Milk Tea is yummy too.
It's very creamy and light tasting.
The Black Milk Tea is just alright to me.
milk tea.author: Jenny Y.
milk tea.review:
"On a scale from 0 to Plentea, how good is it?"
This is how my SO and I rate milk tea now. 

We came here on a Sunday afternoon after finding out that Boba Guys was closed. Yes, the prices are higher than most milk tea places but you get to keep the glass bottle that comes with it. Besides, lattes cost this much but you don't ever hear anyone complaining!

The Matcha Red Bean Slush is delicious. Add egg pudding to that and you've got a matcha made in heaven (see what I did there?). 

The Thai Milk Tea is yummy too. It's very creamy and light tasting. The Black Milk Tea is just alright to me. The Takoyaki was also nice to snack on ($5.25 for 6).

Make sure you use the check in discount to get 25% off your order. Reusing your bottle gets 10% off as well, not sure if you can combine the discounts though. Oh, and no restrooms which sucks, cause you know what happens when you drink liquids...

excerpts: There's milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies, all with the option of boba.
I usually opt for the Thai milk tea with boba, perfectly sweet (maybe sometimes too sweet), the perfect afternoon picker-upper.
milk tea.author: Nique F.
milk tea.review:
Don't read my review if you're a molecular boba-ologist, because I really can't tell the difference between perfectly cooked boba and slightly under/overcooked boba, like some of you brilliant people. I just LOVE milky tea with little chewy balls in it! And Plentea makes exactly that, in cute reusable glass jars. So yeah, I'm a fan. 

I came here with a group of non-Californias, who had never seen/heard of/tasted boba before. Gasp! Thankfully, Plentea's menu makes it easy for novices to figure things out. There's milk tea, fruit tea, and smoothies, all with the option of boba. I usually opt for the Thai milk tea with boba, perfectly sweet (maybe sometimes too sweet), the perfect afternoon picker-upper. 

For about $4.50, it's not a bad habit. You get some kind of credit if you bring back your glass jar. Very smart for the environment AND for getting customers to come back and back again. 

Plenty of reasons to applaud Plentea!

excerpts: The oolong has a nice roasted flavor, and the green milk tea was refreshing and not too sweet.
milk tea.author: Steven V.
milk tea.review:
Cute bottles with boba and pretty quality drinks! The price is slightly more than most tea stands (over $5) but the glass is a nice souvenir that is functional and aesthetically pleasing.

I've tried the taro milk, oolong, and milk green tea and all were pretty solid. The boba was fresh everytime and sometimes warm and usually at a nice chwey consistency. The taro milk was made by blending fresh taro with milk into a nice creamy drink that captures true taro flavor. The oolong has a nice roasted flavor, and the green milk tea was refreshing and not too sweet.

If you have a bottle, you get 10% off for bringing it back! There's not too many places were you can keep the container so Plentea gets extra points for being a more unique boba bottle stop.

excerpts: Paying almost $5 for milk tea is pricey, but you are buying drinkware as well.
Service was alright; it had a hint of that hipster edginess and they didn't ask me about ice/sugar level preferences when I forgot to ask.
Also, be sure to grab a cap!
I got the iced milk tea with black tea, which turned out to be good
but not all too amazing--it might have been the creamer, but I thought there was a bit of a strange taste to the milk tea overall.
At least the jars are large size so there was Plentea of tea.
I've also heard that they run out of jars sometimes, so I guess it's not Plentea of jars (even though it's all 'bout that jar).
milk tea.author: Edna C.
milk tea.review:
It's all 'bout that jar, 'bout that jar, no tea.  

^I'm not a fan of that song either, but it quite accurately describes my thoughts on Plentea--it's one of those places that is an obligatory SF bucket list item, but once you've gone there, had your share of photographing the photogenic hipster jars, and now have the photogenic hipster jar in your cupboard, it's not really worth going back unless you are showing friends around SF and know that take-home photogenic hipster jars will make them happy.  

The storefront and ambiance are everything you'd expect, i.e. photogenic and hipster.  It seems a tad bit out of place in the more oldschool neighborhood as a shiny cafe boasting large, clean birch planks and a minimalist logo in an artsy font.  The birch accents extend to the interior, and together with the menu written on the chalkboard, the high stool seating, and half second level layout, it gives off a very clean and modern vibe.  

Perhaps an advantage of the chalkboard menu is that they can raise prices easily, because when I went the prices were slightly higher than what I had seen on Yelp.  Paying almost $5 for milk tea is pricey, but you are buying drinkware as well.  Service was alright; it had a hint of that hipster edginess and they didn't ask me about ice/sugar level preferences when I forgot to ask.  Also, be sure to grab a cap!  It's quite useful for the future use of the jar.

I got the iced milk tea with black tea, which turned out to be good but not all too amazing--it might have been the creamer, but I thought there was a bit of a strange taste to the milk tea overall.  At least the jars are large size so there was Plentea of tea.  I've also heard that they run out of jars sometimes, so I guess it's not Plentea of jars (even though it's all 'bout that jar).

excerpts: The hot milk tea was actually not bad.
Nothing stand out, but not bad.
Still insanely expensive though.
The second time I went, I was determined to do it right, so I got a pearl milk tea.
First of all... at $5.44 who has the money for milk tea that expensive???
I'd rather go down the street and at least get high quality pmt from Boba Guys or something.
I get that part of that money is paying for the bottle, but when the milk tea is really mediocre, $5.44 is ridiculous.
Honestly it tasted like $1 pmt you can get in Richmond.
Tea itself was very dilute and flavorless and the pearls were clumpy--i.e.
you'd bite down and find your teeth stuck.
No bounce at all, no flavor.
milk tea.author: Jasmine X.
milk tea.review:
I'm not a huge fan of this place. I ended up going because I wanted the glass bottle.. but beyond that novelty, there's really no reason in going. 

The first time I went, my friend and I both felt like hot milk teas before we thought about our experience and realized that hot drinks are not served in glass bottles. The hot milk tea was actually not bad. Nothing stand out, but not bad. Still insanely expensive though. Was about $4.50 for one.

The second time I went, I was determined to do it right, so I got a pearl milk tea. First of all... at $5.44 who has the money for milk tea that expensive??? I'd rather go down the street and at least get high quality pmt from Boba Guys or something. I get that part of that money is paying for the bottle, but when the milk tea is really mediocre, $5.44 is ridiculous. Honestly it tasted like $1 pmt you can get in Richmond. Tea itself was very dilute and flavorless and the pearls were clumpy--i.e. you'd bite down and find your teeth stuck. No bounce at all, no flavor. At least I got a bottle out of all of this?

I will say they have some interesting dessert options, so if a friend ever wants to try the place... I might go back and give the dessert a shot.

Also $10 minimum for credit card.

tldr; inflated reviews because they market well; bottle is pretty cool and I'm glad I got one, but definitely not a fan of their tea, especially at that price.

excerpts: I got a milk tea
but I tried my sisters fruity teas
and they were great.
I recommend this place
milk tea.author: Judy H.
milk tea.review: Very cute place. All drinks come in one size, in the glass bottle & the tea itself was pretty yummy too. I got a milk tea but I tried my sisters fruity teas and they were great. I recommend this place

excerpts: Everyone in my party was trying milk tea, and I again have to be honest and say the thought of milk mixed with tea sounded gross.
I'm thinking coffee and creamer/milk and tea...
nah, I passed on that and branched out on my own, and ordered the strawberry green tea.
milk tea.author: Heather P.
milk tea.review:
This was my first experience trying boba tea, or tea with tapioca balls. I have to be honest, I wasn't a fan of the boba. They were too chewy and not exactly how I imagined them to taste. 

Everyone in my party was trying milk tea, and I again have to be honest and say the thought of milk mixed with tea sounded gross. I'm thinking coffee and creamer/milk and tea... nah, I passed on that and branched out on my own, and ordered the strawberry green tea. Even though I usually don't like my green tea sweetened or flavored, this tea was delicious! 

The glass bottle was a nice touch and will bring it back with me on my next trip to San Francisco, just so that I can get 10% off, and have a reason to go back. Unless, I decide to use it as a flower vase instead. 

This place is one of the places that's missing in my city, so I hope that San Franciscans appreciate the fact that they have Plentea and glass bottles. 

We didn't stay, we just ordered, grabbed our teas to go and walked back to work sipping our teas. What a great memory! Thanks Laura and Nique for showing us this awesome place.

excerpts: I got the almond milk tea with egg pudding.
You can take that bottle and get ten percent off your future purchase.
Not a bad way to get repeat customers.
There's plenty of seating upstairs as well
milk tea.author: Randy L.
milk tea.review: Everybody comes here for the glass bottles. Boba guys charge you for it but they don't here. I got the almond milk tea with egg pudding. You can take that bottle and get ten percent off your future purchase. Not a bad way to get repeat customers. There's plenty of seating upstairs as well

excerpts: I thought it needed more green tea since I got the Matcha Green Milk Tea.
I got lychee jelly in it too.
The drink my boyfriend got was really sweet!!
