I liked it more than my drink and I LOVE Matcha Green Tea!
He got the Brown Sugar Milk Tea with Taro Pudding.
milk tea.author: Akemi H.
milk tea.review:
So my friends and I actually stumbled upon this place. We knew about it, but didn't know the location of it while walking to Union Square that we would find it. 

I like the jar the drink comes in. The drinks could get pricy though. If I remember for two drinks I paid I think $11? I don't fully remember since I went there a few weeks ago and should have wrote the review the next couple of days after I came back. Sorry, this is going off complete memory.

I like how there's a loft upstairs to hangout and just sit lol. That's where my friends and I went. It was hot up there though. 

The drinks were too sweet according to the people I went with. I thought it needed more green tea since I got the Matcha Green Milk Tea. I got lychee jelly in it too. The drink my boyfriend got was really sweet!! I liked it more than my drink and I LOVE Matcha Green Tea! He got the Brown Sugar Milk Tea with Taro Pudding. The pudding and jelly were extra cost.

I only would go back just cause I give places two chances, and if you bring your jar back they will give you 10% discount.

excerpts: The hot gimmick about this place is the cute free milk tea jars that you can bring home with you.
However, the milk tea brown sugar tasted really diluted.
All the other drinks were good EXCEPT for the milk tea, which was quite disappointing.
milk tea.author: Joyce L.
milk tea.review:
The hot gimmick about this place is the cute free milk tea jars that you can bring home with you.  If you bring it back it's 10% off your bill.  

I love love love their sea salt caramel creme tea and honey lemon tea.  The sea salt creme tea was just the perfect balance.  The other boba joints I have tried skimps on the sea salt creme and puts too much tea in theirs.  Same with the honey lemon tea.

However, the milk tea brown sugar tasted really diluted.  All the other drinks were good EXCEPT for the milk tea, which was quite disappointing.

But I like this place def more than T-Pumps!  And I will be coming back :).

excerpts: I've tried the Matcha, Sea Salt Crema Oolong, and Thai milk tea.
Whenever I'm in the city, I make it a priority to swing by Plentea.
They used to serve these cute little glass bottles that you could take home, bring back and reuse for a discount.
The last time I went though, they didn't have them.
milk tea.author: Katherine Z.
milk tea.review:
Great quality bubble tea. I've tried the Matcha, Sea Salt Crema Oolong, and Thai milk tea. Whenever I'm in the city, I make it a priority to swing by Plentea. They used to serve these cute little glass bottles that you could take home, bring back and reuse for a discount. The last time I went though, they didn't have them. Not sure if they were going to bring them back (I have a suspicion that those bottles were a large part of the hype). 

Matcha: Wonderful. Not too sweet that it overwhelmed the matcha flavor. 

Sea Salt Crema Oolong: Very interesting. It's layered - sweet oolong tea on the bottom and a frothy layer of sea salt crema on top. I wasn't sure if I drank it correctly; I thought the waiter told me not to stir the drink, so I drank the bottom sweet layer first and then the remaining crema. The crema was very salty by itself...so maybe I misheard what he was saying (he had an accent) and was supposed to mix them? Not sure. The oolong tea was lovely, though, and the crema was perfectly textured, just a bit too salty for my tastes. Contrast was nice.

Thai: A bit too sweet for my tastes, but then again, I've never had a Thai bubble tea that wasn't too sweet for me.

excerpts: Recently, I had the jasmine green milk tea.
It was rather watered down but drink came out quickly
and you get a glass bottle!
milk tea.author: V C.
milk tea.review: This is usually my second choice when there's a huge line at iTea. They have really cut down the menu to offer the basics with minimal additions. Prices are reasonable. Recently, I had the jasmine green milk tea. It was rather watered down but drink came out quickly and you get a glass bottle!

excerpts: Solid boba, decent milk tea.
Boba is sweeter than the bland boba at many boba spots, but nothing to write home about.
milk tea.author: Vanessa O.
milk tea.review:
Solid boba, decent milk tea.  Boba is sweeter than the bland boba at many boba spots, but nothing to write home about.  They use real milk here (as opposed to half and half or creamer), so you lactose-intolerant folks be wary.

Glass Plentea bottle is included in your inflated San Francisco price ($5+), and as others said, you get a discount on your next drink if you have it refilled.  That being said, who would ever lug around a heavy bottle all day (presumably if you're in downtown for work), all for a mere ~50 cents?  I don't--I just collect bottles. :)

There's usually a relatively long line here at lunch and in the afternoon.  Not something to go out of your way for, but if you're in the area and craving boba, it's one of the better spots, and easily beats out Boba Guys in taste, cuteness, and variety of options.

excerpts: I went with a basic milk tea which had the options of either black, green, or oolong tea.
I chose green, and you can also add a flavor which was strawberry, peach, honeydew, and something else, I forgot.
I chose peach and also added egg pudding.
The drinks came out pretty quick.
I wasn't too amazed by it since the flavors were okay.
My egg pudding was kind of off though?
Everytime
I took a sip and consumed egg pudding, these white little small crumbs I guess were on the egg pudding?
Not sure if this is because it was old or not.
I finished the drink tho without any issues.
milk tea.author: Jayson M.
milk tea.review:
Plenteaaaa! A cute little boba shop served in glass jars to keep! Their selection of drinks is not too big, but I like this as they can specialize and focus on making the drinks tasty. If you want the drink Togo, they have a plastic lid on their counter that you can grab. 

I went with a basic milk tea which had the options of either black, green, or oolong tea. I chose green, and you can also add a flavor which was strawberry, peach, honeydew, and something else, I forgot.
 I chose peach and also added egg pudding. The drinks came out pretty quick. I wasn't too amazed by it since the flavors were okay. My egg pudding was kind of off though? Everytime I took a sip and consumed egg pudding, these white little small crumbs I guess were on the egg pudding? Not sure if this is because it was old or not. I finished the drink tho without any issues.

excerpts:
Recommend: 
Brown sugar milk tea with pearls!
If you want something sweeter than get caramel milk tea!
milk tea.author: Vicky P.
milk tea.review:
Came here for their cute glass teas tbh!! First time trying plentea & I love it! You can really tell that their tea tastes fresh & that they don't use a lot of sugar or lots of syrup. 

Recommend: 
Brown sugar milk tea with pearls! If you want something sweeter than get caramel milk tea! 

Peach fresh fruit tea.. Tastes like fresh peach OR strawberry fresh fruit tea.. If you're feeling fruity I definetly recommend all of these three drinks! 

PERKS: U GET TO KEEP THE GLASS JAR 
TIP: bring the jar back next time u come again to get 10% off your entire purchase

excerpts: I ordered a strawberry milk tea and it was good, but tasted more like graham crackers.
The strawberry flavor was very subtle.
The boba was good but maybe a bit too firm for my taste.
Still so happy I tried it!
milk tea.author: Larissa S.
milk tea.review:
Finally got to try out this teashop last week and it was pretty good! The prices are great considering you get the take home the bottle too!
I ordered a strawberry milk tea and it was good, but tasted more like graham crackers. The strawberry flavor was very subtle.
The boba was good but maybe a bit too firm for my taste.
Still so happy I tried it!

excerpts:
Or, the standard black milk tea with tapioca when I'm feelin' like a basic B.

I admit
No wonder I'm broke...paying an additional $4 delivery fee on top of the overpricedness of the milk tea.
But sometimes you just gotta go with your lazy, fat girl instinct.
Gotta get that boba.
milk tea.author: Ashley S.
milk tea.review:
Plentea, you deserve plentea of love. Take my money. From now on, I'm only ever gonna drink tea that comes in a glass bottle.

I stick to my two staples: Premium Mountain Tea (green tea) with grass jelly when I'm not feelin' something milky and/or am lying to myself that it's a healthier option. Or, the standard black milk tea with tapioca when I'm feelin' like a basic B.

I admit I've Postmates-ed Plentea one too many times, too. No wonder I'm broke...paying an additional $4 delivery fee on top of the overpricedness of the milk tea. But sometimes you just gotta go with your lazy, fat girl instinct. Gotta get that boba.

excerpts: one time I got taro milk tea which was good if you like the real taste of taro, little chunks of it inside too.
Different but great.
milk tea.author: Charlotte M.
milk tea.review: I love plentea. Great options and friendly staff. I got the sea salted caramel oolong tea. It was INSANE. Everyone needs to try it!! I can't wait to try their other flavors, one time I got taro milk tea which was good if you like the real taste of taro, little chunks of it inside too. Different but great.

excerpts: Coffee tea and Milk tea.
Decided to go back 2 nights later.
We wanted to try the Thai Ice tea.
I then asked the young lady for suggestions as I wanted something hot to soothe my scratchy throat.
She mentioned the Honey Lime which I purchased.
milk tea.author: Neesa S.
milk tea.review:
Visiting the Bay area and this Tea shop was recommended to us.  We decided to check it out and YES, we all enjoyed our drinks.  The glass bottles was a pleasant surprise!  Coffee tea and Milk tea.  Decided to go back 2 nights later.  We wanted to try the Thai Ice tea.  I then asked the young lady for suggestions as I wanted something hot to soothe my scratchy throat.  She mentioned the Honey Lime which I purchased.  It worked!  

Great service and friendly staff.  I encourage anyone to visit the store on Kearny St.

excerpts: Got a milk tea which was basic, but you know when a place makes good drinks when the basic is fantastic.
milk tea.author: Frank T.
milk tea.review:
Got a milk tea which was basic, but you know when a place makes good drinks when the basic is fantastic. I would rate this place 2.5, but rounded up to 3 stars due to the nice milk jar you get to keep. 

A bonus is if you buy 5 drinks, you get one free. The rewards system is great where you put in your phone number and it tracks your purchases. No need for card stamps.

excerpts: I ordered the Brown Sugar Carmel Milk Tea
- NOT Bad......
I may come back here again when I'm in the area next time.
milk tea.author: Ryan R.
milk tea.review:
Friday (1/8) visit changed my mind on this location
I ordered the Brown Sugar Carmel Milk Tea - NOT Bad...... I may come back here again when I'm in the area next time.

excerpts: The regular oolong milk tea is a way better option than the almond milk tea (what we got last time).
Even the boba tasted better.
They're smaller than your average boba balls but they have a slight honey-soaked taste.
milk tea.author: Shannon L.
milk tea.review: The regular oolong milk tea is a way better option than the almond milk tea (what we got last time). Even the boba tasted better. They're smaller than your average boba balls but they have a slight honey-soaked taste.

excerpts: They have flavors such as sea cream, different milk tea, flavored teas and fruit teas.
You can also get milk tea with soy milk for those that are lactose or allergic.
milk tea.author: Brittany T.
milk tea.review:
Pretty good boba! Loving the jars.

PARKING: We actually walked over from union square but it looks like parking would be difficult since it's located in chinatown near sushiritto and other establishments.

ATMOSPHERE: The outside is wooden and there are 6-7 high tables for 2 people each inside on the lower level and then you can also go upstairs for more seating for larger groups.  We came on a Friday afternoon and found seating even though the line was out the door.

FOOD: Their boba comes in modern looking milk jars, which are really cute and instagram worthy but sometimes they run out.  If you come and get a jar you should save it, bring it back and get 10% off...plus you are guaranteed a jar.  At the end you can empty out your ice and they provide lids near the garbage cans.  

They have flavors such as sea cream, different milk tea, flavored teas and fruit teas.  You can also get milk tea with soy milk for those that are lactose or allergic.

HONEY LEMON GREEN TEA - It doesn't have a prominent tea taste, which is what I was hoping for but one good thing was that it's not overly sweet.  A decent honey lemon flavor with a lime squeezed and put on top.  

BOBA - Their boba is on the smaller side but it was chewy, which moved it up to 4 stars.  They call it honey but it wasn't as sweet nor warm like half and half.  

Overall though, their presentation and flavors make it a legit boba place with good boba.

excerpts:
Just order the jasmine milk tea
- Mostly ice in the drinks
- Awkward and rude staff (ie high schoolers with major 'tude problems because they need a little spending money and they have to *gasp* work!)
- Lack of options (If you're going to specialize, make it good.
Basically, make each drink something memorable -which the drinks were not-.
If you're just riding the hype train, then add more options so everyone can enjoy the disappointment.)
milk tea.author: Crystal Z.
milk tea.review:
TL;DR - Literally just, meh.

Honestly, I might return, I might not. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here tho.... especially reading some of the other Yelper's complaints.

Pros:
- Price is fair for what you get
- Clean interior and relatively fast service

Cons:
- Overly sweet drinks 
- The matcha green tea tastes like jasmine green tea so...... missing matcha, a lot. Just order the jasmine milk tea
- Mostly ice in the drinks
- Awkward and rude staff (ie high schoolers with major 'tude problems because they need a little spending money and they have to *gasp* work!)
- Lack of options (If you're going to specialize, make it good. Basically, make each drink something memorable -which the drinks were not-. If you're just riding the hype train, then add more options so everyone can enjoy the disappointment.)

excerpts: We got the traditional milk tea with green tea which was my favorite!
I could really taste the strong fragrant tea flavor in my drink, and the boba was the perfect texture.
However, the taro milk tea we ordered was pretty disappointing.
I'm not sure if the drink itself sucked or if the red bean I added overpowered the drink and was a bad combo.
milk tea.author: Jenny C.
milk tea.review: We got the traditional milk tea with green tea which was my favorite! I could really taste the strong fragrant tea flavor in my drink, and the boba was the perfect texture. However, the taro milk tea we ordered was pretty disappointing. I'm not sure if the drink itself sucked or if the red bean I added overpowered the drink and was a bad combo.

excerpts: I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade
milk tea.author: Katie P.
milk tea.review:
The glass bottles are cute and reusable but the drinks were disgusting. I got the lavender lemonade and it tasted bitter and like soap. It had a spicy taste of some sort, neither me nor my friends liked it at all. My friends got the Matcha Latte, they said it was bitter and left a nasty feeling on the tongue. The atmosphere is really nice; crowded, but aesthetically pleasing. 

It is also pretty overpriced. I recommend getting a simple milk tea that you can't go wrong with instead of the Matcha Latte or Lavender Lemonade

excerpts: Brown sugar milk tea was only ok, gong chat is still my favorite for it.
milk tea.author: Sherry Y.
milk tea.review:
I recommend the mango green tea, which has bits of mangos. Sweet level is normal pretty sweet which is how I like my drinks but if you don't ask for it less sweet. 

Brown sugar milk tea was only ok, gong chat is still my favorite for it. 

Line is usually out the door but luckily we came here after the lunch rush and barely had a line. 

They use five star, which is an extra +! So just enter your phone # when you're at the register. I prefer this rather than carry an extra card.

excerpts: Did not taste like authentic milk tea.
The green milk tea was alright, a lot of tea, not very sweet but wasn't creamy enough, the boba was good tho.
Very nice texture.
The oolong milk tea was disgusting and tasted like roasted water 0/5.
sea salt creame tea was too sweet and you can't taste the tea.
milk tea.author: Nini N.
milk tea.review:
Went here because a lot of people recommend it. The drinks were not good at all. The atmosphere was nice, the theme was very cute. I love the look, the jars, the interior and exterior: it was very contemporary. But the drinks was not good. Did not taste like authentic milk tea. Maybe their smoothie is better.

The green milk tea was alright, a lot of tea, not very sweet but wasn't creamy enough, the boba was good tho. Very nice texture. 3/5
The oolong milk tea was disgusting and tasted like roasted water 0/5. 
sea salt creame tea was too sweet and you can't taste the tea. 2/5

Overall, never again. The service was really good tho. She remade the drink and asked which drink didn't taste good. Probably for reviewing. If you wanna go for the experience, then it's nice. But if you're going for the drink, it's disappointing. So many good tea places out there, this one didn't make it on my list :( it's pretty busy tho. Always a line, maybe we bought the wrong drinks

I got diarrhea after.

excerpts: Excellent milk tea made with fresh ingredients at a great price.
Love the sustainability mission with the glassware.
I recycle some, but they are also totally cool with you taking them home if you want to.
milk tea.author: Alejandro R.
milk tea.review:
Excellent milk tea made with fresh ingredients at a great price.  Love the sustainability mission with the glassware. I recycle some, but they are also totally cool with you taking them home if you want to. They make great vases for my flowers!

The only reason I rated 4 star instead of 5 is because I still much prefer the quality of the tapioca balls at Boba Guys to those at Plentea. 

Great service, cool vibes, tasty tea.

excerpts: - Oolong milk tea
milk tea.author: Robinne D.
milk tea.review:
I always gotta stop by here whenever I'm in the Financial District. And oh yeah, bring your bottle back for a 10% off discount! (But I don't because I'm a glass bottle hoarder, hehehe.) Call ahead of time to ask if they still have glass bottles in stock for the day because sometimes they run out during their rushes. 

I don't know any other place in the Bay Area besides Plentea that gives out boba in a glass bottle that you can actually take home. Drinks taste great, and the glass bottles add a great presentation to it. For about $5 per drink, I'm always satisfied with my boba from Plentea. 

Some faaaaves:
- Strawberry black fresh fruit tea
- Brown sugar ice milk (may be too sweet for some people!)
- Oolong milk tea

excerpts: We got the avocado milk with boba and a milk tea.
I think the bobas were the best part.
Her milk tea tasted like bitter chocolate milk,
milk tea.author: Mackenzie P.
milk tea.review:
Boba very sweet and with a nice firm texture. We got the avocado milk with boba and a milk tea. I think the bobas were the best part. Her milk tea tasted like bitter chocolate milk, a huge let down considering the cost of the teas (13 bucks for the two and a dollar tip) . 

My avocado milk smoothie was bland at first but the bobas are fairly sweet here so they helped round the flavor away from blandness. As always the avocado made the drink deliciously smooth and creamy. 

Overall disappointment for the price. Two stars for the clean atmosphere/store, the boba and the poor fish trapped at the cashier desk. I bet he's sensed so much disappointment in his short life.

excerpts: i'm sure there's a bunch of bubble tea spots in San Francisco, but hey... it's the Original Glass Bottle Milk Tea in SF.
For the price of their drinks.. I think being able to take home one of their glass bottles as a souvenir is pretty worth it.
And if you come back with your bottle you can get an extra discount on your drink.
But don't forget to check Yelp to see if they offer any discounts as well.
I usually order the Nutella Milk Tea, which is delicious.
I've also tried their Thai Tea and Mango Smoothie.
All good choices.
All drinks range from $4.50 to $6.
A bit pricey, but I guess the glass bottle makes up for it.
milk tea.author: Jadelann J.
milk tea.review:
i'm sure there's a bunch of bubble tea spots in San Francisco, but hey... it's the Original Glass Bottle Milk Tea in SF. For the price of their drinks.. I think being able to take home one of their glass bottles as a souvenir is pretty worth it. And if you come back with your bottle you can get an extra discount on your drink. But don't forget to check Yelp to see if they offer any discounts as well. The last time I went they offered 20% off. 

Anyways. They offer a wide range of Milk Teas and Fresh Fruit Slush drinks. I usually order the Nutella Milk Tea, which is delicious. I've also tried their Thai Tea and Mango Smoothie. All good choices. All drinks range from $4.50 to $6. A bit pricey, but I guess the glass bottle makes up for it. But keep in mind - if you go towards the end of the day they may be sold out of the glass bottles. 

 They've also expanded their food options as well! Last time I went we ordered the Octopus Balls... pretty tasty! i'd say give that one a shot. 

The only downside to this spot is the parking. I always have trouble finding parking around the block. So be prepared to either pay for parking or walk a few blocks.

excerpts: Taste-wise the milk tea is on par with other places
but I was expecting more.
Most of they hype surrounding Plentea is the glass bottle you get to keep, but the drinks are more expensive than average.
The boba pearls I do like, as they are very firm and chewy.
milk tea.author: Brian G.
milk tea.review: Taste-wise the milk tea is on par with other places but I was expecting more. Most of they hype surrounding Plentea is the glass bottle you get to keep, but the drinks are more expensive than average. The boba pearls I do like, as they are very firm and chewy.

excerpts: My personal favorite is the matcha milk tea.
They use a whisk to mix the matcha before they pour it in the glass.
This process is done in front of you.
milk tea.author: Katelynn N.
milk tea.review: When ever I go downtown sf, I go here. They serve their drinks in a glass bottles which you can take home. If you can't finish your tea, they provide lids. My personal favorite is the matcha milk tea. They use a whisk to mix the matcha before they pour it in the glass. This process is done in front of you.

excerpts: My coworker recommended the brown sugar milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca, but it sounded a little daring to try for my first time.
I soon regretted not getting it after trying hers.
The milk tea wasn't too sweet at all and the egg pudding was a nice, soft add in.
milk tea.author: Georgina G.
milk tea.review:
The fresh fruit tea here is really comparable to Tpumps, but what made me like this place better was the fresh fruit bits and more options of topping add-ins other than tapioca such as aloe, lychee jelly, taro pudding, egg pudding and more.

I came in around a little after they opened at 11:30am so thankfully no line at all. This was my first time here so I kinda wanted to play it safe and ended up getting what I usually order at Tpumps, which is peach green tea except I was able to add aloe and tapioca. It was really light, refreshing and I liked how the peach flavor wasn't noticeably syrupy. I also loved the bursts of freshness I'd get from biting into the aloe and fresh peach chunks. They aren't stingy with tapioca so the the boba to tea ratio is good, I ended up having leftover boba once I finished the tea. The tapioca texture could be a little softer though.

My coworker recommended the brown sugar milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca, but it sounded a little daring to try for my first time. I soon regretted not getting it after trying hers. The milk tea wasn't too sweet at all and the egg pudding was a nice, soft add in. I'll probably be back to get that one.

It is a pretty pricier than normal boba spots, but like most peeps said the extra is paying for the reusable glass bottle which is pretty neat. $13 sounds a lot for 2 drinks here, but I wouldn't mind having it once in awhile since I'd most likely only get it if I was around the area. Making a trip deep into downtown/chinatown  for expensive boba and a long wait is kinda ridic.

excerpts: and I was also able to try a regular milk tea with grass jelly as well.
The grass jelly didn't mix too well with the milk tea and continued to float about the liquids until the tea was nearly half way down the jar.
It was surprisingly bitter.
The peach green tea on the other hand was very sweet and sour from the amount of honey and the chunks of peach I presume.
Overall, I'm happy with the jar, but I probably wouldn't pay the same price without it.
milk tea.author: Linda K.
milk tea.review:
They're pretty clever with their advertising because a free glass jar with the purchase of my peach green tea got me to check it out! I had added grass jelly and I was also able to try a regular milk tea with grass jelly as well. The grass jelly didn't mix too well with the milk tea and continued to float about the liquids until the tea was nearly half way down the jar. It was surprisingly bitter. 
The peach green tea on the other hand was very sweet and sour from the amount of honey and the chunks of peach I presume. 
Overall, I'm happy with the jar, but I probably wouldn't pay the same price without it.

excerpts: My friend got a cold Almond Milk Tea with boba and her drink came out warm.
milk tea.author: Tiffany C.
milk tea.review:
Cute place, okay tea. 

The place is really nice and has lots of cute decorations (especially since it was almost Halloween) They also have a second floor so there's lots of space to sit!

My friends and I all wanted to try this place since we were in city but it was pretty disappointing. I got the Jujube Honey Flavored tea and I watched as they put real honey and fruit inside the glass jar and shake it up. However, it just ended up tasting like a sweet tea with not a lot of flavor - I couldn't even taste the fruit.

My friend got a cold Almond Milk Tea with boba and her drink came out warm. Not hot or cold (which were the two options), but just warm. 

Another friend got lavender lemonade and the lemonade is actually sparkling (since they added sparkling water to it). I'm not a big fan of the lavender but I thought they drink was pretty unique. 

Everyone thought their drinks were interesting but nobody really enjoyed it that much, especially for $5+ a drink.

excerpts: I wanted Oolong milk tea
No bobas $4.5 - with .39tax = $4.89!
It came in the glass container.
I think the glass container is just ok, wish the prices were lower though.
milk tea.author: Ann L.
milk tea.review:
Tried out Plentea because there was no line outside, but inside was about 5 customers in front of me, it moved pretty fast.

Girl couldn't hear me because it's loud over there.  I wanted Oolong milk tea No bobas $4.5 - with .39tax = $4.89!  It came in the glass container.  I think the glass container is just ok, wish the prices were lower though.  Drink was sweet and nothing special.

Can I get my money back for the glass jar without buying another drink??  I really don't want to go back there and carry that heavy sucker.

Can't even use my credit card because they have a $15 minimum!  Sucky place doing illegal sh*t.

NO Bathrooms even, gotta use the garage bathroom the cashier told someone else.

Some seating in the main area, more upstairs.

excerpts: Next time I'd like to try the avocado milk tea that turns out to be one of the staffs favorites.
milk tea.author: Samantha M.
milk tea.review:
I'm a huge fan of bubble tea so when I was finally able to visit Plentea I was very excited to try it out! Walking into the location, there is typically at least a bit of a line going out the door, but what good place doesn't especially in San Francisco?

The decor is very cute and cozy especially if you go into the upstairs area! I ordered a matcha milk green tea with boba which was a little over $5 but it was well worth it! I thought it was very refreshing and especially nice with the glass milk jar they give you. Next time I'd like to try the avocado milk tea that turns out to be one of the staffs favorites.

They have a card charge of at least $10 so be mindful of that! Otherwise if I lived in the area I would come all the time, so get yourself some good bubble tea!

excerpts: I ordered Matcha Green milk tea with herbal jelly.
It was not too sweet
and I like that.
I get to keep the jar
so I think it's worth $5.5
milk tea.author: Cindy G.
milk tea.review:
Wanted to go to boba guys but it closes on Sundays.  Plentea was my next boba place to go to.  I heard about plentea through YouTuber - Weylie. 

Line was not long but waited 15-20 min, then another 5 minutes for my drink. I ordered Matcha Green milk tea with herbal jelly. It was not too sweet and I like that. I get to keep the jar so I think it's worth $5.5 -$6! 

I didn't think it was anything special so I didn't give a 5 star.

excerpts: I knew I was in for an expensive milk tea before I arrived.
milk tea.author: Jess C.
milk tea.review:
I've read practically all of the reviews at Plentea, so trust me, I knew I was in for an expensive milk tea before I arrived. I had also been warned about the unfriendly cashier who practically was rolling her eyes at me the entire time while I asked her questions.

* BLACK TEA CREMA WITH PUDDING (~$5.50) - 4 STARS:
Tea crema was rich and thick and reminded me of Purple Kow and Half and Half. Just a few hours earlier I had One Plus Tea House's version which made it clear how Plentea's quality was far above the many copy cats out there. The tapioca was perfectly cooked and the egg pudding was standard but good. The tea is good, not quite as strong and bitter as boba guys. I asked for 50% sweet and it was the perfect sweetness. 

* ICE MILK (BROWN SUGAR) (~$5.50) - 3 STARS:
I expected the ice milk to be akin to PK or HH but really it left me wanting more. It's not as rich and creamy, and way too sweet (make sure to ask for it 25-50% sweet).

* PEACH FRUIT TEA ($4.95) - 3 STARS:
Their fruit teas are merely a black tea with a fruit syrup mixed with fresh cut fruit. The peach tea was way too sweet for my liking.

I enjoyed my black tea crema and the perfectly cooked tapioca balls. Despite the price, I could see myself coming back if I needed an emergency boba mid work day. Perhaps if there was no line, or perhaps if the cashier didn't have her eyes permanently rolling around, this might be a 4-STAR establishment.

Note: no hot drinks. All tea is caffeinated. A few decaf options - fruit drinks and lemonade.

excerpts: My oolong milk tea was average, but my boyfriend got a fresh strawberry green milk tea & it honestly just tasted like a liquified hi-chew.
If you're looking for just a drink, skip here.
If you're looking for an Instagram or aesthetic snap story, stop by, but be prepared to pay at least $5-6.
milk tea.author: S R.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is not worth the hype anymore. I've noticed that some of the milk teas seem to be premade rather than shaken and made to order. Even chain shops like Sharetea or T4 will make it to order. And they definitely use high fructose corn syrup and cheap tea leaves like the chain shops above. 

You're really just paying for a glass jar. Their drinks aren't bad, but they're not good either. My oolong milk tea was average, but my boyfriend got a fresh strawberry green milk tea & it honestly just tasted like a liquified hi-chew. If you're looking for just a drink, skip here. If you're looking for an Instagram or aesthetic snap story, stop by, but be prepared to pay at least $5-6.

excerpts: I also tasted my friend's coffee milk tea - definitely tastes like it would give you a caffeine boost!
I'll be back to try the black milk tea and the peach fresh fruit tea.
milk tea.author: Varsha S.
milk tea.review:
On the expensive side, but definitely good tea - probably one of the most talked about in SF. The tea is served in a glass bottle, and you receive a discount if you remember to bring the bottle back (what a great branding strategy!). Even with the discount though, two teas with boba cost $11.50. 

Knocked down one star because the tables were in *desperate* need of cleaning (every single one had something spilled on it) - but only one star because the shop is crazy busy. It's understandable that the workers don't have the time to escape the kitchen and squeeze between crowds to mop. If you're looking for seating, the upstairs was emptier.

It's in downtown SF, so an easy enough place to stop by while exploring or running errands. I ordered the mango fresh fruit tea with tapioca pearls. It tasted great, although their shreds of fruit were a variety of sizes (some too big for the straw lol). It seemed like they were trying to emphasize how freshly cut the fruit was. The tapioca probably wasn't the right complement, but the pearls were perfect. I also tasted my friend's coffee milk tea - definitely tastes like it would give you a caffeine boost! I'll be back to try the black milk tea and the peach fresh fruit tea.

excerpts: I don't like matcha, but I like Plentea's matcha green milk tea simply because it didn't really taste like matcha.
I also had the black milk tea with tapioca.
It tasted like chocolate and coffee.
Nothing about it remind me of milk tea.
It kind of reminded me of the chocolate milk cartons you got in grade school.
The tapioca was also very very sweet and hard (way too chewy).
Also, it seems like the drink was much more caffeinated than other drinks I've had.
I had such a hard time sleeping after drinking this at 9 PM.
I was wired until 3 AM.
I would probably only come back for the "matcha" green milk tea.
Plus, drinking from a jar is more fun than drinking from a paper cup.
milk tea.author: Denise L.
milk tea.review:
Plentea has a unique novelty of jars that other boba places don't have. If you order a cold drink, you get it in a cute branded jar that you can take home and then reuse to purchase a drink at a cheaper price the next time you're in.

I don't like matcha, but I like Plentea's matcha green milk tea simply because it didn't really taste like matcha. It was the perfect sweetness, but for people looking for that solid matcha taste, you won't find it in this drink.

I also had the black milk tea with tapioca. It tasted like chocolate and coffee. Nothing about it remind me of milk tea. It kind of reminded me of the chocolate milk cartons you got in grade school. The tapioca was also very very sweet and hard (way too chewy). Also, it seems like the drink was much more caffeinated than other drinks I've had. I had such a hard time sleeping after drinking this at 9 PM. I was wired until 3 AM. Never again.

I would probably only come back for the "matcha" green milk tea. Plus, drinking from a jar is more fun than drinking from a paper cup.

excerpts: Their black milk tea is delicious and not too sweet.
Most boba places tense to over sweeten their tea for some reason.
Hey, I'm trying not to have diabetes here.
Love it!
I always add boba with my milk tea but
milk tea.author: Lien C.
milk tea.review:
I really don't care what people say.  I just love it here.  The line was never long when we stop by (what can I say, I'm just lucky).  Their black milk tea is delicious and not too sweet.  Most boba places tense to over sweeten their tea for some reason.  Hey, I'm trying not to have diabetes here.  Love it!  I always add boba with my milk tea but surprisingly I never thought about adding grass jelly in the mixture.

I must try it next time. Their waffle is good, I would say its standard.  Waffle, Nutella, Strawberries, Powder Sugar and Whip Cream to the side. 

Nice small spot to hang out with friends.  The décor is simple and to the point.  I like the free glass vase.  I now have 3 and uses them as my flower vase at work.

excerpts: There was a long line when I was drinking my 25% sugar  oolong milk tea, and saw two people in line who already had bottles.
milk tea.author: Lizzie S.
milk tea.review:
Come for the Instagram picture. 

It's the bottle that gets people in, but I do wonder if it makes people come back. There was a long line when I was drinking my 25% sugar  oolong milk tea, and saw two people in line who already had bottles. Who knows.

Anyways, the tea is good, but nothing to write home about. It's pricey, and I like how you can change the sweet level, but I wish you could go lower than 25% sweet because it was already very sweet. Not bad service, cute comfy chairs.

excerpts: Tried the milk tea today, and it was infinitely!
Milk tea seems to be their specialty!
milk tea.author: Henry L.
milk tea.review:
Tried the milk tea today, and it was infinitely! better than the lemon black tea. 

Soooooooo. Smoooootthh. Mmmmm

Makes sense I suppose. Milk tea seems to be their specialty!

excerpts: Second drink was a black milk tea with boba.
The BMT was good with a strong black tea flavor.
Overall, Crema Oolong reigned superior.
Came out with TWO glass bottles.
It was worth the experience but definitely not worth coming back frequently for $6 per drink.
It was good
but not THAT good.
That's hella pricy for boba.
milk tea.author: Liana F.
milk tea.review:
My boyfriend and I came with a mission: Acquire a Plentea glass bottle for the novelty! 

THE WAIT: Long line during the weekday lunch and early afternoon. We placed our name on the Ramen Underground wait list before getting in line. With four parties of two ahead of us for R.U., we managed to get seated before acquiring our drinks. A good deal of the waiting came after the ordering. With Plentea being this poppin', you'd think they'd have come up with a system to speed it up. Waiting ~15 minutes for one drink is slow.

THE DRINKS: First we ordered the Crema Oolong Tea with boba and enjoyed that after our ramen lunch but while waiting in line again for another drink. Crema Oolong Tea, bomb! Boba, soft and sweet. Second drink was a black milk tea with boba. The BMT was good with a strong black tea flavor. Overall, Crema Oolong reigned superior. Came out with TWO glass bottles. It was worth the experience but definitely not worth coming back frequently for $6 per drink. It was good but not THAT good. That's hella pricy for boba. A drink is not worth the price even with the 10% discount when bringing the bottle back for reuse.

THE SERVICE: Bad. As a first timer, I asked the cashier how different the Crema Oolong Tea and Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea taste and which she preferred. Her response: "Well, one has sea salt, you know, so it depends if, you know, you want your drink salty... or not salty." ... ... Okay you know what, forget it. I went with without the sea salt to be safe and the drink was delicious. My friend who comes here vouches for the deliciousness of the oolong with sea salt so I guess that scenario would have been a win-win. This friend and I can agree on this kinda chubby female Chinese/Taiwanese cashier with long black hair, round pale face, and black-rimmed glasses to be of no help when it comes to answering your questions!

excerpts: Anyway, a group of us ordered a variety of drinks that ranged from regular milk tea, ice milk, fruit tea, and green milk tea.
The ice milk with pudding was also spectacular.
milk tea.author: Nina H.
milk tea.review:
I'm so glad I discovered this place on Instagram! I don't even know what hashtag I was searching, but I somehow stumbled onto some food blogger's Instagram account and bookmarked this spot immediately because I really wanted the bottle.

I really love the concept of the bottle to take home because it's "green" and it's a pretty novel concept for the bubble tea world. If only they would start one in Seattle too...

Anyway, a group of us ordered a variety of drinks that ranged from regular milk tea, ice milk, fruit tea, and green milk tea. They made for really cute photos.

I tried all of them and they were really tasty, especially the fruit tea with strawberry. The ice milk with pudding was also spectacular. I probably should've asked for more sugar in mine but I opted for 50% sugar, so it wasn't as sweet, but probably healthier.

The honey boba was the BEST part!!! And also the unhealthiest, but whatever, I was on vacation. The food also looked amazing, like the savory and sweet waffles. Seems like a cute spot for breakfast or brunch too. Prices are little big higher than your usual boba joint, but hey, they are sustainable, and I'm willing to pay a bit more to take home the bottle.

The interior was cozy and modern; very chic.

They are still working out their kinks so there might be a line... but then again, aren't there lines everywhere you go in SF?

excerpts: We ordered one green milk tea with boba and one without, peach oolong, strawberry oolong and honey lemon tea.
The green milk tea is okay, kind of too watery for my taste but gets better as you continue to drink it..
I could go without this next time.
I think their success is in their flavored teas because I really liked the strawberry and peach.
The teas still hold their real tea flavor while complimented by a sweet flavor.
They also have real cut up fruit pieces in the tea.
milk tea.author: Tiff C.
milk tea.review:
I won't lie, I gave into the hype. If a new place is on my Instagram feed more than 5 times, I definitely have to try the place out for myself.

Just went in (Monday night around 9) and there was only one other person in line before us and a few people sitting around enjoying their drinks. The wait time for the drinks to be prepared was less than 5 minutes. I would definitely go on a weeknight to avoid an hour wait like I read on other reviews. 

We ordered one green milk tea with boba and one without, peach oolong, strawberry oolong and honey lemon tea. 

The green milk tea is okay, kind of too watery for my taste but gets better as you continue to drink it.. I could go without this next time. I think their success is in their flavored teas because I really liked the strawberry and peach. The teas still hold their real tea flavor while complimented by a sweet flavor. They also have real cut up fruit pieces in the tea. The honey lemon was average, something you can easily make at home. 

Also, I'm sure you all know by now that you get to keep the bottle it's served in and you can bring it in on your next visit for 20% off your next drink.

I'll be back to try other things on the menu like the blueberry milk.. Sounds good.

excerpts: Milk Tea, Fruit-Flavored Tea).
milk tea.author: Ringo M.
milk tea.review:
The only way you can look cooler than drinking boba out of a Plentea glass bottle is if you drink boba straight out of a Patron Tequila bottle.

But there's a price to looking cool. In fact, it's almost $5 after tax for most of their drinks +boba (Lemon Tea, Milk Tea, Fruit-Flavored Tea). For their fresh smoothies +boba, it'll run you to almost $8.

If you bring their HEAVY glass bottle back, you get 20% off your next purchase. But I kept mine to use as dumbbells at home, because 20% off later, its still pricey.
(tip: fill them with Gatorade to consolidate your workout space)

While I'm not a big fan of Plentea's prices, I bet I'll be coming here again and again. There's always going to be that one friend who hasn't tried it yet. Maybe I'll try their Belgian Waffles instead of getting their drinks.

excerpts: I got the Nutella Milk Tea HOT
and it was pretty gross.
Maybe if I had gotten it cold.
The service is good
but it's hard to understand the employees though they are very nice.
Just didn't have a good experience with my order.
milk tea.author: Laura T.
milk tea.review: I got the Nutella Milk Tea HOT and it was pretty gross. Maybe if I had gotten it cold. The service is good but it's hard to understand the employees though they are very nice. Just didn't have a good experience with my order.

excerpts: milk tea caught my eye.
As I pull out my phone to yelp the exact location, I spot a giant line coming out of a shiny new bamboo store front.
Boba guys has jasmine milk tea which happens to be my favorite.
Plentea only offers black, green, oolong, and thai.
Step up your game!!
milk tea.author: Angela L.
milk tea.review:
On my way there, multiple Asians holding glass jars filled to the brim with milk tea caught my eye. As I pull out my phone to yelp the exact location, I spot a giant line coming out of a shiny new bamboo store front. Ah, there it is. 

30 minutes later in the scorching heat, I finally get to second in line and oh guess what, 3 ladies who've been standing in line just as long as me, if not longer DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY EFFING WANT. Seriously people, you've had 30 minutes to decide. FINALLY, I get to the front and viola, ordered in 30 seconds and paid (a spendy) $5.45. 

I get my beverage pretty quickly and am glassy eyed ogling the nifty jar. 

45 seconds later, the novelty has worn off and my hand/arm is getting tired from holding this heavy ass jug. 

It was cool, but I doubt I'll come back, especially with that price tag. Boba guys has jasmine milk tea which happens to be my favorite. Plentea only offers black, green, oolong, and thai. Step up your game!!

excerpts: Sweet milk tea" is the best description I can give.
You can taste the milk, you can taste the tea, and it's very sweet.
The toppings are also very sweet but I enjoy the sweetness.
If you don't like your milk tea sweet
I'm sure you can ask for less sugar.
They have very unique flavors and I still have to try a lot of them.
Definitely worth it and if you don't like it then
at least you get to go home with a cute bottle.
milk tea.author: Kimmy L.
milk tea.review:
I wrote tip saying they ran out of bottles awhile ago. It made me pretty upset because the workers told me new shipments of bottles were "coming tomorrow." I actually came the next day but they said tomorrow again and I came a week later and they still said "tomorrow." I'm aware of their 300 bottles a day policy but during this time their inventory was actually empty. 
I wouldn't write a bad yelp review based on low inventory, because it happens, but I think the workers should've gave a realistic estimate of when the new shipments would arrive. It's giving false hope because some faithful customers might actually come back the next day.

Here's a review of their drinks: The drinks come out within a few minutes no matter how long the line is so that's a huge plus. The bottles are so cute and they come with a cap so you can take it to go as well. "Sweet milk tea" is the best description I can give. You can taste the milk, you can taste the tea, and it's very sweet. The toppings are also very sweet but I enjoy the sweetness. If you don't like your milk tea sweet I'm sure you can ask for less sugar. They have very unique flavors and I still have to try a lot of them. Definitely worth it and if you don't like it then at least you get to go home with a cute bottle.

excerpts: Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and
my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.
milk tea.author: Angela T.
milk tea.review:
Literally one of the cutest tea places I have ever come across. No other tea place can compare to the bottles, minimalistic walls, and (small) upstairs section with a nice loft-style view of the downstairs. The most Instagram-worthy cafe there is out there. It is kind of small though so I assume that it can get crowded at times, but everything else about the shop aesthetics is 5/5.

Now, on to the tea. So I have not tried much from the wide variety of their menu, but when I tried the Fresh Fruit tea (peach), the tea was comparable to my all-time favorite tea shop, Fantasia. The flavor was strong enough and not extremely artificial, so 5/5 on the tea. However, I would say that the tapioca is a little more harder than I wanted but still decently chewy. 4/5 for the pearls only because I am biased to Fantasia's incredibly soft, chewy ones.

So overall, I would give it around a 4.75/5. Trust me, the bottle and wide variety of drinks is worth it; there's milk tea, coffee, fruit tea, matcha latte, and my friend even got a nutella milk tea which she liked.

excerpts: I would say their milk tea is decent but nothing great.
milk tea.author: Dianna H.
milk tea.review:
It's great that there's finally a decent boba place near where I work!!! I never understood why there weren't good places in downtown.

I've been here twice and had two different drinks - first was a mango green tea, and second time I had papaya milk. 

I would say their milk tea is decent but nothing great. Doesn't deserve the $4.50 or $4.95 they charge you. 

BUT THEIR FRUIT MILKS. I could go on all day about them! And I don't even like milk normally! The papaya milk was extremely tasty and fresh. Not only were there still bits of papaya floating around in the drink, but they also used really yummy ripe papaya for maximum deliciousness!! ^_^

Had some friends who tried the strawberry milk, and while I didn't try any, they swore by it and called it their new favorite drink.

As far as the space itself goes, there are two floors - the first floor and half of a second floor above with some more cozy seating. Both times I was there (once at 3 pm on Wed and once at 11:30 am on a Thu), there weren't too people sitting inside, so it was pretty easy for my friends and I to find a spot to sit and take a nice little break from work.

As much as I love this place's fruity milk drinks (they're the main reason behind the 4 stars), I have to admit there are some cons:
-pricy
-no credit cards accepted under $10
-no rewards system (okay this isn't really that big of a deal, but given how many times I see myself coming here, I really hope they implement something soon!)

excerpts: MILK TEA OKAY?
THIS IS NOT TEA.
I REPEAT!!
This is REAL taro chunks served with MILK only!!
No tea in it!
Different from the regular use of taro powder with tea.
It tastes different but good because it's real taro for once!
And it's white... remember...
taro is not purple..
it's white...
Black Milk Tea: very good classic milk tea. cannot go wrong with any of their milk teas!
they have
black, green, oolong, and one more i forgot.. their honey boba is actually sweet and chewy!
milk tea.author: Cuc N.
milk tea.review:
I was bribed to come try this place for their glass milk jugs despite the expensive prices (which include the milk jug to be fair enough). They claim that they can only serve up to 200 milk jugs in the morning and 200 milk jugs in the evening starting at 6PM (but honestly my own theory is that this is a advertising rouse because I came at 330PM and they still had heaping boxes full of milk jugs)

They're not real milk jugs! I thought they were.. they resemble them but they are more square-ish shape. Real milk jugs back in the day were circular...but it's okay! I'm still going to use them to drink milk! If you want a plastic cap for your milk jug, it's in the basket on the table where you pick up your jugs. Also, if you bring back your milk jug, make sure it's clean b/c they don't wash it for you! And 10% off your drink for saving the environment?? Yes, yes? I'm hoping that's their initial motive for this milk jug! Haha, or if you don't want a milk jug to begin with, just tell them you want it served in a regular plastic cup and they'll subtract 10% off the expensive price for not buying their milk jug hahahaha 

Line seems long because they work slow and the place is short so it goes out the doorway. there are tables on both sides to sit and also an upstairs lounge area (look nice too)!

Taro Milk: THIS IS NOT TARO MILK TEA OKAY? THIS IS NOT TEA. I REPEAT!! This is REAL taro chunks served with MILK only!! No tea in it! Different from the regular use of taro powder with tea. It tastes different but good because it's real taro for once! And it's white... remember... taro is not purple.. it's white... so don't be fooled.. 

Black Milk Tea: very good classic milk tea. cannot go wrong with any of their milk teas! they have black, green, oolong, and one more i forgot.. their honey boba is actually sweet and chewy! i approve :) 

Creama Oolong Tea: Delicious and looks flattering for pictures! do not mix your jug! it will start to mix on it's own.. just leave it be :) You can also order it with sea salt, but i personally heard that sea salt makes it too salty.. i'll try it next time but it's yummy the way it is!! :) 

Pros:
-cute milk jugs with their name engraved in it.. i finally understand.. PLENTEA like plenty.. of tea... i'm slow :D :D 
-also provides plastic lids too! and they seal pretty tight! my BF shook it with the lid on and nothing leaked out! BRAVoO :) 
-delicious teas but small selections

Cons: 
-location is hard.. in the heart of downtown SF where parking is so hard and impossible! I wanna come back here but maybe not on a regular basis just when I want boba.. maybe if I'm already shopping there or it's convenient.. otherwise i think this place is a gem for people that work in downtown SF and want good boba :) 
-expensive But it's cause of the milk jugs haha

excerpts: Plentea has a solid selection of hot and cold drinks, including a popular Nutella milk tea which can be served hot or cold.
milk tea.author: Irina P.
milk tea.review:
(4.5) My office orders milk teas often. Plentea has a solid selection of hot and cold drinks, including a popular Nutella milk tea which can be served hot or cold. Good selection of toppings.

All teas come in returnable glass bottles which can make things tricky when on the go.

excerpts: They have lots of tea options including some creative ones such as Nutella Milk tea
and they also offer various toppings other than just bubble.
milk tea.author: Athena C.
milk tea.review:
Plentea satisfied my thirst for bubble tea ever since I moved to the bay area. I was spoiled by overflow of bubble tea options in New York City and I haven't had a chance to try them in San Francisco. Plentea was a great introduction to the bubble tea world here. 

They have lots of tea options including some creative ones such as Nutella Milk tea and they also offer various toppings other than just bubble. My personal favorite has always been the grass jelly for summer season and the egg pudding around the year. 

You can ask them to decrease sugar and ice level for your preference although the counter girl English isn't very good. 

The price is slightly higher than other places in Chinatown but you do get a nice glass jar out of it. If you reuse it, you get 10% discount.

excerpts: My other friends had the honeydew tea, milk black tea, mango fruit tea, Thai tea, green milk tea, strawberry smoothie, salted cream tea, and some were duplicated.
They were all tasty.
(Yes, I did my very best to sample them all for the sake of yelp! )
I did like the honeydew one the best.
milk tea.author: Kat C.
milk tea.review:
The people who work here are quite nice and friendly. They would help with recommendations and tasted that you're unsure with. 

I came with a group of friends and as out of towners, we took a bit of time deciding. Good thing the workers were patient with us. 

I had the peach fresh fruit tea with boba. I got to say, as someone who use to work at a boba place, their boba was pretty good. It was perfectly chewy and not too sweet. It was cooked all the way through where there wasn't that uncooked powdery center. Good job on the boba. 

The tea itself was pretty tasty. I asked for low sugar and they did as asked. My other friends had the honeydew tea, milk black tea, mango fruit tea, Thai tea, green milk tea, strawberry smoothie, salted cream tea, and some were duplicated. They were all tasty. (Yes, I did my very best to sample them all for the sake of yelp! ) I did like the honeydew one the best. That one tasted pretty awesome. 

Oh and did I forget to mention, you get to keep the glass bottle that it comes in! It even has their name as part of their bottle. Great way of marketing and it's visually appealing too. Pretty drinks in pretty bottles!!!!! 

Oh and there's no bathroom here. Just be warned about that. Their two story location should have one. Oh well. 

Overall: next time I'm up in the area, I would come back just to try the other flavors....and to get those adorable bottles!!!!

excerpts: EDIT: I have also tried the Taro Milk, which I mistook for Taro Milk Tea.
It's literally taro and milk, where you can taste the bits of taro in the milk.
I'm not a big fan, but perhaps it's just not my cup of milk.
milk tea.author: Stefanie C.
milk tea.review:
Not bad! I was skeptical about boba in the Financial District, but this is actually a super cute place to grab a quick bite (or snack) and either take it to-go or hang out in the upstairs loft area, which has a decent amount of seating. Plus... free WiFi!

I ordered the Peach Green Tea ($4.95) with Aloe, which was pretty good. I feel like they didn't put $0.50 worth of aloe in my drink. Drinks come in a super cute milk bottle so I guess that's what the higher tea price goes towards. That and it's worth bringing back the bottle for 10% off each subsequent drink. Still pretty pricey though, but it's FiDi so what did you expect?

My friend and I also ordered the Strawberry Belgian Waffle ($6.95) which is topped with fresh strawberries, chocolate syrup, almonds, and powdered sugar, alongside a dollop of whipped cream. They took forever to be made, so by the time it got to us, the waffles were cold. The baristas are very delicate with the toppings, though! What intricate decorative abilities. The waffles were overcooked and crunchy, but I suppose some people like it that way. Anyways, this was a good snack choice, and I'm glad we ordered it.

EDIT: I have also tried the Taro Milk, which I mistook for Taro Milk Tea. It's literally taro and milk, where you can taste the bits of taro in the milk. I'm not a big fan, but perhaps it's just not my cup of milk.

excerpts: - No more almond milk tea!

- No more fruit syrups
- No more FiveStars program.

I believe they said they'll still take whatever rewards you have remaining until 5/31/17
- New caps.
Previously, they had rubber caps.
Now they have these weird plastic caps.
You would think it's a screw-on cap, but it's actually a pop-on.
milk tea.author: Michael C.
milk tea.review:
Recently, Plentea underwent some kind of renovation, menu-wise & ingredients-wise. In my opinion, for the worse. I work nearby, and frequent this location. During the past year, the staff has become noticeably ruder and slower.

- No more almond milk tea!
- No more fruit syrups
- No more FiveStars program. I believe they said they'll still take whatever rewards you have remaining until 5/31/17
- New caps. Previously, they had rubber caps. Now they have these weird plastic caps. You would think it's a screw-on cap, but it's actually a pop-on. Very hard to take back off as well

Based on the recent updates, and the many competitors nearby, I will most likely not be coming back often (or at all).

excerpts: My favorites include brown sugar milk tea w/ boba and almond milk tea w/ grass jelly.
milk tea.author: Bunny M.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is my go-to place for gourmet boba. This place is AWESOME because the drinks come in glass bottles that you can choose to take home. If you bring it back, you get 10% off future orders! They also have a good range of flavors and toppings. My favorites include brown sugar milk tea w/ boba and almond milk tea w/ grass jelly. They don't use powder and their boba pearls have never let me down in terms of chewiness and taste.

The atmosphere is pleasant, but it does get loud at times. It gets crowded during busy hours so there may or may not be seats for you (and others). I personally adore the line of cacti lined up along the wall near where you pick up your drinks. I come here whenever I'm in San Francisco and it's a great pick-me-up.

excerpts: Was strolling around Chinatown/Union Square Area and decided to get some milk tea.
This was my first time trying out Plentea and the line went out the door.
First impression of this place was that it must be pretty good.
Don't get me wrong, the recycled glass bottle is unique but the milk tea I got was not up to par.
I've heard from friends that recommend to get other drinks on their menu that are not milk teas are better
and I might consider coming back to give it another try!
milk tea.author: Devin T.
milk tea.review: Was strolling around Chinatown/Union Square Area and decided to get some milk tea. This was my first time trying out Plentea and the line went out the door. First impression of this place was that it must be pretty good. I decided to get Coffmilk Tea with boba (tapioca) and to me it just tastes like your average ice coffee. It was a bit water down and lacked in flavor. Don't get me wrong, the recycled glass bottle is unique but the milk tea I got was not up to par. I've heard from friends that recommend to get other drinks on their menu that are not milk teas are better and I might consider coming back to give it another try!

excerpts: I got the Peach Oolong Milk Tea.
It was pretty good!
It wasn't amazing though.
if I was in the area I will try it again.
But I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.
I believe people like coming here because of the Jar.
I agree.
milk tea.author: Christina T.
milk tea.review:
I got the Peach Oolong Milk Tea. It was pretty good! It wasn't amazing though. if I was in the area I will try it again. But I wouldn't go out of my way to go there. I believe people like coming here because of the Jar. I agree. Thats what attracted me. 

I like the pudding here as well. I think this place has probably one of the best puddings. I would have to come back her again to try their other stuff. Its kind of pricey, I guess its because of the jar. If you haven't been... its worth a try I suppose.

excerpts: I got their regular green milk tea with boba.
It was watered down, and the boba became progressively harder to chew.
Definitely overrated and overpriced.
I guess you can taste the tea, but for $5, I'm basically paying for the glass, not the drink.
Unfortunately, not impressed with this place!
milk tea.author: Stephanie C.
milk tea.review: I got their regular green milk tea with boba. It was watered down, and the boba became progressively harder to chew. Definitely overrated and overpriced. I guess you can taste the tea, but for $5, I'm basically paying for the glass, not the drink. Unfortunately, not impressed with this place!

excerpts: However their matcha and oolong milk tea are really good.
You can still taste the tea flavor and it's not overly sweet like other places.
I always come back here whenever I'm around SF.
Definitely give it a try.
Plus you get to keep the jar
they serve your drink in!
milk tea.author: Tuyen H.
milk tea.review: Wish there was a Plentea closer to San Jose. A really good boba place to grab something to drink and chill with friends. I've tried their sea salt crema and personally I didn't like those very much. However their matcha and oolong milk tea are really good. You can still taste the tea flavor and it's not overly sweet like other places. I always come back here whenever I'm around SF. Definitely give it a try. Plus you get to keep the jar they serve your drink in!

excerpts: I ordered the black milk tea with pearls a few months ago and was extremely disappointed.
I gave it some time and ordered something from their top 3 list, almond milk tea.
milk tea.author: Danae L.
milk tea.review:
Pretty expensive but at least the drink comes in a jar. 

I ordered the black milk tea with pearls a few months ago and was extremely disappointed. The tea was watered down and I was pretty pissed considering the price.

I gave it some time and ordered something from their top 3 list, almond milk tea. Huge difference! 

There was crowd, but I wouldn't consider them busy. Slow service.

excerpts: After much anticipation, my friends and I came to Plentea expecting some yummy milk tea.
However, we were extremely disappointed.
We ordered the mango green milk tea with tapioca, mango black milk tea with tapioca, and peach black milk tea with tapioca.
All 3 milk teas were bland and somewhat tasteless.
The flavor of the drinks was not strong at all;
the drinks tasted like water and milk.
The tapioca in the drinks tasted like soft plastic balls.
We sat upstairs and couldn't find any napkins either.
Although the the store is cute and the bottles are nice, the drinks were not worth the high price.
(Edit:
Since the bottles are glass and fairly nice, I understand why we had to pay around $6 for each drink.)
milk tea.author: Christina L.
milk tea.review: After much anticipation, my friends and I came to Plentea expecting some yummy milk tea. However, we were extremely disappointed. We ordered the mango green milk tea with tapioca, mango black milk tea with tapioca, and peach black milk tea with tapioca. All 3 milk teas were bland and somewhat tasteless. The flavor of the drinks was not strong at all; the drinks tasted like water and milk. The tapioca in the drinks tasted like soft plastic balls. We sat upstairs and couldn't find any napkins either. Although the the store is cute and the bottles are nice, the drinks were not worth the high price. (Edit: Since the bottles are glass and fairly nice, I understand why we had to pay around $6 for each drink.)

excerpts: I ordered their black milk tea.
If you can't make a decent milk tea, you won't survive the boba industry (haha).
The drink was good, tea flavor wasn't strong enough though.
milk tea.author: Ava F.
milk tea.review:
The first time I had Plentea was when they first opened, before the ridiculously long lines occurred daily. Staff was nice, asked me how the drink was and how they could improve. I ordered their black milk tea. If you can't make a decent milk tea, you won't survive the boba industry (haha). The drink was good, tea flavor wasn't strong enough though. First rating: 3

The second time I went I ordered a premium oolong tea with boba. Again, tea flavor wasn't that strong. They forgot my boba so I had to go back to ask for it, but I wish I hadn't. The boba was soft and mushy and tasted old. Second rating: 3 still.

Great concepts, not executed well.

Caution: lines out the door daily around 3-4 pm.

excerpts: - Nutella Milk Tea
: This is my go-to drink, and definitely my favorite out of everything I've tried here!
You can definitely taste the chocolate, and together with the the boba creates a symphony of sweet flavor.
The boba itself, to me, has the perfect consistency.
Highly recommend.
- Matcha Milk Green Tea: This is really good as well.
The sweetness of the tea balances out the green tea flavor.
I recommend getting this drink with the taro pudding, which has a subtle, yet noticeable taro flavor.
milk tea.author: Jay C.
milk tea.review:
My best friend introduced me to this place, and I've been going back ever since! It's really central to Chinatown and Union Square, so definitely check this place out!

The line is hit or miss; sometimes it goes way out the door, while other times I can just walk in and right up to the counter. They do have a limited selection compared to other boba places, but the items I have gotten are actually really good:

- Nutella Milk Tea: This is my go-to drink, and definitely my favorite out of everything I've tried here! You can definitely taste the chocolate, and together with the the boba creates a symphony of sweet flavor. The boba itself, to me, has the perfect consistency. Highly recommend.
- Matcha Milk Green Tea: This is really good as well. The sweetness of the tea balances out the green tea flavor. I recommend getting this drink with the taro pudding, which has a subtle, yet noticeable taro flavor. I also really liked the consistency of the pudding.

I really like the fact that they serve the boba in glass milk jugs that you can keep! They also provide lids for them, if you want to save it or take it to go.

Overall, I really enjoy this place and frequently return to it whenever I'm on this side of San Francisco. Definitely recommend!

excerpts: I ordered an original black milk tea with boba and the tea flavor was intense.
It wasn't my favorite, and the boba seemed under cooked maybe?
They were really hard.
In the end, the only thing I was excited about was for the cute glass jar it came in.
And I would definitely come back and order another drink-- just to get another jar.
milk tea.author: Ashley W.
milk tea.review: Decided to come and try it out one day and was neither wowed or disappointed. It's on a really busy street making it hard to find parking but also has long lines on weekends. They have a big menu with lots of different flavors but I thought it was a bit expensive for boba. My total for two drinks was around $10. I ordered an original black milk tea with boba and the tea flavor was intense. It wasn't my favorite, and the boba seemed under cooked maybe? They were really hard. In the end, the only thing I was excited about was for the cute glass jar it came in. And I would definitely come back and order another drink-- just to get another jar.

excerpts: * Oolong Milk tea (because it has the least amount of caffeine), (+) boba, (+) almond milk,
(-) sugar, aka no added sugar

Almond Milk tea

PS - Plentea gives you your drink in glass jars!
milk tea.author: Alexa H.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is one of my favorite Boba spots for a number of reasons but one of my favorites is because they are open so late. If you are looking for a nice hang out spot for an after work gathering, then Plentea should be your top choice.

The upstairs area in their building is wonderful; they have couches and tables set up for all of your lounging needs. 

Favorites:
* Oolong Milk tea (because it has the least amount of caffeine), (+) boba, (+) almond milk, (-) sugar, aka no added sugar
* Almond Milk tea

PS - Plentea gives you your drink in glass jars! If you return it, you get a discount on your next drink.
PSS - their check-in offer is great, don't forget to check in :)

excerpts: I ordered a green milk tea and it was OK, nothing special but still delicious.
milk tea.author: Diana W.
milk tea.review:
The atmosphere inside is nice and cute. There was plenty of seating on the weekend. I ordered a green milk tea and it was OK, nothing special but still delicious. (I love milk teas of all shapes and sizes.)

Walking out with my drink was not enjoyable.. The drink was cold and the condensation on the outside of my glass jar made me afraid it would slip out of my finger tips!! I had to hold it with two hands, making holding my earlier Chinatown food purchases less convenient. I would definitely have preferred a regular cup. The Plentea logo is not even that cute in my opinion ........ Therefore I do not like to pay the higher price for the glass jar. I may have liked this idea more if the logo was cuter hehe.

excerpts: I love their drinks but their almond milk tea is a bit too strong, but none the less still yum.
The Nutella milk barely had any Nutella inside unlike the picture shown on the menu...
It tastes like basic milk tea to me..
But I was extremely happy with my taro milk and Thai milk tea.
There are no public restrooms available
so you'll have to go some place else if you have bladder problems
they have four tables downstairs and an upstairs portion too.
milk tea.author: Noelle Y.
milk tea.review: This place is about a mile away from China town! I love their drinks but their almond milk tea is a bit too strong, but none the less still yum. The Nutella milk barely had any Nutella inside unlike the picture shown on the menu... It tastes like basic milk tea to me.. But I was extremely happy with my taro milk and Thai milk tea. There are no public restrooms available so you'll have to go some place else if you have bladder problems  they have four tables downstairs and an upstairs portion too.

excerpts: I ordered the brown sugar ice milk tea with pearls and egg pudding.
milk tea.author: Steffi G.
milk tea.review:
Plentea over Boba Guys any day!!!

I ordered the brown sugar ice milk tea with pearls and egg pudding. It's just as amazing as Cafe Lattea down in Cupertino. 

The glass jars intrigued me, as well as how well presented the drinks were displayed on social media. I was not disappointed. It's a bit pricey, but who cares?! It's a good drink! 

The ambiance is very hipster and modern. Small, cozy interior. Fast service. The staff gave really good recommendations. Usually, I've heard there is a line that goes out the door, but luckily, we were in and out right away.

Tip: if you bring the glass bottles that you purchased, you get a discount on your future visits.

excerpts: I decided to stay with the classics and got a green milk tea with boba.
It was pretty good and on the sweet side; I had forgotten to tell them to include less sweetener.
Pretty decent if you ask me.
My friend got a "sea salt crema tea" cause she thought it sounded good, but it was nasty.
Overly salty that you don't taste any tea.
Don't get this.
The cool things out this place is you get to keep the glass container that your milk tea comes in!!
I would definitely come back again but the tea itself is not THAT special.
milk tea.author: Michael N.
milk tea.review:
Finally visited Plentea and it in fact live up to the hype!!
They had a pretty big variety of teas, but not so big where you have no idea what to get. I decided to stay with the classics and got a green milk tea with boba. It was pretty good and on the sweet side; I had forgotten to tell them to include less sweetener. Pretty decent if you ask me.
My friend got a "sea salt crema tea" cause she thought it sounded good, but it was nasty. Overly salty that you don't taste any tea. Don't get this.
The cool things out this place is you get to keep the glass container that your milk tea comes in!! 
I would definitely come back again but the tea itself is not THAT special.

excerpts: I came here the other day and ordered the black milk tea with grass jelly.
First of all, this was unbearably sweet.
I could only drink about a quarter of it, and I felt sick for the next few hours.
The drink itself was pretty strong too.
It almost tasted like coffee instead of milk tea.
Also, the grass jelly was broken up into all these tiny little pieces, which I didn't really enjoy.
I liked the glass bottle that I got, but I pretty much didn't enjoy anything else about my drink here.
milk tea.author: Cynthia M.
milk tea.review: I came here the other day and ordered the black milk tea with grass jelly. First of all, this was unbearably sweet. I could only drink about a quarter of it, and I felt sick for the next few hours. The drink itself was pretty strong too. It almost tasted like coffee instead of milk tea. Also, the grass jelly was broken up into all these tiny little pieces, which I didn't really enjoy. I liked the glass bottle that I got, but I pretty much didn't enjoy anything else about my drink here.

excerpts: I got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca pearls.
I derno but that milk bottle sure adds flavor or makes the whole experience better.
My friend got the caramel and that one is way sweeter than brown sugar so latter is the way to go.
I really liked the egg pudding and when I got a straw of pudding, pearl, and the slushie tea,
oh that hit the spot.
I also tried the combo of egg and taro pudding and that was good
but I still like the pearl in it.
Dang
I broke my New Years resolution of no boba because of the friggin milk bottle.
Don't forget to pack the cap so you can reuse and drink water.
Bring the bottle back for a discount too!
milk tea.author: Amy H.
milk tea.review: Yum. Came here around 4 on a Saturday after my failed attempt at casting for the Amazing Race. There was indeed a line. I got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca pearls. I derno but that milk bottle sure adds flavor or makes the whole experience better. My friend got the caramel and that one is way sweeter than brown sugar so latter is the way to go. I really liked the egg pudding and when I got a straw of pudding, pearl, and the slushie tea, oh that hit the spot. I also tried the combo of egg and taro pudding and that was good but I still like the pearl in it. Dang I broke my New Years resolution of no boba because of the friggin milk bottle. Don't forget to pack the cap so you can reuse and drink water. Bring the bottle back for a discount too!

excerpts: You can taste more of the tea than milk in their milk tea which is a major plus.
I don't like places that over-do the sugar and milk.
Will return to try other flavors!
milk tea.author: Briget P.
milk tea.review: I'll be honest, I came here for the glass jar. You can taste more of the tea than milk in their milk tea which is a major plus. I don't like places that over-do the sugar and milk. Will return to try other flavors!

excerpts: Okay, now taste the milk tea.
I'm no pearl milk tea snob, but it's not too shabby.
Honestly, this place in my opinion fares better than Ten Ren up in chinatown.
It's pretty tasty milk tea, decent boba, and decent grass jelly.
Expensive as shit, but if you're working downtown and need that fix, the $5 drink will get you there.
Not to mention if you're a hipster you'll probably dig the fancy glass bottle you get to keep.
I use it at work now as a water cup and love it.
Worth.
milk tea.author: Joanne Y.
milk tea.review:
This place is expensive - get over it.

Over it?

Okay, now taste the milk tea. I'm no pearl milk tea snob, but it's not too shabby. Honestly, this place in my opinion fares better than Ten Ren up in chinatown. It's pretty tasty milk tea, decent boba, and decent grass jelly. Expensive as shit, but if you're working downtown and need that fix, the $5 drink will get you there. Not to mention if you're a hipster you'll probably dig the fancy glass bottle you get to keep. I use it at work now as a water cup and love it. Worth.

excerpts: Milk tea served in milk bottles!
This cute idea has crowds lining up all the time, often out the door.
I tried their milk tea, green milk tea, and iced milk with caramel and egg pudding.
All of the drinks were nothing special and their boba wasn't well cooked as well.
For approximately $5, I had hoped for a more delicious drink.
milk tea.author: Michael L.
milk tea.review:
Milk tea served in milk bottles! This cute idea has crowds lining up all the time, often out the door. However, I was unfortunately disappointed with the quality of the drinks.

I tried their milk tea, green milk tea, and iced milk with caramel and egg pudding. All of the drinks were nothing special and their boba wasn't well cooked as well. For approximately $5, I had hoped for a more delicious drink. I enjoyed the novel glass milk bottles though.
