As a note, you can use the bottles afterwards (avoid hot drinks though, two of my friends' bottles broke because they put hot water into it). If you bring them back (or just grab one from the second floor) you can get 10% off your purchase.

excerpts: I love matcha so ofcourse I had to get the matcha milk tea.
It was really good
but I highly recommend you drink it right when you get it.
Saving it for the next day or a couple hours is a bad idea.
I wanted something sweet
so I went with the chocolate mousse.
They don't make it themselves as I saw them take a slice from a box
but I didn't mind since it was bomb.
milk tea.author: Vivian P.
milk tea.review:
I loved this place ever since the very first day. I love matcha so ofcourse I had to get the matcha milk tea. It was really good but I highly recommend you drink it right when you get it. Saving it for the next day or a couple hours is a bad idea. I wanted something sweet so I went with the chocolate mousse. They don't make it themselves as I saw them take a slice from a box but I didn't mind since it was bomb. My boyfriend and I ordered another slice after we finished the first one in seconds. 

I also tried the peach fruit green tea. I think it was ok, I felt like it was a bit too watery even though I always order less ice or no ice here. The fruit bits are nice too. I'll try to try something else next time.

My boyfriend and I have somehow always managed to get here to find no line but last time we came, there was a long line out the front door. Even though the lines here might be long, it goes by pretty fast. The drinks are made pretty quick too, unlike other tea places. Will be coming back!

excerpts: Working at milk tea shop myself (I won't mention which one)
I have high expectations for tasting the tea in my drinks,
I ordered the Nutella milk tea (4/5) and the Almond Milk tea (2/5).
The Almond tea had too much flavoring
and I couldn't even taste the tea in it!
I will probably not come back here again and just stick with my milk tea places back in SJ.
milk tea.author: Zeinab J.
milk tea.review:
Working at milk tea shop myself (I won't mention which one) I have high expectations for tasting the tea in my drinks, so I was really excited to try Plentea for the first time. 

I ordered the Nutella milk tea (4/5) and the Almond Milk tea (2/5). The Almond tea had too much flavoring and I couldn't even taste the tea in it! I was really disappointed in that. 

Also, when I got my drinks I didn't notice there was a crack in my bottle until I was already on my way home to SJ!!! Do the employees even check the bottles?!?! 

I will probably not come back here again and just stick with my milk tea places back in SJ.

excerpts: The almond milk tea ( black tea based) was a little strong but still good.
milk tea.author: Ana B.
milk tea.review: Boba was good. Cute atmosphere. The almond milk tea ( black tea based) was a little strong but still good.

excerpts: Plentea is a milk tea place on that hipster street nearby Chinatown, and it's an interesting change of pace from the super Chinese milk tea places.
Order a milk tea drink, it comes in a bottle.
You finish your bottle, cap it up, and toss it in your backpack and ruin everything.
Come here if you have to show your friends to Bay Area milk tea.
They honestly won't know the difference in terms of quality, since it's not THAT much worse compared to other places, but given the price, it really isn't the best deal you can get for your money.
milk tea.author: Brian L.
milk tea.review:
Sometimes, I wonder why I come here.

For the jars? For what other reason, really? For the drinks? Are you kidding me?

Plentea is a milk tea place on that hipster street nearby Chinatown, and it's an interesting change of pace from the super Chinese milk tea places.

They subsist almost exclusively on their bottle gimmick. Order a milk tea drink, it comes in a bottle. You finish your bottle, cap it up, and toss it in your backpack and ruin everything. It's fun to do every once in a while, really.

But in all serious, the drinks are rather unremarkable. Everything tastes slightly watered down, but maybe I haven't been ordering the right things. I think the saving grace for this place are the milk drinks, since they're not half bad, but for the price, I'd really rather go elsewhere. I guess you do get the bottle with it.

Come here if you have to show your friends to Bay Area milk tea. They honestly won't know the difference in terms of quality, since it's not THAT much worse compared to other places, but given the price, it really isn't the best deal you can get for your money. However, they will love the jars that come with it, and basics love jars.

TIP: Sometimes they don't have the jar. Check Yelp for the tips to see if anyone has updated, and if they don't have jars, take your business to somewhere like Boba Guys instead.

excerpts: The plan was to try the simple classic (black milk tea with tapioca pearls) and see how it went.
It's the kind of good that probably now has ruined me for almost all other milk tea I might encounter.
milk tea.author: Daniel B.
milk tea.review:
I've got boba tea on my mind, so I thought it was finally time to write about my experience at Plentea.

Two words: genre redefining

Friends tried and failed to turn me onto boba tea in the past taking me to their favorite spots around the edges of Chinatown. But the tea was too sweet, and the tapioca pearls really did nothing for me. They were gummy, bland, and entirely undesirable.

Fast forward several years to my first excursion to Plentea. I was with a group from work, and figured I would give boba tea one last try. The plan was to try the simple classic (black milk tea with tapioca pearls) and see how it went.

Damn. That's good. 

It's the kind of good that probably now has ruined me for almost all other milk tea I might encounter. But at least I now kind of get it.

Because more than a sugar bomb, this was about tea first and foremost. Tannic, malty black tea was the dominant flavor. And it was good tea. There was just enough milk and sugar to smooth out the edges. The tapioca balls weren't slimy at all. They were firm and snappy. Chewing on them was a pleasure, and the act of chewing helped to extend the joy of my tea and not diminish it.

Speaking of joy... it's hard not to be delighted by the visual appeal of this shop and its product. Count me among the many who have been charmed.

Given the high quality of everything else, I was only dismayed to see they were pouring Kirkland milk from Costco. This is San Francisco. It's Clover country. Get with the program Plentea. 

But with lines out the door, I guess they don't have to change a thing. To get a fifth star from me, they'll need to take that one last step towards awesomeness. So close.

excerpts: I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba and egg pudding.
The boba was pretty good, chewy and cooked just right.
I enjoyed the egg pudding more though, because it's probably the best I've had at a boba place.
milk tea.author: Kailin H.
milk tea.review:
This is one of the boba places in SF I've wanted to go for a while because I kept seeing instagrams of their cute glass jars. I now have the jar since they let you keep it, and I really like it.

I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba and egg pudding. The boba was pretty good, chewy and cooked just right. I enjoyed the egg pudding more though, because it's probably the best I've had at a boba place. The egg flavor is really strong, and the pudding is not overly sweet and doesn't fall apart easily.

I especially like visiting this place because they have a charming upstairs lounging area, with couches and tables. One of the walls is decorated with lovely flowers and the shop's name. The only drawback is that they don't have a bathroom, which can be a challenge after drinking lots of tea! Their service is great also, with staff routinely cleaning the area upstairs.

excerpts: I had Thai Milk Tea with tapioca.
It's good, just like the common thai milk tea you get almost everywhere.
It's not too sweet for me fortunately.
milk tea.author: Bianca N.
milk tea.review:
Day of Visit: 24 Nov 2016.
This is my second visit, first one was about 2 years ago(?) i don't remember what I got at that time so I'll just talk about my purchase today.
Main reason why I was here today is: they're the only boba shop open on Thanksgiving (at least around downtown).

I love the bottle! I threw my first bottle away because it was bothersome to pack some 'unnecessary' stuff when I was moving out of my old place. The cap doesn't look very reliable, but enough for to cover the bottle so I could just rest it next to my leg while sitting during a commute. 

I had Thai Milk Tea with tapioca. It's good, just like the common thai milk tea you get almost everywhere. It's not too sweet for me fortunately. I also like the taste of the boba, but don't you think the size of the boba is a bit smaller than the boba you get at other places?

It's not a place I'll visit often, but I'll definitely visit once in a while.

excerpts: My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting.
Worth a try, but probably won't return.
milk tea.author: Gary C.
milk tea.review: Honestly, the tea is so-so, it's not impressive. The gimmick here is that they let you take their glass bottle to-go! We tried the taro ice milk which is tasted good. My friend tried the nutella milk tea, pretty interesting. Worth a try, but probably won't return.

excerpts: Despite the wait time, the milk tea was incredible!
It actually tasted like tea rather than sugar water like what most places have to offer.
The boba has a decent taste as well.
I will definitely stop by here again.
I recommend the black milk tea w/ pearls!
milk tea.author: Tina T.
milk tea.review: Today was the first time I tried plentea. I walked 2 miles only to wait 30 minutes to order. Despite the wait time, the milk tea was incredible! It actually tasted like tea rather than sugar water like what most places have to offer. The boba has a decent taste as well. I will definitely stop by here again. I recommend the black milk tea w/ pearls!

excerpts: so I like my milk tea plain
(it's cold in SF so why not a hot milk tea?)
they let you know in advance that you won't be getting a glass bottle
milk tea.author: Faith C.
milk tea.review:
Personally working at a boba shop, this place is great and has great boba to pair with your drinks. 

I've had boba since i was 5 so I like my milk tea plain and that's exactly what I get here. 

Staff is very accommodating especially when it comes to getting hot drinks (it's cold in SF so why not a hot milk tea?) they let you know in advance that you won't be getting a glass bottle but i disliked the fact that you don't get a 10% discount since you got a cup instead of a glass bottle. 

Usually you can bring in your old glass bottle and get a percentage off your drinks or if they run out of glass bottles you also get a percentage off but why is it that when you order an ordinary hot drink you are
charged with the same price? I believe it's a little unfair. 

Overall staff and drinks are great but pricing should be consistent.

excerpts: I love milk tea and boba, so that was just an added bonus.
Or so I thought....
Their milk tea was a little underwhelming.
Something about the taste that just made me want to waste half of it.
The boba was ok, but definitely nothing special.
milk tea.author: Aaron Y.
milk tea.review:
I really went here to get one of their useful glass bottles. I love milk tea and boba, so that was just an added bonus. Or so I thought....Their milk tea was a little underwhelming. Something about the taste that just made me want to waste half of it. The boba was ok, but definitely nothing special. There are other spots in the area that don't cost $5 and are better. 

I supposed if you're walking by and you don't want to walk much further, you can stop by and pick up some here, but I'm definitely not going out of my way to get this. At least I came away with a couple neat glass bottles to use for other things!

excerpts: Anyway, the tea and milk tea are both very good quality.
milk tea.author: Audrey L.
milk tea.review:
Plentea usually has a ridiculously long line for a reason -- it serves pretty darn good tea and desserts. Not to mention the glass bottles that come with the drinks are a really good draw for all the hipsters out there. 

By the way, you have to get the glass bottle whether you're going to come back with the bottle for a 20% discount or not. They don't give refunds if you decide to return the glass bottle to them. I personally think they should have the latter option too, just in case people are from out of the area and don't need a glass bottle. Reuse, recycle, right?

Anyway, the tea and milk tea are both very good quality. They use real fruit in their fruit teas, which is always a plus. 

I wouldn't recommend the fruit milk though -- they were quite artificial tasting. I tried the blueberry milk once, and I think they used dried blueberries and blueberry jam, at least that's what it tasted like.

The belgian waffle is pretty legit, and the restaurant owner takes a lot of pride in this dessert. The toasted marshmallow was perfection -- browned just the right amount, and served nice and warm. I was also very impressed at the quality considering it was a mad house in the kitchen, and there were lots of other drink orders going through.

excerpts: There are so many flavors--original milk tea, matcha latte, sweet taro, coffee milk, almond milk, and even nutella milk (??!).
They also have fruit teas for the non-milk tea lovers.

Drinks are ~$5 and you basically choose your flavored drink cold/hot, sugar level (50% is usually perfect for me for other places but plentea makes it less sweet compared to other places which is perfect for me), and finally add-ins (my fav!).

For add-ins you get to choose from: taro/egg pudding (my must-have!), tapioca (boba), chia seed (for the health nuts), lychee jelly (fruity peeps), grass jelly (yum), red bean (for the sweeties), and aloe (light jelly/texture).
My favorite part is the glass bottle your drink comes in.
They're super adorable and you can even keep them!
I got the almond milk tea with taro pudding (my two fav things together omg), cold, 50% sugar.
Loved it!

It had a nice almond flavor that tasted really pure (NOT artificial almond flavor that gets stuck at the back of your throat), subtle black tea mixed in the background that was not overpowering or bitter, and perfect level of creaminess that just had me wanting more!
Definitely wished they gave more taro pudding because it was that good--again, no artificial or overly sweet taro taste, and the pudding tasted soft and fluffy.
I'm already ready to come back and try some more!
Matcha is definitely my thing
so...until next time!
milk tea.author: Alvina L.
milk tea.review:
FIRST time of PLENTEA ("plenty") times to come! 

Point to note: I am not a crazy boba fan and really don't drink boba all that often (except for half and half in socal which I lovee or sharetea which is pretty good too).

However, this place definitely has my stamp of approval for your boba fix. There are so many flavors--original milk tea, matcha latte, sweet taro, coffee milk, almond milk, and even nutella milk (??!). They also have fruit teas for the non-milk tea lovers. Drinks are ~$5 and you basically choose your flavored drink cold/hot, sugar level (50% is usually perfect for me for other places but plentea makes it less sweet compared to other places which is perfect for me), and finally add-ins (my fav!). For add-ins you get to choose from: taro/egg pudding (my must-have!), tapioca (boba), chia seed (for the health nuts), lychee jelly (fruity peeps), grass jelly (yum), red bean (for the sweeties), and aloe (light jelly/texture). My favorite part is the glass bottle your drink comes in. They're super adorable and you can even keep them! (or bring them back for your next drink for 10% off...correct me if I'm wrong). 

I got the almond milk tea with taro pudding (my two fav things together omg), cold, 50% sugar. Loved it! It had a nice almond flavor that tasted really pure (NOT artificial almond flavor that gets stuck at the back of your throat), subtle black tea mixed in the background that was not overpowering or bitter, and perfect level of creaminess that just had me wanting more! Definitely wished they gave more taro pudding because it was that good--again, no artificial or overly sweet taro taste, and the pudding tasted soft and fluffy. I'm already ready to come back and try some more! Matcha is definitely my thing so...until next time!

excerpts: My friend even doubled checked with the barista (female Asian with big eyes and heavy eyeliner) that his boba milk tea is made with whole milk and she confirmed yes.
When the barista was making the drinks I saw her adding whole milk followed by some half and half.
She then exchanged a look with the other barista (male) and smirked.
The guy then looked at me and my friend, as if he wanted to make sure that we didn't see what they were doing.
There weren't any other customers, but I wasn't sure if she was making our drinks
so I didn't say anything.
After me and my friend tasted our boba we were certain that there is definitely half and half in our drinks.
I should've went back and ask her about it
but I didn't feel like it.
It was very bizarre.
I couldn't figure out why she would do that.
Did they run out of milk?
Was she taking some kind of pleasure in adding half and half into people's drinks?
Was she simply trying to make it taste better?
Idk.
One thing
I'm sure tho, is that I am not going back again.
It's such a shame, because me and friend really liked this place.
milk tea.author: Tinaa T.
milk tea.review: Me and my friend went here on a Thursday night around 8:30 and ordered 2 drinks, both with whole milk. My friend even doubled checked with the barista (female Asian with big eyes and heavy eyeliner) that his boba milk tea is made with whole milk and she confirmed yes. When the barista was making the drinks I saw her adding whole milk followed by some half and half. She then exchanged a look with the other barista (male) and smirked. The guy then looked at me and my friend, as if he wanted to make sure that we didn't see what they were doing. There weren't any other customers, but I wasn't sure if she was making our drinks so I didn't say anything. After me and my friend tasted our boba we were certain that there is definitely half and half in our drinks. I should've went back and ask her about it but I didn't feel like it. It was very bizarre. I couldn't figure out why she would do that. Did they run out of milk? Was she taking some kind of pleasure in adding half and half into people's drinks? Was she simply trying to make it taste better? Idk. One thing I'm sure tho, is that I am not going back again. It's such a shame, because me and friend really liked this place.

excerpts: Their milk tea (oolong) was good, I prefer it over Sharetea.
milk tea.author: Linda T.
milk tea.review:
I love the glass bottle and even comes with a cap.
I tried the honey lemon tea with taro pudding and that wasn't the beat combo but the tea itself  refreshing. Their milk tea (oolong) was good, I prefer it over Sharetea.

Worth checking out because of the glass bottle :-)

excerpts: I ended up ordering black milk tea with taro pudding.
Delicious.
The milk tea wasn't super sweet and went really well with the pudding.
There's just something about the glass bottle that makes it taste that much better.
It's kinda like how coke is in a real bottle.
milk tea.author: Jen W.
milk tea.review:
My cousins first introduced me to this place when I was visiting them.  I was already intrigued with the bottles the drinks came in.  I only had a couple of sips of theirs and had to come back for my own bottle.  

The lady at the counter was super friendly.  I was super stoked to see taro pudding!  I've never had it before and I think it was pretty obvious how excited I was.  She went and immediately gave me a sample of it.  What awesome service.

I ended up ordering black milk tea with taro pudding.  Delicious.  The milk tea wasn't super sweet and went really well with the pudding.  There's just something about the glass bottle that makes it taste that much better.  It's kinda like how coke is in a real bottle.  Haha.  

If you return the bottle, I believe you get 10% off your next purchase.  What a brilliant marketing concept.  Parking is difficult.  It's best to take the bus out here or walk.  

I'd give it 5 stars anyhoo.

excerpts: Honey Milk Tea with Boba
milk tea.author: Jonathan C.
milk tea.review:
Ordered: Honey Milk Tea with Boba

Why 3 Stars:

Honestly the tea was very average here and the boba was quite good. Nothing about the drink stood out as wow or you need to come here. Kind of tastes like most other boba places and so I wouldn't really say that you need to come here and check it out.

Something that they do, do is that they serve their drinks in glass bottles and that is very cool and unique. Also they have plastic caps on the top so that you can take the drink to go if you would like. 

Once again the reason I came here is because I am from Seattle and I heard that the Bay Area boba is so much better and that is why I made my way down here.

excerpts: I got the Thai Milk Tea with Tapioca.
I love Thai tea and this one was alright.
I didn't think it was exceptionally good.
milk tea.author: Millie W.
milk tea.review:
I got the Thai Milk Tea with Tapioca. I love Thai tea and this one was alright. I didn't think it was exceptionally good. I love the concept of having boba in a glass jar and this was exciting. 

I want to go back to try the teas next week.

excerpts: I am probably different than other customers who I seen so far drink either milk tea or slush (like smoothie but not as watery).
milk tea.author: Charles S.
milk tea.review:
One of the best tea place in the city.  This place pours tea in glass bottle instead of plastic cup like other places.  Advantage for glass bottle is able to keep and bring it for next visit.

I been there for few times and only drink either no sugar black tea or oolong.  Toppings usually either tapioca, grass jelly, or red bean.  I am probably different than other customers who I seen so far drink either milk tea or slush (like smoothie but not as watery).

excerpts:
and I have had 

Nutella milk tea 

Nutella milk tea with extra nutella 

Iced coffee milktea with nutella 

Lavender lemonade with aloe
Currently craving iced coffee milk tea with nutella.. yum..
milk tea.author: Lindsay S.
milk tea.review:
When you first walk in and look at the menu it looks so simple and plain but once you you mind opens up to all the possibilities come into mind. 

My husband and I have had 

Nutella milk tea 

Nutella milk tea with extra nutella 

Iced coffee milktea with nutella 

Lavender lemonade with aloe (wish it didn't have seeds pain in the ass to drink)

Fresh fruit Oolong mango tea with grass jelly

Sweet taro milk with taro pudding and grass jelly 

Iced carmel milk with tapioca 


and we have yet to cover the menu. 

I really enjoy the glass bottles that come with the every drink and the discount that is offered if you bring it back. 

Currently craving iced coffee milk tea with nutella.. yum.. :)

excerpts: They use a fruit purée instead of syrup, which I enjoy, and you can customize the sweetness and ice as with any other chain milk tea store.
Plentea is among plenty of milk tea options in the city.
But, if you're hankering for tea in FiDi, or if you really want a souvenir glass bottle to add to your glass bottle blowing band, a visit to Plentea is as good as any.
milk tea.author: Adele F.
milk tea.review:
The hype surrounds the bottle. It's trendy, hipster, and Eco-friendly. Plus, if you decide to keep it and bring it back, you get 10% off your drink.

But, unless you work in FiDi and remember to grab your bottle on the way out, it's highly unlikely you'll be scoring that 10% discount on a regular basis. Unless carrying heavy glass bottles in bags is your makeshift workout. Which seems intriguingly dangerous.

Nevertheless, the prices of the drinks here definitely absorb the cost of the branded glass bottles, running you around $4-$5 for your drink and an additional $0.50 per topping.

That is steep.

I usually get their fresh fruit teas, $4.95, with tapioca for an extra $0.50. They use a fruit purée instead of syrup, which I enjoy, and you can customize the sweetness and ice as with any other chain milk tea store. The pearls are chewy, the tea is smooth, and they use crushed ice--aside from the price, they're doing it right.

Plentea is among plenty of milk tea options in the city. But, if you're hankering for tea in FiDi, or if you really want a souvenir glass bottle to add to your glass bottle blowing band, a visit to Plentea is as good as any.

excerpts: I ordered a sea salt caramel specialty milk tea and my friend ordered a roasted oolong.
Not too sweet, but still flavorful enough.
I usually frequent Wonderful Food on Irving and Purple Kow in Richmond, but Plentea is a strong contender!
I'll be back!
milk tea.author: Y D L.
milk tea.review: I love this place! Cute interior, reusable glass bottles, but the best of all- their tea is high quality! I ordered a sea salt caramel specialty milk tea and my friend ordered a roasted oolong. Not too sweet, but still flavorful enough. I usually frequent Wonderful Food on Irving and Purple Kow in Richmond, but Plentea is a strong contender! I'll be back! =)

excerpts: We were craving boba and saw some people walking on the street with boba milk tea in glass bottles.
We decided to try it out.
The boba shop is cute, modern and clean.
The boba the texture was off and uneven.
The drinks are overpriced at $6-7.
I got the matcha green milk tea and it didn't taste like the real matcha at all.
milk tea.author: Essie K.
milk tea.review:
We were craving boba and saw some people walking on the street with boba milk tea in glass bottles. We decided to try it out. The boba shop is cute, modern and clean. 
The boba the texture was off and uneven. The drinks are overpriced at $6-7. I got the matcha green milk tea and it didn't taste like the real matcha at all. It's a unique concept and cute but the quality of the boba drinks is way off. 

Pros: you get to keep your glass bottle. They give a 10% discount if you bring it back for future drinks.

excerpts: Except for the taro milk tea cause that is fresh off the boat.
Not the boat, maybe wherever taro grows from.
milk tea.author: Alison K.
milk tea.review:
Try Plentea just to say you've been here. And for those cool looking bottles. Other than that, the drinks are really nothing special. Except for the taro milk tea cause that is fresh off the boat. Not the boat, maybe wherever taro grows from. The drink has taro bits in it, and it doesn't taste like they used powder. 

If you reuse the bottle, they give you a discount. Don't be too amazed because the discount is probably just the price of the bottle. Nothing surprising there. 

Kind of annoying to drive with the drink once you put your straw in and started drinking because it leaves you wondering where to store the cap. I don't know about you but I wanted to keep the cap so I had some hard time keeping it in a safe place so that it doesn't get lost. All for a cap. Yup. 

The boba shop is kind of small, but it's two story! So if there are no more open tables on the first floor, try your luck on the second. The second floor is more like a loft because you can look down to the first floor from it. There is also a cool hipster decorative area that will gain you all them likes on instagram. You're welcome.

excerpts: Supposedly besides milk tea, this place also sells juices, shakes etc.
Iced Oolong Milk Tea (half sweet) with boba: C.
I was very disappointed.
I almost felt like drinking water.
Usually with half sugar, the tea taste should stand out or at least you can feel some milk silkiness - not at all.
There was also no taste for the boba.
milk tea.author: Simon C.
milk tea.review:
Honestly, I went to Plentea because of two reasons:

1. It was a Sunday and Boba Guys was closed
2. The cute little bottles pictures on Yelp

It was around 3pm on a Sunday afternoon. There were quite a few customers, and interior design was pretty nice. Supposedly besides milk tea, this place also sells juices, shakes etc.

Iced Oolong Milk Tea (half sweet) with boba: C.
I was very disappointed. I almost felt like drinking water. Usually with half sugar, the tea taste should stand out or at least you can feel some milk silkiness - not at all. There was also no taste for the boba. Drink quality aside - the cups they use are the simplest plastic transparent cups with no decoration whatsoever, so there is no marketing/art point that I could have added.

Meh, next time I am in downtown craving for boba on a Sunday, I would rather walk up a bit more to Chinatown to get some higher quality drinks.

excerpts: Ordered the regular milk tea with black tea and the Nutella milk tea.
Both very good.
We ordered takoyaki as well and that was delish.
milk tea.author: Nancy Y.
milk tea.review: Ordered the regular milk tea with black tea and the Nutella milk tea. Both very good. We ordered takoyaki as well and that was delish.

excerpts: Drink: Black milk tea with boba, 0% sugar.
I was truly disappointed with the milk tea however.
It was watery, not at all creamy, and I could just barely taste any tea.
I might as well have been drinking dehydrating water?
milk tea.author: Nicole B.
milk tea.review:
Drink: Black milk tea with boba, 0% sugar. 

Milk teas with boba are pretty much my baseline when trying out boba places. I usually order milk teas with no sugar and hope that their tapioca balls are well soaked in brown sugar/honey/sweetener.

Honestly, I wasn't super impressed. The tapioca balls were just okay in texture, not that sweet at all. I was truly disappointed with the milk tea however. It was watery, not at all creamy, and I could just barely taste any tea. I might as well have been drinking dehydrating water? I had to make sure I had some boba with each sip to get some flavor. 

I definitely like the glass bottles that come with the drinks and their incentive to reuse. I think it's a fun idea. 

As for the store, the store was pretty clean, and the employees were very kind. Since they don't have a public restroom, they even gave recommendations on some restaurants nearby that had restrooms I could use LOL. 

WiFi is great with readily available password, plenty of seats and outlets on the second floor. Fair warning though, the speakers are located on the second floor, so it's LOUD.

excerpts: I personally went with the Nutella Milk Tea which had a nice little chocalately addition to each sip of milk tea.
I didn't ask for any bubbles
so I can't comment on that.
However do note that you only get to keep the glass bottle if you order a cold drink.
Warm drinks will not come in the glass bottle.
milk tea.author: Jackson S.
milk tea.review: Great little boba shop on my first visit to SF. Many options that all seemed delicious. I personally went with the Nutella Milk Tea which had a nice little chocalately addition to each sip of milk tea. I didn't ask for any bubbles so I can't comment on that. However do note that you only get to keep the glass bottle if you order a cold drink. Warm drinks will not come in the glass bottle.

excerpts: The iced coffee is just ok, but the standark milk tea with boba is good.
milk tea.author: Eric E.
milk tea.review:
This is a good place to bring a date or to hand out with friends. 

ENVIRONMENT
The downstairs space is limited but there is an upstairs as well. Don't expect it to be quiet..think Starbucks.

SERVICE
It's a little slow. You can wait in line for up to 30 minutes; especially on Saturdays. It's good, but they really need to start taking orders from people standing in line starting at the front door. They use an iPad for payment so it would really be easy.

COST
It's a bit pricey, but you get to keep the beaker. They do offer a 10% discount if you bring your own beaker back, but who carries a glass container around with them. 

QUALITY
I will that it's good and they take the time to get it right. I've have the Ice Milk with caramel and the brown sugar, but the caramel is better. The iced coffee is just ok, but the standark milk tea with boba is good. 

FOOD
I haven't eaten there since they do not offer anything Gluten free.

excerpts: I got the regular milk tea with the lychee jelly.
It's alright.
Nothing special.
I've also had the crema before, which wasn't as great
but I do have to say it was being saved for me for quite a number of hours in a fridge,
milk tea.author: Julie L.
milk tea.review:
The bottle is probably one of these smartest marketing ideas that this place has. Everyone comes here because they want the bottle or they want to use their bottle they got for a 10% discount. Also, it sounds like they often run out of the bottles because when I went, they didn't have bottles to sell nor did they have any when a friend of mine went a week ago. Again, the bottle is such a smart marketing idea.

I got the regular milk tea with the lychee jelly. It's alright. Nothing special. I've also had the crema before, which wasn't as great but I do have to say it was being saved for me for quite a number of hours in a fridge, so I don't think it's fair for me to review it besides saying that it's not good after being in the fridge for a while. 

The interior is really nice. It's clean and it's two levels. When I went, it was a bit stuffy and warm, but it was okay for me because I was a bit sick and cold. However, my friend said it was too much. I enjoy sitting in the upper part of the place, it's a nice place to grab a drink and catch up with a friend.

excerpts: 4.5 dollars for plain milk tea is slightly expensive in Chinatown.
But considering that I got a glass bottle
I got the plain iced oolong unsweetened milk tea.
It was a just plain milk tea, unsurprising.
But it was a good break in a long day of walking.
I wouldn't suggest fully unsweetened with Oolong, since it turned out quite bitter.
milk tea.author: Yu S.
milk tea.review:
4.5 dollars for plain milk tea is slightly expensive in Chinatown. But considering that I got a glass bottle it wasn't bad for the price.

There was a lot of ways to customize the drinks here. I was able to get it unsweetened, which I wasn't able to do in a lot of other bubble tea stores. The store was nicely decorated, and much cleaner than the streets outside. I got the plain iced oolong unsweetened milk tea. It was a just plain milk tea, unsurprising. But it was a good break in a long day of walking. I wouldn't suggest fully unsweetened with Oolong, since it turned out quite bitter.

excerpts: The menu is really streamlined and easy to choose from, unlike a lot of other milk tea shops which have menus covering the walls.
milk tea.author: Stephanie D.
milk tea.review:
This place is SO cute. Definitely instagram worthy, isn't that how we judge eateries now? 

The menu is really streamlined and easy to choose from, unlike a lot of other milk tea shops which have menus covering the walls. 

The staff was really quick and nice! 

The flavor in my tea was delicious. I loved that they have a yelp coupon also!

excerpts: I ordered the oolong milk tea and it wasn't too sweet (which was good), but it felt just a little watered down.
If I am ever in Chinatown and really have to have boba, I may come back and get it without the glass bottle (if that's an option).
It is a good place to hang out because there is seating upstairs.
There are seats downstairs, but those tend to be taken over by people who are waiting for their orders.
Otherwise, I will just go to my usual boba spots.
If you are in the union square/westfield mall area, there is a boba guys on stockton and a sharetea on mission st.
milk tea.author: Breniel L.
milk tea.review: The only reason why I came here was for the glass bottle and that's the only reason why you should come too. The prices are high (like boba guys high) because of the bottle and not because of the ingredients.  The boba was just alright and could have been of a better consistency. I ordered the oolong milk tea and it wasn't too sweet (which was good), but it felt just a little watered down. If I am ever in Chinatown and really have to have boba, I may come back and get it without the glass bottle (if that's an option). It is a good place to hang out because there is seating upstairs. There are seats downstairs, but those tend to be taken over by people who are waiting for their orders. Otherwise, I will just go to my usual boba spots. If you are in the union square/westfield mall area, there is a boba guys on stockton and a sharetea on mission st.

excerpts: The milk tea I got was one of the best ones I had.
Minus one star because they cater to those with the stupid glass bottles.
I didn't want a glass bottle because I didn't want to take it home on the plane
so I ordered it in a normal cup
but it was poorly packaged and dripped all over me.
milk tea.author: Roger R.
milk tea.review:
I was worried that this place was all hype but there's something alluring about a long line of people. I mean, it must mean it's good since people are willing to spend 30-40 minutes waiting. 

Turns out, it was pretty good! :D. The milk tea I got was one of the best ones I had. Minus one star because they cater to those with the stupid glass bottles. I didn't want a glass bottle because I didn't want to take it home on the plane so I ordered it in a normal cup but it was poorly packaged and dripped all over me.

excerpts: I had the honey dew slush and my cousin got the brown sugar milk tea.
We both liked our choices.
milk tea.author: Max M.
milk tea.review:
I think the bottle they serve it in is what brings the tourists in. I had the honey dew slush and my cousin got the brown sugar milk tea. We both liked our choices. The boba was a 8/10. 

Don't forget to use your 15% coupon thru yelp!

excerpts: A heads up - the taro milk tea isn't that sweet since it uses the natural sweetness of taro!
milk tea.author: Janet H.
milk tea.review: I think Plentea is just okay. A bit pricier than your normal boba, but it's because you get to keep the glass bottle (or return it for a partial refund). A heads up - the taro milk tea isn't that sweet since it uses the natural sweetness of taro!

excerpts: I normally order the original black milk tea w/ boba and I avoid the fruit teas because they tend to be overly sweet and taste like juice.
Overall, decent boba shop and would return!
milk tea.author: Christian V.
milk tea.review: Drinks are served in a glass bottle that you get to keep and it's reasonably priced for around $5! I really only come here for the glass bottles otherwise I wouldn't go out of my way to visit. The drinks themselves are decent, but they're nothing special. This place also has a really trendy ambiance and there's an upstairs loft for people to sit and hang out. I normally order the original black milk tea w/ boba and I avoid the fruit teas because they tend to be overly sweet and taste like juice. Overall, decent boba shop and would return!

excerpts:
I ordered the Nutella Milk Tea w/out Boba and I loved it. 
I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option. 

I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option.
milk tea.author: Tony D.
milk tea.review:
Went for the first time and enjoyed the ambiuance of the small yet, well put together Boba shop. I'm not really into Boba, but a friend and I went and we enjoyed it. I ordered the Nutella Milk Tea w/out Boba and I loved it. I wanted to try the Lavender Lemonade, but the cashier recommended the Nutella Milk Tea, which is their top seller, so I went with that option. 

Great place! Plus I like the bottles the drinks come in.

excerpts: Delicious oolong milk tea!
milk tea.author: Emily C.
milk tea.review:
Delicious oolong milk tea! 

Packaging is adorable and service is friendly :) Love it here and will be back

excerpts: I tried the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the peach green fruit milk tea, also with tapioca.
Both were super dank.
Be sure to check out the upstairs seating, it's way chill.
milk tea.author: Andy B.
milk tea.review: It's true. The glass bottles really do make it taste better. Be prepared to wait in line. I tried the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the peach green fruit milk tea, also with tapioca. Both were super dank. Be sure to check out the upstairs seating, it's way chill.

excerpts: I ordered a regular milk tea and very disappointingly...
I received no glass bottle :( no cool pictures to show off...
It says on the door that because of some distribution issues that the place they order their glass bottles from are currently not available.
As a business, I would assume that they can find alternatives.
It is very disappointing that they can simply say "out of stock" and expect to have returning customers.
In addition, they charge you the same as if they did give you the glass bottles...
not cool... either way I've had better
and I probably would not go out of my way again to come visit Plentea again.
milk tea.author: Katie P.
milk tea.review:
To be fair....Plentea is no big deal. What really attracted me to the place, that being it is in CHINATOWN, is only their glass bottles. I ordered a regular milk tea and very disappointingly...I received no glass bottle :( no cool pictures to show off...
It says on the door that because of some distribution issues that the place they order their glass bottles from are currently not available. 
As a business, I would assume that they can find alternatives. It is very disappointing that they can simply say "out of stock" and expect to have returning customers. 
In addition, they charge you the same as if they did give you the glass bottles...not cool... either way I've had better and I probably would not go out of my way again to come visit Plentea again.

excerpts: This is the only milk tea place I've went to that has a bottle for the milk teas and their milk teas and shakes are pretty good.
I love their avocado milk because it's blended with real avocado unlike others which is blended with flavored powder.
I ordered a mango milk before and it taste like power.
Now the avocado milk has more milk taste than the actual fruit taste.
I prefer to taste more of the fruit than the milk.
milk tea.author: Sylvia H.
milk tea.review: This is the only milk tea place I've went to that has a bottle for the milk teas and their milk teas and shakes are pretty good. I love their avocado milk because it's blended with real avocado unlike others which is blended with flavored powder. I ordered a mango milk before and it taste like power. Now the avocado milk has more milk taste than the actual fruit taste. I prefer to taste more of the fruit than the milk.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and that was really good.
You could still taste the matcha and it wasn't overly creamy or sweet either.
I don't know if it's the days that i went that the boba was hard?
Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc).
I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening.
There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.
milk tea.author: Amy V.
milk tea.review:
Been meaning to try Plentea for awhile now, but I tend to forget that it's there. So i finally decided to give it a try on Thursday with my boyfriend and I've been back 3 days straight now! I really like the bottle but at the same time I don't because it jack the price of the drink up so much.

I've had the Thai Tea with boba and it was good, but not my favorite. My boyfriend got the Matcha Milk Tea with boba and that was really good. You could still taste the matcha and it wasn't overly creamy or sweet either. I don't know if it's the days that i went that the boba was hard? So the next time that I went, i got the the Caramel Ice Milk with grass jelly. It kinda reminded me of Half&Half ice milk drink. It wasn't crazy sweet like the ice milk in Tea Society nor was it bland. It was sweet enough for me to finish the whole bottle and not feel sick after. 

Definitely will be back and this time i want to try the Nutella Milk Tea and their flavor milk (strawberry, mango, etc). I havent had any problem with waiting long, maybe it's cause I go in the evening. There's basically no parking unless you go after 6PM or park in those expensive parking garages.

excerpts: Eventually, I settled on getting the Oolong Milk Tea with Boba and it was a satisfying decision.
milk tea.author: Regina L.
milk tea.review:
The attractive architectural design of the place was enough to grab my attention. Plentea is one of the up and coming hipster boba places that serves their drinks in glass bottles, which you get to take home with you! 

I came with a group of friends on a Saturday night around 10 pm and then place was packed! The line went out the door but that was good because I always take awhile to choose my drink of choice. Eventually, I settled on getting the Oolong Milk Tea with Boba and it was a satisfying decision. The portion was big, considering the size of the bottle and the price of the drink, and the oolong tea was flavorful, which was what was most important to me. 

Two other drinks that stood out to me were the Fresh Fruit Mango Tea drink and the Matcha Milk Green Tea with tapioca and grass jelly. 

I am in love with this hipster spot and am excited to come back and try more! I also really love their atmosphere. It was a welcoming environment that encouraged me and my friends to stand and talk there until closing time. Another plus is their free wifi!

excerpts: I got the green match milk tea with egg pudding 75% sweet
I really liked it!
milk tea.author: Rachel C.
milk tea.review:
I came here last weekend with some friends that visited from LA and coincidentally it was my first time here too! But I've been wanting to come here for the longest time. Yes, ever since I saw the cute glass bottles. THEY GOT ME. 

Cash only with transactions under $10, you'll easily be over that buying 2 drinks. 

I got the green match milk tea with egg pudding 75% sweet
I really liked it! I think it was smart to get it with less sugar because egg pudding is usually pretty sweet. 

My friend got blueberry smoothie with pearls. Also pretty good but he loves blueberries.

You can also get a lid which seals on pretty tight which is good for on the go. 

I'll be back for sure and bringing my glass bottle back too! :)  recycling ftw.

excerpts: I ordered the lemon green tea and my friend ordered the Jasmine green milk tea with boba.
I love the lemon green tea.
It was pretty good.
The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good.
It had the same taste was Quickly's tea.
I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas.
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.
The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good.
It had the same taste was Quickly's tea.
I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas.
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.
milk tea.author: Kelly O.
milk tea.review:
I was in the area and decided to give this place a try since they give glass bottles instead of the regular plastic ones, which is very environmentally friendly. I ordered the lemon green tea and my friend ordered the Jasmine green milk tea with boba. I love the lemon green tea. It was pretty good. The Jasmine green milk tea however, was not very good. It had the same taste was Quickly's tea. I would recommend sticking with the flavored teas. 
Overall, I appreciate this place for being environmentally friendly and the location is not the most convenient place if you are driving.

excerpts: Thai milk tea with honey tapioca is amazing.
Love the atmosphere with the little seating area upstairs.
My boyfriend had the strawberry banana waffle and said it was amazing.
It had slivered almonds and a chocolate drizzle on it.
The only downfall, it's pricy, like the Starbucks of bubble tea.
You get to keep the jug though!
milk tea.author: Jennifer R.
milk tea.review: Love the cute little milk hugs they come in. Thai milk tea with honey tapioca is amazing. Love the atmosphere with the little seating area upstairs. My boyfriend had the strawberry banana waffle and said it was amazing. It had slivered almonds and a chocolate drizzle on it. The only downfall, it's pricy, like the Starbucks of bubble tea. You get to keep the jug though!

excerpts: I came here today with a bunch of friends excited to further explore the what else the world of milk tea had to offer.
The place was fairly small, but because it had an upstairs getting a table wasn't really an issue.
Overall the milk tea is just okay; very comparable to other milk tea places except I feel like this place uses a lot more tea, which some people may not like.
The best part about this place is you get to keep the bottle!
The next time you come in, be sure to bring your bottle for 10% off your purchase :)
milk tea.author: Thuy T.
milk tea.review:
I came here today with a bunch of friends excited to further explore the what else the world of milk tea had to offer. The place was fairly small, but because it had an upstairs getting a table wasn't really an issue. Ordering was really fast; their menu isn't super extensive. 

Overall the milk tea is just okay; very comparable to other milk tea places except I feel like this place uses a lot more tea, which some people may not like. The best part about this place is you get to keep the bottle! The next time you come in, be sure to bring your bottle for 10% off your purchase :)

excerpts: But when I arrived it turns out about half the milk tea selections are already mixed in with milk and cant be replaced with almond or soy.
This would be my go to spot if it weren't for that.
Plus one star for the glass bottles though!
milk tea.author: Monica M.
milk tea.review: I was super excited to see a bubble tea place that had non-dairy milk options. But when I arrived it turns out about half the milk tea selections are already mixed in with milk and cant be replaced with almond or soy. This would be my go to spot if it weren't for that. Plus one star for the glass bottles though!

excerpts: I had started off with the regular black milk tea with boba, and the tea actually had a chocolate taste, which I didn't like very much.
They have a sign up in the store saying that they'll fix something about the tea for you if you don't like it, so I went up to them and they actually switched it to oolong for me!
The oolong milk tea was fantastic.
Good tea and great staff.
milk tea.author: J. Z.
milk tea.review: I had started off with the regular black milk tea with boba, and the tea actually had a chocolate taste, which I didn't like very much. They have a sign up in the store saying that they'll fix something about the tea for you if you don't like it, so I went up to them and they actually switched it to oolong for me! The oolong milk tea was fantastic. Good tea and great staff.

excerpts: This is probably one of my favorite milk tea/boba places to go to in the city.
The aesthetic of the store is amazing.
Setup makes you feel like you have walked into a modern museum.
There are plants everywhere, bamboo walls, making it feel more homely than ever.
Nonetheless, the glass bottle that the drink comes with is reusable and reliable for any other occasion after you are done enjoying your drink.
It is too notch and if I could come here everyday, I would.
milk tea.author: Jack L.
milk tea.review: This is probably one of my favorite milk tea/boba places to go to in the city. The aesthetic of the store is amazing. Setup makes you feel like you have walked into a modern museum. There are plants everywhere, bamboo walls, making it feel more homely than ever. Nonetheless, the glass bottle that the drink comes with is reusable and reliable for any other occasion after you are done enjoying your drink. It is too notch and if I could come here everyday, I would.

excerpts: I got the fresh fruit (strawberry) milk tea.
There is an option to choose what kind of tea you want: green, black and oolong.
The boba tasted like it was made fresh and had the right amount of chewiness.
All cold drinks come in these cute hipster jars that you can bring next time you visit for $0.25 off your drink.
Note that hot drinks come in regular paper cups.. that's why despite the freezing cold weather, I opted for a cold drink
milk tea.author: Jeri A.
milk tea.review: I'm really glad that we stumbled upon this lovely place while walking around SF. I got the fresh fruit (strawberry) milk tea. There is an option to choose what kind of tea you want: green, black and oolong. The boba tasted like it was made fresh and had the right amount of chewiness. All cold drinks come in these cute hipster jars that you can bring next time you visit for $0.25 off your drink. Note that hot drinks come in regular paper cups.. that's why despite the freezing cold weather, I opted for a cold drink :)

excerpts: Simple boba place, good quality milk tea (especially the oolong).
Only qualm is the price which is higher than what I am used to, coming from SoCal.
The service is really quick though, which can be good or bad.
We ordered a sea salt crema oolong tea w boba and an ice green milk tea w boba ($11.22 total) and the order was made within 1 minute with no one in front of us.
milk tea.author: Alison C.
milk tea.review:
Simple boba place, good quality milk tea (especially the oolong). Only qualm is the price which is higher than what I am used to, coming from SoCal. The service is really quick though, which can be good or bad. We ordered a sea salt crema oolong tea w boba and an ice green milk tea w boba ($11.22 total) and the order was made within 1 minute with no one in front of us. 

There's a good amount of seating with an upstairs balcony available! 

One big plus is that I ordered "less ice" and they actually gave me a noticeably less amount of ice! 

Also, card minimum of $10, which is basically two drinks.

excerpts: My fave is the original milk tea ..black..

w tapioca
OR new fave sea
Salt oolong crema w tapioca!
milk tea.author: Gina I. B.
milk tea.review:
Love this spot..I live super far in ssf but ide drive out just to get Boba here!
My fave is the original milk tea ..black..w tapioca
OR new fave sea Salt oolong crema w tapioca!

excerpts: This place is alright, and it's probably the most convenient pearl milk tea place in the Financial District area.
There's no bathroom for customers, which means you might end up running back to your office to relieve yourself, especially since pearl milk tea is kind of a diuretic.
- The prices are pretty high, even for SF.
I blame the glass bottles.
- There's not a lot of options for people who like hot drinks and people who don't like sugar in their drinks.
Unfortunately, I fall into both categories.

I've been twice and will probably be back, because it's the only pearl milk tea place that comes to mind in downtown, but it's definitely not worth trekking across town for.

==
Just popping in to say that I was mistaken and there is totally another pearl milk tea place in downtown.
Boba Guys is literally two blocks over.
milk tea.author: Brittany C.
milk tea.review:
This place is alright, and it's probably the most convenient pearl milk tea place in the Financial District area.

Some good things: 
- The glass jars are cute. Sure, they're probably the reason why the prices are so ridiculous, but at least they're sort of unique. Some of my friends collect the jars, others can't wait to get rid of them, so I guess it's a mixed bag. Some kind of sink where you can wash the jar before you leave would be nice. (There's no bathroom, more on that later.)
- An impressive amount of seating considering how small the space is.
- Located really close to downtown and open late so you can go during lunch, as an afternoon break, or after work.

Some not-so-great things:
- There's no bathroom for customers, which means you might end up running back to your office to relieve yourself, especially since pearl milk tea is kind of a diuretic.
- The prices are pretty high, even for SF. I blame the glass bottles.
- There's not a lot of options for people who like hot drinks and people who don't like sugar in their drinks. Unfortunately, I fall into both categories.
- The tea quality isn't particularly impressive.

I've been twice and will probably be back, because it's the only pearl milk tea place that comes to mind in downtown, but it's definitely not worth trekking across town for.

== EDIT ==

Just popping in to say that I was mistaken and there is totally another pearl milk tea place in downtown. Boba Guys is literally two blocks over.

excerpts: We are lucky to live in a part of the country where there are plenTEA of milk tea places
(Haha, get it?!).
Ok seriously - the flip side of that is that many of those places are just OK.
This is where Plentea stands out.
As someone who spent a couple years in the LA/OC area, there just seems to be more good places down south (sorry norcal!).
Cue Plentea - a solid spot with a great lineup of handcrafted drinks.
I came here a few times, and my favorite is the iced milk drink with boba + pudding.
I always choose caramel whenever they ask, and it is awesome.
Very few places do the milk drink right up here.
Oh and did I mention you get to keep the mason drink jar with your purchase?
SCORE!
milk tea.author: Darren L.
milk tea.review: We are lucky to live in a part of the country where there are plenTEA of milk tea places (Haha, get it?!). Ok seriously - the flip side of that is that many of those places are just OK. This is where Plentea stands out. As someone who spent a couple years in the LA/OC area, there just seems to be more good places down south (sorry norcal!). Cue Plentea - a solid spot with a great lineup of handcrafted drinks. I came here a few times, and my favorite is the iced milk drink with boba + pudding. I always choose caramel whenever they ask, and it is awesome. Very few places do the milk drink right up here. Oh and did I mention you get to keep the mason drink jar with your purchase? SCORE!

excerpts: This is likely the only and last time I let a transplant hipster tell me where to find a great boba milk tea in the city.
The red flag should have gone off when he boasted of how his best boba tea experience was in Austin, TX, not Taipei, not Hong Kong, nope, not even LA...
milk tea.author: Taffany H.
milk tea.review:
This is likely the only and last time I let a transplant hipster tell me where to find a great boba milk tea in the city. The red flag should have gone off when he boasted of how his best boba tea experience was in Austin, TX, not Taipei, not Hong Kong, nope, not even LA...I should have known. 

Anyway, letting this guy talk me into trying Plentea is a rookie mistake I should not be committing. Plentea makes you buy these ridiculously impractical and heavy glass jars to house their mediocre boba tea. You can't even just turn them in for a refund, only discount for your next purchase. I'm sure there's a way for one to purchase the tea without the glass jar but this option sure isn't readily offered by the dude at the register.  

I mean, if I want a cool milk jar, I'd buy myself a jar of milk, not tea. I'd go to the grocery store and grab me my usual jar of Straus Creamery milk or half&half. Paying $5 to carry around a heavy jar of mediocre boba tea really makes me question whether to kick my own ass or to just recycle the glass jar and call it a day.

I would have tried to do both but I'm not as flexible as I'd like to be so in the meantime, I'm tossing the jar into the recycle bin and will work on my flexibility so I can kick my own ass the next time I let another hipster talk me into drinking boba tea from an establishment where impractical vessel for tea is more important than crafting the taste of the tea itself.

excerpts: Creamy and fruity, it makes for a sweet treat that's different from anything I've gotten from any other milk tea place.
milk tea.author: Sabrina C.
milk tea.review:
I actually am a big fan of Plentea! Aside from the fun glass jars, I think their drinks are very unique and tasty. The past couple times I've been here, I've gotten the Mango Fresh Fruit Milk with Pearls and it's delicious! Creamy and fruity, it makes for a sweet treat that's different from anything I've gotten from any other milk tea place. I can't really speak to any of the other drinks, but all of them sound interesting!

The decor in Plentea also adds to the experience here. Plants are lined up against the side of the counter and in a corner high up on the wall, and the wood furniture and chalkboard menus make it feel cozy and home-y. Staff is also very friendly!

The drinks here are pretty pricey, but that also includes the glass jar that you get to keep, which you can bring back for 10% off your drink. But what I wish they did was give that same discount for anyone who doesn't want a keepsake jar and would rather just have their drink in a standard plastic cup. I'd rather have that option than to keep collecting jars, just because visits can be spontaneous, as I don't always plan out my SF outings to include a trip to Plentea. Just a thought, but I do love the reusable jar concept!

excerpts: my beloved milk tea + boba.
no sugar, almond milk,
everything's organic!
the real fruit smoothie are wonderful too!
keep the glass bottle (make sure it's clean) and get 10% off (for cold drink)
next order!
w/ sitting area & a snack menu.
milk tea.author: Freya-Loki O.
milk tea.review: my beloved milk tea + boba. no sugar, almond milk, everything's organic! the real fruit smoothie are wonderful too! keep the glass bottle (make sure it's clean) and get 10% off (for cold drink) next order! w/ sitting area & a snack menu.

excerpts: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!
milk tea.author: Doug V.
milk tea.review: My faves are the classic black milk tea with boba, matcha latte and the Nutella milk tea ... worth the schlep to Chinatown!

excerpts: I ordered a green milk tea with tapioca.
milk tea.author: Irina R.
milk tea.review:
What is up with the crazy line for Plentea? 

During a late lunch, I saw my opportunity to try Plentea (no line!) 

I ordered a green milk tea with tapioca. 

Opinion: Yummy, sweet, good stuff. 

Con: Is a tapioca tea really worth around $5?

excerpts: Don't get me wrong I really love the green milk tea here, however I realized the discount for bringing your bottle back is not really worth it.
I wanted a taro milk tea and a brown sugar milk tea, all they offer is just the milk...
Obviously a lot is pre-made since there are many jugs of milk tea already sitting out but can they add a little more options with their teas please?
milk tea.author: Zsa Zsa G.
milk tea.review:
Don't get me wrong I really love the green milk tea here, however I realized the discount for bringing your bottle back is not really worth it. 10% isn't really that much off the order, might as well just keep getting more bottles and pay regular price.

When I first came here I thought, "Oh yeah the price is reasonable for boba since we are pretty much paying for the bottle..." Why is it still so costly when we bring the bottle back? They're just refilling it... Probably because it is in the financial district, and in San Francisco so OF COURSE it's a little more pricier. They need to make it like a 25% discount or something or even 30%! 10% is nothing.

I also don't like the fact that I can't customize the taro and brown sugar. I wanted a taro milk tea and a brown sugar milk tea, all they offer is just the milk... Obviously a lot is pre-made since there are many jugs of milk tea already sitting out but can they add a little more options with their teas please? 

I usually recommend this place for the glass bottles so its a one time thing kind of place.

excerpts: The creme milk tea is good.
The boba was a bit too dense for my liking.
Maybe it just wasn't fresh?
Still the tea was good and I would return to try other flavors.
milk tea.author: Lauren N.
milk tea.review: I love the glass bottles. Bring your bottle back for 10% off. The creme milk tea is good. The boba was a bit too dense for my liking. Maybe it just wasn't fresh? Still the tea was good and I would return to try other flavors.

excerpts: Matcha milk tea with egg jelly = da bomb!!
Sometime I just need to go after having some milk tea.
milk tea.author: Joon Y.
milk tea.review:
Matcha milk tea with egg jelly = da bomb!! I'm a fan so far. 

-1 star cause they don't have a bathroom. Sometime I just need to go after having some milk tea. :(

excerpts: I had the nutella milk tea which kinda tasted like chocolate milk.
Not something I would get again to be honest.
the second time I went
I got the strawberry fruit tea
and that was yummy.
I shared the waffle with my friend and it was ok.
I just enjoy the concept of using reusable glass bottles and they have a good amount of flavors to choose from.
Their real fruit slush was good too from trying from my friend.
milk tea.author: Heather S.
milk tea.review: How amazing is this place to provide reusable glass bottles and when you bring it back you get 10% off!! Their flavors were great. I had the nutella milk tea which kinda tasted like chocolate milk. Not something I would get again to be honest. the second time I went I got the strawberry fruit tea and that was yummy. I shared the waffle with my friend and it was ok. I just enjoy the concept of using reusable glass bottles and they have a good amount of flavors to choose from. Their real fruit slush was good too from trying from my friend.

excerpts: Approaching the counter, we ordered the Thai tea with egg pudding, Green Milk tea with Boba and Oolong milk tea.
The green milk tea was a delivery for another friend and she said it was good.
My friend that ordered the Oolong was very happy with his choice.
He claimed it was, "the best milk tea evarrrrr" to which he continues with its better than a lot of places he has been too.
As much as this place makes it to one of my top spots in milk tea spots, I really hope it wasn't just a fluke when I went in that evening
milk tea.author: Harry P.
milk tea.review:
Yelp, it's been a while. Quite a while since I wrote a review, but I can't just churn out reviews like a mindless machine, I like to craft my reviews and make sure it's an enjoyable read.

Wait what? I'm getting ahead of myself.

I saw my friend post pictures on Instagram about Plentea with the milk like jug bottles and I was like, "oh myy I have to stop by." Little did I know I stopped by the same night after dinner in Japan Town.

It is on Kearny, a little bit past the financial district and next to Chinatown. Google maps actually got the directions wrong (wanted me to go on the behind street) and I eerily missed it because where Plentea is located, there are no streetlights there and it looks dark as hell. Add to the fact Plentea didn't really looked opened so two clueless idiots drove right by then looked back and said "ooooh I think that's the place"

We ended up parking around the corner and walked there and I was surprised there was no line on a Saturday night. I mean there was clueless idiots standing around debating what to order but it didn't go out the door. Approaching the counter, we ordered the Thai tea with egg pudding, Green Milk tea with Boba and Oolong milk tea. 

After reading some of the reviews I was concerned I couldn't get the glass bottle especially since it was at night also, and when they called our number, I took a glance and I was so overjoyed. They had the glass bottles available even after a full day of orders on a Saturday. You'd expect them to be out. 

Hmm maybe that's why they looked closed so they don't have sell to more customers. Just kidding. We took the bottle caps for our three drinks and some straws and headed back to the car. The green milk tea was a delivery for another friend and she said it was good. My friend that ordered the Oolong was very happy with his choice. He claimed it was, "the best milk tea evarrrrr" to which he continues with its better than a lot of places he has been too. 

Curious I tried mine, as I went for the Thai Tea with egg pudding. First thought was it wasn't overly too sweet and that is a quality I like. You can taste/smell the Thai tea aroma, and it was silky smooth tasting oh so fresh. The egg pudding? Quite wonderful.

As much as this place makes it to one of my top spots in milk tea spots, I really hope it wasn't just a fluke when I went in that evening and it tasted good. 

It looks like they take all major credit cards but have an outrageous 15 dollar minimum. If you have the glass bottle save it after you're done! You get a 10% discount if you bring back your bottle.

I must try the other flavor drinks and the food. They all sound so delicious.

Cheers!

excerpts: I've had the Nutella milk tea all the way to the taro one, and they're all really good
so this is a definite place to try!
:D
milk tea.author: Jordan C.
milk tea.review:
Probably one of the top 10 boba spots in the bay that I like is this place! Their souvenir signature glass cups that they give with the drinks were a cool idea.

Setting wise the place barley has no parking outside so your gonna have to probably walk from somewhere nearby so expect to walk! The place is two floors, but still kinda small so the line goes outside. There are only like 8 tables on the bottom floor (2 seaters) so when your drinking your drinks or eating food your gonna be looking at the people next to you that are in line.

Food and drinks! Food wise the food was okay I ordered the salmon rice plate before and it wasnt hella bad, but I did recognize the costco fish on it loool! But the food didn't taste processed ya know? Other foods like the sashimi salad was okay the sashimi was decent not frozen tasting or something and salad was fresh. Drink wise I've had the Nutella milk tea all the way to the taro one, and they're all really good so this is a definite place to try! :D

excerpts: Its a super eco friendly milk tea spot that I would definitely come back to.
Their brown sugar, and hazelnut milk teas are the best.
milk tea.author: Marissa M.
milk tea.review: This place is really neat. The atmosphere is super laid back and they have a lot of plants which was a nice touch. I love how you can take the bottles home and reuse them. Its a super eco friendly milk tea spot that I would definitely come back to. Their brown sugar, and hazelnut milk teas are the best.

excerpts: I got the oolong ice milk tea.
It comes in a glass bottle with the logo on it - very cool "green" way to serve up a beverage.
Unfortunately the tapioca was a little overdone, making the very outside of the boba too soft and the inside overly chewy.
The tea itself was ok but was exceptionally sweet.
Since the sign near the register said to tell them about any drink that isn't perfect, thankfully my friend took the bottle out of my hand and told them it was too sweet
(I was thankful that she was so bold).
milk tea.author: Thomas C.
milk tea.review:
Summary:  Trendy tapioca tea place in SF that is more about quantity than quality

Tea:  I got the oolong ice milk tea.  It comes in a glass bottle with the logo on it - very cool "green" way to serve up a beverage.  Unfortunately the tapioca was a little overdone, making the very outside of the boba too soft and the inside overly chewy.  The tea itself was ok but was exceptionally sweet.  Since the sign near the register said to tell them about any drink that isn't perfect, thankfully my friend took the bottle out of my hand and told them it was too sweet (I was thankful that she was so bold).  It came back with more tea in it and much better.

Shop: Cool shop with places to sit.  Clean and trendy, steps above the old boba tea shops from a decade ago.  Nothing incredibly special about it though.

Overall:  With just 3 visits to Plentea and Boba Guys, I have to say Boba Guys has this place beat.  The boba wasn't cooked well and the tea itself was just ok.  Go Boba Guys for quality.  Go Plentea for quantity and to support their green efforts.

excerpts: At any milk tea places, my signature drink to get is always taro milk tea, but due do my latest addiction to matcha, I had a decision to make.
The taro milk tea was phenomenal !!
It was a thicker drink
but I can taste the taro pieces!
It was so good that I've decided I have to go back and get one myself!
milk tea.author: Josie H.
milk tea.review:
After working in the city for over a year, I finally was able to try this place. 

At any milk tea places, my signature drink to get is always taro milk tea, but due do my latest addiction to matcha, I had a decision to make. 

Since my friend was getting the taro, I got the matcha.

First of all, the glass bottle! I love the concept and if you bring it back, they give you 10% off or if you opt out you get 20%. Otherwise it's about 5 dollars drink isn't bad! Considering they give you a jar with their name on it!

The matcha was sweet, be sure to mix it! Decent.

The taro milk tea was phenomenal !! It was a thicker drink but I can taste the taro pieces! It was so good that I've decided I have to go back and get one myself!

excerpts: I've had the almond milk tea other places and this one was just ok.
Prices are little more expensive for the glass bottle but its a cute little bottle.
Now, I just need to figure out what to do with it.
Great option for the Fi-Di but a little far for me.
milk tea.author: Alicia A.
milk tea.review: It was alright, not the best. I've had the almond milk tea other places and this one was just ok. Prices are little more expensive for the glass bottle but its a cute little bottle. Now, I just need to figure out what to do with it. Great option for the Fi-Di but a little far for me.

excerpts: I ordered the green milk tea with honey jelly.
There is nothing too special about the milk tea, so next time I'll give an update on the fruit drinks!
My drink was $4.50 which is pretty pricy for milk tea
milk tea.author: Sabrina L.
milk tea.review:
DRINKS IN CUTE JARS! 

Great way to attract people, right? It's totally INSTAGRAMABLE worthy! :) I love the look of the jar and the toppings that float around inside! I would even save the jars! 

I ordered the green milk tea with honey jelly. There is nothing too special about the milk tea, so next time I'll give an update on the fruit drinks! My drink was $4.50 which is pretty pricy for milk tea but I'm sure I paid for the jar more than the tea. 

They don't accept credit card transactions less than $15 so bring money! However, the worker was nice enough to let me use card even though I ordered one drink... He knew I was a first timer! The place is pretty clean and looks new... A cool spot to hangout with a friend during lunch. 
Although if says Chinatown, it's in the financial district so goodluck finding parking or not getting into thick traffic around 5 during the weekday. 
I would recommend coming here for the experience of getting a cool ass glass jar and that IG pic that I'm sure will get over 100 likes ;) let me know your IG so I can like it! Haha

excerpts: For $5.54, I got an oolong milk tea with boba.
I asked if I could get one without the jar.
Nope.
They were really fast getting my drink out.
A lot of chewy boba and a lot of tea.
Just right with the sweetness.
I don't get the point of the jars even though they are really cute.
From what I hear from other reviews - the caps don't hold well
so you can't use the bottles unless you are at home.
It is a bit pricey.
milk tea.author: Sarah C.
milk tea.review:
Finally got to try this place out. For $5.54, I got an oolong milk tea with boba. I asked if I could get one without the jar. Nope. They were really fast getting my drink out. A lot of chewy boba and a lot of tea. Just right with the sweetness. I don't get the point of the jars even though they are really cute. From what I hear from other reviews - the caps don't hold well so you can't use the bottles unless you are at home. It is a bit pricey. =/ 

No bathrooms but the space is open and there is an upstairs seating area.

excerpts: The boba has almost always been good, and the milk tea is good.
I'm not a huge fan of the fruit ones, but they're an interesting break away from regular milk tea.
Overall, a solid milk tea boba stop.
milk tea.author: Mitty C.
milk tea.review:
I've had overwhelmingly good experiences here at Plentea. The boba has almost always been good, and the milk tea is good. I'm not a huge fan of the fruit ones, but they're an interesting break away from regular milk tea. 

What's unique about Plentea is that they have their own mason jar glasses that they serve their drinks in -- and you get to keep!! There are plastic lids on the counter if you want to take your drink to go. 

This place is a little small, so the seating is limited. There's an upstairs area that is pretty sweet to sit at. 

Overall, a solid milk tea boba stop.

excerpts: Our cashier said they're known for their milk tea
so we got that as well
and I liked my seacream oolong tea better
milk tea.author: Sophia V.
milk tea.review:
This was on my to-do list while visiting SF and honestly I wasn't that impressed.

We came about 2-3 hours before closing and they ran out of tapioca! What kind of boba place runs out of tapioca way before closing time? They can't measure when they're close to running out and making a new batch sooner? I came to try the sea cream oolong tea and it was alright. For the price and small portion you get, not worth it in my opinion. Our cashier said they're known for their milk tea so we got that as well and I liked my seacream oolong tea better and that wasn't even that good.

Two stars because our cashier was friendly and we got our tea fix. But not our 'boba tea' fix.

excerpts: I got the Real Taro Milk tea with boba.
It was so much more expensive than a regular milk tea, but that's mostly due to the jar.
The drink, without boba, is $5 already!
The drink itself was decent, not the BEST I've ever had, but not the worst either.
We also got the mango slush.
milk tea.author: Jenny C.
milk tea.review:
To be completely honest, the only reason why I wanted to try this place was because I know you get to keep the jars they serve their drinks in. I think that's how they attract customers, which is a bit unsettling knowing that people come here more often to get the jar than the drinks.

So many of my friends were posting pictures and talking about this place, my boyfriend and I finally decided to try it out. The drinks were definitely not up to par as I was expecting.
I got the Real Taro Milk tea with boba. It was so much more expensive than a regular milk tea, but that's mostly due to the jar. The drink, without boba, is $5 already! The drink itself was decent, not the BEST I've ever had, but not the worst either.
