We also got the mango slush. It was also average, but I personally like their milk teas more.

Now that I have the jar, I don't know if I'll come back. Maybe if I'm in the area, yeah. But I wouldn't go out of my way to get it.

excerpts: Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50)

Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95)

Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95)

Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50)

Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca
One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet.
The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers.
The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus.
milk tea.author: Kitty K.
milk tea.review:
This shop isn't located in Chinatown like I had thought since on Yelp's address it did say it was in Chinatown. It's way closer to the FiDi but still within walking distance of Chinatown (~8-10min). There's only street parking and parking's hit and miss (depends on when you go). There are a few stools and tables down stairs, but they have a cute little loft upstairs as well with a couple cushioned seats and more tables. No public bathroom.

I have been wanting to come here for ages because I love the jars that they serve the drinks in! I came here with a group of friends right after dinner in North Beach, so we walked over around 9PM on a Sat. I was surprised it wasn't packed or that there wasn't a line. I definitely wasn't going to complain!

Drink Menu:
Ice Milk Tea: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong / Thai
Ice Milk w/ Pudding or Tapioca: ($4.95) Brown Sugar or Caramel
Premium Mount Tea: ($4.25) Black / Green / Oolong
Honey Lemon: ($4.50) Black / Green / Oolong
Fresh Fruit Smoothies: ($6.50) Strawberry / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Milk Smoothies: ($4.95) Strawberry / Papaya / Blueberry / Mango / Avocado
Fresh Fruit Tea: ($4.95) Tea (Black / Green / Oolong) with fruit (Strawberry / Orange / Mango / Peach / Honeydew)
Crema Milk Tea: ($4.95) Crema Oolong Tea / Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea
Special Drinks: ($4.95) Lavender Lemonade / Ice Taro Milk Tea / Green Tea Mocha Slush
Add-ons: (+$0.50) Honey Tapioca, Egg Pudding, Taro Pudding, Coffee Pudding, Aloe, Grass Jelly)

Waffle Sandwiches Menu: ($8.95) Add 2 Slices of Applewood Smoked Bacon +$1
Morning Waffle: Only served before 10AM. Bacon, Egg, Spring Mix, Swiss Cheese
Turkey Club: Roasted Turkey, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Tomato, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Hot Pastrami: Pastrami, Swiss cheese, Avocado, Spring Mix, Pesto Aioli
Smoked Salmon: Blue Cold Smoked Salmon, Herb Cream Cheese, Cucumber & Chives

Salad Menu: ($8.95) served with Spring Mix, Avocado, Tomato, Pecan
Meat: Turkey / Pastrami / Smoked Salmon
Dressing: Ginger / Mustard Soy Sauce / Yuzu Citrus

*All vegetables are organic

Dessert Menu:
Strawberry Belgian Waffle: Whip Cream, Fresh Strawberries, Jam, Almond Slices & Chocolate Syrup
Banana Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream, Banana, Nutella, Almond Slices, & Chocolate Syrup
Marshmallow Belgian Waffle: ($6.75) Whip Cream Topped w/ Toasted Marshmallow & Chocolate Syrup
New York-style Cheesecake
Tiramisu
Add Vanilla or Green Tea Ice Cream: +$1

Our Order:
Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding 
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Pudding
Brown Sugar Ice Milk w/ Tapioca

I was debating between the two cremas and asked the cashier's opinion and she told me the most popular was the Sea Salt Creama Oolong. So I had the Sea Salt Crema Oolong w/ Egg pudding and I LOVED my drink. The crema was really smooth and creamy and didn't have too much salt. The egg pudding had a good consistency as well. One of my friends also liked my drink more than hers. The bad thing is that they are not consistent in their drinks. One of the Brown Sugar Ice Milk was more watery while the other was more sweet. The person that had the more watered down drink didn't care for his while the girl who had the more sweet drink enjoyed hers. The tapioca pearls were soft and not overly chewy so that's a plus. Fairly pricey but so yummy!

Note: If you don't want your drink in the glass bottles, you get a 10% discount off the drink prices and get your drinks in a plastic cup instead. You also get the same discount if you bring the bottle back

excerpts: hey, now you are part of the trend drinking your milk tea in a glass bottle.
Welcome to SF!
milk tea.author: Cindy W.
milk tea.review:
Very smart marketing with the glass bottles to create hype in the FiDi. Before, unless you can get there before lunch time, you won't be able to get your hands on the milk bottle and it drove me crazy. I wanted my tea and boba in a milk bottle! But now, the milk bottle is available all day errday. Finally got one today and I was satisfied. 

Aside from the milk bottle craze, the quality of their drinks is good. The 2 times I've been here, I got the black honey lemon tea with aloe and tapioca. It's not sweet, the perfect hint of lemon without it being too sour, the aloe jelly gave it the perfect balance of sweetness, and the tapioca was fresh and chewy. I like it.

Today, Kash was having a special promotion in front of Plentea. Free drink on them if you download their app. Who am I to turn down a free drink?  Otherwise, this drink would've cost me $5.00 ($4.50 for the tea, $.50 for each additional toppings. Thanks Kash!) A bit pricey imo, but hey, now you are part of the trend drinking your milk tea in a glass bottle. Welcome to SF!

excerpts: We ordered the milk tea and Nutella milk tea both with boba.
I really enjoyed the milk tea because it wasn't too milky
and I was able to taste the tea.
My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea.
I didn't get to try it
but I assume it's chocolatey.
We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like.
It was super adorable upstairs.
They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters.
Overall, I would come back here to try other things.
My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea.
I didn't get to try it
but I assume it's chocolatey.
We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like.
It was super adorable upstairs.
They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters.
Overall, I would come back here to try other things.
milk tea.author: Shannon C.
milk tea.review: Came here a few minutes after they opened and lemme just say, the guy that was ringing up our order was really nice. I didn't catch his name but he was super friendly. He also pointed out that he was wearing the same sweater as my boyfriend lol. Anyways, since we came when it opened, we were able to get the glass bottles. The drink prices range from 3.50 to 5.95 I believe. We ordered the milk tea and Nutella milk tea both with boba. I really enjoyed the milk tea because it wasn't too milky and I was able to taste the tea. My boyfriend said he liked his Nutella milk tea. I didn't get to try it but I assume it's chocolatey. We walked upstairs because I wanted to see what it was like. It was super adorable upstairs. They have a few plants and plentea spelled out with wooden letters. Overall, I would come back here to try other things.

excerpts:
The selection (they had NUTELLA milk tea!!!)
2)
milk tea.author: Kris P.
milk tea.review:
Two things I was a big fan of at Plentea:

1) The selection (they had NUTELLA milk tea!!!)
2) The use of reusable glass bottles (ranks high in 'grammability)

Obviously I had to get the Nutella MT as it was such a unique menu item. The Nutella flavour was strong and the drink itself was very good. Boba was prepared well. 

The glass bottle is narrow but very tall and comes with quite a lot of tea. Great value for the price.

There are usually lineups at Plentea, but the service is quick and you'll receive your drink in a reasonable time.

Definitely worth a visit!

excerpts: I tried to order an almond milk tea
but they said there was probably gluten in it.
Maybe they have gluten elves that come at night and sprinkle it in there.
Ah well
milk tea.author: Xue H.
milk tea.review:
They don't know what's in their tea. That's pretty disturbing.
I tried to order an almond milk tea but they said there was probably gluten in it. Maybe they have gluten elves that come at night and sprinkle it in there. Ah well

excerpts: But compared to the similar milk tea shop at financial district, I consider this as the best quality and cleanness.
Price is high.
A single drink on average is usually over 5 bucks.
(Black tea is 5, add pearl or pudding is additional amount, some other smoothies are $7)
If u prefer cheaper milk tea, u can walk additional 4-5 blocks to get it from chinatown, but these places are dirty.
milk tea.author: Nina H.
milk tea.review:
This place deserves a 3.5 star rating. Drink tastes just so so. But compared to the similar milk tea shop at financial district, I consider this as the best quality and cleanness. 
Price is high. A single drink on average is usually over 5 bucks. (Black tea is 5, add pearl or pudding is additional amount, some other smoothies are $7)
If u prefer cheaper milk tea, u can walk additional 4-5 blocks to get it from chinatown, but these places are dirty.

excerpts: Love the almond milk tea and lychee jelly here.
I want to say best I've had, just the right amount of sweet for me.
Nutella milk tea is a must try as well.
milk tea.author: Vivian T.
milk tea.review:
Love the almond milk tea and lychee jelly here. I want to say best I've had, just the right amount of sweet for me. 
Nutella milk tea is a must try as well.

excerpts: No milk tea should cost that much.
milk tea.author: Kathy Z.
milk tea.review:
So nice to have a boba place near union square! Love the fresh fruit milk drinks here, I see them cutting up the fruit just for my drink! It IS very pricey, my honeydew fruit milk cost almost $6 and, let's be honest..No milk tea should cost that much. Extra cost for a glass bottle, which I didn't opt for. 

You CAN adjust the level of sweetness here :-) Thumbs up for that!

Nice clean interior, wish it was cheaper. But it's yummy and satisfies my sweet tooth twice over. But could really be cheaper. :'(

excerpts: Pretty decent milk tea, but the boba wasn't soft.
It was really hard and chewy :(
milk tea.author: Cathleen S.
milk tea.review: Pretty decent milk tea, but the boba wasn't soft. It was really hard and chewy :(

excerpts: The drinks we ordered were: red bean, Nutella, oolong milk tea, mango slush, iced coffee, & milk tea with taro pudding .
Everyone was very satisfied with their drinks and saved their bottles.
milk tea.author: Bel W.
milk tea.review: This place has good tea and average boba. They DO have a Nutella drink that's pretty bomb. The bottles that they provide with their drinks are awesome, and totally reusable. The drinks we ordered were: red bean, Nutella, oolong milk tea, mango slush, iced coffee, & milk tea with taro pudding . Everyone was very satisfied with their drinks and saved their bottles.

excerpts: Since it was my first time here, I ordered the black milk tea with tapioca
The milk tea is pretty strong..
I'm feeling pretty wired after drinking it, and I'm a 3-4 shots of espresso type of gal!
But I like how you can actually get the tea flavor without just a bunch of creamer and sugar.
The tapioca is a great consistency and perfect the chewiness.
milk tea.author: Jennifer S.
milk tea.review:
Was DYINNNNNNNNNNG to try this place ever since it opened and Dominic T. started blowing up my instagram feed with pictures..

FINALLY made it over here today during my 2 mile walk from Trader Joe's in Nob Hill and there was hardly anyone in line. They were completely out of glass bottles and offering at 20% discount for giving it to you in a plastic cup. Heck yeah! I'd prefer the plastic cup over the glass bottle any day!

Since it was my first time here, I ordered the black milk tea with tapioca so I could appropriately benchmark the place.

The milk tea is pretty strong..I'm feeling pretty wired after drinking it, and I'm a 3-4 shots of espresso type of gal! But I like how you can actually get the tea flavor without just a bunch of creamer and sugar. The tapioca is a great consistency and perfect the chewiness. I'm actually quite impressed!

I'm definitely level setting because this is a boba shop IN FiDI and in NorCal..BUT, its worth the four stars because it is in a convenient location, has awesome hours because they're open late-ish, AND it had yummy tapioca.

Not bad, Plentea! I'll definitely be back to try more teas and some of the desserts!!

excerpts: Milk tea is awesome here and it's definitely worth the try.
Highly recommended.
milk tea.author: Nathan L.
milk tea.review:
One word. Jars.

One of the coolest things here is that you get to keep the jar bottle after you purchase your boba. Also there's something about sipping from a jar that makes you feel awesome. Milk tea is awesome here and it's definitely worth the try. Highly recommended.

excerpts: There were so many options to choose from, from milk tea to fruit tea to smoothies.
To be honest, I mainly came here for the milk bottles (great marketing haha!)
but the tea is excellent.
They use real taro, strawberry, ingredients in your tea and the boba is very chewy.
Prices range from 4.50-6 I believe.
Since I had a hard time finding the place, it's 4.5 stars(for reference, it's across from ramen underground).
Plentea doesn't disappoint, so I'd say give it a try!
milk tea.author: Michelle Z.
milk tea.review:
My first time at plentea was pleasant. There were so many options to choose from, from milk tea to fruit tea to smoothies. 
To be honest, I mainly came here for the milk bottles (great marketing haha!) but the tea is excellent. They use real taro, strawberry, ingredients in your tea and the boba is very chewy. 
Prices range from 4.50-6 I believe. 
Since I had a hard time finding the place, it's 4.5 stars(for reference, it's across from ramen underground). Plentea doesn't disappoint, so I'd say give it a try!

excerpts: When I asked the cashier how the taro pudding was and if it would be good in a Thai milk tea, he replied "that's extra."
But is it good?"
Yeah, yeah
" was his reply as if he was just hurrying me along
so he could get to the rest of the line.
It was a simple question, but whatever, I ordered it anyway and the combination wasn't all that good.
The taro pudding was more like jello with an artificial taro taste.
After a couple sips, I didn't really want it anymore.
The glass jars are kind of cool, but they're heavy and not a convenient thing to walk around with.
milk tea.author: Monica V.
milk tea.review: My friend loves this place for their bubble teas, so I decided to give it a try during my visit last weekend. When I asked the cashier how the taro pudding was and if it would be good in a Thai milk tea, he replied "that's extra." "But is it good?" "Yeah, yeah" was his reply as if he was just hurrying me along so he could get to the rest of the line. It was a simple question, but whatever, I ordered it anyway and the combination wasn't all that good. The taro pudding was more like jello with an artificial taro taste. After a couple sips, I didn't really want it anymore. The glass jars are kind of cool, but they're heavy and not a convenient thing to walk around with.

excerpts: So if you're in the area and/or in need of a reusable water jug at home, I'd definitely suggest coming here and getting some boba milk tea as well!
milk tea.author: Athena L.
milk tea.review:
I think the glass bottles (with plastic to-go lids!) are what's going to bring me back to Plentea. Not that their drinks are bad.. it's just that the location is pretty out-of-the-way for me and a boba drink isn't much of a priority in my life right now. I had the Iced Milk with Brown Sugar and Taro Pudding. It was a teeny bit too sweet for my taste but it was still enjoyable. It's something different from the other boba place I go to, so it's a nice treat when I want something different. 

Staff are nice here and the wait wasn't too bad. So if you're in the area and/or in need of a reusable water jug at home, I'd definitely suggest coming here and getting some boba milk tea as well!

excerpts: I weighed the shit out with a measuring cup) of milk tea is not bad when you're smack dab in the middle of downtown.
The bottle costs $4 retail by itself, which means the cost of your tea is about $2.50 including tax besides that it's all about the location.
milk tea.author: Hedilyn G.
milk tea.review:
First of all let me just call out you "yelp snobs" for having super high expectations from a place that has only been open for less than a freakin' week!!! Really?! 
 
*No bathroom... (not all places in the financial district or downtown area have one, get over it! Go to Starbucks!) 

*Limited options or adjustments to the menu...( they've only been open 5 days!!! The people who work there are only getting acquainted with the amount of items they have on the menu. It takes a few times to get it down. How do I know? Because I'm a chef! Repetition is the key, not to mention the owner is still trying to get feedback about his products. I spoke to him tonight, i told him the smoked salmon waffle was good but the salmon was a little too salty since the slices are big.) 

*Steep pricing... $6.50 for a pint (2 cups exactly, yeah I weighed the shit out with a measuring cup) of milk tea is not bad when you're smack dab in the middle of downtown. The bottle costs $4 retail by itself, which means the cost of your tea is about $2.50 including tax besides that it's all about the location. You want something cheap go to China town or the Sunset. 

I usually don't like reading comments nor ratings because a lot of you guys are so subjective. It's annoying as hell! But anyhow I'm giving this place 5 stars. Great location and good hours (finally good boba around downtown and open till 12am), flavors are spot on and well balanced (I've had 4), lovely interior and straight forward menu (better because it doesn't confuse the consumer plus too many options gets overwhelming e.g t pumps/teaway), Waffle options are fun and the waffle itself was perfect in texture and sweetness (Had smoke salmon, it was nice the owner wanted to give you more  but it gets to salty because of thickness. He took note of it and graciously thank me for telling him what my thoughts were). STAFF was very warm and friendly. Hope I gave the owner some justice. It's a cool concept no doubt! My pastry team's guilty pleasure.... 

Flavors I've had:
Brown Sugar- taste like maple... Perfect amount of sweetness for using brown sugar. For that person who was complaining about how it taste like sugar milk, guess what it is! That's why it's called FLAVORED ICE MILK!!!
Oolong Tea with Strawberries/Green Tea with Peaches- not too bitter and too light. You can taste the tea on top of that they use fresh fruits always a plus! 
Strawberry Milk- reminds me of Momo Milk bar beverage. Milk steeped with bright fruit flavor.

excerpts:
- lids to cap on when finished with drink
- milk tea is RICH and BOLD -

I've never had anything THIS close to tasting like REAL, AUTHENTIC milk tea flavor
- thai tea is JUST the right amount of sweetness and tasted soft/milky
- grass jelly has a nice texture

Cons:
- pretty pricey $4.50 for milk teas + $0.50 for toppings
milk tea.author: Vivian L.
milk tea.review:
AHHHH, the bottles are soooooo cute! It was what drew me in to coming here at first, and I definitely don't regret it! 

Pros: 
- comes in a bottle form (bring it back next time for 10% off)
- lids to cap on when finished with drink
- milk tea is RICH and BOLD - I've never had anything THIS close to tasting like REAL, AUTHENTIC milk tea flavor
- thai tea is JUST the right amount of sweetness and tasted soft/milky
- grass jelly has a nice texture

Cons:
- pretty pricey $4.50 for milk teas + $0.50 for toppings
- long wait out the door (~15 minutes)
- limited seating inside
- portions are a bit small

Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend trying this place! I was hesitant to order their cremas and iced teas since it's rather expensive but will for sure try it next time!

excerpts: My friends got a taro milk tea and loved it as well.
Can be a bit pricey, but at least you get to keep the jar!
If you bring it back on your next visit, you get 10% off!
milk tea.author: Weylie H.
milk tea.review:
SOOO GOOD!! Got here an hour before they closed. No line and really good service! I got the milk green tea and it was amazinggggg. Love when milk teas aren't overly sweet. The tapioca was nice and chewy too! 

My friends got a taro milk tea and loved it as well. Can be a bit pricey, but at least you get to keep the jar! If you bring it back on your next visit, you get 10% off!

excerpts: The milk tea's are average.
I really enjoyed their mango oolong tea, but mainly for the mango.
milk tea.author: Joseph T.
milk tea.review:
Not the best, but it'll do. The bottles are nice, though that means the drinks are pricy. And there's a $10 credit card minimum, so come with cash if you don't plan on ordering more than one!

Environment: 4/5
Seating downstairs is limited, but there's more space with tables upstairs. The store doesn't have much space, and because it's so popular, it gets crowded really easily. On two of my three visits, the line would go out the door, which wasn't the most fun experience when it gets cold.

Also, no bathrooms!

Drinks: 4/5
The salted crema oolong is good... in a very interesting way. I don't believe the oolong was strong enough, but the salt and foam at the top made it enjoyable, as it was a taste that I'd never experienced before.

The milk tea's are average. I really enjoyed their mango oolong tea, but mainly for the mango. There was something about their oolong tea when I ordered it with mango that didn't taste like tea, but like a cleaning solution of some sort.

Service: 4/5
Friendly, but not overly friendly. Not too fast either, but watching them make drinks, they definitely do more work than mixing powders and syrups with a spoon!

excerpts: The green milk tea with boba tastes exactly like teaway's green milk tea.
The boba was still hard and haven't been cooked fully.
Disappointment :(
The honeydew smoothie was pretty decent, just not great.
milk tea.author: Kathleen U.
milk tea.review:
Boba in a Bottle in the Financial/Chinatown district. Probably inspired by Boba Guys and SoCal boba joints. The location is smack right dab between Sushirito & the second location of Cool Tea Bar. 

Inside of Plentea is pretty chic and clean. There are only a few tables inside. Dislike how there isn't a restroom. 

The price for 2 drinks is usually around $12. The green milk tea with boba tastes exactly like teaway's green milk tea. The boba was still hard and haven't been cooked fully. Disappointment :( The honeydew smoothie was pretty decent, just not great. It tasted like it was made fresh with real honeydew so that was a plus. 

Am I only the one has a problem with trying to take off lid on the bottle? I think it is baby proof or maybe girl proof in this case for me. The concept of lid and on the bottle looks nice, however I have trouble taking the lid off. 

Bring back the bottle for 10% discount. However, if I'm in the area, I don't think I will be coming here for boba. Pricey & so hard to find parking.

excerpts: I got the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the tapioca was a very soggy texture and tasteless
the oolong milk tea was too sweet and left that nasty feeling in my mouth.
I also got the fresh honeydew milk
and I liked this one because of the fresh honeydew.
However, it was a bit frothy on top.
Total came out to be 11$ for the two drinks.
milk tea.author: Leilani Y.
milk tea.review:
Even though you get a discount for brining back the glass bottles, 10% isn't going to motivate customers to bring our bottles back in. This is very unsustainable because people would rather just pay that 50 cents for a new glass bottle..... I really don't like this concept. I figured that the only people that would bring the bottles back are people that work in the offices but that's about it.. I would recommend them giving customers a better discount for bringing in their glass bottles or making the option to have the drinks in glass containers and plastic containers. This would be a lot more Eco-friendly...

As for the drinks, they were just okay.... I got the oolong milk tea with tapioca and the tapioca was a very soggy texture and tasteless :/ the oolong milk tea was too sweet and left that nasty feeling in my mouth. I also got the fresh honeydew milk and I liked this one because of the fresh honeydew. However, it was a bit frothy on top. Total came out to be 11$ for the two drinks.

excerpts: Like any modern day boba connoisseur, I like to judge a store based on the classic black milk tea with boba.
I ordered a black milk tea with boba and a fresh milk with pudding drink.
And both were equally disappointing.
The milk tea was bland with little black tea flavor.
It was very diluted.
However, the actual boba was okay, but not anything special.
The fresh milk with pudding sounded amazing and unique.
However, the drink was overwhelmingly sweet with an underwhelming flavor.
So much so, my friend and I made it a third of the way through before tossing it.
On top of the overly hyped drinks, I found a tiny shard of glass as I was beginning to reach the bottom of the milk tea.
I was chewing on my boba when I heard a crunch, at this point I spit it out and found a shard of glass.
Needless to say, I threw out the glass bottles and most definitely will not be coming back.
milk tea.author: Eva C.
milk tea.review:
For a boba store in SF, Plentea sucks.

San Francisco has many other boba shops that taste great with better prices. Being so close to Chinatown, there are stores such as Sweetheart or Cool Tea Bar with much better boba drinks. The only thing really keeping this store going is the fact that it comes in a Plentea glass milk bottle. Taking away the bottle, the actual drink is most definitely not worth the $5 + dollars that they charge here.

Like any modern day boba connoisseur, I like to judge a store based on the classic black milk tea with boba. I ordered a black milk tea with boba and a fresh milk with pudding drink. And both were equally disappointing. The milk tea was bland with little black tea flavor. It was very diluted. However, the actual boba was okay, but not anything special. The fresh milk with pudding sounded amazing and unique. However, the drink was overwhelmingly sweet with an underwhelming flavor. So much so, my friend and I made it a third of the way through before tossing it. The pudding made the drink look tasty, but that's just it, it was only contributed to the aesthetics. 

On top of the overly hyped drinks, I found a tiny shard of glass as I was beginning to reach the bottom of the milk tea. I was chewing on my boba when I heard a crunch, at this point I spit it out and found a shard of glass. Needless to say, I threw out the glass bottles and most definitely will not be coming back.

excerpts: I'll have to try that next time, along with their milk tea, pudding and other tasty items they have.
milk tea.author: Jennifer D.
milk tea.review:
I came here last week as I found out this place is right by my work and bought two drinks- sea salt creama with honey boba and peach green tea with lychee jelly. Prices ranged from $4.50-$6 and you get to keep the glass bottle. You could bring it with you the next time and you get 10% your next order. 

It is SUPER DELICIOUS and they have SUPER FRIENDLY STAFF! I have to say those ice cream waffle desserts sure looked appetizing. I'll have to try that next time, along with their milk tea, pudding and other tasty items they have.

excerpts: The Plentea logo'd glass bottles they used as a marketing strategy is genius--that's probably what inclines most of their customers, myself included, to wait in an out-the-door line for some boba milk tea.
The funny thing is, the price of their milk tea is about $1 more than most other spots in the area, which pays for the glass bottles.
I tried their oolong milk tea with boba.
Their tea was good and the boba decent as well, but not the best milk tea in the Chinatown area.
The lunch options, however, are pretty darn good.
I've had the pastrami waffle sandwich and the smoked salmon waffle sandwich,
both worth ordering again.
The saltiness of the pastrami/salmon complement the slight sweetness of the waffle bread.
I will definitely have to come back for the dessert waffles.
milk tea.author: Celia K.
milk tea.review:
The Plentea logo'd glass bottles they used as a marketing strategy is genius--that's probably what inclines most of their customers, myself included, to wait in an out-the-door line for some boba milk tea. The funny thing is, the price of their milk tea is about $1 more than most other spots in the area, which pays for the glass bottles. I'd recommend opting for a regular plastic cup and receiving a discount, as the glass bottle is not worth keeping and hard to clean anyway.

I tried their oolong milk tea with boba. Their tea was good and the boba decent as well, but not the best milk tea in the Chinatown area. The lunch options, however, are pretty darn good. I've had the pastrami waffle sandwich and the smoked salmon waffle sandwich, both worth ordering again. The saltiness of the pastrami/salmon complement the slight sweetness of the waffle bread. I will definitely have to come back for the dessert waffles.

excerpts: I have tried their milk tea w/ black tea and tapioca
, I don't think it's their specialty
so it's just okay!
it tasted the same as regular instant milk tea that you can get from asian grocery store, not too special from what i've experienced.
milk tea.author: Miss G.
milk tea.review:
Surprisingly, Plentea has one of the best Ice milk drinkI've ever had. I ordered it w/ brown sugar and egg pudding. LOVE it!!! The sweetness of the milk drink is complimenting the no-so-sweet egg pudding which I think is the great combination.

They don't have that many variety of drinks but they also serve sandwich and waffles. The place is not too big but they have seating upstairs and some downstairs. It can be really crowded during lunch break so prepare your trip accordingly. 

I have tried their milk tea w/ black tea and tapioca, I don't think it's their specialty so it's just okay! it tasted the same as regular instant milk tea that you can get from asian grocery store, not too special from what i've experienced. Not to mention that the tapioca is kinda hard to chew and a little bit tasteless compared to purple kow boba.

Definitely will come baackk! especially because they serve it it glass bottle so we can always reuse it and they give 10% whenever you come back. good marketing!

excerpts: I opted for their "fruit tea" and got their iced strawberry green tea, while my boyfriend got their boba black milk tea.
Their boba black milk tea was pretty good, but my strawberry green tea was just okay.
I have had better, but taking home a cute glass bottle that I can reuse for other things KINDA made up for that.
milk tea.author: Angelica E.
milk tea.review:
The hype is over the drink jug, not the drink.

We decided to stop by this place before going to the airport since it was walking distance thinking we had time to get a drink here...BOY WERE WE WRONG.

It took a total of almost a hour for us to order and wait for our drink! Being from SoCal, and my boyfriend's house being walking distance from a Half n Half; I will admit I am "boba spoiled" as I would call it. 

Their menu doesn't have much variety, it really is mostly teas (PlenTEA, yes I know). I opted for their "fruit tea" and got their iced strawberry green tea, while my boyfriend got their boba black milk tea. The total came out to around $10, which isn't so bad because Half n Half cost about $9 for two people. 

The wait is L-O-N-G. I don't know if it is always like that or it was just because it was Lunar New Year and they were busy and understaffed, but it took a long time. The facility is on the small side, and while they do have an upstairs, it started to get stuffy inside so we ended up waiting outside.

Their boba black milk tea was pretty good, but my strawberry green tea was just okay. I have had better, but taking home a cute glass bottle that I can reuse for other things KINDA made up for that.

excerpts: I tried some of the milk tea and it tastes like any other milk tea to me.
My friend said it was a little too sweet
milk tea.author: Stephanie L.
milk tea.review:
I came here because a friend told me about how they had the glass bottles. To be honest, I did go mainly for the reusable bottle, not so much the drink itself. I was expecting a long wait so I went on a Monday at 11:30 AM. I was surprised to find no line so I quickly ordered my drinks: a mango black tea for myself and two black milk teas for my friend and for my mom. 

Although the wait to order was fairly quick, the wait for the actually drinks took about 10 minutes, even when it wasn't crowded. 

They called out my order and gave me my drinks. The lids for the bottles are in front so you can cap your own drinks.

So, as I expected, my mango black tea did remind me of a tpumps or honeyberry drink, but it included real mango pieces on top, which seems more worth it.

I tried some of the milk tea and it tastes like any other milk tea to me. My friend said it was a little too sweet so I'd probably get the 50% sweet next time.

Overall, I think this place is pretty good considering it comes with nice bottles, but if you're going primarily for the drink, you could go anywhere else unless this is the closest boba place nearby.

excerpts: Would recommend the green milk tea and oolong milk tea with egg pudding.
Giving 3 stars as it's good enough to satisfy my craving for milk tea, but have definitely had better elsewhere.
milk tea.author: Michelle R.
milk tea.review:
At first you think it's cool because of the "free" jar they give you... but the tea is just average. Would recommend the green milk tea and oolong milk tea with egg pudding. Giving 3 stars as it's good enough to satisfy my craving for milk tea, but have definitely had better elsewhere. Also $4.50 + tax for tea with bubbles is pretty expensive, even if they do give you the jar (which is pretty annoying to carry around and makes your hands cold when it's chilly out).

Also we tried pouring hot water into one of the jars and the bottom fell out, so don't try at home! They hold up to warm/hot water but not water that's just been boiled.

excerpts: I ended up with a glass bottle of ice green milk tea only.
Needless to say I paid $4.00 + tax.
Seemed pricey.
If you bring your empty glass jar back you'll get a 10% discount off your next drink.
milk tea.author: Shirley N.
milk tea.review:
The three of us were on route to Chinatown on foot when we passed by Plentea.  I had read about the glass bottle novelty and the long lines to order a boba drink.

We walked in Saturday around 12:45pm as our curiosity was peaked about the glass jar. And no lines.

Once again I made a boo boo.  I'm not boba expert so when the order taker asked me what I wanted to order to drink, I went with the ice green tea milk.  She asked any toppings?   I said no.   I guess boba is a topping.

I ended up with a glass bottle of ice green milk tea only.  Needless to say I paid $4.00 + tax.  Seemed pricey. If you bring your empty glass jar back you'll get a 10% discount off your next drink.  I don't know how many folks plan to do that unless you work in the FiDi area.

On the other hand I am going to be in Chinatown Sunday.  Maybe I'll bring my clean glass.  And get a boba topping.

excerpts: I got the iced green milk tea with pudding.
It was just ok.
There were quite a few other items on the menu that looked good, but i tried my friends dranks too
and it's just ok too.
I will likely not return after getting my first jar.
milk tea.author: Kathleen C.
milk tea.review: I totally came here bc of the glass jar! Fell for their scheme!!! You get to keep the jar and get a discount if you bring it back to be reused. The drinks are about $5, which prob factors in the jar. I got the iced green milk tea with pudding. It was just ok. There were quite a few other items on the menu that looked good, but i tried my friends dranks too and it's just ok too. I will likely not return after getting my first jar.

excerpts: I wish more boba was in the drinks (50 cents) but I did like the flavor of their black milk tea.
Boba was nicely chewy.
But I'm just happy with the glass bottle that will be filled with fresh flowers every week.
milk tea.author: Winnie T.
milk tea.review:
Prices are high but I suppose it's to cover the cute glass bottles you get. My friend wanted to leave hers but I  think they'd make great flower vases! 

I wish more boba was in the drinks (50 cents) but I did like the flavor of their black milk tea. Boba was nicely chewy. But I'm just happy with the glass bottle that will be filled with fresh flowers every week.

excerpts: Now normally when I go to a place that serves bubble tea I like to get just a standard milk tea with boba or the egg pudding, I tend to stay away from the fruity teas because I feel like they are too sweet and the fruit masks the tea flavor.
So I ordered the milk tea with grass jelly and it was perfect, there was a good amount of grass jelly and the tea wasn't too sweet and you could taste the tea itself.
milk tea.author: Zach C.
milk tea.review:
I stumbled upon this place after swinging by sushirrito and the line was way out the door but luckily the workers inside worked quickly and I only had to wait ten minutes. What attracted me was the people walking out with their drinks in glass jars! The catch is (at least when I went) they only offered glass jars to the first two hundred customers of the day, however, they do offer a 20% discount for drinks in plastic cups so it's not too bad if you don't get your nifty glass jar.

Now normally when I go to a place that serves bubble tea I like to get just a standard milk tea with boba or the egg pudding, I tend to stay away from the fruity teas because I feel like they are too sweet and the fruit masks the tea flavor. So I ordered the milk tea with grass jelly and it was perfect, there was a good amount of grass jelly and the tea wasn't too sweet and you could taste the tea itself. And drinking it out of a glass jar just made it seem so much cooler!

From what I've heard their other teas are awesome so I plan on coming back to give those a try as well.

excerpts: I like my milk tea creamy and smooth + strong tea
is my favorite and Plentea does exactly that!
The boba is chewy, yet very soft and actually reminds me of Fantasia's boba.
It's not Asha's milk tea, but it's very close!
Crema Milk Tea with boba - I honestly couldn't taste the difference except the Crema was a bit creamier than the Iced Milk Tea.
Overall, it was a nice drink to have if you want a creamier consistency milk tea.
The milk tea is 5 stars, but I need to knock down a star for the expensive prices!
milk tea.author: Joyce E.
milk tea.review:
Boba in a Bottle? Say it ain't so! In fact, I think Plentea might have been inspired by Boba Guys' Boba in a mason jar idea and low and behold, the Boba in the Bottle was invented! 

I was in the Chinatown area on Wednesday, 04/30 and desperately wanted to try Plentea so I begged my boyfriend to go with me. It was almost 90 degrees, my boyfriend was grumpy, hot and Yelp directions were leading us everywhere, so I knew that the only thing that could alleviate this situation was a nice cold glass on boba. When we finally got to Plentea, we were told by some guy on their second floor balcony that they were closed and that their grand opening is tomorrow, which I found odd because the store was open, pretty much looked ready to go, and there were 5 Yelp reviews raving about their boba. Disappointed, we took our business to Ten Ren a couple blocks up from Plentea.

A day after their grand opening, my sister and I went to try their boba. If you plan on driving, then I wish you the best of luck because it is almost impossible to get parking near Plentea. Luckily, there is a parking garage nearby and public transportation is always available! This time, the shop was open and they were actually ready for our business! We ordered the Crema Tea with boba and the Iced Milk Oolong Tea with boba.

Iced Milk Oolong Tea with boba - Absolutely delicious! I say this a lot, but this could quite possibly the the best boba in SF. I like my milk tea creamy and smooth + strong tea is my favorite and Plentea does exactly that! The boba is chewy, yet very soft and actually reminds me of Fantasia's boba. It's not Asha's milk tea, but it's very close!

Crema Milk Tea with boba - I honestly couldn't taste the difference except the Crema was a bit creamier than the Iced Milk Tea. Overall, it was a nice drink to have if you want a creamier consistency milk tea.

The total was around $11 and yes, it was pricy, but worth it! Although they do encourage you to reuse your bottle for an extra 10% off, I do not see myself coming here often due to the horrible parking situation and location. The milk tea is 5 stars, but I need to knock down a star for the expensive prices!

excerpts: I went for taro pudding for my taro milk tea, and my friend went with aloe for her honeydew black tea.
I am really grateful that they use real taro and real honeydew for their drinks, but I will probably never order the taro milk tea again.
Yes, the cashier warned me that it was milk tea with taro mixed into it, but I didn't realize that the taro would be so gritty.
That, plus the stickiness of the milk... not a very refreshing drink.
Oh well.
Live and learn.
My friend liked her honeydew black tea, but said that it was too sweet.
milk tea.author: Iona C.
milk tea.review:
Stopped by Plentea twice yesterday:

2:45 PM - First time I've seen a line out the door!  It took my friend and I about 20 minutes to get to the front to place our order.  While in line, a representative from Kash, a new app designed to skip over transaction processing fees for retailers (while rewarding points to customers who use it), told us that we could get $10 off our order if we paid with it.  Heads up, y'all!  There must have been a huge catering order right before us, because I saw one of the Plentea employees wheeling out crates of drinks.  Next thing I know, the cashier calls out our order number and tells me that... they've run out of boba.  You what?!  The cashier was really apologetic, asked us if we wanted to just substitute something else or get our order refunded altogether.  Though my friend and I wanted boba, we opted for new add-ins.  I went for taro pudding for my taro milk tea, and my friend went with aloe for her honeydew black tea.  Oh, the sadness, though!

I am really grateful that they use real taro and real honeydew for their drinks, but I will probably never order the taro milk tea again.  Yes, the cashier warned me that it was milk tea with taro mixed into it, but I didn't realize that the taro would be so gritty.  That, plus the stickiness of the milk... not a very refreshing drink.  Oh well.  Live and learn.  My friend liked her honeydew black tea, but said that it was too sweet.  If you actually like to taste the richness of the tea, adjust your sweetness level.  

7:30 PM - After grabbing dinner at Bun Mee, two of my girl friends and I headed over to Plentea.  I was a little wary after my experience earlier in the day, but when we got there, there were only a few other people in line ahead of us, and they had boba again!  Praise the Lord!  I went with their peach black tea with boba, and my friends got the sea salt crema with boba, and the peach oolong tea with lychee jelly.

The way their fresh fruit tea drinks work is that they're basically whatever tea you choose (black, green, or oolong), with minced pieces of your choice of fruit (mango, peach, honeydew, etc.).  The fruit flavor really isn't fully infused into the drink in the way that you might get from a syrup or powder, but then again, you get the benefit of knowing you've got fresh fruit in there.  The peaches were not ripe, though, so the bits and pieces were crunchy and super tart.  You win some, you lose some, I guess.  Between my black tea base, and one of my friends' oolong tea base, I'd probably try and go with the oolong, or maybe even green, next time.  The black tea almost overpowered the peach flavor, while the oolong nicely complimented it.  As for the sea salt crema... blech.  I've never been on that bandwagon, though, so take my comment with a grain of, er, salt...

Still love the glasses here!  I'm starting to build quite the collection...

*NOTE - NO PUBLIC RESTROOMS!*

excerpts: This is my fav milk tea place in SF!
The glass bottles is a nice touch; they even give you a 10% off on your drink if you bring back the glass bottle on your next visit.
My favorite is the regular milk tea with egg pudding :)
milk tea.author: Stephy H.
milk tea.review: This is my fav milk tea place in SF! The glass bottles is a nice touch; they even give you a 10% off on your drink if you bring back the glass bottle on your next visit. My favorite is the regular milk tea with egg pudding :)

excerpts: While I had the usual black milk tea, my friend tried the oolong crema.
I loved my drink; the tea flavor was strong and prominent and tapioca chewy - just the way I like it.
milk tea.author: Hannah P.
milk tea.review:
New boba shop located in the extremely busy FiDi - I admire their courage! Yes, drinks served in a glass milk bottle makes them that much more appealing, especially to the after school/lunchtime crowds. 

While I had the usual black milk tea, my friend tried the oolong crema. I loved my drink; the tea flavor was strong and prominent and tapioca chewy - just the way I like it. My friend wasn't as enthusiastic with his choice. 

I'll give this place the benefit of the doubt. There is always room for improvement for a new shop, and I'm sure soon they will find their groove.

excerpts: I ordered the basic milk tea and saw the staff pour tea into the blender and add a scoop of powder to blend.
After that, she poured it into the glass jar.
Their website feels deceptive.
milk tea.author: M H.
milk tea.review:
I've come a few times over the years and always thought it tasted good. But then I noticed that the milk that's added is actually "powder" and not fresh. For an artisanal boba shop, that was shocking, especially at their prices. I don't think the tea is of any particularly good quality. The gimmick really are the glass jars. For teas or boba, I'd recommend Asha down the street or Boba Guys.

FYI -their website says they use organic fresh milk. But that was not the case with my drink. I ordered the basic milk tea and saw the staff pour tea into the blender and add a scoop of powder to blend. After that, she poured it into the glass jar. Their website feels deceptive.

excerpts: Drinks wise, the milk tea is REALLY creamy, which I don't like.
BUT if you're into that, then this place is great for you!
Somehow the tea flavor still comes through despite all the cream, which I admit is impressive.
milk tea.author: Emily T.
milk tea.review:
Convenient location, and "free" jars.

Ok, well I guess they already factored the glass jar into the base drink price, but the people waiting in line don't seem to care or notice. This seems to be a good boba place to show off to your SF-noob friends after a long day shopping at Westfield/Union Square. I think a lot of the traffic in Plentea is primarily due to the jars, and wannabe-hipsters love jars.

The price is a little above average for boba places, and they do have a credit card minimum ($10 I think? Normally ordering 2 drinks will take care of it). Location-wise, it's a relatively quick walk from the Montgomery bart station, although they don't have a bathroom in the store-- which I guess is great since it keeps the crowd moving so people can't perch there too long. 

Drinks wise, the milk tea is REALLY creamy, which I don't like. BUT if you're into that, then this place is great for you! Somehow the tea flavor still comes through despite all the cream, which I admit is impressive. The fruit teas are ok -- nothing special.

Tip: If you really need to use the restroom, go to Super Duper across the street!

excerpts: Giving out jars instead of cups is what differentiate them from other milk tea places.
I really like their jars because it makes their business unique.
Bring it back to order your drinks will save you 10% off, I haven't done that
but I should.
I usually order oolong seasalt
and I recently order jasmine milk green tea, which I like.
Sometimes simple is good!
Bobas are just right to chew.
4 stars because I feel like their menu is less compared to other places, not much choices.
milk tea.author: Lynn T.
milk tea.review: Giving out jars instead of cups is what differentiate them from other milk tea places. I really like their jars because it makes their business unique. Bring it back to order your drinks will save you 10% off, I haven't done that but I should. I usually order oolong seasalt and I recently order jasmine milk green tea, which I like. Sometimes simple is good! Bobas are just right to chew. 4 stars because I feel like their menu is less compared to other places, not much choices.

excerpts: But there is no fruit milk tea.
None of the milk teas they offer are flavored and none of the flavored milks have tea in them!
The first time I asked if they had fruit milk tea, they said no
and that was the end of the conversation.
So I ordered a blueberry milk with honey tapioca.
I could pass on the tapioca, the blueberry milk was what you think blueberry milk should taste like.
However, they graciously decided to experiment for me and made what I requested: Strawberry Oolong Milk Tea w/ Egg Pudding (they ran out of grass jelly).
The outcome was perfect.
If they keep doing this special creation for me, I will keep returning!
milk tea.author: Sandy T.
milk tea.review:
I might have just changed the game.

I've been studying their menu since they opened. There's fruit milk and then there's fruit tea. But there is no fruit milk tea. None of the milk teas they offer are flavored and none of the flavored milks have tea in them! The first time I asked if they had fruit milk tea, they said no and that was the end of the conversation. So I ordered a blueberry milk with honey tapioca. I could pass on the tapioca, the blueberry milk was what you think blueberry milk should taste like. It is actually whole milk with blueberries.

The second time around I asked if they could add milk to their fruit tea. It took a while to get a definitive response, because that would involve going against the menu and being a little creative *gasp* I was told that they don't do fruit milk teas because they don't want to mix too many things together and flavors might not mix well, etc. However, they graciously decided to experiment for me and made what I requested: Strawberry Oolong Milk Tea w/ Egg Pudding (they ran out of grass jelly). The outcome was perfect. If they keep doing this special creation for me, I will keep returning!

excerpts: When I'm in sf I always stop by plentea to get the jasmine milk tea and the Thai tea, both drinks are in glass bottle which is pretty cool!
milk tea.author: Jenifer D.
milk tea.review: When I'm in sf I always stop by plentea to get the jasmine milk tea and the Thai tea, both drinks are in glass bottle which is pretty cool!

excerpts: We ordered the thia iced milk tea with the pudding and the boba and I have to say that the pudding and boba mixed together was actually good!
The Thai milk tea was creamy and delicious as well.
All the other drinks that people were getting looked really yummy too.
There are lots of combinations for drinks you can order.
milk tea.author: Adam M.
milk tea.review:
Been here only once and decided that we would come back in the future! 

First off, I just want to say that their glass bottles are a pretty catchy trick to get people to come in. My girlfriend and I were eating at Sushirrito and saw some people walking around with a glass bottle with tea and boba in it and we were like "whoa we need to get some of that wherever it is!" 

The lines gets pretty long but I mean if you're with somebody just chit chatting away, then the wait to order and the wait for the actual drink won't even matter. They've got a few chairs and tables inside to hangout while waiting or drinking. 

We ordered the thia iced milk tea with the pudding and the boba and I have to say that the pudding and boba mixed together was actually good! The Thai milk tea was creamy and delicious as well. All the other drinks that people were getting looked really yummy too. There are lots of combinations for drinks you can order.  Unfortunately I can't talk about the food because we didn't order any. 

Don't forget to bring the glass bottle back to receive a 10% discount y'all!

excerpts: I am a fan of their caramel milk tea with boba and pudding.
It's a bit sweet due to to the caramel
but you can ask for less sweet.
I have a sweet tooth
so I like mine at normal sweetness.
The cool thing here is that the drinks come in cute milk jugs that you get to keep!
milk tea.author: Stephy L.
milk tea.review:
Parking may be hard to find sometimes, but there is street parking where you have to pay or there is a garage across the street that charges a few dollars per half an hour or so.

Love the tea here! I am a fan of their caramel milk tea with boba and pudding. It's a bit sweet due to to the caramel but you can ask for less sweet. I have a sweet tooth so I like mine at normal sweetness. The cool thing here is that the drinks come in cute milk jugs that you get to keep! And if you bring the bottle back next time then you get 10% off on your order! 

I also like their strawberry yogurt when I'm in a fruity mood. It's refreshing.

excerpts: My coworker wanted a fruit milk tea, which apparently they DON'T DO because they "can't guarantee the taste"....
Whatever that means.
I'm not quite sure how they can offer regular milk teas but say that they can't make a strawberry green milk tea.
Weird.
She ended up getting the Strawberry Milk, which is just whole milk blended with strawberries.
milk tea.author: Ava S.
milk tea.review:
Pricey but quality teas. I got an unsweetened mango oolong tea. DELICIOUS. It came with small fresh mango chunks, which added just the right amount of sweetness (I'm not a fan of sweet drinks).

My coworker wanted a fruit milk tea, which apparently they DON'T DO because they "can't guarantee the taste".... Whatever that means. I'm not quite sure how they can offer regular milk teas but say that they can't make a strawberry green milk tea. Weird. She ended up getting the Strawberry Milk, which is just whole milk blended with strawberries. I wouldn't recommend getting the Fruit Milks.

All drinks come in a cute branded glass jar that you can take home. If you bring it back to reuse on your next trip, you get 10% off your order. :)

Free wifi... but I wouldn't stick around to hang out here. They don't have a restroom!

excerpts: 5 stars for their green milk tea.
milk tea.author: John Y.
milk tea.review:
5 stars for their green milk tea. 

All I really want these days from a boba joint is good green tea with good milk. This place delivers both in spades, with a classy glass bottle to boot. 

The tea is strong, which I can appreciate. The milk to tea ratio also seems appropriate. 

Not looking for perfection here, but my drink was sweet, smooth, strong and tasty. Not much more I can ask for.

excerpts: I also tried my friends mango milk tea, thai milk tea and mango milk and thought all tasted really nice.
milk tea.author: Jenny N.
milk tea.review:
I fell in love with this place after my 1st visit today lol. The drinks were spot on, the place was nice, and the owner is such a lovely person. She was going around asking people how their food and drinks were and i thought that was so nice of her. 

My 50% sweet avocado fresh fruit milk, with soy milk, egg pudding, and aloe was perfect. I also tried my friends mango milk tea, thai milk tea and mango milk and thought all tasted really nice. The waffle had a nice texture and they did not skim on the nutella and banana 

The place was so crowded and the line was sooooo long. But once we make our order, it came out pretty quickly. Overall a nice experience and i loved how they let us kept the bottle haha.

excerpts: I ordered a classic milk tea boba and despite not caring for the tea itself the boba was good.
Not to mushy and not to hard haha.
But the bottle gives it another star
so I'll settle with 4 stars for pleantea.
milk tea.author: Mahina M.
milk tea.review:
What can you say right? the bottles are adorable and a unique idea. Total seller there, these bottles are what sparked my interest and brought me to pleantea.... Nice marketing strategy there. 

Being that its in the city of course there was no parking, upon my arrival I was bummed to see a ridiculous line. But anything for boba! So I waited with my patient friend for roughly 30 minutes. Once we ordered waiting was rough considering the tight space and taken tables. After getting a table we probably waited 8 minutes or so for our 3 drinks. But my goodness this chick was eager for our table and was up against where we were seating I was ready to ask her she wanted to have tea with us already.... Nah just joking. 

Talking boba business now I'd give it 3 stars. I ordered a classic milk tea boba and despite not caring for the tea itself the boba was good. Not to mushy and not to hard haha. But the bottle gives it another star so I'll settle with 4 stars for pleantea.

excerpts: I ordered a custom drink: Strawberry oolong milk tea w/ grass jelly.
(Originally I wanted blueberry but they ran out of that..)
They don't have fruit flavored milk teas on the menu, but they could make it for you if the line isn't busy & if they know how.
I was very satisfied with my drink.
It tasted really good!
The second time I went, I ordered Mango Oolong Milk Tea.
They didn't really know how to make it but try tried anyway.
It didn't taste good this time...
There was way to much powder and my drink was warm..
I think from now on, I'm going to avoid asking for fruit milk teas.
I wish I got the name of the guy who made my first drink because that one was perfect.
milk tea.author: Tina S.
milk tea.review:
I went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded at that time. I ordered a custom drink: Strawberry oolong milk tea w/ grass jelly. (Originally I wanted blueberry but they ran out of that..) They don't have fruit flavored milk teas on the menu, but they could make it for you if the line isn't busy & if they know how. I was very satisfied with my drink. It tasted really good! Better than Tpumps in my opinion. 

Love the idea of getting to keep the glass bottle. I think that's one of the main things that attracted people to try this place.. Well at least for me it did :P 
Plus it's environmentally friendly that way!
You can bring back the bottle next time for 20% off your drink. 
(Which I think is kind of a hassle to bring back and forth.. But it shouldn't be so bad if you have a bag with you :P)

The price is however.. overpriced.. At first I was willing to pay $6 for a drink because I get to keep the bottle, I would love to come back again to try all the flavors but I don't know if I want to pay like $5 for drink since it's just milk/tea.. Even if it's 20% off, it's still pricy. I don't think this should be more/as expensive than Jamba Juice or Starbucks.. :/

The workers there were very nice, and it's a pretty nice place to chill at. There are two floors to this place. 
But overall, my experience was great. My only problem is the price.

----- Update -----

The second time I went, I ordered Mango Oolong Milk Tea. They didn't really know how to make it but try tried anyway. It didn't taste good this time... There was way to much powder and my drink was warm.. I think from now on, I'm going to avoid asking for fruit milk teas. I wish I got the name of the guy who made my first drink because that one was perfect.

excerpts: I ordered the thai tea and the jasmine milk tea and both were just bleh.
I would never pay the price for the boba period
so I am very glad I got a free tea with all the bottles I had because it's not even worth it.
There are better places in chinatown!
milk tea.author: Star S.
milk tea.review:
Ehh.. this boba isn't that great. 
My work place had a ton of these bottles from co-workers going here a lot over the past few months and I found this place on the bottom of my bubble tea list. I think it was the worst tea I ever had. I ordered the thai tea and the jasmine milk tea and both were just bleh. I would never pay the price for the boba period so I am very glad I got a free tea with all the bottles I had because it's not even worth it. There are better places in chinatown!

excerpts: Although, it's much better than powdered milk tea (+1), but geez, five dollars a pop?
My wallet hurts.
I feel like I'm paying for this gimmicky glass bottle that I don't even want (and isn't convenient for me to carry around the city).
milk tea.author: Miffy Y.
milk tea.review:
Let's see. For one, good God, turn the music DOWN. I can't even hear people who are 3 ft from me. It does not make for an enjoyable time. The shop needs to be cleaned. The maneki neko in the upstairs loft was covered in dust, and there was food on the floor. Per my husband's ranting, if you're going to open a store, either say cash only or eat the cost of doing business. What am I talking about? The $10 credit card minimum. If you're coming here by yourself, good luck, I hope you have cash. It's like dangling a carrot in front of someone; We accept credit cards... just kidding, only if you spend x amount. Just. No. 

Why does it take so long? 20 minutes to get two (simple) drinks is ridiculous. Are you guys growing the tea leaves back there? This stuff ain't cheap either. Although, it's much better than powdered milk tea (+1), but geez, five dollars a pop? My wallet hurts. I feel like I'm paying for this gimmicky glass bottle that I don't even want (and isn't convenient for me to carry around the city). Why not just focus on good customer service and tea rather than relying on this whole glass bottle nonsense? 

I'll be sticking to my tried and true, less than 5 dolla' boba. You know, that happy place where you don't have to deal with chicks next to you taking 20 selfies and your eardrums bleeding.

excerpts: Their green milk tea with boba is good -
just ask to use less sugar
and you'll be set.
Boba is just sweet and chewy enough.
milk tea.author: Susan Y.
milk tea.review:
Glass bottles!!!!! 
For a small extra cost you get a glass bottle and you can use it for flowers, water, etc. 
You also get a discount the next time you come back with the bottle. Yaaaaaassss!!!

Their green milk tea with boba is good - just ask to use less sugar and you'll be set. Boba is just sweet and chewy enough. Yums. 

I've never actually set foot in here - all of my boba from here has been delivered to me but I can say this - it's worth the trip if you're already in the area! lol

excerpts: I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea with Tapioca and my boyfriend had the Mango Oolong Tea with Grassjelly and Tapioca.
We were the many who didn't get our drinks in the glass bottles (limited to 300/day until July)
so we got a 20% discount for purchasing in a plastic cup.
milk tea.author: Michelle S.
milk tea.review:
I was recommended to try this place because of how cute the drinks came in a glass bottles. I'm not the one who would drink boba all the time unless I have a craving and since my boyfriend and I were in the Chinatown area, we decided to try Plentea. 

It was early afternoon and there was a line out the door. The interior is rather small with a few tables, and from what it looks like, it seems like there's also a sitting area upstairs. The price of drinks were a little on the pricey side, but it didn't surprise me since you're basically paying for the glass bottles. I ordered the Oolong Milk Tea with Tapioca and my boyfriend had the Mango Oolong Tea with Grassjelly and Tapioca. We were the many who didn't get our drinks in the glass bottles (limited to 300/day until July) so we got a 20% discount for purchasing in a plastic cup. The cashier told us you can receive a discount for every time you bring your glass bottle in.

It didn't take long before our drinks arrived and when we tasted it, it was just..alright.  My boyfriend said he wasn't too impressed with his drink and had better elsewhere. It wasn't bland but it came out a lot sweeter than we thought it would be..too much syrup perhaps? We both didn't think it was THAT spectacular-tasting to be waiting in line for 30mins.

excerpts: My regular black milk tea was much too sweet for my taste and I gave up half way
so I'll probably ask for less sugar next time.
The pearls were good
milk tea.author: Jennie C.
milk tea.review:
Really wanted to like the tea, but I honestly think it's the jar that makes this place as popular as it is. Novelty, I guess? My regular black milk tea was much too sweet for my taste and I gave up half way so I'll probably ask for less sugar next time. The pearls were good so that's definitely a plus. 

Line is out the door which can be a bummer...be prepared to wait.

excerpts: I was in the area one day since I was shopping with friends and we decided to go get some milk tea after.
We walked in, the place was small, and the set up was just ok.
They have an upstairs with tables and chairs, but it was still a little crowded.
milk tea.author: Wendy L.
milk tea.review:
Okay I'll be honest. I really just wanted to try this place out because of the cool looking bottles. That's what really caught my attention & I like to call it "hipster boba".

I was in the area one day since I was shopping with friends and we decided to go get some milk tea after. We walked in, the place was small, and the set up was just ok. They have an upstairs with tables and chairs, but it was still a little crowded. The lady who took our orders was super friendly and she gave us her recommendations on the menu which was super nice of her.

Since I'm a fan of sea salt cream tea, I decided to get the sea salt oolong tea. When my drink came out, the lady advised me not to shake the drink which I thought was weird since I always shake my sea salt drinks before drinking it. She had told me that it actually tastes better when it's not mixed together. I took her advice, and I'm not sure if I actually really liked the taste of it. I felt like the drink was just ok: I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it. The sea salt tea just didn't compare to the one I usually get at 85 bakery. I'm not sure if it was because I didn't shake the drink this time or if it really was just ok. I'm giving this place 3 stars for now, but I would actually go back to retry the drink again and try out some of the other drinks. And plus, if you bring the bottle back next time, you get 10% off!

excerpts: The oolong milk tea tasted more like milk than tea.
Why though!!!
My friends were raving about this place in San Jose but better luck next time.
It wasn't that great for me.
Few stars for the glass bottle!!
milk tea.author: Kelly P.
milk tea.review: First timer here! The oolong milk tea tasted more like milk than tea. Why though!!! My friends were raving about this place in San Jose but better luck next time. It wasn't that great for me. Few stars for the glass bottle!!

excerpts: The jasmine milk tea is great if you ask for it less sweet.
milk tea.author: Grace H.
milk tea.review:
This place blew my mind!

I love the caramel ice milk with egg pudding. It's like salted caramel ice cream without the salt and it's not as heavy!

The jasmine milk tea is great if you ask for it less sweet. 

The fruit teas are a bit too perfumey for me.

excerpts: All the drinks are roughly $4+ (expensive for milk tea) and are served in a glass jar... which probably accounts for the high prices as the glass jar is pressed into that price.
You need a $15 minimum for card which I also found ridiculous!
I'm not trying to buy 3 drinks just to use my card.
milk tea.author: Cris-ann L.
milk tea.review:
Decided to give this place a shot with a friend. Line was out the door, just like you'd probably see at T-Pumps. I would have turned right around but my friend & I had nothing better to do. All the drinks are roughly $4+ (expensive for milk tea) and are served in a glass jar... which probably accounts for the high prices as the glass jar is pressed into that price. You need a $15 minimum for card which I also found ridiculous! I'm not trying to buy 3 drinks just to use my card. I ordered the fresh fruit tea and got strawberry black tea. I wasn't impressed with the drink for the time I had waited in line (seriously 20 minutes) and the price I'd paid.

Save your money and go to T-Pumps instead. Kudos for trying to endorse the reduce of trash/reuse of bottles by offering a discount for bringing it back for your next drink, but who's really going to conveniently carry that glass bottle around?

excerpts:
Recently ordered: $4.95 Jasmine/Green milk tea w/ "boba"

Yep, I gave into the hype and successfully bought a drink
so if you want your milk tea not too sweet, order it LESS
LESS sweet because the boba will actually sweeten your milk tea already.
milk tea.author: Kenny L.
milk tea.review:
Recently ordered: $4.95 Jasmine/Green milk tea w/ "boba"

Yep, I gave into the hype and successfully bought a drink ONCE, yep just once. The other times I came by ... the lines were so long and ridiculous during the 2pm post-lunch time where the line was out the door and atleast 10 deep on the sidewalk. That is at least a 30 minute wait since it took a little more than 30 minutes last time I was successful when the line got to the door. 

Anyways. 2? yeah 2 ... that disappointed.
-1 = price is a downer here. Yes, they give you a re-usable bottle and they give you 20% off when you bring it back. Great marketing technique to bring customers back ... but it should be an option to buy a glass bottle for those who want one and offer regular plastic / compostable cups if you wanna go "green"

- 2 = the wait / line. There HAS to be a better way to regulate the wait and/or the line. You gotta have a better system in terms of when the customer walks in, orders, get the drinks made, then get them out. I hate comparing but,  check out Sharetea. They get your order, make it, then in 5 minute, I get my drink. 

Last the taste - the boba is actually GOOD and sweet. so if you want your milk tea not too sweet, order it LESS LESS sweet because the boba will actually sweeten your milk tea already. I had no idea my first time, and it was too sweet for me. 

I'd love to come back and give you another try Plentea (and to use my bottle) but every time I come no matter what time it is, the wait and the line is too long and AIN'T NOBODY GOT TIME FOR THAT.

excerpts: I had the Ice Green Milk Tea with Tapioca ($4.50+0.50).
It was alright.
Nothing mind blowing, and the tapioca was a nice semi-soft chewy texture.
I can't remember if it was honey boba.
milk tea.author: Jess W.
milk tea.review:
I had the Ice Green Milk Tea with Tapioca ($4.50+0.50). It was alright. Nothing mind blowing, and the tapioca was a nice semi-soft chewy texture. I can't remember if it was honey boba. Overall, I just wanted the jar. 

My friend had the Ice Lemon Black Tea ($4.50). It was tasty, but at the end of the day, it tasted almost exactly like the boxed ones you can find in Chinatown. I would be laughing if that is what it really is...

The line started at the door frame. I was in and out within 20 minutes. 

Parking - a pain, typical for this location. 

Note to Plentea - change your cash register. I have NEVER seen so much cash lined up on their side. The cashier carefully "picked" out my change. It was mind blown. I couldn't stop staring. I wish I could've snapped a picture.

excerpts: I like their boba milk tea.
The store is clean and boba milk teas are delicious.
Upstairs has few small tables for people to chat, read books, or just  relax.
I also like their tea bottles.
milk tea.author: Lifang Y.
milk tea.review: I like their boba milk tea. The store is clean and boba milk teas are delicious. Upstairs has few small tables for people to chat, read books, or just  relax. I also like their tea bottles.

excerpts: The boba milk tea was super washed out.
It tasted like watered-down milk with some brown color.
milk tea.author: Kevin Y.
milk tea.review: If it weren't for the glass bottles that I can reuse daily, I would give this place 2 stars. The boba milk tea was super washed out. It tasted like watered-down milk with some brown color.

excerpts: Came to Plentea on a Saturday afternoon for a honeydew milk tea with pearls and a caramel milk tea with caramel pudding.
milk tea.author: Mabel Y.
milk tea.review:
JAR JAR JAR!!! That's all anyone comes for right?

Came to Plentea on a Saturday afternoon for a honeydew milk tea with pearls and a caramel milk tea with caramel pudding. Unfortunately, they ran out of jars but we got 20% off!

The drinks were not bad at all and honestly for the $5 you're essentially paying for the jar, not the drink.

excerpts: ; I got the caramel milk tea with tapioca.
The reason for the price is because you're paying for the bottle.
However the price you can get 10% if you bring the bottle back the next time.
Don't be surprised when you come and you see a long line full of Asians, it's pretty popular among them.
milk tea.author: Andre B.
milk tea.review:
Best way to get here is from Montgomery station if you're taking the Bart. It's right across the street from Sushiritto so if you want to be a typical asian, go ahead and get that prior.
The drink is overpriced but it's pretty tasty; I got the caramel milk tea with tapioca. The reason for the price is because you're paying for the bottle. However the price you can get 10% if you bring the bottle back the next time.
Don't be surprised when you come and you see a long line full of Asians, it's pretty popular among them.

excerpts: Milk tea with boba comes with cute bottle
！Delicious balance of flavors...
Best part is you get to take the glass bottle home!
milk tea.author: Samantha P.
milk tea.review: Milk tea with boba comes with cute bottle ！Delicious balance of flavors... Best part is you get to take the glass bottle home!

excerpts: Today, I stopped by early and the line hadn't formed yet, so I had an almond milk tea with bubbles, which was excellent.
Tea can be served hot or cold.
The only reason I didn't give five stars was the price was a bit high.
Quality has its price, however
and I highly recommend Plentea.
milk tea.author: Chris K.
milk tea.review: I've walked past Plentea many times and there is always a line out the door.  Today, I stopped by early and the line hadn't formed yet, so I had an almond milk tea with bubbles, which was excellent.  Tea can be served hot or cold.  The only reason I didn't give five stars was the price was a bit high.  Quality has its price, however and I highly recommend Plentea.

excerpts: I asked the employee if they were able to make fresh fruit milk tea
but unfortunately they could not.
milk tea.author: Tiffany P.
milk tea.review:
I've tried the Fresh Fruit Mango Milk with boba. I went after work and luckily purchased the last bottle of the day! Woohoo. It was very refreshing and the boba was good. The glass bottle definitely adds to the appeal of the drink. If it were in a plastic cup, it'd be a regular drink to me.

Only thing that I thought was weird: they have fresh fruit milk and fresh fruit tea. I asked the employee if they were able to make fresh fruit milk tea but unfortunately they could not. :( I still enjoyed it though.

Definitely worth the try for anyone who loves boba.

excerpts: Best milk tea in the city.
milk tea.author: Adam Y.
milk tea.review:
Best milk tea in the city. Perfect balance of sweetness and tea-flavor that comes in a reusable glass jar. 

Lines can be long on the weekends, but the wait usually isn't too bad (~20 min)

excerpts: I got the thai milk tea with boba.
I like that they use fresh ingredients, but the boba drinks were just subpar.
5/5 for service but 2/5 for the drinks.
milk tea.author: Vivian S.
milk tea.review: Meh. Came here with a couple of friends to try the place out. The service and everything was good and they have a cool concept (very instagram-worthy drinks). I got the thai milk tea with boba. I like that they use fresh ingredients, but the boba drinks were just subpar. 5/5 for service but 2/5 for the drinks.

excerpts: Husband ordered the fruit tea with boba and I ordered the green milk tea with boba.
The tea is good but the boba was not.
It was too chewy, to the point of almost hard.
I believe making the perfect boba is a must for every milk tea place.
milk tea.author: Tami T.
milk tea.review:
One of the better boba place near Union square. The glass bottles are cute and I like that you can re-use it to get a 10% discount. Husband ordered the fruit tea with boba and I ordered the green milk tea with boba. The tea is good but the boba was not. It was too chewy, to the point of almost hard. I believe making the perfect boba is a must for every milk tea place. They need to expand their toppings variety. 

Overall the place is quaint and there is enough space to sit and enjoy the tea in the shop instead of a grab and go place. I may come back if I happen to be around the area.

excerpts: I got their oolong milk tea with tapioca balls: the tea was good, but it didn't "wow" me.
The tapioca balls were a little hard for my taste, and I felt like as I kept drinking, the tapioca got slightly harder to chew.
milk tea.author: Clevian H.
milk tea.review:
Finally got to come here after hearing everyone hype about it. 

The drinks come in a glass jar you can keep which is why they're a little on the pricier side. Their interior design was definitely aesthetically pleasing, so bonus points for that. 

My rating is mainly for the drinks themselves. I got their oolong milk tea with tapioca balls: the tea was good, but it didn't "wow" me. The tapioca balls were a little hard for my taste, and I felt like as I kept drinking, the tapioca got slightly harder to chew. Not sure if I just got a bad batch or if it's always like that. 

I would come again with friends who've never been before, since the interior is really cute, but I wouldn't consider it a go-to place.

excerpts: I got the strawberry fruit tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea (something like that).
We waited about 10 minutes for our drink and then when it finally came.. my boyfriend was the first to take a sip and he made a face of disgust.
So here I am thinking "Oh lawd, probably one of his drama queen moments" as I went to go take a sip of mine.
I was about to make the same face again
so I took yet another sip and gave that face up.
The strawberry milk tea was so..
bland.
It tasted super watered down
and it just wasn't pleasant at all.
It was also pretty warm in temperature so that probably made it even worse.
I tried my boyfriend's and his again had the same problem.
I still can't decide what's worse- watered down coffee or watered down fruit milk tea.
