Either way, I had a terrible experience but at least the glass bottles made it safely back to NY?
milk tea.author: Kimberly K.
milk tea.review: Meh. I had to come try this place because the bottles make for such a cute photo and I came all the way from the East Coast and I was passing it- so why not? The prices were pretty decent too for such a monstrous bottle. I got the strawberry fruit tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea (something like that). We waited about 10 minutes for our drink and then when it finally came.. my boyfriend was the first to take a sip and he made a face of disgust. So here I am thinking "Oh lawd, probably one of his drama queen moments" as I went to go take a sip of mine. I was about to make the same face again so I took yet another sip and gave that face up. The strawberry milk tea was so.. bland. It tasted super watered down and it just wasn't pleasant at all. It was also pretty warm in temperature so that probably made it even worse. I tried my boyfriend's and his again had the same problem. I still can't decide what's worse- watered down coffee or watered down fruit milk tea. Either way, I had a terrible experience but at least the glass bottles made it safely back to NY?

excerpts: I ordered the black milk tea with egg pudding and I was not disappointed.
The black milk tea was good and the tea taste was very prominent unlike other places I have tried before.
milk tea.author: Loree T.
milk tea.review:
This place was not a let down. I went around 1130 and the place wasn't so busy so I was able to get my hands on their glass bottle. I ordered the black milk tea with egg pudding and I was not disappointed. The black milk tea was good and the tea taste was very prominent unlike other places I have tried before. I'm coming back to try the other choices that they have on their menu. 

Come early enough so you can grab their glass bottles, if you don't they end up running out and you'll just get it in a regular cup. If you get the glass bottles, bring it back when you get another drink because there's an extra discount!

excerpts: Milk tea: Definitely creamy, but too sweet.
milk tea.author: Jen P.
milk tea.review:
Milk tea: Definitely creamy, but too sweet. Needs a little more tea flavor.

Fruit tea: Too sweet yet watery at the same time. Needs stronger fruit & tea flavors.

The search continues...

excerpts: Another place nearby where I can indulge my milk tea addiction!
milk tea.author: Viet N.
milk tea.review:
Another place nearby where I can indulge my milk tea addiction!

Sure, their matcha milk green tea tasted pretty decent ($5.98, if you get it in the glass), with a decent amount of the familiar green tea flavor infused. But the one thing that attracted me to this place was the glass bottles! It's such an original idea (at least, I haven't seen anyone else do it yet), and they offer a discount if you bring it back. Personally, I plan to just keep it as a memento. 

I also hear their sandwiches are pretty good as well, give it a try! 
But I'm huge on matcha milk green tea, and so I'll be coming back here for it when I can!

excerpts: I usually order oolong milk tea and it used to be so great
but lately it's not at all.
Once I asked for a new oolong milk tea and it was so much better.
But last time I asked to replace it with coffee milk tea and it was even worse!!
I would recommend to ask for sample if you go before ordering one and taste it before you leave.
Now I like i-tea much better which is on the same street.
And there you can have a bigger cup with the same price.
milk tea.author: Fatima E.
milk tea.review: I used to go to this place regularly with my husband until the last two times. I usually order oolong milk tea and it used to be so great but lately it's not at all. Once I asked for a new oolong milk tea and it was so much better. But last time I asked to replace it with coffee milk tea and it was even worse!! I would recommend to ask for sample if you go before ordering one and taste it before you leave. Now I like i-tea much better which is on the same street. And there you can have a bigger cup with the same price.

excerpts: We had already ordered hot drinks with boba, but they don't even have any spoons to get the boba with, so we had to drink hot milk tea with boba out of a straw.
milk tea.author: Cody H.
milk tea.review: The tea tasted slightly above average, but I'm annoyed that they don't have restrooms, even for customers. They recommended to use either the super duper restroom across the street (closed at the time) or the parking garage next block over. We walked over to the garage and found the restrooms closed there too. We had already ordered hot drinks with boba, but they don't even have any spoons to get the boba with, so we had to drink hot milk tea with boba out of a straw.

excerpts: Considering the area/district, and that this is hand made milk tea in a reusable glass bottle (which is the only tapioca place, so far, that does this), I'd say prices are somewhat reasonable.

Got the Thai ice milk tea w/aloe; even after about 30 mins., when the ice melted, the flavor didn't dilute and still had that Thai tea flavor (like a Thai tea should taste); I also like how my drink stayed cold after making a pit stop to grab a quick lunch before I headed back to MUNI.
Will be back, but it won't be a constant thing.
milk tea.author: Jessica S.
milk tea.review:
I gave it 4 stars because Plentea is located in an area for people who are already in the financial district, downtown/union square, and/or Chinatown; plus, to make the trip across town, just to grab tapis, is not worth it.  Since I didn't have to work, I decided to ride MUNI to check out the hype.  Considering the area/district, and that this is hand made milk tea in a reusable glass bottle (which is the only tapioca place, so far, that does this), I'd say prices are somewhat reasonable.  Perfect location as it is in the middle of a block of restaurants, and people can grab drinks back to their workplaces.

Came here just in time, right at the beginning of the lunch rush, so I waited about 5 - 8 minutes for my order.  Got the Thai ice milk tea w/aloe; even after about 30 mins., when the ice melted, the flavor didn't dilute and still had that Thai tea flavor (like a Thai tea should taste); I also like how my drink stayed cold after making a pit stop to grab a quick lunch before I headed back to MUNI.  Will be back, but it won't be a constant thing.

excerpts: The milk tea, however, was pretty good.
Just not worth the steep price without the glass :(
But with the $1 teaways gone and Quickly's being terrible, and Purple Kow far from my house and with long lines...
searching for another place has begun.
milk tea.author: Aly A.
milk tea.review:
As other reviews have clearly stated-it's ALL ABOUT THAT GLASS!  I just wanted, just ONCE, to try expensive, over-priced boba in a little glass that I could keep.  Alas, for whatever reason, I was given a plastic cup...(maybe they ran out of glass already that day??)

So much disappointment.  The milk tea, however, was pretty good.  Just not worth the steep price without the glass :(  But with the $1 teaways gone and Quickly's being terrible, and Purple Kow far from my house and with long lines...searching for another place has begun.

excerpts: I had the milk tea and the thai tea and my boyfriend had the taro milk and something else
milk tea.author: Shayla S.
milk tea.review:
SO good. If I lived in San Francisco I would come here frequently. I had the milk tea and the thai tea and my boyfriend had the taro milk and something else I can't remember...

Very good and fresh. Also LOVE the bottles. They make a great souvenir from SF. A bit pricey compared to other bubble tea drinks, but worth it.

excerpts: The regular oolong milk tea was so great!
So was the peach oolong with aloe vera yum!!
milk tea.author: Wendy T.
milk tea.review:
I LOVED the Oolong Crema with 30% sugar and herbal jelly!! The creme itself tasted divine!!! I wished they are closer but I guess you can't have everything =)
The regular oolong milk tea was so great! So was the peach oolong with aloe vera yum!!

excerpts: Solid milk tea.
The fresh fruit teas (with actual bits of fruit in it) are refreshing on hot days, which we've had quite a few of recently in the city.
milk tea.author: Andrea L.
milk tea.review: Of course I mainly came for the glass bottle. :) But they're also a good solid boba tea spot. Firm, chewy boba. Good, strong tea taste. Solid milk tea. The fresh fruit teas (with actual bits of fruit in it) are refreshing on hot days, which we've had quite a few of recently in the city.

excerpts: The reg black milk tea was okay
, didn't hit the spot.
"Went wild" and tried the salt crema oolong --ooNO.
Gave it to shots
and I'm done.
milk tea.author: Melody T.
milk tea.review:
Things to know:
There is always a long line. 
It's small and cramped and noisey. Squished and uncomfortable waiting for your drink. 
They up-charge you for tapioca and any other toppings. 
You can opt for a non-glass cup and save 50cents. 
Tapioca texture is actually okay, chewing slightly too soft not bad. 
The reg black milk tea was okay, didn't hit the spot. 
"Went wild" and tried the salt crema oolong --ooNO. 
Gave it to shots and I'm done.

excerpts: Came here to grab some cold oolong milk tea.
Milk tea was okay, although there was too much ice, and it was quite pricey.
milk tea.author: David L.
milk tea.review:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 3

Came here to grab some cold oolong milk tea. Milk tea was okay, although there was too much ice, and it was quite pricey.

excerpts: I got the peach black tea with lychee jelly and tapioca, while my sister got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca.
The peach tea was alright, a little more bitter than how normal places make it, but it wasn't bad.
The tapioca here is good!
My sister's drink, the brown sugar iced milk, was super good
and I definitely recommend it!
It's one of their most popular drinks and I understand why!
That's probably what I'll be getting next time.
Also, their iced drinks come in really cute glass jars that can be capped and you get to keep!
milk tea.author: Yvonne L.
milk tea.review: I've heard about this place for a while and I thought I'd be disappointed because of how hyped up it was, but Plentea turned out to be good. The line was pretty much to the door when I got there but the service was fast and we got our drinks only a couple minutes after we ordered! I got the peach black tea with lychee jelly and tapioca, while my sister got the brown sugar iced milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca. The peach tea was alright, a little more bitter than how normal places make it, but it wasn't bad. The tapioca here is good! My sister's drink, the brown sugar iced milk, was super good and I definitely recommend it! It's one of their most popular drinks and I understand why! That's probably what I'll be getting next time. Also, their iced drinks come in really cute glass jars that can be capped and you get to keep! :)

excerpts: Got almond milk tea and Nutella tea and both were very good.
Love the glass bottles and definitely worth the little extra price.
Nice decor and will come back.
Friendly service and very clean.
milk tea.author: Henry H.
milk tea.review:
Got almond milk tea and Nutella tea and both were very good. Love the glass bottles and definitely worth the little extra price. Nice decor and will come back. Friendly service and very clean. Will return. 

Ps. Best music ever. Think Britney+nsync.

excerpts: The drinks themselves are pretty good, I tried just the black milk tea without boba and it was decent.
It wasn't too sweet or too bitter, and it gave me a really good caffeine kick.
The only problem was that the drink was a little too warm for my taste.
milk tea.author: Revati V.
milk tea.review:
I love the bottles that the drinks come in. Plus, if you bring in your bottle on your next visit, you can get a discount on your new order. 

The drinks themselves are pretty good, I tried just the black milk tea without boba and it was decent. It wasn't too sweet or too bitter, and it gave me a really good caffeine kick. The only problem was that the drink was a little too warm for my taste.

excerpts: Would not recommend to other people unless you have 20+ mins of spare time to get an overpriced milk tea drink.
milk tea.author: Mel P.
milk tea.review:
Waited 15 mins in line and I couldn't wait any longer so I had to leave. 
Would not recommend to other people unless you have 20+ mins of spare time to get an overpriced milk tea drink.

Highly disappointed and not coming back.

excerpts: The milk tea itself is decent, the boba soft, and the bottle super cool.
The menu is pretty limited, but that's not always a bad thing if it's executed well.
We ordered the Coffmilk Tea and the Green Milk Tea.
The coffmilk is just a coffee milk tea, with good coffee flavor.
The green milk tea was decently strong in tea flavor.
I just wasn't wowed by the flavor profile with either drink.
I probably should have been more adventurous and gone for the sea salt crema tea or coffee, but I don't get to drink SF grade boba very often anymore, so I have to get my fill when I can.
There's a yelp discount which was helpful, but I honestly hate places that charge for toppings.
It just feels very stingy and the original prices really aren't cheap.
milk tea.author: Karen C.
milk tea.review:
Have to admit, I was enamored by those cool milk bottle-esque glasses that the drinks come in. But in the end, that's where the obsession stops. The milk tea itself is decent, the boba soft, and the bottle super cool. The menu is pretty limited, but that's not always a bad thing if it's executed well. We ordered the Coffmilk Tea and the Green Milk Tea. The coffmilk is just a coffee milk tea, with good coffee flavor. The green milk tea was decently strong in tea flavor. I just wasn't wowed by the flavor profile with either drink. I probably should have been more adventurous and gone for the sea salt crema tea or coffee, but I don't get to drink SF grade boba very often anymore, so I have to get my fill when I can. There's a yelp discount which was helpful, but I honestly hate places that charge for toppings. It just feels very stingy and the original prices really aren't cheap. Guess you're paying a premium for the bottle! 

And oh, that bottle that I was so excited to add to my collection? Cracked after one use.

excerpts: I ordered the strawberry black tea with boba which also included strawberry bits and my mom ordered the coffee milk tea with boba.
Unfortunately they had just ran out of boba, and it took at least 20 minutes for them to make more!
, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us.
Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return.
At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?
, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us.
Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return.
At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?
milk tea.author: Simone M.
milk tea.review:
When my mom and I walked up the line was out the door and for the next hour or so we were in there, there was a steady stream of people coming in and going out. The menu was pretty impressive, with a large selection of milk teas, fruity teas, flavored milk, and plenty of toppings to go with it all. Tucked away at the bottom right corner of the menu was a good selection of snacks, including Takoyaki.

I ordered the strawberry black tea with boba which also included strawberry bits and my mom ordered the coffee milk tea with boba. Unfortunately they had just ran out of boba, and it took at least 20 minutes for them to make more! If I didn't have good company with me, I wouldn't have wanted to stick around and wait, especially being that the place is so small. 

Drinks were okay, the strawberry black tea was a little too sweet and the coffee milk tea was not sweet at all, but after letting them know they were happy to accommodate us. Glad I tried Plentea, but I won't return. At least I got a cool glass bottle to bring home with me, right?

excerpts: I had the black milk tea when I came the first time and
this time I got the strawberry green tea with chia seeds and it has fruit bits in it which makes it really delicious .
It's kinda pricey
but it's really cute
:3 haha worth it every time I'm in sf
milk tea.author: Shirley B.
milk tea.review: Second time here and it's so cute !! I love the glass bottle they give and when you bring it back you get a discount ! I had the black milk tea when I came the first time and this time I got the strawberry green tea with chia seeds and it has fruit bits in it which makes it really delicious . It's kinda pricey but it's really cute :3 haha worth it every time I'm in sf

excerpts: I bought 3 drinks (Taro, Milk Tea, & Coffee Milk Tea) which came out to about almost $18, so it is kind of pricey.
The milk tea is OK.
It's not like Tapioca Express or Quickly milk tea, it's more of the tea, tea type milk tea (similar to a Tea Stations).
And the Coffee Milk Tea was just gross.
It was so watered down
I ended up giving it away to my friend
we met up with.
The milk tea spots around there are probably better tasting.
So unless you want that glass bottle, I don't recommend coming if you're craving a bomb ass milk tea.
milk tea.author: Asia C.
milk tea.review:
I was honestly really excited to come here for my first time and the hype behind the famous glass bottled milk teas.... But all it is, is a hype. 

I bought 3 drinks (Taro, Milk Tea, & Coffee Milk Tea) which came out to about almost $18, so it is kind of pricey. You're basically paying for the glass bottle. 

The taro was like fresh taro, wasn't all that good to me. My boyfriend ended up throwing the rest away. The milk tea is OK. It's not like Tapioca Express or Quickly milk tea, it's more of the tea, tea type milk tea (similar to a Tea Stations). And the Coffee Milk Tea was just gross. It was so watered down I ended up giving it away to my friend we met up with. Didn't even care about the glass bottle at that point.

Overall, probably not coming back again. The milk tea spots around there are probably better tasting. So unless you want that glass bottle, I don't recommend coming if you're craving a bomb ass milk tea.

excerpts: Great boba thai milk tea and cute glass bottles.
$10 minimum credit card purchase, so bring cash.
milk tea.author: Aileen d.
milk tea.review: Walking distance from our timeshare which makes this place convenient. Great boba thai milk tea and cute glass bottles.  $10 minimum credit card purchase, so bring cash.

excerpts: I attempted to order the Iced Milk Tea with Tapioca because that is usually how I guage the quality of a boba place, by the quality of the most standard drink.
They ran out of boba!
WTF!
A boba place with no boba?!
That's like KFC running out of chicken (which did happen to me one time)!
I settled for the pudding instead.
The Iced Milk Tea flavor was very watered down and wasn't very strong.
I didn't get that "oomph" tea taste.
The pudding tasted grainy and not smooth.
I didn't think the quality was very good, maybe because the end of the day and it's towards closing time.
milk tea.author: Janny S.
milk tea.review:
We came here at 10:15pm on a Saturday night and it was still crowded with tons of hipsters. I figured people wanted to come just to get the novelty glass jars. This place is banging with customers mainly because of their competitive selling point - fancy glass jars with their business name exclusively imprinted on the jars. I felt skeptical, but I too fell victim to the novelty item. Haha! I begged my boyfriend to bring me here. I attempted to order the Iced Milk Tea with Tapioca because that is usually how I guage the quality of a boba place, by the quality of the most standard drink. They ran out of boba! WTF! A boba place with no boba?! That's like KFC running out of chicken (which did happen to me one time)! I settled for the pudding instead. There were 3 people working and they get slowed down when people order the blended drinks. 

The Iced Milk Tea flavor was very watered down and wasn't very strong. I didn't get that "oomph" tea taste. The pudding tasted grainy and not smooth. I didn't think the quality was very good, maybe because the end of the day and it's towards closing time. But still, quality shouldn't be compromised at any time. 

My boyfriend ordered the Honeydew Fresh Milk and it was way too sweet. I feel like I need to come back again during the day and get the tapioca so I can give it a less biased review! They also have waffles which sounded really good from the description on the menu.

excerpts: Instead I just got the red milk tea with pudding and aloe jelly.
1/4 of my glass was filled with ice and the rest was the drink.
You don't get too much to drink, but hey you get to keep this cute plentea souvenir cup!
milk tea.author: Cindy D.
milk tea.review: I wanted to try this place for a while. They ran outof the brown sugar milk and tapioca. I was looking forward to trying the brown sugar milk too. How can a boba place run out of tapioca ? Instead I just got the red milk tea with pudding and aloe jelly. 1/4 of my glass was filled with ice and the rest was the drink. You don't get too much to drink, but hey you get to keep this cute plentea souvenir cup! :)

excerpts: In my opinion,  the prices are a bit high for milk tea
but then again it is FiDi...
so it's expected.
With the increase in boba milk tea enthusiasm in SF, I think all the other new milk tea cafes should catch on to the glass bottle service.
milk tea.author: Elisha Y.
milk tea.review:
The 4 stars are primarily for the glass bottle that they give you the drink in.

In my opinion,  the prices are a bit high for milk tea but then again it is FiDi...so it's expected.  I ordered the thai iced tea and it was a little sweeter than I'm used to but still enjoyed it.

This place is pretty great because they are open until 11pm and play top 40 music and the staff was friendly. 

They also keep a bucket of plastic tops on the counter if you want to take your drink to go and so you can reuse your bottle for other beverage purposes. With the increase in boba milk tea enthusiasm in SF, I think all the other new milk tea cafes should catch on to the glass bottle service. Embrace your inner SF environmentalist!

I have to go back for another cap since my dog chewed mine up...so this time I may grab 2.

excerpts: Pretty good milk tea and nice glass jugs.
I've been here twice and got the matcha green milk tea the first time, then the normal milk tea with grass jelly.
Really like the grass jelly, which is a bit sweet.
milk tea.author: Charles G.
milk tea.review:
Pretty good milk tea and nice glass jugs. I've been here twice and got the matcha green milk tea the first time, then the normal milk tea with grass jelly. Really like the grass jelly, which is a bit sweet. Kind of expensive for boba though.

$10 limit on credit cards, which is a shame, but if you're with someone else 2 drinks comes out to just over $10 with tax.

excerpts: Either I got the ice black milk tea with 50% sweetness.
It was still sweet, but I usually like my drinks less sweet, so
if I do go again I'll get like 25% sweetness.
The drink itself was still good though!
The pearls were really good.
I'm pretty picky on my pearls and like them on the chewier side.
These pearls were chewy and sweet.
milk tea.author: Lydia K.
milk tea.review: I work in the city and took the wrong bus.  So while walking back to the Caltrain station I decided to stop by Plentea because it was on my way.  When I went, there were no glass bottles left.  I'm not going lie I was disappointed and the 10% didn't really make up for it, it was still $5.  Either I got the ice black milk tea with 50% sweetness.  It was still sweet, but I usually like my drinks less sweet, so if I do go again I'll get like 25% sweetness.  The drink itself was still good though!  The pearls were really good.  I'm pretty picky on my pearls and like them on the chewier side.  These pearls were chewy and sweet.

excerpts: Very tasty milk tea.
The most attractive part is their bottles, which can be used for air plants.
We tried Thai, Fruit, Mocha and they all tasty.
milk tea.author: Daming L.
milk tea.review: Very tasty milk tea. The most attractive part is their bottles, which can be used for air plants. We tried Thai, Fruit, Mocha and they all tasty.

excerpts: I just went for the greentea milk tea with tapioca.
Confused as heck, I took a sip to find out it truly was a green tea milk tea.
milk tea.author: Tina Y.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is quite uniquely known for giving their drinks in a glass bottle. Not gonna lie, that was probably the reason why I was attracted to this place after seeing pictures and reviews on yelp while visiting the bay area.  Located in the busy downtown of union square, you'd think that people wouldn't want to carry around a heavy glass of boba, but boy was I wrong! Even at 3pm, the lines were long, and I had to wait around 15 minutes before ordering.

They seem to sell not only bobas, but just regular tea (Plentea...hehe.) and some other yummy bites like waffles. I just went for the greentea milk tea with tapioca. 

-Greentea Milktea: I expected some kind of green colored drink in a bottle, but what I got was a coffee colored drink. Confused as heck, I took a sip to find out it truly was a green tea milk tea. I guess I was so used to the powder matcha flavored that I didn't expect the tea to taste actually, like greentea (which I appreciated)

For that I would give it a 4 star. Truthfully if it tasted like the regular artificial matcha greentea, I probably would have given it 3 star. But for sticking true to the flavors of the tea, I can appreciate it. :) Only downside is that it's quite pricey. $5+ for boba? 

You can bring back your bottle and get 10% off next time. Again, didn't think people would actually bring back used bottles since it's located in such busy financial district area, but I saw a lot of business employees in line during their break to grab some delicious boba. Good for you plentea!

TL;DR: Boba in glass bottle, kinda cool concept, expect lines, actual tea flavors, pricey 5+, cool if you're a tourist.

excerpts: The black iced milk tea tasted exactly what you'd expect from pre-made milk tea.
The tea flavor was barely noticeable, and the drink tasted overall watered-down.
You're better off going to Quickly's getting the same pre-made milk tea for half the price.
milk tea.author: Tanya A.
milk tea.review:
You'll pay "Plentea" of money here for a poor quality drink.

The line was out the door on a Sunday afternoon, but the wait wasn't long. Since all the milk teas were pre-made, drinks were ready by the time you finished paying at the register. You could even see the storage containers holding all the pre-made milk teas behind the counter and the staff simply pouring them into the glass bottles.

The black iced milk tea tasted exactly what you'd expect from pre-made milk tea. The tea flavor was barely noticeable, and the drink tasted overall watered-down. I'll give Plentea credit for not serving diabetes in a bottle though like other shops.

The glass bottles are branded with the store name, and they're an interesting novelty in the plastic cup-domnated bubble drink scene. They're far from making up for the hefty price tag of drinks here though. The 10% discount for bringing your bottle back is hardly worth it either, as you'll still pay at least $5.00 for your drink. I'll be using my bottle to hold all my drawing pencils.

I'm happy to have finally tried a boba shop everyone's been talking about, but I won't be going back. You're better off going to Quickly's getting the same pre-made milk tea for half the price.

excerpts: My partner ordered their black milk tea with boba and I had the lavender lemonade.
The tea was fine, nothing too memorable but good, but the boba was a great level of softness and sweetness.
The lavender lemonade was delicious.
I wish they had more seating, but the store itself is cute.
The service can be a bit off if there's a line, and the prices are expensive but the bottles are cute to keep!
milk tea.author: Nana S.
milk tea.review: My partner ordered their black milk tea with boba and I had the lavender lemonade. The tea was fine, nothing too memorable but good, but the boba was a great level of softness and sweetness.  The lavender lemonade was delicious. I wish they had more seating, but the store itself is cute. The service can be a bit off if there's a line, and the prices are expensive but the bottles are cute to keep!

excerpts: I really like boba milk tea and this place is definitely a top pick for me when I'm in the city.
milk tea.author: Mark L.
milk tea.review:
Cool place. Nice bottles, and very awesome drinks. 

Aside from the bottles, this place has some legit drinks made with real fruits. They grind it up before they serve it up. 

I really like boba milk tea and this place is definitely a top pick for me when I'm in the city.

Though you do kind of pay a higher price than other places though, maybe it is the bottle? But for the fresh fruits I think it is very worth it. 

The staff is friendly and the place is pretty clean. 

Make sure to try the sea salt and caramel. I know it sounds weird, but it is pretty freaking good.

excerpts: I got Taro Milk Tea w/ taro pudding, & i absolutely enjoyed it!
The quality was great and tasted like actual milk tea, not the cheap-watered down kind.
I could even taste the taro bits, which surprised me b/c you usually don't get the actual taro in those drinks.
The taro pudding was a delicious add-on as well.
In regards to the price, it didn't really bother me b/c
w/ their taro milk tea & would def come back if I'm around that area/craving boba
milk tea.author: Trina N.
milk tea.review:
I've heard about this place through friends so when I stumbled upon it, I had to try it out! 

I got Taro Milk Tea w/ taro pudding, & i absolutely enjoyed it! The quality was great and tasted like actual milk tea, not the cheap-watered down kind. I could even taste the taro bits, which surprised me b/c you usually don't get the actual taro in those drinks. The taro pudding was a delicious add-on as well. In regards to the price, it didn't really bother me b/c I don't get boba often

Overall, great first experience w/ their taro milk tea & would def come back if I'm around that area/craving boba

excerpts: Including the bottle and milk tea, the total came out to be around ~$6.
I got my usual, jasmine milk tea with pearls
but I thought it was pretty mediocre.
The milk tea was super watered down and the pearls seemed slightly uncooked.
My friend's drink had pudding in it and that tasted pretty good.
milk tea.author: Katie L.
milk tea.review:
Honestly, I went for the glass bottle. Including the bottle and milk tea, the total came out to be around ~$6. I got my usual, jasmine milk tea with pearls but I thought it was pretty mediocre. The milk tea was super watered down and the pearls seemed slightly uncooked. My friend's drink had pudding in it and that tasted pretty good. All in all, don't get the pearls and get the pudding!! 

The location is also pretty "meh." It was impossible to find parking nearby so we had to drive down a few blocks down and walk. 

Still, this place is good for pictures, if you're into that. I believe they offer discounts if you bring back the bottles.

excerpts: I feel like a milk tea place automatically gets 3 stars if I can customize the sugar level & if there's an option for soymilk or other alternatives to dairy.
Plentea gets an extra star on top of that just for the glass jar.
milk tea.author: Becky M.
milk tea.review:
I feel like a milk tea place automatically gets 3 stars if I can customize the sugar level & if there's an option for soymilk or other alternatives to dairy. Plentea gets an extra star on top of that just for the glass jar. Although it's technically not "free" it's just a good addition to their branding/marketing strategies. 

I got oolong tea with soymilk and the taste of soymilk was too strong that I couldn't really taste the tea but I can't blame anyone for that I guess. Their boba was decently chewy and sweet too!

excerpts: I would come back, I would recommend this to my friends and they give your milk tea in a glad milk jug, how cute!
milk tea.author: Jonathan L.
milk tea.review: Small joint. I dig it. Simple selection. Simple service. I would give an extra star if it had a bigger selection, if they blended there tea just a little more, I still tasted the ice bits in my drink. I would come back, I would recommend this to my friends and they give your milk tea in a glad milk jug, how cute!

excerpts: My SO got the Oolong Milk Tea
and I got the Thai Iced Tea.
Both were very good, but his was less sweet, which was something I preferred.
Be prepared for long wait times during lunch time!
milk tea.author: Kimberly P.
milk tea.review:
I came here with my SO earlier during the year, and we were surprised by how cute the shop looked.

The upstairs was closed, however, due to renovations; but that's alright, as we were only there for the boba.

All their drinks come in glass bottles (or if they're out, they'll give you a plastic cup), which are really cute and reusable!
If you come back with your bottle, you can get 10% off your order. Also, if you're coming in for the first time, you can check in for a 25% discount!

I'd have to take a star off, as it's pretty pricey (~$10 for two drinks). 
My SO got the Oolong Milk Tea and I got the Thai Iced Tea. Both were very good, but his was less sweet, which was something I preferred.
Be prepared for long wait times during lunch time!

excerpts: I've tried their Oolong Milk Tea with Boba as well as their dessert waffles.
The boba is pretty standard.
It's Ok.
milk tea.author: Christine D.
milk tea.review:
I've visited Plentea twice.  Their space feels clean and they have seating both downstairs and upstairs.  Their main attraction is the cute glass bottles that they serve their boba in.  Aside from tea, they serve a couple of sandwiches and desserts.  

I've tried their Oolong Milk Tea with Boba as well as their dessert waffles.  The boba is pretty standard.  It's Ok.  Their dessert waffles are pretty good, but what dessert isn't when there's whipped cream and nutella involved?  

There can be a long line and if there is be prepared to wait at least 20 minutes.  They have a minimum of $10 to use card and will give you 10% off if you remember to lug your old glass bottle back the store for more boba.

excerpts: I tried the brown sugar milk tea with taro pudding and it was delicious!
It might be a little sweet for a lot of people so get it 50% or 75% sweet!
I just loove when it's super sweet
so that's why I didn't decrease it.
Man that brown sugar taste though.
And the taro pudding YUM.
milk tea.author: Kelly T.
milk tea.review:
The jars are so adorable! 

I tried the brown sugar milk tea with taro pudding and it was delicious! It might be a little sweet for a lot of people so get it 50% or 75% sweet! I just loove when it's super sweet so that's why I didn't decrease it. Man that brown sugar taste though. And the taro pudding YUM. It was just perfect. 

Bring the jar back and get 10% off next time! I think the drinks are pretty pricey here though so I probably wouldn't frequent this place....yes even with the 10% off it is still pricey.

The place is pretty cute with the little upstairs area and it just seems kinda hipster. I like it!

Note: Cash only unless your order is above $10!

excerpts: I think the milk tea itself was pretty tasty, if it wasn't for the sugar problem.
milk tea.author: Alice S.
milk tea.review:
I really like the bottles-- I might buy them just for the bottles, they're cute and nice to have at home.  If I remember, I'll bring it back for a discount :)

Their milk teas are way too sweet-- they didn't offer any sweetness options, so i didn't ask.  Maybe if I did, they might be able to control the sugar levels?  It was completely caramel saturated, so it was kind of difficult to enjoy.

I'll still try it again though-- I think the milk tea itself was pretty tasty, if it wasn't for the sugar problem.

excerpts: I've tried the regular milk tea, oolong milk tea, and the coffmilktea, and my favorite is probably the coffmilktea - tastes like a hybrid between Starbucks' bottled coffee frap drinks and milk tea.
milk tea.author: Abby S.
milk tea.review:
I like the glass bottles, but wish they had a non-glass bottle option that was cheaper haha. The tea itself is pretty good, and I like that you can adjust the sugar levels down to 25% sweetness. I've tried the regular milk tea, oolong milk tea, and the coffmilktea, and my favorite is probably the coffmilktea - tastes like a hybrid between Starbucks' bottled coffee frap drinks and milk tea. 

The area upstairs is nice to chill in!

excerpts: BUT, I think the milk tea itself is pretty mediocre (Yes, like the T.I. song).
I was so excited when I went for the first time
and I thought it was going to be all rainbows and butterflies.
It was just normal milk tea with normal boba balls and normal tastes.
I wouldn't go a second time unless there was no more milk tea left in the world.
Or if there was only Quicky's.
milk tea.author: Sally H.
milk tea.review:
I don't get it. Is it the glass bottle that keeps people coming back? I mean the bottle is great and all and I can keep it as a drinking glass or flower vase. BUT, I think the milk tea itself is pretty mediocre (Yes, like the T.I. song). I was so excited when I went for the first time and I thought it was going to be all rainbows and butterflies. It was just normal milk tea with normal boba balls and normal tastes.

Oh yeah, be careful of the pricing. I bought two for $11 something and I was like O.O what?! how is it that expensive. Definitely on the pricier side. 

I would recommend trying it once for sh*ts and giggles and some cool glass bottles to keep. That is what the hype is about right. I wouldn't go a second time unless there was no more milk tea left in the world. Or if there was only Quicky's.

excerpts: Got two creama oolong teas with boba and one iced milk tea.
I liked the layers of cream on top, tea in the middle and boba in the bottom.
It was pretty sweet
so if you have a sweet tooth, this one is for ya.
The milk tea was ok, nothing too special, but their honey boba was warm and chewy, which was a plus.
milk tea.author: Sharon K.
milk tea.review:
This place has a cool concept, buy boba in their glass jars, bring it back to reuse and you get a discount. I likey! Too bad they were out of glass jars but they're supposed to have a full stock of them in July. 

Got two creama oolong teas with boba and one iced milk tea. I liked the layers of cream on top, tea in the middle and boba in the bottom. It was pretty sweet so if you have a sweet tooth, this one is for ya. The milk tea was ok, nothing too special, but their honey boba was warm and chewy, which was a plus. 

There's seating upstairs, which was neat. Luckily, we came during their down time so there wasn't a line out the door. 

Prices were average, $5-7? Not bad for this area. Enjoy!

excerpts: How I like my milk tea is definitely more on the tea flavor side
and so I got their Black Milk Tea with no boba.
The milk tea definitely got the tea part of the mix and it was not too sweet as other places.
milk tea.author: Patrick L.
milk tea.review:
Boba is a way of life.  Plenty of places to get boba and Plentea is certainly one of them.  Most of the boba establishments are often similar but when I first saw that glass bottle, I told myself "I MUST HAVE!"  Thus I gave Plentea a shot.

Food:
How I like my milk tea is definitely more on the tea flavor side and so I got their Black Milk Tea with no boba.  The milk tea definitely got the tea part of the mix and it was not too sweet as other places.  The taste can be comparable to places such as Tea Station and Sharetea and Plentea got my approval.

Service:
The service is pretty straightforward.  Order drink, pick size, and add any toppings.  I am completely indifferent with service as the drinks should speak for themselves.

Experience:
My experience at Plentea is pretty similar to other grab-and-go style boba places, but you cannot beat the fact that you get to KEEP a glass bottle that comes with your drink.

Judgment:
Plentea is definitely a place to drop in and grab yourself a drink if it is on the way.  It is on the pricier side for their drinks but you do get a discount for bringing that bottle back for your future drinks!

excerpts: When a place needs to ask you how sweet you want your milk tea, it's usually a sign that it's super duper sweet.
That was my experience coming here and ordering a basic milk tea at 100% sweetness.
The milk tea tasted super concentrated instead of super sugary sweet and I ended up with a headache for the rest of the afternoon.
Next time, I think I'll go with 50%.
milk tea.author: Virginia T.
milk tea.review:
When a place needs to ask you how sweet you want your milk tea, it's usually a sign that it's super duper sweet. That was my experience coming here and ordering a basic milk tea at 100% sweetness. The milk tea tasted super concentrated instead of super sugary sweet and I ended up with a headache for the rest of the afternoon. Next time, I think I'll go with 50%. At least it tasted like it was made from real tea leaves and not that Quicky-esque made from powder stuff. 

I've had a fruity concoction before which was probably ordered at 100% sweetness and its flavor intensity was definitely derived from sugar and not concentrated tea. 

$10 minimum card charge, 10% off your drink if you bring back a bottle (1 bottle per drink ordered). There will always be a moderate to long wait no matter what time you go.

excerpts: +Ordered an oolong milk tea w/ taro pudding.
The oolong isn't sugary sweet, it tasted mainly tea.
+Taro pudding wasn't too sweet either
so it didn't throw off the taste of my milk
rea.
+Service was really quick.
At first I didn't believe my drink was sitting on the table the whole time.
+Has an upstair sitting area great for group hangouts.
Not too tiny but enough to get around.
Just watch your step because the stairs are small.
+The price range for the tea quality and packaging (glass bottle) is reasonable.
It's usually around $2-4 if there's a lot of syrup or a lack of tea involved.
Plentea had quality and fresh-made oolong tea that you can actually tasted the smooth smokey fragrant of an oolong instead of the sugar sweetness alone.
It's usually a bargain to have more tea contents than milk/water/syrups at $2-4.
So $5-6 is a reasonable price range according to what I had from my oolong milk tea.
milk tea.author: Jackie T.
milk tea.review:
+Ordered an oolong milk tea w/ taro pudding. The oolong isn't sugary sweet, it tasted mainly tea. 
+Taro pudding wasn't too sweet either so it didn't throw off the taste of my milk rea. 
+Service was really quick. At first I didn't believe my drink was sitting on the table the whole time. 
+Has an upstair sitting area great for group hangouts. Not too tiny but enough to get around. Just watch your step because the stairs are small. 
+The price range for the tea quality and packaging (glass bottle) is reasonable. It's usually around $2-4 if there's a lot of syrup or a lack of tea involved. Plentea had quality and fresh-made oolong tea that you can actually tasted the smooth smokey fragrant of an oolong instead of the sugar sweetness alone. It's usually a bargain to have more tea contents than milk/water/syrups at $2-4. So $5-6 is a reasonable price range according to what I had from my oolong milk tea. 

-The tea tasted great, bad thing is the caffeine made me feel anxious and shakey after drinking it halfway. That's weird because I though oolong usually have lower caffeine contents than black tea. Maybe the staffs added it in a bit too much.

Next time I'll ask them to take it easy on the tea for me! Overall I'm looking forward to visit Plentea more often. 

*ahem, cute guy staffs are here too but they're not effected by my Yelp critism. Just saying for you ladies out there, haha*

excerpts: The offer all kinds of milk tea with glass bottles, which is really special.
(P.S.
The bottle can not hold hot water, or it will explode.)
I ordered milk tea(oolong) with grass jelly inside.
OMG!
It tastes so good.
It is just the same taste as Taiwan.
Really deserves a try.
milk tea.author: Nancy S.
milk tea.review: The shop is very popular. Lots of people are waiting there. The offer all kinds of milk tea with glass bottles, which is really special. (P.S. The bottle can not hold hot water, or it will explode.) I ordered milk tea(oolong) with grass jelly inside. OMG! It tastes so good. It is just the same taste as Taiwan. Really deserves a try.

excerpts: Ordered an oolong milk tea and by the time I was handed my receipt, my drink was ready!
Highly recommend.
milk tea.author: Amanda B.
milk tea.review: This place is delicious! I walked here on my lunch, at about 12:30 and it wasn't packed at all. Ordered an oolong milk tea and by the time I was handed my receipt, my drink was ready! Highly recommend.

excerpts: The attractively branded glass bottles that are yours to keep is an incentive that breaks stalemates between Plentea and any comparable milk tea merchant.
Nevermind the inadequately flavored drinks or the tapioca balls that have as much flavor as gum that has been chewed for three hours.
Forget the fact that the above average pricing means you are essentially paying for the bottle and offering free advertisement for Plentea.
milk tea.author: Andrew M.
milk tea.review:
Like our lunar guardian, everything that we love to do, eat, collect, and wear comes and goes in phases. Tie-dye shirts, stamps, roller-blading and aviator shades gave way to beanie babies, Old Navy anoraks, yoyos, and Game Boys. Some of these once-popular trends are gone for good, but others are raring to make a comeback at any moment. Right now though, our focus is on skinny jeans, succulents, and sipping from glass containers - and Plentea is thriving on that thirst.
 
The attractively branded glass bottles that are yours to keep is an incentive that breaks stalemates between Plentea and any comparable milk tea merchant. Nevermind the inadequately flavored drinks or the tapioca balls that have as much flavor as gum that has been chewed for three hours. Forget the fact that the above average pricing means you are essentially paying for the bottle and offering free advertisement for Plentea. Turn a blind eye to the obnoxious $10 minimum for credit card use that no lone boba buyer would reach.

Plentea offers a 10% discount towards a purchase upon a bottle's return, but who in their right mind would give up a sea salt holder, candle container, or makeshift vase? 

Anyways, despite Plentea's various shortcomings, GLASS BOTTLES!!

excerpts: The milk tea is ok.
milk tea.author: Qianren Z.
milk tea.review: The glass bottle is the nice point. The milk tea is ok.

excerpts: First off, the value here isn't that great; a fruit milk tea was 6.25.
Even if you bring back the jars they give you, it's still well over $5 for a pretty small tea.
It's more like a milk shake than a milk tea.
I would like it better if they incorporated more real fruit into it like Tea Era in Mountain View for instance, the gold standard for strawberry milk tea.
milk tea.author: Kevin T.
milk tea.review:
First off, the value here isn't that great; a fruit milk tea was 6.25. Even if you bring back the jars they give you, it's still well over $5 for a pretty small tea. Even something like making the drinks larger would help if drinks can't be made cheaper.

The sea salt crema in oolong has too much crema for me. It's too rich and I can't taste the tea at all. It's more like a milk shake than a milk tea. It's not bad if you like your drinks like that though.

I also tried the strawberry fruit milk. I would like it better if they incorporated more real fruit into it like Tea Era in Mountain View for instance, the gold standard for strawberry milk tea.

excerpts: And because it was my first visit, I opted to get a black iced milk tea with boba and pudding.
I always say you meed to order the original boba first to get a sense of the baseline.
I enjoyed it.
The boba texture was good - chewy but not too chewy and sweet but not as flavorful as others.
The milk tea was better - sweet, strong and ice cold.
milk tea.author: Marie B.
milk tea.review:
Finally made it to Plentea and I think Yelp got it right, a four-star venue!  I'm a fan, and I'll go again with my reusable glass bottle...gotta get that discount!

Saturday afternoon and the line was out the door...a couple doors down once a brilliant person in line decided to snake the line against the buildings (as opposed to blocking the sidewalk). After a lil over 30 minute wait, I was happy to finally order. 

And because it was my first visit, I opted to get a black iced milk tea with boba and pudding. I always say you meed to order the original boba first to get a sense of the baseline. I enjoyed it. The boba texture was good - chewy but not too chewy and sweet but not as flavorful as others. The milk tea was better - sweet, strong and ice cold. I added the (mango) pudding for good measure, it had a nice consistency and was sweet enough, but didn't add to the drink.

Nice my friend and I nabbed a two top upstairs. The venue itself isn't much to speak of but a tad nicer than the smaller boba shops. Our drinks were served quickly and by nice, smiley staff. I can't wait to go back to try fruit teas and with jellies, oh, and the cremas!

excerpts: I happened upon this place while I was looking for something small and wanted to try out their milk tea...
oh gosh, Best.
Decision.
I ended up getting two that day: black milk tea with boba and a crema with pudding.
I highly recommend checking them out if you're a fan of bubble/milk tea.
milk tea.author: Nicolette B.
milk tea.review:
I happened upon this place while I was looking for something small and wanted to try out their milk tea... oh gosh, Best. Decision. Ever!

The bottles are definitely cute, but their teas are awesome. I ended up getting two that day: black milk tea with boba and a crema with pudding. Both were just brilliant!

I highly recommend checking them out if you're a fan of bubble/milk tea.

excerpts: I got the thai milk tea with boba.
I thought it was okay
, I wish I got the more popular ones like the regular milk tea with the special whatevs.
milk tea.author: Liping H.
milk tea.review:
My friend Marie and I came here on a spontaneous boba craving, and it seemed like this was the only boba place that was open late at night. So we took a big ass trip from the Mission to Downtown.

It was worth it! Marie got mango green tea with boba. She appreciated the bits of mango in the drink.

I got the thai milk tea with boba. I thought it was okay, I wish I got the more popular ones like the regular milk tea with the special whatevs. But it wasn't horrible though! 

I mean, we were in the mood for boba, and this satisfied it.

The total was around ~$10. Not too shabby for a late night boba expedition.

Anyways, if you're getting a boba craving at night; Plentea is a pretty good choice.

excerpts: for the non milk tea lovers there is regular tea with fruit of choice to be added in to it to make it the fruit tea.
the milk tea selection.
consists of matcha milk tea, creme milk tea or the sea salt creme milk tea and choice of tea.
each drink may have the amount of sweetness adjusted.
to accompany the drinks, there is a simple menu of a few sandwiches and desserts on the black chalk board against the wall.
I loved this place!
uniquely done well.
only con, no restroom! !!!
milk tea.author: Jessica W.
milk tea.review: I was so scared coming even on a winter weekday praying that there won't be a wait going at a later time close to closing due to the reviews saying they waited 20 minutes in line! and we got lucky! it is so cute right when I walked in because there was upper level seating and all the tables were stool tables. all the drinks being in bottles got my friend and I so excited because it's a free souvenir we paid for, unlike a plastic cup we toss daily. drinks were about 6 bucks each after topping added.  I think it's quit a deal. the menu is very simple and I like that. there is the selection of oolong, green or black tea. for the non milk tea lovers there is regular tea with fruit of choice to be added in to it to make it the fruit tea. the milk tea selection. consists of matcha milk tea, creme milk tea or the sea salt creme milk tea and choice of tea. each drink may have the amount of sweetness adjusted. to accompany the drinks, there is a simple menu of a few sandwiches and desserts on the black chalk board against the wall. I loved this place!  uniquely done well. only con, no restroom! !!!

excerpts: Quite a standard milk tea location.
milk tea.author: Kevin L.
milk tea.review:
Quite a standard milk tea location. The cute thing is their jars - you get to take them home afterwards. 

Nostalgia points: Makes me feel like I'm back in high school.

excerpts: The milk tea itself was less than impressive it
just was not there for me , I am more into authentic Taiwanese milk teas and this was definitely not it.!
My bf tried the Nutella and its straight up
just chocolate milk ..
duh should of known there was nothing special about it.
On to the next milk tea place!
milk tea.author: T. C.
milk tea.review:
Cool over priced jar , save your money and get the darn jar at the dollar store.!
The milk tea itself was less than impressive it just was not there for me , I am more into authentic Taiwanese milk teas and this was definitely not it.! My bf tried the Nutella and its straight up just chocolate milk ..duh should of known there was nothing special about it. On to the next milk tea place!

excerpts: I order strawberry milk tea with lychee.
I like that they crushed the ice and and the drink was delicious.
Not too sweet for my liking.
What's enjoyed the most was probably the cute plentea bottle!
You get to keep it
and if you come back with the bottle, you get a 10% discount.
What a way to get the customer to come back!
I will definitely revisit...
With my cute plentea bottle!
milk tea.author: Ellen Z.
milk tea.review: Been wanting to check out this place for the longest time and since my little cousin came to visit, she also wanted to try it! As expected, the line was quite long but it went by pretty quickly. I order strawberry milk tea with lychee. I like that they crushed the ice and and the drink was delicious. Not too sweet for my liking. What's enjoyed the most was probably the cute plentea bottle! You get to keep it and if you come back with the bottle, you get a 10% discount. What a way to get the customer to come back!  I will definitely revisit... With my cute plentea bottle!

excerpts: This used to be my favorite boba tea spot in Bay Area, I love their fruit milk tea, super high quality drinks!!!
Now they're not available no more....
milk tea.author: Elaine L.
milk tea.review: menu changed when i came today... extremely disappointed. This used to be my favorite boba tea spot in Bay Area, I love their fruit milk tea, super high quality drinks!!! Now they're not available no more....

excerpts: I just had a regular black milk tea with boba.
It was just ok.
Had better elsewhere.
Im just not impressed at all.
milk tea.author: Vanessa W.
milk tea.review:
This place wasnt my favorite. They ran out of the glass jars, which I didnt even care for in the first place. Only good thing, they gave us a discount because they didnt have thr jars. 

I just had a regular black milk tea with boba. It was just ok. Had better elsewhere. Im just not impressed at all.

excerpts: My favorites are the mango black milk tea, the mango ice milk, the mango smoothie...
milk tea.author: Arianna N.
milk tea.review:
Okay, I'll admit, I'm a sucker for a cute bottle-- and don't even get me started on boba. So when I was strolling down the streets of the FiDi, I did a double take when I saw a group of strangers pass by sipping bubble tea in those adorable glass containers. Luckily they were kind enough to point me to Plentea, otherwise I would never have found my go-to FiDi spot for my (constant) boba cravings. 

The taste is pretty consistent-- not too sweet nor watery, and they use fresh fruit instead of the artificial-tasting powder that most other boba joints use. My favorites are the mango black milk tea, the mango ice milk, the mango smoothie... okay, pretty much anything and everything with mangoes. 

There's always a long line out the door, but don't worry as the service is pretty quick. Sadly, it's pretty pricey for boba (around $5)  and there's a $10 minimum card charge, hence the 4 star rating. Still, you get a 10% discount if you bring back your bottle which is kinda nice.

Long story short, I'd recommend stopping by if you're in the area. As for me, I see plen(tea) of Plentea in my future. :)

excerpts: The milk tea wasn't anything special, I've had better.
The peach smoothie was way better.
The boba is pretty good, chewy and soft.
It's also a little sweeter than other boba places
but I like it.
The glass bottles are pretty cool, kind of the only reason a lot of people come here.
Even with the glass bottle discount, it's still a little pricey.
milk tea.author: Rose B.
milk tea.review:
Let's start with the fact that the cashiers are always unbelievably rude. Simple questions are answered with attitude, and they rush you all the time. I know customer service can be extremely difficult at times but you shouldn't take it out on customers, especially if they didn't do anything to you. If you don't like being asked questions, they you shouldn't be working there and you should find a new job.  

Since all my coworkers raved about it, and it being so close I thought I'd give it a try. The milk tea wasn't anything special, I've had better. The peach smoothie was way better. The boba is pretty good, chewy and soft. It's also a little sweeter than other boba places but I like it. The glass bottles are pretty cool, kind of the only reason a lot of people come here. Even with the glass bottle discount, it's still a little pricey.

excerpts: I got the brown sugar milk tea with tapioca and egg pudding.
The tapioca was fresh but pieces were quite hard.
milk tea.author: Phillip D.
milk tea.review:
I'm not sure I understand the hype of this place just yet. This review is just for the drinks. 

Things I don't like: 
- No one knows how to order
- Lines are out the door "literally"
- Slow

Things I do like
- The bottle is eco-friendly and reusable (vs just using the "quickly style" tapioca cups
- They have tapioca, pudding and other "add-ons"
- They serve other things besides drinks (waffle sandwiches)

I got the brown sugar milk tea with tapioca and egg pudding. The tapioca was fresh but pieces were quite hard. The pudding was stuck at the bottom and I could barely get anyway until the end. 

The prices are kinda hefty (Mine was $5+) so it's definitely not cheap. Perhaps i'll like it the next time I visit but I'd rather go to a quickly-chain or just another Asian tapioca/boba place.

excerpts: I got the milk tea and it was okay..
drinks are okay here.
They have a pretty good drink selection though and got a good strategy on their part;  to put their drinks n those jars..it lures people like me in
milk tea.author: Phuong K.
milk tea.review:
I pretty much live off of boba. 

Even when traveling I still make it a point to get my boba.

Im sure most people come here because of the cute glass jars that the boba is served in; well that is why i went here. 

I got the milk tea and it was okay.. drinks are okay here. They have a pretty good drink selection though and got a good strategy on their part;  to put their drinks n those jars..it lures people like me in

excerpts: Such good milk tea!!
They give you super cute glass bottle.
It's was super busy so give yourself some extra time.
If you love bubble tea you have to try this!
milk tea.author: Maddie K.
milk tea.review: Such good milk tea!! They give you super cute glass bottle. It's was super busy so give yourself some extra time. If you love bubble tea you have to try this!

excerpts: and I ordered the Thai milk tea with extra tapioca.
When my fiancé tasted his, you can tell by the look on his face the drink was not good.
I decided to taste it and honestly it tasted NOTHING like lemonade.
It was gross.
He did want to make a big deal out of it so we left.
My sisters drink was ok.
The Thai tea was pretty good.
Overall I would not go out my way to come here again.
I think staff should be more friendly and attentive.
milk tea.author: Angelica G.
milk tea.review: Decided to drive around the city and stumbled upon this place. Super cute decor. The staff was pretty rude. We were the only ones inline and by the time someone decided to take our order the line grew to the door. It seemed like the girl taking our Oder just didn't want to be there. My fiancé ordered a Lavender Lemonade, my sister ordered the sweet taro drink and I ordered the Thai milk tea with extra tapioca. When my fiancé tasted his, you can tell by the look on his face the drink was not good. I decided to taste it and honestly it tasted NOTHING like lemonade. It was gross. He did want to make a big deal out of it so we left. My sisters drink was ok. The Thai tea was pretty good. Overall I would not go out my way to come here again. I think staff should be more friendly and attentive.

excerpts: The oolong milk tea is the most disappointing thing there.
No oolong Taste.
milk tea.author: Cynthia D.
milk tea.review:
The only thing good about this place is the bottle. The lid isn't right for the bottle. If you tilt it, even a little, the tea will spill. So if you are getting it to go, bring a bag. 

The oolong milk tea is the most disappointing thing there. No oolong Taste. The peach tea is a little too sweet. 

It's good to hve if you're in the area I guess.

excerpts: I often spot people walking around the Chinatown/financial district area with these stylish milk-jar glass bottles filled with milk tea and boba.
They are definitely eye-catchers and good marketing tools because it made me curious about where everyone was getting this fancy-looking boba drink.
Now every time I carry around a glass, I get asked all the time about where it's from.
They're pretty, which I give credit for, because, you know, we eat with our eyes too.
The drink itself is good-- just good and above average.
Their standard is not too sweet, so it's not one of those places where you have to ask for less sugar every time.
I can taste the freshness in their tea, but it sometimes has a slight bitterness to it, like over-steeped tea.
milk tea.author: Hannah P.
milk tea.review:
I often spot people walking around the Chinatown/financial district area with these stylish milk-jar glass bottles filled with milk tea and boba. They are definitely eye-catchers and good marketing tools because it made me curious about where everyone was getting this fancy-looking boba drink. Now every time I carry around a glass, I get asked all the time about where it's from. They're pretty, which I give credit for, because, you know, we eat with our eyes too. The drink itself is good-- just good and above average. Their standard is not too sweet, so it's not one of those places where you have to ask for less sugar every time. I can taste the freshness in their tea, but it sometimes has a slight bitterness to it, like over-steeped tea. Their boba is consistently tasty and delectably chewy. 

Wouldn't make it my regular boba spot though. Way too pricey for adequate bubble tea :(.

excerpts: I ordered a black milk tea drink with pudding but they forgot to add my pudding inside the drink and they still charged me the extra $0.50.
milk tea.author: Pariya N.
milk tea.review:
After seeing such cool pictures of plentea on Instagram and other social media I decided to come down to SF to give it a try.

It was around 7:30pm on a Monday & I was really excited once I entered the shop, because guess what?! NO LINEEEEE YAYAY.  

To be honest I was more excited about the glass than the drink itself after I got my order. 

I ordered a black milk tea drink with pudding but they forgot to add my pudding inside the drink and they still charged me the extra $0.50. But I still enjoyed the place because their glass cups are so cool and cute ^.^ 

overall I would come back to this place, but I think I'd rather try another drink next time.

3/5 stars because the drink I ordered was really watered down and I couldn't really get any flavor out of it. But the service was great & I loved how cute the shop was & I loved the glass cups!

excerpts: - milk tea was ok

(I prefer my tea a little stronger and my milk a little creamier)
- boba was a bit too soft (but appropriately chewy)
- DON'T LET
milk tea.author: Jiann M.
milk tea.review:
Pros:
- ADORABLE glass jars
- you save 10% if you bring back your jar
- save $ if you ask for a regular cup

Cons:
- milk tea was ok (I prefer my tea a little stronger and my milk a little creamier)
- boba was a bit too soft (but appropriately chewy)
- DON'T LET YOUR GLASS BOTTLE TOUCH HOT LIQUID (the bottom is weak and will fall out in the dishwasher)

Bottom line: I would totally come back to get a cute glass and to try a waffle. But I'll set my expectations lower for the tea.

excerpts: I got the classic milk tea with boba and my friend got the strawberry green tea.
Both were quite bland and watered down.
The boba was mushy and not chewy enough.
I thought it was a bit expensive since two drinks added up to $12.
milk tea.author: Gwingie L.
milk tea.review:
The glass is cute and they obviously invested a lot in the decoration and experience.  There was a short line on a Sunday afternoon but the service was quick and we didn't have to wait too long.  I really liked the atmosphere.

I got the classic milk tea with boba and my friend got the strawberry green tea.  Both were quite bland and watered down.  The boba was mushy and not chewy enough.  I thought it was a bit expensive since two drinks added up to $12.

excerpts: Loved the milk tea and boba!
Cool little place with lots of flavors to choose from and sweet desserts.
I tried to brown sugar milk tea with boba - SO yummy!
Another convenience is they serve dairy free milk tea, which is awesome for my lactose intolerant hubby.
milk tea.author: Genna D.
milk tea.review:
Loved the milk tea and boba! Cool little place with lots of flavors to choose from and sweet desserts. I tried to brown sugar milk tea with boba - SO yummy! Got a souvenir glass too. 

Another convenience is they serve dairy free milk tea, which is awesome for my lactose intolerant hubby.

excerpts: One of them ordered the Sea Salt Oolong Milk Tea but actually tasted like the ocean.
The nutella milk tea made my friend throw up, while the other drinks were mediocre at best.
Only good thing about this place is the cute jars I guess.
0/10 do not recommend!!
milk tea.author: Vincent L.
milk tea.review: My friends and I visited SF and stopped by here to grab some late night boba. One of them ordered the Sea Salt Oolong Milk Tea but actually tasted like the ocean. The nutella milk tea made my friend throw up, while the other drinks were mediocre at best. Only good thing about this place is the cute jars I guess. 0/10 do not recommend!!

excerpts: I got a fruit tea and the matcha milk tea.
Both were good and rich in flavor.
milk tea.author: Leanna W.
milk tea.review:
Only been here twice but both times I was pretty satisfied. I got a fruit tea and the matcha milk tea. Both were good and rich in flavor. The boba is also pretty good. 

The place itself is cute and quaint, small with a upper deck and some seating. Would come back again if it wasn't so far from where I live. This is also by far the most expensive boba place I've been to in SF.

excerpts: Love the fruit milk teas, nutella milk tea, and sweet taro milk tea.
milk tea.author: Julian S.
milk tea.review: Best boba I've ever had. Love the fruit milk teas, nutella milk tea, and sweet taro milk tea.

excerpts: The first time I came here, I got the hot black milk tea with boba in it.
Don't get hot drinks here...
Mine came in a coffee container, which wasn't exactly the experience I was looking for.
Nonetheless, the drink was still good.
The second time I came here, I got the cold peach oolong tea with boba in it.
The peach tea was AMAZING.
It was perfectly sweet, had little bits of peach in it, and the texture of the boba just amplified the drink.
It also came in the glass bottle and I'm definitely going to bring it back to get a discount on my next drink.
Also, be sure to have cash on you because they don't take debit or credit if it's less than $10!
milk tea.author: Hana K.
milk tea.review: I love this boba place. Yes, it's pricey but the drink and the glass bottle is well worth it. The first time I came here, I got the hot black milk tea with boba in it. Don't get hot drinks here... Mine came in a coffee container, which wasn't exactly the experience I was looking for. Nonetheless, the drink was still good. The second time I came here, I got the cold peach oolong tea with boba in it. The peach tea was AMAZING. It was perfectly sweet, had little bits of peach in it, and the texture of the boba just amplified the drink. It also came in the glass bottle and I'm definitely going to bring it back to get a discount on my next drink. Also, be sure to have cash on you because they don't take debit or credit if it's less than $10!

excerpts: I will consider this good milk tea.
They made milk tea with real tea not powder.
Beside tapioca, the egg pudding and taro pudding are good toppings to get.
milk tea.author: Danning X.
milk tea.review: I am naturally picky about bubble tea as an Asian girl. I will consider this good milk tea. They made milk tea with real tea not powder. Beside tapioca, the egg pudding and taro pudding are good toppings to get.

excerpts: Fave drink is the almond milk tea, but really you can't go wrong!
milk tea.author: Cecily D.
milk tea.review: BEST TEA IN THE WORLD!!! Such a fun place and a great place for tourists to go that locals actually go to too. Fave drink is the almond milk tea, but really you can't go wrong!

excerpts: Ordered oolong milk tea with pudding.
Delicious milk tea and free wifi.
Will definitely come again.
milk tea.author: Olivia G.
milk tea.review: Wonderful place! Ordered oolong milk tea with pudding. Delicious milk tea and free wifi. Will definitely come again.

excerpts: Milk Tea was okay
, it was really sweet...
milk tea.author: Emiko N.
milk tea.review:
Milk Tea was okay, it was really sweet...
Highly suggested to order drinks as less sweet.

Bottles are cute and reusable *\(^o^)/*

excerpts: It's just regular milk tea with boba, nothing special.
It's a good picture
I'll tell you that
but I'm not sure it's worth $5-6 for a drink.
Next time I come here, I'll probably try something different and bring my bottle as well.
Overall, the milk tea isn't bad.
milk tea.author: Vicky L.
milk tea.review: I think it's the jars that makes people coming back because the drink is pretty normal. It's just regular milk tea with boba, nothing special. It's a good picture I'll tell you that but I'm not sure it's worth $5-6 for a drink. Next time I come here, I'll probably try something different and bring my bottle as well. Overall, the milk tea isn't bad.

excerpts: One of the better milk tea/boba places I've tried.
The ordering process is a little slow because your barista (bobista?) takes your order and makes your drink.
The result is that the line tends to get a little long at busy times.
The wait is worth it, however, because the teas, milks, and slushed are pretty great.
They serve the teas in an old school glass milk bottle that you can return for a 10% discount or you can request it to go in a standard plastic cup.
milk tea.author: Calon L.
milk tea.review: One of the better milk tea/boba places I've tried. The ordering process is a little slow because your barista (bobista?) takes your order and makes your drink. The result is that the line tends to get a little long at busy times. The wait is worth it, however, because the teas, milks, and slushed are pretty great. They serve the teas in an old school glass milk bottle that you can return for a 10% discount or you can request it to go in a standard plastic cup. We tried the avocado with egg pudding and the Carmel ice milk with tapioca - both were good but the Carmel was dealt great.

excerpts: However after the hype of the jar wore off, I was actually disappointed by the milk tea.
It didn't taste enough like tea and was pretty plain.
Quality was mediocre.
It wasn't sweet enough or had enough tea flavor.
I also tried the brown sugar iced milk which was def better in quality than the milk tea so would recommend that over the milk tea.
Wouldn't recommended this place for the milk tea but would recommend if you want a pretty jar.
milk tea.author: Tiffany S.
milk tea.review:
My main reason for going to try plentea was for the cute jars without even thoughts about the actual tea. However after the hype of the jar wore off, I was actually disappointed by the milk tea. It didn't taste enough like tea and was pretty plain. Quality was mediocre. It wasn't sweet enough or had enough tea flavor. I also tried the brown sugar iced milk which was def better in quality than the milk tea so would recommend that over the milk tea. It was thicker but had much more flavor. 

Wouldn't recommended this place for the milk tea but would recommend if you want a pretty jar.

excerpts: I was so happy that it was far from watered down milk tea.
I definitely would advise getting this if you're unsure on what to get!
The only odd thing about it was that there was a LOT of boba leftover at the end.
But the boba in general is good!
I've been here on several other occasions and their milk tea and flavored fruit milks are solid.
milk tea.author: Leonna T.
milk tea.review:
The Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea is absolutely perfect. I was so happy that it was far from watered down milk tea. I definitely would advise getting this if you're unsure on what to get! The only odd thing about it was that there was a LOT of boba leftover at the end. But the boba in general is good! 
I've been here on several other occasions and their milk tea and flavored fruit milks are solid.

excerpts: We got 4 drinks from Plentea this time, mine was brown sugar milk tea with boba, which was so-so and too sweet even with just 50% sugar.
My coworker really loved her taro milk tea though - apparently it's made with real taro, I had a sip
and it's pretty good, and
I don't even like taro!
milk tea.author: Essie L.
milk tea.review: 2nd time having Plentea. The first time was disastrous, the drink was basically diluted milk with no tea flavor whatsoever. So why second time? We wanted to get boba guys and they were closed on a Tuesday. We got 4 drinks from Plentea this time, mine was brown sugar milk tea with boba, which was so-so and too sweet even with just 50% sugar. My coworker really loved her taro milk tea though - apparently it's made with real taro, I had a sip and it's pretty good, and I don't even like taro!

excerpts: I ordered a regular black milk tea and it came out to almost $5, which is fair considering you get to keep the bottle.
The drink was okay, very reminiscent of Fantasia's milk tea but slightly watered down and not as strong.
milk tea.author: Lena L.
milk tea.review:
Let's face it: the only reason I came to try this place was so that I can get their cute glass bottle! I ordered a regular black milk tea and it came out to almost $5, which is fair considering you get to keep the bottle. The drink was okay, very reminiscent of Fantasia's milk tea but slightly watered down and not as strong. I still liked it!

Why the 2 stars? The young lady taking my order was rude. No hello, no greeting, no smile. I came in 4 minutes before they distributed the next batch of bottles and asked if I could order now and wait for it. She rolled her eyes and said "I guess." The rest of her customer service was lacking and she continued to take my order with a snotty attitude. Didn't seem like she wanted to be there. 

If you don't care about how you're being treated, this place will be just fine and their tea is not bad. But my overall experience leaves me hesitant to make another return.

Also, how does a place that serves tea have no restroom?! D:

excerpts: Black boba milk tea:
I would say the milk tea tastes about average.
Still, it's refreshing to find a boba place that shows restraint in sweetening their milk tea.
milk tea.author: Andrew K.
milk tea.review:
Bottled boba is a unique concept, even for someone who grew in up in the 626.  Beyond the bottle is a respectable boba joint, using fresh ingredients at an above average price point (roughly over $5).

Black boba milk tea:  I would say the milk tea tastes about average. Still, it's refreshing to find a boba place that shows restraint in sweetening their milk tea. 

Honeydew milk: Delicious, with real chunks of fruit.

excerpts: I got the Strawberry Fresh Fruit Milk Tea
I think that was the name.
With lychee jelly.
It was so good!!!
A lot of people here are complaining about the price ...
but like... why?
You all pay 3-4 bucks for boba someplace else where they give you the cheap plastic-y cups with the cheap plastic top wrapper.
Here, you get to KEEP the glass bottles plus get the lids!
And here, the milk tea isn't syrup-y and super sweet.
It's just perfect.
milk tea.author: Alice H.
milk tea.review:
It's the best feeling every when you run into a place that you didn't plan on going to and it's like, the best place ever.

Me, my bf, and his friend were walking down the street when we came across Plentea!!! I've seen it on IG before, but never thought about coming, since we don't live in SF. Line wasn't that long when we went around 2-3pm ish.

I got the Strawberry Fresh Fruit Milk Tea ... I think that was the name. With lychee jelly. It was so good!!! A lot of people here are complaining about the price ... but like... why? You all pay 3-4 bucks for boba someplace else where they give you the cheap plastic-y cups with the cheap plastic top wrapper. Here, you get to KEEP the glass bottles plus get the lids! And here, the milk tea isn't syrup-y and super sweet. It's just perfect. You can even adjust the sweetness level if you tell them.

I'm definitely coming back!!!

excerpts: The taro milk tea is hands down the best I've had!
What differentiates Plentea from every boba shop on the street is that they use REAL taro.
Wait times can be a bit long, but service and product makes up for it.
Christine was awesome and really went out of her way to help me figure out what drink
I'd like, she even offered me samples.
The interior is also designed really nicely and the glass bottles are a unique touch.
Will definitely be back when I'm in the city!
milk tea.author: Sylvain U.
milk tea.review: The taro milk tea is hands down the best I've had! What differentiates Plentea from every boba shop on the street is that they use REAL taro.
