Wait times can be a bit long, but service and product makes up for it. Christine was awesome and really went out of her way to help me figure out what drink I'd like, she even offered me samples. The interior is also designed really nicely and the glass bottles are a unique touch. Will definitely be back when I'm in the city!

excerpts: Christine was very helpful and reccomended the green milk tea with the pearls.
That shit bomb and cute i like it 5 stars would visit again if im in the area
milk tea.author: Darren M.
milk tea.review: This was my first time at a tea shop in the united states. I had no idea which one to get. Christine was very helpful and reccomended the green milk tea with the pearls. That shit bomb and cute i like it 5 stars would visit again if im in the area

excerpts: I got a green tea milk tea with aloe.
It's not worth the addition, you barely get any.
The milktea is flavorless, it basically just tasted like water with a dash of milk/cream.
milk tea.author: Stacy C.
milk tea.review:
$5 for a watery milktea? Why!?

I got a green tea milk tea with aloe. It's not worth the addition, you barely get any. The milktea is flavorless, it basically just tasted like water with a dash of milk/cream.

excerpts: so I didn't want a full on milk tea, so I decided on the hot premium mountain tea -- oolong.
Service was pretty fast
and I got my tea in no time.
I really enjoyed the taste!
However, I thought the price was a bit on the high side: $4.25 plus tax for a small (not even close to being completely filled) cup of tea.
I mean, the tea was good, but it wasn't THAT good.
Hipster vibe and solid tea and service but likely won't be coming back.
milk tea.author: Beverly Y.
milk tea.review: Came here on a Thursday evening and it was lively but not too busy. I was getting dinner soon so I didn't want a full on milk tea, so I decided on the hot premium mountain tea -- oolong. Service was pretty fast and I got my tea in no time. I really enjoyed the taste! However, I thought the price was a bit on the high side: $4.25 plus tax for a small (not even close to being completely filled) cup of tea. I mean, the tea was good, but it wasn't THAT good. Hipster vibe and solid tea and service but likely won't be coming back.

excerpts: I like how they have nutella milk tea, something a lot of places don't have.
I didn't get to try the food but
since the appeal of this place seems to be the bottle, I probably didn't miss much.
The boba itself is pretty nice and chewy.
milk tea.author: Allan Y.
milk tea.review: The line is long but the wait time isn't too bad. They get your drinks out to you very quickly even though there's a lot of people. In terms of drink quality, this place would get 3 stars but because of the utility of the glass bottle they give you, I give it an extra star. The drinks aren't anything special and the variety is a bit lacking. I like how they have nutella milk tea, something a lot of places don't have. I didn't get to try the food but since the appeal of this place seems to be the bottle, I probably didn't miss much. The boba itself is pretty nice and chewy.

excerpts: However, this place has amazing milk tea, not overly sweet or fake tasting.
Some of the comments call the tea bitter, which I understand if you are comparing it to Quickly's super sweetened teas.
Only downside is the cost- $5.44 for a milk tea with boba.
But you do get to keep the glass, and get a discount upon returning with the bottle.
Seeing how I usually pay around $4 for milk teas at quickly, the extra $1.44 is not the worst thing in the world.
milk tea.author: Allison H.
milk tea.review:
So I very rarely take the time to write reviews, but this place is definitely worth it.  I have been searching for a place with great milk teas ever since moving to San Francisco 3 years ago.  I never enjoyed the super sweetened teas from Quickly and the like.  However, this place has amazing milk tea, not overly sweet or fake tasting.  Some of the comments call the tea bitter, which I understand if you are comparing it to Quickly's super sweetened teas.  So it's probably based on each person's preference.  

The boba is also super fresh.  I am not a fan of boba that basically breaks in two once you bite into it.  I prefer soft, chewy boba.  And this place lived up to my expectations.

Only downside is the cost- $5.44 for a milk tea with boba.  But you do get to keep the glass, and get a discount upon returning with the bottle.  Seeing how I usually pay around $4 for milk teas at quickly, the extra $1.44 is not the worst thing in the world.

excerpts: I got the standard Black Milk Tea with Boba.
The tea itself was very good and tasted authentic.
The boba was sweet, soft and chewy!
Excellent texture.
My girlfriend got the same except instead of boba she got pudding.
The pudding was good as well!
It wasn't too sweet, like other places.
milk tea.author: Christopher Y.
milk tea.review:
I'm not going to lie...I came here for the cute bottle, even though I told myself I wouldn't.

Another gimmick? Perhaps. But it works.

Plentea is located in Chinatown and is a small cute little establishment. They even have an upstairs with more seating! Yay!!!

The workers here and extremely friendly and they will answer any questions if you have them.

The drinks are a bit overpriced but it is understandable because you get to keep the bottle! The bottle even has their name on it!! But the best part is that they give you a discount if you bring back their bottle.

I got the standard Black Milk Tea with Boba. The tea itself was very good and tasted authentic. The boba was sweet, soft and chewy! Excellent texture. My girlfriend got the same except instead of boba she got pudding. The pudding was good as well! It wasn't too sweet, like other places. This can be a problem if the pudding overwhelms the drink itself. 

All in all, the drinks we had were very good. If the standard drinks were this good, I can imagine the other drinks being delicious as well. They also offer Tea Cremas, Fruit Teas, Waffles and Sandwiches. I will be sure to be back to try it all!

My only problem with this place is that there may be a long line and it could take awhile. I definitely had to wait 15-20 minutes to place an order and get my drink. Also, there seems to be a lack of seating but that is due to popularity.

excerpts: I just got a regular jasmine milk tea and my bf got the peach green tea and both tasted good.
Did I mention they serve their drinks in cute glass cases?
Haha
milk tea.author: Esther L.
milk tea.review: I really like plentea!! I didn't expect it to be that great but it was way better than I thought. I just got a regular jasmine milk tea and my bf got the peach green tea and both tasted good. Did I mention they serve their drinks in cute glass cases? Haha

excerpts: I am not a huge fan of milk tea
so maybe it didn't appeal to me.
milk tea.author: Rosanna T.
milk tea.review: This is my third time at Plentea and yet I am still not sure how I feel about this place. I like that they give you the option of substituting with soy milk as well as sweetness levels. I ordered the Matcha Green Tea with soy milk unsweeten with tapioca pearls. It was good. The tea tasted fresh but the pearls could have been a little bit softer, other than that no complaints. I am not a huge fan of milk tea so maybe it didn't appeal to me.

excerpts: Verde in south bay has much better milk tea.
My friend got a regular milk tea with tapioca.
Got the matcha milk tea.
I couldn't taste anything matcha out of it honestly.
milk tea.author: Ruxin H.
milk tea.review:
This review is generated from 2 visits and both of them were awful
Came here mainly for the glass bottle  honestly. Verde in south bay has much better milk tea. Line was long and the wait was about 30 min around 2pm on Sat. 

The owner/cashier recommended the sea salt oolong crama. The name was pretty accurate as the tea was sweet and salty. However, they put syrup on the side on the bottle so that you couldnt really stir the syrup with tea. 

My friend got a regular milk tea with tapioca. And they forgot to put tapioca in it. 

The second time when I came, they already set up the rule that they only gave out 300 glass bottles per day. Of cuz i didnt see the sign as before you could opt in to get the glass or plastic bottle. Who knows that they changed rule in a week.

Got the matcha milk tea. I couldn't taste anything matcha out of it honestly. Grass jelly was bland but the egg pudding was good.

I will never come here unless I am peer-pressured/forced to.

excerpts: My friends swear by their oolong milk tea and honey green tea.
So naturally, I ordered the sea salt oolong crema.
Which turned out to a major mistake on my end, over half the cup- plastic cup, I was one of the many unluckies* who didn't make it onto the VIP 300
milk tea.author: Ada C.
milk tea.review:
The notion of taking great social media pictures of these glass bottles from all angles supersedes reality of Plentea. Around 5 pm on a Monday, there's hardly a line, but they were already completely out of glass bottles (limited to 300 per day). However, they do offer a 20% discount on all drinks purchased in a plastic cup. Regardless, drinks are around 4 to 5 dollars each- pretty pricey.

My friends swear by their oolong milk tea and honey green tea. So naturally, I ordered the sea salt oolong crema. Which turned out to a major mistake on my end, over half the cup- plastic cup, I was one of the many unluckies* who didn't make it onto the VIP 300 list- was filled with cream "dashed" with an overly generous amount of sea salt, all sitting on top of heavily watered down oolong tea. 

I probably would've walked away a happier camper had I at least gotten that glass bottle so infamously plastered all over Facebook and Instagram. 

*unluckies- yes, it is a word I made up and regularly use to describe the unfortunate.

excerpts: Taro milk tea with real taro bits.
Yum.
Sweetness level just right.
The glass jar is quite an experience that sets it apart from other boba places.
milk tea.author: Raphael H.
milk tea.review: Taro milk tea with real taro bits. Yum. Sweetness level just right. The glass jar is quite an experience that sets it apart from other boba places.

excerpts: The milk tea here isnt all that, but I like the presentation =]
milk tea.author: Timothy N.
milk tea.review:
I go to this place every now and then since its close to my school.
The real upside to this place is the bottles you get tbh lol
The milk tea here isnt all that, but I like the presentation =]

You get your drinks in these cool glass (almost milk jug) like bottles, and you can keep em afterwards.

They have downstairs and upstairs seating too which is nice.

Just make sure to come at the right time to get bottles, cause they run out and then you'll just get it in a regular cup.

excerpts: ! hahaha), so I decided to try their caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding.
OMFG!!!!
But I for sure suggest the caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding.
milk tea.author: Eduardo R.
milk tea.review:
5 stars for taste and concept, -1 star for pricing! 

My go-to is usually an avocado smoothie, especially at pho restaurants. But this place charges $6.50! I know, I know.. SF/FiDi pricing, yadda yadda.. But still. C'mon. LOL 

Now that I've finished my short rant, this place is great. I didn't order the 'cado smoothie because I refuse to pay that much (after giving them so much yelp grief! hahaha), so I decided to try their caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding. OMFG!!!! Super friggin' delicious. 

It was so good in fact, that I clotheslined everyone in the long line to get up front and order another one. WWF style. Off the top rope. High Risk Maneuver!* 

They ran out of glass bottles, but are currently offering 20% off when served in a plastic cup. Great model, I approve. 

Overall, I like this place. I'll definitely come back and try other drinks. But I for sure suggest the caramel milk tea w/ custard pudding. You won't be disappointed! 


*I didn't really clothesline anyone, I swear. I'm actually a really nice guy. :P

excerpts:
a fresh fruit tea -- delicious and made with FRESH fruit!
 a milk tea -- so creamy yet light!
milk tea.author: Jane L.
milk tea.review:
The glass bottles are so cute and the drinks are delicious. You get to keep the bottles!!
I had...
 a fresh fruit tea -- delicious and made with FRESH fruit!
 a milk tea -- so creamy yet light!
Will definitely come back and will try to remember to bring my bottle for a discount!

They also seemed to have a special with an app dL where you could essentially get $15 worth of drinks for $free.99

excerpts: I also enjoyed their regular milk tea.
milk tea.author: NikO D.
milk tea.review:
I have a confession to make....We only came here because most nearby places were closed. We thought the bottles looked cool, but that it must be a gimmick to make up for average drinks. But hey, why not?

I'm so glad we decided to try it! I can't vouch for all if the drinks, as I have only tried 3 of them. But the ones I have tried were delicious! My personal favorites is the Creme Oolong Tea. I love that it is not overly sweet like so many other places. The "creme" is more like a whipped creme, or sweetened creme fraiche that sits on top of the tea. They advise you to not stir it in until you try each of the components separately. The tea is lightly sweetened and good on its own. But the sweet creme is truly amazing.  The Sea Salt Creme Oolong is good too. It really is a bit on the salty side, even for sea salt drinks, but you can ask for less sea salt creme. I also enjoyed their regular milk tea. 

If you bring back the bottles, you get 10% off. But I admit....I'm currently using mine as a vase! :)
If your order is under $15, they prefer cash.

excerpts: Rest assured, you'll get your average milk tea in a nice glass bottle in the afternoon if you choose to.
If you're like the new customer I saw at the counter today who was shocked that you needed to pay more than $5 for a bottle of tea, then you can opt for the discounted drinks in the plastic cup.
I prefer the classic black milk tea and less sweet.

If you're coming out of town just to try this, lower your expectations, have plans to stand in line with a friend who is fun and can keep you entertained, be prepared to pay about $5+ for a milk tea, and you'll be fine.
I, for one, cannot justify standing in line for an overpriced milk tea during my lunch hour.
By the way, I think it was my first time seeing a cashier drink boba milk tea in the middle of taking an order.
She had to hurriedly chew through the boba, covered her mouth before she could reply to the customer's questions.
I'm all for drinking water on the job
, that's fine and totally normal, but the quick chewing and attempting to speak that was quite a bit to watch.
milk tea.author: Shirlene K.
milk tea.review:
The bottles are back full time and we can continue saving the planet one glass bottle at a time. Rest assured, you'll get your average milk tea in a nice glass bottle in the afternoon if you choose to. If you're like the new customer I saw at the counter today who was shocked that you needed to pay more than $5 for a bottle of tea, then you can opt for the discounted drinks in the plastic cup. But let's face it, why are you waiting in such a long line if you're not getting the glass bottle?

I tried the sea salt crema everyone raves about. Personally didn't think it was mind boggling. The tea flavor was lacking, covered by the cream. I prefer the classic black milk tea and less sweet. They have 25%, 50%, 75% sweet options so the mild sweet tooth can be satisfied. 

I stay true to my original review. I give them 2 stars for the average milk teas and nice chewy bobas with a nice bottle. Originally I was going to give this 3 star with the glass bottles there all the time but after trying the other drinks, it's truly a 2-star "meh. I've experienced better" rating. 

If you are in a hurry, don't even bother coming. The line is almost always out the door. Sure it might be a short looking line but the wait is unexpectedly longer than you'd anticipate. If you're coming out of town just to try this, lower your expectations, have plans to stand in line with a friend who is fun and can keep you entertained, be prepared to pay about $5+ for a milk tea, and you'll be fine. I, for one, cannot justify standing in line for an overpriced milk tea during my lunch hour. On the rare occasions when I get off work early, I'll stop by again.

By the way, I think it was my first time seeing a cashier drink boba milk tea in the middle of taking an order. She had to hurriedly chew through the boba, covered her mouth before she could reply to the customer's questions. I'm all for drinking water on the job, that's fine and totally normal, but the quick chewing and attempting to speak that was quite a bit to watch.

excerpts: I think I really would have let myself pay $6 for plain boba milk tea.
milk tea.author: Macy H.
milk tea.review:
This place is so silly - I am not paying $5-6 for boba when I can get it for roughly $3 elsewhere!

The interior looks really cute and there's upstairs seating overlooking downstairs and the street, so I can see why people want to come and be a part of the ambience. The other factor that appeals to and lures you in is their cute glass jars. Well I am not buying, sir!

Apparently they only distribute 200 glass jars a day, and once they're out you get your drink in a plain ugly plastic boba cup. Luckily when we went, they were out of glass jars. I think I really would have let myself pay $6 for plain boba milk tea.

You have been warned! For us it was just a walk around the block but if you're investing time to drive into SF and come here, you'd better come early - before the  glass bottles run out. Without them there's no novelty and it's just plain ol' boring boba.

excerpts: Ordered the Oolong milk tea with boba.
$5 tea should not be remotely watery.
Sent my first glass back.
Got no ice in the 2nd glass and it still was slightly watery but better.
The killer was when they only filled the 2nd glass up 3/4 because i "drank abt that much of the first glass".
poorly made drinks.
milk tea.author: Brandon N.
milk tea.review:
Ordered the Oolong milk tea with boba. $5 tea should not be remotely watery. Sent my first glass back. Got no ice in the 2nd glass and it still was slightly watery but better. The killer was when they only filled the 2nd glass up 3/4 because i "drank abt that much of the first glass". poorly made drinks. customer service about the same.

what was the profit margin on 1/4 glass?

excerpts: Ordered the coffe milk tea and oolong milk tea, both with tapioca pearls.
The coffee was a bit strong for my taste, but the oolong was on point.
Liked the bottles but would have probably enjoyed the hot drink better in a different cup!
oh well
milk tea.author: Leslie H.
milk tea.review: Ordered the coffe milk tea and oolong milk tea, both with tapioca pearls.  The coffee was a bit strong for my taste, but the oolong was on point. Liked the bottles but would have probably enjoyed the hot drink better in a different cup! oh well

excerpts:
and like this place.. 

some things i've ordered:
-ice milk brown sugar w taro pudding: taste like filipino drink sago
-ice milk green/black tea w grass jelly
-sea salt crema milk tea

the glass bottles are cool but we never keep them.
milk tea.author: Raquel T.
milk tea.review:
i've been here a handful of times now and like this place.. 

some things i've ordered:
-ice milk brown sugar w taro pudding: taste like filipino drink sago
-ice milk green/black tea w grass jelly
-sea salt crema milk tea

the glass bottles are cool but we never keep them.

they also have food but i have yet to try them

this place is a-ok by me

excerpts: This made me really happy because most milk tea places don't let you take their glass/mason jars with you if it's a to go order.
The glasses even had covers so you don't spill
and if you come back with your jar I think you get 10% off.
I've been to a lot of milk tea places
and I am rarely satisfied.
The oolong sea crema was very creamy and had just the right amount of sweetness to it.
You could also taste the tea in the drink.
A lot of milk tea places now make drinks that taste like they've been sitting in a refrigerator in the back all day or is made from a powdered mix.
My drink reminded me of gong cha in milpitas or half and half down in SoCal, which is something I've been looking for in the sf area for awhile now.
Overall, a great milk tea place that I can't wait to go back to!
milk tea.author: Gayle G.
milk tea.review:
Rushed here during my one hour break between my classes and it was worth it. Parking was hard and I ended up having to pay for garage parking. But the tea here is worth it! I ordered the oolong sea crema with boba. It came in a cute little glass jar which we could take to go. This made me really happy because most milk tea places don't let you take their glass/mason jars with you if it's a to go order. The glasses even had covers so you don't spill and if you come back with your jar I think you get 10% off. (:

The drink itself was amazing. I've been to a lot of milk tea places and I am rarely satisfied. The oolong sea crema was very creamy and had just the right amount of sweetness to it. You could also taste the tea in the drink. A lot of milk tea places now make drinks that taste like they've been sitting in a refrigerator in the back all day or is made from a powdered mix. My drink reminded me of gong cha in milpitas or half and half down in SoCal, which is something I've been looking for in the sf area for awhile now. Overall, a great milk tea place that I can't wait to go back to!

excerpts: Their milk tea is just alright, but the cute glass jar that the milk tea comes in makes up for it.
What kind of bums me out, is that I have to carry this glass jar everywhere afterwards
and I feel bad throwing it out later.
milk tea.author: Carmen C.
milk tea.review:
CUTE JARS. that's like def the best thing about this place. Their milk tea is just alright, but the cute glass jar that the milk tea comes in makes up for it. What kind of bums me out, is that I have to carry this glass jar everywhere afterwards and I feel bad throwing it out later. I understand that you can bring it back next time and get 10% off, but if you're shopping in downtown sf, there is no way to carry a sticky glass bottle around all day.

Not bad to get your boba fix, but definitely have had better :)

excerpts: I tried their traditional milk tea, half sweet.
It was just ok.
Seemed very watered down
but I guess it's cool
I got to keep a nice glass bottle?
Their boba is very good tho but very sweet, so I'm glad my tea was half sweet otherwise it would be way too sweet for my Chinese pallet!
milk tea.author: Judy S.
milk tea.review: Always need to try a new place to see if I agree with all the hype.  I tried their traditional milk tea, half sweet.  It was just ok.  Seemed very watered down but I guess it's cool I got to keep a nice glass bottle?  Their boba is very good tho but very sweet, so I'm glad my tea was half sweet otherwise it would be way too sweet for my Chinese pallet!

excerpts: My boyfriend has his with milk tea and it was way too thick for my liking.
It was also on the pricier side of different places I've been in San Francisco, but like I said you can keep the bottle!
milk tea.author: Danielle B.
milk tea.review: I want to start out by saying that it's is only getting a 3 star rating only for the fact that you can keep the glass bottle your tea comes in! We stopped by here earlier today and enjoyed the loft area for sitting upstairs. It wasn't the best boba tea we got in town, but it was okay (I got the mango green tea with tapioca). The flavors in mine were a bit bland and all the tapioca was stuck together and hard to get through the straw. My boyfriend has his with milk tea and it was way too thick for my liking. It was also on the pricier side of different places I've been in San Francisco, but like I said you can keep the bottle!

excerpts: I had a green milk tea
and I was so disappointed.
My drink was watery and the green tea was very bitter.
Green tea is easy to steep too long and mess up
and I was sad that Plentea didn't make the cut.
My boyfriend, though, got one of those ice milks and he was it was okay.
It lacked flavor, to me, when I tried it and the boba was really soft and too well done.
Way to expensive for not so great tea.
milk tea.author: Katherine L.
milk tea.review: I was so excited to try this place out and get me one of those glass bottles! I had high hopes for this place. I had a green milk tea and I was so disappointed. My drink was watery and the green tea was very bitter. Green tea is easy to steep too long and mess up and I was sad that Plentea didn't make the cut. My boyfriend, though, got one of those ice milks and he was it was okay. It lacked flavor, to me, when I tried it and the boba was really soft and too well done. Way to expensive for not so great tea.

excerpts:
4/5 Taro Ice Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50 % sweet 
Variety:
We got the Brown Sugar Ice Milk and the Taro Ice Milk.
While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it.
I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area
and it's worth a try.
P.S.
i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!
While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it.
I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area
and it's worth a try.
P.S.
i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!
milk tea.author: Christiana C.
milk tea.review:
Drink of Choice: 4/5 Taro Ice Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50 % sweet 
Variety: 4/5 
Ambience: 3.5/5 (cute and a few tables up and downstairs, but busy busy busy!) 

One of those places that you see on your instagram/fb feed and have to try just once.. at least for the picture. We got the Brown Sugar Ice Milk and the Taro Ice Milk. While I prefer this Brown Sugar Ice Milk Tea over Shareteas, the Taro Ice Milk seemed to be more notable because of the taro pieces it had in it. I don't think I would ever crave Plentea and actually drive out of my way to get it, but this place is cute if you're in the area and it's worth a try. 
 
P.S. i love using these bottles for juicing/smoothies and they're perfect for flowers too!

excerpts: The milk tea is subpar, but the experience was wonderful.
I got the mango fruit milk-- the drink came in a glass bottle (which you can keep!)
and drinking the beverage was a wonderful.
The mango fruit milk had the same viscosity of milk, with chunks of real mango in it.
I will forever keep my Plentea glass bottle
:P
This place was expensive though....
I guess you pay for what you get.
milk tea.author: Stacey W.
milk tea.review: ! The milk tea is subpar, but the experience was wonderful. I got the mango fruit milk-- the drink came in a glass bottle (which you can keep!) and drinking the beverage was a wonderful. The mango fruit milk had the same viscosity of milk, with chunks of real mango in it. I will forever keep my Plentea glass bottle :P This place was expensive though.... I guess you pay for what you get.

excerpts:
, 
first heard Plentea, from my girls,

milk tea.review:
You see, I am just like you, 
just an average de rigueur azn, chasin' the next hype,

excerpts: My favorite is the Thai and Black milk tea with tapioca.
milk tea.author: Mariah T.
milk tea.review:
I love how they sell their teas in a glass bottle! When you bring your bottle back you get 10% off your drink (like how when you bring your own reusable coffee cup to Starbucks) 

The staff is really nice, helpful and friendly! This week they sold out of their jars and had to use the usual plastic cups but they let me know that I got 10% off because they had no more jars (which was really nice!)

My coworkers and I go their all the time and we have collected a pretty good amount of jars haha they're really cute and since I like collecting mason jars this was a nice addition lol but be very careful because they break easily. They may appear strong but when I was trying to rinse out my jar using the hot water (the boiling hot one you use to put in your cup of noodle at work) it shattered!

Anyways, the flavors are super delicious! The usual flavors and you can add any toppings to your drink. They could add more flavors but the basics are good enough for me! My favorite is the Thai and Black milk tea with tapioca.

I still have yet to try the other flavors but I've heard the honeydew melon is good!

I love this place! Definitely going to come back, since it is a couple blocks away from where I work :)

excerpts: Wanted taro milk tea
but they didn't have taro.
Tried the sea salt crema oolong tea, it was good but the crema part doesn't really mix with the tea so you get curdles towards the bottom of the drink.
Brown sugar milk with pudding tasted like sugar milk
, we wanted caramel
but they didn't have any caramel - just opened
and there's no caramel or taro??
Okay.
Mango oolong tea was good but they forgot to give us boba even though it was requested.
Ice milk tea was not good, something funky about the flavor
milk tea.author: Ryan L.
milk tea.review:
It's cool, but it's pricey for what it is. Wanted taro milk tea but they didn't have taro. Tried the sea salt crema oolong tea, it was good but the crema part doesn't really mix with the tea so you get curdles towards the bottom of the drink. Brown sugar milk with pudding tasted like sugar milk, we wanted caramel but they didn't have any caramel - just opened and there's no caramel or taro?? Okay. Mango oolong tea was good but they forgot to give us boba even though it was requested. Ice milk tea was not good, something funky about the flavor but I couldn't put my finger on it. 

Come here for the novelty of a cool glass that can second as a vase or something. Not worth the $5-6 for a drink, even for this area. Bring the glass back for 10% off your drink, that's equals a free topping - if they happen to remember to put it in.

excerpts: Got the iced black milk tea!
It's usually my drink test for each new tea place (besides T Pumps): if they can make it well, they've got a new fan.
Plentea's tasted fine, but it was incredibly average, and the boba was slightly hard/not chewy enough.
Ehhhhhhh.
Unimpressed face.
Roomies thought green milk tea and thai tea were alright, too.
The $5+ seems worth it because of the bottle, but the watery, lackluster milk tea reminds you that you are overpaying for this novelty.
Especially since Bobo Drinks just opened in Berkeley and they have cool embossed mason jars you can just buy for $1.
May have to come back to try a couple other flavors - and bring my bottle back for the 10% discount!
Though who wants/remembers to lug that heavy thing around?
milk tea.author: Tina Y.
milk tea.review:
Got my apartment excited to try this interesting new place with its limited glass jars! Initially wary because of the 3.5 stars, but Plentea looked unique enough to warrant a visit. 

Brief line at 2 PM on a Sunday afternoon, and it moves quickly.

Got the iced black milk tea! It's usually my drink test for each new tea place (besides T Pumps): if they can make it well, they've got a new fan. Plentea's tasted fine, but it was incredibly average, and the boba was slightly hard/not chewy enough. Ehhhhhhh. Unimpressed face. Roomies thought green milk tea and thai tea were alright, too.

The glass bottle is super nifty; I've used it to hold smoothies/other beverages at home, and it looks cool to carry to class! The lid is a semi-flimsy plastic cap, the kind you just push onto the top (no twist), and it has leaked a little, so avoid putting it in purses in case it tips over.

The $5+ seems worth it because of the bottle, but the watery, lackluster milk tea reminds you that you are overpaying for this novelty. Especially since Bobo Drinks just opened in Berkeley and they have cool embossed mason jars you can just buy for $1. May have to come back to try a couple other flavors - and bring my bottle back for the 10% discount! Though who wants/remembers to lug that heavy thing around?

excerpts: My favorites the Oolong Milk Tea and Honey Lemon Oolong Tea.
Just the right amount of sugar and tea flavor.
Prepare to wait thought.
I waited for a good while (probably 30mins?)
but definitely worth the wait.
milk tea.author: Jae C.
milk tea.review:
My favorites the Oolong Milk Tea and Honey Lemon Oolong Tea. Just the right amount of sugar and tea flavor.
Prepare to wait thought. I waited for a good while (probably 30mins?) but definitely worth the wait. At least in my opinion.

Gotta love the people complaining about the line though. No one made you wait in line. You saw how long the line is, you choose to wait. The end.
So if you wait for 30mins, 1 hour, or more for a drink and end up regretting that you did so. No one to blame but yourself.
Go back when there is no line or just to go somewhere else. Plenty of bubble tea places a few blocks away in Chinatown. I don't know if it'll taste as good but at least you won't have to wait so long in line.

Pretty simple. Wait or don't wait. Again, no one forced you to.

Things get pretty hectic during rush hours and I'm not surprised if it takes longer to prepare drinks.
Parking is extremely troublesome but it's downtown. I expected it but obviously many others failed to understand this.
There are several parking garages (Portsmouth Square Garage) nearby. If you can't afford measly $3-4 an hour to park your car, take the bus.

They definitely need to work on some ways to make drinks faster and the numbers for the drinks are very unorganized like someone mentioned. I assume due to the fact that some drinks are faster to make than others. If so, it's understandable to me at least. Others probably failed to understand this too.
But they have been opened for a little over a week so maybe it'll get better as time passes.

I do love the glass bottles though. The lid on the other hand is a pain to take off sometimes.

excerpts: I came here and tried the jasmine green tea, thai tea, and regular milk tea.
I would say that their teas are good but not worth my $5.
Thai tea is probably the best that i tried.
milk tea.author: Cecile S.
milk tea.review:
Came here to get the glass bottle that came with a large drink during their promo period. I think they only have one size for all drinks? Anyway, what kind asian doesn't line up for free stuff. One time I was the last person to get a glass bottle before they ran out. Whoop whoop, small victory. Line is always out the door after 1145 or so. one time I waited 25 mins to get to the cashier. 

 All their drinks are on the pricier side, $4-6 per drink. So without the glass bottle, the drinks here are actually not worth it. they give you a 10% discount if you get plastic. I came here and tried the jasmine green tea, thai tea, and regular milk tea. I would say that their teas are good but not worth my $5. Thai tea is probably the best that i tried. They also have some snack and lunch foods.

Will not come again when there are better and cheaper places. I fell for the glass bottle gimmick and that's it.

excerpts: I had the black milk tea with honey boba, and it was good.
My best friend had the strawberry milk with boba.
I wouldn't say that either were anything super special.
I would definitely come back, but the price is a little steep to come too often ($5.44 with tax).
milk tea.author: Jennifer J.
milk tea.review: Loved the glass bottle! It is definitely a great idea to get people to come to the store. I had the black milk tea with honey boba, and it was good. My best friend had the strawberry milk with boba. I wouldn't say that either were anything super special. I would definitely come back, but the price is a little steep to come too often ($5.44 with tax).

excerpts: I really liked the tea I had here, I need to come back to try their milk tea.
They do a lot of different styles here too including the sea salt tea.
The boba was also pretty good too.
I think the bottles are really cool though, and I don't particularly mind spending a little extra for them.
milk tea.author: Bryson L.
milk tea.review: Love the atmosphere and the service is friendly too.  Like the other reviews mentioned, your boba is served in a glass bottle.  This is partly why the pricing is a bit higher here, but to be fair, I've paid for boba that costed nearly the same, but without the bottle.  It's a nice keepsake, but being someone who doesn't live near their store, I doubt I would ever bring the bottle back for the 10% discount.  I really liked the tea I had here, I need to come back to try their milk tea.  They do a lot of different styles here too including the sea salt tea.  The boba was also pretty good too.  I think the bottles are really cool though, and I don't particularly mind spending a little extra for them.

excerpts: The Nutella Milk Tea tasted like chocolate milk.
The brown sugar milk tea was a little too sweet but pretty good, nonetheless.
Pretty reasonable boba price considering you get to bring home a glass bottle.
milk tea.author: Shela D.
milk tea.review: The Taro Milk is actually real Taro and none of that fake powder stuff, so so good! The Nutella Milk Tea tasted like chocolate milk. The brown sugar milk tea was a little too sweet but pretty good, nonetheless. Pretty reasonable boba price considering you get to bring home a glass bottle.

excerpts:
You can never go wrong with the Matcha Milk Tea, or Green Milk Tea, or check out the smoothness

Come back and bring your jar!
milk tea.author: Jason Ping T.
milk tea.review:
GET THAT JAR
I DON'T CARE WHAT TIME YOU WAKE UP, you better set that alarm, wake up early get there by 11 and get that jar. okay now thats outta the way

So I came here for their jar hahaha and the drinks here are not bad but pretty pricy ( Range (from 4.00~ and up) 

TIPS: Cash under 10 bucks so buy two drinks or they charge fidddyyyyyy cent on your credit card

I got the honey ice tea with citrus and aloe, really good and refreshing but they had some citrus strips on the bottom of the jar so i had to swallow that... not that good.

You can never go wrong with the Matcha Milk Tea, or Green Milk Tea, or check out the smoothness

Come back and bring your jar! 10% off and hey we all like to save money #asians

excerpts: There were "Plentea" of high school students lined up for milk tea.
The line was out the door which equated to a 45 minute wait.
The place exudes a nice hip vibe.
There is an upstairs for lounging and they serve waffles in addition to milk tea.
When we finally reached the line, I ordered a Oolong Tea Crema and my friend got a Black Milk Tea.
It took a while to get our drinks after we ordered.
We received our teas in nice tall glass containers that we get to take home.
If you bring it back you can receive a discount on your next visit.
After trying my tea, something was off.
I wasn't able to immediately put my finger on it.
I tried my friend's tea and it was 10x better.
I took another sip at mine.
By the time I got half way through I realized that my drink was not cold enough.
It was about the temperature of tap water.
I figured that they don't put ice in the Oolong Tea Crema, but after looking around and at yelp photos, all the drinks have ice.
Well, except mine.
The tea was a little weak
and it wasn't too sweet either.
To be fair though, my friend's black milk tea was decent.
I would still not pay $5 dollars for it.
Their small kitchen looks way to cramped for the amount of people back there.
I think once they figure out how to be efficient with their space and staff the wait time should improve and their drinks will be more consistent.
I will wait till then, but for now, I will pass.
milk tea.author: David C.
milk tea.review:
I stopped by Plentea with my friend on a Friday afternoon. There were "Plentea" of high school students lined up for milk tea. The line was out the door which equated to a 45 minute wait. The place exudes a nice hip vibe. There is an upstairs for lounging and they serve waffles in addition to milk tea.

When we finally reached the line, I ordered a Oolong Tea Crema and my friend got a Black Milk Tea. It took a while to get our drinks after we ordered. We received our teas in nice tall glass containers that we get to take home. If you bring it back you can receive a discount on your next visit. After trying my tea, something was off. I wasn't able to immediately put my finger on it. I tried my friend's tea and it was 10x better. I took another sip at mine. By the time I got half way through I realized that my drink was not cold enough. It was about the temperature of tap water. I figured that they don't put ice in the Oolong Tea Crema, but after looking around and at yelp photos, all the drinks have ice. Well, except mine. The tea was a little weak and it wasn't too sweet either. The boba here was really soggy and didn't have a good bite to it.

I like the concept of the place, but no ice, no flavor and over cooked boba is not impressive. To be fair though, my friend's black milk tea was decent. I would still not pay $5 dollars for it. Their small kitchen looks way to cramped for the amount of people back there. I think once they figure out how to be efficient with their space and staff the wait time should improve and their drinks will be more consistent. I will wait till then, but for now, I will pass.

excerpts: I'm always up for trying new milk tea places.
It's the asian girl in me
I came here on a Saturday afternoon.
Line went out the door but it moved quickly and gave me a chance to decide on what to get.
They have food on their menu too if you're looking for a quick bite, but from the look of it, you're better off eating elsewhere.
Get your drinks here though and be prepared to pay at least $5/drink.
I got the peach oolong tea with aloe.
Very refreshing and perfect amount of sweetness.
I like that I can keep the glass jar that they serve it in
so that's why I'm not complaining about the $5.50 drink.
I'm taking off stars for the taste.
Ive tried the blueberry milk tea with honey boba as well and wasn't impressed by the boba.
They added too much milk and made it taste like nestle milk.
I've had better.
Besides that, their staff was nice and efficient.
milk tea.author: Lynn V.
milk tea.review: I'm always up for trying new milk tea places. It's the asian girl in me :) I came here on a Saturday afternoon. Line went out the door but it moved quickly and gave me a chance to decide on what to get. They have food on their menu too if you're looking for a quick bite, but from the look of it, you're better off eating elsewhere. Get your drinks here though and be prepared to pay at least $5/drink. I got the peach oolong tea with aloe. Very refreshing and perfect amount of sweetness. I like that I can keep the glass jar that they serve it in so that's why I'm not complaining about the $5.50 drink. I'm taking off stars for the taste. Ive tried the blueberry milk tea with honey boba as well and wasn't impressed by the boba. They added too much milk and made it taste like nestle milk. I've had better. Besides that, their staff was nice and efficient.

excerpts: Overall Impression: Small milk tea shop that always runs out of boba in it's closing hours, yet the glass jar that comes free with every purchase makes buying anything worthwhile.
milk tea.author: Kevin T.
milk tea.review:
Overall Impression: Small milk tea shop that always runs out of boba in it's closing hours, yet the glass jar that comes free with every purchase makes buying anything worthwhile.

Cost: Around 5 for most drinks. Decent variety, and add-ons are extra. Boba supply seems to run short in the few times that I've been there.

Taste: My friend got a blueberry smoothie once that he said was one of the best drinks he's ever tried. I usually stick with the milk teas and have not been let down so far. 

Customer Service: It's average. Nothing special, but they do make your drinks quickly.

Ambience/Atmosphere: A place to hang out for a bit and then leave. There is limited seating, and when you find seats there is not much to look at.

excerpts: Milk tea (50% sweet)!
milk tea.author: Chelsea L.
milk tea.review:
Milk tea (50% sweet)! 


Skip the coffmilk tea/fruity drinks.

excerpts: Anyways I ordered a strawberry fresh fruit milk tea with tapioca which was delicious and came in a nifty glass bottle that I totally intend to use for non milk tea purposes.
milk tea.author: Sherry M.
milk tea.review:
Cool, original concept. Hasn't quite hit LA yet in the way that it has for the Bay Area which is why I think I liked it so much (I live in Los Angeles if that wasn't an obvious). 

I was literally the only non Asian person in the entire store. The place was full. Uncomfortable you ask? Nay, I'm used to awkwardly being glared at. 

Anyways I ordered a strawberry fresh fruit milk tea with tapioca which was delicious and came in a nifty glass bottle that I totally intend to use for non milk tea purposes. 

A little expensive but worth the price for what you're getting. The employees work really hard and very fast in a teeny space so credz to them.

excerpts: Great little spot for some milk tea.
I had the sea salt crema oolong tea, based on my friend's recommendation, and it was very good.
A little salty and also a little sweet.
The girl behind the counter told me not to mix it up, but I actually think it tastes better when it's mixed (call me crazy).
They also give you cute glass jars with your drink, and if you bring it back, you get 10% off your next drink.
I didn't want to bring the glass jar with me back to Seattle
so I handed it back to them when I was leaving
and they were surprised I didn't want to keep it, haha.
But apparently you can opt for just a plastic cup, which is probably what I'll do next time.
And I definitely want to come back!
milk tea.author: Karen L.
milk tea.review: Great little spot for some milk tea. I had the sea salt crema oolong tea, based on my friend's recommendation, and it was very good. A little salty and also a little sweet. The girl behind the counter told me not to mix it up, but I actually think it tastes better when it's mixed (call me crazy). They also give you cute glass jars with your drink, and if you bring it back, you get 10% off your next drink. I didn't want to bring the glass jar with me back to Seattle so I handed it back to them when I was leaving and they were surprised I didn't want to keep it, haha. But apparently you can opt for just a plastic cup, which is probably what I'll do next time. And I definitely want to come back!

excerpts: I normally wouldn't buy milk tea without my boba
so I chose a mango smoothie.
First of, what kind of tea shop runs out of boba, especially during the early afternoon??
Anyway, came back today cause I've been wanting to find out how the milk tea was here and sighhhh what a huge disappointment.
I got the black milk tea with boba and everything about it was just mediocre.
The milk tea tasted bland and lacked the normal sweetness that normal milk tea have.
Upon reading other reviews, I guess you could customize your sweetness, but they never asked us and there was no sign saying we could.
Even then, wouldn't a normal non-customized milk tea be sweet regardless in the first place??
Sigh again, huge letdown.
Also the boba was not satisfying at all.
Not chewy enough and bland as well.
but I've always been one to only always order the milk tea.
I wouldn't be coming back again just cause it doesn't suit my taste.
I guess it's only hyped for the bottle and the IG pic.
milk tea.author: Amy X.
milk tea.review:
It really isn't worth waiting in that huge line if all you're hoping to get out of this is the glass bottle. You could literally get that at target or something. I came here with my boyfriend during the winter, excited to see what the hype was all about, but they had ran out of tapioca balls. I normally wouldn't buy milk tea without my boba so I chose a mango smoothie. First of, what kind of tea shop runs out of boba, especially during the early afternoon?? And hugeee regret when I took my first sip of my smoothie cause it tasted like any ordinary smoothie plus more pricey. 

Anyway, came back today cause I've been wanting to find out how the milk tea was here and sighhhh what a huge disappointment. I got the black milk tea with boba and everything about it was just mediocre. The milk tea tasted bland and lacked the normal sweetness that normal milk tea have. Upon reading other reviews, I guess you could customize your sweetness, but they never asked us and there was no sign saying we could. Even then, wouldn't a normal non-customized milk tea be sweet regardless in the first place?? Sigh again, huge letdown.  Also the boba was not satisfying at all. Not chewy enough and bland as well. Everything was just bland. 

I guess they could excel in other types of drinks but I've always been one to only always order the milk tea. I wouldn't be coming back again just cause it doesn't suit my taste. I guess it's only hyped for the bottle and the IG pic.

excerpts: Kept it simple, milk tea, no boba, and its decent.
You know you're going for the bottle, once you accept that part, its A-OK.
milk tea.author: Chetan S.
milk tea.review: Kept it simple, milk tea, no boba, and its decent. You know you're going for the bottle, once you accept that part, its A-OK.

excerpts: I barely ever get regular milk tea just because I feel that it's very plain
but I just wanted to try it here.
However, they actually gave me Jasmine milk green tea instead
and I am actually glad that they messed up.
I actually did not even know it was Jasmine until i noticed the difference in color with my friend's regular milk tea.
The Jasmine milk tea had a really nice floral note to it and the mango one was pretty good, tasted like any other mango green tea I've had.
The glass bottles are of course a nice souvenir to keep at the end.
Overall, a pretty good first try!
milk tea.author: Sam L.
milk tea.review: So I ordered a regular milk green tea and mango green tea both with boba.  I barely ever get regular milk tea just because I feel that it's very plain but I just wanted to try it here.  However, they actually gave me Jasmine milk green tea instead and I am actually glad that they messed up.  I actually did not even know it was Jasmine until i noticed the difference in color with my friend's regular milk tea.  The Jasmine milk tea had a really nice floral note to it and the mango one was pretty good, tasted like any other mango green tea I've had.  The glass bottles are of course a nice souvenir to keep at the end.  Overall, a pretty good first try!

excerpts: I had a black milk tea bottle, and it tasted
okay.
I like the ambience of the bona place though, and the music.
milk tea.author: Grace P.
milk tea.review: Everyone hypes about Plentea, but really, the boba tastes the same for me as any other boba place. I think people are just jumping on the bandwagon and exaggerating about how good Plentea is because of the free bottles. I had a black milk tea bottle, and it tasted okay. I like the ambience of the bona place though, and the music.

excerpts: The cool glass bottles are what draw me to this milk tea spot.
It's cool to drink out of (though part of me is afraid that I'm going to drop it and
glass is going to shatter everywhere, but that's besides the point) and nice to keep to reuse at home.
I really like the Matcha Green Milk Tea with tapioca (sorry, I'm anti saying boba).
The regular black milk tea, almond milk tea, and taro ice milk are also great choices in my book.
milk tea.author: Sharon L.
milk tea.review:
The cool glass bottles are what draw me to this milk tea spot. It's cool to drink out of (though part of me is afraid that I'm going to drop it and glass is going to shatter everywhere, but that's besides the point) and nice to keep to reuse at home. You are paying a bit more than other drink places (I think because of the bottle and the location), but you do get a discount if you bring the bottle back during your next visit. 

The drinks aren't bad and they have a pretty good menu selection to choose from. I really like the Matcha Green Milk Tea with tapioca (sorry, I'm anti saying boba). The regular black milk tea, almond milk tea, and taro ice milk are also great choices in my book. You definitely taste the tea in their drinks and the tapioca is perfectly sweet and chewy. 

The only downside is that its location is out of the way for me with it being in the financial district. But it is a nice addition to the hustle and bustle work area and is great to grab on your lunch break. Just be aware, lines are almost always out the door in the afternoon.

excerpts: My base line tea drink is jasmine milk tea.
If a place can pass the jasmine milk tea test with pearls, then they are a winner in my book.
milk tea.author: Rosary N.
milk tea.review:
Came here on a warm day, and the line was out the door. I like that they serve their drinks in glass bottles. But I'm not a fan that after you finish you have to carry your glass bottle all day with you, especially if you park really far. However, I am a fan that that glass bottle are reusable for 10% off your next drink. 

My base line tea drink is jasmine milk tea. If a place can pass the jasmine milk tea test with pearls, then they are a winner in my book. They have secret seating upstairs, where is it more quiet and intimate. 

The staff is really nice, but I had a hard time hearing my number being called for my drink until another customer pointed it out. Other than that, it is worth the wait to try.

excerpts: I like the place, and the staff are great, but I ordered the nutella milk tea and there was zero nutella in it!
Just milk tea and chocolate syrup :(
milk tea.author: Anna K.
milk tea.review: I like the place, and the staff are great, but I ordered the nutella milk tea and there was zero nutella in it! Just milk tea and chocolate syrup :(

excerpts:
New hype in boba milk tea madness..

i got the earl grey milk tea. 
i love the taste of their milk tea
, it doesnt have any weird after taste like you get from Quickly's or any other cheap boba milk tea place.

The milk tea is a bit pricey, maybe because of the glass bottle, but the taste of their drinks are delicious.
milk tea.author: Steve S.
milk tea.review:
New hype in boba milk tea madness..

i got the earl grey milk tea. i love the taste of their milk tea, it doesnt have any weird after taste like you get from Quickly's or any other cheap boba milk tea place.

Just the right consistency, a blend of well brewed tea, milk and sweetner. none of that other stuff.. 

it can get quite busy here aropund 1-2pm...  The milk tea is a bit pricey, maybe because of the glass bottle, but the taste of their drinks are delicious. 

i will definitely go here again.

also you can keep the glass bottle!!! or give it back and receive 10% your next order.

excerpts: so...I'm pretty used to decent milk tea and boba.
I roll in at maybe 8/9pm
and I note that there aren't any more glass bottles.
Well, whatever, might as well try the hype.
So I ordered the matcha milk tea because I figure matcha milk might be pretty good.
But nope - the matcha flavor is pretty much nonexistent and the milk tea is more milk than tea.
Oh, and as other yelpers have noted, the price is the same no matter
milk tea.author: Doris K.
milk tea.review:
Ok, so I admit that I fell for the gimmick - I really, really wanted to try this place when I visited San Francisco because I wanted that glass bottle. But what I didn't account for were two things - 1) the possibility that they would run out of glass bottles at a certain time and 2) that the tea might not be that good. Now, I'm from SGV so...I'm pretty used to decent milk tea and boba. I roll in at maybe 8/9pm and I note that there aren't any more glass bottles. Well, whatever, might as well try the hype. So I ordered the matcha milk tea because I figure matcha milk might be pretty good. But nope - the matcha flavor is pretty much nonexistent and the milk tea is more milk than tea. Oh, and as other yelpers have noted, the price is the same no matter if you get the bottle or not (to which I call bs).

So yeah, I would say Plentea is...not the business. Or at least, not the place to take your boba business to if y'all craving good boba.

excerpts: They said they were closed early because there were no customers so they could only make basic milk tea.
If you say you close at 11PM, close exactly at 11PM.
I work also and would never do what these people do.
Otherwise, just keep one register open.
The total was $5.38 for a milk tea with tapioca.
It was good, but for the price it was way too basic and out of the way for me to walk.
milk tea.author: Wesley K.
milk tea.review: The drinks here are pretty average. I came here at 10:45PM and they close at 11PM. They said they were closed early because there were no customers so they could only make basic milk tea. If you say you close at 11PM, close exactly at 11PM. I work also and would never do what these people do. Otherwise, just keep one register open. The total was $5.38 for a milk tea with tapioca. It was good, but for the price it was way too basic and out of the way for me to walk.

excerpts: My green milk tea + boba + tax came out to be $5.44.
Very average milk tea, not enough of the tea flavor.
milk tea.author: Cheri S.
milk tea.review:
Yeah yeah you get a glass bottle as a souvenir. Other than that, the drinks are expensive for what it is, but then again, welcome to the Financial District. You make your money here and you also lose all of it here. My green milk tea + boba + tax came out to be $5.44. Very average milk tea, not enough of the tea flavor. Boba is standard boba (standard chewy, no honey flavor). 

At least I get a glass bottle to put my flowers in. Woohoo!!

excerpts: I get a nice bottle, and my milk tea fix all in one!
Those bottle is nice advertisement too!
I tried a black milk tea and the green one, and both were too milky for me.
I would like a bit more tea taste.
Also it was hard to go back
consider they are pretty expensive.
There were also one time when I went and they ran out of the bottle.
They would give you like 10% discount using plastic cup, but seriously?...that is like only 30 cents less the full price.
milk tea.author: Mandy C.
milk tea.review:
Okay okay, lets be honest here...I come here because I want the bottle. But hey!! I get a nice bottle, and my milk tea fix all in one! Those bottle is nice advertisement too! You see people walking around with them, and you just got to ask, where you get them from?

The tea...it was okay. I tried a black milk tea and the green one, and both were too milky for me. I would like a bit more tea taste. Also it was hard to go back consider they are pretty expensive. There were also one time when I went and they ran out of the bottle. They would give you like 10% discount using plastic cup, but seriously?...that is like only 30 cents less the full price. Totally not worth it, I would think I would at least get a dollar off or something. 

I wouldn't mind going back if I'm around, but I don't think I would purposely go there.

excerpts: I got the green milk tea with egg pudding.
Wasn't great, wasn't bad.
milk tea.author: Peter D.
milk tea.review:
Came here since it's the only real place you can get tapioca/boba in the FiDi area so perfect for all you working people in the area with that boba craving!

I came on a Friday with a bunch of coworkers at 3pm and the wait was around 20 minutes. A few in the group actually thought it was too long and went back to the office.

When we went they also ran out of the glass bottles. Isn't that one of the few reasons everyone is coming here anyway?! Just kidding. Or am I? Granted, there was a 20% discount, but it's still a little pricey for those who are used to $3 drinks in the Sunset or Richmond. 

I got the green milk tea with egg pudding. Wasn't great, wasn't bad.

excerpts: w/ Milk Tea
I got the caramel milk tea w/ tapioca in the cute milk bottle.
What an utter disappointment!
It wasn't horrible by any means, but I don't understand the hype or long lines.
Honestly, it tasted like something I could have bought as a pre-made mix and made myself at home.
Absolutely nothing that should have, in my mind, made it a $5 drink that I've heard people wait in long lines for.
milk tea.author: Eboniña E.
milk tea.review:
Someone recommended this place to me as they knew of my newfound obsession w/ Milk Tea

I got the caramel milk tea w/ tapioca in the cute milk bottle. What an utter disappointment! It wasn't horrible by any means, but I don't understand the hype or long lines. Honestly, it tasted like something I could have bought as a pre-made mix and made myself at home. Absolutely nothing that should have, in my mind, made it a $5 drink that I've heard people wait in long lines for. Thankfully, when I got there no one was in line.

Although, this place is out of my everyday route I figured it COULD be a spot I would hit up in the future if ever I'm in the Union Square area. Ummmm, nope Like I said it's not horrible, but also it's nothing I would go out of my way to get. Honestly, if I was by it in the future I'd probs go elsewhere. It wasn't gross...just not worth it, to me

excerpts: Good teas and milk tea.
Always a plus for nice decor and pretty glass jars.
There pearls (boba) was nice and chewy.
milk tea.author: Julie C.
milk tea.review: It was really good!  Good teas and milk tea.  Always a plus for nice decor and pretty glass jars. There pearls (boba) was nice and chewy.

excerpts: I ordered a coffee milk tea and it was ehh alright.
The boba qual let me down.
It can be better.
The coffee milk tea tasted normal.
There was no line.
milk tea.author: Jonathan T.
milk tea.review: Decided to check this place out. I ordered a coffee milk tea and it was ehh alright. The boba qual let me down. It can be better. The coffee milk tea tasted normal. There was no line.

excerpts: I got the sea salt cream oolong tea after reading the reviews on their fruit milk tea
and I did not want to pay over $7 for a smoothie.
The drink had the tea on the bottom with a layer of cream on the top.
They told me not to shake it so I just stirred it with my straw.
Not too salty or sweet.
milk tea.author: Isabel C.
milk tea.review:
I've been about about Plentea for the past few weeks and decided to try it. Boba in glass bottles aren't exactly new since I've seen places in SoCal that have done this a year or two ago. Plentea is probably one of the first ones in the Bay Area to try this where you get to keep the bottle.

I got there at 1 pm and the line was out side the door. I waited for about 10 minutes before I got to order. Definitely not as long as Purplekow or T-pumps. I only waited for about 2 minutes for my drink. I got the sea salt cream oolong tea after reading the reviews on their fruit milk tea and I did not want to pay over $7 for a smoothie. The drink had the tea on the bottom with a layer of cream on the top. They told me not to shake it so I just stirred it with my straw. Not too salty or sweet. No complaints.

I did see that they only sell a limited amount of glass bottle drinks so I would get here early I want one. However it is 20% cheaper if you get their drinks in a plastic cup. Make sure that you keep your bottle because you want reuse it to get another drink for a discount. You'd have to plan to bring it but if you're a poor college student like me it's worth it.

I did see that they messed up one order but they fixed it immediately with no attitude. This place is relatively new so there is some things they need to fix. I feel like the drinks are overpriced since you're just paying for the glass bottle but come here often enough I would think you'd get your money's worth if you'd reuse them.

excerpts: The milk tea tastes like real milk tea!
Their tapioca could use some flavor or sweetness though.
I also wanted to try their black milk tea, really strong tea
but I liked it.
milk tea.author: Melanie M.
milk tea.review:
I love the fruit drink here! The milk tea tastes like real milk tea! Their tapioca could use some flavor or sweetness though. I don't like getting boba if i know there's no taste. 

But my first time here I bought 2 drinks for myself! I don't go to the city often so I wanted to try 2 different drinks. I got the fresh strawberry fruit tea --- amazingly good--- I loved the strawberry pieces! I also wanted to try their black milk tea, really strong tea but I liked it. (Next time ill try it with green tea). 

The prices are a bit expensive, which is why I would only go here once in a while. And I'm big on tea drinks, I probably get a boba drink once a week or every other week (b/c I'm also big on coffee places too). Yeah, the prices are the only negative id give. I like how they offer discounts on reusing their bottles but it basically just covers for the tax. Bump it up to a bigger discount and maybe people would reuse 'em.
I love the drinks but not so much the prices. I'd say this wouldn't be my weekly boba place, its more of an occasional boba spot. 

PRO: Really good drinks

CONs: Expensive & tasteless tapioca

excerpts: I got the oolong milk tea and it was okay tasting
but you could tell they forgot to put any sweetener.
I like my tea flavor
don't' get me wrong but there is suppose to be a tad bit of sweetness in it which I didn't get.
Pretty much I would come to try it and get a cool bottle but not really worth coming back multiple times.
The tea is alright but there are better spots.
Cool, unique idea for boba.
Since it is in the financial district it will get business but if you are thinking about going out of your way multiple times to come here, it's not worth it.
If you are in the area, it's worth a try.
milk tea.author: Jeromy G.
milk tea.review: I like the idea where you get a glass milk bottle with every drink order. You can take it home and come back to re-use it and get a 10 or 20% discount, I'm not sure. So pretty much it's super over priced because you gotta get the glass bottle. I got the oolong milk tea and it was okay tasting but you could tell they forgot to put any sweetener. I like my tea flavor don't' get me wrong but there is suppose to be a tad bit of sweetness in it which I didn't get. Pretty much I would come to try it and get a cool bottle but not really worth coming back multiple times. The tea is alright but there are better spots. Cool, unique idea for boba. Since it is in the financial district it will get business but if you are thinking about going out of your way multiple times to come here, it's not worth it. If you are in the area, it's worth a try.

excerpts: I got Oolong milk tea with boba (no sugar).
Tasted kind of watered down, tea flavor is there but not enough (tea might need to steep longer).
Boba is nice and chewy and not too sweet either!
A plus is that they did not put too much ice in the jar so theres plenty of milk tea to enjoy!
I also had a taste of what my friends ordered (they all got regular sweetness) so I will review those too.
Black milk tea with boba - tea flavor is strong (I like!)
and the drink is not overly sweet.
Salted Caramel -
So this drink came out in three layers...
boba at the bottom, what seems like black tea in the middle, and white foam looking substance (I don't know what this is) on top.
The barista handed it to us and told us not to mix it.... are we suppose to drink the tea and foam separately?
Anyways, my friend mixed it anyways
and wow.
It was delicious.
Salty caramel flavor ON POINT.
Also, as someone who doesn't really like sweet stuff, this drink was not as sweet as i thought!
(basically by this point i have come to a conclusion that Plentea drinks are not overly sweet compared to other boba places)
Iced milk with taro & taro pudding - whattt?!
they have taro pudding?!
I wish I knew!
Anyways, is basically milk with taro bits (real taro chunks!
gotta chew a bit before swallowing) and chunks of taro pudding....
and I loved it.
I have been avoiding taro drinks from places even though I love taro just because a lot of places use taro powder, which makes the drink thick and too rich to drink.
milk tea.author: Jessica L.
milk tea.review:
Let's be honest, we all went there for the milk jar. However, their milk teas/drinks are not bad at all! My friends and I bought plenty of Plentea today... and soon we were left with none-tea and wanting more.
You get to keep the milk jar and re-use it! 10% off when you bring it back. Also, if they ran out of jars, your drink is automatically discounted :)

I got Oolong milk tea with boba (no sugar). Tasted kind of watered down, tea flavor is there but not enough (tea might need to steep longer). Boba is nice and chewy and not too sweet either! A plus is that they did not put too much ice in the jar so theres plenty of milk tea to enjoy!
I also had a taste of what my friends ordered (they all got regular sweetness) so I will review those too.
Black milk tea with boba - tea flavor is strong (I like!) and the drink is not overly sweet. 
Salted Caramel - So this drink came out in three layers... boba at the bottom, what seems like black tea in the middle, and white foam looking substance (I don't know what this is) on top. The barista handed it to us and told us not to mix it.... are we suppose to drink the tea and foam separately? Anyways, my friend mixed it anyways and wow. It was delicious. Salty caramel flavor ON POINT. Also, as someone who doesn't really like sweet stuff, this drink was not as sweet as i thought! (basically by this point i have come to a conclusion that Plentea drinks are not overly sweet compared to other boba places)
Iced milk with taro & taro pudding - whattt?! they have taro pudding?! I wish I knew! Anyways, is basically milk with taro bits (real taro chunks! gotta chew a bit before swallowing) and chunks of taro pudding.... and I loved it. I have been avoiding taro drinks from places even though I love taro just because a lot of places use taro powder, which makes the drink thick and too rich to drink. However, plentea actually use real taro! 

Service is good. Drinks come out really fast (probably within 2 minutes of ordering). However, the guy who took our order today was not understanding what we wanted... but after repeating ourselves multiple times, he got our orders right.

Parking is always a struggle in the financial district, so plan ahead! Also, the shop is surrounded by other food/snack places so it does get crowded.

excerpts: I got the Oolong crema sea-salt which was yummy (and the owner tells you how to drink it right haha), and my friend got a papaya milk tea, which was kind of a flop because it wasn't as flavorful as it should be (felt like they skimped a little on the papaya?).
milk tea.author: Jolene L.
milk tea.review:
Cute hipster set-up in Chinatown. Good location since there's a lot of options around. It's unique that they have the glass jars but really they should consider giving people an option (kind of like how they ask paper or plastic at the grocery store). 

Anyway, the boba is not too mushy nor is it hard as a rock. The teas have a nice flavor although they don't blow me out of my mind. I got the Oolong crema sea-salt which was yummy (and the owner tells you how to drink it right haha), and my friend got a papaya milk tea, which was kind of a flop because it wasn't as flavorful as it should be (felt like they skimped a little on the papaya?). 

Service is better than that of your standard Asian owned place. Since they're new it seems like they're having some rationing issues. For example, my friend and I dropped by about 1-2 hours before closing and there was a sign on the door stating that they ran out of boba. Excuse me but how do you run out of boba...?

Overall, it's a new store with a lot of potential. However, they have many things to work on if they want to survive as the next big boba store in SF.

excerpts: I got the Green Milk Tea with Tapioca, no ice.
It was quite expensive...
Nearly $6.
The milk tea is not as sweet--you can actually taste the tea.
The boba is either hit or miss-
sometimes it's a bit chewy while it can be soft too.
milk tea.author: Emma H.
milk tea.review:
So much better than Quickly's! I got the Green Milk Tea with Tapioca, no ice. It was quite expensive... Nearly $6. The milk tea is not as sweet--you can actually taste the tea. The boba is either hit or miss- sometimes it's a bit chewy while it can be soft too. I prefer Boba Guys.

The only thing that sets this part is the glass bottle. It's quite heavy which is meh.

excerpts: You can really taste the tea leaves in the oolong milk tea, the boba is delightfully chewy, and the fresh fruit teas are super refreshing on a hot day.
It's rare to find any milk tea place in FiDi, so I was pleased to find that the drink quality here is pretty good.
milk tea.author: Tiffany W.
milk tea.review:
You can really taste the tea leaves in the oolong milk tea, the boba is delightfully chewy, and the fresh fruit teas are super refreshing on a hot day. It's rare to find any milk tea place in FiDi, so I was pleased to find that the drink quality here is pretty good.

It is rather pricey, but I guess everything downtown is. There is an extremely long line, but I guess everything downtown has one. I am knocking a star for two recently implemented policies:

1) Minimum credit card purchase of $15. This is just unreasonable for a place in the heart of the Financial District whose menu consists mostly of items around $5. How many people are going to wait in that long line only to get to the front and realize they can't pay for the drinks they just ordered? At least give the option of using credit card if we pay a transaction fee.

2) Only 400 bottles given out per day (200 in the morning, 200 starting at 6PM). Considering that the bottles are one of their main marketing schemes, it's highly disappointing to arrive after they've reached their daily maximum.

Tip: Order your drink with less ice. Otherwise it gets pretty watered down.

excerpts: I had the milk tea with lychee.
My boyfriend had unsweetened coffee with boba.
He said his was not flavorful.
My biggest complaint, being someone who doesn't intend to return given that I am hardly ever in the area of a Plentea, was that we were served our drinks in glass bottles with the Plentea logo.
This is a cute concept and great for returning customers, but for me, it was kind of a burden.
I'm sure the aim is environmental, but I would rather be charged less and get a plastic compostable cup (assuming the glass bottles cost more than those cups).
I am aware I have a slight hoarding problem for things like this.
I asked myself, "Would I ever have the need for a glass bottle?
It wouldn't fit snugly in my car cup holder, and I don't know how tightly the free bottle covers are that Plentea provides, so
would I ever want to use it?
It's also not very comfortable to hold, with no handle and direct contact with the cold drink...

"  Needless to say, I carried that bottle all the way to the Ferry Building with me, when I came to the realization (as did the rest of my group, one of whom had a Plentea bottle at his condo), that I would never, ever use this thing and it wasn't worth carrying around all day.
I tossed it, annoyed that I had carried it around while I walked, only to decide to throw it away.
And all for an okay serving of milk tea.
milk tea.author: Christina G.
milk tea.review: Came here when there was too long a line at Boba Guys on Stockton... I wonder how many of Plentea's customers have said that.  Plentea offered much more of a selection than Boba Guys, for example, but I thought their boba was so-so.  I had the milk tea with lychee.  My boyfriend had unsweetened coffee with boba.  He said his was not flavorful.  My biggest complaint, being someone who doesn't intend to return given that I am hardly ever in the area of a Plentea, was that we were served our drinks in glass bottles with the Plentea logo.  This is a cute concept and great for returning customers, but for me, it was kind of a burden.  I'm sure the aim is environmental, but I would rather be charged less and get a plastic compostable cup (assuming the glass bottles cost more than those cups).  I am aware I have a slight hoarding problem for things like this.  I asked myself, "Would I ever have the need for a glass bottle?  It wouldn't fit snugly in my car cup holder, and I don't know how tightly the free bottle covers are that Plentea provides, so would I ever want to use it?  It's also not very comfortable to hold, with no handle and direct contact with the cold drink..."  Needless to say, I carried that bottle all the way to the Ferry Building with me, when I came to the realization (as did the rest of my group, one of whom had a Plentea bottle at his condo), that I would never, ever use this thing and it wasn't worth carrying around all day.  I tossed it, annoyed that I had carried it around while I walked, only to decide to throw it away.  And all for an okay serving of milk tea.

excerpts: My black milk tea is average...nothing to rave about.
I do like the sweet and chewy tapioca.
You also can ask them to make the drinks more or less sweet.
Also the glass doesn't fit in the car cup holders so don't even bother.
Overall a good addition to the financial district.
milk tea.author: Lisa Z.
milk tea.review: I'll give them some slack since today is their first official day of opening. The girl on the register look hella lost and confused and that's probably why they totally forgot to make my drink. Most drinks cost average $5 after tax and that's pretty reasonable since we do get to keep the glass bottle. 10% off the next drink if you bring it back the next time you purchase  something. They have $9 sandwiches and salads if ya wanna eat lunch there. My black milk tea is average...nothing to rave about. I do like the sweet and chewy tapioca. You also can ask them to make the drinks more or less sweet. Also the glass doesn't fit in the car cup holders so don't even bother. Overall a good addition to the financial district.

excerpts: If it's your first time here try the fresh fruit milk blue berry or the stick with their house milk tea with boba.
milk tea.author: Victoria S.
milk tea.review:
Hit or miss. Not all drinks are good or bad. If it's your first time here try the fresh fruit milk blue berry or the stick with their house milk tea with boba.

Free glass jar to keep though. Still hunting for the best.

excerpts: I had the strawberry milk with boba and my best friend had the black milk tea with honey boba.
Neither were fantastic but again...that glass jar.
We literally talked about how excited we were to keep the jar for like 10 minutes (it's that fun).
If you bring the bottle back you get 10% off each purchase.
Both of ours were around $5.30.
Come for the bottle, leave with some boba.
milk tea.author: Salma R.
milk tea.review: Average boba but you get to keep the glass bottle! That in itself pretty much boosted my review up 2 stars. I had the strawberry milk with boba and my best friend had the black milk tea with honey boba. Neither were fantastic but again...that glass jar.
