We literally talked about how excited we were to keep the jar for like 10 minutes (it's that fun). If you bring the bottle back you get 10% off each purchase. Both of ours were around $5.30. Come for the bottle, leave with some boba.

excerpts: Ordered an iced milk tea with tapioca and brown sugar.
This particular drink was a bit too sweet for me but despite that the tea has a really fresh taste.
My husband had the strawberry fruit milk and it was incredible.
milk tea.author: Lisette C.
milk tea.review:
Went there at about 10:15pm and there was a very short wait. Ordered an iced milk tea with tapioca and brown sugar. This particular drink was a bit too sweet for me but despite that the tea has a really fresh taste. My husband had the strawberry fruit milk and it was incredible. We also tasted the strawberry Belgian waffles and they were the best EVER. 

We didn't get a glass bottle since they are only handing 300 a day until July. That part was a bit disappointing. Oh well.

excerpts: I got the black honeydew milk tea.
It was pretty good.
I find the glass jar kinda unnecessary and think a disposable plastic cup and a few dollars off would be better.
Regardless, the tea was above average and I would recommend it to others.
milk tea.author: Sam A.
milk tea.review: I was going to go to Boba Guys, but didn't feel like walking 10 minutes. I got the black honeydew milk tea. It was pretty good. I find the glass jar kinda unnecessary and think a disposable plastic cup and a few dollars off would be better. Regardless, the tea was above average and I would recommend it to others.

excerpts: Luckily their sea salt caramel oolong and Iced Milk tea with caramel makes up for all the petty mistakes.
milk tea.author: Reginne B.
milk tea.review: I was so excited to try a new boba place . The glass bottle they have definitely makes your drink look nicer. However, they always run out of tapioca ( may mean theyre selling a lot ). Make sure you call if you want tapioca on your drinks ! Also, One of the guys that work there doesnt seem to know how to do simple math. He was supposed to give us 10% discount for each drink since we brought in our own bottles. He gaves us .25 back instead of a $1.15. And thats besides the fact that he charged us .50 each drink for tapioca when they didnt even have any. Luckily their sea salt caramel oolong and Iced Milk tea with caramel makes up for all the petty mistakes.

excerpts: I opted for the normal milk tea (black).
The wait wasn't short, but my friends and I went upstairs to the 2nd floor to chill.
Other people were situated up there and it had such a nice, buzzing atmosphere.
milk tea.author: Spencer L.
milk tea.review:
Paid a lot more for a lot less.

Plentea is such a hip boba joint. The name initially threw me off, but as soon as my friends and I stepped inside, a smile crept upon my face.

The first thing you'll notice is that the drinks are served in a fancy schmancy glass bottle. It's tall and awesome, and there are lids in the front where you order so you can cap it if you're unable to finish your drink (which is very unlikely).

Their drink selection isn't huge, but it's sure to please everyone who steps in through the door. I opted for the normal milk tea (black). The wait wasn't short, but my friends and I went upstairs to the 2nd floor to chill. Other people were situated up there and it had such a nice, buzzing atmosphere. Everyone seemed friendly and happy, some were also studying.

The drinks tasted great - not too sweet. Like I said, I paid a lot more for worse boba.

The cool glass containers, open hours and quaint atmosphere makes me regret that this visit was not going to be routine. I was visiting some friends up at UC Berkeley and they suggested we try this place for desert.

Hopefully SF will be a place I can call home in the future and I'll be sure to make Plentea among the shops to visit often.

excerpts: Stopped by around 4pm on a Thursday afternoon to grab some milk tea.
As expected there was a line of tweens out the door for the new boba spot but luckily the long moved at an even pace.
I just went for the green milk tea with less boba though the fresh fruit drinks were enticing.
The green milk tea was satisfying and
actually tasted tea-like.
I ordered less boba (I don't like the usual amount people add) and was happy to see the amount I was hoping for.
My friend ordered the sea salt oolong tea which I wasn't a fan of, but some may like the flavor.
milk tea.author: Kellyn W.
milk tea.review:
Stopped by around 4pm on a Thursday afternoon to grab some milk tea. As expected there was a line of tweens out the door for the new boba spot but luckily the long moved at an even pace. I just went for the green milk tea with less boba though the fresh fruit drinks were enticing. The green milk tea was satisfying and actually tasted tea-like. I ordered less boba (I don't like the usual amount people add) and was happy to see the amount I was hoping for. My friend ordered the sea salt oolong tea which I wasn't a fan of, but some may like the flavor. The combination of sea salt with the oolong and milk wasn't right for my palate. 

Drinks also come in a Plentea branded glass bottle that's yours to keep. You can bring it back in for 20% off your next drink, but I'd prefer that they simply have a deposit that they refund upon return of the bottle like Juice Shop and etc. 

Overall I'd say Plentea is worth a try but not in the afternoon with the after school crowd. Next time I'll try stopping by earlier to avoid the lines.

excerpts: Unique upper level seating and a cool atmosphere only to be let down by an unwelcoming barista who served below-average milk tea recipes!
milk tea.author: J J.
milk tea.review:
Unique upper level seating and a cool atmosphere only to be let down by an unwelcoming barista who served below-average milk tea recipes!

Now you can taste the quality in the ingredients they ordered, but something obviously went wrong from the moment the ingredients were shipped and the drink was handed to me because it did not taste that great at all.. very inconsistent in flavor, with cheap, boring bobas (yes, some places do bobas very good), and very unsavory. 

You can keep their jars, which is cool.

excerpts: I like to add aloe in my milk tea.
However, the milk is too cold
( it doesn't have the hot choice).
I don't think I will go there in winter.
milk tea.author: Su Y.
milk tea.review: I like to add aloe in my milk tea. However, the milk is too cold( it doesn't have the hot choice). I don't think I will go there in winter.

excerpts: The black milk tea was okay but
not the best I've had.
The price point is higher than what I'm used to, but hey, it's San Francisco.
milk tea.author: Mai N.
milk tea.review:
3.5

Maybe I've been spoiled by the plethora of yummy & cheap boba shops in New York that I didn't see the appeal of this place. The black milk tea was okay but not the best I've had. The price point is higher than what I'm used to, but hey, it's San Francisco.

excerpts: For this more or less $5 drink, I was not impressed...think it was the matcha oolong milk tea?
Something like that.
But yea, no wow-factor.
milk tea.author: Glecie C.
milk tea.review:
Most expensive boba I've ever purchased, even with the 20% off because they had no glass bottles! For this more or less $5 drink, I was not impressed...think it was the matcha oolong milk tea? Something like that. But yea, no wow-factor. Quickly's would've satisfied for an even cheaper price.

They're all hype! Only really worth it for the glass bottle, if you're able to even catch them when they have it.

excerpts: Long line, unfriendly service, mediocre green matcha milk tea, no bathroom for customers.
milk tea.author: Jiwon M.
milk tea.review:
PLENTEA of BAD SERVICE.

Long line, unfriendly service, mediocre green matcha milk tea, no bathroom for customers.

Never coming back.

excerpts: Over the last couple of weeks I had a plain milk tea with boba, a matcha slush, a lavender lemonade, and the brown sugar ice milk with taro pudding.
Everything was generally okay except for the matcha slush as it didn't really taste like anything but ice, and it was really difficult to drink out of a glass bottle.
Nothing really stood out to me in terms of taste - it is pretty much your run-of-the-mill tea, but dressed cuter.
milk tea.author: Robbin A.
milk tea.review:
Plentea! I finally got to go here and I didn't realize it was so close to my meeting spot after work. I finish up at 6pm, so I always get here right when they get their deliveries for their fancy glass bottles. I have never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes, though for my first two visits, using card was fine - note that there is now a $15 minimum to charge, so be aware of this before stopping by.

The tea itself is all right. Over the last couple of weeks I had a plain milk tea with boba, a matcha slush, a lavender lemonade, and the brown sugar ice milk with taro pudding. Everything was generally okay except for the matcha slush as it didn't really taste like anything but ice, and it was really difficult to drink out of a glass bottle. Nothing really stood out to me in terms of taste - it is pretty much your run-of-the-mill tea, but dressed cuter. This would be the ultimate gift to give to someone when you're running late or want to leave a good impression on someone's mind - few things are more special than giving someone boba in a capped glass bottle and a smile.

The service itself isn't all that spectacular, I admit. Much of the time they seem flustered or aren't particularly pleased about giving customers more information about a drink or how to order. I imagine that on a bad day, this is not what you want to deal with - if you want a better drink with the same lackluster service, skip the fancy bottle and head over to pretty much anywhere else in the Inner Richmond, Sunset, etc. This may be the outskirts of Chinatown, but it's basically like you're in FiDi, which I think really makes for a better picture of this place.

Overall, it's not bad. You get a discount for bringing the bottle back (which you will probably want, because even if you get two cups of tea/etc. beverage, it's probably not enough for that $15 minimum charge...considering that it's $5-6 a drink). I went there enough times to say that I wouldn't go back unless I am reeeeally craving some overpriced lemonade or something.

excerpts: Decent drinks (milk tea tasted a little diluted), good customer service.
cute glass jar, PERFECT boba!
milk tea.author: Audrey H.
milk tea.review: Decent drinks (milk tea tasted a little diluted), good customer service. cute glass jar, PERFECT boba!

excerpts: bc my milk tea
still cost me $4.50.
And what bums me out even more to this day, is that the milk tea was so low quality.
It wasn't even strong in the tea flavor, watered down, and lukewarm.
Come here if you want to take an IG pic of mediocre milk tea in a glass bottle that they don't even have 90% of the time.
Not worth it, bruh.
milk tea.author: Jo L.
milk tea.review:
Thoroughly disappointed and I'll explain why. 

Came here around 12:30pm with my friend so we were expecting a bit of a wait but no, holy crap the line was out the door and nearly outside onto the end of the sidewalk. So we wait bc we have some time and finally when we're the next people to be served we see this small AF sign at the cash register that says "Minimum credit card charge $15". Obviously, being in SF who really carries around cash anymore when there are SO MANY other forms of payment. So we left. Time wasted: 15 minutes. They really should have signage announcing that on the outside of boba place so people aren't wasting their time. -1 star. 

Gave this place another shot later that same afternoon at 3:30pm. We were expecting no line but nope! Line out the door again. We finally made it inside and the poor couple in front of us experienced the same "credit card minimum charge" heartache we felt so they left. I'm going to assume this is a common occurrence with Plentea. 

When we finally ordered, they had run out of glass bottles which was a bummer bc most people go for the glass bottles. The gentleman at the cash register offered us 10% off which is honestly not that much bc my milk tea still cost me $4.50. -1 star. 

And what bums me out even more to this day, is that the milk tea was so low quality. It wasn't even strong in the tea flavor, watered down, and lukewarm. I honestly don't think this place is worth the price and time you spend invested in it. 

However, I will say the boba was decent but for $4.50, I would not come here again. Come here if you want to take an IG pic of mediocre milk tea in a glass bottle that they don't even have 90% of the time. Not worth it, bruh.

excerpts: The oolong milk tea was pretty good.
Might be more on the milkier side.
Boba is soft and chewy.
If you bring the glass back its a 20% discount.
They run out pretty fast.
Also I think everything tastes a lot better in a fancy jar !
milk tea.author: Vincent L.
milk tea.review: Tea is a little bit on the pricey side even when you include the glass cost. What's with the new name trends like plentea or tastea (socal). The oolong milk tea was pretty good. Might be more on the milkier side. Boba is soft and chewy. If you bring the glass back its a 20% discount. They run out pretty fast. Also I think everything tastes a lot better in a fancy jar !

excerpts: I ordered the oolong milk tea with egg pudding and it was good!
May not be the best milk that I've ever had, but I will drink it anyway.
They do provide food at this location, but no finger foods though.
Make sure you check into their location on yelp to utilize their current 25% discount.
The most disappointing part about this location is the bathroom.
They have one
but it's only for employees!
Surrounding establishments will not have public restrooms so keep that in mind as you're finishing your drinks here.
milk tea.author: Sue T.
milk tea.review: Such a cute place! This location is small but it comes with two levels. Drinks come in a glass jar that you can take home with a plastic lid. I ordered the oolong milk tea with egg pudding and it was good!  May not be the best milk that I've ever had, but I will drink it anyway. They do provide food at this location, but no finger foods though.  Make sure you check into their location on yelp to utilize their current 25% discount.  The most disappointing part about this location is the bathroom.  They have one but it's only for employees!  Surrounding establishments will not have public restrooms so keep that in mind as you're finishing your drinks here.

excerpts: Finally, I came here for the so called milk tea and its bottle.i have to say, they over charge the milk tea and the container.
Their milktea taste like...
I don't even know how to describe it...
too heavy and a taste of plastic...it does not worth all the waiting.
Maybe their flavored tea taste wayyy better than the milktea, but I don't wanna
give a try anymore.
milk tea.author: Amanda K.
milk tea.review: Finally, I came here for the so called milk tea and its bottle.i have to say, they over charge the milk tea and the container.Their milktea taste like...I don't even know how to describe it...too heavy and a taste of plastic...it does not worth all the waiting. Maybe their flavored tea taste wayyy better than the milktea, but I don't wanna give a try anymore.

excerpts: Overall enjoyed the black milk tea:) will be back again.
milk tea.author: A. P.
milk tea.review: The drinks are good and the decor is nice. I really like how they put the teas in glass bottles and we are welcome to take them home. Overall enjoyed the black milk tea:) will be back again.

excerpts: I'm a big tapioca milk tea drinker and if I have to compare this to other boba places, this place has a lot of opportunity to make it big while it's still new.
I guess what lures people here is the glass bottles their drinks come in
AND you get to keep it!
You can bring these bottles back for 10% off your next drink.
The price of the drinks range from $4.25-$4.95.
I ordered the Iced Oolong Milk Tea with honey tapioca.
The tapioca was bland... just chewing on soft, chewy dough.
However, I liked the milk tea.
milk tea.author: Nancy N.
milk tea.review:
I'm a big tapioca milk tea drinker and if I have to compare this to other boba places, this place has a lot of opportunity to make it big while it's still new. I guess what lures people here is the glass bottles their drinks come in AND you get to keep it! You can bring these bottles back for 10% off your next drink. The price of the drinks range from $4.25-$4.95. If you want toppings, it's another 50 cents. 

I ordered the Iced Oolong Milk Tea with honey tapioca. The tapioca was bland... just chewing on soft, chewy dough. However, I liked the milk tea.

I also ordered the Strawberry Fresh Fruit Milk. I expected this drink to be sweet but it's very subtle. Some might call it bland but for the ones who likes it less sweet... you might like this. Besides strawberry flavor, there's many other flavors to choose from including avocado, honeydew, and papaya! Flavors you don't see everywhere.

Per drink rounds to be $5. It is overpriced, and I can do without the glass bottle even if I get 10% off my next drink. I doubt I would plan when to bring the glass bottle from home to go get me a drink. I'm spontaneous about drinks!!! I get it when I want it!

excerpts: This is definitely one of those milk tea shops where you've heard about it so much that you just HAVE to go try it.
I've had their regular black milk tea, jasmine green milk tea, and sea salt crema with oolong tea.
I always leave satisfied with the taste of my tea, but as I mentioned earlier, the tea tastes the same as any other decently upstanding milk tea shop.
At $4.50 a bottle for milk tea and $4.95 for crema, I would also be perfectly happy going to Sharetea, for example, and getting an equally good milk tea for $3.50 and creama for $4.25.
Giving Plentea 3 stars for decent yet overpriced milk tea.
milk tea.author: Dale W.
milk tea.review:
This is definitely one of those milk tea shops where you've heard about it so much that you just HAVE to go try it. If not for the drinks themselves then for the ability to talk about said drinks afterwards.

The single defining characteristic of Plentea is the cute milk bottle they hand out with every drink. (I think I've accumulated four by now....) It's quite eco-friendly, and you have the added benefit of bringing back your bottle for a discount. (10 whole freakin' percent.) Although the general problem I've noticed is, I don't decide ahead of time whether or not I want Plentea, and by the time I pass it and decide that I do want something to drink... well, there's another bottle for me.

The drinks themselves are definitely solid, but not mind-blowing. I've had their regular black milk tea, jasmine green milk tea, and sea salt crema with oolong tea. I always leave satisfied with the taste of my tea, but as I mentioned earlier, the tea tastes the same as any other decently upstanding milk tea shop. At $4.50 a bottle for milk tea and $4.95 for crema, I would also be perfectly happy going to Sharetea, for example, and getting an equally good milk tea for $3.50 and creama for $4.25. 

Giving Plentea 3 stars for decent yet overpriced milk tea.

excerpts: Taro milk tea was great.
This is my new favorite boba place in bay area.
The store looks clean as well.
We chilled upstairs after buying our drinks.
Will definitely come back for tea and the milk bottle
milk tea.author: Winnie W.
milk tea.review: No jars when we came in afternoon. A gem in the financial district. Taro milk tea was great. This is my new favorite boba place in bay area. The store looks clean as well. We chilled upstairs after buying our drinks. Will definitely come back for tea and the milk bottle

excerpts: So my husband has been raving about Plentea's boba milk tea for some time now because they cater to his office frequently.
We have been searching for great boba in walnut creek/concord area for months and I finally had an opportunity to visit this past sat.
We managed to get street meter parking right out front and the place has a cool vibe, top hits music playing and a neat lounge upstairs.
I was so happy to see matcha green milk tea!!!
My husband got the caramel milk tea which was a bit sweet for my tastes.
4 stars because they do not have restrooms available (not good if you have kids in tow), and the girls behind the counter were very friendly to your face
but I could hear inappropriate conversation going on...
They have a card minimum of $15 which seems a bit crazy for a boba place and their prices for their drinks range from $5-6.
Now you do get a cool glass container which you can bring back for discounted drinks in the future.
Too bad I don't live in the city, but I will definitely be back after I try the Japanese curry place a few doors down.
milk tea.author: Justina L.
milk tea.review:
So my husband has been raving about Plentea's boba milk tea for some time now because they cater to his office frequently. We have been searching for great boba in walnut creek/concord area for months and I finally had an opportunity to visit this past sat. We managed to get street meter parking right out front and the place has a cool vibe, top hits music playing and a neat lounge upstairs. 
The menu is well versed, your typical selection of milk teas, the even have fruit milk, fruit smoothies and their food selections looked good. I was so happy to see matcha green milk tea!!! My husband got the caramel milk tea which was a bit sweet for my tastes. 
4 stars because they do not have restrooms available (not good if you have kids in tow), and the girls behind the counter were very friendly to your face but I could hear inappropriate conversation going on...
They have a card minimum of $15 which seems a bit crazy for a boba place and their prices for their drinks range from $5-6. Now you do get a cool glass container which you can bring back for discounted drinks in the future. Too bad I don't live in the city, but I will definitely be back after I try the Japanese curry place a few doors down.

excerpts: I went to Wonderful Foods right after and got man friend his favorite milk tea and poured it in my empty Plentea glass HAAHA.
WF is already 5 stars, but 5.5 when drinking it out of a glass jar.
Heheh #win
milk tea.author: Melissa Y.
milk tea.review:
Had to try this place because I wanted to be hip and cool and fit in with all the popular kids with a cool Instagram picture of my tea in a bottle. .
Came tonight (Wednesday around 10PM to avoid to crazy lines I've been hearing about) and there was no line, but they were out of tapioca/boba/pearls/whatever you hip kids call those black ballz. SAD FACE. I don't usually get balls but I was gonna bringing one back for man friend and he loves balls in his mouth. Too bad for him. No balls tonight. 
I got the peach green tea w/ aloe for me (not bad, but nothing special I'd travel across the city for again) and the honeydew milk for him (fresh honeydew, but meh) 
My drink buddies got the strawberry oolong (Maybe it's an acquired taste but the boys did NOT like it. Gag reflex and all @ first sip.)  and peach black tea w/ lychee  jelly (so ugly, but tasted the best of the 4 drinks we ordered).
We sat upstairs to enjoy our meh drinks, and it's nice and cozy. Only about 5 small tables-- some hip rustic wooden ones w/ matching chairs and whatnot. Yep. 
Anyway, the bottles are the only thing they really have going for them. (Bring it back to refill for 10% off your drink).
See my cool hip picture? 
That's about all I'll ever want from this place. I'll revisit if I'm in the neighborhood, but never across the city for this again. Got my bottle and picture, PEACE! ^_^v

P.S. I went to Wonderful Foods right after and got man friend his favorite milk tea and poured it in my empty Plentea glass HAAHA. WF is already 5 stars, but 5.5 when drinking it out of a glass jar. Heheh #win

excerpts: The regular black milk tea is great, but my favorite is the almond milk tea.
I also love the glass bottles that the drink comes in and have a growing collection sitting in my kitchen cabinet.
milk tea.author: Mina K.
milk tea.review: Consistently excellent milk teas! The regular black milk tea is great, but my favorite is the almond milk tea. I also love the glass bottles that the drink comes in and have a growing collection sitting in my kitchen cabinet.

excerpts: and I tried the regular milk tea with pearls (around $5.5).
The milk tea isn't the best.
Strong tea flavor and not sweet enough for me.
2.9 out of 5 for black milk tea.
milk tea.author: Cindy L.
milk tea.review: I gave it a 4 because I like the fact that I can keep the glass bottle as a souvenir. I've only been there once and I tried the regular milk tea with pearls (around $5.5). The milk tea isn't the best. Strong tea flavor and not sweet enough for me. 2.9 out of 5 for black milk tea.

excerpts: the milk tea.
One extra star for the glass bottle.
milk tea.author: Kathy Z.
milk tea.review: My go-to tea place! I like their salted creame oolong very much but not the milk tea. One extra star for the glass bottle.

excerpts: I got the salted crema oolong milk tea with egg custard which I really liked.
The selection of different teas and toppings was good too...
there were milk teas, fresh fruit teas, yogurt fruit teas.
The glass bottles are a nice look and also practical.
milk tea.author: Lisa V.
milk tea.review:
I got the salted crema oolong milk tea with egg custard which I really liked. The selection of different teas and toppings was good too...there were milk teas, fresh fruit teas, yogurt fruit teas. The glass bottles are a nice look and also practical. It's nice to get the discount when I reuse it, which pretty much gives you a free topping.

I'd rate this place only 3.5 stars mainly because of the price.  Though I do realize they're in a prime location in FiDi, $5+ is ridiculous for boba and their service is slower than what I'm use to at other boba places. There's always a long line. I will gladly walk to further places for more reasonably priced boba but sometimes I'll indulge here since they do have flavor and topping options I can't find nearby.

excerpts:
Where the milk tea hype is at.

I ordered the Thai milk tea with tapioca, it was okay, and the tapioca was pretty good.
milk tea.author: Joy L.
milk tea.review:
Where the milk tea hype is at.

It's pretty cool how you get a glass bottle, very unique indeed.
I can go back with this bottle next time and get a discount.. woo hoo

I ordered the Thai milk tea with tapioca, it was okay, and the tapioca was pretty good.

PROS:
-cool bottle

CONS:
-long lines

excerpts: I ordered the crema oolong milk tea with boba, but only had 3/4 of the bottle filled with milk tea and the rest with cream foam.
Maybe I am biased because I just came back from Taipei, where the boba is incredible and inexpensive, but Plentea is overpriced and average.
You are basically paying more for the glass bottle and the environment.
milk tea.author: Emily F.
milk tea.review: I visited Plentea today with my friends to see what the new hype was all about. I ordered the crema oolong milk tea with boba, but only had 3/4 of the bottle filled with milk tea and the rest with cream foam. Maybe I am biased because I just came back from Taipei, where the boba is incredible and inexpensive, but Plentea is overpriced and average. You are basically paying more for the glass bottle and the environment.

excerpts: A friend went with the regular Milk Tea with tapioca, and I went with the Honey Lemon Tea with tapioca.
Took about 5 minutes or so, we capped our drinks and were on our way - super portable!
I appreciated the ability to adjust the sweetness level of the drinks, because milk tea can get pretty sweet.
All in all Plentea is a pretty solid place head to in the FiDi for a standard tapioca drink, and so far the only one.
My friend and I really enjoyed our drink, and will definitely be back soon when our milk tea cravings cave in, which will be soon, unfortunately for me...
milk tea.author: Cindy L.
milk tea.review:
After seeing all the co-workers walking around the office with  Plentea glass bottles, I had to go see what the hype was all about.

We arrived a little after the lunch rush, so I was a bit surprised that there were still glass bottles left, but glad to have gotten one!  And there wasn't a line either, another plus! A friend went with the regular Milk Tea with tapioca, and I went with the Honey Lemon Tea with tapioca.  Took about 5 minutes or so, we capped our drinks and were on our way - super portable! You can also choose to sit in the store as well, as they have a few seats around, but a majority of the patrons take their orders to go.

The price itself, was pretty on point with everything else in this area, hovering around $4 a drink.  If you do bring back your glass bottle, I believe you receive 10% off your drink order.

I appreciated the ability to adjust the sweetness level of the drinks, because milk tea can get pretty sweet. All in all Plentea is a pretty solid place head to in the FiDi for a standard tapioca drink, and so far the only one.  My friend and I really enjoyed our drink, and will definitely be back soon when our milk tea cravings cave in, which will be soon, unfortunately for me...

excerpts: I always order the classic black milk tea whenever I go to new boba shops.
Because if they can't do black milk tea right then what's the point, right?
I asked for my black milk tea to have only half the amount of sugar and it was the best decision I made that day.
The milk tea still had lingering tastes of "tea".
The drink wasn't drowned with milk.
It was a beautiful blend of two flavors, a perfect base to the perfectly prepared tapioca.
To top it off the experience, my drink was served in a reusable glass bottle!
There was even a cap
so I had the option to toss it in my bag or save it for later!
milk tea.author: Michelle W.
milk tea.review:
Since moving out of the Sunset, I've been looking for a place to fulfill my boba cravings and I think I've found the place :D

I always order the classic black milk tea whenever I go to new boba shops. Because if they can't do black milk tea right then what's the point, right? I asked for my black milk tea to have only half the amount of sugar and it was the best decision I made that day. The milk tea still had lingering tastes of "tea". The drink wasn't drowned with milk. It was a beautiful blend of two flavors, a perfect base to the perfectly prepared tapioca. To top it off the experience, my drink was served in a reusable glass bottle! There was even a cap so I had the option to toss it in my bag or save it for later!

excerpts: I ordered a Caramel Milk Tea w/ Taro Pudding & she ordered just a regular Milk Tea because she didn't know what to get.
Line was long, waited about 5-10 minutes maybe.
Got out drinks, posted on Instagram & everyone was just like omg tfti, lol.
My friend liked my drink so much, she wanted to trade with me haha.
We bought them in the glass bottle so next time
if we come again, we'd get a discount.
We did come again the 2nd time with our bottles & I noticed they don't give back your original bottle.
It was actually a different one, either a new bottle or bottle someone else brought it.
Maybe they meant to do that, or maybe they mixed it up.
I would still come here once in a while.
I just don't like how it's kind of pricey overall for a drink.
They have chalkboards as menus.
There is an upstairs & downstairs for you to sit.
Not only they have boba, they have some desserts too.
But I never tried it yet.
Really bright inside with their glass windows.
I like it.
milk tea.author: Ivy Q.
milk tea.review:
This place is like any other boba place, but just a bit better & I like it! It had just opened & my friend told me about it so we decided to go try it out. 
I came here on Labor Day. I ordered a Caramel Milk Tea w/ Taro Pudding & she ordered just a regular Milk Tea because she didn't know what to get. Line was long, waited about 5-10 minutes maybe. Got out drinks, posted on Instagram & everyone was just like omg tfti, lol. My friend liked my drink so much, she wanted to trade with me haha. We bought them in the glass bottle so next time if we come again, we'd get a discount. We did come again the 2nd time with our bottles & I noticed they don't give back your original bottle. It was actually a different one, either a new bottle or bottle someone else brought it. Maybe they meant to do that, or maybe they mixed it up. I would still come here once in a while. I just don't like how it's kind of pricey overall for a drink. 
They have chalkboards as menus. There is an upstairs & downstairs for you to sit. Not only they have boba, they have some desserts too. But I never tried it yet. Really bright inside with their glass windows. I like it.

excerpts: and I was just left disappointed, with my taro milk tea..
3 Stars for the amazing customer service though!
milk tea.author: Isabel B.
milk tea.review: I have never spent $6 on boba let alone on taro. I know that some tea places can be quite expensive, however, if you're spending a lot of money, especially for a drink...then you are definitely looking for high-quality boba. I went here with my friends after an evening walking around the city and we all come from socal (where boba lives, thrives and is of genuine nature) so when we came upon this place on yelp we were expecting HQ. Unfortunately it did not live up to its hype and I was just left disappointed, with my taro milk tea..3 Stars for the amazing customer service though!

excerpts: I went for my regular, Green Milk Tea with pearls, and my boyfriend got the Honeydew Fresh Milk.
The cost of drinks are a bit pricier, but it's just like any other milk tea spot since you're paying for the cost of the bottle in the price.
milk tea.author: Kim N.
milk tea.review:
To be honest, I was only really excited to try this place because of the cool glass bottles. I went for my regular, Green Milk Tea with pearls, and my boyfriend got the Honeydew Fresh Milk. The cost of drinks are a bit pricier, but it's just like any other milk tea spot since you're paying for the cost of the bottle in the price. 

My drink was not sweet enough for me. Maybe it's because of the green tea but the pearls didn't help either (though they were the right amount of chewy). My boyfriend's honeydew drink was interesting though. There were pieces of honeydew in them! It was a bit too sweet for my liking; I almost wished we could have mixed our two drinks together, then it would have been perfect (I think...). 

Next time I'll definitely try something else, and stick around to have them adjust sweetness levels if I don't like it.

excerpts: I had the black milk tea with pudding and ice milk and two separate occasions.
Both were delicious.
The second time I came it was just past closing and they served me anyway.
milk tea.author: Christine D.
milk tea.review:
Their reusable bottles are so cute I wish I were a local so I could come back regularly with it and get the 10% discount. I had the black milk tea with pudding and ice milk and two separate occasions. Both were delicious. The second time I came it was just past closing and they served me anyway. I was very grateful.

It is kind of pricey and there will be a long line during peak hours but I like the drinks so I think its worth it.

excerpts: I got the iced milk with brown sugar and pudding,  the green milk tea with pearls, and a strawberry smoothie with pearls.
All came out pretty quickly, and I was actually extremely satisfied with all 3 drinks.
The level of sweetness is pretty good.
It's just sweet enough that you can still taste the drink flavor and flavor from the pearls, but not overly sweet.
Although I really do enjoy the drinks, the price was a little bit steeper than I expected.

Granted I knew I'd be paying for the bottle, but if I were to just get it in a plastic cup, it's 20% off, but most of these drinks were 5$ or more, so that's only about a dollar off, and I think the plastic cup size is 12oz,
so yup quite steep.
But at least it's good quality pearls and drinks, so I guess if I were ever in the area again, I would be down to stop by and grab a drink.
Location-wise
, I think it's quite good, as it's nestled close to Union Square and Chinatown, but I can see how during peak hours it'd be difficult to find parking.
milk tea.author: Brendan D.
milk tea.review:
Was home in the Bay Area for July 4th weekend, and I saw all these AWESOME bottles on Instagram, so I was like I NEED THIS. Rounded up 4 other friends, so that we could carpool to SF just to try this new place, as well as get the bottle.  I read one of the earlier reviews, saying they arrived just before they opened since there is a limited supply of bottle to get one, and originally that was the goal, but two of my friends had a slight time conflict, and we ended up showing up around 12:45.  The whole way there I was actually semi-stressed because it's about a 40 minute drive from where I live, so I was like WHAT IF WE DROVE ALL THIS WAY AND WE GET NO BOTTLES. But, praise the lord, they still had bottle when we arrived haha.  I'm guessing because it was a Sunday that parking was extremely easy to find.  I parked pretty much outside the shop, and then walked in.  The decor was fairly modern looking, and there is an upstairs. However, I immediately notice a few drawbacks about the decor.  Somewhat tight, but it's SF, so what can you do, but this led to all the tables on the first floor seating only 2 individuals, so for a group of 5, we took up 3 tables.  Also, I had no freaking clue that to the right of the register was a huge chalkboard that had FOOD ITEMS.  I was so busy looking forward at the drink menu, that I never noticed this.  Such a shame because some of the items sounded really exciting.  I also believe none of my friends noticed the food menu either.  Since I commuted so far, I went what the hell, I might as well get several bottles... LOL. So I decided to try three different drinks.  I got the iced milk with brown sugar and pudding,  the green milk tea with pearls, and a strawberry smoothie with pearls.  All came out pretty quickly, and I was actually extremely satisfied with all 3 drinks.  The level of sweetness is pretty good. It's just sweet enough that you can still taste the drink flavor and flavor from the pearls, but not overly sweet.  Although I really do enjoy the drinks, the price was a little bit steeper than I expected.  Granted I knew I'd be paying for the bottle, but if I were to just get it in a plastic cup, it's 20% off, but most of these drinks were 5$ or more, so that's only about a dollar off, and I think the plastic cup size is 12oz, so yup quite steep.  But at least it's good quality pearls and drinks, so I guess if I were ever in the area again, I would be down to stop by and grab a drink.  Location-wise, I think it's quite good, as it's nestled close to Union Square and Chinatown, but I can see how during peak hours it'd be difficult to find parking.  I would recommend this place to my friends only for the bottle, or if they were in the area.


P.S.  I noticed I keep talking about the bottle, and I'm sure if you see the bottle in the photos on here, you'd know what I'm talking about, but they have a disclaimer that they only give out 300 bottle a day, which is why I was in a rush originally! I'm not sure how long this promotion is going on for though.

:D

excerpts: Already addicted to the milk tea here!
My friends and I like to come by and hangout upstairs.
The drinks are excellent.
I've had the milk tea and ice milk with brown sugar, both are good along with all the other drinks shared with my friends.
You get to keep the glass bottle and cap - which is nice.
Don't forget to check in for a 25% discount!
milk tea.author: Kevin N.
milk tea.review: Already addicted to the milk tea here!  My friends and I like to come by and hangout upstairs.  The drinks are excellent.  I've had the milk tea and ice milk with brown sugar, both are good along with all the other drinks shared with my friends.  You get to keep the glass bottle and cap - which is nice.  Don't forget to check in for a 25% discount!

excerpts: To be safe, I tried the green milk tea which I thought was really good.
It did get a little watery
so I'll remember to tell them to put less ice next time
but overall, the flavor was delicious.
They had some really interesting flavors
milk tea.author: Malika R.
milk tea.review:
Yum. I really enjoyed the first time I visited Plentea. To be safe, I tried the green milk tea which I thought was really good. It did get a little watery so I'll remember to tell them to put less ice next time but overall, the flavor was delicious. They had some really interesting flavors so I'll definitely be back to try them. 

On top of that, it's a very SF thing to do, but the cute glass bottles they serve with the drink make the experience even better. I do admit that it does get a little pricey for one glass of boba, but it's definitely something to try!

excerpts: I don't really live in SF, but when I do I know just where to go for some fantastic milk tea bobas.
milk tea.author: Sandy T.
milk tea.review:
I don't really live in SF, but when I do I know just where to go for some fantastic milk tea bobas. 


This place is very cute in the inside. It's quite packed, but people seem to be friendly anyway which doesn't bother me one bit that it is packed. As long as the environment is welcoming then it's good enough for me! 

I've tried other boba places whenever I do come to SF, but the quality isn't so great. I guess it's just because Im used to SoCal Boba drinks. Who knows. 

BUT this is one place I will never forget. ONE PLACE  I will always come back too. 

What makes it even better is that they have their own custom made milk jugs which you get to keep. :)

excerpts: Last time I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba.
This time we ordered the milk tea with boba again but with black tea as per my coworkers suggestion.
I can say that it's one of the better tasting boba shops in town!
Recommendation: Milk tea and boba with black tea.
milk tea.author: Henry P.
milk tea.review:
I came here twice. I initially did not enjoy Plentea and I did not plan on any future visits. But when my coworker convinced me that I ordered the wrong drink, I decided to give it another shot. Last time I ordered the oolong milk tea with boba.

I came here again on the weekend with DD and the line was long bit manageable. This time we ordered the milk tea with boba again but with black tea as per my coworkers suggestion. I can say that it's one of the better tasting boba shops in town! The milk to tea ratio has been consistent for both visits but if you're like me and appreciate a strong tea presence, the black tea finishes it off well! 

The place is quite big for the FiDi area with an upstairs seating area. Modern natural decor. And they serve your drinks in glass bottles where you can receive 10% back on your next drink if you return with it (limited supply). 

Will I return? Yes I would.

Recommendation: Milk tea and boba with black tea.

excerpts: I ordered their special iced nutella milk tea ($4.95) and it tasted like chocolate milk.
Toppings are extra at $0.50 a pop.
In general, their drinks are a little more expensive than I'm use to.
However, I would go back to give them another shot but just order something else.
milk tea.author: Maxine C.
milk tea.review: I primarily wanted to go here for the fact that they serve bubble tea in glass bottles (something that you do not see on the East Coast). I ordered their special iced nutella milk tea ($4.95) and it tasted like chocolate milk. Toppings are extra at $0.50 a pop. In general, their drinks are a little more expensive than I'm use to. However, I would go back to give them another shot but just order something else.

excerpts: The almond milk tea is not good at all, with an almost spicy, astringent flavor, and the peach milk tasted like yoplait yogurt blended with milk :(
For the price, it was not worth it.
milk tea.author: Kaitlynn S.
milk tea.review: I am not a fan of this place's tea, but their bottle are cute and the service was good. It was clean inside! Their little snack section is nice and a discount for bringing your bottle back is a good perk! I didn't try the food but it looked good as well. However, after trying three times, neither my friend nor myself could find anything that really tasted good. The almond milk tea is not good at all, with an almost spicy, astringent flavor, and the peach milk tasted like yoplait yogurt blended with milk :( For the price, it was not worth it.

excerpts: We got the iced milk tea w/ egg pudding and honey tapioca, and a sea salt crema oolong tea w/ grass jelly.
I could skip on the egg pudding and the grass jelly, it wasn't soft and didn't taste like it was made fresh daily like some other places I'm used to.
What can I say, I'm spoiled with my taste buds lol.
I liked the sea salt crema oolong.
Just perfect.
I'd get it again.
The iced milk tea was ok
milk tea.author: Molly M.
milk tea.review:
Pretty decent! One of the better tasting tapioca I've had, really chewy which is what I like! They use real tea so thats cool. I like the honey tapioca flavor, instead of just plain, non flavored. Pricey but I can forgive that since you get to keep their cute glass jar cups, I'm gonna put it to good use! 

We got the iced milk tea w/ egg pudding and honey tapioca, and a sea salt crema oolong tea w/ grass jelly. I could skip on the egg pudding and the grass jelly, it wasn't soft and didn't taste like it was made fresh daily like some other places I'm used to. What can I say, I'm spoiled with my taste buds lol. I liked the sea salt crema oolong. Just perfect. I'd get it again. The iced milk tea was ok but just a tad bit on the sweet side.

We also got the banana Belgian waffle. Good size to share for 2 ppl. Waffle was toasty. Wish the banana was cold, it was warm, a little weird for me. Drizzled with Nutella and chocolate syrup...hmm good but I wouldn't spend $6.75 on it again.

It is a small joint, expect there to be lines. They have an upstairs lounge area, has wifi, still cramped though. No restroom. Would I be back? Only if I was in the area.

excerpts: Milk tea anywhere with no lines is a win win nowadays.
Minus getting then a Quickly cause they never have lines
milk tea.author: JJ S.
milk tea.review: Changing my 3 stars to a 4. They've been able to overcome their bottle demands. Can't tell the difference but today I went by during lunch and didnt have to wait in line. Milk tea anywhere with no lines is a win win nowadays. Minus getting then a Quickly cause they never have lines

excerpts: The boba was definitely too sweet, but the grass jelly and the milk tea part itself was pretty on point.
I'd have to say that it definitely isn't the best in the bay (Ocha and Tea Era and Verde are better).
Still cool to keep the mason jars though!
milk tea.author: Amanda C.
milk tea.review: Went here after the SF pride parade and we were really excited to see what all of this artsy PMT mason jar stuff was. The boba was definitely too sweet, but the grass jelly and the milk tea part itself was pretty on point. I'd have to say that it definitely isn't the best in the bay (Ocha and Tea Era and Verde are better). Still cool to keep the mason jars though!

excerpts: I got the classic black milk tea with bubbles and pudding.
There wasn't much bubbles and pudding for having charged $0.50 for each.
If I remember correctly, my drink was $4.95, plus $1.00 for add-ons, making the drink over $6.00 after tax.
milk tea.author: Camille B.
milk tea.review:
I've tried to come here a couple times, but the line ups made it really difficult during the work day which is the only time I'm in this part of the city.

However, one night, all the stars aligned and I happened to be in this area around 9pm on a weeknight. There was still a line up of about 6 people ahead of us, but the wait wasn't too bad. Maybe 10 min. from getting in line to taking the first sip of my drink. 

Like many first time patrons, I got the glass bottle. I got the classic black milk tea with bubbles and pudding. There wasn't much bubbles and pudding for having charged $0.50 for each. If I remember correctly, my drink was $4.95, plus $1.00 for add-ons, making the drink over $6.00 after tax. The drink was good though.

Pros: High quality tea, real fruit, high quality add-ons, recylable/reusable bottles.
Cons: Long line-up, limited seating if you want to hang out, pricey, no restroom.

Tip: Bring your bottle for a 10% discount.

excerpts: My go to drink for trying and evaluating a new boba place is jasmine green milk tea.
I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well!
Definitely had the perfect balance between sugar, tea, and milk.
A few of my friends tried it, but only felt so-so towards it.
I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well!
Definitely had the perfect balance between sugar, tea, and milk.
A few of my friends tried it, but only felt so-so towards it.
I guess it's a place thats not consistent with their milk tea making, which is bad for boba cravers.
But, the glass jars were too cute to pass by for me!
milk tea.author: Mo W.
milk tea.review: My go to drink for trying and evaluating a new boba place is jasmine green milk tea. I have to say that this place's jasmine green milk tea was made well! Definitely had the perfect balance between sugar, tea, and milk. A few of my friends tried it, but only felt so-so towards it. I guess it's a place thats not consistent with their milk tea making, which is bad for boba cravers. But, the glass jars were too cute to pass by for me!

excerpts: Average tasting milk tea and come early if you want the glass bottle!
If not it's 20% off.
milk tea.author: Amanda W.
milk tea.review: Average tasting milk tea and come early if you want the glass bottle! If not it's 20% off.

excerpts: Drink itself wasn't anything special; standard milk tea drink
milk tea.author: Taryn Q.
milk tea.review: Great service! Asked for a recommendation between two drinks and the cashier gave me samples to try instead. Able to customize drink/alter to your liking and the glass bottles were definitely a nice touch. Drink itself wasn't anything special; standard milk tea drink

excerpts: I've tried the Regular Milk Tea, Oolong Milk Tea, Sea Salted Caramel Milk Tea, and Brown Sugar Milk.
However, Brown Sugar Milk (half sweet) with egg pudding and tapioca is my FAVORITE!
Highly Recommend!
milk tea.author: Euodia A.
milk tea.review: Plentea has the great and cutest idea of using the glass milk jugs. I've tried the Regular Milk Tea, Oolong Milk Tea, Sea Salted Caramel Milk Tea, and Brown Sugar Milk. However, Brown Sugar Milk (half sweet) with egg pudding and tapioca is my FAVORITE! Highly Recommend!

excerpts: I tried the black milk tea with honey boba and had the sweetness adjusted to 25% sugar.
The tea had a strong flavor which was good and the honey boba was also pretty good.
The texture of the tapioca was soft, chewy, and ideal.
Overall, I think the drinks, store environment, and staff deserve a solid 4 stars.
milk tea.author: Monica T.
milk tea.review:
I tried the black milk tea with honey boba and had the sweetness adjusted to 25% sugar. The tea had a strong flavor which was good and the honey boba was also pretty good. The texture of the tapioca was soft, chewy, and ideal. Overall, I think the drinks, store environment, and staff deserve a solid 4 stars. The store had nice, modern decor, seating area was very clean, and the staff was helpful and very friendly.

-1 star for drinks being a little too pricey. It would be nice if they didn't force you to purchase your drink with the glass bottle (that's probably why the drinks are marked up so high) With one topping, my drink was $5-6. I would definitely go back if they provided cheaper options (plastic cups, or option to drink the boba in-store)

If you bring back the glass bottle, you get 10% off your next purchase.

excerpts: I ordered the green milk tea w/ boba.
I thought the drink was decent, but it was not amazing.
Also, it was much pricer than other boba places I've been
milk tea.author: Leah F.
milk tea.review:
I really wanted to like the hype! I left with thinking the drink was OK.

Well for starters, I only waited maybe 10-15 minutes so that wasn't too bad. I ordered the green milk tea w/ boba. I thought the drink was decent, but it was not amazing. Also, it was much pricer than other boba places I've been and I guess you're really paying for the throwback glass milk-bottle-eque feeling which was kinda cool. 

I'll probably only go back if I'm in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

excerpts: Plentea's a milk tea place that also sells waffle sandwiches.
It's a weird concept but there's people eating the food
so I guess it works.
Milk Green Tea and the Thai Milk Tea are very meh.
Both of them don't have a good tea taste... for some reason it tastes pretty watered down.
milk tea.author: Steven B.
milk tea.review:
Plentea's a milk tea place that also sells waffle sandwiches. It's a weird concept but there's people eating the food so I guess it works. The place is pretty tiny, but there's a small area upstairs to sit down in.

== Drinks ==

Milk Green Tea and the Thai Milk Tea are very meh. Both of them don't have a good tea taste... for some reason it tastes pretty watered down. Maybe too much milk compared to tea.

Sea Salt Crema Oolong Tea is pretty good. It's not amazing, but it's the best one I have tried so far.

== Service ==

Pretty quick. 5-10 minute wait usually. The line goes to the door sometimes, but it doesn't go out the door.

== Overall ==

The glass bottles make it pretty awesome right now to grab some.

excerpts: Black milk tea with boba (my usual order to determine if the store was good) was good.
The bottles are so cute!
There was no waiting line to order.
milk tea.author: Pauline Y.
milk tea.review: Black milk tea with boba (my usual order to determine if the store was good) was good. The bottles are so cute! There was no waiting line to order.

excerpts: A little bit pricey for milk tea.
But worth the try.
milk tea.author: Yining Z.
milk tea.review: Love this place. They have cute bottles and lovely drinks. Its about 5 bucks a drink. A little bit pricey for milk tea. But worth the try.

excerpts: I ordered a salted crema oolong milk tea with tapioca and taro pudding.
The pudding was decent, the boba chewier than I prefer.
They put too much ice considering how small the container is.
And the drink itself was pretty gross.
The combination of the saltiness and sweet was not a good balance and unusually love that combination!
As for the gal taking my order: I was obviously not familiar with the menu, and she was clearly very impatient and annoyed that she had to correct me.
I also tried to discreetly let her know that it's unethical
To require a minimum debit card purchase amount.
A minimum for credit card is legal, but requiring a minimum amount for debit is downright dirty.
I was merely trying to do them a favor as I usually like to help asian-ran businesses to do well.
After how rude she was, I am making an exception by writing this review.
Instead of recognizing that my tone and demeanor was simply one of saying "please be careful", she mistook it as me blowing a whistle at her.
Her reaction was borderline ghetto.
Try them out, maybe you'll have a better experience.
As for me, never again.
milk tea.author: Crispy P.
milk tea.review:
This was my second time visiting this spot. The first time was so-so. I remember being slightly disgusted at how overpriced their drinks were. I have my share of favorite Boba spots, and this wouldn't be one of them. This last time I was highly-motivated to write a review, mostly because the chick behind the counter was ridiculously rude. If I'm paying $5 for a mostly-ice drink, atleast be courteous. I also ordered a mango milk with boba to-go to bring home to my kid who's obsessed with boba drinks. 
Let me start with rating my drink. I ordered a salted crema oolong milk tea with tapioca and taro pudding. The pudding was decent, the boba chewier than I prefer. They put too much ice considering how small the container is. And the drink itself was pretty gross. The combination of the saltiness and sweet was not a good balance and unusually love that combination!
As for the gal taking my order: I was obviously not familiar with the menu, and she was clearly very impatient and annoyed that she had to correct me. I also tried to discreetly let her know that it's unethical
To require a minimum debit card purchase amount. A minimum for credit card is legal, but requiring a minimum amount for debit is downright dirty. I was merely trying to do them a favor as I usually like to help asian-ran businesses to do well. After how rude she was, I am making an exception by writing this review. Instead of recognizing that my tone and demeanor was simply one of saying "please be careful", she mistook it as me blowing a whistle at her. Her reaction was borderline ghetto. 
Try them out, maybe you'll have a better experience. As for me, never again.

excerpts: Hopefully I will come back soon -- I am definitely curious with their milk tea!
milk tea.author: Carmen W.
milk tea.review: I finally get to try this place after hearing about this from friends and being known top boba places from Facebook (I believe). I was surprised of how pricey it is -- I'm assuming because it is in a glass container, though on the bright side, you can bring it back for 10% off (similar to Starbucks reusable cup policy). I ordered my usual (Peach Black Iced Tea) -- LOVE the taste (I am very picky when it comes to my peach because I swear, it seems like a lot of places cannot put the right amount of peach flavor in my drink), but my boba was kinda hard (maybe it was a bad batch because when my sister ordered it before, she didn't have that kind of problem). Hopefully I will come back soon -- I am definitely curious with their milk tea!

excerpts: The milk tea is too sweet and they don't do any customization.
A good location will give them enough business tho.
milk tea.author: Minqi L.
milk tea.review: It's a bit pricy for just a fancy jar. The milk tea is too sweet and they don't do any customization. A good location will give them enough business tho.

excerpts: Ordered the coffee milk tea and it was watery beyond belief.
On top of that they force your hand into buying a glass bottle that you don't really need which of course makes the prices of it ridiculously high.
milk tea.author: Evelyn Q.
milk tea.review: It's okay. Ordered the coffee milk tea and it was watery beyond belief. On top of that they force your hand into buying a glass bottle that you don't really need which of course makes the prices of it ridiculously high.

excerpts: Waiting in the upstairs seating area for it to shorten before I order a taro milk tea or fruit tea with boba.
milk tea.author: Debra M.
milk tea.review: Line out the door today. Waiting in the upstairs seating area for it to shorten before I order a taro milk tea or fruit tea with boba.

excerpts: They milk tea is alright, nothing really special.
The only thing that attracts everyone is the glass bottle you get to take home.
Its pricey b/c you pay for the bottle as well.
Definetly a good location since its in the financial district and pretty close to Chinatown.
Long wait just like tpumps.
milk tea.author: Suki L.
milk tea.review: They milk tea is alright, nothing really special. The only thing that attracts everyone is the glass bottle you get to take home. Its pricey b/c you pay for the bottle as well. Definetly a good location since its in the financial district and pretty close to Chinatown. Long wait just like tpumps.

excerpts: Not really worth paying over $5 for a milk tea Without the jar near Chinatown area.
milk tea.author: Sophia H.
milk tea.review: Two star is for the marketing. I came here for the cute jar. But I got paper cup when I ordered it hot. NO ONE TOLD ME WHEN I ORDER! All the pictures on the menu are showing drink with a jar. if the selling point is the jar, please make it clear. We ordered two drinks and when we came back asking can we at least get one jar( we paid same price for drink with a jar) they said no. Probably it's out of their control but I wish business ppl know better than that. It's bad marketing.  Not really worth paying over $5 for a milk tea Without the jar near Chinatown area.

excerpts: I got the almond milk tea with boba, it tasted great
wouldn't change a thing about it.
milk tea.author: Jesse K.
milk tea.review: Really cool place, simple, refreshing boba tea served in glass bottles you get to keep! I got the almond milk tea with boba, it tasted great wouldn't change a thing about it.

excerpts: Got the Oolong milk tea and honeydew milk
but there was no distinct tea flavor for the milk tea and the honeydew didn't taste...
right?
Nothing stood out.
milk tea.author: Windy L.
milk tea.review:
Sadly, it's just another hype. It's not worth the price or wait. 

The cool thing is the bottle that comes with the drink but the drink itself is alright. Got the Oolong milk tea and honeydew milk but there was no distinct tea flavor for the milk tea and the honeydew didn't taste...right? Nothing stood out.
Aside the bottle, the boba is actually soft and really chewy which is a plus! 

Btw..the bottles do run out and when they do, they give you 20% off - but if they don't give you the bottle, it's honestly not worth getting.

excerpts: I have had fresh fruit milks and the milk tea with tapioca.
Everything I have had here has been delicious!
milk tea.author: Suzie Y.
milk tea.review:
A great place in the Financial District!  I have had fresh fruit milks and the milk tea with tapioca.  Everything I have had here has been delicious!  The lines are long and it's interesting watching someone chop fresh fruit with a little plastic knife.  

The bottles are cute, although there is a production problem right now, so they only have 300 bottles available a day.  If you take the bottle back, you get a 20% discount, but if you get a plastic cup instead, you also get a 20% discount.  

I have met tourists in line, people who drove from the East Bay, Peninsula, etc., so that they can give this place a try.  

This is one of my favorite places for bubble teas, but it is very tempting to go here often since it is just a block away from the office.

excerpts: I ordered a strawberry milk tea and the unagi donburi.
After ordering, of course I had to wait a while for my food and my drink.
There was only 2 people working at the time.
1 girl who was taking orders and making drinks, and another girl in the back prepping the food.
I would've given this place 4 stars
but I decided to give it 3 stars because the wait time was really long.
I really liked the milk tea.
It was very flavorful and you can really taste the tea compared to most of the other boba places.
The unagi bowl was pretty good.
It had just enough teriyaki sauce on it.
The pricing of their drinks is a little on the steep side
but then again you are paying for the glass container.
Most definitely I will come back again.
milk tea.author: Marc U.
milk tea.review: I heard so many good things about this place so I figured to try it out.  I have been meaning to come here but every time I come up to the city I never have time to stop by.  Now that I work in the city, I can finally be able to come here whenever I want.  When I first arrived, I noticed that there was a line. Before I could order, I had to wait about 20 minutes.  I ordered a strawberry milk tea and the unagi donburi.  After ordering, of course I had to wait a while for my food and my drink.  There was only 2 people working at the time.  1 girl who was taking orders and making drinks, and another girl in the back prepping the food.  I would've given this place 4 stars but I decided to give it 3 stars because the wait time was really long. I really liked the milk tea.  It was very flavorful and you can really taste the tea compared to most of the other boba places. The unagi bowl was pretty good.  It had just enough teriyaki sauce on it. The pricing of their drinks is a little on the steep side but then again you are paying for the glass container. Most definitely I will come back again.

excerpts: The oolong milk tea is life!
My absolute favorite tea place compared to share tea and boba guys.
Bring back your glass bottle for a 10% discount too.
milk tea.author: Deandra S.
milk tea.review: The oolong milk tea is life! My absolute favorite tea place compared to share tea and boba guys. Bring back your glass bottle for a 10% discount too.

excerpts: Got green milk tea w/ boba, nothing special.
I have to say, kobe bento's $2 milk teas @Chinatown taste better than this.
Doesn't worth $5.44 at all, guess I'm just paying for the cup..
And the boba has a plastic after taste..
Soooo NASTY....
milk tea.author: Sharie H.
milk tea.review: Got green milk tea w/ boba, nothing special. I have to say, kobe bento's $2 milk teas @Chinatown taste better than this. Doesn't worth $5.44 at all, guess I'm just paying for the cup.. And the boba has a plastic after taste.. Soooo NASTY....

excerpts: Milk tea not bad.
This time I got the black milk tea with grass jelly.
milk tea.author: serene h.
milk tea.review:
Milk tea not bad. This time I got the black milk tea with grass jelly. I like the jar and how you can bring it home.

I came here long ago and got a sandwich then but couldn't remember which so I asked the worker for his recommendation it which was popular. Got a hot pastrami sandwich and that was what brought my rating down. It had an off taste to it but didn't know what it was. Waffle was also pretty soft. If I come back, probably only getting the drinks.

Atmosphere wise, I like how there is an upstairs for u to sit, but once more ppl started coming in then it got pretty noisy. However, thumbs up for the worker kicking out this really loud homeless person that walked in

excerpts: My friend and I had the Thai milk tea and peach fresh fruit tea
and they were pretty good!
The Thai tea was standard and I loved the fruit bits in the peach tea.
Nothing special but definitely better than many boba chains + the bottles are great!
Definitely kept mine for whenever I come back.
Also the store and it's deco is very minimalist and appealing!
One star off because we had to clean up one of the tables upstairs on our own
and I noticed there were other tables that also haven't been cleaned.
milk tea.author: Sandy N.
milk tea.review: My friend and I had the Thai milk tea and peach fresh fruit tea and they were pretty good! The Thai tea was standard and I loved the fruit bits in the peach tea. Nothing special but definitely better than many boba chains + the bottles are great! Definitely kept mine for whenever I come back. Also the store and it's deco is very minimalist and appealing! One star off because we had to clean up one of the tables upstairs on our own and I noticed there were other tables that also haven't been cleaned.

excerpts: The black milk tea was one of the best I've had before.
It was perfectly sweet and the boba was perfectly chewy to me
AND they didn't run out of the glass bottles this time!
Haha
milk tea.author: Jamie J.
milk tea.review: I've been here twice now, and I didn't enjoy my drink that I got the first time. It was too bitter and watery AND they ran out of the glass bottles (which I won't deny I came here for in the first place). So, as I passed it again a second time a few months later, I decided to give it another chance. The black milk tea was one of the best I've had before. It was perfectly sweet and the boba was perfectly chewy to me AND they didn't run out of the glass bottles this time! Haha

excerpts: I love the Oolong Milk Tea with honey boba.
The tea is strong and very good.
Also the tea is not very sweet.
The honey boba has a very good consistency and they are very soft.
I would definitely come to Plentea if you have never been.
milk tea.author: Taya S.
milk tea.review: Plentea, I love you! I love the Oolong Milk Tea with honey boba. The tea is strong and very good. Also the tea is not very sweet.The honey boba has a very good consistency and they are very soft. I would definitely come to Plentea if you have never been.

excerpts: My husband took me here, and we order caramel milk tea and black sugar milk tea both with boba.
It was a little bit sweet, and cannot be adjusted.
milk tea.author: Abby L.
milk tea.review:
My husband took me here, and we order caramel milk tea and black sugar milk tea both with boba. It was a little bit sweet, and cannot be adjusted. 
The boba was nicely cooked, chewy and flavoured. 

But it is still very yummy drink, and I love their glass jugs!!! They are so cute!
Must come by if you have a chance!

excerpts: The milk tea and coffee milk tea were terrible.
No flavor.
The boba were not cooked thoroughly enough.
It's definitely a cool place with great packaging.
Nice to try once.
milk tea.author: david l.
milk tea.review: Their fruit teas are decent. The milk tea and coffee milk tea were terrible. No flavor. The boba were not cooked thoroughly enough. It's definitely a cool place with great packaging. Nice to try once.

excerpts: I got the green milk tea here, it was pretty good
but it wasn't sweet enough.
So I asked the workers to add more sweetness, it was so much better after.
The crema milk tea isn't so good
but that's just me
, I recommend to be adventures with the flavors !
milk tea.author: Shayla N.
milk tea.review: I got the green milk tea here, it was pretty good but it wasn't sweet enough. So I asked the workers to add more sweetness, it was so much better after. The crema milk tea isn't so good but that's just me, I recommend to be adventures with the flavors !

excerpts: I love their milk tea.
I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and their milk tea was not too sweet and their topioca was chewy just how I like it.
Love their glass jar that the drink comes in with.
Definitely going to reuse the jar!
Will recommend!
milk tea.author: Nancy L.
milk tea.review: I love their milk tea. I ordered a black milk tea with tapioca and their milk tea was not too sweet and their topioca was chewy just how I like it. Love their glass jar that the drink comes in with. Definitely going to reuse the jar! Will recommend!

excerpts: Then I gave it one more try with the plain milk tea (no bubbles!)
and finally had a pleasant experience.
It tasted similar to the Kirin brand (Japanese) bottled milk tea, which is sort of a premium drink that you can buy from Asian supermarkets.
At the end of the day, I'm not sure if there was a quality control issue, or only a few products were good.
milk tea.author: Peter H.
milk tea.review:
When there is a different bubble tea shop on every street block, Plentea certainly has come up with a creative marketing strategy with its own branded glass bottles.

Can't say there's much more to it.  I came here twice and got two fruity teas and were quite disappointed both times.  They looked nice but didn't taste good at all... speaking of being able to get more for less at the more established places like Cool Tea Bar!  And two of my friends had all their bubbles stuck together in a way that just looked nasty.  They didn't like the taste of their drinks, either.

Then I gave it one more try with the plain milk tea (no bubbles!) and finally had a pleasant experience.  It tasted similar to the Kirin brand (Japanese) bottled milk tea, which is sort of a premium drink that you can buy from Asian supermarkets.  At the end of the day, I'm not sure if there was a quality control issue, or only a few products were good.

excerpts: I got the oolong milk tea and it was really nothing special.
For almost $5, you get a cool glass bottle but the actual milk tea isn't spectacular.
It lacked body and the tea to milk ratio was off.
I'd probably go back if I was in the area and wanted milk tea
but it's nothing to rave about.
milk tea.author: Maggi K.
milk tea.review: I feel like Plentea is another boba gimmick - a punny name containing the word "tea" and "free" glass containers (I'm looking at you - mason jar boba joints!!). I got the oolong milk tea and it was really nothing special. For almost $5, you get a cool glass bottle but the actual milk tea isn't spectacular. It lacked body and the tea to milk ratio was off. I'd probably go back if I was in the area and wanted milk tea but it's nothing to rave about.

excerpts: the drink I got which was mango ice milk tea was ok
, It could be better.
The pearls isn't soft enough, but I'm coming back to try other drinks
And hopefully it is better.
milk tea.author: Leslie N.
milk tea.review: I dont get the hype of this place but it is a Super cute place! I love how they give our drinks in glass jars, super creative and usable ;) the drink I got which was mango ice milk tea was ok, It could be better. The pearls isn't soft enough, but I'm coming back to try other drinks And hopefully it is better.

excerpts: The drinks (matcha green milk tea, jasmine milk tea) were overall too sweet, and nothing particularly remarkable, especially for the price (expensive!) .
I haven't tried any of the teas without milk, so I can't say anything about the quality of their teas alone, but better boba places exist.
milk tea.author: Courtney N.
milk tea.review:
The most adorable thing about this place is that you get your boba in milk bottles. Milk bottles! Real life milk bottles that you can take home and fill with...whatever you want, I suppose. The decor itself is pretty standard, perhaps a step up from most boba places, and there's upstairs seating, which isn't cleaned very often, so you might have to use some napkins to wipe down tables before sitting down. 

The pearls...not quite the right consistency. The lychee jelly was too stiff. The drinks (matcha green milk tea, jasmine milk tea) were overall too sweet, and nothing particularly remarkable, especially for the price (expensive!) . I haven't tried any of the teas without milk, so I can't say anything about the quality of their teas alone, but better boba places exist.

excerpts: I love their oolong milk tea
but Thai milk tea is gross..
Doesn't have that special taste in it
and it's too sweet.
A little too pricey for a milk tea and the price for a smoothie is wayyyyy too much
milk tea.author: Anna L.
milk tea.review:
Well first of all I went with my friends because of their fancy glass bottles. It's cool how we get to keep them. 
I love their oolong milk tea but Thai milk tea is gross.. Doesn't have that special taste in it and it's too sweet. 
A little too pricey for a milk tea and the price for a smoothie is wayyyyy too much 

Also need faster services!

excerpts: All the workers were really friendly, the oolong milk tea succeeded my expectations, and the glass bottles were definitely a plus
milk tea.author: Kiki M.
milk tea.review: All the workers were really friendly, the oolong milk tea succeeded my expectations, and the glass bottles were definitely a plus

excerpts: I got a fresh mango milk tea with boba for $6.25.
They grind ice with their milk tea and frankly it was not worth having to walk up 2 blocks :(.
The boba was way too hard and I ended up just putting my straw at the top of my drink to not get any boba.
The mango milk tea was pretty good, it was sweet
but I was expecting more actual milk tea not it to be blended in with ice.
Also I had a lot of ice chunks which annoyed me.
Only good thing was the glass jar that I got.
But even that was sticky!
Sigh I probably won't be back for this drink but may try their other drinks if my friends convince me to come back.
milk tea.author: Sarah K.
milk tea.review: I got a fresh mango milk tea with boba for $6.25. They grind ice with their milk tea and frankly it was not worth having to walk up 2 blocks :(. The boba was way too hard and I ended up just putting my straw at the top of my drink to not get any boba. The mango milk tea was pretty good, it was sweet but I was expecting more actual milk tea not it to be blended in with ice. Also I had a lot of ice chunks which annoyed me. Only good thing was the glass jar that I got. But even that was sticky! Sigh I probably won't be back for this drink but may try their other drinks if my friends convince me to come back.

excerpts: The oolong milk tea is very good.
milk tea.author: Xavier S.
milk tea.review: The oolong milk tea is very good. I also tried my friend's caramel ice milk and it was fantastic. I will be visiting again soon.

excerpts: I always get the taro milk tea and it has a smoothie texture to it with what seem like little pieces of taro!
Also the tapioca tastes more "natural" too somehow.
milk tea.author: A S.
milk tea.review: This is the best bubble tea I've ever had and the cute glass jars are an added bonus. I always get the taro milk tea and it has a smoothie texture to it with what seem like little pieces of taro! Also the tapioca tastes more "natural" too somehow.

excerpts: As a Bay Area teenager, I've been to my fair share of amazing milk tea joints.
Plentea is definitely on the top of my list.
milk tea.author: Larissa Q.
milk tea.review: As a Bay Area teenager, I've been to my fair share of amazing milk tea joints. Plentea is definitely on the top of my list. I had the mango green tea that came with mango chunks and it had the perfect amount of sweetness. Its fairly hard to get the perfect proportion of when it comes to tea but Plentea was pretty successful. Its also a bonus that we get to keep their beautiful glass bottles.

excerpts: All the ingredients they used are fresh, I like the taro milk tea the most
, it's very creamy and tasty, if you have a chance to pass by this tea shop, you might want a healthy and also tasty tea!
milk tea.author: Penny L.
milk tea.review: All the ingredients they used are fresh, I like the taro milk tea the most, it's very creamy and tasty, if you have a chance to pass by this tea shop, you might want a healthy and also tasty tea!

excerpts: The Black Milk Tea is crazy bad!
I just could not drink it.
It was bitter, tasted like coffee, and left such a bad taste in my mouth.
It's kind of like vodka.
milk tea.author: John H.
milk tea.review:
It literally took me at least 2 hours to finish my drink. I was drinking it for dear life, not wanting to waste a good $5 for a SMALL, low-quality drink.

Listen to the reviews on here. That was my mistake. The Black Milk Tea is crazy bad! I just could not drink it. It was bitter, tasted like coffee, and left such a bad taste in my mouth. It's kind of like vodka. You can't drink a lot of it at once or your mouth and throat will hate you.

The boba was tasteless. They were extremely tiny, which I hate, and tasted like plastic. Low quality drink + low quality boba equals an unhappy customer. Plus, the price was extremely high, all for nothing.

It's all hype. Plain and simple.

Additionally, my friend and I (whom of which had the same exact drink) both felt extremely jittery because of the strength of the drink. I experienced a bit of anxiety and a fast heartbeat because of it. Definitely not fun! 

I would choose Quickly over this place any day!
