P.S. There is a 10% discount for getting plastic cups. The funny part about it is that it's not really a full 10%, because my check was for $16 and instead of $1.60 off, I got $1 off. CHEAP! Lastly, they require a minimum purchase of $15 to use credit cards. I've never heard of such a high requirement for spending. All these tactics used to make dough for this shop. Uncool! The whole "bring your jar in for 10% off" means nothing because prices are sky high to begin with!

excerpts: The milk tea is very refreshing and delicious.
It can be a bit slow at times and there's always a line.
The bottle is so cute and you can get extra caps by the door.
There's extra seating upstairs
so you can enjoy a nice meal there.
milk tea.author: Ziyao Y.
milk tea.review: The milk tea is very refreshing and delicious. It can be a bit slow at times and there's always a line. The bottle is so cute and you can get extra caps by the door. There's extra seating upstairs so you can enjoy a nice meal there.

excerpts: I usually just get their regular milk tea (Green tea or Thai tea) with boba or pudding, which have been consistently great each time I go.
In terms of price, it can be a little overpriced ($4.50 for regular milk tea w/o toppings).
But overall I love coming to Plentea and definitely recommend trying it out!
milk tea.author: Stephanie H.
milk tea.review:
I love coming here whenever I'm in the area. Their glass bottles are absolutely adorable, and you get a discount on your drink when you bring in your bottle again! I usually just get their regular milk tea (Green tea or Thai tea) with boba or pudding, which have been consistently great each time I go. During my last visit I tried their Matcha Milk Green Tea, which was a little too sweet for me (I ended up not finishing it because it was too sweet!).

In terms of price, it can be a little overpriced ($4.50 for regular milk tea w/o toppings). But overall I love coming to Plentea and definitely recommend trying it out!

excerpts: I ordered Iced Taro Milk Tea with Honey Boba.
Tasted ok, certainly not the best, but definitely not the worst.
They have quite an extensive selection of drinks and a more limited selection for snacks.
The lines were pretty long, waited around a good 20ish minutes?
Quite honestly I just came here for the glass bottle, I think I liked the glass bottle itself more than my drink.
If you bring your bottle back next time, you get a 10% discount.
milk tea.author: Xin W.
milk tea.review: I ordered Iced Taro Milk Tea with Honey Boba. Tasted ok, certainly not the best, but definitely not the worst. They have quite an extensive selection of drinks and a more limited selection for snacks. The lines were pretty long, waited around a good 20ish minutes? Quite honestly I just came here for the glass bottle, I think I liked the glass bottle itself more than my drink. If you bring your bottle back next time, you get a 10% discount.

excerpts: Stopped by during lunch for Thai Milk Tea.
Tastes good, comes in reusable glass bottle with plastic top.
milk tea.author: Cecilia J.
milk tea.review: Stopped by during lunch for Thai Milk Tea. Tastes good, comes in reusable glass bottle with plastic top.

excerpts: and I love their milk tea especially the taro milk tea.
And they have good customer service and they give me good deals too!
I love plentea
milk tea.author: Jessi L.
milk tea.review: I love plentea they have those little jar that's so cute and I love their milk tea especially the taro milk tea. And they have good customer service and they give me good deals too! I love plentea

excerpts: The Nutella Milk Tea is so bomb
I can't even begin to describe my obsession-but don't forget to grab a lid to shake!
The fresh fruit teas: all are seriously incredible.
I have never been to a place that puts real fruit in the teas
and it's just an added touch of love to the things.
My favorite is a toss up between the mango and strawberry.
The honey lemon tea.
That's all.
Cute little limes floating in there really just help the citrus-y flavors come alive and is just a really awesome tea.
For the slushes, I've heard that you have to try the avocado, but I've only had the blueberry.
SO GOOD.
Toppings:
I love the aloe and the boba, but it's a real bummer that it costs extra:/ kinda disappointing since the drinks average $5 a piece.
The employees- AWESOME.
I've never had a bad experience there and they are always so accommodating and nice!
I've never had any sort of negative interaction with any of the people that work there.
It's very inviting and makes it easy to come back(embarrassingly frequently).
This place is all around really cute, it's small but for a takeout tea place in the city you'd be crazy not to expect that.
Parking can also be crazy, if you don't find yourself walking there nearby
it's not good to go noon-1 on weekdays because it's the financial district and everyone insists on taking their lunch.
But just about halfway down on the next block, there's a parking garage that's not too expensive and the employees there are very nice as well!
Overall, a very awesome place:)
milk tea.author: Nina P.
milk tea.review:
This place is seriously the source of my happiness. 
The Nutella Milk Tea is so bomb I can't even begin to describe my obsession-but don't forget to grab a lid to shake! 
The fresh fruit teas: all are seriously incredible. I have never been to a place that puts real fruit in the teas and it's just an added touch of love to the things. My favorite is a toss up between the mango and strawberry. 
The honey lemon tea. That's all. 10/10. Cute little limes floating in there really just help the citrus-y flavors come alive and is just a really awesome tea. 
For the slushes, I've heard that you have to try the avocado, but I've only had the blueberry. SO GOOD. 
Toppings: I love the aloe and the boba, but it's a real bummer that it costs extra:/ kinda disappointing since the drinks average $5 a piece. 
The employees- AWESOME. I've never had a bad experience there and they are always so accommodating and nice! I've never had any sort of negative interaction with any of the people that work there. It's very inviting and makes it easy to come back(embarrassingly frequently). 
This place is all around really cute, it's small but for a takeout tea place in the city you'd be crazy not to expect that. Parking can also be crazy, if you don't find yourself walking there nearby it's not good to go noon-1 on weekdays because it's the financial district and everyone insists on taking their lunch. But just about halfway down on the next block, there's a parking garage that's not too expensive and the employees there are very nice as well! 
Overall, a very awesome place:)

excerpts: It's not the worse milk tea place I've had (that place is also in SF ), buts also not the best.
I got an Oolong milk tea for my brother and that tasted better, but again, I've had better
milk tea.author: Andrew B.
milk tea.review:
My first time here and I had to check out what the hype was all about. That's what it is mainly... A hype. It's not the worse milk tea place I've had (that place is also in SF ), buts also not the best. I got one of their popular Ice Milk with Caramel and Boba. Sadly it just tasted like sugary milk with over chewy boba. 
I got an Oolong milk tea for my brother and that tasted better, but again, I've had better and I've had worse. 

It's worth another try. Plus the have desserts!

excerpts: They were out of glass jars and the plastic cups were super flimpsy that my milk tea spilled out.
Average drink and the tapioca balls were too hard.
milk tea.author: Kimmy P.
milk tea.review: 4 people ahead of me take 15 min to order... People were so annoyed they walked out. They were out of glass jars and the plastic cups were super flimpsy that my milk tea spilled out. Average drink and the tapioca balls were too hard.

excerpts: I don't think I'll pay this much or milk tea.
Drinks a bit sweet
so I'll always have to ask for them to make it half
sweeten.
I'll stick to my 2.75 Milk with boba at Wonderful Foods.
milk tea.author: Phuong V.
milk tea.review: Oh god. Have you ever had $6 boba that requires you to spend $15 in order to use CC. Plentea is the epitome of hipster with their fancy glass bottle and logo. I guess since you have a little souvenir to decorate your cubicle in the farm you work. But seriously? I don't think I'll pay this much or milk tea. Drinks a bit sweet so I'll always have to ask for them to make it half sweeten. I'll stick to my 2.75 Milk with boba at Wonderful Foods.

excerpts: Honestly quality wise this is just an okay milk tea place closer to my office and Asha has way better drinks and customer service.
People rave about their glass bottle but to me this is just ridiculous.
It doesn't improve the taste of the drink and instead makes it harder to hold.
Probably my last try here.
Next time when you go just keep in mind you'd probably have to wait twice as much as you think you will.
milk tea.author: Christina H.
milk tea.review: I honestly didn't understand why there's always a long line at this place until I walked in 20:45 tonight. There were 3 ppl in front of me and it took the cashier 15mins to take the 3 orders. By the time I finally finished ordering the line is out of the door. Several people left while the rest of us were waiting and the Plentea ppl said nothing. I brought up the wait issue when I ordered but the girl didn't seem to care. To her customers are supposed to just wait longer when they are training a new staff and that unapologetic attitude bothers me. Honestly quality wise this is just an okay milk tea place closer to my office and Asha has way better drinks and customer service. People rave about their glass bottle but to me this is just ridiculous. It doesn't improve the taste of the drink and instead makes it harder to hold. Probably my last try here. Next time when you go just keep in mind you'd probably have to wait twice as much as you think you will.

excerpts: DELICIOUS milk tea.
You can tell that its brewed very well and not made of any sort of powder.
The glass bottles are so cute and unique!
I love their milk teas, ice milks, and fruit teas.
The price is a little costly but still very worth it.
Decor is super cute and hipster!
I enjoy sitting on the upper level to sip my drink.
Wish they had bigger sizes though!
milk tea.author: Jasmine Q.
milk tea.review: DELICIOUS milk tea. You can tell that its brewed very well and not made of any sort of powder. The glass bottles are so cute and unique! I love their milk teas, ice milks, and fruit teas. The price is a little costly but still very worth it. Decor is super cute and hipster! I enjoy sitting on the upper level to sip my drink. Wish they had bigger sizes though!

excerpts: Come on peeps, u work in fidi, u can't expect to wait that long for one milk tea.
Their priorities: obviously to make money off of stupid jars and with little effort on quality.
I ain't about that life
milk tea.author: Sandra W.
milk tea.review: Wow what a waste of time!  Drinks are ok, but they got 6 ppl in the back still manage to take 15 min to make my drink, which I only got bc the cashier girl recommended it.   They don't even have almond flavor!  So when I had to go and thought a refund would be quicker than getting my drink, that's when they decided to make my drink in less than a min. Come on peeps, u work in fidi, u can't expect to wait that long for one milk tea.  Their priorities: obviously to make money off of stupid jars and with little effort on quality.  I ain't about that life :/

excerpts: I usually get the black milk tea with tapioca and lychee jelly.
I love the jars that use for the tea and if you bring them back you can get a 10% discount.
milk tea.author: William F.
milk tea.review: I really like this place. The lines are pretty long though. I usually get the black milk tea with tapioca and lychee jelly. I love the jars that use for the tea and if you bring them back you can get a 10% discount.

excerpts: I got the milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca.
Tapioca was way too bland for me.
It had no flavor, like little flour balls.
The tea and egg pudding was tasty.
Shouldn't have added the tapioca.
They ran out of the jars, so we ended up with plastic to go cups.
Cashier gave us 10% discount.
The place was way too loud.
I couldn't really hear the cashier, nor could I understand her.
The previous customer gave up and left.
He was practically yelling his  order.
milk tea.author: Andy L.
milk tea.review: This place was ok. I got there when the line was not really that long. i usually drive by and wanted to try it, but it always has a long line. I got the milk tea with egg pudding and tapioca. Tapioca was way too bland for me. It had no flavor, like little flour balls. The tea and egg pudding was tasty. Shouldn't have added the tapioca. They ran out of the jars, so we ended up with plastic to go cups. Cashier gave us 10% discount. The place was way too loud. I couldn't really hear the cashier, nor could I understand her. The previous customer gave up and left. He was practically yelling his  order.

excerpts: The milk tea is pretty good.
The place also looks nice inside and is pretty clean.
The Thai tea is solid.
It's not mind blowing but it gets the job done if you need a milk tea fix (it's probably the best in the area).
I gave one star off because it's pretty expensive for boba!
Just make sure you bring back your glass to get 20% off!
milk tea.author: Gregg H.
milk tea.review: The milk tea is pretty good. The place also looks nice inside and is pretty clean. The Thai tea is solid. It's not mind blowing but it gets the job done if you need a milk tea fix (it's probably the best in the area). I gave one star off because it's pretty expensive for boba! Just make sure you bring back your glass to get 20% off!

excerpts:
Oolong Tea

Milk tea in a glass bottle

Milk tea in a glass bottle

excerpts: Got the green tea milk tea, and it was way better than I expected!
Super fresh
and it actually tasted like the tea.
$5 for good boba and a bottle?
Worth it!
Thank you Plentea.
milk tea.author: Susan H.
milk tea.review: Came here on a short trip to SF. Line was a little long, I loved the upstairs seating and of course the bottle. I actually took it home (don't judge). Got the green tea milk tea, and it was way better than I expected! Super fresh and it actually tasted like the tea. $5 for good boba and a bottle? Worth it! Thank you Plentea.

excerpts: Very good drinks,especially the fresh fruit milk tea.
They put real fruit in it.
I love the bottle as well.
Go green!
The only down side is there is no restroom in the store.
Really?!
milk tea.author: Abby L.
milk tea.review: Very good drinks,especially the fresh fruit milk tea. They put real fruit in it. I love the bottle as well. Go green! The only down side is there is no restroom in the store. Really?!

excerpts: Better for the environment but a lot smaller than a typical milk tea.
Ordered the black milk tea w/ tapioca but
someone right before me got a mango smoothie that looked awesome.
Boba is well done and obviously sweetened like it should be...
Brown sugary goodness! !
milk tea.author: Jessica M.
milk tea.review: Clean decor. Small space packed with peeps til late afternoon.  Double the price of any other boba/dessert spot but their shtick is a reusable glass bottle.  Better for the environment but a lot smaller than a typical milk tea.  Ordered the black milk tea w/ tapioca but someone right before me got a mango smoothie that looked awesome.  Boba is well done and obviously sweetened like it should be...Brown sugary goodness! !

excerpts: Ordered the iced Oolong milk tea both times and the quality was poor.
Having tried all the milk tea establishments in the Bay Area, I would rank this place as below average.
Fantasia is still #1 for me.
Overall, the quality of the tea at Plentea just isn't there
and the execution is unfortunately very inconsistent.
My friend has been here 4-5X and on days the owner is present, it is good and when he's not, quality is sacrificed.
I'm more than willing to pay the premium for a quality product.
milk tea.author: Michelle C.
milk tea.review:
Gave this place two tries and overall, disappointed and I won't be returning.

Ordered the iced Oolong milk tea both times and the quality was poor.  

1st time (owner not present): not much tea taste, was watered down
2nd time (owner present):  better than the first time,  too sweet and not enough ice.   I tossed the drink after a few sips.

Having tried all the milk tea establishments in the Bay Area, I would rank this place as below average.  Fantasia is still #1 for me.  Overall, the quality of the tea at Plentea just isn't there and the execution is unfortunately very inconsistent.  My friend has been here 4-5X and on days the owner is present, it is good and when he's not, quality is sacrificed.  I'm more than willing to pay the premium for a quality product.  But aside from the fancy glass bottle, there isn't anything special with the tea.

Perhaps other drinks are better but if they can't get a simple iced oolong milk right, i'm hesitant to try others.

It's too bad given the place had good potential.  It goes with the trend to differentiate via the glass bottle but at the end of the day, if the quality of the end product isn't there, it'll be challenging for repeat business once the novelty of the place wears off.

excerpts: Tried the iced oolong milk tea without boba and friend ordered the same with boba, but neither of us were impressed with the flavor and quality of the drinks.
milk tea.author: Linda J.
milk tea.review:
Tried the iced oolong milk tea without boba and friend ordered the same with boba, but neither of us were impressed with the flavor and quality of the drinks. Mine was pretty sweet and tasted very watered down, with barely a hint of the actual oolong tea.

The glass bottles are a nice touch, but I agree with another Yelp review that the offer to bring the bottle back should be greater than its current 10% discount on the next drink. I'll probably just end up using it as another mug in my office.

Actual store is nice, very clean, with an upstairs seating area.

Overall, may try to come back and try one of the other drinks, but for $4.50+ per drink, I'll have to be pretty selective of which one to order.

excerpts: I worked in a shop that sold boba and teas (not mentioning where especially since it was awful milk tea) but my drink was done before I even got my receipt to sign.
That's...
odd, I thought.
It was the EXACT SAME TEA we served at my old job.
Probably came from the same bag mix.
Still overly sweet.
Cost $1.50 more than the other trash.
Soooooo overhyped and at least I got a nice milk bottle out of the deal.
milk tea.author: Raven P.
milk tea.review: Well I mean, I know that tea isn't hard to brew. I worked in a shop that sold boba and teas (not mentioning where especially since it was awful milk tea) but my drink was done before I even got my receipt to sign. That's...odd, I thought. It was the EXACT SAME TEA we served at my old job. Probably came from the same bag mix. Still overly sweet. Cost $1.50 more than the other trash. Soooooo overhyped and at least I got a nice milk bottle out of the deal.

excerpts: The concept of serving milk tea in glass bottles already attracts many customers to come and try their boba.
Unfortunately I was not wowed by their flavors and limited selection of drinks.
We ended up using the 25% off offer on Yelp which helped with the costs but probably would not place Plentea as one of my go to spots for milk tea.
The reusable glass bottle though is an incentive where I can see many customers returning for, especially since you get 10% off each time you bring your bottle back.
milk tea.author: Wendy Z.
milk tea.review: The concept of serving milk tea in glass bottles already attracts many customers to come and try their boba. Unfortunately I was not wowed by their flavors and limited selection of drinks. I got the brown sugar ice milk because they said it was one of their more popular drinks. I wanted to adjust my sweetness to 50% but the cashier recommended getting it at regular because "it will defeat the purpose of getting the drink in the first place" and he said it's "not even that sweet anyway." First taste? pretty darn sweet to me! There wasn't anything unique about the drink that would want me to order it again. Prices are slightly more expensive especially since the drink doesn't come with tapioca. We ended up using the 25% off offer on Yelp which helped with the costs but probably would not place Plentea as one of my go to spots for milk tea. The reusable glass bottle though is an incentive where I can see many customers returning for, especially since you get 10% off each time you bring your bottle back.

excerpts: However, they seem a bit inflexible with the menu and the milk teas are already pre-mixed meaning they cannot customize for an unsweetened milk tea drink which most places will do for premium versions including Boba Guys in the Mission.
Here are my +s and -s about this place.
By the way, NO BATHROOM to use!
milk tea.author: Tina C.
milk tea.review:
I heard about this place from my friends' Facebook postings. This is a new bubble tea place and it's pretty solid. However, they seem a bit inflexible with the menu and the milk teas are already pre-mixed meaning they cannot customize for an unsweetened milk tea drink which most places will do for premium versions including Boba Guys in the Mission. Here are my +s and -s about this place. By the way, NO BATHROOM to use! This is important enough that I am going to mention it again under minus.

+ Plus Points
+Comes in a unique glass bottle. Bring the bottle back and get a 10% discount off your next purchase. Comes with cute lids too. Not spill proof, but close to it. Pretty stable placed in my bag although I was watching for spills.
+Great location along 8X MUNI bus line. Very walkable between Fi-Di and Chinatown.  Great lunch choices around the place and also some waffles and organic salad choices here.
+Unique drinks like fresh fruit with milk.
+Trendy ambiance.
+Takes credit card INCLUDING Discover!
+Pretty quick turnover for drinks even when they were busy. I've been twice.
+Steep pricing. Yes, even steeper than Boba Guys in the Mission. Drinks start at $4.50+ tax for regular tea drinks without toppings and go up to $6.95+ tax for the fruit milk drinks. 
+Offers organic salads and waffles. Grand opening deal right now whereby customers get 25% off their lemon honey drink if they order a waffle. Waffles were about $7 bucks.

Minus:
-Ordered a mount premium tea drink which can be unsweetened. However, tell them twice because one of mine came out sweet and I did not know until I got home. They forgot what I told them!
-Gals at the counter were not too creative and flexible with the menu. They really stuck with the menu and at that price, you gotta let customers customize!
-More topping choices beyond boba and pudding would be nice.
-No reward program for frequent drinkers.
-NO Bathroom. Seriously?

excerpts: I drank here for the first time and I ordered the ice green milk tea and the sea salt crema oolong tea, both with pearls.
The sea salt crema oolong tea was good, and had an interesting taste to me because I've never tried a sea salt kind of milk tea before.
The ice green milk tea, however, tasted watered down.
There was a lot of people when I went so maybe they were rushing?
Overall, this place is aight and I'd be glad to come again.
milk tea.author: Huyen L.
milk tea.review: The jars are really cute! I drank here for the first time and I ordered the ice green milk tea and the sea salt crema oolong tea, both with pearls. The sea salt crema oolong tea was good, and had an interesting taste to me because I've never tried a sea salt kind of milk tea before. The ice green milk tea, however, tasted watered down. There was a lot of people when I went so maybe they were rushing? Overall, this place is aight and I'd be glad to come again.

excerpts: This isn't your normal - powdered, overly sweet boba milk tea.
I ordered the original black milk tea with pearls and it was lightly sweetened with the flavor of black tea nicely coming through.
Plus, the bottles are to keep and if you bring it back you get 10% off your next drink.
I say come through, get some really good,
no fuss milk tea and a bottle to-go!
milk tea.author: Krutika D.
milk tea.review: I've had boba before, but not in a glass milk bottle. My friend wanted to come here just for that. But I have to say, the glass milk bottle is definitely why the price for a boba is $4.50, but the tea is quite good. This isn't your normal - powdered, overly sweet boba milk tea. I ordered the original black milk tea with pearls and it was lightly sweetened with the flavor of black tea nicely coming through. Plus, the bottles are to keep and if you bring it back you get 10% off your next drink. I say come through, get some really good, no fuss milk tea and a bottle to-go!

excerpts: My friend declared her black milk tea the best she's ever had!
milk tea.author: Mrs P.
milk tea.review:
Arrived right at 11 a.m. when they opened and there was no line. Ordered caramel ice milk with egg custard and lychee jelly.  Beautiful presentation and delicious liquid dessert for me. My friend declared her black milk tea the best she's ever had!

I noticed fresh papaya and honeydew being cut behind the counter for a fruit drink. Hooray--they use the real stuff!

Definitely paying a premium for these drinks in a glass bottle, but the presentation is outstanding!

excerpts: She even asked if I would like to try Oolong or Black milk tea and that she would be happy to make a switch.
I ended up with a whole new bottle of tea.
milk tea.author: Cleo C.
milk tea.review:
Plentea is a place that is new and is developing. 
So a week or two ago, my boy friend and me went for our daily tea run. We decided to give Plentea another try because there was no line.
I ordered a Milk Green tea and my baby cakes ordered a Fresh fruit Blueberry Milk. My boy friend loved the blueberry one but my green tea tasted very run down. It did not have that amazing bitter taste that I was hoping to experience (I took a few sips from my friend's the first time we went as a group). I was not going to complain but then one of the workers approached me and asked us for our honest opinion, suggestions, or concerns. 
I told her what was up and she thanked me for my input. She even asked if I would like to try Oolong or Black milk tea and that she would be happy to make a switch. I ended up with a whole new bottle of tea. I really liked how the workers valued their customer's input and do not complain/make ugly faces if the customer had one.

Plentea of tea for us that day, lol.

excerpts: The mango fruit milk tea with an egg pudding topping is refreshing yet not excessively sugary.
The iced milk tea with egg pudding (or tapioca) and caramel sugar will remind you of Half-and-Half
milk tea.author: Jack W.
milk tea.review:
This is the closest to LA's Half-and-Half SF has to offer: they use real milk.

Downside is the wait. The line can be 5-10min, and the wait thereafter can be another 5-10min.

The mango fruit milk tea with an egg pudding topping is refreshing yet not excessively sugary. The iced milk tea with egg pudding (or tapioca) and caramel sugar will remind you of Half-and-Half - it's noticeably heavy.

Friendly owner/manager.

excerpts: and I got the taro milk tea which is made with real taro - no artificial powders!
With honey boba.
I will try other drinks in the future.
Because you are paying for the glass bottle the drinks are pricey.
The taro milk tea was 4.95 and boba is additional 50 cents.
Much cheaper in the avenues but a good option if you are downtown and have a milk tea craving.
milk tea.author: Bebe W.
milk tea.review: Plentea has a good variety of drinks to choose from. It was my first time and I got the taro milk tea which is made with real taro - no artificial powders! With honey boba.  I will try other drinks in the future. Because you are paying for the glass bottle the drinks are pricey. The taro milk tea was 4.95 and boba is additional 50 cents. Much cheaper in the avenues but a good option if you are downtown and have a milk tea craving.

excerpts: I went for the honey lemon tea with aloe instead of milk tea.
It was refreshing but didn't stand out from other places I frequent.
milk tea.author: Emily M.
milk tea.review: I came here for the cute jars honestly. The drinks were mediocre... nothing amazing that would make me want to come back. I went for the honey lemon tea with aloe instead of milk tea. It was refreshing but didn't stand out from other places I frequent.

excerpts: My oolong milk tea had A TON of bits.....
Too bad I didn't take my first sip until I was already down in the subway.
Every sip felt like I had some sand in my drink.
I'm really disappointed; I'm really surprised so many people in FIDI come here....
milk tea.author: Theresa M.
milk tea.review: My oolong milk tea had A TON of bits..... Too bad I didn't take my first sip until I was already down in the subway. Every sip felt like I had some sand in my drink. I'm really disappointed; I'm really surprised so many people in FIDI come here....

excerpts: The drinks are average, I always get black milk tea and boba which is soo yummy.
Plus the guy at the counter is super nice!
milk tea.author: Cristelle J.
milk tea.review: I like stealing, let me get this out there.  But the fact that I can get a spiffy glass bottle that i didn't have to swipe with my boba is awesome! The drinks are average, I always get black milk tea and boba which is soo yummy. Plus the guy at the counter is super nice!

excerpts: I had their honeydew milk tea which was pretty good the first time I went, although the second time I got it was just meh.
My friend had their avocado smoothie which was pretty good!
Their bottles are what make them popular more than anything else though, and their drinks average $5+ so it's more expensive than most boba places.
The cashiers have been great whenever I come and they're willing to answer questions/give recommendations.
milk tea.author: Anthony W.
milk tea.review: The line is always out the door when I come here. Two floors for eating in but chances are there won't be anywhere to sit as it's a fairly small place. I had their honeydew milk tea which was pretty good the first time I went, although the second time I got it was just meh. My friend had their avocado smoothie which was pretty good! Their bottles are what make them popular more than anything else though, and their drinks average $5+ so it's more expensive than most boba places. The cashiers have been great whenever I come and they're willing to answer questions/give recommendations.

excerpts: it was good the first time i get the milk tea.
few times later feel like it taste not that good anymore.
the tea is not good., and too sweet too.
milk tea.author: Chia-Pei W.
milk tea.review: it was good the first time i get the milk tea. few times later feel like it taste not that good anymore. the tea is not good., and too sweet too.

excerpts: I got the black milk tea with tapioca pearls.
I liked it despite the  expensive prices.
I guess you mostly pay for the glass bottle that you get to keep.
At least they give you 10% if you bring it in the next time.
milk tea.author: Cathy N.
milk tea.review: I got the black milk tea with tapioca pearls. I liked it despite the  expensive prices. I guess you mostly pay for the glass bottle that you get to keep. At least they give you 10% if you bring it in the next time.

excerpts: I recommend getting the oolong milk tea.. the black tea tastes a bit funky.
i've never actually brought back the bottle for a discount because I've never gone to the city just for the sake of getting a boba refill
and so I'm suckered into paying an extra few bucks for a new one every time - genius.
milk tea.author: Mason T.
milk tea.review: they trick you into liking the place by giving you a cute little bottle that you can show your friends or instagram or whatever, but hey, it works.  the boba itself is actually pretty good.  I recommend getting the oolong milk tea.. the black tea tastes a bit funky.  i've never actually brought back the bottle for a discount because I've never gone to the city just for the sake of getting a boba refill and so I'm suckered into paying an extra few bucks for a new one every time - genius.

excerpts: Best milk tea I've had in SF so far.
Kind of pricey cuhs you're paying for the glass jar.
There's a small selection of drinks and they ran out of like all the food there except the desserts.
Parking sucks also.
milk tea.author: Rana D.
milk tea.review: Best milk tea I've had in SF so far.  Kind of pricey cuhs you're paying for the glass jar.  There's a small selection of drinks and they ran out of like all the food there except the desserts.  Parking sucks also.

excerpts: The Black Milk Tea was very watered down and bland
milk tea.author: Andrew D.
milk tea.review: The Black Milk Tea was very watered down and bland but the Ice Milk with Pudding was really good and saved this place. I like that we got to keep the cool glass jars :)

excerpts: The best milk tea we've tried in years!
A little bit line
but that's how you know you are in a good store.
Their fruit juice are made out of fresh fruit bought daily,love them!
milk tea.author: John W.
milk tea.review: The best milk tea we've tried in years! A little bit line but that's how you know you are in a good store. Their fruit juice are made out of fresh fruit bought daily,love them!

excerpts: 2 weeks ago i bought 2 thai milk tea and 1 red bean green tea.
It was pretty tasty and i love the glass jar.
A girl behind the register
and I didnt pay for extra topping since the milk tea already has pearl in it.

On the next thursday after my 1st visit, i revisit the place and reorder thai milk tea but the guy in register said i hv to pay for extra topping bcoz all beverage doesnt have anything in it (pearl, jelly, etc) unless u add it..
I got confused of how they can charged me differently?
Any of you experience this or just me?
milk tea.author: Windi P.
milk tea.review: 2 weeks ago i bought 2 thai milk tea and 1 red bean green tea. It was pretty tasty and i love the glass jar. A girl behind the register and I didnt pay for extra topping since the milk tea already has pearl in it. On the next thursday after my 1st visit, i revisit the place and reorder thai milk tea but the guy in register said i hv to pay for extra topping bcoz all beverage doesnt have anything in it (pearl, jelly, etc) unless u add it.. I got confused of how they can charged me differently? Any of you experience this or just me?

excerpts: I got the normal milk tea
and it kinda reminded me of Quickly's or Tap X.
Maybe one day I'll try something else, but lets hope it's amazing because the basic, was just...
milk tea.author: Denise L.
milk tea.review:
I went here during my lunch which was from 1:30-2:30. I will never come here during peak hours (which I have no clue what the peak hours are...). I waited for 30 mins just to order. The lines are ridiculous!! 

I was the last one to get those jugs which was pretty lucky/cool. Honestly, the tea was just ok. I got the normal milk tea and it kinda reminded me of Quickly's or Tap X. Maybe one day I'll try something else, but lets hope it's amazing because the basic, was just...ok......

On the plus side, if you bring the jugs back, you get a discount.

excerpts: I got the simple bubble milk tea and it was delicious!

you can easily tell the difference with fresh brewed tea.. my only complaint with tea houses in general is that they use coffeemate instead of milk.. coffeemate has hydrogenated oil which as we all know is not good for us..
my husband got the matcha green tea milk with grass jelly
and it was perfect.
Not too sweet, real milk, it was yumm!
milk tea.author: Aditi A.
milk tea.review:
uh-mazing! I got the simple bubble milk tea and it was delicious! you can easily tell the difference with fresh brewed tea.. my only complaint with tea houses in general is that they use coffeemate instead of milk.. coffeemate has hydrogenated oil which as we all know is not good for us.. 
my husband got the matcha green tea milk with grass jelly and it was perfect. Not too sweet, real milk, it was yumm!

excerpts: The last time I was there took me 45 minutes to get a milk tea.
I didn't know that they were picking tea leaves in the back and making tea from scratch.
milk tea.author: Joe C.
milk tea.review: They get two stars because they sell a genuinely good product, but other  they need to do something about their line. The last time I was there took me 45 minutes to get a milk tea. I didn't know that they were picking tea leaves in the back and making tea from scratch.

excerpts: I ordered the oolong milk tea.
It was pretty good
but I seemed to have finished it pretty quick even though the bottle looks quite big.
A bit pricey but not bad.
I'll try a different one next time
I'm in the area.
milk tea.author: Raymond C.
milk tea.review: Walking on this particular street, I've noticed every now and then passerbys drinking out of what looks like a glass jar, which caught my attention.  I couldn't help but finally give it a try one day since the lines usually turn me away.  Surprisingly, for my first time the wait wasn't that bad and I actually got my drink pretty quickly.  I ordered the oolong milk tea.  It was pretty good but I seemed to have finished it pretty quick even though the bottle looks quite big.  A bit pricey but not bad.  I'll try a different one next time I'm in the area.

excerpts: We ordered the salted crema w oolong without hesitation, but wanted to get creative with the second drink but settled with the Thai milk tea w boba.
The salted crema was different than other salted cremas and foams, as this one was like whipped cream floating on top, but it was so good.
We did wish they had given us more of it, though, because it's just a small dollop of it
and it wasn't the most easy thing to get at with the smaller opening of the milk bottle.
We also found out that the fruit milks use whole milks, while the milk teas use coffee mate or creamers, and you can sub for Soy Milk, except for the Thai milk tea.
They also offer sugar level modifications, which is great.
The Salted Crema Oolong was awesome with just 25% sweetness.
I was also surprised that this place opened late on a Sunday night, considering the surrounding location is pretty dead after normal business hours and days.
They offer 10% off if you bring back your glass bottle to reuse, also a discount if you use plastic cups.
The glass jugs are quite a waste of resources, but it is such a draw.
It's highly unlikely that the everyday customer will have their glass with them on hand, unless they actually work in the FiDi or Soma area.
Luckily, I do, and will be back to try the Taro milk teas and fruit milks.
milk tea.author: Vivian L.
milk tea.review:
Honestly, I've had my eye on this place since it opened and the biggest draw was definitely the glass jug the drinks come in. I'm sure the initial draw for everyone is the novelty of the glass jug, but I'm glad the drinks didn't disappoint.
   We ordered the salted crema w oolong without hesitation, but wanted to get creative with the second drink but settled with the Thai milk tea w boba. The salted crema was different than other salted cremas and foams, as this one was like whipped cream floating on top, but it was so good. We did wish they had given us more of it, though, because it's just a small dollop of it and it wasn't the most easy thing to get at with the smaller opening of the milk bottle. 
   We also found out that the fruit milks use whole milks, while the milk teas use coffee mate or creamers, and you can sub for Soy Milk, except for the Thai milk tea. They also offer sugar level modifications, which is great. The Salted Crema Oolong was awesome with just 25% sweetness.
   I was also surprised that this place opened late on a Sunday night, considering the surrounding location is pretty dead after normal business hours and days. They offer 10% off if you bring back your glass bottle to reuse, also a discount if you use plastic cups. The glass jugs are quite a waste of resources, but it is such a draw. It's highly unlikely that the everyday customer will have their glass with them on hand, unless they actually work in the FiDi or Soma area. Luckily, I do, and will be back to try the Taro milk teas and fruit milks.

excerpts: Mediocre black milk tea.
milk tea.author: Jtina K.
milk tea.review:
Mediocre black milk tea. There was a lot of tea settlement at the bottom of my milk jug.

The grass jelly texture was off. It was more like agar jelly then soft grass jelly.

3 Stars because the bottle idea is pretty awesome!

excerpts: We got a regular milk tea and an oolong creme.
I thought the milk tea wasn't too bad, but the other one was just a tad bit sweet for my taste.
The bottle was pretty nice, but not sure if it's still worth the price.
I don't think it's a place that I will frequent.
milk tea.author: Amimee D.
milk tea.review:
It seems like boba places have been popping up left and right. Even if there's already two or three places that have already set up shop in very close proximity. For me, I'm a sucker for those cute glass jars. I also found the name to be really cute and clever as well.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while now, but it's just out of the way for me. But i finally went with a friend who came over from the East Bay to grab lunch. We were in line for about 15 minutes, I guess that's not too bad if you're not in a hurry.

We got a regular milk tea and an oolong creme. I thought the milk tea wasn't too bad, but the other one was just a tad bit sweet for my taste. The bottle was pretty nice, but not sure if it's still worth the price. I don't think it's a place that I will frequent.

excerpts: The milk tea here is kind of watered down a lot now.
It used to be good when it first opened.
Also, there milk tea seems to carry more caffeine than other boba places.
What made/makes this place notable was that it came in glass bottles but now the owners can't seem to keep up with demand so either they don't carry them anymore in that or they charge you extra.
I forget which.
Trash now, ownership really sinks this place down.
2 stars because their milk tea USED to be really really good.
milk tea.author: Anonymous ?.
milk tea.review: The milk tea here is kind of watered down a lot now. It used to be good when it first opened. Also, there milk tea seems to carry more caffeine than other boba places. What made/makes this place notable was that it came in glass bottles but now the owners can't seem to keep up with demand so either they don't carry them anymore in that or they charge you extra. I forget which. Trash now, ownership really sinks this place down. 2 stars because their milk tea USED to be really really good.

excerpts: They have their usual milk tea
but you can add yogurt, salted caramel creme and other different
add ons to your drink.
We tried the fresh fruit tea that you can pick different types of tea Oolong, green and black were some of the choices not to mention you can add boba, jelly, aloe, etc.
Cool twist on the norm
and it even comes in a glass jar although it didn't fit in our cup holder.
It's a little pricier than most places and the line can be a bit long but cool to experience.
milk tea.author: T L.
milk tea.review: Cool spot to get some refreshments and maybe a snack. Unique twist on boba tea. They have their usual milk tea but you can add yogurt, salted caramel creme and other different add ons to your drink. We tried the fresh fruit tea that you can pick different types of tea Oolong, green and black were some of the choices not to mention you can add boba, jelly, aloe, etc. Cool twist on the norm and it even comes in a glass jar although it didn't fit in our cup holder. It's a little pricier than most places and the line can be a bit long but cool to experience.

excerpts: She wasn't really pleasant and just seemed to brush me off...not really good customer service...to not be the jerk holding up the line I ordered the Peach milk tea with bobba...
I really love the glass bottle touch, I can always re-use it for my morning smoothies so it didn't bug me that they charged $5.93..
The tea itself was really sweet for my taste and not cold enough...
It tasted like a super sweet peach milk drink...
nothing special...
I prefer the bobba drinks at Quickly in China town they never disappoint.
So all in all I think its more the hype than anything...
Although I will come back to try their green tea and waffle sandwich..they may be better.
milk tea.author: Lia B.
milk tea.review:
Finally decided to come here to see what all the hype is about...I arrived about 10 minutes before they opened and there was already six people ahead of me..the line moved along pretty fast...when I got to the front I asked the girl what she recommended...She wasn't really pleasant and just seemed to brush me off...not really good customer service...to not be the jerk holding up the line I ordered the Peach milk tea with bobba...
I really love the glass bottle touch, I can always re-use it for my morning smoothies so it didn't bug me that they charged $5.93..The tea itself was really sweet for my taste and not cold enough...It tasted like a super sweet peach milk drink...nothing special...I prefer the bobba drinks at Quickly in China town they never disappoint. 
So all in all I think its more the hype than anything...Although I will come back to try their green tea and waffle sandwich..they may be better.

excerpts: Don't order the almond milk tea or the coffmilk tea.
The almond milk tea tasted like they dumped a couple teaspoons of almond extract in milk tea.
They did offer us a new drink for free.
We got the regular green milk tea, which was significantly better.
milk tea.author: Liz D.
milk tea.review: Don't order the almond milk tea or the coffmilk tea. The almond milk tea tasted like they dumped a couple teaspoons of almond extract in milk tea. They did offer us a new drink for free. We got the regular green milk tea, which was significantly better.

excerpts: Love their brown sugar milk tea!
My fave :)
milk tea.author: G. G.
milk tea.review: Not a fan of the lunch-time long lines, but the drinks make up for it! Love their brown sugar milk tea! My fave :)

excerpts: Got the milk tea with boba, very average.
Cool glass bottle for your boba at a premium though.
milk tea.author: Jeannie C.
milk tea.review: Got the milk tea with boba, very average.  Cool glass bottle for your boba at a premium though.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the basic black milk tea and I ordered the matcha milk tea with boba.
The drinks are served in cute glass bottles.
Unfortunately, despite the cute packaging, the drinks were just average.
Next time, I'm in SF, I want to try a different place.
milk tea.author: joanne c.
milk tea.review: Tried this place yesterday with my boyfriend because it was close to sushiritto. The line here was ridiculous. They really need a second cashier. My boyfriend ordered the basic black milk tea and I ordered the matcha milk tea with boba. The drinks are served in cute glass bottles. Unfortunately, despite the cute packaging, the drinks were just average. Next time, I'm in SF, I want to try a different place.

excerpts: After working at a place making milk tea from powders and sugar solution I've become very picky about my milk teas.
Namely that they shouldn't taste like sugar and powder.
So I got the green tea ice milk tea with 75% sweetness.
milk tea.author: Sekhmet S.
milk tea.review:
After working at a place making milk tea from powders and sugar solution I've become very picky about my milk teas. Namely that they shouldn't taste like sugar and powder. This place definitely meets my expectations, real tea!

Reusable glass bottles is a great idea. I'll be brining mine back tomorrow for more and a lovely discount for bringing it back!

I asked if I could have it less sweet and apparently you can choose any percentage of sweetness! So I got the green tea ice milk tea with 75% sweetness. Very delicious!

I also got to try the Oolong sea salt crema tea, which was good too.

I'll definitely be back many times to try all the flavors... maybe add the honey tapioca next

excerpts: Ended up getting a black milk tea with lychee jelly and fresh peach black tea with boba for $11.00 I drink boba literally everyday from a variety of places and this one was by far not worth the walk nor the price.
milk tea.author: Adrienne C.
milk tea.review:
This is a review of the quality of the drink because, no, I did not go for the souvenir glass. ( To be real, I am not going to carry it around all day or ever bring it back ) 

Went in Thursday afternoon at 5PM with a very short line. Ended up getting a black milk tea with lychee jelly and fresh peach black tea with boba for $11.00 I drink boba literally everyday from a variety of places and this one was by far not worth the walk nor the price. Very forgettable. 

Its all a big ( genius ) marketing ploy like a bunch of other asian places...

excerpts: I got the brown sugar milk tea with boba in the milk bottle.
I honestly got it for the milk bottle
but I noticed their "300 a day until July" sign
so I have to go back and get more!
The boba is very soft and chewy but their milk tea was kind of sweet, even if it was brown sugar.
I think i would definitely go back to this place once this place mellows down.
milk tea.author: Jessica Mae T.
milk tea.review: Tried this place for the first time! Line wasn't as long as what I thought it would be and the cashier rang up the customers in a timely manner.  I got the brown sugar milk tea with boba in the milk bottle.  I honestly got it for the milk bottle but I noticed their "300 a day until July" sign so I have to go back and get more!  The boba is very soft and chewy but their milk tea was kind of sweet, even if it was brown sugar.  I think i would definitely go back to this place once this place mellows down.  :)

excerpts: but I want to try their milk tea next time.
milk tea.author: Jennie W.
milk tea.review: We had the tea here in plastic to go cups because they ran out of the glass ones. The peach oolong tea was very fragrant. Overall taste is good but I want to try their milk tea next time.

excerpts: $4.50 for milk tea plus 50 cents each topping.
Essentially you are paying for the glass bottle with your drink.
Lines are shorter in the evening than afternoon.
milk tea.author: Ann H.
milk tea.review:
The milk green tea, crema oolong, and avocado smoothie were all tasty. The boba was too sweet however. 

The plastic caps on the glass bottles don't seal well and leaked in my bag.

Prices are on the expensive side. $4.50 for milk tea plus 50 cents each topping. Essentially you are paying for the glass bottle with your drink. Lines are shorter in the evening than afternoon.

excerpts: The iced Oolong milk tea with grass jelly and egg pudding was decllous!
The drink is pricey, at $5.98 with sales tax, but I can see why as it comes with a reusble glass container.
milk tea.author: Anne T.
milk tea.review: The iced Oolong milk tea with grass jelly and egg pudding was decllous! The drink is pricey, at $5.98 with sales tax, but I can see why as it comes with a reusble glass container.

excerpts: I ordered an iced milk and a jasmine milk tea.
Their iced milk with egg pudding is delicious.
It's not watered down
and it's the perfect amount of sweetness.
The jasmine milk tea was alright, and their tapioca was kind of a little too soft, but overall not that bad.
It's kind if pricey, but the glass bottles makes it worth it.
Would definitely come again and reuse my bottle for a discount.
milk tea.author: Ivy P.
milk tea.review: I came here on a Tuesday afternoon,  so it wasn't too busy and the line wasn't that long. I ordered an iced milk and a jasmine milk tea. Their iced milk with egg pudding is delicious. It's not watered down and it's the perfect amount of sweetness. The jasmine milk tea was alright, and their tapioca was kind of a little too soft, but overall not that bad. It's kind if pricey, but the glass bottles makes it worth it. Would definitely come again and reuse my bottle for a discount.

excerpts: They serve milk tea in glass bottles.
That you can keep.
That had me sold pretty quickly, so I went just to try it out.
It is a little pricey ($5 for a milk tea with pearls), but it's 20% off the next time you come back if you bring the bottle.
As a warning, I'm a huge pearl milk tea snob.
The milk tea was too sweet for me, cause I prefer a heavy tea flavor in my milk teas with just the right amount of milk to take off any bitter edge it has.
And maybe some milk tea as well.
milk tea.author: Tommy H.
milk tea.review:
They serve milk tea in glass bottles.  That you can keep.  That had me sold pretty quickly, so I went just to try it out.  It is a little pricey ($5 for a milk tea with pearls), but it's 20% off the next time you come back if you bring the bottle.

As a warning, I'm a huge pearl milk tea snob.

The milk tea was too sweet for me, cause I prefer a heavy tea flavor in my milk teas with just the right amount of milk to take off any bitter edge it has.  It was good though, just nothing special.

The tapioca was better than most places actually!  They were chewy instead of the hard pearls I've had many times in other places, and the pearls actually had flavor from tapioca syrup.

There's food here too that I didn't get the chance to try, but overall it seemed like a pretty good spot to sit and chat with some friends (in the upstairs seating).  There seems to be a line most of the day, but it's not too bad.  They only have a limited number of glass bottles per day....and I probably wouldn't come here if it wasn't for the glass bottles.

So yeah, I'd come back.  For more glass bottles.  And maybe some milk tea as well.

excerpts: May be lack of boba milk tea store in downtown financial area.
milk tea.author: Natalie L.
milk tea.review:
I been there 2 times already, tea is not that great but most people come because of the glass bottle.    $5-6 dollars it a bit expensive, not so worth for the pre-mix powder drink.
May be lack of boba milk tea store in downtown financial area.

excerpts: Got a green milk tea.
It was really good, the best in the city.
Also got the brown sugar ice milk tea with egg pudding.
I was looking for Brown sugar milk tea ever since I tried in in LA and this place was the first Boba place that taste similar.
Love this place :D
milk tea.author: Anna L.
milk tea.review: This place is awesome. The baristas were so nice to us because they genuinely cared about our Boba needs. Got a green milk tea. It was really good, the best in the city.  Also got the brown sugar ice milk tea with egg pudding. I was looking for Brown sugar milk tea ever since I tried in in LA and this place was the first Boba place that taste similar. Love this place :D

excerpts: Milk tea seems to taste better in glass for me.
There's almost always a line at this place.
The drinks are ranges from really good to ok depending on the day; not very consistent.
Still, if I have time, I like to make a pit stop here and chill before going to wherever I was going.
milk tea.author: Lea M.
milk tea.review: Milk tea seems to taste better in glass for me. There's almost always a line at this place. The drinks are ranges from really good to ok depending on the day; not very consistent. Still, if I have time, I like to make a pit stop here and chill before going to wherever I was going.

excerpts: The first two times we've been satisfied with the black milk tea with tapioca and the sea salt caramel oolong milk tea with tapioca.
milk tea.author: Dianne G.
milk tea.review:
CUSTOMERS BEWARE - BROKEN GLASS PIECES FOUND WITHIN TAPIOCA.


This is the third time my family and I came here. The first two times we've been satisfied with the black milk tea with tapioca and the sea salt caramel oolong milk tea with tapioca.

BUT...

This third time (which is earlier today, 9/18/14, around noon) my mom got three orders to go. Mind you, it's so DIFFICULT to find metered parking around that place. So while I drove, my mom started to drink her boba and a couple of sips into her drink she found herself chewing on something crunchy in the tapioca. She spat out the tapioca and LO AND BEHOLD there were two small pieces of BROKEN GLASS INSIDE THE TAPIOCA that she was chewing on. 

We didn't touch the other two in fear of chewing on broken glass. I tried calling Plentea to let them know so we don't have to trudge all the way back to downtown but they didn't answer. SO we're going to go back and return the drinks and hopefully get to talk to the manager or supervisor and show them the tapioca with the broken glass pieces and get a refund. 

I saw another review of a customer that was served with broken glass as well. 

This will be the last time we're giving them our business. They're products are hazardous. 

I hope people get to read this review so that they can take precaution when planning to order from this place.

excerpts: I hate drinks that are overly sweet-I got the strawberry fresh fruit tea with black tea and the peach milk tea (forgot what these drinks are actually
called)-and
they were amazing, refreshing, and the perfect amount of sweetness.
The glass bottles make it more environmentally friendly-which I love.
The only downside of this store is that there is usually a long line-because this place is awesome!
Best boba/tea place, in my opinion.
Always coming back here again
milk tea.author: Karen I.
milk tea.review: Top stars. I hate drinks that are overly sweet-I got the strawberry fresh fruit tea with black tea and the peach milk tea (forgot what these drinks are actually called)-and they were amazing, refreshing, and the perfect amount of sweetness. The glass bottles make it more environmentally friendly-which I love. The only downside of this store is that there is usually a long line-because this place is awesome! Best boba/tea place, in my opinion. Always coming back here again :)

excerpts: I ordered a regular milk tea, and to be honest, I didn't think it was all that good.
To me it tasted just like teaway
milk tea (which can be found all over sf, honestly), and
the drink just wasn't all that great for it's price.
But I guess the main attraction was the glass bottle, which was indeed cute.
Overall all I think the bottle was worth going for, but not the drinks themselves.
milk tea.author: Annie H.
milk tea.review: I went to Plentea in the afternoon, and as expected, there was a long line. When I got to the front of the line, I realized that they had a long line because the workers took a while to make each drink. The workers there were really polite, and I could tell that they wanted to make sure their customers were satisfied. I ordered a regular milk tea, and to be honest, I didn't think it was all that good. To me it tasted just like teaway milk tea (which can be found all over sf, honestly), and the drink just wasn't all that great for it's price. But I guess the main attraction was the glass bottle, which was indeed cute. Overall all I think the bottle was worth going for, but not the drinks themselves.

excerpts: The first time I visited, I wasn't sure what to get but saw that another yelper had gotten a "salted caramel" milk tea.
I thought it looked delicious and decided I would order that.
When I placed my order I was told that there was no such thing.
The sweet cashier started listing off options to me and with some confusion I ordered, not really sure of what I would receive.
What I got was the most delicious drink ever.
A milky caramel drink with boba on the bottom topped off with a thick delicious cream on the top.
Of course it was so good that I had to go back and order another a few days later.
When I went to do so, I tried to explain to the cashier what I got the last time.
She looked confused and what I ended up with was disgusting and nothing like what I got the first time.
Unfortunately I was in a hurry
so I just took it and left.
That leads me to today.
I was determined to get the drink of my dreams again and returned to attempt to order correctly.
After standing in line, I tried to explain to the cashier exactly what I wanted.
She again looked very confused, but was very sweet and tried to point me in the right direction.
I ordered and when I received my drink I could tell just by looking at it that it wasn't the right thing.
I wasn't worried though, because they have a large sign that says "we will fix your drink if you don't think it's perfect.
So without even touching the drink I told the cashier it wasn't right and asked her for milk tea on the bottom, not plain tea as I had been given.
She sweetly listened and went to the back only to come back to tell me that her manager said if I wanted another tea I would have to pay for it.
I asked to speak to her manager and was rudely confronted by her.
She kept saying "well what am I supposed to do with this drink??
I can't give it to another customer!!!
I don't see what the problem is.
What's your problem??
Finally I was forced to read her sign to her, which she just happened to be standing next to.
She finally conceded, and as she walked to the back THREW my drink into the sink in anger.
(Remember, glass bottles.)
I was made another drink that was closer to what I wanted but still without the creamy top that I asked for, but I was sick of arguing
so I left.
I'm sad.

I really wanted that delicious drink again, but I guess I'll never have it, as even if I did decide to give that rude woman more of my money for her overpriced drinks, she still probably couldn't get it right.
I just felt bad for the cashier who was very sweet and apologetic.
milk tea.author: Lauren C.
milk tea.review: This review is based on three separate visits. The first time I visited, I wasn't sure what to get but saw that another yelper had gotten a "salted caramel" milk tea. I thought it looked delicious and decided I would order that. When I placed my order I was told that there was no such thing. The sweet cashier started listing off options to me and with some confusion I ordered, not really sure of what I would receive. What I got was the most delicious drink ever. A milky caramel drink with boba on the bottom topped off with a thick delicious cream on the top. Of course it was so good that I had to go back and order another a few days later. When I went to do so, I tried to explain to the cashier what I got the last time. She looked confused and what I ended up with was disgusting and nothing like what I got the first time. Unfortunately I was in a hurry so I just took it and left. That leads me to today. I was determined to get the drink of my dreams again and returned to attempt to order correctly. After standing in line, I tried to explain to the cashier exactly what I wanted. She again looked very confused, but was very sweet and tried to point me in the right direction. I ordered and when I received my drink I could tell just by looking at it that it wasn't the right thing. I wasn't worried though, because they have a large sign that says "we will fix your drink if you don't think it's perfect." So without even touching the drink I told the cashier it wasn't right and asked her for milk tea on the bottom, not plain tea as I had been given. She sweetly listened and went to the back only to come back to tell me that her manager said if I wanted another tea I would have to pay for it. I asked to speak to her manager and was rudely confronted by her. She kept saying "well what am I supposed to do with this drink?? I can't give it to another customer!!! I don't see what the problem is. What's your problem??" Finally I was forced to read her sign to her, which she just happened to be standing next to. She finally conceded, and as she walked to the back THREW my drink into the sink in anger. (Remember, glass bottles.) I was made another drink that was closer to what I wanted but still without the creamy top that I asked for, but I was sick of arguing so I left. I'm sad. I really wanted that delicious drink again, but I guess I'll never have it, as even if I did decide to give that rude woman more of my money for her overpriced drinks, she still probably couldn't get it right. I just felt bad for the cashier who was very sweet and apologetic.

excerpts: The milk tea is premade so the tea looses its taste.
Very disappointing
milk tea.author: Stephanie O.
milk tea.review: To be honest this place is overhyped. The bottles are really nice but the tea is not very good at all. There are definitely better places for a cheaper price. The milk tea is premade so the tea looses its taste. Very disappointing

excerpts: The drinks are pretty good and I ordered the green milk tea with boba.
It's a bit bitter and sweet for my liking but good for a place that opened recently.
The glass bottle is nice since you're initally paying for the bottle.
But overall I do like the drink and it is worth it.
milk tea.author: Monica D.
milk tea.review: I came here twice with friends and the first time was during lunch hour so the wait was really long. The second time wasn't that bad. The drinks are pretty good and I ordered the green milk tea with boba. It's a bit bitter and sweet for my liking but good for a place that opened recently. The glass bottle is nice since you're initally paying for the bottle. But overall I do like the drink and it is worth it.

excerpts: I was with my nieces, we ordered 9 drinks and they told us that they only serve regular milk tea.
They lazy as fck.
I swear, we wanted different flavors.
Its our first time and this is what we get?
Never ever.
They're lazy!
Stupid bitches!
Very dissapointed!
milk tea.author: Clariz M.
milk tea.review: Bad service ever! That blonde chinese bitch is fcking lazy! All of them! I was with my nieces, we ordered 9 drinks and they told us that they only serve regular milk tea. They lazy as fck. I swear, we wanted different flavors. Its our first time and this is what we get? Never ever. They're lazy! Stupid bitches! Very dissapointed!

excerpts: but hey, who am i to question the person who's sole purpose throughout the day is to deliver milk tea drinks to people?
so i stuck my straw in and drank from the first layer only to choke from the excess amounts of sodium coating every part of my throat and tongue.
surely she was mistaken and meant
"don't drink it straight like it is. mix it.
damn, girl!!
get your shit straight please, because i almost hated Plentea after that.
but then i decided to ignore her backwards instructions, mixed it up, and happily drank it down properly.
the tapioca had great consistency and chew and the tea was pretty good.
milk tea.author: Regina C.
milk tea.review:
overall pretty good i think, though there was definitely some miscommunication at the counter. i ordered the sea salt crema oolong tea with tapioca, which comes layered. sea salt cream, tea, then tapioca. the woman at the counter said "don't mix it. drink it straight like it is." these sounded like terrible instructions but hey, who am i to question the person who's sole purpose throughout the day is to deliver milk tea drinks to people? so i stuck my straw in and drank from the first layer only to choke from the excess amounts of sodium coating every part of my throat and tongue. surely she was mistaken and meant "don't drink it straight like it is. mix it." damn, girl!! get your shit straight please, because i almost hated Plentea after that. but then i decided to ignore her backwards instructions, mixed it up, and happily drank it down properly. the tapioca had great consistency and chew and the tea was pretty good. i'll likely be back if i happen to be in the area. 

someone tell me how they possibly keep up with all of the glass bottles they hand out. i can't imagine that's a cheap thing to maintain. their bottle game is strong so they must be making a ton of money off of sugar and tea.

excerpts: for two drinks (decided to go safe and got jasmine green milk tea and thai iced tea both with boba) - total came out to about $11-$12? pretty steep for some boba.... but i figured its because of the glass bottles....and the location - nothing labled "financial district" is really cheap.
the milk tea was alright...
nothing fancy
i believed the boba were honey flavored.. at least to me it tasted like honey - similar to T-Pumps so that was good.
i would come back.... because im a sucker for glass jars.
milk tea.author: Kristina L.
milk tea.review:
what got me excited to come here was the boba in a glass bottle. browsing through fb is great advertisement. my friend had came here before the grand opening day - soft opening? and everything was 50% off at that time. so im like whoa! i gotta go... but the two days before their grand opening.... they were closed... so came here on their grand opening day and waited about 30 mins? for two drinks (decided to go safe and got jasmine green milk tea and thai iced tea both with boba) - total came out to about $11-$12? pretty steep for some boba.... but i figured its because of the glass bottles....and the location - nothing labled "financial district" is really cheap. the milk tea was alright... nothing fancy i believed the boba were honey flavored.. at least to me it tasted like honey - similar to T-Pumps so that was good. i would come back.... because im a sucker for glass jars. i also want to try their fresh fruit tea.... 

if you bring your glass bottle back you get 10% off... which isn't much... i think your better off paying that 10% for a new glass bottle...

excerpts: I've had plentea multiple times with different drinks - black milk tea, fruit tea, and honey lemon tea - each time, it's beyond amazing.
Service is prompt.
I also had a waffle once, and it was pretty good, definitely great for dessert.
Plus you get a glass jar which is pretty classy and reusable either at the store or at home.
Highly recommend.
milk tea.author: Leslie T.
milk tea.review: I've had plentea multiple times with different drinks - black milk tea, fruit tea, and honey lemon tea - each time, it's beyond amazing. Service is prompt. I also had a waffle once, and it was pretty good, definitely great for dessert. Plus you get a glass jar which is pretty classy and reusable either at the store or at home. Highly recommend.

excerpts: The milk tea isn't even good.
With that quality, I'd probably just charge $2.50 instead of $5.00.
I've had better...
A LOT better... milk teas for a much cheaper price.
milk tea.author: Kristine Z.
milk tea.review: Overpriced. The milk tea isn't even good. With that quality, I'd probably just charge $2.50 instead of $5.00. I've had better... A LOT better... milk teas for a much cheaper price.

excerpts: I usually go with just a plain milk tea with boba and it just doesn't hit the spot like other places.
I came in pretty late one night and only one girl was working.
She dispensed my milk tea from a large square cube and there was something so unappealing about that.
Decent service.
While I'm not totally against this place, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back since the quality just isn't there
and it's pricier than other locations.
milk tea.author: k h.
milk tea.review: I'm just gonna put this out there: I don't get the hype.  My coworkers told me about this place and I've been here twice.  Maybe I'm order the wrong thing.  I usually go with just a plain milk tea with boba and it just doesn't hit the spot like other places.  I came in pretty late one night and only one girl was working.  She dispensed my milk tea from a large square cube and there was something so unappealing about that.  Decent service.  While I'm not totally against this place, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back since the quality just isn't there and it's pricier than other locations.

excerpts: Listen, if you want to spend $6.47 for a Hazelnut Milk Tea (with two toppings) that will actually turn into Chocolate Milk Tea when your recieve your order, then by all means come here.
That's what happened to me today
and I dont like it.
In fact, I'm tired of all these inconsistencies and drinks not being what i expect them to be half the time.
And for the price of two bobas somewhere else?!
Yeah i think I'll stop coming here.
$6.47 psssh.
To be honest, i didnt even realize i was spending that much because i kept throwing down a ten dollar bill and just never really processed it.
This week all I had were ones
so i was paying more attention to the cost.
Last week my drink was $6.69 WITH a 10% discount for bringing back a jar for that coffee milk tea.
hahahah
oh god.
Don't be fooled by the jars.
They're basically sirens singing to your eyeballs.
Passssss.
BYE FUHLEESHUH.
milk tea.author: Mila B.
milk tea.review: Ugh. I think my initial review was just a bunch of BS. Listen, if you want to spend $6.47 for a Hazelnut Milk Tea (with two toppings) that will actually turn into Chocolate Milk Tea when your recieve your order, then by all means come here. That's what happened to me today and I dont like it. In fact, I'm tired of all these inconsistencies and drinks not being what i expect them to be half the time.
